text: BEWARE OF THE MOTHS. My boyfriend and I killed at least 10 of them, and our friends staying a few rooms over had the same problem. These are not small moths either....but giant creatures that will appear out of no where. It was almost comical, if it hadn't been mildly disgusting.

Excalibur must bring me good luck because I hit 3\/3 sports parlays here which is not usual for me. The rooms are just alright. No fridge and you have to walk a half mile to find the ice machines. Cool view that over looks primarily MGM and New York New York. No WiFi which is pretty whack. You have to go ghetto style and plug their ethernet cord into your laptop if you bring one. The midevil castle them has always been pretty cool in my book as well. I'm still going with the 5 star heavily because of me hitting 3\/3 parlays here.

So this is an update on my review in response to Lori. I understand views are subject to availability but your check in lady told us that we had a view when we checked in as well as an updated room which clearly both were just blatant lies.Also maybe talk to your management and put the fridges back in the rooms that's incredibly bad business I talked with 16 different couples all of which stated that due to that they will never stay there again. Just bad business.

I haven't stayed at Excalibur since I started coming to Vegas many years ago. I remember my first stay here being magical, very befitting that this hotel is a castle. Yes the casino is old, but it's always busy and entertaining! There's been some reno's and it's looking better! I can't say that I will ever stay here again, but it's in the part of The Strip I like the most and it's the best hotel for the budget traveler! I remember the pool was quite nice too!

I'm giving it 4 stars because for $27 room fee+$14 resort fee per night I don't think I would find anything better. For the money, it was an excellent value. They upgraded us to a better room without us asking. We had a very comfortable king-size bed, big flat screen TV, internet (not wifi), the room was clean plus we got 2 free drinks per day, which we used at a bar in the Luxor.

I will say I was very disappointed that only 2 of the 4 pools were open and those 2 pools were PACKED with kids.

The Excalibur is by no means a high end resort, but I was very pleased with our over all stay. The room was very clean and the staff at the check in was very friendly. I am going to be staying here again on my upcoming stay in Vegas but upgraded to a room with a view this time. If your looking for a nice, clean, inexpensive place to stay I definitely recommend the Excalibur.

Pretty content with our stay at Excalibur on New Years Eve weekend! The front lady hooked us up with an upgraded room (with no charge) since it was my boyfriend and I's first time in Vegas together! Our room was clean and spacious with a nice king size bed and flat screen tv. Not so bad for our first experience. Will definitely visit again.
Yes, it's OK hotel in Vegas. Pool is far away from room. Their sports bar staff are friendly.

At least now I know.....never again. This place is shabby, thoroughly unimpressed. You cannot use an umbrella at the pool unless you pay $40, the pool hours suck, no frig, no coffee maker, AND we keep finding moths at our window in our room....infestation? Not sure, but Yuk.

This place is mehh... One thing I don't get is the stupid resort fee's for this place.  Especially because the pool is being worked on and we had to walk to the Luxor pool if we wanted to use a pool???  Also a weird situation there was a ambulance by the valet when I came one night.  I was told be the security guard even though I'm staying here I have to go somewhere else to park??? I just didn't get it... Why do you have to shut down all Valet operations when when a ambulance is there. I get a fire truck.... but why a ambulance when you could use YOUR RADIO and stop movement if you are bringing a patient down to that area???  Maybe its my military side but their security\/emergency procedure is stupid.  

Speaking of fire.... At 0230 the fire alarm went off.. holy shit was I freaking out... I thought I was back in Iraq how f***ing loud that sh** was.  There was no fire but that alarm is loud as all heck.  The hotel itself isn't too bad.  Parking is a b***h, the slots and hotel floor are ok.  The food court and restaurants are all pretty cool.  Make sure you know there is $26.00 resort fees per day!  Which was more than the Palms BTW.  All in all the experience wasn't the best but what do you expect from $25.00 a night!

Investing should be more like watching paint dry or watching grass grow. If you want excitement, take $800 and go to Las Vegas. - Paul Samuelson

For the value and location of this place, this hotel is not bad at all. I think a lot of the mad reviews are being really nit-picky about this hotel especially when you can get a hotel room for $25\/night here during the week. You get what you pay for and for $25\/night, you really shouldn't be expecting the services and quality that you would see at newer, fancier, and way more expensive hotels like the Wynn and Cosmopolitan.

People stay here for its location and when you're sitting on the Strip next door to the New York New York, Tropicana, and Luxor hotels and an extremely short taxi ride away from the Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, Caesar's Palace, and Cosmopolitan, you really can't beat this deal.

I highly recommend this hotel if you're budget-conscious, looking for a place to crash during the night and don't plan on staying in the room the entire time you're in Vegas which is just silly since you're in Vegas!

This place gets a worse rep than it deserves. You should go into the stay knowing that you are not staying at the Cosmo or Wynn. You didn't pay the price for it, so why would you expect something similar?

I checked in at about 10 am. The clerk was very friendly and even waived the resort fee because I was celebrating my birthday! My room was clean and it faced the Luxor pyramid. It looked similar to an average Holiday Inn inside the rooms. 

As a first time gambler, I enjoyed the $5 minimums on the table games and the friendly dealers. I also visited the pool. I liked that there was an adult pool area! The main pool and connecting hot tub were filled with kids. The adult pool was nice because it wasn't too crowded and I ended up meeting great people to party with later on that night!

If you are a cheap college student looking for a place to crash that is not sketchy, I recommend Excalibur!

This review is strictly for the casino as we didn't stay here.

The casino was awesome and the machines actually payed out.  My favorite place to gamble, I love all the older slot machines!!

Well, just stayed there over the weekend and you get what you pay for.  If you want a cheap hotel on the strip,  this is it.  Dont expect anything fancy.  This was a classic room, one tv with basic programming, normal bathroom, two regular noisy beds, out of date furniture and that's it.  I didn't like that you could hear almost everything and I mean everything from the room next door thru the room connecting doors. This is basically why I gave a three stars rating.  I think the hotel could do something better to improve this.  The fire sprinklers looked rusty,  I assume these get tested.  Sorry but I just couldn't keep the 1980 MGM fire out of my head.  We did see improvements on the Fun Dungeon area, my kids loved it. The staff was nice and helpful.  The "want a free show" people are kind of annoying. We probably heard that at least 20 times a day. Most likely will look for a different hotel next time we go to Vegas.

I really don't like this place. The rooms are musty and gross, the food is on par with Denny's and it gives me the creeps. There are always huuuge crowds and tons of noise. It sort of feels like the Motel 6 of Vegas. Spend an extra $20 and book a room next door at the Luxor. I will not be going back.

Not a bad hotel but not a great hotel. Our room served its purpose sleeping and.... Ok this is the clean review.  The room could have had a refrigerator tower two seems to be the better tower as we had friends stay in tower one and they have a wall view. Lots of walking so bring your walking shoes.  Otherwise a good experience.  It's Vegas Baby!

We only stayed at this hotel because it was a comped flight + hotel from a time share pitch. I'd personally never stay here again!
The front desk guy was nice and friendly and no problems during that process. I didn't like the fact that we were literally harassed about seeing a show every time we entered or left the property. 
Other resorts don't seem to have near the same amount of those pushy people. 
There are multiple pools that seem nice with a lot of non-intimidating bodies and also many families. We walked into the adult pool area with no issues or being charged. However, when my Husband ran back to the room and came back their was a little guy at a desk trying to charge $10 for entry. My husband motioned to me and walked past him. We discovered there is in fact a fee to enter which wouldn't be a problem if it was more of a "fun" atmosphere within the walls. There was no music playing. The waitresses looked annoyed bothered to be working. Any door fee would be acceptable if they'd earn it! 

The room was clean and alright but there were 3 glasses just outside our door when we arrived on a Monday and they remained in the same spot upon checking out on Wednesday. 
Just a lack of attention by housekeeping staff and also a hazard. 
Could've been better!

This is one of the worst hotels on the strip I upgraded my room and it was still smelly and dingy ... I got sick and they would not work with me about taking off the last day of my trip I didn't expect to get a full refund but I expected some kind of compassion and did I mention all the rooms smell horrible ..mine did and so did the other rooms my family got .. I will never stay here again the rooms are ugly and smelly ,the slots are super tight and the staff is not hospitable at all the whole hotel was horrible..
Good rooms for a great price... clean and comfortable.. the only issue I had was they did not have a coffee maker in the room. Otherwise great place

Excalibur Hotel is a giant, cheap motel. I have never stayed in any hotel \/ motel without a coffee maker! What kinda cheap spit is that?! The place wasn't exactly filthy, but it also didn't feel or smell clean. The temperature of the room was either really hot or really cold. The thermostat didn't do an actual, comfortable temperature. The bathrooms are also only okay.  Oh, yeah, no free wi-fi, even though it is the year 2014.  

 This place is cheap. That is the best thing about it. I would not likely come here again.

So I booked this hotel for the same reason that most do. The excellent rates. I also thought the Medieval theme was kind of neat. I had kids with me so I thought that the options offered at were kind of neat. As soon as I walked into the lobby the long lines shocked me. My check-in was on a weekday so I am not sure what the long lines were all about. I noticed that on everyday I walked by the registration area that the line was always long. After about a twenty-minute wait time we were off to our room in the "renovated" Tower 2. The room was pretty basic. Two beds with a common soft headboard separated by a nightstand. The room was fairly clean. The wall-mounted TV was huge which was great during the few minutes a day that I watched TV. I did not have a view so not much to note there. The one thing that I did find kind of annoying was the fact that there was camera mounted right outside the window so we could not open the blinds without feeling like we were under surveillance. Not sure if that is the case for all the rooms or not, but I could not bring in any natural light during the day with that damn thing there.  No gripes about the bathroom. It is what it is I guess. It was clean. If you have a ton of gadgets, as most do these days, finding a receptacle to charge said gadgets is nearly impossible. The most obvious place to find an outlet is right on the nightstand. Well in our room the outlet was on the base of the lamp that was on the nightstand. This outlet was equipped with only one plug-in for only one device. The frustrating thing about the outlet is that to plug in just about any charger we had we had to somehow tilt the lamp back then plug in the charger and hope that it stayed in. My suggestion for this issue is to put something underneath the lamp to keep it fixed at a tilted position. Finding any other chargers was like a scavenger hunt. Enough about the room. There are plenty of options for grabbing a quick bite. I do not recommend the buffet, but that was only me. Some in my group enjoyed it. The service personnel in this hotel also had bad attitudes. I understand they have jobs to do and all, but some were just over the top. I will not get into detail but some trouble areas were the lifeguard attendant who checks room keys before allowing you access to the pool area and the security in lost and found. Security moves at a snail's pace when helping you in retrieving your lost possessions. I understand thorough, but thorough can be done quickly.  And if you loose some of your personal belongings with your name on them do not wait for the hotel to look you up to see if you have a room. It will not happen. So hopefully you find your things before you return home. The arcade's hours are the worst. It closes too early and opens too late. Again, one of my reasons for picking Excalibur was for the options it had for kids. The arcade's hours took away one of those options. The pool was great beside the lifeguard access granter person and the rude guests who would leave their seats for over an hour and expect that seat to be reserved for them. Get real people. The sound system may be in need of an upgrade in the pool area. I could barley hear the tunes from some of the pools. And any time the little ones strayed away and got too close to the pool bar or to a machine on the casino floor the staff would quickly lash out at us to reel them in. I understand the law is the law, but show the same kind of excitement to help us out. Not sure if I would try this one again.

As a recent weekend guest, I will say Excalibur did surprise me. I've never really liked this hotel (maybe I'm just not a huge fan of the cheesy medieval times theme) but stayed here because everyone else in my party booked their rooms here. We got a really good deal (Friday-Sunday) at $75 a night in the renovated tower (tower 1) as well as 2 free drink coupons. Staff at check-in were very helpful and accomodating, allowing our party of 9 in 3 seperate rooms to all be on the same floor and room pretty close by each other. It was awesome that we all booked completely seperate but still got to stay in rooms close to each other. 

The room I stayed in had a king bed and a nice view of the strip. We asked for a non-smoking room but it smelled like smoke in the room. The renovations are nothing spectacular but nice enough. Honestly, we weren't in the room much anyways so as long as it's clean, I'm fine with it. If you're looking for amazing rooms, stay somewhere else. The hotel itself was fine but again, nothing great. We checked out the food court upstairs (McDonalds,Quiznos, Auntie Anne's, Krispy Kreme, Pizza Hut) and the buffet. There's also a baha fresh downstairs. Buffet was OK, priced a little too high for what you get ($47 for 2 at dinner). 

Loved the service here and the room worked for what we needed. I still wouldn't prefer to stay here but the location is good and so are the room prices. I have a little bit better view of Excalibur now and can say I've stayed here.

I know, you get what you pay for. Nothing spectacular, yet nothing horrible about this place. If it hadn't been such a last minute trip I would have saved up a little extra to stay more central on the strip and for a better ambiance. 

Friendly check in people, restaurant credit ($20 per room) which we promptly used at the first bar, and a decent Starbucks were the highlights. 

The rooms are dark, the air is smoky in a way that seems to linger on and make your eyes burn, but again I think we paid under $50 a night. So, better than not going to Vegas at all.

First tip: Stay in tower #2 if you want to use the pool. Otherwise it's a 5 minute hike across the entire hotel and casino if you are in tower #1.

Second tip: Stay in tower #2 - the renovated rooms are much better than the tower 1 older style ones. While roomy, tower 1 rooms show their age in little ways - no bathtubs, worn carpet, etc.

Overall the place is decent, but I've stayed in small town Holiday Inn Express-es that were nicer.

The nicest thing I can say is they were cheap for my first time to Vegas. However I've waited on hold less time with Comcast than I did this morning trying to get a bellhop to answer the phone for my luggage! :)

I love this place!  I know it's sort of a dump but it's homey.  We stayed three nights at the end of June 2010
 
The Good - 

The rooms are nice and the bathrooms are roomy.  Our room had a big plasma t.v. and a great view of the strip.

Buffet is worth the price of $27 for all day.  

We love the arcade that has county fair like games and of course, my favorite, the claw game!!  Games are not hard to win.  So it makes it fun for the kids.

Pool is nice.  One area has a water slide and the other side is more for the drinking adults.  

The Bad -

Asked for 4 extra blankets and we only got 2.  They said they were out!  That's crazy!  Who does the laundry?  Fire 'em!

Ice machine on our floor was out of ice for a whole day.  

Our nice big plasma t.v. turned itself on at 5:00 a.m. and nothing worked to turn it off.  I finally had to unplug it!  Then when I plugged it back in we only got a few stations.  We checked out that day so we didn't complain.

On our second night, a burning smell woke me out of a sound sleep.  We panicked and searched the room for the smell.  It was the air conditioner!!  We shut it off and went back to sleep.  Crazy, I know.  But we were tired.  We only had the thing at 65.  The next night it worked fine.

The arcade is a little run down.  Most of the claw games are out of order, but some of them did work just fine.  

We did get a little tired of the buffet after having it for every meal.

Still, I love this place.  I never want them to fix it up because then it will be higher priced.  It's fine the way it is.  Not perfect, but nice.  

We go to this hotel once and year and to the MGM Grand once a year.  They are different.  MGM is nicer but much higher priced.  Excalibur is great.  At it's price we can still afford to go to shows and do other things and not break the bank.  At MGM we just go and enjoy our expensive hotel.

Decent hotel at affordable prices. It's not amazing, but it's pretty comfortable and a fun enough place. I've stayed here a couple times and it has a pretty good location, at the nicer end of the strip. The shops are cute and have pretty good prices. Lots of quick, easy dining options. The buffet is average. The casino is decent and has bar carts and dancers on the weekends, plus the arcade downstairs is kind of fun.

They lied to me about the room price. I reserved a room for less than $40, paid for it online, and they hit me with a $30 "resort fee" when I got to the desk. Totally not cool. If I'd known the real price, I would have stayed somewhere else.
This has a neat thing and pretty nice size rooms but unfortunately being stuck in an elevator on the 18th floor for over an hour did not make this trip.

Not worth the money, listed for 150$\/night. The rooms are worst than extended stays and the service is horrible. The rooms are very dry and can't sleep through night. When we asked for humidifier they denied and offered a room deodorant!?! Poor quality dusty furnitures.

Oh good lord, this place hasn't changed in ages. Ok, so they renovated their buffet and they have a food court now, but the actual casino is the same as I remember it 20 years ago. This is why I no longer stay on this end of the strip, as this area used to be "the" area to go to when you were in Vegas. Now, I stay on the other end as I find the experience much more pleasant (albeit more $$$). The up escalator wasn't working when we were there either so my wife and I had to join the legions of sad souls who had to trudge up the stairs.

If you're on a budget or a 20-something who just wants a place to crash, this is the hotel for you. For those of you who can afford a bit more there are way better options out there. You get what you pay for.

Have friends staying there and want to have a bottle of champagne sent to their room. Called the hotel at 5:00 pm today (Wednesday) to arrange it.  I was told by the operator that room service was closed - I should try tomorrow.  I said - "You're kidding?  If I was staying there and wanted to order a sandwich to my room, I couldn't?" She said, nope, you'd have to come down to one of our restaurants.  You can try tomorrow though. I decided to call the Concierges desk directly (which is listed on their website) - As I type this, I've been on hold for a Concierge for 19 minutes 39 seconds so far. (they're open until 8:00pm - 5:44 pm there now. This is unbelievable!  I'm hanging up now.  I suggest those considering coming here hang up too!

This was our first time at this Hotel and will be our last. The rooms are dirty and old. Our 2 queen bed room was one of the towers remodels..... Well I don't want to know what they looked before the remodeling. 

There was hair on the bathroom sink, garbage in the bathroom basket, our beds had hairs as if they never change their sheets, the night stand where the phone is placed was all sticky. Yuk... I called housekeeping and they sent someone to change sheets and wash bathroom.   

Honestly I did not sleep confterful anymore. I had to sleep in my cloths. So glad it was for 1 night but the price was not worth it. 
No one from the Hotel called to follow up to see if everything else was OK. Never will be staying here again.

Hotel felt dirty. Sink drain was very very slow to drain. Only a single outlet available and it didn't work. I had to unplug the alarm clock to use an outlet. Towels smelled bad. Walls and ceilings had lots of stains. One of the lamps didn't work. Bathroom smelled old and musty.  Sidewalks to the parking lot weren't there the entire way.   And they try to get you to sign up for discount nights on your next trip when you're trying to head to the check out counter.  

Only positive was the buffet was ok. 

Thankful we only stayed one night and didn't have to shower there.

I just spent two nights at the Excalibur for my Birthday. We came in on early Monday afternoon, and were immediately greeted by the valet and luggage guys. They welcomed us with open arms and we're very fast. The front desk staff were so fast and helpful. We only waited a few minutes and we're checked in and our room was ready. 

The room was okay. It was a good size room, clean and had a very specious bathroom.  It had everything you need while in Vegas. We were in the newly remodeled tower, tower 2. The view from our window was absolutely amazing. We were able to see a large portion of the strip. If I had to knock anything about our room, it would be that the shower floor was a little slippery and that the beds were very hard. But we didn't spend much time in the room other than to sleep and shower.

The casino had a wide selection of slots and table games, so you definitely won't be bored. Many of the slots include many of the Vegas classics and many of the newest games. They also have a decent poker room with affordable poker tournaments.

The hotel also has many restaurants to choose from, including buffets, sit down restaurants and fast food. All decent and the food court is open 24 hours.

Decent amount of shops with a wide selection of products.

The location of the Excalibur is fantastic. Being on the south end of the strip, it's right across the street from the MGM, New York New York and Tropicana. It's also connected on the inside and by trams to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay.

Overall, I had a great time and the hotel delivered. It's staff is amazing and it has the essentials to make a great Vegas getaway.

I would definitely stay here again.

ARRIVAL
  the bus bumps you of at the back entrance of the hotel where you walk  endless streets and round many corners passing  rows of shops to get to the  check in desk 
 on the way  you are confronted almost every step by a team of hustlers trying to get you to sign up for their  (no obligation) time share presentation for which you will receive tickets to one of las vegas.s many shows .

getting to the line is no more uneventful  as they inform you check in is at 3 pm  ..its now 10 am but for a payment only  $20 you can  precheck in  and  if you dont want that  there is another army of coons willing to take care of your bags until such time as you can occupy a room and then deliver the bags to you.
 just a few  clever ways to  more money from  your pocket

 while avoiding these   offers you are still at the mercy of the * time share pushers *  who never seem to   know  when  a no means   no and continue to hassle   you  we  turned down all offers and waited out our time to check in by sitting  in a nearby bar.

THE ROOM 
 it was about average size  strange thou it didnt have  any of the mandatory  pictures attached to the walls. no safe or bar but it did have   a coffee maker in the bathroom .
it was old and needed updating the beds* two king size*  were   clean with plenty of pillows,  the shower screen was loosely  attached to the wall and the taps on the sink needed tightening  down  we found the air conditioner was noisy with no way to adjust it .


 FOOD 
  this was the good part the restuarant    sells a DAY ticket for $36 PER ADULT VIP STATUS   you can eat ANY  time as  MANY  times as you like  for this price. a good deal in vegas as most eateries in hotels  for even a light meal starts at around $15.the food was good   the service was excellant and as VIP we got to go right in and not join the end of the  line   this privilege   was one of the reasons it was  worth the day ticket alone
   so much time is wasted in las vegas   waiting in line to eat ,see a show or enter one of the many nite clubs .


For the price we paid it was nt a bad deal you only get what  you pay for
  just wish the hotel management would take action to stop these   little asian  guys harrassing  every new quest as soon as they walk thou the door .
   your tired after a long and stressfull flight your first thought is to get to a room, shower change clothing and hit  the strip    this continued hustling is annoying .

 one little ass jumped right   in front of me as  i  was turning   a bend in the corridor trying to manevaer   a suitcase between  a thong of people  

  he at least  was one who  got the message loud  and clear  after i shouted a few nasty names  loudly in his ear

I was suckered into one of the timeshare scams that I'm now being warned about! Thought it sounded like a good deal. Stay away from the friendly people in the lobby's of any of the hotels!! They're everywhere!
First, I was promised a 3 night stay at the Luxor with 2 show tickets and $150 cash voucher, and that would have my money back for the $125 I paid for the deal. I did get the money back, however the timeshare presentation was excruciating and took almost 5 hours instead of the 2 or 3 they said it would. No I didn't buy into it. The show tickets choices were all really lame, we wound up choosing a dinner show that we didn't actually even get to go to because the timeshare presentation took so long! Could have gone the next night but it was their blackout date and we left the next day. We did not get to stay at the Luxor as promised, ended up at the Excalibur, which is only a subpar hotel these days. Took almost an hour just to check in for the line. Stay away from the buffet! It has totally gone down the tubes! Expensive and nasty! The room was just OK, the bed was comfortable but there was zero water pressure in the shower, and we got noise from the street and from our neighbors all night long! This whole experience has me thinking that I'm about over our annual Vegas experience. I might just be getting older and slowing down, but this time it left a really bitter taste in my mouth. Seems to me that quality of service just doesn't matter there anymore!

SO i went to vegas for my buddies wedding and stayed at the Excalibur hotel.  I was able to check into the hotel early which was nice and the hotel clerk upgraded my room which was great!! So the first night gambling was great had drinks and fun.  
The next day i had  breakfast in the room went down to gamble and ordered some shots.  The cocktail waitress Cheryl yelled and said that they don't serve shots on the floor and that she worked for the hotel for 26 years and all her days there they have never served shots on the floor!  Instead of arguing we asked to speak to a manager and the manager apologized and gave us shots.  SMH was all that really needed for a customer who has been gambling and just wants a shot before its time to head out to a wedding??  That just killed my entire vibe. I went to the wedding came back to the room and noticed that the person who was supposed to clean the room made the bed but left the trash and the old breakfast plates from the morning.  SMH.
So i thought no big deal. let me just put the trash outside the door ill order some food drink and get ready for tomorrow. So i called downstairs to request new towels so that i may take a shower in the morning. It took them 2 hours with no exaggeration for them to bring towels to my room.  SMH.
Next time i will definatly be trying another hotel. I don't believe I will be coming back here any time soon.

Upgrayedd! 

Booked a discounted rate at $35\/night and got upgraded to the more modern rooms with a view of the strip.  M-Life seems to pay off. Very nice and spacious rooms in tower 2. 45" plasma TV. Shower large enough for two. Can't complain about that. 

Not the best of the best hotels, but really really decent.  And for the price I paid for this, excellent!
Enjoyed my stay during Christmas! I did not have problems. Check in and out was a very easy process!

I prefer Luxor, but this place was cheaper. See, I do care about my money! Anyways, the times that we stay here, we've always been in tower 2. This time, they stuck us in tower 1. It's like the unrenovated side of the hotel.  The door was stuck and everything looked old. However, that was the only bad thing about the room. Spacious bathroom and tub, and huge comfy beds. I love the fact that this hotel is connected to Luxor and Mandalay Bay so I could so shopping without having to drive. A consistently good place to stay at!

Final Verdict: We can always trust this hotel when we come to stay. It's a good place for your head to lay. The tram connects you to a day of fun, you don't even have to step foot in the sun!
Awful hotel, lots of time share sellers in the atrium that try luring newbies with cheap shows tickets. Rooms look old and not up to par with rest of the strip. Definitely keep away from here..

I rarely write reviews; however, I want to make people aware of what they're paying for. My family of four was visiting for four nights and five days, and paid over $1000 and it was so not worth it. The hotel is old and outdated and reeks of smoke. The room has been remodeled, if that's what you call it. There's no tub and the shower has corking that is coming up so it looks like mildew is developing in the corners. There was hair in the restroom from the previous guest, so that also shows that housekeeping is not doing a good job. Housekeeping also failed to swept the bathroom several times because there was hair left on the floor. The walls have been repainted in the guest room, but that's about the only good update. With the price of the room you would expect a refrigerator in the room, but it was removed (You can pay an extra fee to rent a refrigerator during your stay). The fact that this hotel charges such a high fee for your stay you would except the housekeeping and updates to be "updates" but it's not by far up to par. This was my first time costing  Vegas and I loved the attractions, but I will NEVER stay at this hotel or recommend anyone else stay!

While Excalibur is located on the southern edge of the strip, it is still part of the hustle and bustle of the strip. It is also located near I-15 as well as the airport. 

We got there early but still had to wait a long time to check in. The workers did not seem to have any sense of urgency. The line got much longer throughout the day. We had to wait a long time for our room to be ready as well. The check in process needs to be more efficient. 

I'm not much into gambling but the casino was nice. There wasn't too much of a cigarette smell. 

The rooms in the hotel were surprisingly nice. They weren't too cramped. The views from the upper floors are amazing, regardless of which direction you were facing. I think the bathroom has been redone recently. 

There are a lot of options for food here. There is a buffet, an Italian restaurant, and a food court as well as several other restaurants scattered about. Dick's is also located here which is a great time as long as you're not sensitive. All of it is insanely priced but good luck finding cheaper food elsewhere. 

The pools here are nice, though one of them was closed and the other cost $10 to use. One of the pools has a little slide. 

Most of the staff here seemed friendly. 

The hotel is within walking distance of a number of hotels. New York, New York, MGM Grand, and Tropicana can be accessed via outdoor walkways. Luxor can be reached via an indoor walkway and there is a free tram that takes you to Mandalay Bay. 

Overall a nice hotel that once you finally get checked in and your room is ready.

What a dump.  I took my teen son here because someone had said they had a good arcade.  Most of it is midway games like at a carnival, and set up to suck the kids dry before giving them a cheapo toy.  Very few decent machines for gamers.  Biggest impression for me was, no offense, but the crowds there looked like they came right off of the Wal-Mart floor.  Big families, big people, lots of strollers, lots of noise.

We stayed in Tower II and got upgraded to a LCD tv (big whooP!) but the decor was very cute and updated and I really liked it and expecting the worse for a cheap hotel in Vegas was quite pleased.... The line at midnight to check in really sucked but I found the staff on every level to be pleasant and friendly... however we did not go to Dick's haha... I would stay there again in a heartbeat... and we played the penney slots for a loooooong time too... will be back!

Good hotel for the price.....used our AAA discount.  Dont waste your money on the lunch buffet....very bland and limited items.  Kids arcade in the basement was nice...and entertaining for the kids.  Tournament of the Kings show and dinner was nice as well..!!  Recommend the stay, but go somewhere else for the buffet.

It was exactly what we expected for the price we paid. All in all, we paid $260 for 5 nights, and that was great for still being on the strip. Not to mention, we received an "upgrade" upon arrival which was a nice touch. Obviously, it was a no-frills room, but we are low maintenance folks. It is far from the bustling side of the strip, and the food court is really hard to locate. Other than that, it was clean and there was NO SECURITY DEPOSIT REQUIRED if you pay upfront with cash.

Budget friendly indeed

Not the greatest hotel on the strip, but it was worth its price.

We came here for a quick spring-break get-away.  It wasn't as magical as I remember it when I was a kid, but thatt's to be expected.  Sadly, Las Vegas has shied away from kid-friendly to more adult themed (well, as it should be).  Circus circus seems pretty ghetto (again, it could be that I'm older now...) and the games area in Excalibur has seen better days.

It's sad that I don't gamble, my wife and I won a ton of stuffed animals for around $50.  My profile pic is my baby surrounded by our pilage of the games area.  If only that luck transferred to the tables or slots, I would be rich!

Oh yeah, there are dancers of the pleasure palace.  Takes a lot of confidence to dance on a table in a hotel with just your underwear on.  I'll just be nice and say good luck to all of them...

Honestly people complain way too much.You can't expect a 5 star experience at  a 3 star hotel.Went about 2 weeks ago for my 21st birthday weekend.We came to the Excalibur because the riviera refused to accept our card. We got there the place was nice there was smoke in the air but thats at every casino.We checked in and the lady gave us a free upgrade because it was my birthday. The room was nice and spacious.Yes there wasn't a view but I didn't expect one since it was the first floor. The casino has plenty of games and tables.There was also a lot of food options upstairs including a buffet. Overall it was a great stay for an affordable price.

The Excalibur is one big castle on the strip that is connected to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. On this Halloween weekend the Excalibur had set-up festivities such as beer pong and other adult games to cater to the dressed-up guests. The rooms are nothing special, older curtains, 19 inch TVs from the 80s, older carpet, small bath towels, so much for the room. But hey this is Vegas and you just sleep in them anyways.

Excalibur does have something I want in a casino...a big sports bar to watch and bet on games. The casino also features two lounges with live music and an upstairs lounge with a dueling guitars act. For gamblers..black jack tables, poker tables and an abundance of slot machines. I didn't see many people dumping silver dollars in those dollar slots. So they must be drinking themselves at the main bar, Dick's bar (redneck bar), or watching the pseudo strippers at the bar across the from Dick's. (yes that was the name of the bar).

Most of the casinos have bufftets and for $29.99 you could eat until you pass out. I decided to checked it out, ate a lot of fruit, pasta, chicken dishes and desserts. Excalibur also has a very nice food court that featured a McDonalds, pizza parlor and a Coldstones.

Not happy place is a bit dirty ~ found a used condom out side my window  spider webs in the room ~ used body wash container in shower I paid $170 for my room - wont visit again !! My hubby was sick all night from our Italian dinner that cost us over $100 just overall not a good visit this place has never even apologized so disappointing 02\/01\/2016 trip was 10\/31\/2015

We booked Excalibur because we were in Vegas for a friends Birthday. We had never stayed here before so thought we would give it a try. So far very disappointed. Shame on us for not doing our homework. Rooms are very dated. We "upgraded" to the Royal Tower as the sold us in the fact the rooms had been recently remodeled. Well it appears they have been brought into the 1990's.....yay!!!  I'm fearful of what the "non-upgraded" rooms look like. We made the mistake of assuming that since the dresser section of the room had a spot for a refrigerator there would be a refrigerator. Wrong, you can rent one if you would like. Again shame on us for not doing our homework. Rooms are very noisy, both from outside and inside the hotel.  We called for extra pillows and the staff gave us attitude like we had asked them to come tuck us in and sing a lullaby. Also mentioned bathroom floors were slick like something was on them and they came and mopped them (with attitude), but this didn't fix the problem. I will say the Buffet was very good for the price and the location was good. Our overall impression was we were just one customer and that one customer doesn't matter in the big picture. Be their next customer at your own risk.  There are far too many choices in Las Vegas and we won't be staying here again.

Another review from someone that hasn't been impressed. I'm currently sitting in my room at the Excalibur (which actually has great strip views, I must admit), typing this review from my "free", yet wired, high speed internet access that I paid $9.95 a day for (note, the rate has been raised to $12.95 for all new check-ins, we just happened to reserve when the rate was lower back in October). If I'm going to be paying for it, I might as well use it, right?

Staying here out of a need to save money, rather than a desire, I wasn't really expecting much from the hotel overall, and my expectations have been met head-on. The room is of a fine size, and I believe we have one of the "recently remodeled" options as the furniture seems new, or at least well taken care of. However, our King size bed is really hard, and I find it hard to sleep all the way through the night without readjusting because my back hurts.

The water pressure is lackluster at best, and the electrical outlet on my bed-side table (built into the bottom of the table lamp) doesn't function.

All in all, you get what you pay for and this is no exception. Know what you're going into before you get here, and you can save yourself a lot of frustration. This isn't a 5-star hotel, but if you're looking to save money, at least the hotel functions well-enough for that end.

Yikes. My girl friends and I had to stay here because we booked very last minute and it was the cheapest place to stay. That being said, it wasn't the best of hotels i've ever stayed at, but it wasn't the worst.... but pretty close. haha

The room itself was a decent size. It was big enough to fit 4 girls comfortably. The furniture and look of the rooms are very outdated. The bed actually wasn't as bad as I thought it would be, but I prefer more firmer beds. The one complaint I have is the smell of whatever cleaner they use for the bathroom. Every time we walked back into our room I almost wanted to gag from the smell of it. I'm totally fine with the smell of clorox, but that was not it. gross..

I will say the plus side of staying here is that they have a food court. When we came back from the clubs we were able to go to our room, shower, then come back down to grab a quick bite.

Overall the hotel is meeeeh. If you're looking for a cheap place this is probably a decent option, but I'd prefer to stay somewhere else next time.

It would have literally been cheaper, for me to stay at Wynn\/Encore, but for some reason, my aunt LOVES the Excalibur hotel. Fine, we'll stay here.

At LEAST, we stayed in a suite. It was on the top floor, and the rooms were pretty nice.

My gripe with Excalibur is pretty much the same as with Wynn\/Encore...they're both on almost the complete opposite ends of the "happening" part of the strip.

One more thing that I noticed...Excalibur is borderline ghetto, clientele wise. Every morning, as I walked through the casino lobby, I felt like I was in Riverside county, or, at best, Orange county. (Sorry Orange county, that's how I view your piece of CA)

Oh, and if you have a nicer car, you may not want to come here, as most of the parking, is outdoors. It's not snobbish, it's just that, the sun can be pretty harsh, on car paint.

BE CAREFUL!!  I took the wife and kids here after Christmas\/before New Years Eve for a small getaway.  Average hotel, but be careful with the doors and lock you things up.  They do not close tight unless you slam or push\/pull them.  My wife went gambling between midnight and 3:30 am while I was sleeping with the kids.  I did not put the latch-lock on because she needed to get back in.  Iphone and ipad were charging on the floor.  Wallet and coin purse on the entertainment center.  ROBBED while we were sleeping.  Filed the report with security and they said they do "push checks" on the doors at night, so this must be a problem.  Maintenance man came up the next morning and said that was normal.  They do not seem too caring about the fact that we were robbed while sleeping and lost over $1100 worth of Apple equipment.  That can be replaced, but just creepy someone was in the room taking from us.  They have security downstairs and you have show your keycard, but they could be easily distracted.  They said there is a law that prohibits putting cameras in the hallways due to privacy issues.  I'm not sure about the validity of that, or they may just be too cheap to add that.

No frig or coffee pot in the room.  Annoying people asking you for free tickets every time you enter the hotel, which is really to get you to listen to a sales pitch to buy property.  Kids like the game area downstairs.  Lots of places to eat on the 2nd floor.  

I would not stay there again unless they gave me a free stay because of this.  If I did, I would lock everything in the safe, latch the door, and trap the door.  I doubt they will reimburse any losses, so I can only file a police report and start rebuilding my life stolen in my wallet.

I had a very unfortunate visit which began my first night staying at Excalibur. 
After exiting the Johnny Rockets, a guest approached my friend and commented on her "behind". He asked her to go back with him and after she rejected him several times he asked her to continue to walk away so he could stare at my "nice behind" (this gentlemen's choice words were not so polite). This all occurred in front of a bartender amongst a few employees. After he made her feel humiliated (at this point he had been rejected ~4 times and was now objectifying her body by telling her to walk way so that he can stare, I asked him to please leave us alone. This is when the other guest made a fist and told me he would, and this a direct quotation, "beat the sh*t out of me". I asked him to repeat himself for confirmation, and he again said, this time to both of us,  "I will beat the sh*t out of you". At this point the guest started backing up , and I made note that security was now approaching ( i noticed the bartender pick up the phone around the first threat). Both the guest's and our tones were now loud. As he started to walk away he told me to (direct quote) " Shut up, you FAT B#$!H". I started to walk towards him and asked him to repeat himself, he then said YET AGAIN that he was going to "beat the sh*t out of you" (this time he motioned towards both my friend and I). When I asked him why, he told me that he's not afraid to hit a woman. 
After talking with security, and noticing that they intentionally stalled to let the man walk away, my friend and I realized that the issue wasn't going anywhere. Therefore, we walked back to our room and decided to call someone in management.
 This is when we got to speak with Denise. 
She is absolutely horrendous as a representative of your establishment.
She let us know that she didn't see anything that the other guest said and all she heard was that he called us fat and that it was not that big of a deal. She repeated the fact that he called me fat 3 times and claimed she was the one who told the bartender to call security so she "missed everything but the part when he called the girl in the red dress fat".
 If this were true, she should have been more cognizant of the situation and notice the man gesticulating with his fist and saying he would "beat the sh*t out of me" AFTER he called me fat. Instead, she said that the whole situation looked very bad on us and we should have walked away (the entire reason the altercation with the disgusting guest began).

This is beyond unacceptable. Not only did we get sexually and verbally harassed, but we were then made to feel unsafe. Additionally, the reaction of your "management" was to victim blame. She made an assumption, and because she agreed with the man's observation of my size, felt that I had overreacted. I get nauseous at the idea of how poorly she treated us. She was rude from the beginning, asking "what were we supposed to do about it?" and "what would you have done? Were you going to press charges?"
Denise's response to two women's call of distress was completely inappropriate and reprehensible. Because of her wrong assumptions, she made the stay there feel unsafe and unpleasant. The fact that she victim blamed was the worst offense.

Rooms are nice beds are Comfy but becareful when you do express check out,  we couldn't check out till 6am from our room,  had to go check out downstairs,  we stayed 4 nights and used the $13 valet one night.  
They had charged us 8 nights $8 per day parking and 2 valets.  I wonder how many people have never looked at their bill and were charged???  Hmmmmmmmm

I had an awkward experience checking myself into the hotel when the guy checking me in had a problem with 3 people of the same sex sharing a room.  He then tried to apologize and said he just had a problem with 'flamboyant gay men'.  I talked to his supervisor but I didnt get the impression that anything was going to be done.  I will never stay at this hotel again.

OMG, what a horrifying experience! Well, the work convention was at Mandalay and due to last minute registration, I couldn't get into Luxor or Mandalay so instead of hiking from other hotels, I decided to stay on the same side of the block and figured there was the tram to ease the walk a lil. Tower 1 is beyond old, it's ancient dinosaur, a glimpse into a cheap and bad Motel 6!! My gawd, how can they not do anything with it soon?!! Fortunately, with a $20 upgrade, Tower 2 was much newer and nicer with flat screen TV and new carpet and solid mattress and new bedding and sheets!

Really the only good thing was the view, because I did an upgrade. Other than that, parking there is horrible, the hallways and elevator smell like musk and crap, which were also lined with the same used drinks for the 2 days we were there. Instead of looking for my room number, I looked for the half empty vodka cranberry in front of it. Oh, and the old dirty sheets (with blood) were just laying in the room from the maids when we first arrived. Never Again!!!

I was a princess trapped in a tower, and I would've done almost anything to get out of this disaster called Excalibur! Let me explain by simply describing my stay in 2005 point by point: 

When I arrived, I left my car with the valet, my luggage with the bellhop and went to check in. I stood in line for TWO HOURS and when I got to the counter, I was informed that they had lost my reservation.  I had booked a suite with a credit card to hold the room for late arrival. They had given it to someone else.  They promised a king size single with a view because the suites were all gone.  When I got upstairs to the room, it was a single with a full size bed in a very small room and no view. I called downstairs... Three rooms later, I was in a king with a view.  I saw 4 rooms total.

There were two holes in my wall (fist sized) that needed to be repaired and the bedspread had cigarette burn holes in it. I called housekeeping and they promised to send someone to change the bedding. There was nothing they could do about the holes in the wall. Could maintenance come and fix them? No. 

An hour later, I called to check on my luggage and was told that they were understaffed and very busy. The man on the phone vented to me about how they were cutting hours and how guests were complaining. He said they would bring my luggage up as soon as they could. (It had been 3 hours so far.) Could I come down and get it? No, but they would bring mine up next. He promised. 

I ordered room service. They brought me someone else's food. I called down and was told they would send up another order. They did. Again, it was someone else's food.  Third time was a charm and I got my order. 

After eating, I called to check on my luggage as it had been another hour and a half. Once again, I was told I was next in line to receive my bags. It was late and I wanted to get some sleep. Could I please come down and get them so I could get settled for the night? No. 

My luggage finally arrived. It took almost 5 hours to get my bags. The two men who brought my 3 bags up, handed me a folded comforter and left. I called housekeeping. Was I supposed to change the bedding? And if so, what was I supposed to do with the other bedspread? No, the man who brought it up should have done it and taken the other one away. They said they'd send someone up. That someone never showed. 

The next morning when I was ready to drive somewhere, it seemed to be taking the valet a really long time to bring my car around.  After 20 minutes, I asked about it. They told me they had lost my car and were looking for it. No apology. No nothing. It took them about an hour to find my car. 

Later that day, I looked at my itemized bill on the television. I was being charged the room rate for a suite (when I wasn't in one) and I was also being charged for all 3 dinners from the night before. 

Deciding I needed to get some fresh air away from this unbelievable nightmare, I went to get my car from the valet to take a drive.  Once again, I was told, without so much as an apology, that they couldn't bring me my car.  This time, they said they lost the keys.  Later, I was told they found the keys, but couldn't locate the car.  It would take A WEEK for them to FIND MY CAR!!  

I went to the front desk to make a general complaint about everything and straighten out my bill. Before I was finished telling the front desk manager on duty my story (and let me add that I was being nice - not yelling, not taking it out on her, etc.) she offered to give me the phone numbers to some other hotels if I wasn't happy at the Excalibur. She told me she was busy and left.  She didn't listen to the other problems which included: things like being charged for receiving mail that wasn't mine (they charge for each letter or package you receive while a guest in the hotel), inappropriate behavior from two male staff members (they wanted me to go on a date with them both at the same time - I said no.), camera stolen from my room, water leak from the ceiling (slow drip), toilet that ran (maintenance took a week to come and fix it)... I could list more, but you get the idea. 

When the day arrived for me to check out, I still had 2 holes in my wall, a slow drip from the ceiling and 2 comforters in my room with one bed. They never came for the one with the holes in it and housekeeping never took it away. And yes, I did ask. Repeatedly. 

The final kick in the teeth was when I checked out. I called for a bellhop at 9AM to collect my bags. It took them 3 hours to show up. When they did, I went downstairs to check out and had to wait in another long line. The lady at the counter charged me for another night because I was checking out late!

The hotel itself was okay. The room was clean and the bed was comfy. The rooms seemed recently upgraded with a more modern feel, as is the trend with these themed hotels slowly loosing their themes, e.g.: Treasure Island (no more pirates,) and the Luxor (Egypt no more). I personally love the new color schemes in the room and in the public restrooms.
Why the 1 star? 
  #1 Because the parking structure is NOT attached to the hotel, and you have to schlep across a parking lot (that reeks of sewage,) from the structure. No bueno in Las Vegas heat!
      #2 oh, and the cleaning lady tried to barge into my room at 9:30 when checkout wasn't for hours. 
   #3 as guests, we had to pay for parking!!!!! This is new, but total BS for Vegas! Sure it was only $8 a day, but this is Vegas! You should NEVER have to pay for parking in a place that is guaranteed revenue by you simply parking there... either by gambling, watching a show there, or eating and drinking there. AT LEAST make the parking free for the guests. oh, and putting that information on the sites would be helpful too!
  
     This is happening at the MGM resorts, and for this reason alone, I never want to stay at any MGM resort! 
 .... and what is up with the $24 "resort fee?" ???? That's BS too!!!!

oh, and we had a clear view of the back of a wall... the back windowless, solid white wall of the adjacent tower. I'd rather see the backside of water.

My wife and I decided that we needed to get away for a few days, so we found a good deal on groupon for the Excalibur. Here is why I gave two stars.

- The location isn't too bad as far as vicinity to the strip. One star.

- The price isn't bad for what you get. I paid around $50 a night for a room with a king bed. Not bad at all. One star.

- The rooms are in reasonable condition and were clean. One star.

So that's the positives. Negatives:

- The rooms are still outdated and the walls are painted a grotesque brown. Looks like they didn't put a lot into the updates.

- Those event people attempting to sell you on shows and buffets drive me up the wall!!! I get it, you want to sell the products offered and such, but you kill any kind of customer service trust once built up. We ended up walking through a couple of times to get things in order and they just kept on coming! The same lady tried four times to sell me on crap. Maybe a hint on this: Do this when the people check-in. Don't keep bothering me and  wasting my precious time with your sales pitch each time I pass. It's unnecessary and absolutely infuriating. 

Overall I would not recommend or come back to the Excalibur. I can find another room elsewhere that does not make my vacation into a business negotiation.

The hotel has improved a lot since I stayed here three years back. The rooms are renovated and comfortable. But their buffet has taken a step back, I would say it has become the worst buffet in vegas. Also the service at the buffet was sub standard. I would recommend staying here and eating somewhere else.

The excalibur has some good points. The price was right. The location is great.The in-house McDonalds has a dollar menu. The room was comfortable and quiet.  Its true the decor is tacky, but if you are offended by tackyness Vegas isn't for you. 

The Excalibur has a major con: it is way too smokey. We never spent much time (or money) here because our lungs ached from the smoke. 

Stay here for the cheap room, but not much else. On our next trip to Vegas I think we'll pay a $100 more and breathe comfortably.

Have stayed here half a dozen times on trips to Vegas because the room rates cannot be beat sometimes! I usually don't care about hotel rooms either, a place to sleep is what they are for me and as long as they are safe and clean, I don't care what it is. If you're looking for luxury, this is not the place for you (but I would think you would know that already when booking). Have stayed in both the new updated rooms and the old ones and both have treated us well. Simple shower in the bathrooms, maid service is prompt, check in and check out has always run smoothly (although it does get SUPER busy at prime time hours!) and the casino seems to spit out more money than some of the others I've been to. The beds in the older rooms were a little too soft for me, which is the only negative I can think of. Nice views of the NYNY and MGM from the newly updated tower and parking is plentiful and has never been a problem. Kids have never been a problem... at least not anymore so than other casinos. Pool is fine, have only been there once so can't review that too well. 

A few things I don't like - horribly pushy sales people inside the casino and on the bridge to get there. A few times they would RUN after us or people walking next to us yelling about show tickets and whatnot. From being inside all the other casinos on the strip, this hotel was the only one we experienced this at. While I just walk by and ignore like I usually have, it does become an annoying factor when you realize how desperate they are to get you. Another downside - from what I've seen, this place doesn't have any room service at night (I could be wrong.. we usually don't order it as there as so many places to eat in Vegas!). Last time we were there, I noticed on that there were certain hours and during the night was not one of them. They do have a food court which they list on there for their night food. One other negative is the location, it's south of the strip, so it is a bit of a walk if you want to explore other casinos. While this has never been a problem for us, it's something to think about. That being said, with MGM, NYNY, Luxor and Mandalay Bay (which has a LOT of nice places to eat and shop) being so close, there is always something to do. 

The negative reviews always make me laugh... for $24 a night, what did you think you'd be getting? Four Seasons? ... big fat NO. It's a fine hotel to sleep in and that's that.

The Excalibur is a BEAUTIFUL hotel and the room is so comfortable and plush, but OMG the customer service in this place is for chit! We have been calling EVERY DAY since we have been here with one issue or another, things we needed or wanted to order and overall everyone that we encountered had a bad attitude.  The staff didn't seem knowledgeable about process, cost, etc and unfriendly and unaccommodating...and in some cases RUDE. It's really quite astonishing! 
So in summation, if service is not what you require, this may be the place for you. 
Oh and did I mention, we were by their staff that is is a 4 Diamond resort. Unbelievable!

I've stayed here a couple times, and just did again very recently. 

The rooms aren't all that great.. the linens are on the cheap side, and nothing is really luxurious in the regular rooms.  I did get a good deal,  and paid and average of $37\/night including tax, and the $5 resort fee. 

The greatest thing about the casino, is the all electronic poker room.  It's just like playing online, except you can see and talk to everyone.  They even show odds of winning like on the poker TV shows. 50 cent and dollar blinds.  The comps suck though. The rake is supposed to be the lowest on the strip.. and there are always people in there.  The poker staff is very friendly.  It's the only place that i gamble now.. but i heard they will be adding these machines elsewhere soon.

They have a food court, and an IMAX ride as well.   I did notice a revamping of the Casino too.. in ways to try to get you to spend or lose more money!!

1) Flat screen TVs installed right above the tables to distract you from your blackjack hand.

2) Hot bikini gogo dancers right next to the tables, to distract you as well.

3) Female staff asking to give you a massage for $1\/minute while you gamble.

MGM is hurting right now, and they're pinching pennies.  I've also notice room rates vary wildly from day to day. 

Overall, this is a decent bet, for the right price.. For under $40\/night, it's decent, but over $60, and you can probably do better.

There is a free tram that runs to the Luxor and the Mandalay bay.. or if it is closed, they have people movers as an alternative.

Stayed Memorial Weekend 2016 price was very good and overall the Hotel is great for the price. Im pretty picky so we opted for the tower that was recently updated. I was a litt le concerned reading some of the previous reviews, but hotel was perfect and a great location.

im really not a picky person when it comes to hotels just a clean bed a clean bathroom to do the business and a shower. i dont think i ask for anything too much.

i understand that excalibur IS on the cheaper side of hotel room rates but that doesnt mean that they should have....
1. dents on their wall
2. a shadow of a "missing" painting
and heres the really dirty stuff...
3.some sort of blood stain on my blanket
4. another stain on 2 different towels
5. "hair" on the toilet seat when we first checked in (SUPER GROSSSSSSSSSSS)

only reason why im giving 2 stars instead of just 1 is because my BF and i LOVE playing at their 3-card poker tables! (granted we loose a lot of our money there) but i cant help but to have this love\/hate relationship with it. 

oh, and also this last stay it was in tower 1, the older tower so maybe thats why i had all those "incidents" but i dont think its an excuse. cleanliness should be a MUST. 

BOTTOM LINE: with all the money they're receiving from all the gamblers i would think throwing away a couple dirty towels and sheets shouldn't be too big of a deal.

Not as new as some of the other hotels down the strip but clean rooms and comfortable beds and a hot shower are all I really ask for anyway. Good choices of food in the food court. Popeyes, mcds , Krispy Kreme, auntie Anne's and a few other choices for cheap meals. Slots have been pretty loose for me :-) so no complaints!!

If you are on a budget this is the hotel to come to. I actually stayed at this hotel\/casino because it was cheaper than any hotels I found off the strip (and obviously being near the strip has it's perks). 

Some of the rooms are nicer than others although even the non-renovated ones (like I was in) aren't too bad. Plain and old fashioned but I was just passing through.

It does suck that you have to pay extra for wi-fi. That was disappointing but I managed with a tethered iPhone. Overall it was pretty good...and inexpensive. And of course it has everything a Vegas hotel needs--a plethora of bars\/casinos\/food options on the first floor.

If you're not planning on hanging out in a hotel room all day in Vegas, then this hotel is just fine.  It's definitely just like a Motel 6 just the fancy castle theme.

We were stuck right at the end of the floor by the elevator, so we got to hear everyone loud walk by at every hour, and the maid service wasn't too impressive - throwing away the soap each night, no "do not disturb" sign, and not replacing the towels. 

Aside from that, we had a place to sleep and weren't in the room much anyway.

The building is much older and either needs remodeling or demolished. However, this place brings back a lot of childhood memories and I got a chance to bring my kids here to the fun dungeon! Located below the casino floor, it is a mixed of arcade games to win tickets for prizes to games to win stuffed animals. It used to cost $0.50-0.75 when I was a kid but now all games cost $2 or more! Plus the stuffed animals aren't as well made! And the trade up for bigger prizes is a ripoff and not as kid friendly. We played the duck pond where it is a guaranteed win when u pick a rubber ducky. The number below results in the size of the stuffed animal you get so we got a 2 = medium and a 3= large. Sadly could not trade it for anything so we ended up downsizing and got 2 mediums. But then we changed our mind and decided to stick with 1 large after all and the young dude didn't allow us saying too bad u traded down so now you to trade 2 mediums for 1 large. Like really?! In addition, they are one of the hotels that has joined parking fee. Under 60 min is free. 1-4 hrs self parking cost $5. But here's the deal. If you're going to charge for parking, you better offer good amt of parking spots inside a structure bc Nevada is so freakin hot! Aggravates me that i'm paying for outdoor parking!

3.5 stars.
ok so this hotel is old and nothing spectacular..but it has an endearing quality.
$5 BUY INS!
im a cheapass and HATE losing money, so imagine my glee when i actually found a decent casino with a cheapo buy in.  i scoured practically all of freaking vegas looking and the excalibur(along with the venetian--surprise surprise!) were the only places i found.
i ended up losing my money anyway (DAMMIT!) but at least i managed to stretch it for a good couple of hours. muahah. 
tip: beware of skeezy men trying to hit on you!!!!

We were robbed while my husband and two little girls were SLEEPING!!!  The person stole $1000 in cash and do you know what Excalibur did for us? A breakfast buffet for four (worth $60) which we were told we had to use it at the Luxor because they didn't have a buffet.  This ended up not being true, they did have a buffet. The management was less than sympathetic and said there was nothing they could do about it.  NEVER STAYING THERE AGAIN.  This is a sorry excuse for a hotel.  Very disappointed in the management and their lack of empathy and the way they handled our situation.
TELL YOUR FRIENDS!!

Affordable price...clean room ..nice view .. very very nice staff .. thanks Excalibur u made good memories for us... we were there at the busiest time ever (thanks giving ) so the check-in line took us about 1 hour but they had a good greeting and service for that peak hours... we definitely comeback :)

I wasn't amazed with this hotel once I stayed here. I looked at reviews and for the price, it seemed like a good value. It was a great location and within walking distance to many attractions. There was free parking. The pictures of the rooms online appeared nicer online than in person.

Upon check-in, when we got to our room, we were hit with an overwhelming air freshener smell, like it was trying to cover something up. No table surface had been wiped down and there was a pile of hair on one of the bedside tables. Water stains and ashes on the other tables. Called down front immediately to alleviate the situation. 

The manager met us at our new room and made sure we didn't have the same issues as the other room. She was polite and attentive and gave us a partial refund for our troubles. 

Overall, the (cleaning) staff need to pay more attention to detail. We didn't stay in the room much since we were out and about so it was a good value but no one should have issues upon check in like that. It's a good hotel for families traveling to Vegas.

Hmm...I think people are just too spoiled now-a-days...Always wanting the best of the best; Having that "If it's not lavish then it sucks" mentality. I myself, aren't one of those people. I don't need no fancy pancy hotel, I just need somewhere clean to rest my head. Excalibur pulls that off nicely for me!

You honestly, don't even spend that much time in your hotel room to begin with, so why pay big bucks?! Unless you're celebrating something special, then I understand. 

Let me start by saying, I've stayed here numerous times and I don't really have a complaint about the place! The only thing I would mention is that it could use a little refurbishing, like change up the rooms to look a little more modern and add a fridge in the room, but those would be my only critiques. 

It's a good place to stay if you're on a budget and still get a nice looking room, and a pretty big bathroom might I add. It's VERY convenient because it is right on the strip, and linked to the Luxor, MGM and New York NY. 

They have quite a few entertainment shows like The Tournament Of Kings, Thunder From Down Under, and they also have live bands play nightly, and a couple others as well. 

This is a cool spot to stay without cleaning out your wallet!

Upon check out as we went to valet to pick up our car, we discover that the right hand didn't communicate with the left hand...imagine that. The front desk put our parking in as self parking instead of comping as they told us they would. We had to go back and forth with the valet parking attendant. Finally got it squared away. The only upside is there are $5 tables.

This hotel is absolutely disgusting! Why they haven't torn it down and remodeled it I will never understand especially since it's right on the strip! And they have a popular Vegas attraction. First of all they need to improve their parking problem. My fianc and I after driving for hours to get there making really great timing couldn't wait to just get in our hotel and relax. Well that didn't happen. It took us....and this is not an exaggeration...45mins!!! Just to park and go inside! And we had to park in another hotels parking lot! The valet was full and so was their parking structure. Now I get Vegas is busy but they should only allow valet to their guest that are staying there so it isn't inconvenient to park at another hotel and have to carry all the luggage over yourself! The rooms were super gross and had holes in the carpet. The only good thing about this hotel is the food court. That's. About. It.
My wife and I had a comfortable stay at the Excalibur Hotel and Resort. We will definitely be back.

I read all the Yelp reviews warning about staying at Excalibur, but instead, we let our budget dictate where we stayed and ended up staying at the Excalibur after all and for the most part, regretting it.

PROS:
-Cheap. We stayed here mid-August for $32\/night, plus resort fee...very good rate!
-Family Friendly.....there's an arcade downstairs!
-Cheap food court in hotel. They have everything, McDonald's, Quizno's, DQ\/Orange Julius, Starbucks, Krispy Kremes, Chinese Food, coffee cafes at reasonable prices for the strip.

CONS:
-Excalibur is far, far, FAR away from the centre of the strip. You have to do A LOT of walking in the blazing hot sun across catwalks and through hotels to get places (unless you want to fork the money over for cabs).
-Drab decor
-No refrigerators (unless you want to pay $15\/day)
-A few minutes after we turned on the shower, it smelled like butt. Seriously, no other way to describe it other than butt. Luckily it went away after a few minutes, but I wasn't too impressed with that.
-It takes a long time to walk to the bus stop (called the "Deuce"), which is by the Coca Cola Store.

TIP#1 If you do stay here, bring a cooler and buy all your drinks ahead of time or at a grocery store or some place cheaper. Anything is cheaper than in the hotel...even the ABC\/convenience type stores near Excalibur (especially for water)!

TIP#2: If you want a sit down breakfast close to Excalibur, go over to "America" in New York, New York hotel instead of Denny's. You'll wait FOREVER to get a table in Denny's, but you can walk into "America" (FYI -Portions are HUGE at America, try sharing)

Note: A taxi ride from the LAS airport to Excalibur will cost you about $15.

OVERALL: This hotel was okay since it fit our budget, but all the walking in 115 degree F weather was too much....it drained our energy levels and our feet and legs hurt. I don't really care about decor when I'm on a budget....but next time, I'd consider paying a little extra just to stay in a more central location on the strip.

Stayed at the Excalibur last weekend and loved it!  Not as posh as the other hotels down the Strip but also not as expensive.  Nice room, nice fitness center, nice staff, nice pool, nice pool bar with NICE drinks.  Good casino, good cheap breakfast at Sherwood Cafe.  Not many kids - yes!  Very convenient to the Strip and In & Out Burger.

My only complaints:  the lame music they played over the loud speaker at the pool - generic hip-hoppy\/dance music.

I could not wait to come home to write this review.  I paid for this on Las Vegas.com and chose it because it is a castle and we have a two year old.  It was also the cheapest out of all of the hotels although last month we vacationed at the Luxor for about the same price with better customer service.  When we arrived I was told that there was a resort fee of $22.  That was unexpected but cool so I paid cash. The following morning I get a message light telling me to call guest services which I did and was told that I still owed the resort fee.  The woman was rude to me as though I was trying to get away with something and snorted when I told her that I'd paid cash and that should be in their system since after all I was in the room...hello?!  Then she told me that there was no note of it and that I bring down the receipt.  Well that just pissed me off as it was early morning and when I described the guy who helped me as Hispanic she answered, "So you are saying that he's Mexican?!"  Like what?!  I told her that I didn't know specifically the nationality and asked if there was any log of me checking in and she said, "Well yes, but you need to pay."  I asked for the manager.  He came on and told me that the employee was off that day but he would check into it.  We went to have breakfast at the little table in the room and when I sat down I was stuck in my upper thigh by a skinnny piece of metal sticking out of the arm of the chair.  I called down and once again the rude woman on the line just said, "Well, what chair and are you coming down to pay what you owe."  There was no, "I'm sorry that you were hurt are you okay?  We'll send someone right away to take the chair out since you have a two year old with you...or anything like that.   This time I told her that she was rude and she just transferred me to the manager named Mark.  He was nice enough and told me that he didn't understand the rudeness and would speak to her and that they would extend our checkout time until 3p.m.  We agreed I put some Neosporin on the pin prick on my leg and we went out to lunch since we had time to pack.  We got back at 1:40 p.m. and when we tried the door key it didn't work.  I called on my cell the hotel number three times to no answer and finally a supervisor of the maids came by and called security.  The guard got there but first had to let another family into the room.  Then when I told him that we had called downstairs and that they were rude about the call he responded, "Well what do you want me to do, I can't answer for other people."  He opened our room and left.  I laughed at that point because truly you do get what you pay for.  I don't know if the issue of the "resort fee" was solved but I did go down to speak to them again and absolutely no record of my paying cash was lodged and I wasn't given a receipt and they also had no idea that I'd paid the hotel fee on line completely.  It was a disaster.  Leaving on a positive note, the wading pool was great for small children.  Otherwise it was a horrible experience and the unfortunate end to my lovely summer vacation as a teacher on break. Advice:  Spend the extra money and skip the castle.

A GREAT value for your money IF you get the rennovated rooms in tower 2.
However, the casino and the buffet are pretty disappointing. My advice is to get your room here and expect to party elsewhere.

I know exactly how to spruce the old castle up...a controlled demolition.  Time to bring the old girl down and start over.  This place is rotted to the core.  The "upgraded" rooms feature faded old plasma screens that pre date HDMI plugs and seem to display images in grey scale.  The carpets are a mosaic of stains, the buffet is a flesh eating bacteria breeding ground, and the live lounge entertainment is...is...well, I don't know what to make of them.

The price is right for the dump that it is.  That earns them an extra star.  If you stay here, plan on being out most of the time and it may work for you.

The last time I stayed at Excalibur was when I was 5 and that was when they first opened in 1990. 20 years later and damn have things changed. This place is in dire need of a facelift. See, this place needs some cosmetic surgery, not Heidi Montag.

My friends and I stayed in Tower 1 where the rooms are very dated. CRT TV, loud inefficient AC, and the decor is straight up kitschy. One of the last kitschy hotels in Vegas, especially now that the Vegas strip's becoming more high-class and all about real estate and timeshares.

I found it very difficult to sleep (even after a night out on the town and being pretty damn drunk) because of the loud AC that would turn on and off intermittently. The walls are very thin; we were able to hear the people above us getting into their room at around 2am on Sat. night and the sausagefest next door the night before.
