I also found a strand of long blonde hair in the bed my boyfriend and I were gonna be sleeping on. Gross! I guess I should be thankful it wasn't a pube but still! I guess having stayed at the Venetian, the Mirage, Treasure Island, and Vdara during past trips to Vegas spoiled me. Is it too much to expect a clean room? It's true what they say: you get what you pay for. I honestly don't understand why parents would even stay here with their little kids here when you can stay at a non-smoking, non-gaming hotel where the air and the atmosphere's a lot cleaner. And you most likely won't see a lot of people drunk off their asses.

If you're able to wake up early enough, the all-day buffet is a pretty good value. $30 for a wristband that allows you to come back and eat throughout the day until closing at 10pm. This is especially very worth it when they start offering the prime rib. And at least they seem to be making an effort to make good food, unlike the folks over at the MGM Grand buffet who can't even serve taco shells that aren't stale.

And the elevator situation is AWFUL when you're trying to check out on Sunday morning, but then again that's always the case no matter where you stay at. But the difference with this stay at Excalibur is that some of the elevators weren't working! So my friends and I hauled our stuff down 5 flights of stairs to the 18th floor so we could catch a hopefully empty elevator. And then there were some people in the single-digit floors who were actually trying to catch an elevator. Are you serious?! My boyfriend yelled at the people on these floors (since we stopped at every floor on the way down), "DON'T BE LAZY!" There were even people on the 2nd floor who wanted an elevator. Really? Are you trying to be funny?

Excalibur was a good value for where we needed to be at since we went to see the Jabbawockeez perform at MGM Grand and all you need for a weekend in Vegas is a place to sleep and get ready at different times during the day.

You get what you pay for -- I was looking for a cheap cheap hotel room that was on the Strip during my Vegas stay, and that's what I got.

The rate was ridiculously cheap -- something like $51\/night during the weekend. Of course, we crammed four girls in one room, so for four nights, each of us only owed about $50. You can't beat that if you tried!!!

Pros:
-- Location, location, location! If you are taking the shuttle from the hotel, this is one of the first stops because it is on like the first corner after you turn onto Las Vegas Blvd. And, leaving to go to the airport, we were picked up last, so the ride was short and sweet - just how I like it.
-- Shuttle. When you're there in the middle of August and it's 100 degrees outside, the last thing you want to do is walk around. This hotel has a shuttle train that is connected to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay (and maybe even one more hotel - I can't remember). And, it's right across the street from New York, New York and the MGM Grand. We could get around quite easily without having to sweat too much.
-- Price\/Value. Seriously, $50\/night. That left more money for eating and DRINKING. No complaints there. Also, what you get for the money is decent -- room wasn't horrible. It was clean and decent-sized. The recently renovated rooms are MUCH nicer. Try to get one of those if you can. They have the widescreen TVs in them and a nicer bathroom.
-- Pool. Now, I didn't go to any of the other pools, so I couldn't compare. But, the pool there is a nice place to recover from a hangover. Tons of beach chairs and cabanas, and for someone like me who can't swim, they have pools shallow enough that you can wade and not drown. of course, you'll be amongst kids, but whatever.

Cons:
-- Slow elevators! There are only like six elevators that service each tower of 30+ floors. Completely inefficient.
-- The lobby is huge and confusing. It took me about 20 minutes of walking through the casino before I found the check-in desk. Check-in, however, was quick and easy.
-- Poor food choices. On our first day, we were so jetlagged that we decided to have breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Big mistake! I left feeling like I had just inhaled ten pounds of lard. Gross. But, I did discover a Krispy Kreme in there, so I somehow lived off coffee and donuts when I was too lazy to venture elsewhere for food.
-- In-house entertainment. Essentially, there is none. Unless you are a fan of Thunder Down Under, there is really nothing to see or do there. You have to venture outside the castle if you actually want to see a decent show\/concert\/attraction, etc.

Overall, I would definitely stay there again. The cons are nothing that would keep me away from staying at this budget-friendly and convenient hotel.
Been staying here for a couple of days now and I don't really have a problem with anything. I've seen the reviews on this place and I'm glad I haven't seen the dark side( Star Wars pun )

Let's say...you're on a budget, need a big room with two spacious beds, and love to roam the strip on foot: Excalibur is the best hotel for you. 

Price ($29 off season special to about $150 suites) is what set's Excalibur above the other nearby hotels. I have stayed here about 5 times before moving to Las Vegas and my overall feeling is MEH!!!

It's not bad at all, the motif of an adult disney land is old...but awesome. Regular rooms come with two queen beds and a flat screen TV. Suites are moderate in size as compared to the Paris' Red Room and Planet Hollywood Suites. The furnishings and styles inside are EXTREMELY dated but for the price....acceptable.

Entertainment options plentiful: Fantasy, Tournament of Kings, and that dude one (disclaimer: as a straight male, one shall not acknowledge the existence of said "banana fest" show). Also, Excalibur is at the bottom of the strip, perfect for early morning joggers, walkers, and excercise enthusiasts.

I totally recommend this place to all my cash strapped friends visiting from Hawaii. The adage goes, "you get what you pay for.

I stayed at Excalibur this weekend for my 21st birthday and overall I was happy with my decision!  I do feel like the rooms could be more spiffed up. I was hoping to have a coffee pot or mini fridge at least... but the quality of everything else was great! The thunder from down under show was amaaaazing! And I loved how the shops and casino were all laid out. Staff was helpful and nice!

Me and my fiance stayed here while we were wedding venue hunting. We stayed in a standard room. The room was clean which was a big thing for me, but our bed sheet was almost pointless. It was paper thin and didn't offer any warmth or comfort. Our bathroom towels had stains on them (gross) but the room itself was at least a good size. We stayed here because it was on the cheaper side but I don't see us staying there again. It fit our needs at the time and we only needed it for the weekend. Anything longer than a day or two and I wouldn't stay here. If I were on vacation and not there on "business" I would stay somewhere else.

This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. I know it's cheap but you most definitely get what you paid for. The bathroom smelled like a sewage every time you flushed the toilet or used the sink. Carpet was filthy and old. The bedsheets had weird stains... AND THEY HAD BED BUGS. I woke up itching and scratching like crazy.

I did not expect this place to be a 5 star hotel but I did expect it to be clean. I didn't care if it was outdated, I didn't care about the shitty view, I just wanted a sanitary place to sleep and Excalibur did not deliver. This hotel pretty much ruined my whole trip.

Hey man, for an aging, 21-year-old hotel on The Strip, it's doing pretty well. It's pretty well kept and the carpet is clean. I'm surprised it hasn't gone down hill more. It could do with some upgrades, but it's pretty "vintage" compared to the other stuff on The Strip. It's one of the last places you can actually take your family, as it has an arcade, and an even more decent arcade (Gameworks) not too far away.

Hotel room was dingy and dirty.....no housekeeping service available. Watch for the hidden fees......my $29 room for two nights was $146 for two nights! Waiter at the Camelot, though very attentive, overcharged me for my dinner and seemed angry when I VERY politely questioned it. Overall, not impressed in the least!

The bed was way to freaking soft, i rolled off it a few times. 
The casino was good, try the Deal or No Deal shots, i won 3 nites in a row.
The little food court upstairs is cool, if ur looking to save some cash.

The whole place is clean, and filled with polite and not to pushy ppl. i wold go back here. Its cheap and a play to lay your head, its fucking Vegas you shouldn't be in the room anyway!

From the moment we stepped out of the car we were less than impressed. We were being dropped off by friends and there was NO ONE around to help unload our luggage. When the bell hop finally did make an appearance he was extremely rude and kept telling us to move the car, did not help us with the bags and made fun of us for not knowing where registration was then walked off. We were then charged the extra $20 a day resort fee even though our reservation (from another discount site) stated all taxes and fees included. When we finally got to the room it smelled like a Dog had taken a dump in it. It had not been cleaned at all either. I called down to the desk to switch rooms. They informed me it would take 30 minutes to get us keys to a new room sent up to us so I had to go all the way back down to the front desk for them. For my Inconvenience the desk clerk (who did not apologize for the error or look me in the eye) gave me the exact drink coupon that is already provided in the welcome brochure. Thanks but free drinks are already provided when I gamble. After getting sorted in the new room we went down to the casino floor to gamble. We were in the hotel a total of three hours when we went back to the room to find out that they had reset our room keys and for my imposition I had to go back down to the front desk again to get a new key. Again no apologies!! Worst customer service ever. I knew this hotel was older but the rooms are extremely outdated and comparable to a cheap motel 6. Never going back.

Yes, I'm sure you're looking at this review because you found a GREAT deal for the Excalibur online.  Don't do it.  Pay the extra 15 bucks a night and stay like anywhere else.

Unless you are the owner of a screaming, bratty child.  Then you should go to Excalibur so you can be contained with all the other screaming, bratty children + owners.... far away from where I'll be.

The tables are cheap.  The decor is too. Somehow the Excalibur misses the boat on delightfully tacky and kitchsy.  Just feels kinda lame.

Ventilation system is horrible in this hotel, you can  smell the cigarette smoke in your room. valet service is substandard  they are rude and unprofessional . and the furniture in the rooms are stained and have holes.

FYI if you use valet service at this motel make sure you keep your receipts for each night stay because they will charge you extra

I booked this hotel through Expedia and got a good rate. Not a bad location on the strip and you can walk to all the main places without too much difficulty. Our room was very basic and compared to other hotels on the strip this one is on the lower end. When I come back to Vegas I won't be coming back here again. There was a reason why I got a good rate at this hotel.

We arrived at about 1:30 yesterday and we were pleased that even with the cutbacks in valet services, we didn't have to wait long to leave our car. Plus, we were allowed to check in right away - even though check-in time was 3pm.

Thanks to Yelpers who convinced us to spend the extra $20 to upgrade to Tower II.  Our room was supposedly "much newer" and nicer than Tower I. It wasn't great, but it was clean, beds were comfortable, and as a bonus the non-smoking floor wasn't smoky at all! The A\/C was noisy but we slept through it, and we had no other noise issues (a rarity in Vegas).

I was happy to have the food court with affordable and healthy options. My husband enjoyed his Popeye's chicken and I had a turkey breast wrap from Schlotsky's.  There was a coffee kiosk right at the bottom of the Tower II elevator, so it was easy to get coffee in the morning and their low-fat bran\/cranberry muffin was actually quite yummy!

The text-to-checkout ability is a nice idea; however, when I received the link to the mobile site to finish checkout, and entered the requested info, I received only a generic message something like "thank you for your request". So, we weren't convinced we had checked out.  Fortunately, we found a kiosk downstairs near the elevator and requested checkout there. The confirmation screen showed two typos in my husband's email address made by the reservation clerk, and luckily we were able to correct that. 

It was great to have the express tram to the Mandalay Bay as it was 105 or so outside. Overall, it was a solid experience.

We stayed here for a night while in Vegas. Reading all the negative reviews of this place I beg to differ. I actually liked the place minus a few small flaws.

Check-in Experience: The check-in was smooth minus the long line for the check-in counter. We were many people but the lady at the counter was very quick in getting us on our way to the room. She was really polite and also told us a few places to visit since it was our first time in Vegas.

Casino: The casino floor is huge with a lot of different Casino stuff( Sorry I don't have much Casino judging knowledge but there were actually a lot of machines)

Room: The rooms were nice and big. Our room had two queen beds. The housekeeping was very helpful and prompt.

In all I liked staying here and given a second chance might stay again.

I've never given a hotel just 1 star before.

I'm here for a family occasion, but I like Vegas for the excitement, and things to do, pretty much other than gambling. I thought the castle-thingy was cute for my 4 year old daughter. It was... she was so impressed when we got here, and not really knowing any better, I think she still is. She's the only one who will leave impressed at all.
Symbolic was a beer bottle left in the corner of an elevator when we checked in at 4PM. Same bottle was still there at 10PM. Wallpaper in my room is peeling off on the bedroom wall that has the shower on the other side. The clothing closet has no doors on it. Every time you walk thru the lobby, a guy will try to pull you over to an agent who wants to sign you up for a tour of the Grandview Hotel, and in exchange, they'll comp you a show or two, maybe some time at the Excalibur. I didn't do it, and now that I've read horrible things about the timeshare organization RCI that promotes this, I certainly won't.
I'm here on yelp to leave this review, and to find a more suitable hotel for the rest of our stay.  You do get the feeling that management here isn't paying attention, and they might not be getting paid to actually do so. I'm kicking myself for not checking reviews before we reserved, but since it's right "on the Vegas strip", I never would have imagined it could have been like THIS.  I supposed that--if I was gambling--I'd have given them an extra star. This place is BARE BONES, and your bones friggin' STINK!

Room was clean and decent. The furniture was in good condition and the whole vibe was acceptable. Our room did not have a microwave or mini fridge. There are 4 different pools and a water slide so that was pretty cool! 

Unfortunately, I would never stay at the hotel again. The stench of cigarette was horrible! It was my first time in Las Vegas and as I walked throughout hotels on the strip, I quickly realized that Excalibur truly is the worst-smelling. I have a baby and this is something that was very important to me. I will definitely be staying at a different hotel next time.

Decent place but there are other better hotels in the strip. Things I didn't like at this hotel.

1. The sheets are thin and it gets cold at night
2. Called several times the room service for extra towels but never received them
3. Location is at the edge of the strip

Things I liked about Excalibur:
1. Hotel is old school compared to the other ones
2. The casino is awesome - like all others
3. Great price 
4. Cool castle 

Enjoyed my stay at Excalibur and I would recommend it to some

Great place, very customer friendly, the staff goes above and beyond to accommodate it's guests. I've been here a few times. It has an amazing show Tournament of Kings that includes dinner, it's better than Medieval Times. The hotel is very affordable perfectly located on the strip where all the action is happening. The place was clean and the food was great. This hotel is a must superb. I highly recommend it.

Didn't stay here visited a friend who stayed here during June 4-7 2010 in Tower 2 on the 20 Th floor.

Pros's
A high end circus circus that's saying something..
Nice size Flat screen tv


Con's
Where to start oh flat screen with no HD...wow
No Bathroom Towel's
Dated Furniture (Think Orange Chair's) and old curtain's
Older Bathroom'
Dirty carpet in room and in the hallway's
Clogged sink


Overall just seem like a  little less dirtier Circus Circus with castle theme.

PRO: Two security personnel at the elevators. Gosh bless them for their sense of humor & helpfulness.

NEGATIVES:

1. Old.

2. Suspect housekeeper. 4pm checked in. 5:15pm housekeeper knocks once and swiftly keyed into our room without giving us the opportunity to answer. She was startled and we were unsettled by her audacity to enter. Housekeeper fumbled with her words asking us if we needed anything.

Well, yes - a bathroom that doesn't have wads of hair on top of the shower drain or changing the dirty sheets from the previous occupant would've been nice.

But, what we would really like is a peace of mind knowing that a questionable housekeeper won't be pilfering through our room when we're not there.

Veanet helped me check in way earlier than my check in time and made the process easier for me, she was a great help and had awesome customer service. I also let her know I had other friends coming in later and she reserved their room to be close to mine! I love staying here always do!

I stayed at the Excaliber for two nights and then at the Paris hotel for the following night. The Excaliber was better than the Paris by FAR - as far as the room itself is concerned. There were only two flaws with the Excaliber: 1) the people in the lobby who work for that timeshare company - they look like employees and they harass you incessantly at every corner, and; 2) It is at the far end of the strip, so involves a lot of walking to get anywhere. Besides that I loved it - our room had an excellent view, the staff were friendly, the line was not an extremely long wait, it had the EARLIEST check-in time of any of the hotels we called on the strip and it was a pretty atmosphere!
Great prices, but the hotel does need a little updating, old television, no refrigerator, no microwave, etc... but wonderful location and great service! I'd definitely come back!

Just got back from Vegas. We stayed at the Excalibur and we loved it! Great location. Fresh, clean linens. It was very quiet, I got a good nights sleep! With all charges I paid only about $80 per night. Super great deal! Recommended!

**If you arrive right at check in (3pm), be prepared to wait in a long line to check in. That was a bit tough after long travel but the hotel clerks were super nice at check in. :)
Decent service and great location in the strip. Definitely had a lot of options and things to do. Room needed some touch up for example one of the hair dryers didn't work in the room.

Went for a bachelor party. Booked two queen rooms for two nights, both in Tower II, and both at a great rate. Hotel itself is dated, but staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms we had were nice enough, big beds, large, upgraded bathrooms. Not much else, no fridge, no wi-fi, no HD TV...

Casino floor has standard fare, bars and restaurants in the hotel are fair at best, leaves a lot to be desired. Transportation to other areas on the strip is easy and quick. Can catch the tram down to Mandalay Bay and Excalibur; can walk to NYNY and MGM, or can walk up to Monte Carlo and catch the tram through the City Center up to Bellagio. Otherwise it's best to just take a taxi if you want to get down to Venetian, Wynn, etc...

I would return if I got the same low rate, but if I had to pay much more than I did I don't know that I'd be back. This hotel needs an update on the casino floor, as well as some new bar and food options if they want to keep people in the hotel, otherwise, there are better options just a few steps away.

Booked through Expedia. Got good deal for Laughlin Nevada through Expedia previously and received no unpleasant surprises so thought we would use the service for a Las Vegas trip. Not a good resort stay this time including fees piled high and two free breakfast buffets not available as advertised - only discounts and only if buffet charged to room. Went to buffet for breakfast and it was not very good. Even the coffee was very weak - just coffee flavored hot water. On the plus side we could walk to two other resorts connected through walkways, the Luxor and Mandalay (about the only good thing I can say about the Excalibur). Nothing inexpensive at Excalibur. Room rates are no bargain, parking is $8 per day, buffet is $35 during week and $40 on the weekend. Employees try to sell you show tickets as you are walking through the resort. No coffee maker in the room, but there are coffee kiosks available near the elevators. Unfortunately the coffee kiosks are closed half the time. When open, especially in the morning, expect to wait in line 20 to 30 minutes for a mediocre but overpriced cup of coffee served by the slowest baristas in Nevada. Our room was noisy, near some type of equipment that emitted a loud droning hum 24\/7. I am a Navy veteran who used to sleep under the flight deck on an aircraft carrier so I could sleep through it. My wife, however, had trouble sleeping. Update: Checked out a day early and informed front desk. Next day received an email with a link to expedited check out! Contacted the hotel and they insisted the charge for the entire stay would remain in place and I would have to contact my booking service, expedia.com, for any refund issues. I contacted Expedia, was placed on hold for 20 minutes while someone at Expedia contacted Excalibur. In the end the Expedia representative informed me the Excalibur Hotel insisted I had stayed the entire booked time (basically said I was lying) and no refund of any sort would be issued. Recommend avoid Excalibur during a stay in Las Vegas.

Its taken me a while to get around to this one... 

Stayed here in October 2012 with my Best Friend for her Birthday. 

The room was purchased on PriceLine, I hope that isn't why the room was old and disgusting. 

The furnishings were from the 70's. The AC unit smelled like burnt electrical wire and the carpets looked like someone may have puked all over the place. I wouldn't reccommend this place to a homeless bum! 

Oh and don't stroll the lobby, you're liable to get shot.

Eight days in this place was more than I will ever do again. 

I grew up in the days of old Vegas. The Vegas with the 99-cent buffet and when the best prime rib dinner in town was served with a show on the side; the Vegas where the men still wore suits and the ladies wore silk hats and you saved for months to be able to ride to the show in a limo; the Vegas where Caesars Palace was THE place to go (or sneak into if you were underage). Boy, how times have changed. 

The only real positive thing I can say about this stay was the customer service. I know you get what you pay for, but that being the case, this place should have been a lot cheaper. The rooms were very mediocre and the first two rooms we were put in (yes, we changed three times) not only felt dirty, they were dirty. Where the in-room refrigerator should have been was an empty hole. Apparently, management has decided that is not an option. There is no in-room coffee pot so it's either go to the coffee stand downstairs or order room service. Which, by the way, room service ends at 2:00 p.m.  Oh yes, did I mention that we were in the "newly redecorated" tower rooms? I was afraid to see the lower priced, "old" rooms. 

This place definitely wants you to spend money in the casino and restaurants. Unfortunately, since there is no way to keep food or drink in your room, you have no other choice. 

The restaurants are, at best, also mediocre and very expensive. Even the fast-food court was highly over priced and lousy (we spent $30 at Hot Dog on a Stick, for two people, and the food was dry and cold). 

Oh, yeah ... That $30+ per night "resort fee"? I'm still trying to figure out what the hell that covered. The pool was closed (not that I go to Vegas to go swimming), the gym\/workout room is a joke and you will never convince me that WiFi is that expensive. I didn't have a car but I understand they also charge parking fees so it certainly wasn't for that. 

Bottom line, the next time I spend more than an hour on the strip, I will stay some place worthy of loosing my money in Vegas.  The Excalibur certainly was not that place.
The casini dealers here are the most friendliest people. The atmosphere is very lively. I had a lot of fun here in comparison to mgm and bellagii

Worst hotel to stay in period..... It's not safe. They've had 3 different shootings at this casino in the past 2 years and last week they had a fire and has to evacuate and not let guests inside the casino.

I am not sure why there is so much hate on the hotel. I rate restaurants, hotels, services based on expectations, not on whether it is literally the best. For instance, it is established that the excalibur is not a five star hotel, true, but does it live up to the inexpensive hotel rooms and wifi internet it promises to provide? Yes! It does. And if I am still on a budget, I would definitely stay there again.

The registration\/ check-in line moves along. I think I waited 15 minutes. It wasn't a big deal.

Our room was clean, so were the bedsheets and the bathroom in Tower I. 

The casino areas were nice and they have many updated games, as well as $5 dollar tables in the mornings and afternoons.

The pool was a little cloudy though, but the hot tub was a hot tub.

My girlfriend and I saw the Thunder from Down Under show. It's a must see, truly.

The one thing that was a regrettable experience was the fact that there are these "marketing" people with "TAKE A BREAK" name tags that are advertising free shows or gaming monies if you take a "small" tour of a vacation home opportunity. My husband and I did go on the tour. The food provided gave me severe acid reflux. And the three hours that they estimate it taking, really took 5 hours. The sales people hold you hostage in this room with tables and press you hard to buy a vacation rental. I after we were working into hour five AND I had acid reflux, I lost all respect for the company, "Vacation Village" at the Grandview in Las Vegas.  

If you stay at the Excalibur, don't let these Take A Break people rope you into that experience. It was terrible. 

Otherwise, a very fun 3 day vacation in Vegas Baby!

We stayed in this hotel back in December 2016 for a conference for 5 days. Our hotel room was clean when we checked in and was maintained during our entire stay. We did not have any issues with plumbing in the bathroom. 

The outdoor pool was closed in December (weather was ~ 40F).

The entire facility is big and it took a day to figure out how to get to the Strip, to other connecting hotels and to get to the buffet (2nd Floor).

Nice hotel, definitely fits the MGM brand.

The staff is nice and the hotel\/casino is average. The hotel part need updating and I think they know that. I would stay here again. Just dated and not as nice as other hotels in the area. Wifi is good 3 mbits down and up.

I really hated this hotel in my younger years. I must say, I have a different opinion now. 

If you are in Vegas for a Bachelor party, to floss, or for the club scene this is not your hotel. 

If you are in Vegas to take in the experience, see the different themes hotels, for a convention...etc or have kids. This is a great choice.

The staff was helpful and nice. 
Pretty busy casino, check in lines were super long! Although, they kept it moving pretty quickly. 

Whomever, did their work in the bathrooms was sloppy! The faucet on the sink, sits too far back and spills water on the counter between the faucet and the bowl of the sink. And they used two different granite slabs, poor craftsmanship. I noticed it, but it's not so bad that I wouldn't come back.

I can honesty say this is THE worst hotel I have ever stayed in. If you are looking for a good Vegas experience, this is not your place.

From the moment we walked in the front door, I was terrified. The overwhelming putrid smell and the VERY VERY dated decor was enough to almost make me turn around immediately but I continued hoping the hotel room itself would be a lot better... I was wrong. The smell lingered through the halls and into the room. Outfitted with terrible wallpaper and disgusting carpet, a 1990s air\/heat box, dated furniture and NASTY linens\/blankets- this place resembled a motel 6 and an extremely low budget casino from a small town- which I would almost prefer over this.

The staff was unfriendly and unhelpful- asking for towels seemed to be too much for them to handle. My friends luggage was lost on the way in and once it was delivered to the hotel, they called and told her she would have to come get it because they didn't have time for at least an hour.

I can not clearly put into words how low budget and disgusting the entire experience was... Even the restaurants within were terrible. We ate at a Big Dicks one afternoon for a quick lunch before venturing out onto the strip and had the WORST food that was WAY overpriced and took over 2.5 hours from start to finish.... Low budget dairy queen and a kids arcade--- enough said.

I really enjoyed my stay here at the Excalibur. Sure it is outdated & their doors look gross & you can see smudgy fingerprints everywhere, but for the price I paid I would definitely stay again. If I wanted to stay in my hotel room all day then I'm sure I would have paid for a better quality room at another hotel on the strip. For a 2 night stay during the week it was about $40 a night which isn't bad at all if I'm only there to sleep, shower & change clothes. 

The casino was pretty decent in my opinion as well. They offer drink passes as part of the resort fees. I redeemed those free drinks at The Lounge, I believe it was called. I really wished they carried Blue Moon. Perhaps the next time I stay, they will have added that.
Ticket booth lady told my hubby 10pm beeGees show. We drove to hotel only to find out no 10pm show. Bad info & wasted time & gas.

The Strips version of a flea bag hotel. Registration was extremely rude and un-accommodating. Was there early and requested an early check in after calling to confirm our room was on hold. Arrived and found that there is a charge and for early check in that was not disclosed which was no problem until they said they were at capacity. Completely run down and stinks horribly. Avoid at all costs..

The buffet at the Excalibur was very cheap 2 for 1 (19.88).  The food was pretty disgusting. I like getting the most out of my money but I felt like we got what we paid for. There wasn't too much variety... this included nasty instant mashed potatoes, dry turkey, dry chicken, disgusting hard penne pasta...  They lacked a lot of foods and desserts most buffets have. ( gold coast was better i'd go there instead for the same price. )I would say the best part of the buffet would be the drink selection and that wasn't great. You're better off paying a little more for a better buffet. Worst buffet I've ever eaten at. Also, the seating staff was whatever treated adults like elem kids @ an amusement park, cleaning staff was cool.

Stayed here for one night waiting for friends.  It's by far the best valued "4 star" hotel on the strip with rooms under $50 sometimes.  Many of the rooms have been renovated with nicer beds, TVs, and restrooms.  It's a good value Vegas hotel if you're ok not having all the frills of some of the other more expensive places.

I stay at Excalibur on average 2 times a year. I spend a lot of money there. I always receive comp night offers from Excalibur through MLife. I always look forward to my stays there as the staff is friendly, the food and drink options are plentiful and Rick at the lounge bar is the best. 

I am going to Las Vegas in mid October. I checked my MLife as I always do to see what comp nights I have available. I had an offer for 2 free nights mid week at Excalibur. I called to book the rooms. When I gave my dates, I was told comps were not available due to conferences\/conventions in town that week. Ok. No problem. 

Well, on Friday July 1st, my fiance received an email from Excalibur with an MLife offer inside. The offer was for 2 comp nights mid week. They also included a calendar within the email showing what days were comp and what days were discounted rates. I start looking at the calendar at the week I am going. That whole week (Sun-Thurs) is available to her for comps. I was really upset. The comp was not available to me due to events in town but it is available to her? 

Today, I called the reservation number in the email. I explained why I was calling and asked what the deal was. The man (I don't remember his name) I spoke to told me the offer was available to her at a higher tier than me due to her spending more money there. I said that didn't make sense because I go twice a year to her once every couple years.

Then I started thinking. I am a higher tier than her (I'm Pearl, she is Sapphire) yet she gets a higher tier offer? Then I start to think, what difference does it make when we both have 2 night comp offers but my dates aren't available to me but they are to her? 

Next, I get online and go to MLife.com. I looked up my tax info provided through MLife.com and saw I spent $1,900+ last year at Excalibur. According to their tax info for my fiance, she spent $752 last year at Excalibur. But the guy on the phone said she got the higher tier due to spending more and they want those people to come back. Now I feel lied to because I spent $1,200 more than her. 

I plan on taking my business elsewhere while I travel to Las Vegas later this year. Excalibur has just lost 2 loyal guests.

Horrible!! But I guess you get what you pay for. Every other casino on the strip was booked. Thought this one would be decent...wrong! The steakhouse was amazing. That's the only reason I gave it one star. We'll never stay here again. Rooms are totally outdated. Very dirty. Room was nonsmoking but totally smelled like stale smoke.  Not even a clock radio. If you want a refrigerator, they'll bring you one, for 25 bucks a day. If you want internet,(included in the resort fee) they'll bring you some cord, I guss. No wifi. This place sucks!

i was really nervous to stay here based off of the yelp reviews. I checked everything for bed bugs, made sure it wasn't dirty from guests before, etc. 
I was honestly not expecting this place to be good. I was surprised by my stay. 
Everything was spotless! I had an amazing view of the New York New York coaster. We anticipated their being a wait to check in. The wait was probably 20 mins. I'm an annual pass holder and Disneyland so to be honest the wait didn't bug me. We asked to check-in early and they allowed us to. Every staff member we interacted with was super nice and accommodating. the only thing i didn't like so much about my stay was how murky the water was. Every time my friend and I would lift our hand out of the water there would be other people's hair caught between our fingers. We went poolside instead and still enjoyed our time. Also, the strip is expensive so don't expect to pay a reasonable price for most things. I suggest that if you want to buy beer, alcohol, snacks or swimming gear to go to Walmart that is 15 minutes away. 
It's not the most high-rated hotel, I'm sure their are nicer and fancier ones on the strip but the Excalibur is pretty awesome still especially for their low-rates.

First, full disclosure: I put off staying hear on multiple occasions upon reading some of the reviews about this place. I would always book Excalibur but then chicken out at the last minute, cancel my reservation here and book elsewhere. However, on one trip I waited too long to cancel and everything else was booked up. I gasped in terror and thought, "Oh no! I'm going to be stuck at Excalibur!"  I prepared myself mentally for the substandard room and headed out to Vegas. I was so extremely surprised by the fact that the rooms and hallways leading to them had all been remodeled! The room was amazing and perfectly located for my needs. The employees were so helpful and friendly, and I was amazed by the fact that everything was so clean and well kept. Excalibur is, perhaps, one of the best kept secrets in Las Vegas. It maintains a fun thematic environment at a bargain rate. I recently visited New York-New York and was amazed that the room was no better or more impressive than the one at Excalibur. In fact, the carpets in the hallways were old and dirty. The rooms were also twice the price of the ones at Excalibur. From now on, I will always stay here because it is just as nice, if not nicer, than other options along the strip that are twice the cost. Plus, the spa was very affordable and a relaxing experience throughout my trip. Highly recommend!

The hotel was nice and clean. It was quiet we were on the 15th floor. I like that the hotel is smoke free. The only thing that was annoying was the time share sharks bothering you when u entered or left the casino.

for being the first hotel ive stayed at in vegas with my bf..ima give four stars....i liked it..we stayed for valentines day\/ late bday...i liked that i was able to request a strip view..and we got one...everyone was friendly..i didnt like that the "security check" wasnt there...they were supose to make sure everyone going into the elevators had a room key or something..umm they give you vouchers for drinks... we didnt use them...but our room was nice... it was right in the square of the hotels...mgm..new york..excalibur..and the other one..tropicana?...umm at night...they have their bar inside that got packed...and they offer the medievel nights show....
overall, i wouldnt mind staying here again....
make sure to check their website..good deals n stuff..

We stayed at the hotel over the 4th of July weekend, and I'll have to say I was pleasantly surprised, especially after reading all the negative reviews - I almost cancelled my reservations and booked elsewhere. We arrived after midnight and the room type we booked was unavailable so luckily we were upgraded into Tower 2. Our room was very clean and we had a great view of the New York New York roller coaster.

The kids loved the water slide and pool area, and they have pretty decent food served poolside. I had the rosemary chicken sandwich and fries, it was less than $10. Only negative here was the stinky smoke smell in the casino. All in all a good time.
Nice hotel has everything in it . I don't know why people keep complaining . Great for the price I will be back soon !'

Not bad but have had much better for less. The only plus was the location. Even though certain areas and  rooms were non-smoking, smokers still were smoking. I'm not sure if the ventilation systems are poor but the entire hotel reeked of smoke. We visited MGM, Mandalay Bay, New York New York and more and didn't have this issue! By the end of my trip my eyes remained blood shot....didn't realize I had allergies to cigarettes until the stay at Excalibur! Claritin take me away!!!lol

I HATE THIS NEW PARKING situaton.  How much more will these casinos look to make from us!! Its ridiculous to pay for parking and then for there to be none.  Their answer, "Park at Mandalay Bay and use the monorail"....100 percent unacceptable when we've pre-paid for parking and are guests staying at this hotel!!

Excalibur definitely has a great visual impact upon arrival...I mean, what's more awesome than staying inside a hotel that looks like a castle? But once you step inside your room, you realize that it's not as cool anymore.  

The parking lot is huge, but it is spread out around the hotel rather than being condensed into a parking structure.  So, we ended up in a spot where we had to walk pretty far to get inside the hotel.  Not that I'm lazy, but we had a lot of stuff to carry! 

Check in was easy.  We dared my friend to try the "$20 Trick" to see if we could get a room upgrade, but it didn't work-- probably because there were too many bookings for EDC weekend.  

Our room could have used a facelift.  The furnishings were all pretty ugly and must have seen better days.  I've stayed at better equipped Holiday Inns.  Not that I could complain, really, because the price for the room was pretty good! 

This is a practical hotel that fit our needs of 1) being on The Strip 2) storing our things 3) giving us a place to crash at night.  If you are expecting any more than that, or if you'll be spending a lot of time in the hotel, you'll be disappointed.  In that case, I  suggest you drop a bit more cash on a better hotel.  But for the frugal group who will be out most of the time, Excalibur is a good fit!

Stayed here for the night. I've previously booked the room on booking.com and got a really good deal. This was my first time staying at the hotel.

The registration line was pretty long. It took like about 20-30 minutes just to check in. Took a while even though there were a lot of people at the front desk. 

The inside is really great. There are restaurants on the sides of the first floor and they have a buffet on the second floor. It's ~20 bucks but the buffet is BOMB. I went for breakfast and they were making omelette and crepes. They had many different types of food varieties. They even had sushi. 


My biggest problem was the room. I walked in and it looked no one had cleaned it. The beds were the only thing in the room that were changed. The bathroom had towels all over the floor. Also, the trash wasn't taken out at all. I was pretty disappointed. You go to Vegas and have this expectation of these hotels and maybe housekeeping just forgot but it was unacceptable. I called housekeeping and they came and cleaned the room fairly quickly. Besides that the place was nice, the view was great, and the food was amazing. I probably won't stay here a second time since there are so many more hotels to choose from.

A remnant of Las Vegas of old times...this place is now dilapidated and in need of a huge makeover.  Merlin and the Dragon are gone, and allure and attraction that Excalibur once had has been replaced by cheap eats and cheap rooms.  The one saving grace is the Fun Dungeon which still contains a variety of midway games, claw games, and a handful of arcade games.  The midway is probably second best in Vegas (only to be upped by the appropriately named Circus Circus), and is a great place to be a kid again.  

Pro tip: If you change out big bills ($50 or $100) you can usually score free passes for midway games, or in recent months, BOGO coupons.  Enjoy!

I truly believe that this is the worst MGM resort. I got stuck in a room with no view except of a center block wall, no AC, one light bulb, a rude staff and a ridiculous resort fee. I have no idea How in the hell I'll be able to stand this for 3 more days.  I think it is worth it to just pay for another hotel that isn't MGM.

When you check in they will offer you an upgrade for more money per night.  If you refuse this upgrade they put you in the worst, unmaintained rooms they have.  I had to dismantle the AC unit to clean it and I had to pull the dresser\/TV stand out repeatedly to reboot the outdated TV system. 

Time share sales people will be up your butt the entire time.

We stayed here for one week and really enjoyed it. Compared to other hotels on the strip, this place is sort of a dump, however our room was clean and nice and comfortable. We found the beds to be very comfortable, and there was very little noise from the hall or other rooms. It's easy to walk from Excalibur to everywhere else on the strip, so if you get a good deal on a room here, definitely take it instead of paying more elsewhere. The casino is dark and a little smokey but it does have high "castle" ceilings. This place is so cheesy. It has a moat... No wifi but has ethernet cords in each room.

For the price u pay it's well worth it. The rooms are clean and omg the beds are so comfy, I wish I could of stole the pillows. I got a spa room cause the amazing front desk lady named LIZ by the way she made my first VDay with my love so amazing. My girlfriend loved the Jacuzzi it was huge. I was in tower two and they are updated which I like a lot. I had an amazing view of new York New York n the strip. I love Excalibur, it's a freaken castle come on and u can't get better deals then this I researched.

Yah, definitely cheap...
Eh.
We were in Tower 1, room 11150.
No tub, just a large standing shower, which is ok... except for the crappy water pressure, which is a major pet peeve of mine.  The water pressure pretty much sucked across the entire hotel.

Internet is available in the rooms via the Ethernet cable.  No wifi.

Pool was fun but obviously looks outdated in comparison to the "average" amenities available in Vegas.

This is my second stay at Excalibur this year, the first time was February of 2016 and we paid to stay. The room was worn, outdated and shabby, luckily we really didn't spend much time in the room, but because it was upward of a $100 a night with resort fee included I felt was not a good value- we ended up here again on September 7-9, 2016 because we got a "free" room. I have to say it that way because the resort fee with tax made it 32.00 a night, so not free- the resort fee covers internet that is so slow it's not worth using, and the work out room.  No coffee in rooms, no refrigerator in rooms.  I have been to Las Vegas 3 times in last 3 years and probably won't be back. This last time when I was told they now charge  $8.00 a day to park, just to go and lose money at the casino and when you finally get in the casino you have people harrasing you at every corner for time share-you just feel nickeled and dimed to death. On top of that the dealers that you are losing to are sullen and rude, act like they hate their jobs.  There are just too many new casinos popping up in other areas that really do want to give you a great experience and earn your money. It's no wonder Vegas is not the hot spot it once was, they don't cater to people anymore, it's all about getting every dime you have.

I had to give this dump one star because there was no way to give it a negative star. everything here was AWFUL!!!! The towels in the nicer room (you should see the cheap rooms) were like sand paper. There wasnt even a bathtub in this upgraded room. The entire hotel smelled like a cheap motel off the interstate. The maid went into my jewelry box and stole my earrings. The hotel did NOTHING about it.  The safe was hidden in the dresser drawers in the bottom drawer. There was no sign saying there was a safe in the room. 

The picture of the room on this website is the room I stayed in and it was unacceptable. The staff is rude and knows nothing about customer service. The room's bedding was about as nice as a motel 6's. The air would shut off in the middle of the night. The cheap rooms looked like something from a murder scene. 

The pools were closed expect for two and they were so gross and unsanitary looking that I refused to swim. There was no one serving drinks around the pool I had to keep getting them myself. 

The spa was on of the worst ones I have ever attended. The staff at the spa was young, snotty, and ghetto. There was no locker room attendent when I arrived. I was yelled at by one of the cleaning ladies for not knowing my way around since I wasn't given a tour. There was no fresh fruit or water in the locker room. When the locker room lady finally showed up she came with two small children that she was baby-sitting. Instead of relaxing I had to listen to these little kids run around. 

The hair\/nail salon looked like it belong in compton. The decor was awful and reminded of a bad nail salon in the hood. The "stylist" (i use that term loosley) were foreign and could barley speak english. the stylist never heard of audrey hepburn and said i dont know how to do the up do i requested. my stylist was rude and was shaking when she was doing my hair. i think she was running a meth lab in the back cuz she kept running in the back while working on my hair. i was embrassed that  my best friend who was getting married was subjected to this.  I waited close to an hour my my turn and made appointments months in advanced. The nair salon didnt use OPI products, just some cheap drugstore brand. My nails were chipping hours later. 

The dinning options here are not acceptable. It had a fast food food court and a questionable buffet. I was forced to stay here for a wedding I was in and if given a choice I would have been at the Wynn or Venetian.

I checked in on mothers day expecting to get a run down and smoke filled room. When I reached the check in counter, I was greeted by Steven and he was totally nice! We chatted for a bit and I asked for a nice, clean room.  He was so professional and sweet. He told me where the pool was and about the other amenities to enjoy and then gave me my room key, so off I went! I ended up in tower 2 ( upgraded rooms) and took the elevator to the 16th floor. When I opened the door, I was in shock to see how nice it was and when I opened the curtains, I was even more shocked at how beautiful the view was.  I was so pleased and literally ecstatic about my stay. Upon checkout, a very nice operator at guest services named Sue helped me. She was incredibly sweet. The guy at the spa ( didn't catch his name) was so nice also.  He was kind when I checked in for the gym and even let me keep my chocolates inside while I got some last minute rays before checking out.  The pool guys were awesome too. I didn't think I'd have this experience here considering I usually stay elsewhere in Vegas and I'd definitely come back. This stay far exceeded my expectations, thanks to the great staff who helped me! Overall, positive experience :)

I'm a little disappointed this time. I only came a week ago. This time it was to enjoy a couple days with my family. I requested a non smoking Queen double bed room and I got 1 King bed. And the clerk was debating whether to charge me $20 extra for the non smoking room or not. :(

what a dump. yes it's located on the strip, but not THAT great of a location. Also instead of a nice mint on my pillow when i got in, there was a handsome little bed bug waiting for it's dinner (my head.) Fabulous :-) The rooms smelled like old dust, the hallways were very long and haunting. The only reason why I give this hotel a star is because they fully refunded my money when I told them about the bed bug incident. 

If you want to risk it, pay the lower price and stay here. If you can bump up your fees to 100-150 a night, stay elsewhere.

I wish I had a chance to see the pool grrrrrr, but overall it was an ok hotel. The price is on the better end especially for location. I usually like gambling at Tropicana so it's nice that it's just across the street. As is MGM and NY, NY. Luxor is a quick walk to the right and Mandalay Bay is reachable by tram. Now they need to build trams going towards the other end of strip towards the Cosmopolitan! Either way, rooms in the upgraded tower are nice, bathrooms are clean. I would have liked a new shower mat or even a towel like other hotels use because the one they gave us look like it was purchased at a garage sale. Didn't utilize the restaurants much but they have decent ones, including a 24 hour krispy kreme. All in all, a good place to stay if you're on a budget and want to stay on the strip and everything else is too expensive. BUT if you're not going on a fight weekend and prices are decent everywhere else, splurge on something nicer.

Just returned from our trip to Las Vegas where we stayed at the Excalibur Hotel. In the 90's this hotel was new, nice and accommodating, in 2013-not so much.

The hotel is now old, outdated, a bit dirty and most of the employees seem very unhappy.  We stayed here because we were on a family vacation and 2 of the 3 nights were free.  Next time I think we will pay the extra money to stay elsewhere.

The employees at the front desk are far from friendly.  After getting a room with a view of a block wall and no sky, we were able to change to a room with a view of the Luxor.  The front desk employee begrudgingly changed our room after I complained and explained to her what I was told when making the reservations (I was told we would receive a room with a view of the South Strip for no extra charge).

The rooms are pretty decent as far as decor and cleanliness go.  The bathroom could sure use a makeover, but was clean enough. The a.c. was the original unit from 1990. The casino is old, dark, dingy and not very lucky!  It was almost impossible to get a "free" drink.  I played for over 45 minutes nonstop and no waitress was to be found (and no winning either!).  I swear the casinos in Southern California have better odds of winning.

The swimming pool was down right scary.  My 8 year old son begged to go swimming, so we did.  He ended up getting sick and throwing up that night and I'm convinced it was the pool water.  The pool was filled with adults and kids from age 1 to 15, the water was too warm and very cloudy.  After getting out of the pool, I realized there wasn't even a hint of chlorine smell on our swim clothes, not good.  The restrooms in the pool area were absolutely disgusting.  I won't go into details, use your imagination, it will most likely be spot on.

The only reason I even give it 2 stars is because the prices are low and they have a pretty nice arcade for kids.  They could really use a 24 hour cafe type restaurant (they used to have one years ago).  You are forced to go to fast food, expensive eats or leave the hotel and go elsewhere.

All in all, I don't recommend the Excalibur unless you are on a really tight budget and are terrified of staying at Circus Circus (like we were).

Worst experience .. lines everywhere even during week days. To pick up another pair of keys or get parking enabled on the account, it takes half hour. They simply don't put any people at customer service. All the personnel are at the show tickets counter and new check ins... that's where they make money... for customer service ... none... after standing in line for 10 minutes someone comes and another 20 mins before it's my turn ... all this for a parking pass. I'm missing out on the other stuff i have to do....

My friend and I got a promotional weekend stay there. Quite a bit of paperwork to get a discount, but we were both pretty excited. Everything was pretty nice there. We got some photos with a couple of ladies upon entrance.

I saw a few shows over the weekend, enjoyed a nice dinner. Doesn't really get much better than that. Well I'm still waiting for the deposit refund so it'll be 5-stars unless I don't get the check soon; in which case I'll most likely give it 1 or 2-stars.

I've had a bad stay at a hotel though. Recently I was at another hotel nearby and lost my whole wallet and shorts, while not paying attention at the jacuzzi. Talk about ruining an entire couple of days.

Again, six months after my last stay here, I once again stayed at the Excalibur for three nights in Room 1256. 
I must say tt was great to be on the 1st floor'

The Excalibur is still the best value on the strip, especially when you consider it has a great location, with easy access to the New York, New York, MGM Grand, Luxor and, Mandalay Bay. Most major  hotels are within a 45 minute walk.
Excalibur has a festive atmosphere, a great food court,  an above average buffet, and a friendly staff.

Despite these positive qualities however, I am still not sure whether I should give them another chance.

When i made my reservation over a month in advance, I was assured that the first night deposit of $140 included taxes and the resort fee. I even asked again before ending the call, and the agent once again confirmed that this was the final total for the first night.

When checking in, I was expecting a balance of about $200, but it was actually $268 and change. I was told upon checking in that the first night deposit did not include taxes or resort fee, so I was caught off guard.

The room was better than it was six months ago, with improved ventilation, but I am not exaggerating by stating that this was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in.The mattress had no pliability at all, and it felt crooked.The problem was made worse because we received no housekeeping service on Sunday the 26th.

The housekeeper came by at about 9:30 AM, but we were not ready, so she left. I then went to ask her for some towels from her cart a little later. She probably thought that since I asked for towels, that this was all I needed for the day, ans hence she never returned. I was surprised to get back to the room at 6 PM to find she had never returned.

I got no sleep at all the last night because of the uncomfortable bed. I never imagined what a problem it was going to be to try to sleep in a unmade bed. 

Also, shame on MGM resorts for their  $13 vallet fee every 24 hours.  This fee began a few weeks ago.

Pros:

* Great rate (but you get what you pay for)
* Connected to The Luxor and Mandalay Bay (you can even use the tram)
* Comfy Bed
* Great water pressure
* Tower 2 is where all the remodeled rooms at

Cons:

* Check in area is old looking and long lines.
* Timeshare people are everywhere. I just ignored them even when they are just saying good morning.
* The casino is depressing looking.
* There are no good restaurants in this hotel. Mediocre at the best.
* We stayed there for 2 nights and from the first night, we woke up with sore throat and congestion. We had it for the whole time we were in Vegas.
* Their AC is loud and they installed it right where it will shower your body when you are laying in bed. I think this was one of the reasons we got sick.
* The Dungeon of Fun was not really fun. There were hardly people there and it wasn't fun at all.

Will not stay here again, there are better options at the strip.

Location: located at one end of the strip, the Excalibur is convenient to area public transport. The central attractions of the strip are within walking distance, but only if you're really prepared to spend a lot of time walking. 

Room: the rooms in Tower II are recently renovated and come with a new flat screen tv, granite countertops, modern carpet and upholstery. I don't believe this is the case for Tower I, which still looks like it was furnished 25 years ago. 

Casino: one of the more smokey casinos in town. I usually go elsewhere to play so I can enjoy better ventilation since I don't smoke. 

Pool: there are 4 pools. The first and largest has never been open in the 3 times I've stayed here. It's beautiful, just never really available for guests. Also, the pools close at 6pm, but that's standard for Vegas. Otherwise I find them to be very nice with ample seating (although little shade until after 3:30). I spent quite a bit of time at the adult only pool in the back corner during my most recent stay. 

Spa: The spa is very nice and allows guests full use of the facilities (private pool and hot tub, steam showers etc) the entire day of their appointment starting at 6am. 

Shops: shops between the Excalibur and Luxor are standard resort quality and pricing. 

Restaurants: the themed restaurants within the property are 2-star. Think Hometown Buffet or Golden Corral. Good enough food, a bit over priced, but convenient. 

Shows: I've never seen any of the shows within the property as they seem a bit cheesy.

Overall: Great place to stay if you are on a budget and want to be near the main attractions of Vegas without paying the price for staying in the resorts that actually hold those attractions.

I really like this place, got an excellent deal on JetBlue vacation, flew in from Long Beach CA. I tipped the woman at the registration desk $20 and got upgraded to Tower II view deluxe 42" TV room. She threw in a coupon booklet with 12 free drinks tickets. That's as good as it gets, awesome, i love it.

After reading some of the previous reviews I was a little apprehensive about booking this hotel. I read reviews from several other hotels on the strip and it seems that they all have raving reviews and reviews that would scare you away. We took a chance and had a great experience. Our room was clean, smelled great and had a hard working a\/c (we kept it at 62 the whole time). The carpet in the hall was worn but didn't effect us. I self parked and carried out luggage in....the line for valet was extra long. The line for check-in was extra long:))...but the desk attendant was nice and moved us along quickly. The buffet seemed over priced for the quality of food but I am sure that is to be expected in Vegas. Our overall stay was great.

So we stayed here for a night because it was cheap.  We could not do the ultra cheap rooms so we decided to stayed in the newly remodeled "widescreen rooms" tower.  Well the big tv and the newer furniture was nicer of course but still pretty cheap.  The mattress was hard and it still felt a little cheap.  The entire hotel smelled of cigarette smoke no matter if yu are on a smoking or non-smoking floor.  The staff was not that great (especially when compared to the Palazzo, see other review), the ONLY thing that keeps this above 2-stars is the pool area.  The pool was great!  Lots of pools, good music playing, and plenty of  chairs available.  VERY annoying the inadequate staff would only give you 1 towel per person, the pool facility itself was nice.  Also the fitness area thats included in the price of the room (_ their 5 fee) is nicely done as well.  OK to stay as long as you know what you are getting yourself into.

The hotel was ok. As soon as we walked in, we were bombarded with timeshare offers. The room was ok. It had a strong bleach smell. It made my husband eyes water. The only outlets that worked were in the bathroom. If i ever stay here again, I would upgrade my room.

This is the 4th time staying here and its always good. 

Pros:

Rooms are big and comfy with a nice bed (contemporary room) 
The check in took 5 min and its almost always fast and swift  
The hotels got tons of restaurants and bars 
Good pool area  
Free wifi (contemporary rooms)  

Cons:

The free wifi is really slow and sometimes disconnects you 
Kind of away from the "hot" places on the strip that is further north.  
They have started charging 10$ a head for entering the adults only pool. 

The last thing is a big setback since this place is popular among families and you always could get away from splashing children for free on my previous years. Now if you are a couple staying for 5 days you would pay an extra 100 $ on your stay just to avoid  small kids drowning you with water while playing in the pool.  Excalibur has a great value for your money as they usually has great rates but........ 

I would at least check around for better options if you are a couple of friends traveling without kids if you want to have some peace and quiet in the pool area during your holiday.

If I could give this hotel negative stars, I would. First when we entered the hotel, there was no option of early check-in, even for a fee. When we checked our bags into luggage storage, the employee told us that this service was a free service and that gratuity was optional. I decided that it was their job to take my bag into the room that was no more than five feet away so there was no need to tip them. He did not take our bags until we tipped him. When we were able to enter our room, it was in Tower 1 on the sixth floor; the first thing we noticed when we entered the room was a funky smell resembling the death of something. Although it is the theme of Excalibur to replicate Medieval times, the room looked so cheap and tacky. The queen size beds were only a tiny bit bigger than twin sized beds. The bathroom was disgusting; the mirrors were chipped. There is NO WiFi in these rooms unless you manually plug in an ethernet cable into your laptop. When we opened the curtains, we had a view of a brick wall. I felt so unsanitary and unsatisfied. We decided to leave the room for the pool so we tried to use the safe, but it was locked from previous occupants. When we called the front desk, a rude lady picked up the phone as if she didn't want to talk to anyone. When we told her our problem, she said that someone would come up to help us in 30 minutes. When we told her that we needed to leave soon, she said that the person would take 30 minutes to arrive; we were only on the sixth floor. The entire time she was speaking, she had the worst attitude. It was our first time here and definitely our last time. I would never come back and I would never recommend this hotel to anybody.

Many of my friends disapprove of this hotel, but I beg to differ. Excalibur is definitely one of the less impressive hotel on the Vegas strip, but if you compare it to other hotels in another city, you'll realize that the quality is amazing for the price. You have all the wonderful amenities of a swimming pool, a decent room size, and a large bathroom. It is also one of the cheaper hotels on the strip.

There were a few things that detached from its rating: the pillows, they're way too tall. I prefer the flatter ones, but they don't get you the option. The quality of the TV shows, it was very grainy like in the early 2000s. 

However, most people that go to Vegas is there to explore nightlife, shows, restaurants, and shops, not to lounge around in their hotel and watch T.V. or lay around in bed all day anyways. I think Excalibur has everything one needs to enjoy their trip to Vegas while still keeping your wallet happy.

Everything We Needed

Really enjoyed our stay here! We stayed Friday - Tuesday for the Rock n Roll Marathon and couldn't have been happier especially with how close it was to the starting line. Our room was clean (though wish it had a fridge) and had a great view of New York New York and the strip. It was easy to check in, always able to get a taxi, and I had the best luck at this casino over the others :) We also really enjoyed the Excalibur buffet (twice), ate at Bucca di Beppo inside the hotel and had some beers and watched the game at Octane (bar next to the buffet). We also ate at the Baja Fresh that was inside and the Pizza Hut Express. I would definitely stay here again.
This place needs a heavy supply of air filters. The room was so dirty that we couldnt breathe after sleeping. The casino is average - same games and sports book as the others.

Check in: 
I booked 4 rooms for a very good price.  When I checked in, the friendly receptionist offered to upgrade to tower 2 for about $6 more, which I did.  The location for tower 2 was really good.  It's close to the pool and food court.  Also, with this upgrade, I could check out at 12.

Coupon book:
The room also came with a coupon book for $20 toward bar\/ some restaurants.
I used the $20 on Lobby Bar to order some juices for my kids.  I have to say that the bartender did not like my group of people who used the $20 food coupon.  He was impatient to us, but smiling and welcoming to others who paid.  I guess he thought we wouldn't tip him...... That was not a pleasant experience.....

Pool:
It closed at 7pm..  I have never been to a casino with pool closes before 9.  Kids were all so disappointed.  We went the next day morning at 9.  Then we found out the water slide opens at 10.  Also, adult pool costs $10 to enter...  This was really not kids friendly.   

Dragon dungeon:
Really good prices for kids to spend time.  Loved this area!!

Parking: 
Limited parking spaces by the casino.  We had to park behind the casino and cross a street where had no stop sign.  People were driving pretty fast on that street.  It was dangerous and not convenient at all.

Overall, I liked the room, the acade and the food court.  However, because of the pool hours and "not friendly" bartender who does not like people using coupon, I give 3 stars to this hotel.
rooms really big nice and clean. awsome for bachlors party.

For the price, this is an alright hotel. The room we had was a bit dingy. One of the handles on the dresser is a plastic zip tie, the sheets had holes and for some reason, they don't use a fitted sheet. Instead, they use a regular sheet tucked under the mattress but it ends up coming un-tucked in the middle of the night. 

I also felt it was kind of odd that their room service is only open until 2 PM daily. That's really early especially in Vegas. 

Otherwise, I liked the decor and it's not bad if you're looking to save some money.

I stayed here this past weekend for a wedding.  My boyfriend decided to upgrade our room to one of the tower rooms because it featured a large tub.  

Almost immediately upon getting into the room and checking it out, we realized it was not at all worth the cost.  

The first night we tried the bath tub, only to see chewed gum stuck to the light on the ceiling.  It was on the back facing the wall behind the tub, so clearly they don't do detailed cleaning... ever.  

The curtain behind the tub was broken so we couldn't put it up.  That window had our only good view of the strip, so it was disappointing.  

There were mystery stains on the floor and bed, which is never good to see in a hotel.

The sun rising outside our window the next morning really illuminated how extremely dusty everything was. 

Our AC worked very well, but still somehow every time we went back into the room, we reeled at the overly musty smell.

The whole building reeked of cigarette smoke and the smell is the first thing to hit you when walking in the front door.   Multiple times throughout the weekend when considering what to do, I found myself thinking\/saying, "We should go to one of the nice hotels to (gamble\/drink\/eat\/walk around)"

I did find it ridiculous that the pool closes at 6pm.  The one night we were looking for a place to sit outside, away from noise and smoke, we were told we couldn't even SIT by the pool.  For the cost we paid, I think we should have been able to just sit outside.

Most of the other wedding guests also stayed here, and the first morning at breakfast we all exchanged our own dirty\/broken\/gross room stories.  Some other people also had dirty floors and stained pillow cases.

The pros:
Every staff member we encountered was friendly.  Nothing over the top, but competent and not rude, pretty much what I would expect from a hotel.

We only did The Buffet for breakfast, but it was very good each time.

As a guest, the wedding went very well, and the reception at Buco's was well run and the food was delicious.

The bride talked about the pleasant experience she had with the planning and execution.  


All in all, I wouldn't stay here again.  There are just too many other options on the strip to settle for the Excalibur.

My experience here was amazing, rooms were really clean beds were decent sized. Room service was good. I like how they have restraunts inside makes it convenient so you don't have to go out if you feel like just staying in. Pool was really fun, I like how their checkout time is later than 11:00 am. Love how there are close to a lot of things they are literally on the strip. I will come back here when I go to Vegas again.

fourth trip. go during the week. rooms online $33 plus fees. the pool is the best to hang out with a bucket of beers. they have a kiddie pool so the other pools are adult only. good gym in the morning. the room was perfect and cleaning staff was very personal which was 5 stars. the casino is ok but short walk to all the casinos. Parking is very very good during the week. LED flat tv worked great and the internet is wired connection but was easy to hook up and use! $36.99 meal at the steakhouse was worth the money. Where can you getaway for $142 Tuesday to Friday (includes all the fees) NOOOOOOOOO where! Go the week after Labor Day...The strip was half empty and all the bars where very good on pricing and service during the weekdays.

I love Excalibur!   I've been coming here for almost 20 years.   Sure they aren't the fancy casino, but they are affordable and their rooms are clean.   I love the family friendly atmosphere.   Highly recommended!

There are a lot of things to write but the only suggestion I can give to anyone who will stay here is try to stay at Tower 2. I got a room with free upgrade but it was at Tower 1 and everything is old......from carpet to bed, bathroom, shower, all the furniture and A\/C is super loud. If it is same price to stay at Tower 2, I will definitely suggest to do that.

3 stars for a short summary.

AC is EXTREMELY loud, it is not built into the hotel, but a separate machine that is placed on the window. This machine had no built in thermometer, so there was no setting a temperature, which was a drag. Coming back from EDC having it be hot, then sleeping and having to wake up to turn it off. This was a non-stop problem. Either way, I got through it.

The bed is surprisingly comfortable to me.

There is no fridge OR wi-fi..... which... is very sad to me. The room itself wasn't terrible or anything, but nothing amazing as well.

If possible, I would stay on a hotel ON the strip, just because of the experience, but I wouldn't say Excalibur is bad. For a hotel on the older side with not much remodeling, it was not a totally bad experience.

I have been to this hotel several times and the only reason we keep coming back is because it very cheap for being so close to the strip. All of the other hotels around are pretty expensive. We got a non-remodeled room, because it was the cheapest option, and it was just OK. They told us when we made the reservation that they have upgraded some of the things in the room so I was expecting there to be new things. The only thing that was new in the room was the TV and everything else was very old. On our second night we walked the strip and when we came back to our room our key card would not work. We tried several times to get into our room and it just wasn't working. So we went to the registration desk told them our key card wasn't working and they gave us new ones and told us to keep them away from other credit cards and cell phones. So we go back to our room and try the new key cards and they still didn't work. At this point we were mad, went back downstairs and complained. They told us they will send security and they will be able open the door for us. 10 minutes later security comes up and tries getting into our room. Well that didn't work either. So he called engineering to come open the door. He left and we waited 15 more minuets for engineering to come and he finally was able to unlock our door with this hanger looking tool. So after an hour we were able to get in our room and go to sleep. The engineer told us to call the locksmith in the morning so he could check it out. So the next morning we call the locksmith and he comes to our room and tells us our key card reader is dirty. I'm thinking "sure it is" and he cleans it. We only had one more night at the hotel so I wash't going to make a big deal and change rooms but I would have if we were staying longer because I am sure the same thing would happen again in the future. 

So overall, I had a pretty good experience here but my only advice is to pay a little extra and stay in the remodeled rooms.

If you are looking for reviews for Excalibur you are probably looking for hotels on the cheap and to spend more time on the strip than in the hotel. This one is pretty good for that, but I would shoes Ballys over this. You definitely get what you pay for. Rooms are very sub-par, towels hade a funky smell (like years of cigarette smoke trying to be bleached out). Room it pretty basic. One thing that was great was the coupon book you get! 2 free drinks and 2 free admission to LAX night club in Luxor, but that's it. Cheap tables to gamble at.

Excalibur definitely appeals to the budget minded.  I stayed here thanks simply to a great deal for a $62\/night room that I got on Expedia.  

As far as amenities go, the rooms are nice.  Very clean and the staff was very diligent about cleaning while I was gone.  They also have a nice pool area and the casino was very comprehensive with a poker room, sports bookie, table games and machines.  The casino's appearance definitely feels dated, but whatevs.

I only have three gripes.  First, I didn't care for the restaurants they offered.  They were either very pricey, sit-down affairs or cheap take out (McDonalds, Krispie Kream, Starbucks, etc.).  I would have liked a cafe-style area similar to what they have at New York, New York or, say, Paris with healthier options.  

My second wish is that they had better cell phone reception.  I stayed on the 15th floor and I could barely get reception, especially data.  This wouldn't be a problem except for (gripe #3) the lack of Wifi.  The rooms only have a wired ethernet port.  I'm not sure who lugs their laptop on a vacation to Vegas, but they're all set.  Everyone else is going to have to rely on spotty data reception.

That said, if you're traveling on a budget or with kids (who will enjoy the King Arthur motif), Excalibur will do just fine.  

Tip to the owners if you're reading this: You should totally take advantage of  Game of Throne's popularity.  Maybe do a cross-promotion or something.

So I would give more like a 2.5 stars. Stayed here for a weekend. Didn't understand why there are ladies dancing on the main floor with the likely possibility that families will be there. Their buffet is on the cheaper side but so is their food. They had a taco area, which I liked because they were taco. But tacos don't cost $17. Their selection wasn't very expansive or special. 

I do like the idea of their arcade downstairs being like a carnival with people manning the games. Their arcades work and the people there look so bored because no one there is playing their games. 

On the other hand, their Tournament of Kings show was quite amusing. I wouldn't go back again but that one experience was fun and I would recommend it to those that haven't seen it already.

The room had a nice view but its interior wasn't fancy. their shampoo and lotion did smell nice. Very little amenities. no fridge. no microwave. the tv had less channels than the free cable i get at home.

This is what happens to a casino when it is not kept up.  It's pretty bad when the Circus Circus does a better job.  The rooms are small and old.  They are in need to be updated.
