It's an old hotel, so I wasn't expecting much.  My assumptions were right:  an old room with a small CRT TV, old stand up shower, old bedsheets.  Everything in this hotel looks outdated although it does look clean and well kept.  I didn't have high expectations coming here anyways.  (side note:  I'm assuming the upgraded rooms look slightly different according to other Yelp reviews)

I don't gamble so I can't give the best review about the casino.  Every casino looks the same to me:  slot machines and card tables.

I guess it's ok if you don't mind the old vibe.

The hotel is so old. There is a smell that I can not stand. For $20 more I could have stayed at a four star hotel. So mad at my self for picking this hotel over the others. Learn my lesson, I will look more my next trip.

I was pleasantly surprised by Excalibur. We got the wide screen room. The tv was pretty big and the view was great. We could see the NY NY the MGM and a few other smaller attractions from the window. The room was clean, the bed was alright. 

The issues I had were with the elevator and staff. The elevator was by far the scariest I have ever been in. I heard other guests say "that didn't sound good" at least 5 times during my stay. Also, the staff was constantly hounding us to take part in their specials or pre-book our next trip. 

So, for the money it was great. Good location, good room. Somewhat sketchy crowd but what did u expect?

I stayed at Excalibur this past week for 2 days as a staycation for my children and I. They have always wanted to stay here because they wanted to "stay in a castle."  I was not that impressed.  It was disappointing because I stayed here probably 10 years ago and it was much better at that time.  I got a deal through their website for $35 a night which was nice but I definitely got what I paid for.  The rooms were pretty basic.  There were noticeable scratches all over the furniture and the bathroom floor had cracks and marks which wouldn't have been a big deal except there were very big and noticeable.  The nice thing for our room was that we had a big window that the kids could sit infront of and look across at the NY NY rollercoaster.  There was no WIFI which was thoroughly disappointing.  They have a cord if you want to connect a laptop but if you have an iPad...forget about it.  They have a decent kids arcade.  They also have a pool area that my kids enjoyed.  The area for the kids was 3-3.5 feet deep all across and there was a waterfall and small slide that my kids loved.  The hotel itself is like a maze which I didn't enjoy. They have a decent food court area upstairs along with other restaurants.  I think if you are looking for a basic room on the strip for a decent price then it's okay to stay here.  If you are looking for something really nice and comfortable and more aesthetic then go somewhere else on the strip.

DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!!  Although the hotel itself seemed a nice place to stay, you will not have a place to park your car.  We arrived back to the hotel at 10 PM and it is now 12:30 AM and we are still driving around trying to find a place to park.  The manager didn't have a whole lot to offer, saying that they did not anticipate the amount of reservations that they had, therefore, telling me we could park at New York, New York.  Pretty good eh?  I will be here one more night, and I had better be able to find parking tomorrow night.  We definitely will not be staying here again.

Valet was full also.  No excuses.  You do not have enough parking for the amount of people that frequent your hotel.  Paying guests should have a place to park, no matter what.

Ok room for the price but I could of done with out the time share sales people harassing you in every entrance. 

 Let me tell you about the time share experience. While walking thought the Casio I was sucked into a timeshare tour. Thinking it would be legit since we were staying at a MGM property it wouldn't be too bad for a time share tour. The sales person who set this up said these tours are to show off the property and to have good word of mouth. 

Our tour time was at 10:45. We were told it round be two hours. Then we found out that the two hours started once we sat with a sales person. The bus was late. We were the told to sit in this holding area, where we stayed for about an hour. I went to ask when this was going to start to one of the sales people. He was so rude. At that point I told him that I didn't not want to go on the tour and would like my $50 deposit back. He rudely said ok and left me standing there. He went to the desk and was taking to a women. I waited 15 mins then I went to the desk and was tested rudely again. Then we finally got our money back from Daisy. Who complained to us about other customers.

After we got back to the hotel we went and talked to the manger Mitch. He did nothing but look at us with a blank stare and asked if we had gotten out money back. I feel that the time that will be spent should spent should be truthful and not meet with an attitude. 

In the end we wasted two hours and had to fight to get our money back. 

As this being and MGM property this try of customer service doesn't fit the brand and I am very disappointed.
Is getting  more and more run down :(, used to stay here all the time, but it smells, and customer service is getting worse and worse

I always stay in this hotel never have issues even though I don't agree with resort fees because what they cover is not needed at all like phone calls -everybody owns cell phone and gym I mean who will be exercising on limited time in vegas but I guess most hotels are charging it so .. room is nice clean it was not expensive  for 305$ I got royal room with nice view for 4 nights Sunday through Thursday I never gambled in the past but this time I did a little so it was fun win some lose some but it balanced itself

When it opened in June 1990 it was amazing. While the Mirage started the mega resorts in Vegas the year before. This was one the new of the amazing mega themed hotels and casinos and MGM was the leader. While the Mirage was beautiful, I had never seen anything like the Excalibur before. I was a Stardust stayer. But I could see it was time to start thinking about staying else where. This was something to see. It was the begining of a new era in hotels\/casinos on the Vegas strip. It was like there was a war going on to see who could build the most amazing hotels and casinos on the strip. Las Vegas was changing. I could see the difference in the people that stated coming to Las Vegas, people with more money, everyone wanted to come here. 

Excalibur is right across the street just north of the Luxor and south of New York New York on Las Vagas Blvd. I did the visit here this past trip as I did the Luxor before heading back home. This time I just went to the casino. This is another one close to the airport so like Luxor and Mandalay Bay it's a good one when you have time to kill before a flight, i used to go to the Klondike for this. It is connected by a monorail that goes to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. 

We walked from the Luxor, its a short walk across a street and then parking lot and right into the Excalibur's casino. Its not a bad casino, smaller minumum tables. Lots of slot machines. It just doesn't seemed to have been kept up as well as it should. I guess after all it's more than 30 years old. WOW, more than 30 year, that is crazy, hard to believe. I checked out the room prices and they are quite reasonable for the strip. 

I hope this is a hotel and casino that stays here. The shows that I have seen here have been good, I have had good food here. I had some luck gambling here. But, as I have seen so many casinos come and go, this one seems to be following one that may be on its way out. Time will tell. It's worth the visit.

Oh Excalibur This place sucks! Such Woodness! Please DON'T come hither!!!!

I tried coming here over the weekend. The last time I was here it was maybe 15 years ago. Prior to that, it was another 10 years ago. Both times back in the day, I would say it was ok although I had a horrendous memory of its buffet back in the day. Now, it was horrendous experience throughout. 

I booked this place only because I exchanged MyVegas points (game from Facebook) for a night here. And since it was the under bonus days, I got the wife to book for the other night. So I had it for one night, she had it for another. Confusing as it was, we had to book it together at the same time but we had to put in our MLife number and CC as well. 

When we checked in, we had to spend almost 40 minutes just to make sure it was linked so that we don't check out and then had to recheck in the day after. Also the keys had to work so that it won't lock us out the day after. At the check in desk, I even tried the $20 trick. http:\/\/thetwentydollartrick.com\/
It did NOT work. I believe I had a worker who did not know what she was doing. (Hence the 40 minute wait) She never took the money and mentioned she had no rooms available. She asked me if I wanted a high floor and a view I replied yes. We ended up in a room on floor 20, semi close to the elevator with no view 

What's worse, we had to come down to the line again and wait another 30 minutes because the other key did not work. See, did I tell you that I had just the wrong person???

The room itself was okay, the AC is slightly loud, the walls are thin. There is no fridge which I would've love to have but I think it was $20 extra a night for it. 

The POOL here was probably the best experience I had here. It had music, but not crazy loud like the pool at the MGM. There were no drunk ass, fraternity looking, trouble makers. There is, however, just a small area for kids. 

While sleeping here, we had some knucklehead knock on our door at 4am and yelled Security. We clearly had our "Do not disturb" sign out but that didn't work. 
The second night we left the sign out and even though there was no knocking, our sign strangely disappeared. 

While playing here, I dropped a couple of Benjamins and asked to see if I can get some comped breakfast. I had to wait 30 minutes for a printout which I never got and was told to come back in the morning at 8am which was about 4 hours later. 
I came at 8am and found a pit supervisor and then was told that Johnny Rockets was NOT linked to the hotel's system and they couldn't give me a voucher. 
Rediculous right? 

The ventilation here is horrible, if you're sensitive to smoke don't bother coming here. They also have these people trying to pressure to sell you these timeshares which gives more negative image for this place. 

The dungeon fun place is a glorified chuck e cheese. When I went at 6pm, most game booths were not open. 

The only good thing is that I just had to pay for the taxes for both nights which equates to about $40. But with my losses here, it was  a lot more.

Parking here sucks. If you're at tower two , it's best to park outside at the lot closest to Tropicana. If you're at tower one, then you would either valet or park at the structure or the lot closest to the employee entrance. All the handicap parking are always full here. Even the ones by the front and inside the parking structure. 

I'm so NOT coming back.  This was probably one of the worst hotel experiences I've had in Vegas.

They overcharged me 3 times ridiculous !!! Before I left spoke with a supervisor for being overcharged was fixed get back home charged 3 mor times !! Wow who's in charge of the supervisor ! Never again will I stay

Pleasantly surprised. I think I skipped over the photos of the white beds and was freaked out by the pictures of the creepy bed spread type of beds, so I was very reluctant to come here.  It was a budget trip with a huge group of friends, and a friend booked this place.  

When I stepped into the hotel, I was like wow, nice.  And when I went into the bedroom, again, I was like, 'nicer than I thought!"  It was clean.  Beds did not have the creepy bed spread!!!  Bathrooms were clean.  

My only complaint was the lack of mirrors.  No full-length mirrors and no refrigerator.  I don't care for the no coffee thing.  There is wifi, but you must have a ethernet cable or something.

Overall, based on the low reviews and the pictures I saw on Yelp, I did not expect to like this place, but I did.  I would recommend this place to anyone who is on a budget trip.  It was $105\/night total including taxes.

This hotel looks like an enchanted castle. We didn't stay here, but enjoyed the all-you-can-eat lunch buffet for dirt cheap. There was plenty to choose from and everything was fresh. Not generous with the seasoning tho, but I probably didn't need those extra sprinkles of salt anyway.

I stayed here on my first visit to Vegas. It was not a bad hotel! Didn't try the buffet but the beds were okay not too bad.. The set up was fine in the room.. Getting towels was a pain in our butt since we had a couple folks in our room. They took towels never gave us enough back. Weird! But besides that I enjoyed the service.

I booked a room here years ago. We were going to drive out there for one night for a friend's birthday. I figured we'd save the money on the room so we had more spending money to go out with. Wow, what a mistake. We arrived at the Excalibur and checked in. They provided us with our keys and off the room we went. 

We were a bit confused at the fact that the room was on the first floor, the casino floor. I never knew casinos had rooms on the casino floor. WTF? We walked in and I swear I rented a room at a Motel 6. Actually, the rooms at Motel 6 probably would have been nicer. 

First of all, on the travel website I requested 1 king bed in a non smoking room. I got 2 full size beds in a smoking room. Everything in the room looked like the 70's threw up all over the room. This was a place that you should be renting for an hour with a stranger you are paying to have a good time with . Or a place you would see on an episode of CSI Las Vegas with Grissom searching the bedspread with a black light for some incriminating evidence for a murder. 

I immediately went to the front desk and demanded a new room. They provided me with a room that was on a higher floor with king bet, just what I requested. It still was a crappy room, but it was definitely better that the original room. Whatever we just slept there and left in a hurry the next morning. 

I honestly still don't know why this place is still open. I guess we will have to wait to watch the place blow to pieces.

Where to begin? 

Short story - don't stay here!!!!! Choose another hotel! 

Extended story;
I checked into the Excalibur on Wednesday October 4, 2017,  we were placed on the 17th floor of the Royal Tower, my friend and I put our luggage in the room and went to get something to eat around 3:00pm, we walked around, did some gambling and got back to our room about 10:00pm, we started to get ready for the next day (we were there for a convention) as we sitting on the bed chatting we feel ants on us - we started looking around the room and there was a Huge trail of ants all along the wall where the TV and dresser was! Gross! We call the front desk and they offered to change our room and remove 1 resort fee. Fine - we moved 
Fast forward 2 days into our 2nd room now on the 11th floor we had to change the toilet paper roll, while doing so, my friend whom works in the medical field shouts out - this is disgusting!!  There was BLOOD in the toilet paper slot - YES it was Blood, we swabbed it! 
Called the front desk, they sent housekeeping and the housekeeping manager (which whom was genuinely a kind person) to come clean the bathroom, after it was cleaned and they started cleaning the rest of the bathroom the hotel security came up to "take a report" ummm.... the housekeeper had already cleaned it but still insisted to take their own photos - ok- there was nothing there anymore
Talked to the front desk again about what they were going to do to compensate this terrible stay and 2 disgusting rooms - we agreed on what was going to be paid against the rooms for a total of 4 nights
When I went down for checkout - they did not honor what was told to me and wanted to charge me a night in which was stated was going to be comped - the front desk manager was rude and very unprofessional- I understand I may be a dime a dozen and they may never need my reservations again - I mean it's vegas! But seriously, they work in hospitality - would this be acceptable if this happened during one of their hotel stays while visiting another city - I don't think so.
I think the health department will be made aware of the situations

While this may not be the nicest or must luxurious hotel in Vegas, it does the trick for the price you will pay. I loved this hotel when I was a kid because of its huge arcade and fun show (Knights of Excalibur). I always looked forward to staying in a huge castle. This past weekend I visited again as an adult and I definitely was hesitant going in. It doesn't have a great reputation as being very nice and I didn't have high expectations. As someone looking for good value and an even better deal, I definitely recommend this hotel.

The rooms are perfectly adequate, especially considering that during a visit to Vegas you are unlikely to spend much time in the hotel rooms anyways. The biggest oddity of the rooms is that there is no mini fridge, which was a bit of a bummer. The best part of the casino is that there are some cheaper tables to buy into, so if you aren't a big gambler you don't have to risk as much money.

I also appreciated the location of the hotel. It is right across from New York New York and you can walk to a lot of places. Also, the uber is pretty cheap from Excalibur to anywhere on the strip. 

If you are looking for somewhere exciting or fancy to stay, this is not the place. But if you just want a pillow to lay your head on during a fun weekend in Vegas, this is a great low-cost option!

If you like to sleep in other people's urine, then this is the place for you! We had a double queen room with my wife and I and were uncomfortable in our bed the first night. The second night we thought we would try the other bed. We pulled the sheets back to climb in bed and right in the middle of the bed is a huge urine stain! Are you kidding me?! We called the front desk and they asked if we wanted them to come up and change the bed. DUH! We spoke to the manager and since we purchased our stay through Expedia, they could not refund our stay. They could only refund 3 days of resort fees. 87.00!  Needless to say, we did not sleep well the rest of the weekend. We questioned the cleanliness of the entire room. BEWARE!!!!!

We were very happy with our room and what we paid for it. We got a free upgrade to a room looking out directly to the New York New York roller coaster but we honestly couldn't hear anything. It was a quiet room for sure. (Edit: the only thing that did bother me was on Friday morning the evidentally recieve a lot of deliveries at 6 am. They leave the truck on with a constant beeping sound. There's no reason for that.) I love the pillows here, although the bed could be softer. The food court has some cheaper options in case you don't feel like dropping the cash on a nicer meal. We were happy with the location, and if we wanted to go somewhere farther we hopped on the bus at the stop directly out front. We would absolutely stay here again and recommend it.

Meh. Dated, no fridge, buffet is too expensive without even as much variety as a Golden Corral. I miss the good old days when casinos were content to make their profit off gambling and superior food and lodging felt like bargains. I guess Excalibur is no exception but everything feels like a grift from the coffee in the lobby to the employees who help you only as a way to case you.

This is an old school hotel...

VERY 70-80s with it's amenties, smell, sights, and experience.

But it's a bargain next to the venetians and bellagio's of the world.

We went here last november for a bachelor party..

I'm not much of a gambler anymore, but my friends were having a great time playing cards until late into the night.

You know what I don't get???

Why do people try to head to bed early when they're in vegas???
The entire POINT is to get as much out of your days there as you can...

Half my friends went to bed at 12pm..are you serious???

The others were up roaming and having a great time.

THE PLUSES about Excalibur...(depends on what you like)...

For guys....

There are a TON of girls just happy to hang out w\/you at a moment's notice.

My very married friend and father of two.. ran into 5 russian girls who were asking him what kind of party he had in his room...

He had to politely refuse them(don't think he didn't think about it..because he did..I could tell on his face..haha)

The very same night I discovered (Maybe I'm not supposed to relay this secret information out..but I don't care...I'm outta the game..I'll relay the secrets)..

at around 3:30-4:30am...around the slots near the sports betting area it's called the "SOFT SPOT".

Meaning..girls who want to be "taken away" to party with all just hang out there...waiting for guys to take them away...

They were there like clockwork every night.  These girls were NOT professionals and didn't take compensation.  They're just like the
girls gone wild girls who know that this is the bus stop equivalent in the Excalibur.

IF that's your cup of tea.. it's your "buffet" in that sense..
Anything you want is there...

Lots of blonde girls w\/short denim skirts..bad make up, but rocking bodies..all just sitting on the bar stools..asking guys to party w\/them...
LOTS of them...we counted more than 40... 

And that happened EVERY NIGHT....

And NO we did not indulge...
my VERY nerdy friends and I just observed..that was enough for us....

I had to burn those clothes..hehe

So Excalibur is everything a vegas hotel is.  Cheap, excessive, and socially just a big splurging buffet...

Cheap updated, nice pool, great for kids. Mostly a family type place. Better than Circus Circus. Unless you want Adventuredome. They have the pay $20 and eat all day at the buffet. So, like I said good for kids.

I was happy overall with the stay. My friend and I stayed in the 2 queen size bed room, it was clean, spacious. Bathroom was very spacious, beautiful. 

However, I was disappointed that there was no hair conditioner provided, usually hotels and inns provide them. 

The exterior of the hotel is pretty eye catching, like a Disney castle, but bigger, grander!

Recently my wife and I stayed for a week in Tower 2.  It room was okay and the staff were friendly.  The Poker room was good, but the other table games didn't impress us.  My wife said the pool was nice.  The room price was reasonable but I must say that I also don't like those timeshare people trying to sign you up every time you enter and leave.  Overall it was average.  You get what you pay for.  C+

I stayed here during the last week of June.  I think I stayed here 10 years ago and everything looks just the same. The nicest people at this hotel are, by far, the valet guys. It was SO hot out and they were friendly. Got back late one night to a full lot and the guy parked my car so I would not have to go back to creepy self-park all alone. So thanks valet dude. Check in didnt take long, dude was ok. It took forever to get our bags though. The casino reeks of smoke. Pee-youuuu.

My room was on floor 7, tower one. One good thing is that it does not take 30 min to get to your room, like at MGM. The room though...yuck. It's just old. I felt like i was time warped to the 70's. The beds.... Not good. One week later and my back and neck still hurt from the beds\/pillows.  Fixtures and lamps and stuff were dirty. Bathroom was small, it was clean enough. Towels were very thin and stained. Maids we saw in the hallway were super nice and gave us what we needed. 

Excalibur hotel has a good food court. You also get a nifty little coupon book.  Would I stay here again? Only if I absolutely have to. My advice is spend the extra few bucks and get a nicer room at a newer hotel. 

Enjoy Vegas, baby!

We picked the excalibur because it was one of the most affordable options on the strip, but the cost savings wasn't worth it in hindsight. Would have been worth spending the extra few dollars to stay somewhere else. The location is good. Right on the strip, though not central at all so be prepared for a trek to anywhere beyond the few surrounding hotels. Following are the things I was most disappointed with: 

1.) Bad customer service. We booked through expedia and both expedia and the hotel charged us the resort fees. We spent two hours at customer service trying to get it settled and they refused to help. They claimed expedia was breaching their contract to charge it and that its only their right to charge. FINE, but if its their contract being breached why did I have to be the one spending my vacation time fighting it? I had to stand there on the phone with expedia to deal with it. Plus, be prepared to wait 30 minutes to check in. 

2.) The less than impressive rooms. The rooms were clean and the beds are comfortable but they lacked basic necessities you'd get at a Motel 6. No safety deposit box, though online it says they have them, you have to pay an extra $25 per day for a fridge, no full length mirror so I could never see how my outfit looked, the resolution on the TV was horrendous and I'm not one to normally even take note of something like that so it was THAT bad. It was like a 70s television and had less than 10 channels. The bathroom looked like it hadn't been updated in 30 years and the bath mat had rips all over it. There's also no shelves in the shower at all so you have to put all of your shower toiletries, including whatever you plan to wash yourself with on the floor. The icing on the cake was how half the outlets in the room didn't work, including the one between the beds. We had to charge our phones on the ground on the opposite side of the bed. Also, the room smelled like someone hadn't been in it in months. We had to request an air freshener because I couldn't take it. 

3.) Promotion after promotion. Every time we walked to and from our room we had to battle at least 5 hotel workers trying to sell us time shares and other promotions. It was worse than walking on the strip. Any other hotel we walked through had 1 person if that, at the excalbur they were stationed every 25 feet to harass you from 7 am to midnight. 

4.) The smoking. Oh my gosh the smoking. Somehow the other casinos are for the most part able to manage the amount of smoke in the air and properly ventilate the casinos since its legal to smoke within them. At the excalibur you could smell the smoke before you even got in the doors of the building. I could barely breathe in the casino. 

Other complaints: they did construction in the room next to us at 8 am. I don't enjoy being woken up to the sounds of drills on my vacation. All but one of the pools was closed and the towels they give you are barely enough to cover an average size torso. Not to mention the towels are all worn and frayed. We had a $20 food and beverage credit but it took talking to multiple people just to find out how to redeem it. 

Key takeaway: don't be fooled by the low price. They have reasonable daily rates, but when they add in all their resort fees it winds up not being much less expensive than any of the other places on the strip that I'm certain would provide a much better experience. Spend the extra few bucks a day and stay somewhere nicer that you can actually enjoy.

I wish I could give Excalibur no stars. I think this place is in need of a makeover. That makeover being imploding the damn thing and getting it off the Strip because it's an eyesore inside and out. 

I get it, it's probably the one place in Las Vegas parents can really take their kids to. The theme is kiddy, they have a "Dungeon" full of games and carnival-type experiences. The shows here are comical\/fun. It's all about fun, fun, fun here!

Unfortunately the place is a dump. It stinks. The casino floor has that early 90s vibe to it. The food court is odd and out of place. The buffet is horrible. Other dining options are ridiculous too: Bucca di Bepo (poor excuse for Italian) and Dick's Last Resort. Okay, I've never been to Dick's, but who really wants to be insulted by their waiter? And of course the new BBQ joint, which I've heard good things about, and would be more apt to try... if it wasn't in Excalibur.

I cannot comment on their rooms since I've never stayed here, but I can only imagine what they must be like, unless of course, they've been renovated.

Overall this place just needs to go away. It's from a different era, one of which we moved on from a long time ago.

This review is for the room, not the overall facility. For a supposedly newer \/ modern hotel ON THE STRIP in Las Vegas, this is a pathetic excuse for a hotel room.  I would describe this room as a "motel" quality room in a Las Vegas resort structure.  The rooms were plain, with outdated amenities such as old school LCD TV (not HD), old and decrepit shower-head (see my pics), old bathroom fan with a separate metal toggle switch and even the A\/C unit was a below the window unit (similar to what they have in Motel 6).  As a matter of fact, I would describe this room as  Motel 6 style room inside of a Las Vegas resort.  Other areas of the Excalibur were standard.  Pool, Gym, Casino, Restaurants, Spa, etc...If you can find this place for 50-80\/night, it may be worth it, but nothing more than that.

Since the hotel looks like a castle and my boys loved that part of it and my oldest really enjoyed the Tournament of Kings show and the Fun Dungeon, I will give the hotel one star. The beds were also super comfortable!

Now the reasons for the lack of stars.....
After arriving in Las Vegas for our first time, the airport shuttle dropped us off at the hotel with a 9 year old, a 2 year old, and 8 bags, we walked into the hotel only to find that we were dropped off in the rear of the hotel and was very rudely informed by a security guard that there was a phone to call a bell hop. After 3 attempts to call the bell hop and being put on hold for extended periods of time, we gave up and walked to the complete opposite end of the hotel to check in. Once arriving at the opposite end of the hotel there was a line to wait in (which took an hour) to check in. 
We finally get to our room and request more towels and such since there are 4 of us and only 3 sets of towels. We go to eat and when we come back, the towels are on the counter in the bathroom. I lift up one of the towels to move it and there is a large clump of dark hair on the towels which I can understand being missed in the probably massive amounts of laundry that the hotel has to do it the day, but similar instances happened on 3 occassions. One time clumps of hair, second time brown stains on the mats, and the third time brown stains on a towel. All of these on 3 different days and 3 different occassions. That is not forgiveable. 
The first impression is everything!
On day 3 of being at the hotel and out walking around for 6-7 hours we were sore and wore out when we got back to the hotel and we decided to take turns going to get massages at the spa. I went first. When I got down to the spa I wanted to add on a foot rub to my 25 minute massage but apparently it takes 2 different people to make a back massage and foot massage happen and even though it is a total of 50 minutes of massages between the 2, I was told it would take an hour and a half. So I cancel the foot massage because my boyfriend's massage we only an hour after mine. I go back to the women's locker room and the girl sitting at the desk says that I am already running on my time and I have to shower before I can get my massage. So I am thinking that she means that I am using up my 25 minutes worth of massage so I explain that my appointment isn't until 4:30 (it was currently 4:20). Her response was that my time starts 15 minutes before my appointment. I rinse off with water and proceed to wait in the sitting area for my massage. I bring it up to the girl checking people in that it should be explained to people when they set up an appointment that they need to tell people that they need to be there early. She argues back that they did. My boyfriend was literally still on the phone making the appointments when I left the room and headed to the spa. Now the hotel may be big, but it is definitely not that big. As I am struggling with the staff there are 2 other women who openly share their dissatisfaction with the spa also for different reasons. One told me that I would pay more if I went to the Luxour or the MGM but I looked up the prices for massages at them and they were very similar to the Excalibur prices. If I would have known that before my massage, I would have happily taken my business elsewhere. I was there to relax, not be rushed by someone. 
Some other things that were a problem are.......
1. The timeshare people always bothering you.
2. The amount of smoke was terrible. 
3. The one time we went to the Lobby Lounge for drinks the bartender was slow and the ratio on both my drink and my boyfriends was completely off. 
4. Only offered one show and that was the Tournament of Kings. (A word to the wise, you can get the souvenir cups for $8 at the 24\/7 store upstairs instead of paying $14 at the show)

Overall, it is waaaay better than Circus Circus to stay if you have kids but the kid amenities can be visited without being a hotel guest. We will not stay here next time.

I did not like this hotel at all. It's very old and not comforts in it. 
The good thing is that it was cheap but at the time was like a room just to sleep! 
There is no view at all and while you are in the Vegas it should not be those kind of rooms. 
When we came in to the room we just sow a trash cans and an a conditioner staff...!!!
But the Casino and staff were good and cute  ...it's was almost like we were in the animation movies...but inside the casino...

We stayed here on a Thursday\/Friday night to celebrate our anniversary. We arrived at around 5:00pm and the line to check in was crazy long but the staff handled it really well and were very organized. When we got to the front of the line we were directed to the VIP check-in area (they were handling the overflow). The guest services lady was not happy about helping "regular" guests in the VIP room (she complained to a manager who walked by while she was checking us in.  the manager said "I know they are just trying to get through the line as fast as possible".). So we kind've felt a little wired since she said it in front of us and the manager just kind've agreed with and sympathized with her.  

We got a room with a nice view of the New York New York and the Strip.  But our AC was not working properly so we called and asked if someone could come by to check it. The maintenance guy came about 20 minutes later and was very friendly and fast. There were parts disconnected and the filter needed to be changed. 

The alarm clock in the room was not reset and it went off at 6:30am!!! Since we didn't go to bed until almost 3:00am that was terrible! And I couldn't figure out how to shut it off! I had a hard time going back to bed after that and we ended up getting up by 7:30am which ofcourse meant that we were very tired by around 3:00 in the afternoon and had to take a nap (yes we are old haha). The alarm clock fiasco kind've ruined our day. 

The Casino is conveniently located next to the Luxor and near the MGM and New York New York. We didn't spend much time in the Excalibur, there was an odd smell in certain areas, the AC in the Casino didn't really seem cold enough and there were men and women dressed in black who were constantly approaching us to ask if we wanted free show tickets which is a scam. I totally understand that they are doing their jobs and since they are scattered throughout the casino they don't know whose been approached and who hasn't (something they might want to work on) but its so tiring when you are approached 4 or 5 times just walking through the Casino to your room. We made a u turn because we were walking in the wrong direction and the same lady approached us twice in a matter of 60 seconds!  And they are so pushy, they follow you and talk to you even after you let them know your not interested.  Some of them were rude about it. It's pretty sad when you have to walk the long way just to avoid them, like there isn't enough walking going on in Vegas already! Haha

We probably won't stay there again :(  Our not so friendly experience at check-in kind've set the tone for our stay. Not being able to relax when we got into our room after a five hour drive (since the AC was not working) and being woken up at 6:30am just compounded our dissatisfaction. 

The 2 stars are for the maintenance guy who was awesome and the location of the hotel.

This is a review for the hotel, not the casino or restaurants or anything else. 

We stayed here for a long weekend during the Rock N Roll Marathon weekend. I chose this hotel based solely on price and proximity to the start and finish lines. And price. Yeah, I said that already. But really, I'm not trying to drop buckets of bucks on a room I'll only be in for a few hours each night. 

All in all, we were impressed by the hotel and the room. Sure, it wasn't super new or super fancy, but it was clean and affordable, and the room was larger than we had expected. The parking garage was well-lit and spacious. 

The Wi-Fi was free and fast enough for our needs. Our view was towards the front of the hotel, which also gave us a bit of a view of the strip beyond. 

About the only thing I'd squint at is the bathroom. The toilet paper was on the wall behind the toilet itself, so you needed to do your best contortionist impression to get the toilet paper after doing your business. 

The shower was also a bit cramped, for as large as the bathroom was, and kind of dark, as there were no lights above it. There weren't any shelves, either, so all toiletries ended up on the floor. 

The bed wasn't exactly terrible, but it wasn't very comfortable, either. The pillows were of the super-soft variety, which meant I had to stack pillows to get some neck support. 

Still, it was all fine for the time we were there. Decently priced rooms during a time in which most hotels jacked up their prices and friendly staff made our stay just fine. 

We never gambled there, nor did we dine at any of their restaurants. The most we did was frequent their convenience store, the Auntie Anne's Pretzels (how I didn't eat every meal there is a mystery for sure) and the Krispy Kreme (for the hubby and cousin). Heck, any place with an Auntie Anne's in it can't be bad!

we actually have that kind of room in the picture.. upgraded.  A-ok because my daughter was happy and always excited to back and leave our hotel coz she totally feels like a princess living in a castle..  :-)  we like the dinner show too ... something of a change (king arthurs' theme with real horses again, my daughter was ecstatic and on her best behavior) 

Its all about my daughter's happiness.. i doubt it though if she still wanted to stay here 15 yrs from now ( she's 3)

well me and my mom came to vegas for our first time and excalibur was something i picked out blindly with out seeing the reviews. yes people were right that the rooms and hall ways are stained but actually its not as bad as it sounds unless you're a clean freak then you might have a problem (curtains are stained and some walls in and outside the room and doors as well) but i figure since it is a "kids" hotel\/zone most likely kids go CRAZY hyper in the castle (if you have kids you know the story after they get the crayons) !! When we made reservations I think we ordered the standard room but when we got to the registration we got the tower 2 room which also everyone on yelp is saying that is great.....so I can't say anything about tower 1, but the process was easy. the staff was all right, no attitude, but they could have explained to us what the hell they were giving us; like coupons for shows and stuff like that.
Also I just want to say, if you're a big eater or if you're family is its better to get a 24 hr buffet- u kinda save more $ that way; especially if you're bringing the kids along or teenagers.
The reason to why I give 3 stars is cuz it was an OKAY hotel, it wasn't  like luxor ( i mean at luxor there is a theme, at excalibur there is none)
It's great to bring kids here ( the slots machine's and all that is still there though ) to just have fun, or family, but if you're on a vacation with ur significant other then I wouldn't recommend it unless you two are both serious with each other and want to see kids to remind you that you need to get married and start making babies.

How many people get to stay that they've stayed in a castle? hahahha

It was right after NYE (but just in time for my bday) and at $70 for the whole weekend - it's hard to complain!

It's at the very end of the strip so unless you're trip consists of whatever is in this building and New York New York, you're going to have to do a little bit of walking (which luckily our group didn't mind).

Not the prettiest and definitely not the fanciest of room, but it did it's job of providing us a place to get ready and sleep (who stays in their hotel when there in Vegas anyways?)

The sheets were a bit thin and cheap, but it did its job. There was a heater\/AC for the cold winter night anyways so we were fine. Blowdryer was broken though :\/

Overall, for the price - it's a super good deal! And it provided us all the ameneties we needed for the weekend.

I chose the excalibur because of the super cheap price... It was only $30\/night. So we arrive to our hotel room and it looks worse than a cheap motel!! The carpets were so dirty, room smelled like smoke and the walls were dirty... I turn on the AC and it literally smells like poop!!! 

I complained and they upgraded me to their "new" widescreen room which was alright and was much better than the previous room. The walk to the main stuff on the strip is way too far and their food isn't good...

The staff isn't attentive to you either...

Honestly, what we did after a few nights was switch to the MGM Signature.. if you want a TRUE experience then go there!!

AMAZING PLACE TO STAY! My partner and I stay here every time we visit. The atmosphere is fun, exciting, room service is perfect, the rooms are perfect, clean, there is never any lines at restaurants here. The service is impeccable. It's also right next to Luxor and centrally located to walk down the strip. The price is totally affordable! We love this place and everything in it.

The decor hasn't changed in years. The security is inept. Aggressive panhandlers and scalpers harass you at the machines. And the bombardment of people trying to get you to see a show is unreal. No I don't want to see Carrot top! 
The slots are tight and the gaming tables are beat up more than the cocktail waitresses.

First time staying here. Timeshare workers will not leave you alone. Got to our room in the Royal tower and our view is a wall. Very big hotel with a variety of dining options. Johnny Rockets was our favorite for breakfast. Online check in makes it very easy, no need to stand in long lines, they will email you when your room is ready. We watched Tournament of Kings which was amazing, very action packed.  Had an enjoyable time at the casino. 
Did not spend much time in our room being that we are in Vegas and there is so much to do. Room was clean.

An old hotel that smells like car freshener. 

The end.

A friend and I stayed at the Excalibur when we were in town to see a concert.  I hadn't been in Las Vegas for many years and, quite honestly, thought the idea of themed hotels was kind of dumb.  Well, I must admit that the theme does serve to differentiate this hotel from the myriad of others that line the strip and it was kind of fun, in a kitschy way, to see how thoroughly they played out the theme.

My friend is a poker player and spent some time down in their poker area and even won money.  She taught me to play the quarter poker machines and I even tried my hand at Pai-Gow but I don't think I'll ever be the gambler she is.

The Starbucks next to poker area did a fabulous job of keeping us caffeinated and the food court upstairs did an admirable job of providing me with Chinese food and cinnamon rolls, even into the wee hours of the morning.  

There is a free tram that runs between here and te Luxor and Mandalay Bay (I think) and it's right across the street from the MGM Grand where we attended the concert.

The room was not fancy, but it was cheap and got the job done.

My favorite thing about this hotel was that the bathrooms had Dyson air blade hand dryers that dried my hands in about 5-10 seconds, no lie.  I've never used hand dryers that worked so quickly.

Good ol' Excalibur Hotel.  Stayed here numerous times since I was a child, as the hotel is accomodating to all ages---hard to find in Today's Las Vegas.  Anyway, my most recent stay was during Xmas 07 which was in one of their remodeled rooms that feature modern decor and Flat-screen HDTVs.  The remodeled rooms feel really nice...unfortuanately they had very few free channels on TV, so there is nothing you can really enjoy on high resolution without paying extra.  The Casino action is hot as always, and their sports book\/keno combo room is just the right size.  The remodeled casino really does feel really comfortable.  

The Fantasy Faire for kids is still there, but carnival games are up to $2 now.....how i miss Circus Circus and their old 50 cents games.  Also, the arcades are old and outdated.  Ventilation is non-existant here, as the whole bottom level is extremely stuffy and smelly.  

The Buffet is still there with their classic "cattle-line" style of food islands.  Went for Breakfast most recently...don't expect the best, but for its price, it is still worth it.  Besides, it's hard to mess up breakfast food.  

The Dick's Bar is really trashy and gross.  Loud music, trashy women, etc.  I had a buy-one-get-one-free coupon for a drink, but after some trickery, the bartender ended up getting me 3-2 deal...what the heck?  Dick's really sucks.  

Overall, Excalibur is a good value hotel-casino to stay at, eat and gamble....more like the classic las vegas experience.  If you looking for glitz and glamour, a niteclub, or a nice bar scene, look elsewhere.

The rooms in this property have seen better days.  I am surprised I had to pay $200 on a Saturday night during a recent stay.  A few years ago, rooms were going for less than $100 on priceline.com. Either I picked a bad weekend, or Vegas is just that crowded these days.

There are superior options around.  Plan ahead to secure a room for a reasonable price.  Plan too late (like me) and the choice was between this property, New York, and Luxor.  All three properties look the same as when I first visited two decades ago....

I had to think real hard about this review. 

I was in tower 1.

Pros: 
Room was $35 weeknight, $65 weekend. That's just dirt cheap for vegas. 
Food court: McDonalds, DQ, Baja fresh, krispy kreme, wetzles pretzles
Bridge to mandalay bay and luxor, outside bridge to nyny mgm
not crowded

Cons: 
buffet was nothing special 
rooms were like staying in a holiday inn not vegas glam luxury
bathrooms haven't been remodeled since the 80s and show wear 
furniture in the rooms show visible wear and tear and look garbagey
No room service after 2 pm. I maybe would have given 3 stars if it weren't for this. 

I'm from LA, and if I was spontaneously going to Vegas for a night of drunk shennanigans, I would stay at excalibur again. Its a place to sleep with lots of cheap eats and easy access to better casinos. If I was going for a special occasion or I wanted "the vegas glamorous experience" I would definitely not stay here. Like I said, its basically a holiday inn on the strip.

14th Floor room 14246 is a very nice room $35 a night too. Just one king bed. Everything seems new.. Bathroom super nice, like brand new. New bed, nice furniture. Smells nice. I saw a lot of reviews that were not so great about this hotel But we just needed a place to sleep since we're out most the day\/night anyway. I was very satisfied with everything. We usually stay at Aria. I see nothing wrong with the 14th floor here at Excalibur :) two thumbs up!! Tower II by the way..

I am currently staying at the Excalibur for a conference I am attending down the road. I have stayed here many times over the years and I know what the expect for the most part. Even though my expectations were low I have to say that I am disappointed.  

When checking in we were told there were no rooms available yet due to our early arrival. While we were a bit disappointed we understood. Miraculously, there were rooms available if we paid a $20 charge so we made the call to go ahead and do so. Arriving to our contemporary or modern rooms in tower 2 we were once again were less than impressed. Hot room, not cleaned properly and just plain beat up. These are the renovated rooms, I am glad we opted for the better rooms. 

This all being said it is a cheap place to stay but with all the extra fees and odds \/ ends I will move up the strip next time.

This hotel doesn't deserve one star either. I came here to spend my spring break with my friends and we booked a room here through an app due to cheap deals. I paid 75 bucks through the app to buy the room. 
Moved in on Friday and moved out the next day morning. Money was stolen when we went out Friday night and realised it was gone the next day morning. 
We filed a report for the lost money and said they would get back next week since the investigation department was closed on the weekends.
It's Wednesday, and I haven't got anything from them. So I called, and I was told that no one used the room besides us. Then where did my cash go? I'm not an irresponsible person and I know exactly where I put my cash. 
Instead, the lady raises her voice to make it clear that I wasn't getting anything. She finally tells us that she was hanging up because the conversation was over. 

I'm a student and drove all the way from south freaking Dakota to Vegas to spend my sweet spring break here. No, but I loose my money and also be charged for the stupid room with poor room service. 

It's not a ridiculous amount of money I lost, it's just not fair. I feel like I don't have any power to fight back. 

Please don't go there. I don't like them. They are rude. Just makes me sad :(

Eh.

I stayed at the Excalibur a few weeks ago. The place is obviously dated and has a cheesy medieval theme. 

I shared a room with 3 other girls so I requested a room with 2 beds. The room met our needs, which was we just needed a place to sleep and to shower. The bed was fine in terms of comfort. The linens really sucked. The bathroom was extremely spacious and we were given plenty of towels. 

The rate for the place was really good after I applied MyVegas points to it. It was around $175 for a Friday and Saturday night. 

Parking was easy there. They have a structure and a lot so we were able to find parking just fine. 

I don't know if I would stay there again unless I got a very cheap rate. It's far from the newer hotels and shops so we had to take a cab to get back and forth from the cooler\/newer sights.

Our room 16149 reeked of mildew!! Our sheets had makeup stains on them, pillow had mascara stains, and one had a pubic hair on it. Complained about it and was only offered a 1 day resort fee refund of $15! Carla the manager was NO help! The maids came in and woke us up even with the privacy tag on the door. One of the worst hotels I've stayed at in Vegas. Don't waist your money on this filthy dirty place!

I stayed 3 nights at the Excalibur Hotel in Las Vegas, NV on 11\/21\/2014, 11\/22\/2014 and 1123\/2014.  It was the first time that I stayed here.  I stayed in tower 2 which is newly renovated.  My bill for the room was just over $300 total for the three nights.  I love the medieval theme of the Excalibur.  Plus, I took photos.

I did not stay at this hotel.  This hotel has very poor ventilation. I got sick from the over exposure of second hand smoke. This hotel is all not clean at all. It's the Wal-Mart of hotels.  Anyway, I came to this hotel two see 2 shows. Tournament of the Kings and Thunder from down under. It was a complete waste of money. The tournament dinner was gross. The chicken was dry as the Nevada desert.  It's perfect if you have high blood pressure or  diabetes.  I will say the soup, bread, and store bought pastry was good. Next, Thunder From down Under! Years ago, I saw this show and it was in a very nice theatre, and the dancers knew how to dance and was very professional. They have really dummy downed this show. I walked out. I couldn't bear another hour.   Damn these men didn't even try. They were drunk, didn't know their choreography, and just effing lazy.  They need Vivica A. Fox to help them out. Don't waste your money.

First Time I've ever stayed at this place, actually the inside of the room seems to be better than the flamingo where I stayed at last time and the $28 a night im being charged for this time a year is a definite plus. Not in love with the location of the hotel on the south side of the strip but still close enough to get a cheap cab ride if needed to get more in the center of things.

Looks are deceiving! 

Jeez, I've been to Vegas three times already and every time we drive by Excalibur I just STARE.I think it's the fact that it reminds me of Cinderella's Castle and it's so beautiful at night. To all my fellow yelpers, ooh'ing and aww'ing at how epic this hotel is, is as far as you should go. Don't stay here unless you're super budget conscious, you get what you pay for. 

Check in was the usual. The lady that helped me definitely tried to upsell me. She was going to "upgrade' me for free and then asked for my credit card... um NO. LOL, sneaky sneaky. Watch out for that, if you paid online you should ONLY be paying for the resort fee and that's it. There is no pool or gym, I'm not sure where this money goes to but it would be nice to get shampoo that actually foams, haha. 

Honestly, I don't know how "upgraded" the upgraded rooms are because if they are barely better than the standard rooms, it's not worth it. I have a hard time believing the more expensive rooms are that much better. You might as well cruise over to Monte Carlo or Aria and treat YO SELF. 

We came here because the group I was with didn't want to drop too many bills. Understandable, considering we were out and about all weekend long, but DANG coming home to the hotel room we had was awful. I definitely learned my lesson LOL, I've never been to a Vegas hotel this bad before. 

The room is straight up OLD, it has NEVER been remodeled. The carpets are probably the original ones from who knows when. It's worn down and looks like it hasn't been vacuumed in a long time. DON'T walk around barefoot, I had my shoes on the entire time, I just didn't feel very safe. You should use a disinfecting wipe to clean the shower floor and maybe wear some flip flops in the shower if you're paranoid. Yeah, this place just doesn't seem very clean to me. 

Everything is just very gringy, the room has like a moldy\/moth ball smell, the furniture and curtains are all dusty. THE BED IS REALLY HARD AND UNCOMFORTABLE. Also... the AC units are CRAZY LOUD. I literally didn't sleep for three days when we were in Vegas. I know, most people are there to party it up and sleeping isn't part of their vocabulary but if you're looking to take a cat nap in between playing slot machines, you might as well sleep on some chair in another hotel lobby somewhere else. The struggle was very real LOL. 

Location is pretty good though, a lot to do across the street. I definitely prefer being around that area but I just can't come back LOL. My eczema REALLY started acting up when I stayed here. Be warned!

Lorenz Herrera at M-life has to be the most friendly and inviting employee possible. His customer service was above and beyond. We'd return just to see his friendly face. Thanks excalibur for the amazing stay.

i stayed here recently it was very pleasant and the staff is very nice and accomodating. If you are on a budget this place is perfect has alot of fast food choices and located at the tip of the main strip...all you have to do is cross the bridge and you are at new york new york. The only thing was the regula m lige was closed when i checked in...i went to the other mlife and then checked in got to my room.l, the keys did not work and there were pink panties on the handle, the nice security guard openes our door and there was a huge stain in the carpet, we went down they changed our room and etc our whole check in was pushing two hours to get settled in.

i love this place its cheap,on the strip,the pool is very nice just everything about it is great. the room was nice and the bathroom was just your normal bathroom nothing over the top here. had a flatscreen in the room needs a better remote though. stayed my usual 3 nights and paid about 450.00 for my stay. i booked the widescreen viewroom. wich i will get again. Highly recomend going downstairs and eating at dicks last resort.

Im giving this 3 stars from a point of view as someone taking their kids, but if it was just one of my normal reviews then 1 star.

This is a great Vegas casino for kids. The rooms are going to be the lowest on the strip for MGM properties, there is a nice arcade and a nice medieval show that kids would really enjoy. The food places within the casino are also catered to kids. So overall i would recommend this casino for people taking their kids or people that want to save money.
Comfy stay. Minus finding blue hair in our shower upon arrival. Lisa S the best cocktail waitress. Smiling and bringing us the coldest beers. Thank you

Okay, this hotel...definitely not the classiest. But with the deal we got, I have to give it at least 3 stars. The hotel itself is for sure geared more for children. You can tell this is an older hotel that hasn't been remodeled much. The room we stayed in had some funky odor... model\/smoke\/vomit maybe... and it looked like it was a flash back from the 70's. We had the deluxe suit, which is the most basic room. But like I said, for the price, you really can't beat it. And do you really spend much time in your hotel anyway? Not necessarily. It's at the end of the strip, so lots of walking. There is a okay selection of fast food establishments and Buca de Beppo's, which is always good, however, we didn't have a fridge to keep any leftovers. Across the street and down the road a bit is a complex of fast-food restaurants too that are open 24\/7, so that was a good option for after a night of drinking, along with Fatburger ($25 for 2 burgers meals...it is Vegas). All in all we paid $675 told for flight\/hotel for 2 people and we were in Vegas! So for us broke college students it was a great option! Ooh- but their buffet.... TERRIBLE... seriously- the only thing ediable was the soup & lunchmeat\/cheese. Their gatorade and strawberry ice cream really tastes like pepto bismol!!!! Nooo kidding... I mean i know we're in Vegas and my stomach is hurting, but injecting pepto in your gatorade and strawberry ice cream is not helping!!

Sad how this hotel is going downhill FAST. 

To start of my stay I arrived at about 11 am and asked when I could check in.  The guy at the front desk said I could check in at that point.  I came to realize AFTER that we wr charged an extra $20 for an early check in. We wr put in tower one. All I can say is WOW!! They need to update this tower asap. The rooms are dark and have a weird smell. The beds are old and VERY uncomfortable. 

The next day I pulled out the iron to iron my clothes and get ready for the day. I haven't noticed the iron was full of black gunk and it ruined a brand new white shirt I bought for the trip. I called down and spoke with a "manager" Chris  he apologized and said he would send a new iron within 45 minutes. Really??? He then offered to try and clean the shirt. I told him there was. I way it could be cleaned. He said ok sorry about that and THAT was it.  $45 down the drain. 

My party and I tried to enjoy the pool on that sunny day. The only pool open was the one at the far end which I believe was a kids pool. Because it was the only one open it was pretty full. It took us about 40 minutes to get any type of service. I asked for a Long Island ice tea with double shot and the waitress brought me a lemonade basically with no alcohol it seamed. I asked if they can fix it. She said I would need to pay for more alcohol. What a joke but I did end up paying.  As we sat there and tried to enjoy our drinks the music and the sun their sound system was HORRIBLE. It kept going in and out it old sound staticky and go off for minutes at a time. We just ended up going back to the room and tried to enjoy the rest of our weekend. 

I will Definitely  not be staying there again it's unbelievable the lack of management in that hotel and how outdated it is.

My family  enjoyed  our stay over all  , the room was very nice and the pool was refreshing  but keep in mind  the whole valet situation  was a inconvenience  , we arrived and  we weighted 30 minutes before we could valet our  car to check in . I was charged a daily fee to valet and everyday there after  till we checked  out. If you are planing to self park beware  they now charge for self parking.  The pool erea , check out the pool rules befor you make your reservation ,guest are only allowed  to bring in one  beverage  person  keep in mind other resort property's  may allow  a cooler  but not here  . Be aware  that should you get thirsty  for a adult beverage while at there pool , The  pools cafe  menu  post prices for drinks  that are obviously  ment to be alcoholic  beverages but there deceiving,  the posted pricing  is for virgin non alcoholic beverages   meaning  if you want alcohol  added  to your chosen concoction the price  increases  considerably  ,talk about false advertisement   . Other then they's little  pit falls the excalubur  was a placent experience  .

Es el peor hotel para que darte te cambian los cuartos y si sales es posible  encuentres  a alguien en tu cuarto    O  tus cosas se las llevan y te revisan todo y todo lo quieren arreglar con un  I'm sorry for the inconvenience Especial mente  el manager of security su Nombre Tobi Brisco
Security Shift Manager

This place is kind of funny.  It is a monument to a bad marketing campaign. Remember when Vegas was touting itself as a family destination.  Well, that lasted long enough to build this fantasy castle.  It has a really 70s feel right down to the furnishing.  But I have to admit, they followed through with the Sherwood Forest, King Arthur motif right down to the smarmy portrait of a knight (Arthur?) kneeling to a lady (Maid Marion?) in my bathroom.

The furnishings are heavy and clunky, what you would expect in a castle.

The phone worked if you bent the cord in just the right direction.

The TV was also vintage, but in color, alas.

I stayed here for the rate and also because I DID NOT MAKE THE RESERVATIONS!!!

L'htel Excalibur fait partie des plus connus de la grande avenue de Las Vegas ou la foule dambule en sirotant son gigantesque gobelet de cocktail!
Il a l'apparence enchanteresque d'un chteau de conte de fe. Mais la porte d'entre franchie, on comprends vite qu'il s'agit d'une erreur!!
Casino bruyant et populaire, chambres similaires  certains motels o nous avons log au cours de notre voyage mais 2 fois plus chres... 
Si le Vegas des casinos vous dplat, je vous conseille de faire un tour sur la Fremont Avenue dans Down Town et je suis sre que vous serez charms comme je l'ai t!

One of my favorite places to stay in Vegas. Great location for the places I like to spend time in. And the price is usually fairly cheap to be on the strip in a hotel with a casino. 

Gambling is pretty chill, but it does get packed. There are definitely some families around (there is an arcade below the casino floor). 

It's attached to other hotels, which is awesome when you don't want to deal with the heat, but are looking for another scene.

I'm just keepin it real.

Hey!  My wife let me go to Vegas with my friends for my birthday.  Isn't she great? 
 
You know what?  After staying at $1000+\/night resort hotels in exotic destinations with the wifey, I somehow gravitate back to my roots.  What are my roots, you ask (which you probably didn't- how presumptuous of me)?  I grew up in a blue-collared environment bussing tables, washing dishes, mopping floors, etc.  So, I know what I "need" and what I "want".  Well, Excalibur has the stuff I really "need" when I am surrounded by "want".  

What I need in a room is a bed w\/ clean sheets, a shower, a sink, and a toilet (clean ofcourse).  That's all I need. (and It's like being an intern all over again, in a "call-room" that has an bed that has never been used!)

As for my wife, she would definitely NOT "want" to stay here.

Average hotel. It is nothing very special or amazing. A cheap, decent place to stay on the strip. Had a fantastic experience with customer service. They were very nice and friendly and didn't mind helping out when necessary! They were the main reason I gave The Excalibur 4 stars. I'll be returning to Vegas again, for a short trip and will stay here just because it is a fine place for a couple of nights-especially if you will only be there to sleep!

Yes this is a cheap place to stay- but the rooms are not that good.But then again when you are in Vegas you are never in your room. If you are looking better quality in rooms, baths, etc.. this is not the hotel to go to.

Spend the extra money to stay in a hotel rather then a place that smells horrible from the second you walk in the door. There is no good amenities, rom service is only open breakfast and lunch, to be honest I really have nothing good to say about the place, this is my first time staying here, but I come to Vegas at least once a month for the last 5 years and haven't had a worse experience. PS, there is no wifi

This hotel is disgusting!!!! Woke up to bites on my hands!! Pulled the sheets off and was so grossed out...looked all over to see why I had bites and the head board of the bed..not just one bed but both were infested with BED BUGS!! So disgusted..packed all of our things up and took pictures..showed them to management and they basically told us they needed to investigate it..we got no help..and to get a refund was a big ordeal...Never again...poor management customer service and agsin BED BUGS!!

This hotel is just fine for what you pay. I enjoyed the whimsy of the casino floor. The knights of the round table theme is so cool. The craps tables are some of the longest I have ever seen. The staff is so nice and enthusiastic. The room reminded me of a best western room. We had a basic room with a view. I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. There are so many options and depending on your budget and what you are here for and who you are here with- it's awesome to have a full spectrum to choose from. I would definitely recommend Excalibur.

I have never spent the night here but I have done quite a bit of gaming here.

On the gaming side it has been very lucrative, and this one particular casino, has made a record number of instant millionaires.

Regarding the casino.....and the overall resort. it does not require any sort of renovation, and look just as good as it did 20 years ago. but it is in desperate need of better signage. There are very few signs anywhere so once you're inside you usually will require assistance to get to your next location.

I think the exterior architecture is timeless and beautiful.... especially at night.

I have not eaten at some of the fancier places. but Dicks Last Resort, must try on my next visit in February 2015. Somehow eating steak at the steakhouse if you are solo, seems like a good way to attract females hookers. but I would love it if they were male hookers! Just kidding.

The newly remodeled food court is a feast for the eyes and stomach. make certain to use all of your coupons, if you are staying at Lux or or Excalibur. the prices are only a dollar or two higher dad if you were in your own neighborhood location. the tables are kept spotlessly clean as is the entire area.

I am not at all keen on Medieval architecture....but this place does it right, and I did not ask my opinion before building it. It reminds me of a vastly larger and more colorful version of the Disney Castle. but with clearly adult aspirations.

Some may differ..... but I do not think that any Resort Casino in Las Vegas, is a place for children. Period.that is not to say that should be sheltered. but parents work hard for their money, it should be allowed to have fun without worrying about their children. It is also painful to go out to eat and have to sit next to a family, with a crying child, who not a fault of its own, is an unfamiliar and loud circumstances with its sleep schedule disrupted. You get the point.

Lastly..... this place has an outstanding an electric vibe that is sincere and welcoming.

Stayed here with the family from Nov 28-Dec 2nd. When I booked the room I paid extra for a "view room" We had a view alright-Of the parking lot!!! We called the front desk and asked to be moved to a room with a view of the strip. The person on the phone informed us that none of there rooms faced that way. My brother also got suckered into this as well. Very misleading we definently will not stay here again.
Friendly staff. Rooms need a little TLC though. Wall paper was peeling and table had sticky stuff on it. Beds seem comfortable enough.

1.The room wasn't clean! 
2.We couldn't flash the bathroom, and needed to call again and again for help! Over 2 hours no one came to fix it, and when they do came we already needed to  checkout, and we where 3 people in the room, can't use the restroom, not even wash our faces because the smell!!!

This place is way past it's prime, come to think of it, all of Vegas. The front desk was reasonably nice but it took me several trips to the front desk and phone calls to house keeping to get a damn room service menu. My bathroom spontaneously flooded and the emergency alarm went off at 3:15am scaring the life out of me. 

I've been to Vegas 5 times over the last 8 years and unfortunately stayed at the Excalibur twice. It has only gotten worse, I used to think that having fun in Vegas was just a matter of money, the more you spend, the more fun you will have. But when my friend got mugged at gun point in a club and you start getting ripped off by some of the cab drivers and hotel staff (most are very nice) you wouldn't want to spend big money there anyway.

Not a terrible hotel and decent enough for the price.  It's not the most updated hotel I've seen in Vegas and it's also slightly dark and dungeon like but that may be part of the theme.
The pros are the cost and the great proximity to the tram to MBay.  It's also very close to NYNY and MGM.  
Cons, not very close to the main part of the strip, needs an update and recently started charging for parking.

The hotel room have no microwave, no refrigerator, and no coffee maker.  The walls are paper thin so you can hear everything that your neighbors are doing.

The buffet was very expensive, had a very long line, and the food was mediocre at best.   On average the food was bland and very greasy. Immediately after eating there we had to rush up stairs on the elevator to our hotel room and fight over the toilet because it gave us instant diarrhea.

Our entire floor of our hotel room smelled like marijuana even though we were on a no smoking floor.

The people staying in the next room were very loud until I complained to security at three in the morning and they told them to quiet down. 

The next night the people across the hall from us were having a party out in the hallway in front of our hotel room door.

Our shower stall in our bathroom was clogged and almost overflowed onto the floor. My husband went down to the front desk in order for maintenance to have it unclogged. After the maintenance worker finished plunging the shower drain he asked me if I would like to have the maid to clean up the mess that was left behind in the shower or if I wanted to wait until the maid came to clean the room. Mind you only my husband had showered that morning, i couldn't until this issue was resolved. This made us late to leave the room as we had to wait for the unclogging and then for the maid to clean up all the nasty gunk that was plunged up into the shower. 

After asking for a late check out before we left the property and being granted one the maid pounded on my hotel room door constantly while I was in the bathroom getting dressed. Obviously they did not relay the message to their cleaning staff.

We used the in and out valet service for $13 a day and the line waiting for the valet was 30 minutes to retrieve our car.

After paying almost $500 for our 2 night stay and getting this experience we will never stay at this property again.

I'm not a fan of this casino or their rooms. Its dirt cheap and its easy to see why once you're inside. I pick up the smoke in this casino more then any other one Ive stayed at. 

This casino feels more like a circus to me then anything and they don't really have any good restaurants and or Buffet. 

The poker room is large and that's about the only reason I would go here. Don't stay here unless you want a a suitably priced (cheap) room.

I stayed here for a vacation recently and was pleased by this hotel.

I've stayed here before on different occasions, but was a bit hesitant about this trip due to the recent reviews. I couldn't help but wonder if maybe the place has changed since I had last visited? I eventually decided to go ahead and stay here after getting a decent price for the two nights. I can say now that I wasn't disappointed with my stay! I ended up in a room in Tower II on the 22nd floor. I find that most people who are upset with the hotel end up getting a Tower I room, but I can't comment on that since I have not been in that tower for several years. Maybe just go with the $20 upgrade for Tower II?

Let's go over the room first.

The first thing I checked when I got to the room was to look around and make sure that the room had been properly cleaned. I was pleased to find that the place had been properly vacuumed, no mysterious hairs or left over fast food anywhere in the room. The bed was clean as well! No stains, bugs or hairs there either! The bathroom was clean too! No stains, loose hair or mysterious matter in the sink or shower. Not even left over water spots on any of the mirrors corners! Or that funny little fold out mirror that those of you that wear make up use.

Now for the AC unit in the room. I've seen other complaints about it, but I have to wonder if any of you actually have a regular AC unit or if you run central air and heat through your houses? I have a pretty high end unit at home that is installed into my living room and I found that the two units sounded the same in volume. Once the room gets to the right temperature it kicks over to fan and then they run pretty quiet. I did find however that the unit did kick over to the AC often, and I believe that is partially because it was 108 degrees outside and also that the large window and thin walls did little to actually keep the heat out.

Now for the noise. Having the room right above the pool area, I did notice that the music playing down at the pool was rather loud. So I understand the problem for those of you that come out to party all night and sleep in the next morning, it would easily be enough to wake someone who isn't a heavy sleeper. I however had gone out on this vacation to show my girlfriend the city and some of the shows since she hadn't ever been before, so we were up at a decent hour of the morning and didn't have any problems with the noise. But I can agree that maybe thicker walls or perhaps walls made of a more dense material would've mitigated some of the noise.

On a side note, it did take me a few minutes to find the safe. I'm so used to seeing them in the closets I never even thought to look in the drawers! Who would'a thought.

Now for the rest of the hotel.

At check in there was a small line when we arrived, but it only took about ten min. for us to get to the front. But I will say that's only because we got there a half hour before our check in time (Check in was at 3 on our reservation print out). By the time we got finished and were getting ready to head up the room the line had grown to the point it trailed off the slightly raised area the check in was at! So to anyone staying here, definitely COME EARLY! It's not so much the staff that makes check in take long, it the rush of people! Not to mention the people that I saw trying to demand a cheaper price in front of me. So before you go automatically blaming the staff for the check in time, take a look at your fellow patrons, and maybe tell that girl at the front she shouldn't be talking on the phone while she's trying to check in.

As for the staff themselves, most of the people I dealt with directly were very pleasant and happy to help me out, even the housekeeping staff would kindly greet me and wish me luck!.
Except for this one short asian guy with glasses who was trying to get you to sign up for those time shares. FIVE times that guy approached me during my stay! And one of the times he actually followed me through the casino for a bit before I guess I got too far away from his post! But he was the only problem I really had with the staff.

We didn't have enough time to visit the pools so I can't really comment on the quality, but I will note that from the room the area looked too crowded for my tastes and I don't think that we'll visit them if we stay again in the future.

I also didn't get a chance to visit the arcade area to see if that had changed. Lame.

As for the casino, I didn't find it any more dirty than any of the other casino's I go into. Smelled a little of smoke sure, but otherwise I didn't see any trash on the floor or anything. And while it is a bit dated, most of the hotels that were built back then still are, some now just going through renovations.

As for food, I like the options they had! It was kinda broad with the range of options, so everyone should be able to find something for them!

I hope this was enough to help anyone thinking of staying here!

The price will temp you, but if you fall for it just about everything else will disappoint you.  The rooms are a small step up from a motel 6.  I called the front desk to ask if they had any toothpaste because I had forgotten mine.  Apparently not trying to win any customer service awards, the insipid "lady" on the other end said, "No", and hung up.  Not even a, "No, sorry", or a "No, but you can buy some at the shitty convenience store near the elevators", just a " No".  Do yourself a favor and spend a couple more bucks to stay at a nicer hotel, you won't regret passing up whatever "deals" this dump happens to be offering.

Oh, and the wifi is about 500 times slower than dial-up.  What a waste of $10.
