I was looking for a middle of the road ($) hotel on the strip and thought the price was good. I stayed Thu - Mon and paid $39\/ night for Thu and Sun nights and paid $129\/night for Friday and Saturday nights.

When I made the reservation I felt pretty good about the price. The hotel seemed right on the strip and rooms look pretty ok. However, when I got there I wasn't too impressed, even for the price. The rooms were outdated and kind of smelled. I went there with a relatively large group scattered around various hotels. I was even more dissappointed when my friends paid less than me at other hotels right on the strip and their rooms were much better.

The service also seemed average at best. Would I stay there again - definitely not. I think there are better options on the strip.

The suites are great. But I didn't like the regular rooms at all. The shower had mold around it and it was gross. We stay here because the pool is awesome. My daughters really like it and have fun on the water slide. They also love the kids game room. The also have a food court with a lot of options for our kids. And we enjoy eating at Buca di Beppo (yum) The slot machines are fun too especially with complimentary drinks!

We got robbed. Well someone broke into our hotel room then they robbed us and their management wouldn't do anything about it, only give us a different room. We got robbed in the middle of the night with a child in the room. The management refused to help us, saying it our fault, "You didn't close the door all the way,  you know their a hook to lock it on too."Terrible service and business,  will never come back. We think it was an employee.

Haha I love Betty N's review! Honestly, I can't say that I have ever had a bad time in the Excalibur probably because I took it for what it was going to be which wasn't the best on the strip and I have always consistently had a blast here.

I MUST plug Dick's Last Resort in the Excalibur because it is probably the most crazy fun I've had in a restaurant in Vegas. I think a few times I was doused with beer and dragged out on a chair with toilet paper in my face. Don't ask.

Regardless, yes this hotel smells like smoke on the first floor(s), but in the towers which is where you must stay at least in one of the upgraded rooms, the 42" LCD is a nice touch, the beds are not bad, the carpet is in dire need of a revamp and the shower clogs. But it's $22 a night. Can ya beat that on the strip with a 42" LCD?

I just think the Excalibur keeps the child in me alive, sort of, and they have $5 minimums on black jack, a fun wanna-be circus circus downstairs and the rooms really aren't that bad! (yes the elevators didn't want to make me want to cry). I highly recommend it if you come with a group of people and want to crash for extremely cheap because this means you won't have to sleep next to a smelly person you can get your own room! Wooo Vegas!

We reserved online our rooms online at vegas. com, mostly because the price was fantastic. 

When we arrived, the check in was reasonably quick, and our room was clean and comfortable. A little dated, but not bad really. 

For its' price, location, and convenience Excalibur is just fine. I don't think it deserves the low ratings it gets.

Ahhh yes...the good 'ol Excalibur Hotel. 

So ya it's old and weathered...but they just re did a lot of the rooms...and sure...their restaurants aren't exactly 5 star BUT

If you need a good room for a cheap price at the perfect location. Well my friends, Excalibur will always be there for you.

Check out Dick's last resort...the staff is funny.  

And really people....aren't you in Vegas to stir up trouble and drink till your livers shrivel up for the weekend??

Cheapie room to crash in. Clean, well kept, and in a great spot on the strip. 

Well done Excalibur. That'll do.

My experience at Excalibur is like living in the movie Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas. Of course minus the dinosaurs, paintings of Barbara Streisand and Gary Busey. On second thought seeing Gary Busey there wouldn't be too far off. 
I was in charge of planning my sister in laws bachelorette party. So where do you take a lovely workaholic to cut loose? Vegas baby! This would be every ones first trip to Vegas and it had to be perfect. 
Excalibur got my reservation because it was in the middle of the strip, had great prices, and had Thunder Down Under (of course we went!) 
I love this hotel. Sure it isn't the nicest hotel on the strip and the decorations look like they haven't been changed since the 1979, but that is why I love it! Its classic Vegas! kitschy, gimmicky, and historical! 
The only thing modern here is the pool which was always packed and the service was amazing! I'd stay here any day! 
This place made the bachelorette party amazing and completely memorable!

I heard from the grapevine that Excalibur was newly renovated, but apparently it's only certain towers that are. My friends stayed here in June and they said their rooms were nice! When we checked in, I asked the lady if our room was renovated she unfortunately it wasn't. The room wasn't that bad and it was a good thing that we barely hung out there only to sleep, sh*t, and... sleep.. LOL! ;)
The service wasn't that good, either. We called on Monday and see if we could get a late check out and the lady just nastily said, "WE CHARGE $25 if you do!" RUDE! Most hotels don't care, besides we only wanted an hour extra time! UGH.

Only if they had half star on Yelp.  Never ever am I staying here first time and the last time . Nasty room stunk mold everywhere eewwwww.... save your free room offers not worth it . Just bad my body was itchy all over but imagine that I went to luxur and checked in to a basic room but it was better then Excalibur like a million times better and they are sister facilities. Ahhhhhh they suck ass if I may say . Nastyyyyyyyy

On this Vegas trip, I came with 3 budget minded classmates.  While I usually like to stay in classier spots, I understood that unless I wanted to fork out more  money to stay at classier spot, this would have to do.  For 3 nights we spent a total of $183 and change. Split among 4 girls, that's pretty darn good.  

Yes, everyone in our room was outdated, we stayed in Tower 1.  But hey, we weren't there to enjoy the room.  It was just a spot to sleep and store our stuff.  So for what we wanted, we were definitely satisfied.

I have had a couple of experiences with this location\/hotel.  The first time was good and I did enjoy the room, of the walkway over the window of my hotel room.  Plus the 5am wake up of all the glass bottles being thrown away (yes, I was on the third floor).  I just took it with a gain of salt.  

The next time, I showed up to get my room which to my surprise was on the same floor, but this time on the opposite side of the hotel, i am thinking I do not need to listen to glass breaking at 5am, which I was good with.  Arriving to the room, I noticed a wall about 5 feet from my hotel window, thinking I will not be able to see anything, which in my book is OK since I do not look at a hotel window for the view, but I am using this room to shower and sleep.  When I needed to check everything out which I do, the restroom light was burned out, OK still not a show stopping deal, call the front desk and let them know and have somebody change it.  I still needed to get something to eat, which is perfect for them to change the light in the restroom.  After calling maintenance to make sure everybody in the world is aware of the situation, I left to get something to eat.  After returning several hours later, I walked in the room of course to check on the light, to my deep surprise, nothing had been done.  I immediately called the front desk, to see why this had not been done, I was told they did not have a light bulb to change my light, WHAT!?!?!  I am in a hotel resort with several hundred room, and they could not find a light blub!!!!  Go to Home Depot or Lowe's I am sure they have some very cheep.  

I was not going to stay in a room where the restroom light was not working.  I then ask what can be done, and yes I did suggest they go to Home Depot.  They decided to move me to another room, I was OK with that, but here is where it now gets interesting.  They told me the room was in the other tower a long walk as I was at the end of the hallway on my floor in the west tower, now I had to move everything to the east tower at the end of that hallway.  I asked if somebody could send me cart to move my stuff, of course everybody in the world at this hotel resort was busy, and they gave me a time limit to move my stuff or I would have to pay for two rooms, yes that is what i said two room...who in the world set these policies up???  Well, after being confused with my options, I told them to send somebody with the key if possible, of course everybody in the resort is so busy to do that one thing, again none of this my fault and yes I should have gone to Home Depot myself for the light.  Now I moved myself from one tower to the other tower, without any help from anybody staff at the hotel\/resort.  Needless to say I was not a happy camper.  I was able to deal with this whole situation until my stay ended.  

It just makes me think why I would stay at a hotel\/resort that do not have extra light bulbs, they could not take it from another room they were not using, oh wait I did ask that of the front desk and was told that was an older bulb and they did not have any, again Home Depot or Lowe's.  Needless to say with this expense I will not be staying at a hotel\/resort that treats me like this, and yes I have been back several other times, and stay at different places that treat me right.
Great Place for the Price. Also on the good end of the Strip! They gave us free good and drinks and free entry to the clubs. I'll stay here every time!

This isn't the hottest spot on the strip these days, but you might be able to find some dirt cheap rooms during non-peak times of the year.  The rooms are basic, but the beds we had were decent and the price was right.  This place is OK for the value, and more geared to those with kids, but a decent option if you're looking to save a buck. 

Close to Luxor, NY NY, MGM Grand... all easily walkable from the Excalibur.

I think when this hotel was first built it was based upon Vegas becoming a family resort instead of sin city as it was suppose to be. My how time have changed, what old is new again and it goes by the saying, "if it ain't broke don't fix it." Well, the time have passed this place by, the place is a bit tired looking and given the entertainment below ground there is this smell of horse poop that lingers with you. I was lucky not to get a room here, but I would say this is a place stay aways from.

Excalibur is a relatively inexpensive hotel in comparison to other hotels on The Strip. There are two hotel towers. Tower 2 is preferable as it is the tower that is renovated while Tower 1 is not. It is not like you are going to stay in the room that long. 

It is interesting that Excalibur charges a tax inclusive daily resort fee of $20.16. However, the higher end hotels also charge equivalent amounts so I don't really understand why they charge so much for the resort fee. Also, I was somewhat annoyed that they charged an early check in fee. You cannot check into the hotel until 3pm. I know that some other hotels on the strip do not charge an early check in fee.

The good thing about Excalibur is that they have a food court that won't break your pocket book. Even though most of it is fast food, at least you know how much it will cost you. They have a McDonalds, Pick up Stix, Baja Fresh, Johnny Rockets, Buca di Peppo, etc.

Excalibur is so convenient that you can have a wedding on the property at their wedding chapel. 

If you need a no frills place to stay without breaking your pocketbook, Excalibur is a reasonable place to stay, especially if you are able to get accommodations in Tower 2.

First thing I found out is a gay weekend. I have kids, I don't want to explain to them why to men are kissing. I have a service dog to help walk and movement. Had a long ramp to just get to room. The show there was nice to me and son . I have PTSD unable to handle the loud noise. They refunded my money but son love it. The staff at the entrance staff getting room was a bad enough. They acted like should stayed home. My son and I won't come back. Plus all your handicap doors didn't work.

This place is a fun casino and hotel.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  They have a fun atmosphere to place poker with live dancers, just outside of Dicks Last Resort.  Dick's is a very fun place to eat at inside of the casino if you like rude servers with an attitude and a sense of humor. We had a good experience here with everything except for the buffet.  Go somewhere else for the buffet.

Outdated Medieval Casino\/Hotel"
I will have to say that the outside castle and Medieval times theme from the outside of the hotel can surely attract one with a curious mind inside. They have a bit of rennovating to do and if you have kids I guess the shows they offer here are cute.

This summer was my first time actually staying in the Excalibur. Before I had only visited or seen the shows. Unfortunately, I really didn't like my stay. The hotel is very old and it's quickly evident why the prices are so low here. No, we didn't spend much time in the hotel so it wasn't that big a deal but a few other things didn't sit well with me.

For instance, there was some kind of plumbing issue that day because water was backing up in the bathroom sink. I noticed it when I took a shower so not sure if they share the same drainage. Dirty water doesn't bother me so much as the smell.

This is a place to stay on a budget if you want to be close to the strip. Somewhere to stay with your buddies, not somewhere to take your parents or lady.

***CASINO***
This place has cheap ($10 min, as opposed to the standard $15 or $25) craps and roulette tables, and a very non-intimidating atmosphere to stand around and watch for awhile with a beer. 

It kinda feels like you're in a sick smoker's lung, though. Thank God for Cali, eh?

We stayed at Excalibur for one night, just before leaving for a road trip tour of the Western United States. Our room was very inexpensive ($40), and upon checking in, they upgraded us instantly to a jacuzzi suite because they had one available. The room was clean and spacious, and a great location on the Vegas strip!

Horrible. The woman checking us in reprimanded us for not having exactly the information she needed. I am sorry I didn't have the right info, but it was found, and I didn't need to be chastised at the end of it all. The concierge was even rude. There were people in the lobby shilling for theater tickets who were astoundingly aggressive. The room window faces a cinder block wall. Huge. The entire field of vision. The bed has no apron so you can see the box springs- and you know that's classy. If this was all happening in Laredo, or Sandusky, or Duluth I would think it par for the course. But in Vegas? Come on. Never again. (sorry and no offense Laredo, Sandusky, and Duluth).

The bed was comfortable, and everything else was fine.  The internet was non- existent... I tried 3 different connections, and none worked.  I had to use the business center briefly and the internet was WAY too expensive.  I'm assuming this is because they want to encourage people to stay gambling, but I was in the middle of a work emergency, and it was impossible to deal with while at this hotel because their business center didn't allow pdf, and their internet in the rooms was not working. Otherwise everything was fine.  The staff was courteous, and the room was the cheapest on the strip.

Idk what peeps expect out of this place. It's one of the cheapest hotels on the main strip. It is toward to end of the strip so if you don't like walking, you should probably lose some weight. Ha jk but seriously. A bit of a walk to places like the Bellagio fountains or the best tacos in Vegas (YELP iT). However, closer to Fremont st (aka downtown).
 The room? Great for the price.
The casino? I don't gamble much but it did smell more of smoke than others I've been in. I did put in $20 at the bar and the bar tender made me 3 reallll stiff jack n cokes I was hammered before I ever left for the strip!
Gym? Eh okay I guess nothing special.
Parking? Sucks. The lot in behind the casino so you have to walk halfway through it to check in.
Can't say much about the food either. 
Basically what it comes down to is is if you're looking for a cheaper room to pre party and sleep in and are willing to walk a little bit, its devine! You have to remember this place is old.

I spent $50 a night at Excalibur. I had an old school room.  Got regular tv instead flat screen tv.  AC not working.
I went to book another Hotel at venetian (I love it)

This is actually a pretty cool hotel and casino. Just like the outside of the hotel is a castle, the inside as well has a bit of a medieval theme as well. It actually offers a few shows such as Tournament of Kings, The Australian BeeGees , and my favorite Thunder From Down Under. They have a variety of restaurants ranging from casual to fine dining with options such as Camelot Steakhouse, Bucca di Beppo, Dick's Last Resort which is actually a really fun experience, and they have the best food court ever. With options like Pizza Hut, McD's, Cinnabon, Krispy Kreme, Yougurtland, and much more.

This is a pretty good hotel for families as the rooms are very afforable, of course depending when you come. And its location is pretty good as you are accross the street from the Tropicana, MGM Grand, and New York New York. There is also a free tram that will also take you to Luxor and Mandalay Bay, just to shorten your walk.

The saying "you get what you pay for" truly comes into play with this "magic castle." I guess this place is OKAY for children, it just wasn't what I expected. I mean c'mon after seeing the outside you expect wizards and some magical unicorn shit. What did I get? A poster of topless men that says "The Thunder Down Under" & shitload of second hand smoking. The rooms were completely gross. We were told that we were going to be upgraded to a "newly remodeled" room. We walked into this room & I felt like I had checked into the Motel 6 that was three blocks down. The beds looked ancient & the TV was the size of a whale. I opened our curtains expecting at least a view, but what did I get? A view.......of a liquor & adult store. FUCKING FANTASTIC. To hell with this place. Circus Circus is the place to go if you want cheap & family friendly!

More signs!! I was running an errand and found this hotel IMPOSSIBLE to navigate. I'm sure I won't have that problem again now that I know the lay of the land... it was just a little disconcerting. Once I found my destination, all was well. Excalibur also has the first Orange Julius stand I have seen in years. Bravo to that! It is also the only convenient place where I can find Bico Australian jewelry. Another Bravo! All I would say, add more signs to help people navigate and take it easy on the intimidating guys offering free rooms and other things the MINUTE you walk in the door.

After a 50-minute wait in the reservation line Friday night, we went upstairs to our room on the 13th floor, to find the room trashed. Unmade beds, used bathroom towels, trash cans overflowing and half-finished drinks everywhere. It was as if people had just left the room. There was a frozen slushi drink that hadn't even melted. Upon calling the front desk, we barely received a "sorry" and were told another room would be opened for us. And yes, we moved down to the 10th floor and that room was fine. But what about the lack of professional courtesy to find out if everything was okay!? What about asking if we'd like food, drink or service comps? Nothing. It was no big deal to management.

Incredibly smoky so they pump a foul acrid scent into the air near elevators and in the casino.  It made my nose sting and my throat sore.  The bed was like sleeping on a board; the floor would have been more comfortable.  No decent food places in the hotel\/casino and the crappy ones in the food court close early.  The room service is only until 2 p.m.   Yes!  Really!  It isn't available after 2 p.m.  They have no wireless access.  Their buffet food was barely edible and even though it was one of the cheaper ones at $15 for lunch, the food choices made it more expensive since we ate very little of the slop.  They serve only American beers like Budweiser or Coors in their bars.  One bridge away and you can have decent beer, decent food, and a relatively decent atmosphere for a casino.

The only reason I gave 4 stars was they upgraded our room at no extra charge.   I liked the selections of food in the food court.  All the places are familiar if you just want a quick bite without having to examine the menu, and the prices are reasonable. I also like taking the train to the casinos instead of walking.  If it wasn't for my AAA discount I think the cost is a little over priced.  It also would have been nice to have a little fridge in the room.

One of the cheaper places to stay on the strip, but they definitely need to up grade the rooms. Seems as if the only things they've really upgraded in the rooms are the beds and tv (which can swivel). Other than that everything else is pretty old school.

Well. First of all i would like to thank to management for good hospitality. 

I have mlife membership so i made the reservation thru their own website. Good discount. I read hundred of reviews which made me pessimistic. I have stayed at montecarlo before and had couple of hygene problems about the room.but overall it was fine. 
Even my friends told me why i booked from excalibur when i could book from montecarlo with couple of box more. 
To be honest excalibur is 10times better than montecarlo. I got house room but just with a  request, check-in employee mary gave me the room type i asked for. And perfectly clean. It is 13th floor. Some of you might be supertitious but to be honest you dont need to be :) 

I am still at the hotel and i am definetaly planning to come again.and i recommend it to everyone.casino slut machines can be upgraded but that will not make me lower my points. Five stars five stars....

Had a great stay.  Got bumped up to a better room by the really nice desk guy.  Huge shower, bathroom, great beds.  Easy to make your way around the hotel.  The "resort fee" is still crap, but still cheap overall.  Great location.  Would def stay here again!

I have stayed at this property several times over the years since it opened in the 90's. As I grew up my vacation needs have changed & center strip hotels have offered a better caliber of people, shopping & entertainment that I'm looking for. Our last stay at Excalibur my fianc & I dressed up for a nice dinner & club night both of which had a dressed code; which we are are okay with. As we left our room for the night, other guest leaving their room saw us in the hallway & let me know I was nothing but a Vegas hooker & my man was a John buying me for the night. Get some rude guest at a cheap hotel.
On the positive Yolanda at the front desk is 5 STARS, she was very helpful as we were staying nearly 2 weeks at Excalibur with a complicated reservation that included 4 nights comp from playing myVegas app. The rooms have been remodeled which is a plus but the AC\/Heater in the room was super loud!

I have stayed here a couple of times already, and I haven't had any issues with this hotel casino.

A cople reasons why I have stayed here are the price and location.   For me, I find the location of this hotel to be great.  Next door is Luxor, across the street is the New York New York Hotel, diagonally is the MGM Grand, and just a bit further up is a food court with several food selections such as my favorites Subway, and Del Taco, all within a 10 minute walking distance from the hotel. Not in the mood for Subway or Del Taco, then just drive over the 15 freeway to an In-N-Out.  Need gas for your, there is a gas station close by.  Speaking of the 15 freeway, that's another reason why I like this hotel's location.  Just hop off the Tropicana exit and a few hundred feet up is a driveway for the parking lot. You don't have to deal with much pedestrian foot traffic.  Even leaving the hotel to get on the 15 is relatively easy. And the traffic around that area isn't as bad as the traffic I have seen further up the strip.

When I have stayed here,it's always a room with two beds. The bathrooms are spacious and the showers are fairly large.  The beds themselves have been comfortable where I can either lay and relax as I watch some television or to sleep.  For the purpose of using the room for sleeping and relaxing, it does its purpose.

Check-In was easy.  With reserving a room, just show a valid  I.D. and the credit card you used to make the reservation.  I had my smart phone already displaying my email conformation receipt just in case something went wrong. ha ha.  If you check--in early ( I am assuming before 3 p.m.) there is a $20 early check-in fee.

Check-Out was also easy.  I didn't know Excalibur did this until I got home, but on the day of your check out, they send you an email so you can Express Checkout if you want to, which is convenient if you don't want to go down to the front desk.

In a town full of tackiness the Excalibur really stands out. I thought I was in some sort of amusement park casino. There are a lot of families with kids staying here and I even saw a baby in mom's arms while she was playing slots.  Great parenting!  They have a basement with video and other kids games and a food court upstairs so this place attracts a budget crowd. The good news is that it has a walkway to the nearby New York New York, Luxor, and MGM casinos.

My friends and I took a quick trip to Vegas and stayed at the Exclalibur Hotel.  We received pretty good service - we got a free room upgrade to start. We stayed in a "Widescreen Room," which was clean and big enough for the three of us. The service throughout the hotel was nice - there were suited ppl walking around eager to help you find the various services Excalibur has to offer.  Their pool - called "Drenched," had plenty of seating for a hot Saturday, which was a plus. I enjoyed my stay overall; in fact, the only thing I didn't particularly like the fact that they charged my card an additional $33 without telling me; but I let that go because it was late when we checked it and perhaps the neglect wasn't intentional.  We received great customer service, proper directions and confortability. I would come back, of course.

We went on a family trip & Excalibur was our first option since the last time we had stayed here was really nice. We came during the EDC thing was going on so it was packed, so the check in like was like at least 40 minutes ! I was really frustrated by this time because I was super tired from the car ride & I just wanted to lay in my bed & take a nap! Okay, 40 minutes pass by we go to our room, everything was good. UNTIL I saw our view we had the most beautiful view ever it was the ceiling & venting fans ! Excalibur did this again & I was like really Excalibur !!! So I decided this time to go & ask for a better view, guy in the front desk was super nice & said he would put us in a higher lever so he did ! I recommend staying in the remodeled rooms because the other ones are not as  good as the contemporary ones. After we had settled in our room (finally) we had a decent view. Everything in the room was nice we stayed 4 nights & we all had fun! I didn't quite understand the whole process  of having to show our hotel keys to the officers by the elevators but whatever.. It was a pleasant stay!

Don't pay attention to the poor reviews.  This place is a great place to stay for the price and centrally located.  No, it's not the Venetian, but the rooms are clean, renovated, it's on the strip, and you can walk to any other fancy place you want to hang out or eat.  Stayed here June 2016 for 4 nights.

Honestly...the hotel isn't BAD. The location sucks because if you plan on walking to the middle of the strip, it's a good 20-25 minute walk. But the hotel is very run down and the more I stayed, the more I noticed that their elevators smelled like urine and alcohol. 

The one caveat is that it's probably the cheapest place to stay in, and you're not going to Vegas to spend the majority of your time in the room. So it's good for what it is, but I wouldn't recommend it to my friend or anything.
Great price, but not that nice. Casino is okay, restaurants not good. Bars are decent. If you're gonna fall asleep drunk and don't care about luxurious hotel room this is your place

My experience at Excalibur was average at best. The room that we got had no microwave, refrigerator, & the room furniture and decor were outdated and unappealing to the eye. Parking is a nightmare, especially when you arrive late at night and all of the parking spaces are taken up and when you have to resort to paying extra for them to valet your car. However, it is hard to complain considering the low cost that we had to pay as well as the convenient location of the hotel, it being on the strip.

So after leaving my review... I realized more things were taken from my car.. I had a lanyard I bought from Disney Tokyo that contained 2 Disneyland resort annual passes and my parking pass from work were taken. I can't believe it. I realized the person opened the latch for the car hood because they were trying to access my car trunk. I only put in the report that I was missing my coin purse and phone charger. I still haven't heard back from security. I'm so upset... I can't stop crying. I think I'm able to replace the stolen annual passes, but the lanyard was a souvenir when I was in Japan. The coin purse was also from Japan and contained about 1000 yen... :\/ I don't know what to expect from the investigation..

This hotel is very kid friendly with the "fun dungeon" and jousting show
The arcade games are a bit pricy and the show is expensive. The room are ok they are very small and the beds aren't that comfortable this hotel is definitely just a place to sleep not to hang out it

Fun casino atmosphere. We did a casino crawl up the strip and this was one of the stops. I am not a gambler but my boyfriend and friends are so we spent a considerable amount of time at craps tables. This was one of the more fun ones as the craps dealers were lively and funny... Although the waitress' look like they have been working in the casino since it was built, the drinks came fast and what more can you ask for?

DO NOT STAY HERE. We stayed here during Thanksgiving weekend Towel 1 on 22nd floor (I won't mention the room 

number).

On our second day I was out side gambling,someone came in to our room WHILE MY WIFE AND MY 6yr SON WERE IN 

SLEEP IN BED, and stole the purse that was on the table.

Thankfully they didnt wake up, but I cannot imagine if my wife open her eyes and see who ever was in the room, who knows 

what could happen... This can be inside job, or if robbers are  willing to take

what they can, while someone is in the room, I have a good feeling this is not their first time and  I'm certain it won't be the 

last time. While i was making a report to security guard, he didn't tell

me direct, but I got the vibe this wasn't first time it happen. After they investigate, they told me door was not locked(What? 

who doesn't lock the door inside the hotel) and i find out, door is so old when 

you open the door, it shuts the door but it does not "shut" all the way and you would think door is locked, but its not.

We had $3600 in purse,(not to mention her ID ETC) and I ask for some reimbursement, they told me $0.00 

Doesn't matter how reasonable prices are  or how clean the room is,  don't stay here and become a victim.

Personal experiences, is what all these negative posts are. I for one enjoyed this place. Our toilet was clogged and right away they came to fix the problem. Also the buffet was amazing with great food! Everything was enjoyable and a memorable experience!

One WORD:

seedy  

\/sede\/
Adjective

    Sordid and disreputable: "his seedy affair with a soft-porn starlet".
    Shabby and squalid: "a seedy apartment building".

Whew, this place is like a Nascar race meets a Lynyrd Skynyrd concert meets Midevil Times.

I have to admit, it looks pretty cool from the outside, but once you get inside...it's a dive.

We had made reservation months in advance so that we get 6 rooms side by side or across from each other. When we went for check in we were told that we will be on different floors. We received free upgrade to Tower-II when we protested. In Tower-II we had rooms on same floor but were separated from each other. I can't imagine what Tower-I looks like because our upgraded rooms in Tower-II had run down furniture, no microwave, no refrigerator, no free breakfast, no wi-fi. It's not worth staying on the strip. I think staying in place like Cancun Resort, Holiday Inn, and such may not be bad. I would consider it pricey because you get nothing more than a basic room. For that kind of money, I have received more amenities very close to the strip.

Price and convenience, you can never beat excalibur. Only problem is the smell and smoke. But still for the price, its worth ot. What do you expect its a casino with lota of smokers. We just stayed here for a day because our Mandalay bay reservation is totally booked this day and we need to do something here in vegas in advance. Still recommended.

Uhhh, all I gotta say is NEVER AGAIN. haha, I felt like I was in motel six back in the 70's.  The room was horrible.  The bathroom vents was not working.   The towels smelled like a wet diaper. haha. The decor felt like Martha Stewart's blind grandmother made it.  I was just not feelin' it.  The exterior is very attractive, but the inside does not reflect anything medieval.  The casino floor felt like I was playing inside a smoker's lung.  Oh and the "coupons" we got at check-in already expired the previous month. WTF? Just a big disappointment.
Poor poor Excalibur ... I bet at one time you were pretty cool ... but now you just smell like rotten eggs :\/

This place was such a disappointment on so many levels.  

I thought we had gotten a good deal because of the price and being on the strip but I should have paid a little more and gone elsewhere.   

Our very first night we have dinner reservations at a restaurant Inside of the hotel and the blow dryer goes out numerous times on my girlfriend.  I call two times within a 45 minute period for a replacement and they do not show by the time we leave for dinner.  Very very disappointing to say the least.

The other issue was how poorly the air circulation was on the main floor.   Regardless what entrance you go through the smell of cigarettes, shame and tears hits you and it's not a faint odor it's strong.  We visited other casinos and you could tell that the huge difference. 

We will never go back.   If your trying to save money do yourself a favor and spend a couple of extra bucks somewhere else.  Especially if your traveling with your girlfriend.

Excalibur is the worst hotel to stay at over 5 years of experience going to Las Vegas. 
I recommend you read this for your own good I never write reviews but this is worth it.
 Every year we take a trip to Vegas and stay at a different hotel each time to get a full experience. This year we decide to go for my wife's birthday and Excalibur was a horrible choice this year we drove 6 hours to check in and I was looking to get a nap in before heading out only to get bitten by insects or bed bugs. Within the first 30 minutes after checking in I had 4 bites down my leg and my wife on her butt. 
 We went back down to reservations and they checked us a new room and we did a security report and took pictures. The security mention we have "ANOTHER  case of insects" suggesting this has happened before. We asked about it he declined to tell us more, other than "it doesn't happen often". My wife at that point wasn't thrilled about this stay but we figured a new room on a different floor should be fine. Through out the night we couldn't sleep and I ended up getting another bite on my back and 3 more bites on my other leg, for my wife on her arm. By 530am we decided to go to front desk to show the manager. Our stay was originally for two nights but we decided to head home we spent the morning at the laundrymat to kill any bed bugs since they jump on luggage so we left our luggage bags since my wife didn't want to take a chance of bedbugs or insects home with us, we literally walked out with trash bags with clothes. I spoke to a hotel manager Josie who also mentioned "in other cases the rooms come back NEGATIVE with insects" implying its happened to others too just like the security guard did.  
And what do you know after all the bites we got our rooms were "NEGATIVE" too and no report to show us of the results only to take her word of it. JOSIE may have removed any fees of the hotel but we still had to pay full price for a sleepless, bedbug bite night, go to the laundrymat in the morning, cut our trip short and take a 6 hours drive home without any sleep we should not have paid full price at all. Thanks Excalibur for my wife's birthday
We took the family there for a weekend of fun by the pool and the pool hours are not great. Not opening until 10 and 12 and closing at 7 was not what we were expecting.

I noticed the same thing at the MGM and New York New York also - also MGM properties: the doorman actually delays the boarding process of taxicabs rather than speeds it up. It seems to be just a way to gather tips by making you board one at a time and first asking you where you want to go, and then telling the taxi driver. Would have been 7-8 times more efficient to have 7-8 cabs pull up simultaneously and direct guests to the cab they should board, as they do in some great airports.

I stayed at this hotel years ago for my 21st birthday. I enjoyed the room a lot. The view was nice & it was very convenient as far as parking & strip access is concerned. The only disappointment that I ran into was that the swimming pool was actually closed for the time I was there. I can't remember if it was because of remodeling or not. But again, I enjoyed the Excalibur. The rooms were decent & clean. We just had to ask for more towels. But, I will stay here again, mainly because the rates were pretty reasonable.

got to admit, I really thought the worst of this place when we were pulling up to valet and find that it was full. We drove around in circles trying to find a nearby parking because we really didn't feel like walking around with that much luggage; we finally parked in the parking structure. It was a drag carrying all that luggage all the way to check in. We ended up getting a room in tower one, which is a regular room. I was surprised to see that the room was really nice. I like the fact that it has a shower instead of a bathtub and the bed was SUPER fluffy and big. The rest of our family got upgraded and the rooms did look nicer due to the decorating, but the beds were way more firm. I definitely liked this room better than when we stayed at The Quad. If we come back here again, I'm definitely not taking the free upgrade due to the firmness  of the bed, unless it's a suite.

I booked a last minute trip to Vegas to go over some wedding plans for our April wedding. I wanted something cheap because it was going to be a quick trip and something close to our wedding venue. I'm really glad I picked the Excalibur! I was worried it was going to be a crappy hotel based on some review so I was expecting the worst. It wasn't bad! The beds are super comfy, the pillows too! It felt pretty clean to me, it definitely wasn't the place I'd take a relaxing bath but I have no complaints. The service was great, it was a pretty good location for what I wanted. I had a pleasant stay here. The only complaint I have is the line to check in.. OMG, I think there were 10 ppl in front and we waited 30-40 mins. I have to figure out that mobile checkout thing to avoid this in the future.

Also, it wasn't smelly!

I selected this hotel to stay at because it had okay reviews and was a good price. My friends and I were really just looking for a decent place to sleep. I am never staying at this hotel again. This is not a 3 star hotel like I thought. The hotel casino smelled heavily of cigarettes! You could smell the smoke several feet away even before entering the hotel! We nicknamed it the Smoky Hotel because it was that bad. My throat was so dry and inflamed after staying here for 3 days. I think Excalibur is known for being family friendly, but I would never bring my nieces to stay here because of the heavy second hand smoke. The check in line was also extremely long. Express checkout was smooth staff was pleasant, the pool was cool, but I do not recommend staying here.

Only making a review for the Hotel, not the casino as i'm not the gambler type.

We stayed in Tower 2 for 1 night, and had a clean and spacious room, with a large bathroom, the beds were comfy and we had a good night. But nothing much more to say, no breakfast included. 

In the morning we used the pools as well, they were clean, and guarded good, the only thing I have to mention is the over protectiveness I noticed, but I guess it's an American thing we as Europeans weren't used to.

We didn't have Wifi, but did have a cable internet in the room, which was a bit outdated, especially since most of us had mobile devices.
Wasn't as bad as thought! They could update the inside or provide newer shows but it's great for a quick weekend trip.

The hotel was great. Parking garage is all the way at the end of the hotel...meaning if you're walking from the garage to the strip you better wear some comfortable shoes....check in line was ridiculous other than that it's VEGAS!!!

I don't know why this place gets a bad rap, I was totally pleased with my stay here (though the dumb resort fee pisses me off no matter what). We stayed at the end of january for monday-friday. It must have been a slow time because we waited for only a few minutes to check in & had no problems. Ours was a standard room in tower 1 (the old tower i guess), but the room was clean & nice, not stinky. Not fancy, but good enough for me. If someone is a snoot and going to complain about chips on the door or rattling bathroom fan, then sure they'll hate this place, but if you are a normal person who lives with minor imperfections on a daily basis, you'll be just fine. We were on the 20th floor and the wifi worked just fine. I even brought my laptop & ethernet cord in preparation for having no wifi based on others' reviews, but was pleasantly surprised.(atleast that resort fee was for something i guess). We did a late check out option for $28 meaning we could wait to check out until 3pm. Very useful. I actually like the cheesy "outdated" casino, I find it cozier and more homey than the huge richy rich pretentious places. The foodcourt & walkways between the excaliber & neighboring casinos(luxor &NYNY) were really nifty and had good(though conspicuously overpriced) food options if you just need to grab something quick. The "fun dungeon" is a cute little arcade downstairs that is a fun diversion from the adult activities, it's only open til 10pm or so though.  I would totally stay here again and actually preferred it over the Luxor which we stayed at last year, though the luxor's room was just a teensy bit nicer.

My friends and I came here over Memorial Day weekend. This is the second year that some of them stayed here, it was my first time this year. I've stayed at crappy hotels and I've stayed at luxury hotels. I stayed here because that's where my friends booked to stay at, obviously they were going for good pricing. 

We arrived to the hotel around 3AM because our flight was delayed. We had a speedy check-in, since no one else was checking in at that time. Our room was in Tower 2, they had remodeled since last year. It's better, more updated looks within the rooms. No more dark carpet or dark wallpaper. The bathrooms are upgraded with granite counter tops and lighting fixtures, flat screen tv's and new paintings. We were on the 11th floor and had a nice view of NY NY and the strip (which was better than last year's -- a view of the roof). 

Like someone else said, Tower 2 is good for being close to the pools and you have easy access to the parking lots, if you drove. There is a Baja Fresh on the main floor, on the second floor there are other fast food options -- McDonald's, Quizno's, Pizza Hut, ColdStone, Starbucks, and some chinese food place. McD's is open 24 hours.

This hotel was worth the money, especially on the second busiest weekend of the year, when they raise prices by 200%. It's a good place to sleep, get ready, swim and eat cheaply. But if you're looking for a fancy, flashy, luxury hotel...you should probably move along to another place farther down the strip.

My stay had some terrible disasters, despite upgrading to one of their highest level of rooms (broken toilet, flooding shower, then a new room with noisey turbines outside the window and a TV that I had to rewire myself), but at least there were no bed bugs.  They did refund some of my payment, which is why they earned 2 stars.  I won't be going back though.  The air was also pretty bad inside...other casinos had much better air quality.

Stayed in a tower room with a strip view, which was pretty nice. I think this is the cheapest hotel in the heart of the strip. We enjoyed our time here. Here's my complaints:  Right after we got in our room, my 4-year-old immediately ran to the phone and tried to call his cousins, who were also in Vegas at the time. I realized this right away, and immediately made him stop. As I was pulling him away from the phone, I got a call from a front desk person who was very rude. From her tone, I'm guessing it happens often and that's the reason she has a low tolerance. I apologized and was very nice with her, so her rudeness was inexcusable. Another complaint I have is there seems to be miscommunication or just improper training on behalf of the management staff. Before we left CA, I called and asked whether the hotel supplied life jackets for children. I was told yes, so I deliberately left ours at home (wanting to pack as light as possible), but found out they do NOT supply them when we went to the pool. I was also told different prices by different people when calling to make our reservation. So employees need to be trained better in order to avoid giving customers misinformation. Other than that our room was nice and clean, the buffet staff, arcade staff, and staff in the shops & bar were great. I'm looking forward to giving this hotel another try. Hopefully there won't be any customer service issues next time.

I have family down in Vegas and I used to come here a lot when I was a child.  I used to love this place.  Now being 26 years old, it definitely lost it's aura.  Don't get me wrong, if you want to experience Vegas and have to bring your children, this is the hotel to go.  As you can see from the photos I posted, there is a fairly large arcade to keep your kids entertained.  

If you are looking for a cheap hotel, the rates here are pretty affordable. Location on the strip is good and a decent pool.

This hotel is kind of a mixed bag.  The key attributes it has going for it are low room rates, decent rooms, and all of the desirable amenities included under a very low daily resort fee.  The problem is that the staff are not very friendly or accommodating at this hotel, and there is not much cleaning up after the less than considerate guests who jump on those low room rates for a stay in Vegas.  Sigh.  

I would say I was pretty happy with the quality of my bed.  The room itself had no circulation though, and the air conditioner worked so efficiently that after five minutes of turning it on, it felt like a tundra.  There was no way to sleep through the night without shivering or waking up with a dry throat.  There was no balance at all.  The resort fee included free high speed internet which had a fairly good download speed.  It also includes a free daily paper, but don't expect them to deliver it to your door.  You have to go downstairs and ask for it, show ID, and maybe even be given a dirty look to get it.  The fitness center was beautiful with a wonderful range of current machines allowing me to do a full cardio\/strength training workout.  Unfortunately the staff at the fitness center were not just unfriendly but rather rude (accusing me of not wearing shoes when I was for example and then having to show them my Brooks running shoes on my feet).  Also, the narrow hours that the fitness center was open (they close at 8pm) made it difficult to use.  The resort fee also includes phone calls, but they don't advertise that either; you just figure it out for yourself after a few days.  Security was pretty tight at the hotel in a way that it is not at the nearby Paris for example.  This went beyond looking out for the welfare of the guests to the point of being annoying.  

If only they showed the same zeal in keeping their common spaces tidy.  There is nothing more disgusting than walking into an elevator to your room and seeing it littered with spent cups and napkins.  Gross.  My recommendation, stay elsewhere.  At this price point, the Luxor is a much better deal.

So we booked a room here, because like everyone else, it was inexpensive. I have read that this casino is a bit on the older side and I was willing to deal. As we walked through the the lobby\/casino floor I could visually observe the thick cloud of cigarette smoke I walked through absorb into my hair. Super ick! The women gamblers were all older Peg Bundy look-a-likes and there were way too many kids here breathing in that second hand smoke. Based on my observations, I was very hesitant as to what our room would look like.

Now, my superbulous man-friend surprised me with an upgrade to our reservations which included a view of the strip. The renovated room was very much acceptable with granite table, counter tops, flat screen TV and even a  seating area in front of the window. The view of the strip was beautiful and so worth it for only $30 more a night! 

What also annoyed me was the pull string to our Roman black-out shutters that kept breaking. In addition, my man-friend was horrified to find that a bottle of bourbon he had brought in his duffel bag had popped and saturated most of his clothes. The wait to dry-clean pretty much took the duration of our trip. Poor guy mostly wore undershirts! Super lame!

Warning: Steer clear of the Sherwood Cafe!

Excited to be here for a soccer tournament 
We arrive to the hotel only to drive around the parking STRUCTURES for a minimum of 35 min. Finally we find parking. After the long walk through parking lot and walk through casino we get to the reservation desk & we check in. Rooms are not all that great. We have a non smoking room that still has a bit of smoke smell to it. 
Beds are hard and there is no fridge or microwave. 
Disappointed and I haven't even laid my head down on the pillow

This hotel is ghetto as fuck. Also, their staff don't know their own hotel's hours for anything - restaurants, pools, shows etc. I was told by 3 different people directions to the pool without any one of them telling me it was closed. What a waste of my time! The front desk is rude and unintelligent and unprofessional, not knowing their own mgm card and aaa discounts. I had to tell them what % is was! They get two stars because their valet, tho it sucks, they don't expect a tip for their shitty service, and nothing ever got stolen. Also their rooms are clean and bug free if u need a quick place to stay during the week. But don't expect anything from the workers. Pigs are smarter than these people!

It's all about location that's all. Worn out hotel rooms. 95 a night good deal through our event we did on sat. We had two rooms. The toilet ran the first night. The ac is either snowing on or off no temp control worked in either room, so u sweat or freeze.

Bed bugs! 
Found a bed bug crawling on the dresser. Tower 2. Security came up and took pics...and the bug and moved me to another room. Was told I would be contacted by risk management but never heard a word. I have left several messages but have not been called back. 
Will not stay here again.

So...had my room had a mini fridge I would have given this hotel (5) stars, alas, it didn't so (4) stars it is. I didn't even know it was an option NOT to have a mini fridge, I thought it was a given, oh well you live you learn. Other than that I had a great experience here. The line to check in was a bit long but it moved fairly quickly and when we got to the front the lady that helped us was great. She was friendly, quick and efficient, just what I like. The hotel was well kept and very kid friendly, which I love because I have two kids that I will be bringing on our next trip to Vegas. I love that is smack dab in the middle of the fabulous Las Vegas Strip. Another plus is that there are walk ways and a tram to 3 other hotel\/casinos, which as you know if you've been to Vegas, is a heaven send limiting your time in the dry desert heat. 
Excalibur has a variety of good eats, slots, shops, tables and entertainment. There is even a Starbucks right in the lobby!
My suggestion on your next trip to Vegas, consider Excalibur as your choice, but don't forget to ask about getting a mini fridge in your room, don't assume that there will be one, like I did.

We arrived at the Exaclibur at about 10:30PM on a Thursday night and went right to check in. This was probably the only sour point about my experience at this hotel. Our friends were behind us in line, so we were served first. When we went to check in our agent, Nina, said there were no kings left but that we could come down the next day and they would move us. There was some back and forth between her and the agent helping our friends and then we were all checked in and ready to go. Our friends came over and told us that they had been upgraded to a King room. At which point I was like wtf? We went upstairs and lo and behold, they had NOT been upgraded, their agent had lied to them. Not impressed with that.

The next day we did go back down and Kathy was happy to help us switch and was very prompt at doing so. We didn't have to give back our old keys, just leave them in our room and we were able to move immediately. Our new room had a strip view, which was nice, and a king bed and was as well appointed as our previous room.

One thing with this hotel is the noise. Because you're on the strip, non strip view rooms will be quieter. I'm a light sleeper and I slept with earplugs every night, if not for the noise from the strip, for the noise from the air conditioner. Every single room we had (between four of us) had loud a\/c units.

The hotel itself is pretty well situated, you really wouldn't have to leave if you didn't want to. The casino is spacious and I was able to play all the games I wanted to without having to wait long. I also found $100USD on the floor my first night :D Lucky me! The food court has some good options, starbucks, mcdonalds, krispy kreme, etc, and there's lots to see and do within the casino itself. Location wise, I would have preferred to be closer to the main part of the strip but you get what you pay for.

The only other bad thing at this hotel was constantly being hounded to go and see this new property they were pushing. "We'll feed you and you'll tour the facility" they said. "We'll give you cheap show tickets" they said. Very suspicious and my bullshit radar was up - avoid these guys like the plague, they'll hunt you down. After a while, we stopped admitting that we lived at the same address just so they'd leave us alone.

Overall, this was a great hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. The slots were great, the amenities were good, the rooms were well appointed and fairly modern and it wasn't hard to get around. Keep in mind that you get what you pay for - we didn't want to spend a ton of money for four nights in Vegas, we wanted that money to go to gambling and shopping and eating. This was a reasonably priced, clean hotel. We didn't spend a ton of time in our rooms besides sleeping and changing and it suited us just fine.
There dealers can make you rich, can't say much about there hotel

It was ok. The check in process took too long. The hotel was giving us the wrong room. I had to stand my ground, politely, until we got the room we had reserved and paid for. The room was nice and clean. Very comfy feather top bed. One thing, the room is never complete dark due to the drapes not going complete over the shade. So, we woke up earlier than we wanted to. Meaning, waking up after only 3 hours of sleep. By the way...no bath tubs! "It's in the small print". The hotel was built without bathtubs. I found this incredibly funny, after my annoyance wore off. No smoking room smelled good.  Another thing - pizza flyers all over the hallways.  Looked messy.  Nobody cleaned them up.

I remember driving by when this place was being built back in the mid 90's and thinking "wow", this is going to be great!  And it was pretty great back in the day, but it's now far outclassed by the newer, swankier joints that have since sprung up.

I have never stayed here, but have visited many times.  The casino isn't half bad.  It's fairly large, with all the usual table games and a good selection of slots.  Cocktail service has been average on recent visits.

But the poor Excaliber is really beginning to look dated and not really in line with the "modern" vegas culture (meaning non-family oriented these days).  Last October we walked over from the Luxor and through the Excaliber's food court area.  The whole area was dirty, with trash thrown about.  

It's time for a re-do in my opinion.

I've been here about 4 or 5 times since turning 21, and I would have to say this is actually a pretty good place to stay overall.  There are several positives of staying here which includes: location, food court, and proximity of the rooms to the parking lot.  It is very close to everything on the strip, and the last time I came here I was able to walk to New York New York within 5 minutes.  This is a plus if you are trying to watch Zumanity in NYNY and want a slightly lower price range compared to staying at NYNY.  There is also a food court in Excalibur that includes Starbucks, Krispy Kreme, Popeyes, and McDonalds.  It is also very walkable and drivable to other areas on the strip.

Some of the downsides to staying here are that the walls are not very soundproof, and there was another family with a loud child that kept me up for part of the night.  Luckily, the front desk was very accommodating and I was able to get a room change with ease.  The buffet is also not very good, and there is not really a club or night lounge here.  If you are fine with driving to other areas along the strip, this place is overall good for the price.

This review takes price and location into account.  I had booked a room here for three nights this past weekend with round trip flight for $650. That being said, I don't think you'll find a nicer hotel at a more central-strip location for the same price.

It's probably the best available all things considered. I made out really well at the Casino as well. That pushes the review to 5 stars.

Stayed here the 14th-16th August 2015. 
Have to say that the check in was very good. I was upgraded for free near the pool but the room came with no fridge lol. The floor 17th carpet was torn n all sections and they placed duck tape down to hold it. The game room Dungeon was ok but most the games took the money or didn't work. The best part of the hotel were the restaurants and the show tournament of kings. The food at the show was dry but ok, could've been better given the price of admission. Truth my kids even complained more than the parents of the hotel. So would say want be staying at this one again. 
Also the games table games n the casino were wack no kind of foot traffic and paying 6 to 5 on blackjack  what a rip off!!. 
Went to the New York New York and won $305 on there tables. Lol.

I just stayed here this past weekend for my friend's wedding.
The only reason the hotel got a 2 stars is a) I have to remember that I get what I pay for and b) we had a great view out our hotel room.
The smell in the lobby\/casino floor is of stale cigarettes and old nasty carpets. Sure, I can get over that and hustle up to my room, but being "welcomed" by the scent is awful. The front desk were okay, quick but snarky, and were talking about other guests who were standing just down the counter from them, calling them names and complaining about them being high maintenance. Not classy, even if you are a cheaper hotel.
The bedroom was nice, simple -- I upgraded to a Widescreen room (I would recommend the upgrade...only $30 or so). However, our shampoo\/conditioner and body wash bottles were only 3\/4 full, and there was no comforter on the bed...just three sheets. I excused it thinking, "Ya, it's hot in Vegas" but really, it's just cheap. 
The view outside our hotel was lovely, out over the pool and to the mountains, and the location of the hotel on the tram line between the Excalibur and Mandalay Bay was convenient.
The coup de grace of disgusting however was when my boyfriend found mouse droppings when unpacking after our trip. Definitely not there when we traveled to Excalibur...
Take your money elsewhere is the moral of this review.

Stayed here a few years ago and it was horrible. Went in to play a few games and was promptly harassed by a, fat, greasy security guard who thought it would be amusing to try and walk away with my drivers license. I'm pretty sure The Excalibur is a vacuum cleaner that just sucks up all the assholes that picked on everyone in middle school and high school and gave them a job. Which is sad and ironic, because Dick's Last Resort, while having mediocre food and is one of the more entertaining eateries on the strip, is located in this shitty hotel and casino.

This is an okay hotel to stay at in Vegas, but there is nothing super fancy about it. However, for the cheap and reasonable price, you are probably getting what you pay for. Location-strip wise is good. It is on the north end (my favorite) close to New York, New York, MGM, Hooters and Luxor. 
Upon checking in (on a Sunday), we had to wait well over 20 minutes, but the line did move pretty fast. Customer service could use some work. I thought I'd be clear and honest upfront in explaining to our clerk that the name i booked the room with may be different, as I had changed my name due to getting married. She looked at me with a death stare, as though we wouldn't be getting the room if the name didn't match. Luckily, my Expedia reflected the name change, but please wipe your snotty resting b-face off. We ended up upgrading for $10 a night to be in the same tower as our friends, so we lucked out getting the end room (which was slightly bigger with a table area). Another major annoyance was the solicitors that would attempt to harass you into purchasing show tickets or another stay at the hotel--literally every time you headed towards your hotel tower, including when I am in the process of leaving and clearly have my luggage with me. Sure, that's the exact moment that I want to book another stay-when I am trying to get to the airport, or when I'm tired and heading back to my room. I know that it is Vegas, but give it a rest. I'd never experienced that at other hotels.

Cheap and cheerful. Wasn't happy with the first floor room which had the not so pleasant view of ventilation shafts. Rooms are dated and no fridge or microwave- heck even Motel 6 down the road has those! Non smoking room smelled of smoke and I'm pretty sure I was bitten by a bed bug. On the plus side - the gym and spa are pretty cool. The food courts are great and Dicks bar serves a good selection of beers and the location on the strip is convenient. The room rates are good value so I guess you pay for what you get but resort fees are ridiculous. Won't be staying here anytime in the near future.

Not even one star. I am a local here in Vegas and for years Excalibur has been our destination for a staycation. Over the past 15 years I have never had such a terrible experience in my life. It's dirty short staffed and just overall not well kept. Multiple times we were told they did not have any clean towels for the rooms. A picture was missing. Off the bathroom wall. Broken glass still on the floor. Mirrors dirty. Stained pillow cases. Windows so dirty we could see out of our room with a "VIEW". As my brother and his family were meeting us from out of town we wanted rooms close together. We paid for early check in. He got his room pretty early, however my room was not available until after 6pm. Two days after we checked in they called him and said they needed to move his room due to maintenance needing to be done in his room. They wouldn't tell him what. Then they said well it's the joining room. He was not in a joint room so that made no sense. They then said well never mind it can wait.  They now charge for parking which isn't that big of a deal but I feel like to charge us to park given the state of the rooms is not cool. I would not recommend this hotel again. It saddens me that such a fun family focused place is such a dump now.

my stay was fantastic from start to finish. I had one comp night and my mom had one comp night. Our agent was amazing her name was angel check us in at 1:30 on feb 1. pass on good words about her. She changed things around and arranged it that we didn't need to change rooms. grade A service. We stayed in a contemporary room. it was so nice extremely clean and comfortable the decor was very nice. Wall temp controls worked great, nice flatscreen tv and wifi was good. The very nice pool complex was closed but you could use luxors but not issue anyway since they are connected and also the weather was too cold. We were very impressed by our stay and now even more to hear that tower one is remodeled.So we resort tower was renovated few years back and now royal tower is remodeled which equals to a fine choice of stay, friends of us stayed there 2 days before we did and had a nice stay as well. if they remodeled or just painted and updated by the front entrances and here and there and get rid of the time share ticketpeople it really would  be a sharper place than it is, can't wait to return this summer and party at the castle.

My first visit to Vegas and not very impressed with my stay here. We had a plumbing issue that took over an hour and 5 calls to get resolved. The second night we got in late ( around 2:30 am) and my son was unable to access his room; apparently the battery went out in the electric lock and it took over an hour for maintenance to arrive to open the door and another 45 minutes for the bellman to show up with a key to another room to move my son into. To make up for the inconvenience they said they'd comp our breakfast at the Luxor, only when we arrived there the next morning the people at the Luxor didn't know a thing about it and only comped us $50, which was not enough to cover breakfast for three with the prices at the Pyramid Cafe. I'll never stay here again and recommend others to think twice. People forget what it means to provide good customer service.

Pro: It's Excalibur! Games for kids in the lair. Thunder from Down Under!

Con: It's Excalibur at 2009 - falling apart. 2nd floor has been whored out to vendors, with nothing left for the kids. lair is full of smoke and pedos. It's old and dirty. Crappy air inside.

Came here with group of univ classmates for Xmas, to our surprise the heater will burn off horrifying smell since no one ever cleans the vent between the AC season and heater season. Torn wallpaper and mold are your most common decor. 

Buffet was a joke, even for a pretty low price for breakfast.

DO NOT BRING YOUR KIDS HERE. Take them to a better and friendlier place.

I WOULD RATHER SLEEP ON THE STREET!  My fianc and I just stayed at the Excalibur over Labor Day weekend and had the most disgusting experience of our lives. We are Pearl Mlife Members and have stayed at every hotel in Las Vegas through M life at this point. I booked two nights because one night was comped and came with $100 resort credit. We checked in and paid to have our room upgraded. The woman at the mlife check in area insisted that it was a much better room and was very recently updated. Great... we'll go with the upgrade. Room 6168 to be exact (STAY AWAY) We ordered a movie the first night... that didn't work. It kept freezing. Moving on to the most appalling thing I have ever seen in my entire life. On the second night we found DISGUSTING MOLD in the bathroom. There was a growth of mold not just speckles a f****** growth, mushroom, whatever you want to call it  ( I have attached the photo) in the bathroom and mold in the shower. This is beyond neglectful and I can't even process how neglectful this is to PAYING guests!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I am so disgusted that I was breathing in mold for two nights!!!!! Housekeeping should get fired for how neglectful it is. The fact that we were sold on this room and to find that makes me sick to my stomach! Management didn't handle it well either at check out. Just rude and didn't take ownership of the fact that we were sold into being in that room and had to BREATHE IN mold all weekend long ! Almost feel like I should sue them for negligence!




On our way out we had an even more appalling experience! After my fianc kept repeatedly telling the bellman that he will handle the bags, he kept insisting and pushing my fianc to go towards the valet even though he was telling him I was elsewhere. Once we got the the valet once again my fianc told the bellman that we can handle it from here and it's hasn't been a good weekend, the bellman completely ignored that and stayed. Once our car pulled up my fianc loaded all he bags even though Ali the bellman kept ignoring him and basically grabbing the bags from his hands. When my fianc was being polite and came to ask me if I had a cash tip I explained that we had played all our money and we're on our way out. When he told the bellman, "Sorry, no cash.." his response was, " You cost me 45 minutes, and I have to pay taxes on this." this is unacceptable considering my fianc and myself lost about 900 each with M Life this weekend. The man was arguing us in the middle of a full valet lot and that was very embarrassing and unprofessional.

We stayed two nights. Long line to check in but they had most of the counter staffed so they were trying. 

She upgraded our room to a corner room with a tub in the room, very nice woman at the counter!!

The room was clean and we'll maintained. 

I have no complaints, nice place:)

Clearly Vegas is trying to shake their "family friendly" image.  We stayed at another hotel the first couple of nights, then moved to Excalibur because it was cheaper - and we thought would be more family-friendly for our young daughter.  Boyyy was I wrong!  

They stuck us in Tower II - which is the farthest from the registration desk - on the top floor, at the very end of the hall.  It took a good 15 minutes to get to the room upon entering the hotel.  Not only that, but at night we had to walk through "the Party Pit" that had dancers on the bar.  Then we passed a bank of slot machines with another dancer on top.  I know this is Vegas and this kind of stuff is all over the place - but  it was just another sign that they are really trying to return to being an adult-oriented town.  

Excalibur is somewhere between economical and shady.  There were some weird characters in the hallways of the hotel, and drug use (nothing awful - I smelled pot smoke - but again, it's not the kind of thing you want your kids around).  I heard security pay a visit to a room near ours.  Oh yeah, the walls are pretty thin!  

The casino was pretty ghetto.  Hard to get service while I was playing video poker.  We didn't go in the pool, but the pool area did look nice, with several pools and a water slide.

The room was surprisingly nicely-appointed (sort of a Hollywood Regency-meets-Medieval style that actually sort of worked), but the plumbing was obviously having some problems (drains "glug-glug-glugging" every time you used a sink or flushed the toilet).  The shower door only opened on one side - the side that was 4 inches away from the toilet, so you practically had to climb over the toilet to get in and out.  Towels were nice and fluffy.  The shampoo\/conditioner\/mouthwash freebies sucked.  The beds were very high and my daughter fell off a couple of times, which was scary.  There was a nice plasma screen TV, but no "kid" channels (ie Nickelodeon, which seems to be standard in most hotels) - actually there were very few channels at all.  The a\/c was weird - we tried messing with the temperature, but the room was always too warm or too cold, regardless.  The a\/c blasted right onto the beds, so if you were laying down, you'd wind up freezing.

One thing that really pissed me off was that we requested a non-smoking room, and they gave us a smoking room - something I didn't realize until late in the evening when I found my daughter holding a book of matches in one hand and an ashtray in the other.  Fortunately we only stayed one night so it wasn't the end of the world - just very irritating.  

The coffee stand at the bottom of the elevators had some seriously nasty coffee - and you had to walk half a mile through the casino to get to a Starbucks.  

I cannot see us staying here again - the whole Excalibur scene definitely was not for us.

I don't know what can be said about this hotel that hasn't already been said about Afghanistan.  This place is bombed out and depleted!   I stayed in Tower 1 on the 13th floor.  First impression -  the carpet and hallway were dirty and dingy.  Looks like it hasn't been upgraded in 10 years.  The room was equally bad.  It smelled musty and like marijuana, there was no refrigerator, no coffee maker, the remote for the television did not work, and the television signal was poor.  Also, the parking is atrocious.  Not sure what management is doing with the profits from this place, but they definitely are not reinvesting in this hotel. 

Also, because there is no coffee maker in the room, my  group had to go to the lobby for coffee everyday.  When we went to the lobby we were constantly harassed by the timeshare personnel.

One positive - the buffet  was decent.  However, I won't be back.

We went on friday Oct 4 2015 for the buffet and this was the worst buffet ever, the food was mostly cold and old, what was the worse is that this was at 4pm. Not worth the price and will never eat there again, the only thing that was good was the cookies they had on the dessert station. We tried another buffet place at the MGM grand and it was awesome, a bit steep but worth it.

Horrible!  Never stay here!!  We are still stuck here for another night, the staff does not care, don't let the standard "apology" the manager tacks at the end of each review fool you. Sorry means nothing unless there's change or retribution.  The line for check-in was 45 min long, our room is disgusting; dirty carpet, dirty walls, wrappers on the floor and BLOOD on the toilet seat!  No coffee maker, not even glasses so we could drink. We ended up drinking water out of our hands from the sink. I wish I could give it ZERO stars!  What a disappointment for our girls' getaway weekend!

3 pools and all of them go only 3ft deep. WiFi is sporadic.  No fridge, or  coffee machine in room.  Maid didn't come to our room until after 7 pm after we called them.  No mini bar, shampoo,  shelves for shampoo or soap so you set your stuff on the shower floor.  Elevator smells like garbage.

I don't know what I was thinking staying at this place--it SUCKS. The castle exterior looks ridiculous, the carpeting reminds me of some cheap motel 6, and the shows seem like they were made for 5 year olds. I don't remember if the service was up to par, but I do remember how ugly the suites were--when I entered the room I wondered if I was in a hostel somewhere in eastern europe. Ugh. Do yourself a favor--don't come here.

This hotel smells the worst out of all the hotels on the strip. Not to mention when we checked in to our room we were pleasantly surprised to find long black hairs scattered on the bed and some remnants of blood in the bathroom. There's no mini fridge in the rooms so prepare for lots of trips to the ice machine. Also make sure you put the do not disturb sign out when you leave the room. We made the mistake of forgetting to do that one of the days we stayed here and we came back to a clean room however my prescription pills were missing and my clothes looked like they had been rummaged through. I called security and filed a report about my missing items and an hour later the manager called and made it seem that the housekeeper just mistakes it for trash... regardless to say I was pissed. Don't stay here. The only good thing about this place was the Baja Fresh downstairs and the gym was nice.

4 of us stayed in Tower 1 on the 22nd floor in a two queen bedroom. I am pregnant so I was skeptical due to the reviews but we got the room for $30\/night. The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful, we arrived to the room and we quickly did an inspection and it was very clean and smoke free and the view wasn't too bad, the bed comfiness was super imperative to me so I tried it out and it was so comfy we all ended up taking a short nap.
After our nap we went to the pool . They have three I believe but we were all intrigued by the family pool with the water slide and the waterfalls. There were no seats so we sat at the VIP cabana and no one said shit to us, You also get towels when you show them your hotel key card upon entrance to the pool,
Then we got hungry so we decide to use the coupon book the front desk gives you upon check in and it had some great deals. We used the Baja fresh coupon and they were  skimpy and overpriced but nice.  Then we gambled and  we all won . I made $1700 off $100 at the big wheel and with pennies slots my friend kept making high dollar amounts, i love gambling there, The ONLY reason they didn't get five stars is due to the excessive cigarette smell in the casino, it sticks to your clothes and body and it got so bad I got nosebleeds because I am not normally exposed to that and I am very sensitive to it, but the smoke is only in the casino nowhere else,  Im pregnant too so it was so bad I bought a mask, i don't think children should be anywhere near the casino. 
They had a dungeon with arcade games and in the book you get a free midway game so that was fun, 
We also had lunch at bucca de beppo and their family size.
