One of the few casinos still standing, unchanged from my childhood. Probably one of two good arcades left and the best of those. Although I didn't get a chance to visit it in my last trip, I hope it hasn't disintegrated too much since my last visit a couple years ago. 

This last trip I played craps and slots. Lost at craps overall, but had a great run while it lasted. Friendly dealers giving me crap about how young I look. I think the pit boss suspected it to be a fake ID haha. They have teaching tables and $5 tables (a nice relief from the other $15 tables on the strip). 
Definitely is not being maintained as well as it could be (I don't think it's changed much at all since I can remember visiting Excalibur.  
I have never stayed in the hotel but have been getting emails for $20 rooms on weekdays. I'm not sure if there's hidden fees or what but for not being a high roller that's a great price :)

Next time I hope to try the buffet deal they have with Excalibur

This review is for the lobby bar as we didn't stay here. Made a pit stop at the lobby bar to grab some drinks with a group of friends. The bartender Mario was excellent. He was checking in with us to see if we were good with drinks the entire time we were there. I hit a royal flush on the video poker machine at the bar top and enjoyed the comped drinks that came along with it. The next night the mrs and I decided to stop by to check the luck on the bar top machines and Mario once again took great care of us. He mixed up some awesome micheladas. We will definitely stop by the next time we visit.

Very outdated, compared to other hotels on the strip. System crashed when we were checking in and delayed our check in process by about an hour. The staff was friendly. Room was a little dirty and someone had a little fun in front of the window and it left a greasy outline on the window that wasn't cleaned. That was a turn off right away. Then the $20 restaurant credit didn't work because the system had crashed. Very annoying. When we got the bill they overcharged us. We would not go back here.

lots of changes since my last stay.  even more since my first 15 years ago.  i remember like it was yesterday.  fighting with my brother after he kicks my ass at virtua fighter.  collecting those hooker cards and trying to win as many crappy stuffed animals as we could.  but i digress......    
checked in and was surprised by the updated rooms.  nice flat screens, beds were super comfy and the shower was actually functioning.  pool area completely remodeled as well.  and best part rooms were only 35 bux.  now this isnt my first or even second choice when i come to vegas but for that price come on........  calibur!!!!!!!!!!

If ZERO stars was available this hotel would deserve it.
This hotel is filled with BED BUGS! Don't stay here because of the prices you will have bite marks all over your body. Pay the difference and stay at a better hotel.

I recently stayed here for 2nights on a double bed hotel room. First night we slept on the bed by the window and everything was ok. The second night we decided to sleep in the other bed since roomservice didn't come and the other bed was made. WRONG decision around 4am we awoke to bites all over our bodies! Security came and escorted us to a different room so we could shower and leave.

Management acted like this was a normal thing and didn't  apologize or anything. Didn't offer to help us in anyway not even dry cleaning for our clothes that was in that nasty hotel. Never staying here again, they will be hearing from my lawyers.

Steer clear from this establishment!!!!

It's a nice hotel to stay  just around the strip area which is my favorite spot in vegas since I don't gamble, but here's the downside, their housekeeping crew should better understand the word privacy and cleanliness. They will just enter your room while you're still asleep with the pls don't disturb  tag hanging by the door knob . Cleaning the mess which the maintenance people left took 4 days to get cleaned.  Not coming back here even if they'll offer a free room, thanks but no thanks!!

Pretty good place.  Stayed here for several days.  Pros:  pretty nice casino...lots of food places..good location.

Cons:  Check in line was INSANE long.  Lots of people...did I say lots...I mean  LOTS of people by the doors harassing you EVERY SINGLE TIME you walk by trying to get you "show tickets."  This is BS INSIDE a hotel. 

I may stay here again...but I would check around...If I found a better rate ANYWHERE else...I would take it.

Had a great time at Excalibur. The room was a good price and even came with a free buffet. Going during the week was definitely way better than the weekend. You do have to pay for parking now but we did valet for about $5 more than self parking, which was worth it because we didn't have to lug all of our stuff in the Vegas heat. The line to check in was long and took about 30 minutes, which is normal and they also have a lobby bar. The room (Royal tower) was clean and ice cold. We had a view of the Luxor. The air conditioner is a little noisy. The casino itself doesn't smell terrible of smoke which was a huge plus! Do be prepared to pay for a lot of the extras like adult pool, mini fridge, ect. Pros: monorail to Mandalay bay, air conditioned hallways connecting to Luxor and Mandalay bay, friendly staff, buffet, lots of shows.
Cons: time share people that harass you every time. They dress as hotel employees to trick you so beware! Price for water is expensive! Sheets on the bed were all white with some stains.

This place is typically pretty crowded. Building is dated and full of sightseers. This casino is one of the "lower end" ones on the strip, so don't expect a whole bunch. I've never stayed in the hotel, but have heard that the rooms have been remodeled recently and are decent.

Never again will I stay here.  Our room was descent, but this review will focus more on the casino.  First off, their ventilation system sucks ass.  If you're not a smoker, you might as well be if you go to the Excalibur.  As soon as you walk in you get a huge wiff of smoke and smell like you've taken a shower in ash.  Although the minimum for the tables are cheap ($5), you def get what you pay for in terms of ambiance.  Our room was in Tower II (the OLD tower) and at the other end of the entrance.  Also, we were on the 25th floor and on the last night we were there, the elevator kept passing our floor.  We were all ready to go out in our heals and dresses only to find out that we had to take the stairs all the way down.  I hate to bitch, but the staircase also wreaked (sp?) of cigarette smoke.  I'd hate to get stuck here...worst nightmare come true. The morning we checked out, which was at 6am the elevator still didn't stop at our floor.  Luckily we only had to go down 1 flight w\/ our luggage and the elevator stopped on the 24th floor.  FML...I'm super tired and exhausted and the damn elevator doesn't work properly.  What a way to end the trip.   Supposedly Tower I has the updated rooms with flat screens and those are the pictures that the Excalibur has on their website.  So if you're planning a stay here, request Tower I.

Meh- I wasn't exactly thrilled to hear I would be staying at this Hotel a few weeks ago. This is one of the lesser expensive options of Vegas hotels. Its pretty old, and outdated. Because it's a cheaper hotel, it brings in a lower class of visitors. To be fair, it does have a few positives. It is home to Thunder from down under. :) :) :) I kept hoping I would see some of those hot Aussie men walking around, but I never did. Its also home to Dicks (I reviewed this place previously) 
All in all, I would not choose to stay here again, but its not all that bad.

We stayed at Excalibur for 3 days the week before Christmas. The room was clean but that's all I can say for it. It was very dated and the wall paper was peeling. Our window faced a wall, so no view. We were stalked every time we went in or out of the hotel by people saying they would give you vouchers for your stay but simply wanted to sell you tickets. We had a noisy floor with a man across the hall yelling at all hours of the night. Didn't get any sleep. When we left someone was smoking pot in one of the rooms that we could smell in the hallway. These are supposed to be non smoking rooms with fire alarms that are supposed to go off when you smoke. I can honestly say I will not be back.

Absolute worst hotel I have ever stayed at.  They forced us to pay a 15 dollar "Resort Fee" which they charge to everyone per day you stay there.  They said that the fee is for internet use, pool access, and fax use.  This would be reasonable if the POOLS WERE OPEN and their internet was only accessable through wired internet hookups.  All 4 of their pools were closed and they were unsympathetic.   When we got to our room, it stank of vinegar and we could hear the people next to us talking through the paper thin walls.  

We were constantly harrassed by employees trying to get us to participate in a timeshare presentation.   From what I hear, this is the new norm in ANY MGM owned hotel including LUXOR.   

The rooms were bare bones, and I even paid for a deluxe room.  It did not come with a microwave, fridge, or a view.  Instead I had a view of a parking lot.

Woke up to the sound of everyone slamming their doors shut as they left.  

We will not be back.  I will recommend to all family and friends that they stay in other hotels.

Stayed here this July for $33 dollars a night. I had better rooms, but you get what you pay for. We got good coupons (free drinks, discount off spa, and 2 for 1 on the Kings Dinner show). I suggest you see the Kings Dinner show; it does not have good food, but the entertainment is fun. The pools were shallow, and was really crowded when we were there. I think it was a great place to stay for the price I paid.

3.5 stars... i've stayed here numerous times throughout the decades...big castle-themed hotel at the beginning of The Strip...on the original 4-corners...the casino part is old now...not much remodeling...dungeon-feel...well, i guess that is the theme here... the midway is called Fun Dungeon, but not fun anymore...beat up & quite vacant down there these days...unlike Circus Circus, on the other end, who has expanded...

ROOMS  |  they did remodel Tower 2, "Contemporary Tower"...pretty decent...see my pix... idk about tower 1 cuz i haven't been in there for a lllong time...alwaz get my free upgrades...fyi, 2 L-shaped towers seems as if there are 4 actually... Tower 2 rooms have plush microfiber headboards, pillowtop mattress, stitched leather nightstands, big wooden dresser, 42" plasma tv, sitting area, spacious bathroom w\/ granite countertop & walk-in shower (no tub), etc...free wifi for up to 4 devices, domestic calls, etc...$20 resort fee & 12% tax...

rates are great for The Strip...even better if u get comped like me, lol... lil to no waiting in the VIP check-in section, compared to the long lines for regular registration...gotta love that...friendly receptionists too...i alwaz get checked in early, which is another plus not having to wait in the long bell hop line to leave luggage...

XTRAS  |  i've brought diff ppl to their din show, Tournament of Kings, at diff times b4...fun, medieval, knights, horses, jousting, eating w\/out utensils & drinking from goblets...would attend again...

i'd skip The Steakhouse at Camelot...their sister resto, Tender steak & seafood, @Luxor is wwway better!...

Dick's Last Resort resto seems like a lot of FuN w\/ goofy paper hats & all... there are a lot more shows & restos (casual tho) 2 consider...

lastly, seems like they have many pools, but i've nvr checked them out once during my many stays...nxt time maybe...
Could use a decor upgrade for sure but nothing went wrong. Cheap and I would stay there again because of the price but it's nothing special.

I wish I could stay I enjoyed my stay. Upon first arrival, all I wanted to do was get to my room and I got rushed by someone trying to obviously sell me, all I wanted to do was check in but she tried to make me feel like I was going the wrong way.  Felt like i was in mexico being stopped by timeshare people. Then the 2nd disappointment was there was no coffee pot in the room!! I cant recall ever staying anywhere that didnt have coffee. We drink coffee every day and the coffee they have in hotel was expensive. TV quality and selection poor too. I tried to save money by being at the end of strip but decided after its worth an extra 30 or more a night to be more central. The knights show is great I will give it that. We didn't go this visit but have in the past.
Smokey and old, but very nostalgic. I have to say I prefer some of the other hotels on the strip.

The Excalibur Hotel and Casino are typical Las Vegas.  Over-used and under-maintained!  Don't forget to add $16 a day for your "resort fee" and $8 a day for parking...just more ways to get into your wallet.  We had a problem with our door lock and spent over an hour sitting in the hall way and walking back and forth to the front desk (from the 20th floor) trying to get it corrected.  The "management" was so kind, they refunded one day of our resort fee!!  WhoooPeee!!!  I was attending a conference here and this was one of the host hotels so I stayed.  Not at all a good experience.

My favorite hotel we've stayed at in Vegas. 

We are frugal and always go for cheaper options but want to be on the strip. We stayed at another hotel Friday-Sunday but decided to extend our trip so for Sunday evening we stayed at Excalibur. 

Check in was super quick and simple.

Room wasn't anything fancy but in good shape. The bathroom was very spacious with a very large counterpoint which I really loved.

Has a nice food court and restaurants. 

I also liked that after a certain time, a security guard asks to see your room key before you get on the elevator. 

There's a walkway to Luxor which is really convenient and a monorail which takes you to a few other hotels.

We asked for late check out and got an extra hour for no charge. I checked out via an email on my phone and was emailed a receipt. 

Free parking (for now anyway, we were told they are building a new parking structure) and free wifi. 

Would absolutely stay here again. It's a lot closer to the other casinos and places we really enjoyed.

I can't believe the quality of this hotel. I arrived in Vegas on the 3rd of January for a convention and decided to stay at Excalibur. I was disgusted at the clenliness of the the rooms. I could clearly see that the staff does not take pride in maintaining the hotel. The first room that I was given was dirty and had hair on the shower wall, in the sink and under the covers in bed.  I called and they sent someone to the room with a key for another room. That room was also bad. Same issues with the hair and a ottoman with several stains on it. For sure the 3rd room has got to be better. No it was not. This room had part of a toothpick on the carpet along with long pubic hair in the bathroom. I was so grossed out that I grabbed my suitcase and went down to the front desk. I told the manager that the 3rd room was rely disgusting. His response was "so you want to check out?" I responded that most of the hotels are sold out because of the convention and I expected to stay here.  He asked me to back to the filthy room and wait for the housekeeping manager to review my claims.  I waited in the room and the manager and another guy came. They both looked at the issues and pubic hair and continued to apologize. She took pictures and said that she will bring up these issues at the next meeting. The thing that pissed me off is that the manager picked up the room phone and told someone that my claims are valid. Rely! It's 3:00 in the morning, all I want is a clean room to sleep in. I'm sure the person she was talking to was the rude manager at the front desk.  After a few moments they reprogrammed my key card and I went to the next room with the housekeeping manager. Thank goodness that this room was finally clean. I was surprised that the manager at the front desk was not experienced in handling this kind of issue. It was very disappointing after wasting my time searching for a clean room and being considered a lier that i was not ever contacted with a formal apology. My friend that was also staying at the same hotel was also dissatisfied with the clenliness. They could have done something to smooth this experience over but they didn't. Maybe this is expected and all the employees are suppose to disconnected from basic customer service.

Hate this hotel for more reasons then I have room to write here it's just horrible!!! From old stinky rooms to just everything! We've been waiting over an hour in the same spot at the valet line.  You would think they would be OVER staffed NOT understaffed on the weekend of the Mayweather and Pacquiao fight SMH...get your act together!!!!
I hate Las Vegas, but I sometimes accidentally still go, and Excalibur doesn't even have any of the things that I hate the least, like swankiness or remotely good looking people or a cool pool scene.
We stayed here our last night in Vegas. The room was decent, for the price. For $40 I wasn't expecting anything fancy. It was a room with a comfy bed and a bathroom. Not too shabby.

Worst experience at this hotel. Waited in line to check in around 10pm for 30 minutes. Paid close to $500 to stay there for the weekend because once we got there they hit us with a $30 a day resort fee and now parking fees (even though we are a guest at the hotel.) We were told there is no smoking in any of the rooms, but the entire floor smelled like weed 24\/7. Found ants the second day there and when I went to call to change rooms there was no menu options on my phone to call concierge. I kept getting disconnected and redirected to housekeeping. Finally went downstairs to to talk to someone about changing rooms and the line wrapped around the casino (I've never seen anything like it) we stayed in the room still. Check out day came around I woke up to ants covering both sinks, my hairbrush, and toothbrushes. DISGUSTING!!! I called concierge (waited on hold for a long time.) A very rude lady who said was the front desk manager told me she needed to look into it further because I was already checked out in their system. She also told me that I didn't make enough effort to reach out to them to tell them the situation and also insinuated I was lying. I told her I took photos and she told me she would need to see them as proof. I sent the photos to her and the most she said she could do was refund me the resort fees of $80. WOW!! I was amazed at how disrespectful she was and also was not willing to listen to the issues. Do not stay here.

Came here with my family when I was 16. It's great for families, especially the pool. Kids will love the pool with the slides. I do remember tho we requested non smoking but got smoking. After complaining we did get accommodated. Always affordable. Kind of on the edge of the strip. For families on a budget this place is great in my opinion. Right off the exit when you get to Vegas.

I've had been to Vegas a lot of times before and this time I was trying to be on a budget and decided to go w\/ Excalibur. It's a good location since it's on the strip and close to most things we wanted to be however, I "upgraded" to a renovated room in Tower 2 and it was seemingly nice but there were several things that bothered me.  For instance, there was only like 5 channels that worked on the tv. Granted we're not in the room forever so that's not too bad but I ended up getting sick towards the end of my trip so it was a drag.  Second major thing that bugged was how the sink in the bathroom wasn't even properly installed. The faucet wasn't even attached to the actual sink so if you nudge it it would move and possibly fall off. 

Besides that everything was fine.  The floor we were on didn't have a lot of kids and we were towards the end of the halls (another minor drag but it was the only one left) so we didn't hear much of anything.  Service was decent since housekeeping did keep the room nice and was pretty quiet when they did other rooms before ours.  Didn't really eat at the hotel but it's so close to MGM and NYNY so there's good food all around you if you chose not to eat there. We weren't there most the time so in general for the price it was fine

I realize that you get what you pay for, and Excalibur was for sure the cheapest place to stay on the strip during my last Vegas trip...but still.

They put us on the very first floor, 'cause we're high rollers like that, so we had the pleasure of seeing both ants in our room and a ROACH in the hallway.  Damn.  

Then there was the service.  We called the front three times in our two day stay: Once for more towels (which didn't come so we had to call again only to be told they would "check"), once to order room service (which took over an hour), and once for more toilet paper.  The last time we called, my friend said that the person they spoke with COMPLAINED that this was our third call...really???  Sorry you had to actually DO YOUR DAMN JOB...

Finally...the people that stay here are definitely the weirdest, especially the creepers that post up in the casino.  Oh, and there are lots of kids (it's a castle themed hotel with a jousting show, so you kind of have to expect this, but I like my Vegas sans brats).

It is seriously worth it to pay just a little more and stay at Luxor or something...trust me!!!

DO NOT BOOK ONLINE. THEY WILL TAKE YOUR MONEY TWICE. The week I was in Vegas they had the computer SYSTEM DOWN TWICE. Plus like many other reviews you see here, when you come home late at night your card key will not let you in the room. My friends and I were charged online via confirmation they could not check so they took our cards charged again, then charged us a third time when our key cards did not work late at night! Do not take this risk. Don't gamble on your place to stay.

The room was clean and that is really all I need in a room. 

However, since this is a "resort" on the strip I did expect more. which is why I only gave them 3 stars. The "Free WiFi" advertised, is only available in the casino and there is an Ethernet chord in the room. I brought only my phone so that didn't help me at all, who does that in a hotel? I have a complete understanding that certain charges are not within the hotel's control, but a resort fee should cover certain resort type of amenities. For example, WiFi, shuttle service and the like. Neither was really complimentary so it was kind of a bummer. A vacation is best spent out on the town, so obviously these things didn't ruin my trip, but they are certainly meant for conversation.

It is Beautiful and luxurious hotel. The room was clean, comfy and spacious. The best part of getting a room in hotel\/ casino is that you can play and drink all night and don't have to worry about getting back to your hotel. It's located on the strip which is prime location.

This place sucks the "upgraded" suites are decent but house keeping sucks. This chick came by twice and kicked us out the room both times so she could clean. Each time we returned the room was not clean. Currently sitting outside the room to ensure this time she cleans it

I am researching ticket prices for Tournament of Kings for our annual Holiday party. I google searched Excalibur, and clicked the direct link to Excalibur.com One the first page there was a link for BOGO (Buy1 Get1) Tournament of Kings tickets. Awesome, so I clicked the link and it took me to the site. Once I realized that on the site I could only purchase tickets from now until 11\/15 I decided to call reservations to see about purchasing tickets further in advance. 

When the female customer service agent answer the call she asked me in disbelief to confirm the website that I was on, informing me that they do not have a BOGO promotion. I read her the exact url address and offered to email her a screen shot. She was not listening to me and just repeated that they do not have this promotion. I am so tired of customer service people not listening or refusing to believe me. I asked for a manager or someone else that can help me. She put me on hold until a manager was available. At that time the manager informed me that after Nov 15 or 16 holiday pricing takes effect and the BOGO is no longer offered. 

1st, someone needs to educate the customer service representatives so that they have this information. All of this could have easily been avoided had she been aware of this information. 

2nd, I have lived in Las Vegas my whole life and I am very aware that holidays are often the slowest period for casinos, specifically around Christmas. So I find it very unlikely that they are not going to offer BOGO during this time. As a local, I feel it is incredibly rude and outrageous for the CS agents to be treating people this way. Unless the TOK is selling out each show, BOGO should be offered. Regardless I've already seen the show several times and will find something different to do with our office annual holiday party. Very disappointing, Excalibur, very disappointing.

I wish it was possible to give "0" stars. By far, the worst, most disgusting hotel I have ever stayed in. It would be one thing if the hotel was disgusting with a cheap price and excellent service but it was neither of the two. Stayed here for a "cheap" alternative while visiting for a bachelorette party. Did not even feel comfortable taking my shoes off in the room. The sheets had holes and stains and the furniture was older than I am. Disgusting.

I hated this place the whole time I was here. First of all, it seemed as if to get any where in the hotel, you had to walk through the casino and I went to other hotels and that wasn't an issue there. Secondly, the parking is awful. You either search 45 min for a surface parking spot or try your luck in the 3-story garage a mile from the hotel doors. Service was alright, wasn't rude and not a problem. Now, the room. The first thing I noticed was the smell. It is absolutely awful, it smells like stale cigarette smoke and must. If you could book a non-smoking room there wasn't a mention of it. There was no wifi and there wasn't a channel guide for the TV. The TV also was not even close to HD. The beds were hard as a rock and the blankets were thin and cheap. This hotel also has the worst dining on the strip. A dicks last resort? Really? I know most hotels had fast food courts but fast food seemed the best the Excalibur could offer. As for a view, you either pay more for one of the strip or you get the parking lot or a brick wall. Cheap, tacky decor seemed to be a big theme at this place. The only redeeming qualities was that I heard they had a DQ and their pool. The extra $40 for a different hotel on the strip is absolutely worth it. This place is essentially the Motel 6 of the strip. Just know, looks can be deceiving

Excalibur hotel - I must rant. I must - while I await my room service coffee (because there is no complimentary coffee in the "room") - so you pay $22 for 8 cups (Im sure they will be small. Oh - the coffee is only $15 - but there is a service charge and tax- of 4.50 and 2.50 respectively).
Then I can move beyond it. No really - I can.
Lets start from the beginning, shall we?
You cannot pull up to a location to unload your multiple bags and "stuff" - unless you pay for Valet Parking. Either you pay valet, or schlep your bags across a parking lot (that's if you can find a space) - and that walk could be anywhere from 100 feet to 3 blocks if you have to park in the "garage". Ridiculous.
Bags go one way - we go another. We are supposed to call when we get to our room, but the guy who unloaded the bags from the car gives me a "tip". "Tell the lady at the desk to call. Save time. Ok, buddy, thanks. Tip him. Tip the guy who brings the bags up.
Not 5 steps in the door we are greeted (myself, wife and wifes friend- both filipinas) - by a VERY friendly Filipino man - who of course latches on to the 2 Filipina ladies - like a long lost brother. "Ohhh you are filipino - let me get you some vouchers!" Takes us over to the counter where another guy with teeth and manner like Wink Martindale takes over. Now actually I am looking forward to this. I know its coming thanks to a friend . I am willing to go along with the three hour trip to see a vacation home - because she got show tickets, free dinners, and free airfare. So I play along. A long story short - I get nothing like that offered to me. I DO get offered $100 in spending cash, 3 show tickets (he sees there are 3 of us) for $105 - about a third off, and a future 3 day 2 night free stay at Excaliubur (yehhhhh - RIGHT - like thats gonna happen now.) I have to get him up to this offer...its not his initial offer
Ohh...coffee just arrived - "cash only, sir... they did not tell you?"
"Uh... no... they didn't." Give him 2 20's and he cant figure out the change- then he doesnt have it. I'm cutting zero slack by now. "Come back when you have it...meanwhile I keep the coffee."
He starts to leave with my $40. "Uhhh...no... that stays here. Come back when you have change."
Back to Wink..... I actually tell him I will do it - (I have not seen my room yet) - but he wants $50...cash...as a deposit. Offers to pay my ATM fee (thats big of you). but by now Ive had enough. He has looked at our Cards to see that we're married - verified income (very un-specifically, of course), gotten my email and a look at my DL.... I've had enough..... I walk.
Parting shot at Wink. Near the end of his schpeel - I say "How long will you be here?" He looks at his watch. "35 minutes."
Funny thing though.... 90 minutes later I walked out to dinner - guess who is still there? If he had caight my eye I would have called out something. He didn't. I didn't.
40 minute wait to register. I tell the woman "I was offered a room upgrade- and paid for it already." 
"Oh yes,sir... have it right here." Points to a picture... looking good. I ask for a high floor. No problem. 27th floor is newly renovated.
great...up we go.
I suppress my disappointment in front of the girls - this room is a dump. I would expect it in a cheap motel somewhere between Winnemucca and Wendover - not here on the Vegas Strip.
Far from the picture I saw there are fresh sheets and white comforter on the beds - but no colorful bedspread. The floors are carpeted in an ugly brown (Newly renovated? I think not). The bathroom is sparse - no extra lotions or conditioner like we had in Anaheim. No extra towels. And NO FRIDGE or COFFEE? This requires a phone call to which I am told "No rooms come with a fridge - that is an extra charge of $26 PER NIGHT!!"
Are you freaking kidding me?? A mini-fridge is expected. Its not something one should be required to ask about before arriving. Coffee too.
The brochures they leave you - room service menu, etc - is stained with previous food orders. Magazines have been used and re-used.
Oh...Julio just came back with the change. Counted it out like he knew what he was doing.
No tip... and honestly he didnt look like he expected one.

Looking over the room service menu - $18 for a fruit plate..$19 for pastries, coffee and juice- $21 for bacon and eggs

Oh... one more rant - "complimentary" wi-fi internet speeds below 10mbps

AND A $6.99 ATM FEE AT THE HOTEL ATM!!!
Very cool place to gamble with a variety of machines and tables. A lot of places to eat a drink.

Hotel & Casino in stile medievale, situato a una delle estremit della Strip, proprio di fronte al New York, New York. Le stanze sono molto spaziose, pulite e tutte, credo, dotate di 2 Queen bed. Possibilit di richiedere una stanza fumatori (lo sconsiglio perch sono le peggiori e situate al piano pi basso). All'interno dell'hotel, diversi ristoranti fast-food e qualche negozio. Wi-fi gratuito negli spazi comuni. Buon rapporto qualit prezzo.

Worst experience of my life, completely brought our Vegas experience to a screeching stop. 

Have stayed in better Motels than this one. The room smelled bad, carpets looked old and shabby, the toilet smelled. The towels were dirty. 

We Went to reception and spoke to manager and after seeing out frustration she moved us to better rooms. We were ready to pay for the upgrade. The upgraded rooms were better. 

But there was no coffee maker, no body wash or tooth paste. No nothing that a regular hotel would have. 

Response: Thanks for the room upgrade during our stay. But the room advertised that I paid for on website looked way better, it didn't show torn dirty looking towels, battered walls and smelly old room. Fix the ad images or fix the rooms. Please don't tell me that "you get this only for this rate. Else pay more and take an upgrade to better rooms.

excalibur is really really cheap now, as cheap as about 30 bucks for a non-weekend day, and even for weekends it's pretty cheap. you get what you paid for. it's pretty run-down and the service is slightly subpar. but it's really cheap and it's in a relatively decent location, next to luxor\/mandalay bay, across from mgm grand and new york. if you have a car and want to do vegas on the cheap (at least for hotels), this is not a bad choice. just don't get too upset when they don't make your beds

We stayed in a contemporary room. Room was clean, decent amount of space, bathroom is large. The casino area was laid back and not too congested. The staff I encountered were very friendly and accommodating. Easy access to other casinos and a good sized parking area.

Reservation representatives here r the biggest morons ever! I was on the phone for about 30min trying to figure out which room would fit my family needs better n I only asked couple of simple questions but, she didn't answer any of my questions n kept on talking about what restaurants they had n they have heated pool n things I didn't care about so, I just ended up hanging up on her. I'm sure she was probably still talking n reading casino features to herself even after I hung up on her...weirdo!

I was scared of staying here due to all the mixed reviews.. It actually turned out wonderful! Great value with a good deal :) it was clean, economic, good location, the staff was nice and had fun activities for our 6 year old. We stayed for only a couple of days for a weekend get away right before Christmas 2012. We stayed on the 20tb floor in Tower 1. I would definitely not let those bad stars detour you from staying here.

It's an old tacky hotel, who saw better times during the 20 years it's been in service. 

BUT the beds are comfy, the rooms are clean and there is a large flat tv screen and free internet. You sleep really well, it's not too noisy and it's in a perfect location for a ridiculous price. Oh! And they re-did their pool area which is large even though it's missing a little bit more shade.

OK, so check this out.  I know I have been long dormant with the Yelp reviews (bad girl, BAD GIRL!), so to make it up to ya'll, I am now embarking on a casino-by-casino tour of my new hometown of LV, NV, and will include reviews of each as I tour them.  Now, these will not include room stays, but just schlepping around the premises - eating, drinking, and checking out anything that moves or doesn't move.  Got it? OK, let's proceed...

Review #49:
why is it that the 2 remaining "family friendly" resorts (this place & Circus Circus) on The Strip are at the low end of the spectrum and future candidates for implosion?; the main floor, including the knights\/medieval theme, just looks tired and out of date; it is a half-step above Circus Circus however, for whatever that's worth; the 2nd floor with a few shops and a couple of decent restaurants at least looks semi-modern; there is a huge kiddie-city gaming area for all of your rugrats, that is fortunately on a separate level from the main casino floor; the parking is out of date too, with an uncovered hike from the garage to the casino; best craft beer bet = well, you can imagine, as every bar is the same here; but I did find one with a few craft beers (including Tenaya Creek brown ale), and probably best is the 2nd floor big sundries & liquor store which includes a few craft bottles to go

Staying in the Excalibur is like accidentally stumbling into the 1960s, when Camelot was on Broadway and empire waist dresses were really fashionable.  Except that was 40 years ago, and did I mention the hotel looks like it's been untouched since 1960?  To be fair, the cocktail waitresses' outfits remind me of the late 1980s, so that's a moderate improvement.  

The best thing I can say about the Excalibur is that it's cheap, and it's on the strip.  Those are two positive points (thus the two stars).  Oh, and there are two Starbucks in the bottom floor now - trust me when I say this is an improvement on the meager options that used to exist!!  

Sadly, I have to stay here for work every year so I will be back.  A couple of tips I've picked up along the way:

1.   There is always a line at the Starbucks in the food court, but there is NEVER a line at the Starbucks on the casino floor.  Go to that one unless you like excessive waiting.

2.  Speaking of excessive waiting, the first time I came to the Excalibur I was really frustrated that I couldn't get the "Express Check-in" kiosks to work.  I've found the trick.  There is an online check-in website where you can basically pre-register to check in - if you follow the instructions on the website, you'll be able to swipe your credit card and check in without waiting in the lines (which are ALWAYS ridiculous).  It doesn't work unless you pre-register in advance, but it's definitely worth it.

3. It's a lot more fun if you have a sense of humor about the ridiculously low-tech "light show" surrounding Merlin at the entrance, the dimly lit rooms, and the "tapestries" on the walls.  Oh, this also goes for any lounge or featured entertainment performing at the Excalibur (I'm talking about you, "Thunder from Down Under!")

Worth the money you pay.

The hotel is clean and comfortable and cheap rest. I like to save some of my money and I simply just came back to my room when sleep that's all. I spent most of my time in other places. 

When I was there they let's me checked out at 6 pm with no charge, that's so kind.

We paid for a Non-smoking room and what we got was an ashtray. 

If you love your lungs you will stay away from this cancerous castle.

Don't bother unless you are completely broke! I paid for an upgraded room and it stunk like mildew and cat pee. On top of that the carpet was damp. They moved us to new room..... It was freezing and tv didn't work. I fixed it myself. It's cheap for a reason. Casino smells like they over did it with air freshner. Overall would not stay there again. Tables are cheap and keys suck! Had to get new ones 3 times!

I loved the Excalibur!  I can't say enough about it.  However, if you don't like kids, then this isn't the place for you.  It's pretty much the only casino on the strip where you will see kids running around.  There is a kids section on the ground floor where there are all kinds of carnival games (and best of all - a DQ and Orange Julius *YUM*)

There are 4 pools and one of which is adult only.  The alcohol at the pool is very reasonably priced - which is very important - and there is no shortage of servers that will bring all of the food\/drink you can possibly consume so that you don't have to move an inch if you don't want to.  The vibe at the pool is a lot of fun.  When I was there, they tossed out a bunch of balls and everyone was playing with them - even the guys that were trying to Mack it with the ladies.

The casino has an awesome atmosphere to it.  The staff would greet us by our names, often times before we even showed our player's card - perhaps that says something about our routine - but I digress

Here's what you care most about - the room
The bed was very comfortable - The room had many upgrades, but there were some areas that weren't upgraded like the shower - but I thought that it was perfectly fine.  The view was OUTSTANDING!  We had a perfect view of NY\/NY.  The room was clean and without any problems.  Seriously though, how much time are you spending in your room in vegas?  The flat screen is a nice touch but again - who goes to vegas to watch tv?

Okay. The little ones thought staying at a castle was neat. Rooms are comparable to a Best Western or Super 8 in tower 1. Ours was clean enough,  but another family member got a very stinky room that the hotel seemed eager to help with. We also had decent service in requesting extra blankets,  but not very prompt. 
Tip -  there are several fairly affordable fast food place here. They are only,  like 1.5 times normal price while other hotels on the strip have some that are 2 to 3 times normal.

Seeing that this is an experience with many issues, I've tried to narrow it down and be as brief as possible as it spans several months.

From October 26 to 31, 2015, I stayed at Excalibur. On the evening of October 29 (technically the 30th since it was 1:00 a.m.), we were locked out of our room. The night latch had slid over and thus, we could not enter our room. I get this happens and we get into our room.  Then on October 30 at 4:30 p.m., my wife tries to enter our room and the same issue takes place. So, security is flagged down to try to help, but seeing that I'm not with my wife, they have to find me in the casino to get my approval to fix this issue and let them in the room. Now, again, I understand this, as frustrating as it was. It is at that time that security escorts me to the front desk. The person appointed to help out identifies himself as the Assistant Manager for the Front Desk. The security guard details what has happened and the Assistant Manager says "I'll call engineering right away". I'm left standing there for two minutes wondering what that means, but fine, he appears to be solving the problem. He returns from his call to tell me that someone from maintenance is going to be by the room to let us in and they will be "at the room before we can even get back to it." 

He acts like this solves everything, but how is this solved. I turn it back to him and ask how he can assure me that this won't happen again (personally, I thought I'd at least be offered another room) and his response is "trust me, the problem will be solved". I ask how can you assure me that given this is the second occurrence to which I get this doozy "here's my business card with my direct line. If you have this occur again, just call me and we'll fix it". First, where's my apology for this even happening. And then, how is it fixed if I need a business card from this guy "in case it happens again", when I'm told it's solved!! 

Granted by this point, I'm upset but I go up to my room and imagine this, no one is up there as promised. So I pull out my fancy card and call the Assistant Manager and wow, he doesn't pick up. It rings a good dozen times. Nothing. I hang up. Eventually a maintenance person does show up and he gets us in the room and removes the night latch so we don't have this problem anymore (why not do this the first time?).   After, I go back down to the lobby, find the Assistant Manager and confront him. "I just called and you didn't pick up". He then looks at his phone perplexed and says, "did you just call me now?" I say my two cents about how ridiculous of an experience it is and leave the area.  

When I get home, I send an email to Excalibur to outline my concerns as I'm still quite upset with what happened and seriously shocked it was as bad as it was.  After sending my email, Excalibur finally gets back to me in December with a phone call.  

In spite of it taking five weeks to get back to me, the person I deal with (the Director of Guest Experience with Excalibur) seems genuinely disappointed in the situation. She follows up our conversation by inviting me back to Excalibur for a complimentary two night stay in one of their superior suites and would provide me with discounted rates for any additional nights.  

You can't undo what happened, but this was a fairly nice gesture.   So, on March 4, 2016 I email the Director of Guest Experience with Excalibur as I am planning to go back to Vegas for a three night stay in early April 2016.  I ask her to let me know of the availability and what the additional cost would be for the third night.  

Later that day, I get a reply that says, "I have reached out to our room reservations department to check our availability and see how much the rates would be for the additional third night.  I should hear back from them either today or tomorrow."

Well, today marks exactly two weeks since I last heard from the Director of Guest Experience or Excalibur.  As a result, I've booked to stay elsewhere.  I'd rather have an enjoyable experience than constantly be marginalized by Excalibur.  It's now clearer than ever that the attempts in every situation to address issues is so unimportant to these people.  If anyone at Excalibur with a customer service bone in their body reads these posts, seriously consider having a real discussion with your staff about responsiveness and customer service.

Let's all look forward to some half-hearted reply post from Excalibur where they will sincerely apologize for the events that took place during and following my stay at the resort and also for the inconveniences experienced.  No doubt they'll promise to learn from this and enhance their performance.  

To those who read this post, to be fair I must say that much of the casino is just fine and it's not a terrible place to gamble or eat at, but if you run into any issues, don't expect help or any actual sense of care or response.

Parking sucks.  Rooms are outdated..  Place smells...  And who does not have a coffee pot in a room wtf!! Won't be going back there again. Plus I left my iPhone charger next to the bed and the housekeeper stole it because security could not find it when I called lost and found. Lame

So, first, this hotel looked amazing as we drove up. It was late at night and all lit up. Our kids were amazed! Then it kind of went a little downhill from there. We searched for a parking spot for a good 30 or so minutes. The parking, sucks. Then we walked through the very smokey (what's up with that?) casino trying to found the check in. The signage here isn't really that great, honestly. Then, waited in the check-in line for around 20-25 minutes. We were really surprised at the wait considering it was almost midnight. Check in was fairly easy. Finding our tower was a bit of a guessing game as it felt like we had to go all the way back across the casino again.

Our room was nice and large but no fridge or microwave. Which, okay. But there wasn't even a coffee pot! I think it's the first hotel we've stayed in that didn't at least have that. Our view was the roof. Not a super huge deal, until lights out. What was in the roof area were lots of lights. Our curtains didn't close all the way so we had bright lights staring us in the eyes as we tried to sleep. We were thankful it was only two nights of bad sleep. The room overall was okay but a little dirty.

The location was the best part despite the crappy sleep and dirty feeling room. It was a tram ride away from Mandalay Bay (we went to the Shark Reef Aquarium) and the Luxor and also connected to New York New York and the rest of the strip. It really was a pretty great location. I'd give it 5 stars location wise if I could.

This hotel is basic. It does have good qualities though. I doesn't smell like smoke! The pool area was fun and lively, but the pool could be cleaner. There was a lot of sunblock and debris. Dick's Last Resort restaurant is in there and it was hilarious! We did very quick and easy self check in and out, so had little interaction with staff. But, the bell service was good. Only real complaints, $15 daily valet parking, my BRAND NEW car was hit while in valet, and the valet guys seemed to drive quickly.

The service and check in process is so mis managed that it is unbelievable. I stay in hotels about 3 to 4 nights a week year around. I'm hard pressed to remember service as bad I experienced at this Hotel. I am so put out with this place. I have made it a point to not gamble or eat at any MGM property's.
My wife and I rarely get away and we saved our hard earned money only to waste it on something we were never informed about. Resort fee's that were never mentioned. Shame on you scum bags

First time in Vegas, wanting something cheap and clean, upon check in the person checking us in confirmed that we wanted a "non-smoking room". We didn't end up getting into our room until 7am and upon arrival the stench of cigarette smoke welcomed us, the bathroom door wouldn't lock, the button on the television to turn it on was broken and the water in the shower would not drain. I understand that it was cheap and old but it was absolutely disgusting. Upon checkout I mentioned the above to the receptionist, she had only this to reply, "some of the rooms don't even have comforters" with a tone like, "it could've been worse......piece of crap! they need to tear this hotel down because not only is it an eyesore, it's time has come and gone

Woww I simply just mean wowww, we arrived at Vegas for the very first time at 5AM, tired and just looking for a room to crash a few hours before heading out...No one prepared us for the craziness that it is to drive in Vegas, after one hour of reading signs, various, circles around the giant blocks, we found a place to park.
There are no clear signs of where to park or where the main entrance was and when we found the valet parking there was no one there to guide you or at least acknowledge your presence to this hotel, and not a single staff member outside to ask anything.
We were lucky my friend was there already and she kinda guided me of where to park.
After walking what seemed like an eternity in 30 something degree weather with a one year old and our luggage we we're guided to the registration desk at the other side of the hotel!
Upon arrival we we're told we couldn't get a room because check in is not until 3PM and they either way they were sold out! However for a nominal fee of 28$ plus the room at 150$ we could get a room at 10:30am; Whattt???!!! And
Since my friend was already there she offered us to crash with her and after the staff checking with them (good security point thety called the room first) they gave us a key to the room. 
With high expectations since it's you know VEGAS and our first time there tired but very excited up to the room we went.
On our way we decided to just drop of our stuff (since it was now 6am and my friend's family would still proably be sleeping) go eat and shop to let my friend and her family get up and about and until 10:30 so we could get a room.
After all that we came back and we're informed there we're still no rooms available so up to the room we went to plan out the day.
When finally seeing the room in daylight I have to say I WAS TRULY DISSAPPOINTED, the room was a non smoking floor and someone obviously ignored that, the room smelled of old and dirty carpet, the furniture is completely outdated, and so is the bathroom, the screw to the lamp my was so fragile my one year old manged to unscrew it.
*Sigh, I've worked in the hotel industry so I know what to look for in cleanliness, it was decently clean, the toilet is not often scrubbed since you can tell where the dingeness starts, the towels were decent, the bed was soft, the ac vent and the air vent in the bathroom we're clean, the shower was well scrubbed (We checked before anyone showered).
Tho the furniture is supposed to be mediaeval it was more dingy meets mediaeval, the tv had well no entertainment just your basic antenna channels is what it feels like, not great TV quality...I guess I expected more since it's supposed to be a Vegas hotel, after deciding this room was not worth the 100-and something we decided not to rent one there.
However the staff itself was always friendly and courteous.

: I spend most of my time in Vegas and I must say this hotel has served me well and right. Location is absolutely great, hotel staffs are friendly and very accomodating, summertime hotel price is an absolute deal.

It's 11pm and this has been sitting outside our door since we checked in at noon. All of the housekeepers ignored it. 

A phone call to the the front desk didn't do anything. My boyfriend went down to the front desk to ask to have it removed, but the manager simply asked what floor and walked away. At 10:30pm it was still there while a housekeeper cleaned next door. We moved the plate to the hallway so it was clearly visible and in the way... the housekeeper just pushed it back up against the wall instead of picking it up!

Everything else has been wonderful....We even paid extra to upgrade our room during checkin. I'm really upset however, that every staff member chose to ignore a reasonable request. 

Since no one at the hotel wants to listen I thought the potential guests of the Excalibur would listen here.

Pretty terrible overall. Paid for a room upgrade only to be placed on first floor with a wonderful view of a maintenance cart and some rocks. Luckily a manager was able to remedy the situation after I went back to the front desk and showed her the picture of this "view."

New room was better with a view but... deadbolt broken, black mold in shower, incredibly loud and malfunctioning AC, trash and someone's dirty socks left from past guest, and plastic wrap covering smoke detector. Maids were nice but did not do very good job cleaning. 

The main casino floor, which you essentially have to walk through, smelled terrible. Not typical smokey casino terrible, but a smell I can only describe as ass cheese. Visit here, and you'll understand this description. 

Other staff in bad moods that essentially asked for tips and were unpleasant when they then [unsurprisingly] weren't provided. 

Location is pretty good, and I appreciated the manager's help, but there is no way we will ever be back to this dirty ass cheese station. Look elsewhere!

This hotel is definitely not fancy or high class, this hotel is just average, and there's nothing wrong with average.

I've actually stayed here twice, but the second time I was here I had my room upgrade from the standard room to the widescreen room. I remember when I was here in November of 2008, they were doing construction on their widescreen rooms. I thought the room actually looked pretty nice, it wasn't anything spectacular. The room has a flat screen TV, and the bathroom looks pretty modern. 

Staying at this hotel is cheap, and if your plan is to party, then this hotel is perfect. You save money, and who cares if the rooms aren't all that, you aren't going to be spending time in the hotel very much! I was in the hotel room for maybe at the most 9 hours, and then I left for the entire day, and maybe came back to change.

Their customer service is horrible!!! I came to celebrate my anniversary here and regret it!!!! I paid extra for a late check out and had to have office escort me out... And I swore I saw mice in the hallway from all the food left out that the maids didn't pick up in the hallways... AVOID THIS PLACE! Plus the buffet is over seasoned shitty food...
Place ok. last time went there. they doing construction..ugh..put us on the bad loud noise...wasn't pleasant time

DUNGEON OF FUN REVIEW ONLY:

We came here hoping to play games and have fun with the girls since it was easily accessible via the monorail from our hotel. Uhhh....not happening. 

Game choices were not as great and limited. The prizes were a rip off--tiny trinkets or pieces of candy for 30 tickets?  So we told the girls we'd take them to Circus Circus.

Four stars because they showed us love during a hard time. Father was at a local hospital for about two weeks, told the representatives about our situation and they helped get us the best rates possible. I can't speak on any other yelpers' experiences of this place but mine. Room was acceptable. Nice gym and spa. Cool pool for the kids. Food just downstairs. Security guards a little too excited about their jobs if you know what I mean. Place is a little aged so of course it's gonna show, I think it's as old as I am (30). You get what you pay for, so if your a yuppie take you tail to the Wynn or cosmopolitan, that's if your willing to spend a pretty Penny. Otherwise have some realistic expectations and this place might impress you.

Really enjoy staying here. Our contact Chona Enriquez goes out of her way to make sure we have a good stay and find our way to some good events! Saw Shania Twain one night and the Eagles the following night. Outdoor pool is nice and lots of eating places nearby.

This was our first time staying at the Excalibur, out of curiosity. The parking structure is separate from the hotel and parking is $10\/night. It rained hard Friday night so we had to rush through the rain to the parking structure. The check-in line for regular guests took over 30 minutes! There were several people working though, and we checked-in fairly fast when we got to the counter. There are four towers for rooms and our tower was the furthest from the parking structure and the pool, so every time we had to come back or leave, we had to walk all the way through the casino. The good thing is this hotel is on the Strip so we were able to explore by just walking out.
ghetto hotel! cheap, dirty, and the food suck(buffet)...it remind me of East LA.

Maybe it's because we moved here from the San Remo (which was horrible), but the Excalibur seeed like heaven.

Excalibur has been around for awhile. That doesn't mean they don't know how to do business. 

Rooms are clean and appropriately decorated with tapestries depicting medeival themes. The standard rooms are nice, and basically just like they sound...standard. Bed, tv, desk and bathroom. 

There are two towers of the hotel but both are connected to the main casino. Unlike some of the newer casino\/hotels where you have to take a moving walkway or shuttle to the new addition. 

A great location (Excalibur is on one corner with New York, New York, The Tropicana and The Luxor on the other 3 of the intersection) and a great deal.

I was completely underwhelmed by the whole experience here. Not only do the machines pay nothing. But also I must have had my invisible suit on because not one server came by to see if I wanted a coke , coffee or beer. My room was OK, but the toilet in my families room next door didn't work and neither did their hair dryer for the gals. And even when I was leaving EARLY they wanted to give the money back but didn't even have a toll free number to call.

Stayed at the Excalibur for a convention and the experience was pretty good as far as hotels on the strip go. I got a very reasonable rate. The room was clean and the front desk said they had refreshed the Royal Tower a couple months ago so it would be nicer. Basic amenities were provisioned. What really impressed me was the service though. I needed som extra towels, toilet paper in the middle of the night. And each interaction I had with the hotel staff was friendly and proactive.

This low end hotel on the south strip is best known for restaurants.  Forget about themes.  They closed Lynard Skynards, which had the best ribs and they took away the smoked barbecue chicken at Dick's Last Resort.  They took it away because people freaked out about the pink chicken.  Those two restaurants were the main reason I stay here.   The hotel rooms are just blah at best.  The casino is ok.  They still have some video poker machines from the Reagan era.  Most Jacks or Better quarter machines are 7-5.  I've stayed here my last three visits to Vegas and it is time for me to move to a classier resort.  I may not even gamble here on my next visit.

Excalibur is one of the best values on the strip.  It's not the most beautiful or modern hotel\/casino, but for the money, you just can't beat it. It's as close the the central part of the strip as you can expect for what you're paying. The rooms are just ok, and they're pretty dated so if you're looking for something high end, look elsewhere.   I haven't eaten here, but for a place to lay your head at night I highly recommend it.   Plus, how many of us enjoyed the stories of Camelot and King Arthur as kids? It's kind of like being a kid again, just for a moment.

I'm so done staying here.
It's not the rooms.. You get what you pay for with those. A comfortable (yet dated) place to sleep right on a great part of the strip.
The reason I am never coming back is because of constantly being bothered by the timeshare people (or whatever they are selling) who hit you up every single time you walk down the hall to Tower I or Tower II.
I'm on vacation. I'm trying to relax. I don't need you to try and sell me stuff when I'm already staying here.
See ya, Excal!
This used to be one of my favorite places as a child b\/c of the Knights of Excalibur show.  Then 10 years later, I realized how tacky this place was but it's a good, cheap option.

I would give a 3, but this trip dealing with the front desk was frustrating. I had some resort credits that I received with my players card. It was not explained to me very well how to use them(put a credit card on file with the front desk, then charge the food to the room). This was not explained until the 2nd time asking about how it worked. 
When I finally understood how to use it, not many of the food places were set up to even charge to the room. I finally inquired again on who of the very selected few can charge to the room. After charging to the room, i found out that  buying a drink in a bottle was not included. This i feel should have been  explained to me from the beginning. The people that work in rhe restaurants dont even know. The money I spent on that drink although not a lot was not able to be fixed by a manager. Spent money i was not planning to spend. Knowing all This when i checked in would saved multiple trips and calls standing in line wasting time at the front desk and multiple restaurants. What a headache. 
Housekeeping was awesome as usual. Annoying time share people trying to give you shows are annoying and like vultures.

The cons surely outweigh the pros for this establishment.  To be fair I'll list the most obvious of both comparisons.
Pros:
Location
Price
Parking
Pool
Cons:
Room quality is subpar
Room appearance is misleading
Room smells of smoke,smoke,smoke
Room has no sound barriers.  You hear everything all around you including other guests.

Overall you may find it cost effective but personally I'd rather pay a few extra bucks for the satisfaction of having a cleaner more aesthetically appealing room and experience.  Room service prices were surprisingly expensive.  Restaurants were very limited in variety with the exception oh the Buffet.  Lastly, Unlike other establishments Excalibur is not a non-smoking friendly experience.  Our clothes smelled of stale secondhand smoke within moments of entering the Casino. Our room was tented yellow from smoker stains.  The white smoke detector was a deep dingy yellow along with the outdated popcorn ceiling with obvious nicotine residue plastered over it.

Spent a week playing the slots & keno.
Emi the keno queen is the best. 


We love playing here. All the keno staff is wonderful.

Mahalo  Stan :)

The hotel itself may be nice, but the "service" I received from Tim at the front "sea bar" jaded me from returning to this place. After throwing $100 into the video slot at the bar he approached us for drinks. We ordered two vodka and cranberries. To my surprise, he came back with a bill for $20. No problem, we will just blow the money  and head back to the casino floor. I noticed that the drinks were unusually dark and upon tasting I found little to no vodka. Isn't the point to Vegas to liquor you up so you dump more money into the games?!?! Guess this guy missed Vegas 101. I told him that the drinks were way to weak, to which he replied "I already put a fucking double shot in there" and yanked the drinks from us. He went and actually poured two doubles while staring at us, dumped them into a new drink and slammed them in front of us. Even though he was being a complete jerk, I threw down $6 for his tip. As the money landed on the counter he SLAMMED a shot glass in front of me with a receipt in it for me to sign ($0 total, I suppose he was doing it for effect). I hit cash out on the machine, picked up the $6 tip, and got the hell out of there. I will probably not go back to the Excalibur based on this. I would recommend walking down to New York New York. Much better service, and no "Tims" working at the bar.

Just checked into the hotel.  Sandra at the counter was nice and courteous!  Kudos to her.  

No wifi and\/or fridge in the room.  No wifi...?  Is LV in the 18th century?  They charge $16.80 for resort fee but I need a wired hook up via LAN?  Geez guys...!  Is wifi so expensive you can't afford to give your customers?  

Stayed here before and wanted to bring the kids back to the pool.  I would have stayed in Best Western or Quality Inn or Hampton Inn, but wife wanted to stay along the Strip.  Why...?  It's just not worth it and parking in these hotels along the Strip...is FREE!

Reasonable price, tho.

I will never come here again. I have so much to say about this trip and all of the things that went wrong from the very first day. Warning, I am going to write a book. 

Overview: All of my equipment was delivered wet, people were not helpful, contacting them several time but ignored me, etc... I don't have enough room to add everything so this is the short version.

We arrived at Excalibur on a Saturday, we had the bell person load our items onto his cart. Him & I loaded the items to the cart, we let him know which pieces were valuable so that he would be extra careful. Since I am a photographer and my sister-in-law and brother are videographers we have a lot of valuable equipment so we wanted him to know how important these items are to our livelihood. The bell person brought everything up and placed all of the items down. 

The next morning on Sunday we woke up, got ready to go to our conference called the WPPI located at the MGM. The WPPI is a photography conference that we attend every year. I picked up the laptop bag out of the closet and the entire bag was soaked, we had no idea how it got soaked but everything inside was completely wet! We then freaked out because we did not want any of our items to be damaged. All of the items in the laptop bag were DRIPPING WET! We went to the bell desk to let them know that the laptop bag was soaking wet and they left a note for the head bell caption, we waited for him to come for a little bit but we had no time to wait since we were trying to get to our paid classes on time. These classes are very important and we paid a lot of money to attend, we did not want to waste our money by not going to the classes. As soon as all of our classes were done we came back to the front bell desk to follow up regarding the problem. They then had the bell caption come out to speak with us, he said that we will need to put a security claim in so we can have it investigated. They then sent up someone from security to look at the situation and all of our wet equipment. He and I took photos of all of the equipment that was wet, I would love to add the photos I took but it does not seem to allow me. You can see from the wet bag laying on the bed how it was still soaked even after the entire day passed. We had SD cards has wedding videos from the weekend before which is worth thousands of dollars and not to mention memories that could never happen again. Once we put the SD cards in the laptop it gave us the error shown in the photo. The videos are a part of my sister-in-law's & brother's portfolio, worth thousands of dollars and their reputation, she freaked out once she saw these error. We wrote out an incident report for them. He said he will write the report and have it in by that night and to call tomorrow morning. 

On Monday  I called the security at 10am to find out an update and they did not have any news yet.

On Tuesday I called the security again around 10am but no answer.

On Wednesday. We were there from 8am to 10pm attending all of our registered classes and events, after our classes ended we went to go get something to eat. We walked back to our hotel room at 12:00am midnight and were startled to find a big blue loud fan in our room facing the closet. I found my $500 Ice Light turned on. 

We have called several times to check the status of the incident and left messages but they do not care about their customers. I didn't even get an apology which is so crazy. This happened in March and it is now June and nothing has been done to this date. I would recommend that you do not waste your money here because you could be spending thousands of dollars worth in the end.

IMO, this place is a step up from Circus Circus. The place is family friendly and has something for everyone to do. 

The price to stay at this hotel is VERY FAIR. If you compare it to many other hotels, you would appreciate the price of Excalibur. Of course you're not sleeping in 5 star rooms, but they are more than comfortable and as I've stated above, they are a cut above Circus Circus. 

All the staff on hand are very friendly and the random characters walking around the hotel were humorous, to say the least. I haven't done the the "Knights of the Round Table" thing or whatever it's called, but it's something I wish to do when I come back just to see what it was all about.

The hotel is right on the strip and with the tram stopping at the Excalibur, navigating around the strip from here is not a problem at all.

So why three stars and not anything higher? When you compare it to Circus Circus, yes I believe it is a significantly better hotel\/casino. If you compare it to the other big names on the strip (Wynn, Caesars, The Rio... blah blah) it doesn't compare. Of course those places cost an arm and a leg but you get what you pay for. 

NOTE: Getting "knighted" while drunk and having your friends post the embarrassing moment on youtube is very unappreciated. If I was any more belligerent "King Arthur" could have sliced me in the neck. =\/

Zero stars!!!
What a terrible place. The BAD attitudes of the cocktail waitresses, grumpy dealers, the pit boss was a total Biotch --- shocking how angry everyone was!! 
On the flip side -- the restaurant 'Dick's' was so FUN!! The smartass attitudes was so funny!! I think the hotel staff should put an application in to work there. 
Also.. The checkin was about 150 people -- it was insane!!

If you go into this expecting "old Vegas" and nothing extravagant, you shouldn't be disappointed. It is not a new or flashy hotel, but they offered us a free upgrade and great service while we were there.  Was is the Venetian? Absolutely not! But we also payed 1\/5th the price for almost the same Vegas experience. 

Pros- easy check in. Upgraded to king room for free. Friendly service at the "shops" concierge table and housekeeping. Within walking distance to most areas of the strip. 1-2miles isn't a terrible walk. Uber and Lyft are great options. $5 to Bellagio\/Cosmo\/Venetian\/etc. still cheaper than booking there. 

Cons- nothing fancy, smells like Vegas, "value" customer so you are gonna get all walks of life. 1-2mile walk to "new Vegas" 

Overall it was a great stay and great hotel for our first time in Vegas. Knowing what we paid for, I would give it 4 stars easy. Most people will rate it 2 or 3 cause they want to pay Excalibur prices but get Venetian experience. 

Can't wait to go back!

This hotel & casino wasnt so bad.
Near the strip and it was cheap.
As long as theres a casino downstairs im all down for that.

I've been to Vegas dozens of dozens of times. First stay @ Excalibur was this past weekend, April 27 for 4 nights (quick girls getaway).... Yep, we were looking for cheap - both accommodations (seriously, how much time do you spend in a room anyway?) & lower limit craps helps......  I really don't have many complaints.   

Arrived around 3 pm on a Friday (I'd assume that is near a prime check-in time) & yep, there was a line but it moved pretty well. We were given 2 bed room, as requested in Tower I (later was told Tower II is nicer, so......). Went straight to our room, it was acceptable. Had view of Tropicana, nothing special but I guess better than a brick wall.  Yes, the room was dated (old carpet,bedding, furniture) but it was clean. 3 girls in 1 room, it did have something we needed:  a large bathroom! Single sink but large space with long vanity for all our stuff.

We were in our room for maybe 3 minutes before heading out. 

The next morning, our entire hallway reeked of weed. Cannot totally blame Excalibur for that, but still........  

My 2 girlfriends went to the pool & thought it was fine (went to the adult only section). They were there way early (9:30 a.m.), stayed for a couple of hours. Said by the time they left, people were stalking them for their chairs because it was so crowded. 

Left note for housekeeping requesting additional towels, which was accommodated. 

Didn't gamble @ Excalibur at all until late night Saturday & it was great. Friendly dealers (I only play craps).  Other patrons playing were sometimes a little shady; not unexpected at lower limit tables. 

Rented a car for a drive to Red Rock Canyon (cool, btw). rental car service @ desk was easy ....walking to the parking garage & the garage itself:  sketchy, ewwwww.....

Tried to use free drink coupon @ Sherwood Forest and was basically duped. Guy totally saw my coupon (and consistent with a lot of others, he basically ignored us as long as possible & then was pretty rude). I order vodka tonic & when we handed, said I could not use coupon for Absolute. I never requested Absolute. So he told me I had to pay for my drink....  Bait & switch. I should have been more assertive but didn't want to make a scene over $10 in front of my friends so I let it go. 

At checkout, another long line. I opted to just leave.  I emailed to request a copy of my bill, which was promptly sent & was accurate.  

All-in-all, I didn't hate Excalibur (& I've stayed in fabulous places worldwide). I didn't eat in any of the restaurants, I only gambled there late night as we were coming home....  I found it to be a great bargain for on the strip & is worth checking out if you want nothing but the basics.   Biggest complaint is the $15 resort fee for pretty much nothing:  no one WANTS to honor the coupons & there is no wireless.
Hotel room really clean all staff have nice attitude .for 5 dollars I upgrade the room for a bigger room !!!

What a horrible experience! We have been waiting for 3 hours for the checking line to get shorter! This is ridiculous, if they know that they booked this hotel to the max, then have the capable staff to run it.  Unbelievable.  DO NOT COME TO THIS HOTEL! Waste of time!. Vacation time is precious and Excalibur does not get out!

This place is pretty much a dump. I'm sure kids would get excited to stay in the castle, but adults really have no business here. I went for a $5 table and ended up playing with complete trash... you get what you pay for I guess. Avoid this place.

This place has gone downhill over the years and is in DESPERATE need of a remodel. Popcorn ceilings in the rooms, dark\/dingy hallways, tacky old decor and signs, NO free wifi, lower class guests, overwhelming cigarette smoke smell, I could go on and on.

The fact that they charge a $15 daily resort fee and don't offer anything but a free newspaper, erks me. Even the airport offers FREE wifi, but not Excalibur.

The in room safe (the size of a shoebox) didn't work.

NO bathtub (and this is a hotel geared towards KIDS!) Shower only. 

Wall\/window A\/C unit. Window had NO VIEW.

I wish I could give a better rating but sadly I won't be returning because of the downhill slide this place is on. =(

The staff were always friendly, and helpful based on the staff attitude I would of given them a 5-star rating. However the cleanliness of this hotel is very questionable. Drinking glasses sat in our hallway for literally days. Our garbage can wasn't emptied at one point for 3 days and they would let the empty drink cans sit in our room. We had to call to get housekeeping to remove empties and garbage from our room. I would also like to see a major chain like this to start putting recycling bins in each room.            The food court had a decent selection but always had issues with Popeyes. The other locations staff were friendly at the Pizza Hut and burger place.

I had a very good experience at Excalibur.  Clean room, reasonable room service.   The casino was also well kept and most staff were friendly.  I appreciated the easy access to traveling between the Luxor, and Mandalay Bay!

Just came back from a pleasant three night stay at the Excalibur during CES. I saved tons compared to some of my colleagues who stayed further up the strip and still got a clean, quiet and comfortable room. The room had everything I look for including a comfy bed, convenient nightstand power, decent TV channels (no HBO or Showtime though), iron, hair dryer and plenty of drawer and closet space. The bathroom, however, looked a little dated especially the shower but it was quite large not being paired with a tub and very clean. 

I stayed in the resort tower which was convenient to most everywhere I needed to go including the bus pickup and tram station. My room was on the 22nd floor and overlooked NYNY and MGM. The Excalibur is also a straight shot from the airport. For CES, it had a bus to the show and badge pickup to boot. 

Front desk staff were friendly and efficient at checkin. I didn't run into too many other staff members during my visit. Their sports booking room was weak though and I ended up going to the much nicer one at Mandalay to place a couple of bets. Ended up eating breakfast twice at of all places Johnny Rockets right there at the hotel. Good food at reasonable prices and short lines.

I recently stayed here on one of my layovers on my flight back to hawaii.  I often stop in Las vegas and usually stay on the north side of the strip.  I ended up finding a great last minute deal here and thought I would try it out.  I loved my stay.  The hotel is close to the airport, my room was clean, and the location was nice.  But... the reason I am writing this is because of the biggest reason why I loved my stay:  

GILBERTO!!!  He was the lovely man that checked me in!  He is the cutest thing ever and was so welcoming and sweet to me!  He was professional but also welcoming and social and really just a breath of fresh air!  It is because of him that I decided to stay again on my way home.  I travel a lot with work and I will now be using Excalibur as my bi-monthly stop because I loved his service so much!  For the record, he wasn't working on my second stay and the lady that checked me in then was also amazing and super sweet!  I wish I remembered her name so that I could give her credit also!

I just hope that if the managers\/owners read this that they let Gilberto know that he is doing a great job!
