When we opened the door to our room, it smelled of fast food hamburgers, not the best first impression. Our room basically hadn't been updated in decades - burnt orange carpeting, noisy air conditioner probably older than me, loud buzzing from the fluorescent light fixture in the bathroom etc. We had a lovely view of a cinder block wall. I was surprised that this place was a MGM property.

The hotel itself gives off a dingy, Super 8 vibe. Most of the restaurants are fast food or Dick's Last Resort and Johnny Rocket's which are a pure tourist traps. (avoid!) They have an arcade area called the Fun Dungeon downstairs (for the kids I guess). The Excalibur Buffet was pretty good, it has been remodeled recently. It was very clean, food was OK, good value if you are famished. There is a Starbucks and Krispy Kreme for breakfast on the upper level which was nice. 

The pool area was a good size and not too crowded. There were plenty of lounge chairs for everybody. The hotel is conveniently located on the south end of the Strip, and there is a walkway to NY NY, where we spent way more time at. 

I thought the staff were very nice and helpful, much more so than I've experienced in more fancier LV hotels. Our cocktail waitress at the Lounge was really great, she deserves a job at a much better place imo. The room cleaning staff kept our room really clean and were friendly to us.

Overall it wasn't my cup of tea, basically the only time we had spent there was to  sleep and shower. If we hadn't got such a deal I would have been gravely disappointed.

You get what you pay for. In this case, perhaps a bit less. Unless you're interested in deeply smoke-filled casino areas. I experienced much better ventilation in all the 10 or so casinos I stepped foot in during my 4 night stay.  Also, the hotel room's toilet flushed extremely slow. Even Imperial Palace had power-assisted toilets. The food variety at the various restaurants in-house were dull, and the buffet was no better than a Hometown Buffet (not a compliment for those that like that place). Unfortunately, convenience played the key part in why I chose one of either McD's, Pizza Ht Xpress, Quiznoz, Krspy Kreme, or Round Table Buffet. 20 yrs old facility going on 50. At least my inspection of bed bugs came up clean. Oh, didn't mention the $15\/night Resort Fee for I believe the pool\/spa use, and the WIRED internet (no wireless available) both of which I didn't use. Who can really enjoy a pool that lacked trees or shade. Tropicana had a better environment for their pool area. I barely spent 5-6 per day in the room, but next time I'll still pay $50-100 more for a trip if it keeps me out of the Excal.

Well let's start this with a saying...YOU GET MORE BEES WITH HONEY THEN WITH VINEGAR.

Well Excalibur is full of vinegar and the honey said I am not staying here.

Let's start with

Check in....one of the few bright spots.   Line was long but moved quickly and they opened more spots to help customers too.

Room-  Oh man where to start...look at the pictures.  The fire alarm was broken and hanging ( you shitting me?!?!).   see pic.  There was pubic hair EVERYWHERE.
See pic.   The alarm clock broken (it was right once a day at though 12:01. See pic.   The safe...unusable ( shows error and lock mechanism engaged )  See pic.  There was smears on the wall.  Looks to be dirt (hopefully it is but looks like previous Picasso used the wall instead of toilet paper.  The smell...oh yes let's not forget the smell...it was a mix of smoke, B.O., cheese, and something else....let's call it saddness.   I have NEVER been in a hotel room this bad l well that is not true.  There was a motel downtown that the meth users stayed at was a step down.

Customer service-  HORRIBLE could not describe it.  Call the front desk.  We can't help you...you have to stay there (Thx !!!! love being in dungeons and forced to stay because you can't do anything)  My health and safety doesn't matter...nor do laws it seems.   I will sleep in my fire proof suit and air mask I brought with me....oh wait I f@$king didn't bring one.   Go to front desk.  Oh sorry we can't help you either you have to stay there...very nice.   You guys are a joke ...maybe a call to the local Fire Marshall with the attached picture will get your attention.

One bright spot was the Tournament of Kings.   Love meeting the actors after and taking pictures with them.   

So lets recount....Excalibur can careless about you.   Tournament of kings is good.

Good hotel if you're watching your piggy bank. As the 3rd southern-most hotel, It's not too far off the center of the Strip. Room was clean and everything was in order. The hotel has a decent food court (esp if you're looking to grab something quick for breakfast), but the bars are mediocre. Service upon check in was good!

The casino has an old appearance, decor. No cofee maker nor ref in the room. The servers in the casino are slow and sometimes they dont pay attention to you as you call them. Not so happy with my 3 night stay.  I wish the satff would be more like wear a happier face as they perform or work.

I was in town for a work related conference and my boss recommended this place so I booked it.  At first impression I thought I'd hit the jackpot as it looked kind of cool and maybe a place I'd come back to with the family.

The room was spacious and clean and I appreciated the safe.  Came equipped with all the stuff you expect at a casino resort.  Plenty of towels and consumables as far as soap, shampoo, etc.  I was really jazzed.  I threw my luggage in the room and had to go check in to conference but noticed there was the constant "beep" of a smoke detector which I called in and it was resolved by the time I returned a couple hours later.

When I got back to relax for a while I opened the blind.  Really?  I got a view of an alley and a place employees sneak a break or something.  (This must be where the major machinery of the hotel was too as there was a constant machine noise that I drowned out by running the AC on 60 the entire time I was there.)  

After closing the blinds on the depressing view outside I sat down to get to some quick work done using the WiFi which is included in the resort fee.  Then I started to really get annoyed.  The tablet would just sit there spinning trying to connect, my phone (which got no Sprint reception in this area of the resort) connected once, then was booted from WiFi and could not connect.

When work traveling it is *very* important for me to maintain connectivity.  I ended up spending 45 minutes with a tech that night trying to point him in the right direction on the issue (the irony is I was in town for one of the world's largest data networking events).  He was confident he fixed it and told me to "give it time and try again".   Poor kid was just following a script that didn't account for local issues with the AP, but I digress.

So, I would often have to take my device somewhere to check on email, etc.  Sometimes this would just be another area where the WiFi did connect for me (somewhere else on my floor to make sure I had nothing important, or downstairs to complete if I did so I didn't look weird sitting in the hallway on my tablet.

On checking out I wanted some sort of credit since this was a major inconvenience and the girl asked Enrique who rolled his eyes and made me feel like some sort of idiot.  Thankfully she went and asked someone else and I at least got a one day credit of resort fees.  My advice to have someone go up and check out the wireless device serving the area of my room seemed to fall on deaf ears too.

This day and age you would think that guest connectivity would be a big deal but maybe they want you in the casino or something.  But, this was a real pain and I missed being able to have a Facetime with the wife and kids too.  May seem like something minor to others, but it was a big deal to me.

I guess if I were to put this in the running for a family vacation I would want to verify that I wasn't going to get stuck in a room with the same depressing view and noise level and I would verify WiFi was working in the room before I got settled in  or I would bring my own Cellular based access point (but it is annoying to pay for something and not get it.)  

The location was nice, the smoke wasn't as bad as the casinos I stay at in Reno, and it seemed to be very inclusive.  It's really on the bubble and maybe after the sting of this trip's inconvenience isn't fresh in my memory I'd visit again.  After all, if I had a better view and no WiFi issue I bet I would have fell in the four-star "I'm a fan" range for my visit.

Over Labor Day weekend, we stayed here for four nights.  And it was better than what I had expected.  It had been remodeled since I saw it last.  The room was spacious and the pillows were comfortable.  Other than that, it was like any hotel room.  Nothing special.

The casino I feel has the worst ventilation system of any of the hotels I have walked through.  I felt like just walking to my room made my clothes reek of smoke.  I guess I am just used to Chicago with their smoke-free restaurants and bars.  

I did like the pool area.  They have 3-4 pools with one of them having a slide.  It was nice cooling off in the water and just having down time with family.  

Would I stay here again?  Probably.  The value is too good to pass up and seriously, most people don't stay in the rooms very much. It's pocket friendly which I am always a fan of.

Ahh Vegas... where the rooms are dirty and the casinos are... well... dirtier. I've been a pretty big Excalibur fan since I was a kid. Of course the reason has changed but I still get sucked into the "being in a giant castle" idea even as an adult. 
My room is almost always pretty clean. I can handle pretty clean opposed to really clean. Why, you ask? Because the room is cheap cheap cheap. I just payed $40 a night when the next closest on the Strip was around $70. It was totally worth it.
They also know how to bust through a line. Since I drive down from SLC, I get there right around check-in time pretty regularly. Usually, the line has 50 or more people. That is also disappointing to walk into after a 6 hour drive... But the staff handles it well. I waited no more than 10 minutes in a line I thought I'd wait over an hour in. 
Once we got to our room, we had no real complaints. Didn't smell great, but everything seemed clean. Besides... we didn't spend much time in the room anyway.
There are several bars and restaurants on the first and second floors to make everything nice and easy. They also have a 24\/7 convenient store as well.
I also enjoy that there is a direct walkway or tram to New York New York, Tropicana, Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Very easy to get from place to place.
This isn't a 5 star hotel, so as long as you can remember that, you'll enjoy it.

Not enough parking, no parking for guests. They charge $25.00per night for a refrigerator in room
Drapes don't cover windows so early morning sun wakes you up at 6am, don't plan on sleeping in late. Trucks start delivering at 4 am and there back up alarms are a wake up call. They don't comp anything. Over priced fast food court. The selection and food is better in New York New York 
Right next door.
We also had $100.00 worth of clothing removed from our room. Housekeeping said it was an accident and our dirty clothes were thrown out with the trash, after a day of searching for them a front desk supervisor called me and agreed to pay for the lost clothing. Watch the housekeepers

We stayed here last weekend and it was an ok experience...but everyone  be carful with valet here...I parked m y car with them all weekend only took it out twice and noticed when I got home that my back bumper was scrapped which I know wasn't there before I parked valet. Looks like they parked another car too close. This car is brand new, so I'm kind of bummed! Self park if you can!

Umm...this place looks a like Roundtable Pizza from the 80s.  Or maybe a bowling alley.  Maybe a dragon will come burn it down and it can be replaced by something less cheesy.  The wizard has definitely left the building.

The weekend rates were super cheap. (Sign up for the mailing list before you book a room!)  Check-in was fast and painless.  The rooms were so-so. The old furniture is ready to be donated to the Salvation Army. The shower was clogged with hair.  The elevators took forever (when they worked).  The casino floor was a bit depressing and so were the people playing there.  It was still less ghetto than Imperial Palace or Circus Circus.

On the positive side the staff is very nice and it is close to NYNY, MGM, Luxor, and MB.  So if you don't mind walking you can save a few bucks by staying here.

You lied to me Lori! I never heard a word from whoever the fuc* you said would talk to me. You fucking think it's alright to invade someone's room who checked in and it would be ok to pack my stuff so I can get it later? I'm so fuc*ing mad at your low class hotel and I'll tell everyone the bullshit you put me thru - got to guard my belongings!!!!! Thieves!!!!

This is such a bad hotel and their service is horrible. The first night of our stay there were blood stains on the sheets and we requested to have he sheets changed only to find out that they weren't changed but just flipped over. This all happened this past weekend and our first room also had a bed bug infection and we were all bitten up pretty badly. When we brought to the hotels attention they changed our room however when we requested our money back they sent us a statement saying that they would be denying over claim even though they had a security guard take pictures of the bugs and all of our bites and they wouldn't cover any possible medical expenses if it came to that. It's such a hassle having to deal with poor service when dealing with a "prestigious" hotel. Will never stay here again.

If I could give this place no stars I would! Everything that could go wrong with a room went wrong! First and for most we were upgraded for one of their new "contemporary rooms" with "pillow top mattresses", let me tell you how much that isn't true! Those beds are so hard it's like sleeping on the ground!!! After complaining and them trying to tell me these beds are exactly the same as MGM (which is a lie) they took off the upgrade fee. But then the next day at 10am the fire alarm in the room started beeping cause it needed to be changed, the tv stopped working and the blinds broke!!!! To top it off we had the NOISES people above us stomping all over the place!!! This place maybe cheap but just know you get what you pay for!!! Stay at the Tropicana instead! Maybe a smaller hotel but rooms are WAY better....what a disappointment to my 3 day vacation!!!!! Do yourself a favor and look else where unless you don't mind the discomfort then this is place might work for you!

For a cheap, budget hotel on the strip, you cant beat it. Not classy, not super clean, but you know what? It works if your plan is to not stay in the room much. Its on the strip, tram to luxor and mandalay bay, and walking distance to most of the major hotels.

I booked a room at the Excalibur because of the insanely good rates. $30 for a Wednesday $40 for a Thursday. 

Upon arriving we were greeted by a friendly valet and a bellman who took our bags. 

We checked in and were upgraded two levels for free! Once in our room we called for our bags and they were delivered within 10 minutes. 

The bellman was extremely friendly and helpful. He took a moment to familiarize us with some of the hotels secrets and was on his way.

The room was large and clean. The bathroom only had a shower but that's OK. Who wants to take a bath in a hotel bathtub anyways!

As far as the casino is concerned it's not my favorite but the table stakes are decent and the poker tourneys are fun.

The best part about the Excalibur is it's location. It is central to just about every good part of the strip. For the price and value, you really can't beat a stay here!

I was EXTREMELY nervous to stay here after reading all of the bad reviews and pictures of bed bugs BUT we had a great stay here! I am thankful for the reviews that weren't overly dramatic because they all mentioned they stayed in tower 2, so that's how I knew to ask for that tower.
Yes it is an older hotel and needs a face lift but we requested to stay in tower 2 which is newly renovated (for around $20 extra a night, I don't remember the exact price) and I really had nothing to complain about our room. We always prefer for our room to not be cleaned each day so our personal property isn't messed with so we just left the do not disturb sign on the door and we had no issues with any maids cleaning our room. The hotel does have a smell of stale cigarette smoke but the rooms don't have that smell at all. 
Room service is VERY busy and prices are higher but it's expected. There is a good variety in the food court to get you by and a couple restaurants you can choose from. 
Be prepared for this hotel to be constantly busy and packed with people and kids since it is a popular Vegas hotel for families. The pool area is nice and there are 4 pools, but like I said prepare for it to be very packed.
Bottom line, if you want a decent nice room ask to stay in tower 2 and spend a little more. If you're willing to take a risk don't pay to upgrade.

Having worked in a hotel for many years, I am very selective that I get a 5 star place while not paying a 5 star price. I know, keep dreaming. Well, I went to Vegas from SD last month and I couldn't believe how clean and fresh this place is.  The first thing I do when I get to a hotel is a inspection for bed bugs. 

I turn the mattress and boxspring around and I look for blood drops or fecal matter. Then I take the headboard off the wall and look behind it as well as take all the pictures off the wall and look on the backs of them. 

My room was extremely cheap and it was truly what I considered to be a 5 star place. 

the only drawbacks are that to get on the monorail, you need to venture to MGM (not as close as you may think) which sucks at 3 AM when you are wasted trying to come back to your room. 

I am going again in April and I am planning on either staying there or debating staying at the Flamingo only because its closer to the center of the strip.

This was a nice hotel and great location.  We stayed in tower 1 and thought it was just fine.  Only had a shower, no tub, but not bad though.  Quieter than others we've stayed at.  Loved the show!  We would definitely stay here again!

We stayed here because it was cheap and family friendly but I admit it is the first time I ever saw people counting out change to settle their bills. The staff is nice and the entertainment concourse is excellent -- particularly if you have kids -- but on the down side the decor is showing its age and we all came down sick immediately after our stay (low grade not feeling well). Good location and very affordable but if you can afford to stay at a better place on the strip, my advice is to do so.

Proclamation to all of the strip: Hear ye, hear ye...if Vegas is the city that never sleeps, why pay so much for a hotel that you do not intend to be in and that you only go to so that you can change clothes?

Come spring break (slash economic recession) some friends and I decided to venture out to Sin City. Now, trying to spread our budget thin amongst clubs\/drinking, we were not looking to spend much on lodging. 

Badabing, Badaboom. $35 a night to be 20 stories high on the strip...doesn't really get much better than that. Free drinks included? Why thank you.

Honestly, if you do not intend to be in your hotel room pretty much ever (therefore overly aesthetic touches are not necessary), the only reason I could think you would want to stay at a more expensive hotel would be the pool. Granted this pool is no Mandalay Bay, it actually is spacious\/sunny\/large and perfect for your next-morning hangover rehabilitation station. 

Oh and it has been deemed the "softest tables" in Vegas, so you actually have a chance at winning here...not to mention the 24-hour food court near the casino which is always a nice saving grace coming back from clubs!

The rooms were comfortable enough...Big enough bathroom for a few girls to share a room...on the strip...a steal considering the price...Yeah, it fit our needs quite well.

Hotel: I came her for the memorial day weekend, I was trying to have a good time in Vegas without spending an arm and a leg for the holiday weekend. The Valet line was extremely long, there was a lot of waiting just to drop the car off. Has the MGM Signature scent when you walk in which is a great thing. The registration line was fast and easy. I really couldn't hear the lady who checked me in though, I had to ask her yo repeat herself several times. Also the registration desk are very close together, I felt like me and the other guest were standing shoulder to shoulder. It was easy to find the room. It was clean but, old. The bathroom had stains in the toilet and on the tiles. The bed was comfy and the pillows were great. They had a couple of chairs in the room too which was a good little bonus. 

Spa: I called a head of time and booked a Spa package for $145.00. It was a 25 minute Swedish, 25 minutes facial and 60 minute Pedi. They asked me to arrive 30 min in advance to feel out paperwork, which actually only took 5 mins. I got a tour, which was really nice. The spa is nice period. However they were obviously understaffed, not that I already couldn't see that but the girl at the desk in the waiting room had discussed it with other coworkers in front of me. She didn't have anything positive to see about the situation. I showered and waiting in the waiting room for about 25 min. The massage therapist came and got me and told me that the massage was only going to be Back, neck and shoulders. Ummmk, it would have been nice to have been told that before but whatever. The massage was OK, it wasn't wonderful and I definitely could have taken a taxi a few block away and gotten a  better massage from massage Envy for a 1\/4 of the price and double the time. She took me back to the front where I waited for my other services. I waited 30 mins for the lady to come and do my pedi. It was nice. I have no complaints with that part of the package. I was taken up to the front again where I waited another 30 mins. Since it was taking so long I asked how much longer I would have to wait, the front desk person told me that I only was scheduled for the two services.....ummm.. OK what about the facial?!? After she took 15 mins figuring out why I wasn't scheduled she came back and told me that there has been a "Mix up" and the first front desk person didn't provide a "card" to the person providing the facial and that is why I was left out of the schedule, so  her manager can either schedule me later on that day to get one or provide a refund. REFUND please! I was there from 9:30am-2:00pm just for two 25 min services...come on! At that point I was starving. I went up tot he front and wasn't really given an apology, they just processed my refund and said thank you for coming in. Ummm yea, no need to thank me, I won't be back. Ever. 

Pool: After eating I went to the pool, it was crowded given it being in the middle of the day and a holiday weekend. I immediately went to stand in line for a drink. While in line some guys said they were leaving and had paid $40 for the chairs they were sitting in and wanted to know if i wanted to sit there. I was like SCORE!!! being that I wouldn't have had anywhere to sit other wise. I got my drink and went and sat in their chairs. i sat there for about an 1.5hrs relaxing and enjoying just being out in the sun. At 5:40 a hotel service dude came and told me that i wasn't allowed to sit there without paying the $40 and that I would have to pay or leave...um...the pool closes at 6pm (In 20 mins), REALLY you're going to kick me out?!?! I told him that the guys that paid for the chairs for the whole day "gifted" them to me, but he told me that wasn't allowed. OK I guess I will have to go, because I am NOT going to pay $40 to sit here for the next 20 minutes. I understand them doing business and sells seating areas around the pool to guest that have already paid to rent rooms... I get it but REALLY?!? 20 mins, I mean come on its not like i wasn't a guest at the hotel. Whatever... 

Over all, when I think of hotels on the strip, this isn't the worst one. Honestly, I wouldn't stay here again. its old, and not my style. At the same time I don't like the idea of spending three times as much to stay up the street at a newer hotel as much as I go to Vegas. Sometimes I have to slum it, but I wouldn't slum it here again.

My fiancee now husband only stayed here because we got married here. When we walked into the hotel room and it was supposed to be "remodeled" but only certain rooms and certain towers so that was the start of the trip. 

The wedding went off great i would suggest the chapel to anyone and the catering to anyone they are one amazing staff. the food for catering was amazing. But there is always a reason why the  rooms are cheap. 

As you walk through the casino from your rooms you try to get talked into a time share and these people dont know the meaning of the word no. or leave me alone. 
We got married on a saturday. Sunday morning we had a late appointment to get our photos so we left a few smaller items in our room. 

We came back into our thinking they would their. We were wrong. Not only did they check us out, they took our stuff we left behind. the list of belongings: 

Tiara
Champagne
Wedding Cake Topper 
Wedding Cake to save for one year. 
Picture Frame with our engagement photo in it with signatures around it

So not only when did we approach the housekeeping about my cake that was in a cooler full of ice, they said they threw it out. Who does that? how do you not look in it and see it has something inside it? It has meaning. Then when we went to the supervisor to check out all she could do was "comp" my last night there. There is no way she could take the pain away  of what her dumb staff did. 

When i asked for the GM all she did give me was the GM over her and not of Excalibur. they had no right to go into the room to take my belongings and throw them away. I was lucky enough to get a new bottle of champagne from the chapel.  and they had my tiara and topper on a shelf on their cart but the fact of the matter is they went in our room check us out without us knowing and took our things and assumed stuff that had value and meaning and trashed it. 

I will go to any lengths to get my point across that this is messed up. they had no write to do this to me. or to anyone for this matter. So you can comp my room but it cant bring back the memories that were taken. Yes it was just a piece of cake but it had meaning.

So the staff was not helpful. the dont care what your issues are all they care about  is how many people they can get into their hotel.

A million times NOOOOO! This hotel is freaking nasty. I don't even want to know what the stains were on the bedding. We booked 2 rooms online. When we checked in we were told we'd have to wait a little since the rooms are not available yet. This was at noon. 20 mins later one of the rooms were available so we went on up. The AC unit was broke in our room and everyone knows how hot it gets in Vegas during the summer time. We waited and waited and waited some more for our 2nd room to be available. Come 6pm we went down stairs to cancel the room because it still wasn't available yet. We were leaving early the next morning and I wasn't going to pay full price for the room. Decided to go down to the pool. DISGUSTING!!!! omg such a nasty pool idk if they hadn't cleaned it in a while but getting in and having a million of other people's hair wrap around your fingers and toes is so gross. Worst Vegas hotel I've ever been too.

I am a fan of The Excalibur. When my husband and I are in Vegas we like to eat and sleep cheap 90% of our stay and enjoy a splurge or 2 because of the money saved. 

The newly renovated widescreen rooms are comfortable, clean and enjoyable. The staff is accommodating and pleasant. How much time do you spend in your room when you're in Vegas anyway? Lol
I stayed here for the first time in this hotel and it will be the last time I loved the receptionist everyone was nice. But I found bed bugs on my bed and my husband got bit so kind of disappointed.

- Excalibur attracts a less upscale clientele but it's good if you know what to expect.
- On Sun\/21 Apr roughly 4 pm my friends wanted to play here for the $5 minimum craps and I was content with the $10 minimum blackjack (they had $5 tables but then the blackjack paid only 6-to-5 instead of 3-to-2).  
- Dick's Last Resort bar has cheap drinks and is pretty fun.
- Excalibur has an excellent location near MGM, NY-NY and Luxor properites.

The only way to describe Excalibur is, Gross. I read the reviews before we booked our stay here, I wish I would've taken them seriously! I kept an open mind though, since we wouldn't be in the room very much. NO! It was disturbing. The room in general was dingy, with wallpaper peeling and filthy carpet. The bathroom looked stained, as in everything that was supposed to be white, held a yellowish tint. In the actual hotel, everything was dirty. There was trash on the ground, I tripped in two different holes in the carpet on the casino floor. I felt like I couldn't touch anything, for fear that I would need a tetanus shot. Not to mention there are many hidden fees! This really annoyed my boyfriend and I. When we booked our room, we were told the cost for our 3 night stay would be $315. At check in we were told it was actually going to be $430! For resort fees, hotel utilities, and parking. Why wouldn't they just tell us that at the time we booked our room? If it weren't for the fact that this all took pace on July 4th, and every other hotel was sold out, we'd have gone elsewhere. I would recommend staying at NYNY or MGM across the street, Excalibur is just awful. I wish there were a "zero star" option!
I had to go here for a tan and its disgusting  !! YUCK... I feel bad for the people that were staying there .. carpet was gross, the rooms were gross.. I felt like I needed a shower when I left..

I brought my daughter for the night and first pool closed too early especially for a kid friendly hotel. The rooms were clean but had stains on the top cover! And as for the arcade a lot of the games were not working. As I checked out went to get my car from valet and noticed that they charge $13 dollars per day for parking . I payed a $30 resort fee on top of $13 dollars for parking. I will not be coming back here. There are too many other hotels to choose from.

DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!! Someone broke into my room around 5am and stole a purse that was two feet from me. CREEPY!!! Woke up to someone slamming the door shut, walked to see and my door was cracked open. Scary to think someone was in my room while I was sleeping. Security came in and told me the door doesn't close unless you pull the knob up!!! Front desk never mentioned anything and there was no notice on the door! Security showed me how the door doesn't close!!!!!! If they know it is a problem, WHY NOT FIX IT!!!!! This IS NOT THE ONLY TIME either!! Scroll down to read other reviews!! I wish I would have!! I WILL NEVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE!!! Seriously only rated to leave this to helpfully save others the fright and frustration......

Our room was an upgraded to Tower II because there were no non smoking rooms available in Tower I, which is what we had booked.  Room was clean and nice. Casino was pretty gross and VERY smoky. However, staff was so friendly and helpful that it was easy to overlook. I would stay here again and just gamble somewhere else.

For the money, the room was better than I was expecting after having seen Imperial Palace's rooms for only a few dollars less. The bed was comfy, the tv was nice, overall very clean. The pool was nicely renovated, although, there are many better to be found. The hotel overall looked tired, but not worthy of being demolished.   

Excalibur certaily falls short when it comes to service. The entire time of our stay ( a holiday weekend) only one elevator was working for our entire tower's side. Then, one evening, no elevators were working and everyone was forced to climb as many as 8 flights of stairs. To me, that's unacceptable, regardless of how cheap the rooms are. Charge more and fix your equipment or offer some sort of compesation for asking so much from your guests. I know when I book a hotel I am not expecting to be climbing stairs to my accomodations. The front desk was less than interested in offering a solution to this issue. 

My adivice. forget Excalibur and go to the Flamingo for about the same price and btter everything. I wish harrah's hotels offered the packages like MGM does!

One of my conferences was just held here at the Excalibur so I decided to book the accommodations here as well so that I didn't have to wake up butt early somewhere else and cab it here.

This place SUX!!  I spent quite a bit for the room which suct even more.  I was expecting at least a tub to relax in after a long day of speakers and I couldn't even get that.  They were all showers!!! Sucky.  Anyhow, I was upgraded to Tower 2 (which is the newly renovated wing of two) which was nice.  The carpeting was clean and well kept still which was a relief.  The room lay out itself wasn't that bad either.  The sheets looked semi new, mine had a cigarette hole in it - GREAT!  But they looked like Target bed sheets - i guess contemporary? HAHA.  I did get a really awesome view of the freeway and the pools.  They just remodeled that as well.  Since I didn't get a tub, I was gonna hit the pool but the stupid place closed right after I finished my seminars so I looked for the jacuzzi.  Apparently you have to go to the SPA to use the facilities.  I was like ok... sure... but there's a fee of $20 to use it ... so I was like forget it ... I'll just hit the gym....THEN they told me that the gym was at THE SPA and I still had to pay.  This pissed me off. 

YOU HAVE TO PAY FOR EVERY LITTLE THING HERE!!!
$1 phone access per day regardless of use.
$20 for the SPA (jacuzzi, sauna, gym, steam room, etc)
$10 for internet per day

Also I went to the MIDWAY to kill time.  And as we all know it's for KIDS!!! But what the hell does it smell like a GERIATRIC WARD?!?!??!?! Confused the heck out of me.  Hahah.  I chilled a little btw workshops and just headed out of there.

Good thing is that is a "DICK'S LAST RESORT" which is happening.
Anyhow, good to know that this is here.  Don't stay here, unless you get it comped.  It's pretty Ghetto.  You can put in a couple bucks more for something a lot nicer like Monte Carlo.

Worst place to stay I recently stayed four nights come to find out I was getting bites all over my body from bed bugs management haven't returned my calls made a police report room was infested with them don't stay at this hotel!!!! or be expecting bugs to bite u too. Six floor room 6142 has bed bugs

First off. Checking in earlier costs money - $20. 
Second - The minute you walk-in through those doors be prepared. There are people peppered all over on-location on the ground floor that will walk right up to you, trying to get you to come to the concierge desk so that they can sign you up to visit the time share. It is annoying (to put it mildly) - they're like sharks feeding on their prey! There were three of us - and they got us onto the desk (we haven't even checked in!)
Even after seeing the timeshare - we were still hounded by these sharks when they see us coming in and out of the hotel.
Third - the room is not horrible but it's not great. I inspected the bed and immediately had to call house keeping to change the sheets (stains and rips on the cover!). We also needed to call them again after finding out the bathroom does not lock. Horrid. 
They need to change\/ update almost everything in this hotel if they want to keep their customers.
Fourth - concierge is only open from 10am - 10pm. Las Vegas is a night place... why is the time not accommodating to their guests? Then again, it's better than the 8am-8pm at the MGM concierge.
At 2:11am we woke up to a blaring alarm. It turned out someone pulled the fire alarm. While I don't mind that, I do mind it when the alarm keeps blaring non-stop for 10 minutes! Once that alarm is resolved they blare an announcement saying what the alarm was for, and blaring it 3x.
And...... the walls are freakin' thin. We could hear this couple gettin' it on. I was tempted to time them...

First of all it is about expectations. If you want to stay in a five star hotel it will be nicer, but be prepared to pay the extra bucks. The Excalibur was inexpensive compared to any place, the pools were fantastic, one with waterfalls and a slide. The rooms were big and we had a great view of the strip. We loved being close to Mandalay Bay and NY, NY. The Food options were good for us. The furniture in the room and the decor were older and dated, but the beds were new and comfortable and the television was big--although the cable channels were limited--unless you like Friends and Full House which seemed to be on all the time.

Remind me of the TV show Good Times! Nasty-azz projects, waiting for the elevator each way for 20 minutes even the staff was complaining.  Room smelled like pissed & the sheets were dirty. Ask for a new room and front desk ask for another $20. Ha! NOT! You got the wrong one! When the bell boy came up 45 minutes later we finally got to a more descent room after 3 hours at arriving at this thieving rat-hole. Too many hidden fees, had the nerve to call this piece of $h*t a resort.

So first the valet was full crazy busy took a while to get a room. We finally get room and there was 3 roaches in the room running around like if they were having a party not kool super disgusting and there was no comp soaps

For one of the cheaper hotels it wasn't bad at all. The first room we got looked dated and had a view of a wall (tower 1). We got it exchanged and was moved to a MUCH nicer and more modern looking room (Tower 2) with a great view of the strip. The new room was also closer to the pool area and gym. The beds are comfortable, the bathroom was well stocked with towels (2 girls in one room), the TV was cool (not that you really need it in Vegas) and the staff was helpful. Overall I really like it here. Just make sure you get a room in Tower 2. Tower 1 looks very dated and tacky!

from the looks of it outside and inside. this place needs some remodeling. the smell of the cigarette is almost  palpable due to the place being old. the casino floor is the biggest offender. the room though was very surprising. the A\/C was working well, the beds were comfortable enough, the bathroom was clean and nice looking. i think they remodeled the rooms instead of the casino floor. i liked that they had a food court if you ran out of money to spend on buffets and restaurants. i guess i won't mind staying here again when i got to stay for free.

Terrific service at the Excalibur particularly the wonderful Amanda at the front desk who put up with the babble of two travel weary business nerds and was kind enough to give us an upgrade. Also thanks to Ron who brought my baggage to the room... I feel like a jerk because I forgot to bring cash to tip, which he certainly deserved.

Me - "We would like to check out, please."

Front desk lady - "Okay...let's see here...wait a minute.  The computer shows you just checked in two hours ago."

Me - "That's right.  And now we would like to check out."

Front Desk Lady - "You know, you still have the room for until tomorrow at 11 a.m."

Me - "Oh, it's okay.  We're done with it.  It served its purpose."

Ahh...the plus side of recession...

We really enjoyed our stay here and the price of the room couldn't be beat.  Our room was nice and very comfortable.  The bed was awesome!  We liked having the food court close by.  We found the casino itself to be pretty easy to navigate through.  They let us check in early and checking out was a breeze.  The only downfall to this hotel is that it is kind of far down on the strip.  It can be a decent hike to get to other places.

It's a bad 80's relic much that song final countdown (every time I think of this place the song pops up) but much like the song it's love to hate. I think they need to re-style it like TI (Treasure Island) to make it more hip to today's younger crowd because the thunder down under ain't cutting it. But the rooms are nice but you miss the nice view you might get from any strip hotel. I love the buffet they have. For my personal taste I don't like cheesy medieval stuff.
Its nice place, especially for people who love spa.

I think people judge the Ex too harshly.  I've just returned from my first stay at this hotel, and I think it's a great place to save a little money and still get the strip experience.  It isn't luxury, and the rooms are a little super 8ish, but our room was clean and every employee we encountered was pleasant.  I'm sort of the opinion that in Vegas there is luxury (Venetian, Bellagio, etc) and then there is everything else (Bally's, Barbary Coast, Luxor, Trop, Ex, etc).  If I'm going on a weekend or during a major event, most of even the less-luxurious properties go for around $200\/night.  Why not save a few  dollars?  I used to turn to the Trop for savings on busy weekends, but no longer!  At least the Ex has plenty of video poker machines at the bars and is willing to comp any drink (Trop only comps drinks up to 7.50 - No long islands!) and is a little more centerally located.

I agree with the other Yelper on here who mentioned that "one gets what one pays for." This is definitely the case with Excalibur. We stayed here with a group of friends who refused to stay somewhere else and pay a little more.

Honestly, I had no choice. My boyfriend wanted us all to be close together instead of staying at different hotels. Given the fact that I had already stayed at Encore prior to this visit to Vegas, I knew I would be in for a great disappointment. Obviously you can't compare the two hotels since they are not on the same scale.

The rooms are old and the bathrooms feel like a hospital's bathroom. My clothes and everything in my luggage smelled like the room: musty, old, and just nasty. We got a room on the first floor with a view to the sidewalk as people walked by.

If you're going to Vegas on a budget, then I guess this hotel is good for you. Personally, when I go to Vegas, I like to splurge a little and stay at a nicer hotel. It makes me feel like I am really taking some time off and going on vacation.

Also, this hotel is one of the first ones on the South side of the strip. It is far from everything so bring some walking shoes!

The pool area is gross and the water was cloudy. 

I won't be back even if I come with friends. They can stay here if they want. I will stay at the MGM Signature across the street.

Stayed here Sunday - Tuesday. Was here for the rock n roll half marathon. 
Check-in: not so smooth. It's not cool to go check in and learn that you don't technically have a room guaranteed at 3p check in but sometime between 3-5. This was not okay because we wanted to check in and get to our race. They did have rooms available to check in for additional $10\/night. We went with it because we needed to check in to get ready for race and additional $10 was fine. Just wish it was more clear, and it was booked via Expedia, so maybe not the hotel to blame. 
The updated room: was fine, nothing mind-blowing, good room for the price in Vegas. Pretty big room, 2 queen beds and large bathroom. Was clean. No microwave or refrigerator (additional costs). 
Main floors: casino area was pretty big and standard to other hotels. It did smell of smoke and eyes would burn after awhile. Plenty of food options. 
Depending on the next trip, I would consider staying here again.

The Excalibur is good for an upgraded premium room, the other rooms really show their age. The casino and pool area are both large, well maintained and fun. The buffet however i would run from if i were you....seriously its THAT bad! Dicks last resort, however is worth checking out. The bars in the casino are very expensive, but you're on the strip what do you want? The pool is worth mentioning again because it really is very nice....the hot tub feels like youre sitting in a small box in the middle of the pool deck.

The place was clean and decent for the price.  My bf and I stayed here one night on our grand canyon trip.  Las Vegas is a nice stop back to civilization.  We basically stayed in our room and just watched TV and slept.  Excalibur does give you drink coupons though.  We missed out on that.  It is conveniently located on the strip.  Our hotel room was nice and clean, but it was rough around the corners.  For instance the lamp shades were bent, as if someone had a party there and this was never fixed.  We stayed in the newer renovated tower, which was okay.  For the ~100$ we spent for a night it was a-okay!

Cheap, old, dirty. The only reason I am giving it two stars is because of the location. But you get what you pay for. The pool was nice and I recommend renting a cabana for the day. The beds were hard and uncomfortable but tower II is probably the easiest as far as in and out goes.

Not one of the better places to stay on the Strip anymore.  When I was younger, I thought it was great.  Nowadays, I'm not too crazy about it.  I have not stayed overnight here in over 12 years, but I have been back multiple times just to visit.

The positive things are the following:

1.  It looks like a castle (which is still cool after all these years)
2.  They have the Tournament of Kings (Dinner Show)
3.  The Fun Dungeon (I enjoy playing games)
4.  Room rates are affordable
5.  Nice location

The negative:

1.  The ventilation is awful.  
2.  Casino is more smoke filled than most other places on the Strip
3.  The place needs to be upgraded 

If I was on a very tight budget, I'd probably stay here again to see how the rooms are.  From what I hear from my friends who have stayed here recently, I won't be.  They said their rooms were old and outdated.  Okay, I've only heard it from two friends so that does not make a consensus.  I do believe them though.

I'll still come to visit the Fun Dungeon especially when we have nieces and nephews with us.

Wow has this place gone way downhill. We have come here twice a year, every year since 2006 and today was the first time I had horrible customer service at the check in desk. I should have gotten her name, but I was shocked by her sheer rudeness. She refused to check us in because we were in the "wrong line", even tho my friend was being helped by another clerk at the same line and that lady check her in. She actually took my husbands Players Card off it's keychain and didn't return it to me. "You've been downgrade a status so this card is trash." I asked her if we still had a reservation since she's telling me she won't check me in, she says "Oh, you have a reservation, I just can't check you in here." That's a straight lie since my friend just got check in at that very desk. We probably won't be staying here after that.

good prices on gambling; however this is not an upscale hotel but seems that the prices are a little too much for it's surroundings. They got rid of the Quiznos in the food court which really was a terrible choice... That was the only place I went to eat... 

Pretty clean place to roam around and good location.

I shouldn't even give this place a star! If it wasn't for my friends make up to fall behind the TV stand we would of not seen the bunch of roaches; it wasn't one roach it was more then ten. Never again staying here

I have stayed here once before and everything was ok, besides our original room wasn't cleaned and looked like ppl were still staying in it, they gave us a new room and our trip was great. HOWEVER this trip was way different, we arrived on Wednesday 3\/5 and checked in no problem. Well my fianc went golfing Thursday morning and took a shower before he left, I woke up to the worst smell ever. It smelt like nair and something burning all at once. I thought at first it was maybe the fan or something so I didn't say anything. I took a shower on Wednesday night and to my horror it was the water that smelt like. Thursday we went down and let the staff know, then went out on the strip. Well we got back late and found a letter saying that the problem was fixed by some one. Well of course I tested it, and surprise it was still smelling like death. At this point I'm upset because how has house keeping not noticed this smell. My mother in law walked in on Friday and asked me what that horrid smell was so I told her. Well she was even more upset and concerned about how safe it was to shower. A plumber came on Friday night and said it was the smell of sewage, so im thinking great I was showering in that. He said he just needed to use drain cleaner and everything was fine. Well woke up late sat and had to hurry off to the race track, came back sat to shower and the smell was still there, it actually got worse. I got nauseous everytime a shower was taken due to the smell. I actually was thankful that we had booked a couple of rooms for family, that I ended up showering in another room sun because I just didn't feel clean showering in the sewage smelling water. They never moved us or anything. Stay away from room 27-1-47 or you will smell like sewage the entirety of your vacation.

Kind of a dump compared to most of what Vegas had to offer. Barely a step up from Circus Circus. But you get what you pay for and if you are looking for affordability, this place is actually a great option. You can stay a week here with perfectly acceptable no-frills accommodations for the same price it would be to stay a night at one of the high end competitors.  And if you don't plan on spending much time in your room--and who really DOES that in Vegas anyway--Excalibur can be a good choice for you.  Keep your expectations low and you'll probably be pleasantly surprised.  I was.

We arrived at 11am on 4\/22\/17 and got a our room really quick and the lady at the reception was really friendly  elaine( I think) when we went to our room we noticed a food tray in room 16157 we left to the pool at 1pm and the tray was still there came back at 5 still there left at 7 still there came back at 2am still there woke up got some coffee at 8am and the tray was still there so I decided to call guest service they said that they were sending someone but housekeeping just kept kicking the tray around to make the long story short the tray was picked up at 11am on 4\/24\/17 the 2 Sars go for the lady at the check in

The Excalibur (basically at the end of the strip) could be better but it has always met my expectations. I've stayed there 3 different times because the pricing was good for what I needed (but I have stayed at expensive hotels on the strip so I have a good idea of amenities to value ratio). For the price and the amenities you get its worthy to look into, especially if you have kids and you need an easy place for them to hang out at downstairs. 
1. Low cost rooms but clean and everything worked.
2. Security at each tower for your safety. Nice touch and they were friendly too.
3. If you or your kids like arcades, show's with horses, Medieval Castles? Here's your place but don't expect its all magical cause its a bit old. They are trying to fix the place up bit by bit but its a big job and again, its a very low cost in comparison to many strip hotels. The Tournament of Kings is a really fantastic show and a must see for visitors. The hotel offers 2 and 3 for price of 1 deals often which is a great deal.
4. Other cool hotels and shops are within a nice walk (New York, Mandalay, Luxor, MGM, M&M shop, the Arcade Shop (where there are tons of great arcade games), and a few others.
5. The casino floor is nothing original. Its a big place and its not easily marked so you have to get used to where you're at so you know where you're going. Pool area is exceptionally nice when its open.
6. Staff were cool and I had no issues with check in or out. Parking was very good.
7. My daughters are 15 and 18 and they liked Excalibur better than the Luxor, the Flamingo, & the Sahara as far as the lower cost hotels go. Next time we are staying at Planet Hollywood though as we want to be in the center of the strip and willing to pay more.

So if your budget is tight then take a look at this hotel as its likely to suite your needs.

Just got back from Las Vegas and a stay at this place.  Our room was in tower one so that is what I am going to rate.  Basically this was a MOTEL 6.  The room had a old smell to it.  The bathroom was a disaster.  The shower head was old and needed to be replaced.  I hope the renovated rooms are better.  If you go, ask for a recently renovated room if there is one.  The carpet is the old green hotel carpet and it was in need of cleaning.  I will not be staying at this hotel in the future.

Worst hotel I have ever stayed at. I made a room reservation through the phone and I was told that the room I was booking was a remodeled room and had new decor and the sells person made it sound like a beautiful room. They lie on their website and on the phone because the description of the rooms doesn't match the reality of it. My room was one of the " new \/\/ remodeled "  rooms and it was horrible. The decor looked very old and it was all scratched up, the carpet looked old, the bathroom and room in general was not remodeled as they said it was. Additionally, when I went into my room the bed wasn't made properly, the control-remote from the TV was missing, there wasn't any towels, the room smelled horrible and within the first 5 minutes of my check in I spotted a huge cockroach on the wall near my bed. The lack of cleanliness is very evident in this hotel. I spoke to the hotel manager as soon as I encountered all of these issues with my room and she had horrible customer service. Even after the explaining to her the issues she seemed as if it was nothing unusual and just gave me a couple dollars off my stay. I do not recommended this hotel, I had a horrible experience and it's not worth your money to come to this one. I rather pay more for a clean one. Will not ever come back to this hotel.

Avoid if you can. My husband and I were only in town for the night and flying out early the next morning so it was at least a place to sleep. That's about all the good I can say sadly. 

It is the most confusing place to find where to park. Unless you pull up at the front with all the taxis, you enter at the back and have to haul your belongings through the casino to check in. The line to check in is extremely long so get ready to wait. I suggest check in without your luggage. 

Once we got through that ordeal we rode the elevator to our floor and were greeted by extremely dark and depressing decor. You'll feel like you're in a medieval dungeon that's for sure. Be prepared for smoke even on the non-smoking floors. It's everywhere. 
There is no tub, just a large shower. 

We checked in rather late and in doing so missed our room service opportunity. Room service here ends at 2pm and their food court isn't something we desired. So we exhaustedly trekked over to New York New York to find some food which we did. 

Given the options on the strip we won't likely stay here again but it served our need for sleep, it was clean and had an okay view of the strip. I'd rather spend a little extra and enjoy where I am.

First time I came here and I was impressed with staff and reservations center. Check in lady which I forgot her name but really helpful. Andrews was also helpful. Room was specious and very clean. Housekeeping are very friendly. They would great me every time. Also the buffet was great. Thank you to all the staff!

Not exactly the lap of luxury but it is excellent for people on a budget.  This hotel is clean it's on the strip and you are not gonna go broke.  In Vegas you don't spend much time in your hotel so why not.  The rooms are an ok size and clean, bathroom is nothing to write home about but it gets the job done.  Would I stay there? Probably not but I would recommend it to anyone that thinks paying for a luxury hotel room is overrated.

Used to be fun but has become a total dive
 Casino: is old with 
of heavy cig smoke and no ventilation. Everytime you turn around these used car salesman harass you trying to sell time shares. 
Food: Dick is fun and "Taco" makes it great but the food is horrible and way over priced.
Pool: What a dump!! They even try to charge $10 to guests to use the miniature "adult pool" We tried to get 2 VIP chairs with an umbrella and were quoted 3 different prices.
Room: Old, Dirty, used up. We paid for an upgrade and the only difference was a bigger Tv. We were woken up every 15 minutes by sirens on the strip because the windows are so old they have no sound proofing.
Sure the rooms are $20 a night but this place has really gone downhill

We booked excalibur hotel 2 months in advance for our 1 year anniversary. I called a day before we were going to fly there and spoke to stacy. She was super nice. She made notes to give a good room with a nice view (what we wanted) we checked in next day and let the lady know its our 1 year anniversary. We decided to upgrade the room because we originally had standard.  The lady gave us the upgrade to us for no charge. We just had to pay the resort fee which was like 89$ for 5 days. I was scared reading the old posts on yelp that they had a horrible experience.  I mean the casino did have a bad smoking smell but which place doesnt. We had the newly renovated room with a nice view. I was super happy with our stay :p. Our room was on the 27th floor tower 2.One of of the old posts someone said their toilet was getting flushed and hair dryer going on by itself.  
I did get freaked out when i was taking showers. around noon my husband and i were sitting in the room and the shower went on which was weird because we have to turn the knob around. So that was freaky and when i came out of shower next day there was a handwritten letter "B" on the mirror. I asked my husband if he wrote the letter. He said no. I was getting freaked out again because my name starts with the letter "B" but overall good room. Wonderful service and staff

Should not have trusted Hotwire.I don't see myself ever going back to Vegas again.Nothing but fat people,kids,smokers and trailer trash.No bargains and so expensive.Check in was long.Rooms a little outdated.Staff was ok.Resort fees should be outlawed.

We stayed here while my husband had a trade show. We have been to Vegas about ten times, staying at all of the big name hotels.. and this hotel was our least favorite. My husbands work placed him here simply based on price. Yes, it was a great price. As usual, you get what you pay for. The lobby and casino were musty and outdated. The air conditioning in the room was either too cold or not working. The towels smelled like mold. A security alarm went off twice while we were there. Once in the middle of the night and once during the day while I was napping after laying at the pool. All to find out it was a mistake both times. 
We had a flight heading home at 6 pm. On our last day we checked our luggage in at the concierge so that we could walk around without our luggage after checking out of our room. I had a small pink travel pillow with me, and they would not take it. They told me it has to fit in a suitcase. I did not have any more room, so I had to walk around with a pink pillow all day. He wouldn't even take it if it was in a plastic bag. 
The only reason I give it 2 stars is because I won $220 playing video poker and lost everywhere else. :)

small casino area but i did have better luck with the $5 min roulette table beats the hell out of aria $15 min bet. the buffet was good for its price wish they had more food options. free luggage storage great for an early check out an late flight out.

The worst dump I've ever stayed at. Dirty. Noisy. Asked (reserved too) for non smoking room and, although there 'were no ashtrays in the room' as I was told..  It reaked of smoke. The decor is supposed to be 'castle like' but it is really more dungeon like. Dirty, old,  things are stained. This place is not a hotel...  It is just a tall motel AT BEST. The lighting in the room (hardly any) lends to smoke stained walls and dungeon atmosphere. TV broken, phone only worked sometimes, drunks outside my door. I rarely leave a poor review but stay away!!!

Pretty much a dump. Not a great location, rooms are small and guaranteed to smell bad. The whole place wreaks of smoke even if you're in the no-smoking section. It smells truly awful, I can't emphasize that enough. 

As I said the rooms are small, the windows don't really open. The beds are far from comfortable, though not painful like some other hotels I've been at. There was a small low quality tv in the room and the bathroom was a pretty tight fit as well. Thankfully I minimized my time spent in the room.

There may have been a gym somewhere. Excalibur has a pretty confusing layout actually despite seemingly being a square. There's plenty of gambling though and cheap gambling - $5 and $10 tables were pretty frequently available. The downside though is that it's pretty far from the rest of the strip; I much prefer to spend time around Caesars, Bellagio, Cosmo, Aria. And there are cheap casinos there as well (Quad, Harrahs, etc).

There's just one thing going for Excalibur - it's cheap. I think I was paying between 30-60 per night. Pretty tough to find that price anywhere else on the strip. But you get what you pay for...not much.

Nothing about this hotel is a pure 5 stars, but it ALL deserves 4 stars for being a pleasant stay and a clean hotel. For $25 + fees and taxes, we got a 2 queen bed room on the 23rd floor of Tower 1.
NOTE: This is just an average hotel. There are definitely way nicer hotels on the strip, but for the cost you can't beat this one.

We had a decently nice view of the strip! The beds were soft and very easy to sleep in after a long night. Shower looked a tiny bit dated, but was walk-in, so I had no complaints. Large LCD tv and modern furniture was a pleasant surprise! Overall, my experience was very pleasant! I would recommend to any of my friends, and I will probably end up there again in the future.

WORST HOTEL EVER in VEGAS. I've stayed at Mirage, Harrah's, PH, Mandalay Bay, and Treasure Island...and EXCALIBUR HOTEL is the worst ever! I went here last year for my sister's 21st birthday during St. Patrick's Day weekend. This review will be mostly about the front lobby staff. I went to go check in first because I got there early. First I had a man that helped me. Without giving the name, he's American and is about 60 to 70 years old. He didn't greet nor smile. I was thinking to myself okay maybe his morning went bad. He said I couldn't check in because my name didn't show up. I told him, my sister already added me as one of the people that can check in. He said he didn't see my name. So I got out of the line to call my sister so she can call in to see why my name wasn't on the list. She called me back and said that person told her my name WAS on the list. I didn't want to be helped by that man again so I waited in line again. I got helped by a lady this time. I thought to myself okay she looks nice. She's filipino,looks like she's in her late 40's. I walked up to the counter and thought I would get a greeting...and again...nothing. This is when I really thought maybe the whole staff just had a bad morning meeting. Staff room ran out of coffee? Had to come in work early? So many questions running through my head at that moment. I had to shake off those thoughts and get straight to the point. I started the conversation by saying my sister said my name is on the list but that man (I pointed to that American man) said I'm not. She checked her computer and said yes my name is on the list. I then proceeded to pay with cash. She then said no cash and said I had to use the credit card that was on file. I said the credit card on file is my sister's card and she won't be here until midnight. This is when my patience had gone out the window. I didn't know what to do. I didn't know what else to say. She didn't offer any other solutions.I also found out she was the MANAGER. I just walked away because I needed to cool off. Five minutes later, I just randomly walked up to a counter that had a lady behind it. She looked mean, but whatever, I was already in a pissy mood. I am proud to mention this staff member name. YELPERS!!! Her name is LUCHIE. She is the best staff member ever. She greeted me! I told her my issue and she fixed it! Got the room keys ten minutes later and never had to deal with the other staff members again. I really wish we can solely base the reviews on a particular staff member...but LUCHIE, I give you 5 stars! Your caring nature was awesome!

This was our first trip to Las Vegas, we were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary. When we arrived at the airport we caught the showtime tours shuttle. They dropped us off and picked us up at Excalibur. We arrived on Friday night at 11:00p.m the line at check in was lengthy, but they had several staff, so the line moved quickly. Our room was at the Royal Tower 6th floor. As we walked into our room it was very clean and welcoming, it had a very roomy upright shower. We had reserved a "run of the house room," and ended up in a room with two queen beds. We were totally okay with this, it didn't bother us one bit. House keeping was on point! We didn't use the pools, the slots were cool. We enjoyed a buy one get one free meal at their buffet which we obtained through the My Las Vegas Slots game. The food was good and they had a good selection, they had chile relleno in the Latin section and it was very tasty! This Hotel is family friendly, we didn't go to, but they have an arcade and a variety of shows. Plenty of eateries and a few onsite shops. We enjoyed our stay and would gladly return if the opportunity presented itself!

It's not 1993 and the Excalibur is no longer the gem of the strip. With places like the Cosmo, Wynn, and Aria classing things up and doing things to suit a younger crowd, the Excalibur is definitely dates. It seems old and dirtier, and like it caters to the families now. 

But the Excalibur is by no means bad. Its perfectly okay as far as cheep hotels on the strip go. For my non-existent college student budget I'll take a $20 room any day over actually spending money to stay somewhere awesome on the strip. It's worth the walk to and from the castle to stay so cheep on Las Vegas Blvd. 

The rooms are nice sized and really all you need from a room. The casino is okay. The price tho makes it well worth my recommendation.

Let me start by saying, nobody should stay at Excalibur and expect a Bellagio or Wynn type of experience.  I would wager that people who post the most favorable reviews of Excalibur began their stay with an expectation of a Motel 6 type of experience.  People who post the worst reviews may have genuinely had a bad experiences, but some could just have some up tight ideosyncracies.  My advice to anyone is READ THE REVIEWS.  I wanted a cheap, clean room without any frills and that's what I got; AND Excalibur has a great location on the Southern end of the strip.  

TIP:  When booking ANY hotel room during a Las Vegas summer, ask that a "note" be put in the reservation requesting a Northward-facing room.  Remember, the Sun rises in the East, sets in the West and the last thing you want is a room that is facing the afternoon Sun.  A room facing the North will always be easier to cool in the summer.  It's all subject to the architecture of the hotel, but generally the order of preference is North, East (by noon the sun will be over the hotel and out of your window), South (true South rooms may catch some angle of the sun during the entire day) and lastly West.

Now I always make it a point when dealing with the front desk person at check-in is to kill them with kindness.  Remember, they have probably checked in over 50 people by the time that they've gotten to you.  So if you seem laid-back, make a few jokes and smile, you'd be surprised how willing the front desk person will be willing to make a last minute change or even give you a free upgrade.  Sometimes it works, sometimes not.  But it never hurts to help them help YOU.   

TIP:  There is a coupon book that EVERYONE gets when checking in at Excalibur.  This book includes a $20 food & beverage credit coupon.  Be wary when booking a deal at Excalibur that mentions a free $20 F & B credit; since everyone receives this at check in try to find a deal that simply offers a better rate.  You'll get the coupon book anyways.

There's been a lot of talk in these reviews about staying in Tower 2 for a better, cleaner, more modern room.  I decided to roll the dice and book the cheaper Tower 1 room; I always had the option to switch\/upgrade later on if I didn't like how the room looked.

The tower 1 room was clean - no smells or odors.  The bed sheets were really white...I'm talkin' either brand new or bleached well.  And they felt as if they had a pretty good thread-count (for those who are into that sort of thing).  No matter what hotel I stay in, I always undo the bedsheets to check for signs of bedbugs - mattress was all clear.  The bathroom was clean - no residue, mold, etc. in the shower or sink.  I will say that the fan vent in the bathroom looked kind of grungy, but that appeared to be the only issue with the room.  TIP:  As for the wired internet, I planned ahead and packed an extra length of 10\/100 ethernet cable & coupler so that I could plug in my laptop and lie on the bed.  

The casino was fun!  Sure it smelled like smoke, but what casino doesn't.  If you've been curious, but intimidated by Craps, check out the 12 Noon craps class.  Sometimes after the craps class has ended they occasionally offer $3 minimum bets for the first hour!

Overall, I had a really good stay at Excalibur in a tower 1 room, but it must really be luck when booking here.  One afternoon, I overheard my neighbor who was coming out of his room and discussing his stay; he stated unequivocally that he "was never staying here again."  And this was the room right next to mine!  No rhyme.  No reason.  I didn't ask him to clarify, but he was adamant.  I just don't understand why I had such a positive experience and he didn't.  My final advice to anyone is to just set proper expectations; think of Excalibur like it's Motel 6 with a casino and you will have a blast!

This place is a big NO. Very disappointed in the room. I know you're thinking, "you're not even in the room that much", right? Right. Because we were running downstairs to get Wi-Fi signal, running downstairs to get coffee (in the morning), and running down the hall to get more ice to keep our wine cold because the room didn't even have a damn mini-fridge. We paid $18\/day "resort fee" which was SUPPOSED to include Wi-Fi, but you had to be in a "public" place to get a signal. Prior to check out, I asked where their business center was to print out our boarding passes..........uh, yeah, about that: just swipe your credit card in front of everyone in the lobby and you have 5 minutes of "access" to the internet and supposedly can print out your boarding passes. OR, do like we did and leave 10 minutes earlier than we intended to leave and have the friendly staff at JetBlue print them out for free.
Never again!

The Hotel itself was pretty nice. Deco was the best thing about the hotel. Our room was not that great. There was a huge red stain on the carpet. My children were worried someone got hurt in our room from the looks of it. Besides that, it's an average room. Beds were somewhat comfortable. As for the "Baja Fresh",was horrible. I had my two youngest with me to get dinner and take to the room. The man that took our order was a embarras ament to the whole establishment. Iv never been treated so badly. He only made two of the burritos I ordered and then helped the next person.(who happened to be a Spanish man) He then began to talk very bad about me in Spanish to the customer he was helping. Yes I am Caucasian and blonde, but I am also from southern Cali and fluent in Spanish. He was very derogatory. We will never stay here again. Hopefully they will do something about the people skills their employees have. Las Vegas is a place for fun. This was by no means fun!

I filled out a questionnaire with my grievances but I can state them here, as well. 
I had a suite at this hotel from August 8th to 11th. Everything was good and clean. I returned for one more night on August 14th and it was awful. To add insult to injury, it was the most expensive night of all. I found chip crumbs on the floor (we hadn't eaten chips so we knew it wasn't ours.) We also found a pistachio shell near the fridge which was missing the bottom panel. The furniture was dusty, there were smudges on the floor and wall of the master bathroom which tells me that it hadn't been cleaned. The toilet also had urine drop stains on the rim, confirming what I suspected.
In the questionnaire Excalibur sent after my stay, I indicated that I wanted a refund for my last night although I'm sure it's common practice to offer a complimentary night stay, if that. Having a young daughter and a crawling baby, I spent the extra money for a suite to ensure we have a clean room. I was so happy with my first three nights but the good experience was ruined by my last night.

The pool was nice and clean and our service out there was top notch.
I enjoyed my time in the casino, mostly due to the people I met inside, but our dealers were so fun, energetic, and made us feel comfortable.

The rooms. We had a few people in our group all at the same hotel and the general consensus was they were musty and not very pleasing on the eyes. My argument was we were only going to be in them for a few hours (mainly to sleep) so it wasn't a big deal. When it actually came time for us to sleep, that's where the problems for my room kicked in. It was just my boyfriend and I. We were lying down to go to bed with all the lights off around 1:30 a.m. All of a sudden there was a very loud, long scratch along the top of our wall. Naturally I freaked the fudge out. But neither of us wants to look like a siss, so no one says anything. Less than a minute later there is a knock on the adjoining door. (Our friends are not staying in that room - they were in a separate tower.) 
So we get up, open the hall door and here's nothing. A minute or so later there is another tap on the adjoining door but like, no way we aren't answering. I call the front desk and let them know what kind of creepy business is going on (the whole time this is happening there is also continuous banging on the wall and floor in the adjoining room. Can someone call Detective Benson?!) and they say they will take care of it and just hang up. Rude.
A few minutes go by and the occasional banging is still going on. It's not a steady bang or else I'd be like "Okay I get it guys. Do y'all thang." Then - this is almost as creepy as the first scratch - there is a scratch on the wall from one end (the main door) to the other (the window) on the lower part of the wall. WTF!
We called front desk again and said "Oh yeah, we'll take care of it." Uh yeah great fine. But they didn't. No one ever came up and knocked on the door next door, we never heard there room phone ring, nothing. And the knocking and scratching continued for almost an hour. 

If we could've gotten a room elsewhere we would have. I'm more disappointed in the staff than I am creeped the Hell out.

One of the "OLDER" hotels on the strip.  And if you don't know already, you kind of get what you pay for is the theme going on with these reviews.  But honestly, I did enjoy my time I stayed here.  Its not the newest looking place, not the worst.  But it definitely does the job...hence the A-OK.

The best thing I though about Excalibur was the size of casino.  I was presently surprised on how big the casino was and how many gambling tables they had.  They also have a huge area dedicated to poker...if my memory serves correctly...I'm not 100% sure cuz well its vegas.  But yes, the casino is quite large with numerous options.

Additionally, the Excalibur has a pretty good food court as well, having a wide selection of choices.  The downside is that there are not many fancier eateries at this place, but hey can you fault them? Catering to its clientele. 

The CONS: from my experience and reading through some of the reviews, the rooms are definitely, not the best; it is basically what you would expect, or what you see in the pictures.  Just overall..one word = old.

Overall, HEY! I think its a decent choice.  If you are going on a budget but still want to be on the strip with great gambling options, in a great location.  I have a good time when I'm here, so why can't you?  It's what you make of it....
Excellent experience for the price. I booked for $23 night and got a room in the royal tower. Everything is upgraded and new in the rooms from the furniture to the bathroom.

Haven't stayed here in years and now I remember why. Resort Tower strip view rooms are extremely noisy with traffic below on street. Rooms seem old and in need of rennovating. Tile floor in bathroom was old and cracked. Shower had been regrouted with different color than previous grout. Bed was lumpy and uncomfortable. The only good thing was the fitness center which was clean and free to hotel guests.

Inexpensive, nice room, yes, you have to walk a lot. Big enough. Comfy enough. Kinda noisy, but this is LV. Their resort charge at $15\/day is misleading, and dishonest. But this is LV, and many things are misleading and dishonest; just be prepared to pay the $$ each day. The Internet is wired, and reasonably fast, I found. 

No smoke smell in non-smoking rooms, too. Hear that Circus Circus? 

Caveat: I wasn't here to gamble or take advantage of the local entertainment venues at the hotel. I didn't eat there, either. In all, pretty reasonable for what I needed: cheap hotel near the Mandalay Bay, which was my convention destination.

Bad customer service. The slot machine froze and didn't let me cash out. I asked someone named JACK for help and they told me to play another game and see if it will let me cash out. If the machine is frozen then why would I want to spend anymore money. After I asked three times for service then I mentioned that just wanted to cash out (now) and the guy started yelling me. When I confronted him that he was yelling at me, he tried to backstab and say that I yelled at him first. He mentioned how I was Asian and he wanted to help me. What does race have to do with anything! Then the next thing you know, they called the security over. They made the situation like it was our fault.

Another suspicious thing occurred at this hotel. My family went out around 12pm. I took off the "do not disturb" sign on the door so we could get our room cleaned.
