When I came back at 8pm, our room was not cleaned. We noticed that they took out the trash but didn't clean our room. That means that they came into our room but for other reason than cleaning. We called guest services and asked them to clean our room. Instead of apologizing to us, they questioned us. They said that it must be because we didn't take off the "do not disturb" sign or we left the room too late. In fact we did take off the sign and we left the same time as the day before. The day before they cleaned our room, but not today. This hotel practically offers customer service. HORRIBLE. I rather stay at another hotel. People working here ruined the mood. Vegas is suppose to be fun but their service killed the experience. The entire time my family was here, we kept thinking about the bad service. I suggest spending your money elsewhere.

The guest relations that replied to this review is a fraud. I emailed them about my horrible experience and no one replied. They probably hired a woman to reply to every review on her phone just for show. HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT.

I get good room rates here with my MLife card. It's decently priced compared to other hotels. I enjoy it here and stay here all the time. They have a Johnny Rockets, Buca Debeppo, and Dicks located inside. Their gaming tables are decently priced as well. They have a tram to get to close by hotels Luxor and Mandalay Bay.

I've been to Vegas tons and tons of times. This is the first time we've stayed at the Excalibur.  We stayed here because we had two teenagers who have never been here and thought there might be better eating and stuff for them to do.  I was right. This hotel has TONS of places to eat, which is really convenient. We ate EVERY SINGLE MEAL in our own hotel, which was really nice. We also attended the Tournament of Kings show, which was really fun! Had fun losing at craps, but still had tons of fun doing it. This hotel was AMAZING on check in\/out and valet parking. We checked in within 3 minutes from the mobile check in kiosk. Why would anyone want to wait in line? beats me. We did get a bottom floor room, but it was ok for easy access to the casino, didn't have to traverse up and down elevators all day. Checked out at the kiosk as well. There were HUGE lines when we checked in and out, but we were in our room within 5 minutes of arriving. My wife and daughter did shopping right there in our own hotel. Valet parking was cheap and easy. The ONLY issue we have is the swimming pools are only 3ft deep.  So if you like to swim, this might not be the place for you cause there is wading, but no swimming LOL. All in all, this was my favorite vegas hotel to stay in. Price wasn't high, and the amenities were the best I've had in vegas for the money. I'm not rich, I actually work for a living. Wife and I will definitely stay there again when we return, which will probably be at least once a year.

I stayed at the Luxor and took the walkway directly into the Excalibur to go to the casino. Very friendly dealers for the most part. Coming from someone who's first gambling experience was yesterday it was nice not to be treated like I was stupid. Shoutout to the dealer Nancy who was especially helpful to a newbie.
Think about this hotel twice b-4 you decide.  They hit you with a surprise addtitional charge of $55 bucks for some stupid fee upon your arrival.  Also, there are NO coffee pots in the rooms!

If you're looking for a clean, cheap hotel room on the Strip then Excalibur is a good choice - but there's nothing glitzy or glamorous about the hotel. Again, just clean and cheap. 

If you want a luxury Vegas vacation then this is definitely not the hotel for you.

The most disgusting hotel on the strip.
See the photo of the nice little item in the light fixture. Looks like it's been there awhile. 
Room old and the smoke detector is wrapped in a plastic bag and hanging from the ceiling.
Yeah I don't  recommend staying here EVER.

The best thing about the Excalibur is that it's more economical than other hotels on the strip. The cost of the hotel room was $27 (booked through Expedia). Of course, with all the vegas hotels these days, resort fee of $15 which gets you amenities, including wired internet in your room. The deal also included $20 food and beverage credit, which can be used at mostly bars, and the one restaurant I saw on there, which was the steakhouse (which is on the pricier side. Look up my review of the steak house at camelot for more info on the coupon there). Also included was a free play at the Dungeon, aka the midway arcade. The coupon book didn't include any match plays, unfortunately.

The room itself was nice. Spacious enough. The tv is large. There is an ethernet cable for you to plug into your computer for wired internet service. The internet was a bit slow. 

The beds were fine. They give you 3 pillows, so you get some extra fluff. 

The elevators were separated floors 1-18 and 18 and up. So if you want a fast elevator service and a high floor, book Floor 18 or so. 

As for the casino, it was stingy. Many of the blackjack tables use continuous shuffler machines, which I am not a fan of. Most minimums were around $10 for most table games.

I stayed here this past week because of an overnight business trip with my family.  I haven't been here since I was 15 years old, and it still looks the same (well, the casino does).

Pros:  
- The rooms are still reasonable for the strip, but the current trend in Las Vegas is to tack on a daily "resort fee" on top of your hotel bill during your stay.  So, watch out for that...
- The Tower II rooms are revamped and nicer.  Flat panel TV isn't HD, but I didn't care because I don't watch network TV often.

Cons:
- Casino STILL looks the same.
- Timeshare people will constantly bug you (and this is a new thing)
- The Excalibur Buffet has significantly raised its prices
- Not as kid-friendly as before...

If I was taking my car here and will mostly gallivant around, this is an ideal spot to stay at.  However, if I'm looking for a resort experience, I'd stay somewhere else.

But then again, who really stays in their room all day in Vegas?  Hmm?

This place is dirty assed.  If you know what I mean.  Everyone you see, and the place itself you imagine has a dirty ass.  Saturday night "strip poker" is pretty cool though.  Great concept and they have a guaranteed $500 minimum first prize pay out for the 8pm tourney.  Bucca's upstairs also.

This place is a disgrace.  You can see that this is a horrible place as soon as you enter the hotel.  All the employees there are trained to generate revenue I guess.  

On my first day I asked one Nigerian employee about the Buffet and he showd my how to get to the Buffet place.  I went there only to find out that the Buffet was closed for renovations.  This dude was only interested in selling the show tickets and he did not care how he treated the "Guests".

The room had no coffee machine and no wifi.  The bed was good though.

Please stay away from this place!!

The wide screen tower rooms are worth an extra $20-30. They are really nice and the best\/cheapest you're going to get on the strip. Excalibur seems to be a family spot so you will see lots of kids running around. My complaints about this place is the casino gets pretty quiet and dead around 12am and the lack of eating spots but for the price and location, you can't do better. Trust me, you will not find another casino of this caliber (even if it's not the greatest) on the strip at their prices. Also, Luxor, New York New York and MGM are walking distances away if you need a change of scenery.

Staff when checking in were super friendly and very nice. Kudos to them! Price was "okay" so we don't expect a whole lot, but still... mold on the bathroom walls, had to call housekeeping twice for extra towels (waited 5 hours), game room for kids is outdated and BORING!, tv picture quality sucked, no room service menu, accosted at every corner by people trying to get us to sign up for something, trash in the hall ways... Starbucks was cool and made me happy. And I won like 6 bucks at video poker. Just whatever you do, spend the extra money and stay elsewhere cos this place has become rather disappointing.

Okay we got a deal on this place for like 39 dollars.
IF I COULD GIVE THIS PLACE A ZERO I WOULD.
This place sucks and the rooms stink. The after hours food is on the 2nd floor and one place! AVOID AT ALL COSTS NO MATTER THE PRICE.

Through bloodshot eyes, I look into the mirror and wonder if this is gonna be the last time. My cell phone on the dresser is ringing but it seems like its 300 yards away. Its okay I know who it is, and I know what they're gonna say. "c'mon bro, we're gonna go hit up another bar..hurry up!" . this was Saturday, I think. The dense shade covering the lone window of my hotel room gave no indication of the time of day or night. Staring there at my own reflection I cant help but ask myself "is this too much? Have I gone too far? Geeze, I've been here for 26 hrs. I've already been drunk and sober, 4 separate times. And sleep? Not a wink.. Maybe I should get some rest. Just a short nap to re-charge my batteries......peh! yea right! If im gonna do this thing im gonna do it right!" I grab my Stingy Brim hat, and my cell phone from the dresser, and head out the door into the long hallway toward the elevators. I knew it would be a while before I come back here and once again attempted to rest my weary bones. But this is Vegas, who sleeps in Vegas?
To the Excalibur Hotel.  
Thank you for renting me the biggest, nicest, locker I have ever had. You lent me a space to keep my things safe, and shower once in a while. I don't remember if this is true, but my friends tell me there was even a bed in there. Hmm, I wouldn't know. I do, however, vaguely recall an instance that included some nice soft towels too.  Your staff was kind, and their tolerance for a bunch of bumbling, soused curmudgeons, is commendable. Someday when I can piece together the photographic evidence and whiteness accounts, I'll have to tell myself all about it.. thanks again, and may god have mercy on your souls.

Was not what I expected, I booked this hotel
Since I've always wanted to try out Excalibur. I've been to a few hotels in Vegas and this by far was the worst. First we check in, as soon as we get to our floor it smelled unpleasant, we head up to our hotel. My fianc loves having the AC on all night so as soon as we get to our room he goes over to turn it on, we noticed it started making this rattle loud noise. We called front desk and told them we wanted to switch rooms because that was unacceptable and they say "give us a few minutes were send someone up to check on it" 40 minutes past and nothing. We called again because it was really inconvenient waiting for them, so they agree to switch our rooms. The other room was a double bed which was a bit bigger, regardless there were multiple stains on the walls and it wasn't as clean as other hotels I've stayed at. Their were even stain on the floor and all along the lobby. I guess that's why Excalibur is so cheap. I do give them 2 stars for their pool, I had a great time there. Definitely would not stay here again.

This used to be my go to hotel for a cheap room because you never really spend much time in your room when you're in Vegas but lately it has been horrible! The previous time I came baggage claim wait was over an hour to bring the bags to the room and valet was full. The room was mediocre. This time I paid to upgrade to the "newly remodeled" rooms and the room had a moldy smell. Same old shower as the normal room same matters and the TV was unclear and hard to see. Valet was full every time we pulled into the hotel and they hassled us about parking the vehicle and told us there were spots on the side of the hotel - however there are only about 100 spots there which are ALWAYS full. I won't be making this my go to cheap hotel EVER again. Oh & mind you, none of the management cares. - they comment on these reviews stating they'll implement changes and talk to there teams. Clearly that is not work. Thanks but no thanks.

Eh. For someone who was on their first visit to Vegas, I sure wasn't impressed.  The outside and inside are completely tacky.

I only stayed for 3 days and only played 1 round of roulette (the dealer was very nice when I realized at the last second I made the wrong bet and she let me change it) My group mainly stuck to ourselves playing slots into the wee hours.

The room itself was decent,  nothing special. We paid next to nothing to stay here, which is pretty much what its worth. If I ever go to Vegas again, I'll be staying somewhere else

P.S. Fireball is the best slot game ever

Go to another hotel.  This place is a dump.  It looks really pretty on the outside but once you get inside it changes.  The carpets up the elevators going to the rooms are ripped.  The walls are paper thin, this place smells like heavy smoke!! Gross gross gross.  They advertise cheap rates nut in reality once you pay taxes and resort fees you could have stayed at a really nice swanky spot.

I mean...do you have to leave a review when you have a photo of a cockroach in your bathroom? They spend so much on making the outside look awesome to attract tourists, but the inside is outdated , dark and dreary. The beds are mid-evil torture, and the cockroach just topped it all off. It is worth spending a little more, or spend a little less and be near Fremont, but skip this one.

The Excalibur - in all my years of going to Vegas this is one of the few places I haven't been into - it is a larger location, has a lot of families staying here due to the cheaper room rates, and the kid-like attractions. 

The casino is pretty large and can take some time to navigate, especially if you are trying to figure out how to reach other hotels if you are crusing through on your way to the Luxor or the New York New York across the street. The casino floor is also more smokey than some of the others - which makes me wonder why people would want to bring little kids into this particular place. 

I usually end up just passing through on my way to other hotels in the area and you might find yourself doing the same....

What in the HELL?!?!? literally we were in hell!

Came here this past weekend with a bunch of coworkers to get away from LA and work. There were 8 of us so we got 2 rooms with 2 beds. We chose the smoking rooms since we were lazy and did not want to bother going to the casino to smoke.

Damn! we all got stuffed in the 1st floor of the  casino so pretty much pointless in getting the smoking room. I know smoking rooms are at the bottom of the hotels but at least put us in the 2nd floor! 1st floor has shitty signals for our phones..we were pretty much isolated from the world! 

The room felt like a motel rather than a hotel. Actually I've stayed at better motels compare to this place. There was no ice machine on our side of the hall so, we had to walk across to the other side to get our ice. There was NO i repeat NO coffee maker in the room!! I thought that was pretty standard when staying in a hotel or motel. Although our bathroom was pretty roomy for 4 girls, we had a walk in shower! SMH! 

Overall disappointed in staying at this hotel. Xing Excalibur in my choices of hotel to stay in vegas. BUT maybe i'll come back to check out Thunder from Down Under! lol

I am not sure if all of their rooms are renovated, but assuming you do get a room that has been, you'll be just fine here.  My room was clean, my bathroom was clean, my TV functioned properly, and there's plenty of space for 2-4 people to walk around.  I stayed on a non-smoking floor and didn't smell any smoke.  Finally, my rate on the weeknight was $29 and my rate for Friday was $69.  Overall, where else can you stay on the strip for this price and for a room that is perfectly fine?

Also, hard to hate a hotel that does offer $5 roulette and blackjack tables most of the day and night.

I've always thought I was meant to live in a castle and feel like a princess.  Let's just say I'm still waiting for the castle part.  The Excalibur made me feel like I was a pauper.  

I would say the rooms don't matter since you're never in them anyway, but I'm getting older and just can't hang like I used to so one night was spent going to sleep at 11pm.   I know, I know.  I guess I should have kept that fact in Vegas.

What I loved is that we were in between the Luxor and New York, New York.  The casino was huge and I won a whopping $16 (maybe I shouldn't be saying that; I don't want all my long-lost relatives trying to track me down for some of the winnings)!  There was a go-go dancer always dancing to some booty music in the middle of the casino (depending on the girl depended on whether this was good or not).  

What I did not love were the holes in the sheets, the drunk guy sleeping and snoring extremely loud in the hallway, the room-service food left all day in the hallway, the holes in the walls in our room, the cracked toilet, and the list goes on...

We were in Tower 1 so I don't know how the rest of the towers are, but this princess will be staying in a different castle next time.

The only thing it has going for it is location. The place is a dump. Smelly and musty, the rooms are old and made my clothing smell. I use a CPAP machine and the smell of the room was hard to get out! 

The location and price were ok, but the amenities inside the hotel, coupled with the staff hassling you every time you walked through the lobby trying to sell you tickets somewhere was too much. 

The bathroom in the room was moldy and musty and needed a complete  remodel.

The first room was not cleaned up to par( trash and glasses left instead of taken)and we got several bug bites. Dust came up off the coverlet when it was hit to brush off black specks that were on it. A straw wrapper was left on the bed. There's black mildew in the shower. The second room was less dusty but I received yet another 2 bug bite that wasn't there yesterday. I am not happy with this trip and the hotel could have done better to rectify the situation. I'm still itching all over and it's been several hours since we checked out.

My friends and i came here for new years of 08 and it wasn't bad. the room we had was clean and a nice view of the strip. it was pretty much like a typical moderate hotel room. we didn't get to stay in the wing with the new flat screens and newer rooms. they only have showers, no tubs. i really don't recommend checking in on new years day like we did. the WHOLE lobby smelled like people puked everywhere. it was pretty bad and i hate to say this but we were hoping the smell of smokers would mask the smell. that didn't work. the people at the front desk were not helpful and in a way rude. other than that the experience wasn't bad. there was even a walkway on the main level that took u to new york new york and another walkway on the second floor to luxor. it's pretty convenient as long as u don't mind the work. they even have a $7.77 steak deal. it's okay... small but u can't really expect much.

I paid for one of the remodeled rooms and it was a horrible experience.

Bathroom shower head was falling out of the wall, there was no tub, the shower caulk was dirty and falling apart, under the sink was filthy, the toilet ran, the hair dryer was way too hot, and there were little plastic pixie cups for drinking.

The room was horrible - no blackout curtains on North wall that let light through around the shade (had to prop 5 pillows on one side of the bed to stop light from hitting me in the face), the carpet was stained, there were only 5 hangers, no fridge (knew that ahead of time), the "pillow-top" bed is hard as a rock, and the room temperature can never get comfortable because the controls are near the door and the ac\/heat is near the window - by the time the cold reaches the thermostat, it's freezing in the middle of the room where the bed is!

Lastly, the door lock is tricky (Room 21213) and doesn't always read the card right. Had to try 5 times or more to get the card to read (and I was sticking it in correctly).

And that was just the room!

The shuttles let you off clear on the other side of the registration - and you have to go down steps with your luggage to get from one end to another. Check-in takes forever. The other vacationers are loud, obnoxious, and rude. Security never smiles and it seems like everyone is drunk. The kids run around screaming their heads off and parents don't give a damn.

I would have been more comfortable in a tent at the campground on the hard floor with the bugs eating me alive.

Unpretentious. Reminding you that Vegas is not just extravagance and VIP booths and celebrity owned restaurants, but a place for poorly dressed, unattractive people. And LOTS of them. Everywhere. 

1. Staff here has been extremely nice, the cute concierge guys who sell show tickets were very helpful and when walking back to my room looking like a hot hot mess, one of the repair guys actually walked me to my end of the hotel. It turned out he used to live in the Haight. The 94117 follows me everywhere. 

2. 24 hour McDonald's in the basement. When you roll in at 7am barefoot after knocking back a gazillion glasses of bourbon with your new BFFs at Ceasar's Palace, you realize that you need a mass quantity of processed food or you're not going to make it. 

3. Rooms are nothing special and the bedding is hideously tacky, but the water pressure is awesome and how much time are you spending here anyway? 

4. The gambling is low pressure. Lots and lots of slots! 

The biggest negative is that there is no wi-fi, but I found a way around that.
Loved it here!! Check in was easy in & our. The rooms were amazing & I have zero issues there! Will be going back there when I visit Las Vegas again!

This is the 3rd time.. I am staying there.. and I must say this hotel has been changed alot.. it used to hell smoky in casinos but now it's much better.. 

I had great time and staff was amazing. It's on one of the best locations in las vegas, we were given strip view ... which was amazing. 

we will go back again soon.

DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!  
The only good thing I can say is that the room was nice(with a cheap finish).  
None of the staff made you feel like they needed the bussiness.  Exm.. I ordered room service Saturday, the girl on the other end of the line gave me an ETA of 30 to 45 minutes...   I called back in an hour and she told me she would put my order in...WTF  At that point I thought of complaining to managment and decided that it probably wouldn't make a difference!!!  

You pay for what you get....

Great hotel and great price. Not sure why the reviews are so mixed. We stayed 3 night and had the contemporary king room in tower 2. It was very nice, spacious, clean and comfortable. The bathroom looked great and was big as well. The bed was very comfortable. We had an awesome view of the city and the mountains. The AC worked great and was easy to control and our room got cleaned daily. Absolutely no issues. I would definitely stay here again. My only complaints are lack of WiFi and the timeshare staff in the casino who we constantly had to ignore. Even though our room didn't have WiFi there was a long ethernet cable which worked great with the laptop we brought. The internet connection was fast and it was free.

i've stayed at the excalibur every time i've been to vegas. my first experience was nice. i've watched it go downhill thereafter. needs some updating and upgrading. if you like medieval themes you'll enjoy the surroundings though. if you have kids, there's an arcade in the hotel. the breakfast is to die for in the little restaraunt in the lobby area. the waffles are nationally known.

OK.I have been going to Vegas for the last 15 years on and off. I had my own business and when out there often so I have stayed almost everywhere.This is the best hotyl for kids..not adults..Let's start at the bottom floor they have a whole arcade with prizes for the kids. The prices of the food at the restaurants is very fair and the Italian restaurant for example has huge portions.I rarely eat pizza but they have the best I have tasted. There are a lot of stores nearby on the strip and they have a huge food court with everything you could want on a budget..

Now..If you are talking accomidations they are dated and kinda on the generic side so it's not a fancy or glitzy hotel by any means. The hotel has similar prices to Stratosphere,Riviera and the Hilton. If you have a family it's a great place to stay and you are close enough to be bale to walk to some of the other larger casinos. Not a place to come for the young crowd I would suggest some of the more contemporary hotels with exciting new clubs.
Nice Hotel, nothing too over the top, good table stakes on the Casino floor and the tournament of Kings is a great show.

I feel bad complaining since the room was so cheap, but some of the things were pretty bad.
1. It was 40-50 degrees this past weekend we stayed and the heater was broken...brrrr!!! 
2. We booked 2 rooms and asked that they be next to each other, we were initially on complete opposite ends of the hall. This was fixed after a quick phone call.
3. The valet doesn't offer to help with your luggage or even ask if you need a cart for luggage...maybe I'm just spoiled? 
4. Our friends' room was less than clean. There were what appaeared to be pubic hairs on the bathroom floor and an old jellybean on the side of the bed. 
5. We usually left our room after noon and housekeeping NEVER once came to clean our room...usually they check back don't they? That's at least what I'm used to.
6. Buffet was wiggedy whack...don't bother. It is comparable to microwave dinners. You're  probably better off getting a microwave dinner. 
7. There are people every five feet soliciting free show tickets. Annoying. 

In all, this place is a good place to stay if you don't mind all of the above and are short on cash flow. I however, mind and will not be staying here ever again.

Seriously! Bed bugs woke me up at midnight! Caught 5 of those little bastards.
The hotel had someone drop us off keys to a new room. Didn't bother to send a bellman to help with the luggage and offered us a free breakfast buffet. They said they had to have someone come in to verify the bugs before they could do anything else! Ugh! And they put us a few doors down! Not happy at 1:00am!

Let me tell ya'll it pays off to be a M'life member. i skipped a 30 min wait in the check in line to the M life vip check in and i was greeted by a courteous front desk employee by the name of Erika i believe, she pretty much explain step by step and answer all my question that i had as i was checking in, the whole process took 10 mins. I was then check in to the royal tower in the 27th floor. I had an amazing view to the strip thanks to Erika :)
The room was clean, decent for the price that i paid, the staff was great with us when we ask for directions to our tower.The bellman took around 30 mins to bring us our luggage but was nice enough to explain to us why.  Just an FyI the hotel stops doing room service at 2pm, inconvenient. According to the hotel you can get food in the food courts smh. The pool was super small full of kids, the casino floor was super damn packed. Over all, me personally i wont be staying here in the future.

Absolutely horrid. Save your money. 
Service is non existent 
......never going to this place again. Escalator should be one way only and the tram station should be an evacuation portal.  No stars for you.

The Excal has been around since 1990.  When it was built, it was the largest hotel in the world, by room count, for a few weeks - until the Trop finished an expansion across the street and trumped them.  I'm sure both are way down the list by now, but they do have a metric crapload of rooms, something like 4000.

Brak and his crew have been hanging out here for years.  Why?  The lousy food court upstairs?  The kids running around all over the place?  The crappy buffet that wouldn't be out of place at San Quentin??  No, it's the bars, mainly the Lobby Bar (formerly known as Jester's Lounge until recently).  We've known several of the bartenders there for almost 20 years, and they've become great friends over the years, and they really run a smooth ship and provide a great Vegas experience as you slide into an inebriated state.  The sports book is decent too, a good place to catch an NFL game that you've got a wager riding on.

The hotel itself is serviceable, rates are all over the place, ranging from reasonable to a complete rip if something is going on in town, but that's par for the course all over the strip.  Table gaming is good, with personable dealers, some liberal rules (like the 12 pays triple on craps), and we've always found the dealers and pit bosses to be fun to hang with.

Summary: partying gets 5 stars, hotel gets 2.5, food gets 2.5, the whole enchilada averages out to a 3 on the Brak-o-meter.

I read and heard a lot of bad reviews about this place but it's really nice for the price we paid. The view is really nice and the beds and my room was really clean. The lane was crazy long to check in the morning but we were able to get a room before 3pm for check in time which was nice cause we didn't have to carry our bags with us everywhere. Definitely going to stay here again when I come back. And I love how it's kinda at the end of the strip so it's not hard to leave and come back to the hotel. And it's away from the traffic

Stayed here for a convention and that was a mistake.  The rooms were supposedly remodeled but the job looked 50% done.  New countertops and plasmas but the furniture and the shower are still from the 80s.  They dont really inspect the units for paint and clean jobs as well.  Skip the buffet- waste of money unless its free.  The cafe is ok.

We went to this hotel because we caught a great deal on air + hotel package.  Overall, the hotel is a little out dated, but they are renovating it.  We stayed in one of the "old rooms".  Even though this room was not renovated yet, it was still nice.  Everything was very clean and the bed was comfy.  The casino is a little on the small side, but we had good luck there.  The pool is nice.  They just renovated the pool area.  Now they have 3 pools with 1 of the pools for kids.  The staff was friendly and haleful.  Location on the stip is also very good.  The MGM, New York New York, and Trop are all within short walking distance.  Overall it was a good experience.  I would stay here again if the price is right.

First hotel where I've ever gotten attitude for wanting my room cleaned. (And I wasn't even requesting that they get the filth stains out of the sofa!) After they failed to come during the day they accused me of having the privacy hanger on the doorknob. Then offered to bring me towels but "it might be a few hours before we could get someone there." When I said that was fine because I heading out they replied, "oh so you actually want your room CLEANED?" Nah, just swing by and piss on my suitcase please.

They offer the latest in technology with wired internet, but don't fear, the ethernet cord is about 20 feet long, providing easy access around your room. Just don't trip over it.

The Sherwood Forest bar featured the drunkest bartender I have ever been served by, and that is an accomplishment. She took my free drink vouchers (2 per day through the resort fee) with pleasure and spent a good 15 minutes searching for a bottle of gin. Also spent a while staring at the cash register before counting out someones change, and then forgot that they were directly behind her. It was one of the most entertaining shows I have seen in Vegas.

Don't get me wrong, I expected my budget-ass stay inside a castle to be this way. Every time I want to reminisce I look at the picture of the view from my room, that includes some broken wooden pallets on gravel next to the employee smoking area. It looked like there had once been a tree, but it was cut down for obvious reasons like being aesthetically pleasing.

I would probably go back for the absurdity.

We stayed here over Thanksgiving for 8 nights because it was cheap and I thought that it would have been a high class hotel.  Our room smelled like sewer gas from day one.  After 5 nights and no improvement I called the front desk.  They sent up "engineering" to snake the shower, but no improvement.  When we asked for a new room they moved us.  A reliable source told me that room has had a problem for a long time and the management knew it.  Why do they even put people in such conditions?  The "resort fee" was for what?????  Telephone service which I didn't even use??? or wired internet service which is no help for an iPad??? or having to walk through a smoky casino to go anywhere in the hotel??? or having to go to KrispyKreme to get wifi??? or for the inconvenience of not having a microwave or fridge????  The "resort fee"  is just a hotel imposed "tax."  If I'm ever in Vegas again I will look for a hotel that does not impose a resort fee -- some were advertising "no resort fee."  I've had  a consistently better experience at 2.5 star chain hotels.  There has to better choices off the strip.  With a car, it is no problem to get to the strip and park free at any of the hotels.

We got there around 11:00pm on 09\/25 and the line was pretty long, but moving pretty fast. The lady who checked us in, Prytzel, was super friendly. Upgraded us to a newer room, and made us feel at home.

The hotel entrances always smell good and clean, weird for a Vegas hotel but true!
the room was nice, pretty new. The one thing I would change about it would be the shower head, everything was pretty new and it just didn't seem like they cared much for it. But other than than, it was a pretty nice stay.

I would have rated it 5 stars, but on 09\/27 the housekeepers decided to come in the room and clean it. Now this would have been nice and all, but we had the privacy sign up the whole weekend. When they cleaned, I did lose the cloth to clean my sunglasses, small I know, but it's about the principle.

But that won't stop us from staying here again. We liked it. and it isn't far from the other hotels.

Well it is what it is, it obviously is not new and it is old compared to the other strip places. But there are cheap food places inside and I surprised that the pool was decent. The TV reception in rooms was really bad and no HD in the sportsbook is weak.

Not a place a place to poop if you have too 2 star bathrooms.

UPGRADE TO THE TOWER ROOMS!!!

if ur main goal in vegas is to eat eat eat, sleep sleep sleep, gamble and more eating, your room might not be of the most importance if your budget is ruled mainly by eating good food. For me: I just wanted a decent place to stay, close to the City Center, without spending a fortune on a room, that i would just use to sleep and shower. We took advantage of booking early to a discount and I spent about $230.00 for a fri-mon stay. The upgrade says Widescreen TV, but we didn't really care about that- the main difference from the other rooms is that it looks a little more modern. Beds were decent and comfortable : http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/o7AiTlyWUrBSzdz6oMHj5w?select=hEzxVsEJzj4_Bdm1CJoQFQ
Bathrooms were clean. http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/o7AiTlyWUrBSzdz6oMHj5w?select=ez1T5FamJ8MzAvyp94Zueg
I have crashed in some pretty ugly looking hotel rooms in vegas, and for the price and convenience, it was pretty decent! 
Check in was smooth, signing up for the Mlife playing card was a breeze since i registered ahead online, staff was friendly, but slots were not. 
They have a convenient food court http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/o7AiTlyWUrBSzdz6oMHj5w?select=mvxEq1vTcSsHPYC5Kzwrnw.
There's always Thunder From Down Under (been twice for bachelorette parties!)- which is pretty decent too!

I have stayed in several different hotels on the strip including the venetian, elara, flamingo... this place us the best location for easy on and off strip access. Best service of any hotel I've stayed in. They have begun renovations and upgrades here and the rooms are very comfortable and up to date. Clean clean clean! Had a bratty, screaming kid with crappy parents check into the room next to us a few days ago. Excalibur promptly moved our room to a better location as soon as we let them know there was an issue.

Miserable service ..took hours to check in .tried to cancel my registration but they wouldn't refund my money so I had to wait in reg line for hours . Finally checked in at 7 .
Was too tired to enjoy Vegas that night .

I was nervous going in, but I wanted an inexpensive room for my first nights stay in Vegas.  This is by no means the fanciest hotel on the strip, but the price is right.  The bed was SUPER comfortable and the room\/towels were clean.  The decor was extremely dated, but it wasn't a problem since I was using this room to sleep, not entertain.  The hotel staff was courteous.  No complaints here.
Great price and kid friendly. Pool has water slides and the staff was friendly. The beds are comfortable and the view was nice too.

I stayed here for the weekend for something new, having previously stayed at Luxor and Flamingo. Overall I was pleased with the cleanliness of the rooms. The staff was very friendly. The housekeeping team on our floor was especially nice. The dj at the pool played a lot of good music. My only complaint is that the pool is not as great as it could be. They have 3 small pools instead of one big wrap around pool. There is also no shade whatsoever, possibly because they want you to pay to use their lounge chairs with an umbrella. I know the whole pool issue is minor, but hanging out drinking by the pool is one of my favorite things to do in Vegas. I most likely would not come back based on that alone. Step your pool game up guys!

Oh Excalibur...your castle exterior is quite quirky but we didn't exactly get the royal treatment inside. 

Came here with a few girlfriends for a long weekend of bachelorette\/birthday festivities. Since our bridal friend & family was already staying at this hotel, the rest of my girlfriends booked a room here as well (we split one room w\/ 2 queen beds b\/w us 4 girls). We ended up in Tower 1.

The perks: 
+ Large beds
+ Plenty of towels & bedding upon request
+ Decent pricing
+ Strong AC

Things to note:
- No free wifi! Only an ethernet hookup (booooo)
- Thin walls
- No food amenities\/vouchers with booking
- Rather far from other destinations on The Strip
- Not enough wall outlets
- QUESTIONABLE CLEANING...found some sticky pieces of caramel popcorn between my sheets...gross!

Bottom line -- if you're on a budget, Excalibur can be an acceptable deal. But you must remember to factor in cab fares & driving through traffic if you want to check out other places on The Strip. There are limited amenities here, but this hotel may work out if you just need an affordable place to crash during your time in Vegas.

The location of the hotel is very very convenient. Everything is walking distance. The hotel itself is old and not clean. We went into our room and it was dark and it smelled really bad. I believe there were bed bugs as well because we got rashes on our arms, legs and back during our stay. When I looked at the reviews for this hotel, it seemed like we weren't the only ones who got rashes here and there were even people who found bed bugs on their beds. Excalibur, you should really do something about this! One more thing, I don't know if there was a construction going on or something but every morning around 7, we could hear a drill that was very very loud that it almost seemed like it was next door. That woke us up every morning and we weren't happy about that.

Booked my king room 2 months ago and when I got there they said they didn't have a king room anymore. Since I paid more money for the king room they "upgraded" me to their "newly remodeled" 2 queens room in the Royal Tower. The room was nothing special except the view from the window at night. No bath tub and the shower looks very old and not very clean. You pay the $30 resort fee on top of the $73 room price. I asked about the Wifi and they said to enter my name and room number but I only had access to their regular Wifi, nothing came up asking for name or room number...there was also a stain on the sheets.
Wonderful view from the 23rd floor, the price is very attractive for the quality of a room double beds, I strongly advice.
Zero stars. Can you possibly get any more shameless than to have workers in the lobby shaking your patrons down with condominium sales pitches while they are on their way to and from their rooms?!

I have stayed at the Excalibur once, and have visited it many of times. The Excalibur is one of the more family friendly hotels on the strip (next to the Circus Circus) so I stayed here before I turned 21 with my parents and sister because we liked to visit the arcade portion of the hotel\/casino. I remember the room being basic, but clean and quiet which was nice.

The Excalibur is connected to the New York New York, MGM Grand, Tropicana, Mandalay Bay and Luxor Hotel\/Casinos so it's easy to go from one hotel to the next without having to go down to the strip which  is nice to avoid some of the crowds.

Dining options are semi limited at the Excalibur. The buffet\/cafe is OK and they have the national Buca de Beppo chain which serves average to good Italian food. They do have a really nice food court which I have to give them props for. I really enjoy the Krispy Kreme that is there, and I really wanted to try the Schlotzsky's Deli which has a small stand as well. They also have a Yogurtland which is my favorite yogurt place.

The casino is on the older side (compared to some of the ones further down the strip) but it is kept up nicely and I always enjoy my time there. I would come back again to hangout, eat, or stay in one of the rooms.

This hotel even in its heyday gave me the heeby jeebies. For some reason it's always felt claustrophobic to me. Sure it resembles some castle which is supposed to make kids feel welcomed, but trust me, my lil guy doesn't care about that. My lil guy's favorite hotel is The Westin, so seriously, Excalibur just does not do it for him (nor me).

The place needs a desperate new coat of paint on the outside. When you drive by on the freeway it just stands out like a sore thumb, looking really ridiculous amidst all the new flashier hotels either already up or on their way to being built.

It's definitely cheap to stay here, but why would you want to?

I was skeptical when first booking this hotel. But regardless of the reviews, we had a wonderful experience. We had teenage kids with us and felt safe the entire time. Clean room in Tower 2 with view of the pool. Pool time in the afternoon was awesome. No issues finding a chair. Only complaint was some idiots smoking weed in the elevator, but we don't hold the casino responsible for the behavior of others. We will be back.

Pretty good hotel for the price.  The front desk was observant and noticed we had our kids with us (which by the way, if you have kids, stay just off the strip, outside Vegas or way off the strip - Vegas is not a place for the kiddos, families etc.  It use to be but not anymore).  Anyway back to the Excalibur, the front desk associate upgraded our room to the bigger TV and put us high overlooking New York New York which was great because the kids could sit and watch their rollercoaster.  It was a great thing.  Because Vegas is now the Vegas of the 20th century we decided to stay in and go to the McDonald's\/Quiznos and then we brought McDonalds to the room for breakfast the next morning. 

The beds were nice, the room was clean (the shower area could have used a little TLC) but overall it was a good place to stay....for a night.

Worst place ever just got back after staying 3days! Never again! They charge you for everything!!! They now also charge a fee for parking in the hotel property $8 each day! Wtf is a hotel fee for! Also you paying parking they don't even have! There isn't enough to parking! All rooms are none smoking I thought that was great! Till everyone I'm talking at least 6 rooms on my side off the floor 24th floor was smoking pot!! All 3 days so that's stupid beyond I don't care ppl can smoke but don't clam it's none smoking ! Pool was packed and they have an adult pool they charge you to get in 10$ like wth next thing I know they going to charge me for taking a shit on the toilet these ppl are way out line! I'll keep staying with Cesar's entertainment instead! Ppl don't waist your money it's better to pay a little
More then to deal with all this crap! I can't express it enough ! I spoke to the Manger about noise they were making upstairs she didn't do crap! Worthless ppl here don't stay here if u don't want to be upset! Worst of all was the parking and all mgm m life bulls*** is charging for parking so look out 13$ for valet mind u all hotels charge different could be more! good luck hope this helps ppl out! Don't stay here !!!

pros--cheap room price.


cons--too many kids, slot machines never pay back,  no shows for guys,

This review is for the Midway only...the place where the games be.... 

My parents used to bring me and my brother here on the family trips to Vegas back in the day. I have to say, it looked the same from when I was a kid. Well, it looked smaller but that could be because I just grew. We decided to bring our 2 year old here on the way back to my moms house who lives in Vegas. It even seems they have the same carnival games as they did almost 15 years ago. We played a few of them and we won my son a few stuffed animals. My brother and I used to play those games where you drop your quarter in the slot and it is supposed to knock other quarters off the ledge. Well, most of those were not working or taped up so you could not play them. My son liked the huge Sponge Bob thing in front of the 4D ride they have now. My son really seemed to like it down there. Since my mom lives in Vegas we will probably bring him back when we are in town. But, that would be the only reason we go back to that run down hotel. I have a feeling that will be one of the next hotels on the strip to go. I guess if you have to stay there I see they have super cheap rates during the off season...like $29.00 cheap. 
I would go here again, but only for my son to play around down stairs. He had a good time and I would recommend for other parents with kids. It's an option to blow a few hours if you need to.

The Excalibur was a cute place to stay. I enjoyed it most because of the castles that are on the outside. I do have to point out some flaws I had during my experience there. First off, I do like how you can check in your bags and still gamble and roam until your room is ready. But once in the room, I learned the windows barely open; about a centimeter or two (maybe fire the safety of others since it was the 25th floor, but opening a window would have been nice). Also, after contacting guest services for an additional pillow and clean towels, it took them two hours to bring us towels. and the lady who answered was offly rude about not having "softer" pillows, when I asked for just an additional she seemed rather annoyed. I also purchased my room with an addition buffet for two if I stayed for a minimum of two nights(I stayed for four), they never gave me the breakfast that was suppose to come with my room, and I actually had to pay for our buffet entry. Yolanda, the manager, said she'd reimburse us but never did, after calling her.  
It was a bitter sweet experience but vegas is only as fun as you make it, so I decided just to enjoy my time there.

We just stayed in this hotel for three nights during the first weekend of March Madness this year. Overall, we had a pretty good experience.

Here's my take: 

Pros: 

*Good price for busy weekend. I originally booked this hotel for close to $700 for three nights due to March Madness, but Excalibur offers a great price match deal if you book through their website. (I think Luxor might offer the same deal). I booked the hotel through their site and then found a cheaper advertised price on Otel.com. I sent in a claim form (kind of a pain of a process, but worth it) and Excalibur beat Otel's price and offered me 10 percent off as well for finding the better deal. I ended up getting the hotel for about $107 a night before resort fees and tax. Good deal, especially for such a busy weekend. They were advertising upwards of $250 a night for Friday and Saturday. Note: Make sure you read all the rules of the price match before you book and that you give yourself enough time to cancel if Excalibur denies your claim. You can cancel within 48 hours for a full refund. 

*Good location. This hotel is close to lots of dining and fun. It's connected to Luxor and not far from Mandalay Bay and a host of other hotels. It makes for a good home base. 

*Clean and spacious room. Ours was recently renovated

Cons:

*Weird smell. I can only imagine what goes on in some of these casino hotel rooms. Our room had a weird mustard smell that we couldn't seem to get rid of. 

*Hard beds. Definitely not the most comfortable around.

*No conditioner. This is for the ladies. I had to go buy some. I hate when hotels give you the 'conditioning shampoo'. That stuff sucks. I think if I'm paying more than $100 a night, the hotel should provide both shampoo and conditioner. 

*The fees. This is not a specific issue with Excalibur because all Vegas hotels now charge a 'resort fee'. This is, of course, just another way of tacking an additional $15-25 onto your bill daily.  All the hotels do it so they can get away with it. So, even though we got the hotel for $107 a night, we paid $420 total with the fees and taxes. That's an additional $100 tacked onto the trip.  Ridiculous. Again, you'll find this with most hotels so just consider that when booking so you're not surprised at check-in. It bugs me that the hotel can advertise one rate, and keep those fees hidden in small print because it really is a significant boost in price. Just be aware that those fees do exist and the tax is super high.

We stayed here for four days for our anniversary. The room was nice and clean. The casino was a lot less smokey since last time we were here which was very nice especially with how busy it was. 
It would be nice if they would stop the people from sitting outside hotel from asking for money. There were a couple of times when they were arguing with each other. Not fun to walk through! 
There buffet was very good.

This is a fine hotel. It gets the job done. It might not look as up-to-date or as pristine as some other casinos on the strip, but our room was nice and very comfortable. Even though it was early spring and still a little cool, we were happy to enjoy the hot tub and even got to bring some friends along! This is a decent place for a decent price!

We enjoyed staying here. The people who work here are very nice and we liked the casino. The reasons for the three stars are that we were out of our room from 9:00am to 7:00 pm and they never cleaned our room. I finally just called housekeeping for clean towels. Another reason for the three stars is that check in took over and hour.

I am appalled by the service this place provides. The cocktail waitresses are downright mean for no reason. There was not one waitress that was in a good mood the entire weekend I was there. I paid plenty of money playing their casino games and the room itself, so I expect good attitudes in return. Mind you, I work in the service industry. This is by far the worst customer service I have ever seen in my life.
On top of paying for the room, they make you pay a resort fee, AND parking. 
This place is so disappointing. I will never come here again. I can't believe I wasted my time in Vegas coming to this trash of a place. I just wanted to have fun, and this hotel didn't provide me with this vibe AT ALL.

Well it is not the best but not the worst. Cheap, but you get what you pay for. The room is clean but average. The biggest problem I had with it is there is no bathtub in the room. I found myself missing it every day. I would come from a long day of walking, dancing, whatever and always find myself wishing to take a long hot soak. :( Oh and one out four of the clean towels had stains on them. 

There is no good food at the food court. Annie's is good but doesn't make a meal. They seem to be remodeling the restaurant choices on the casino level. 

The tram is good but if the best thing about your hotel is easy transit to somewhere else there is a problem.

Will never stay here again!!! First room smelled like shit had to change rooms. Then housekeeping never came to Clean the rooms. Called at 4pm to have someone come up then got back at 630 then again rooms aren't cleaned worse weekend ever...

I would like to say we completely enjoyed our stay. The customers service was awesome Brandon Shelf at the check in desk was amazing! The staff at the buffet was awesome Shery had lots of good information and was very nice every morning. The all you can eat for $35 day  is by far one of the best deals in Vegas. Aminta the cocktail waitress in the casino always made sure we were taken care of. We were in tower 1 witch is the one that has not been renovated yet but I must say it was very clean and the beds were comfortable.

I had a great time here at the Excalibur in Las Vegas at a great price.

My goal on this getaway was to see all the sites, not sit around in my hotel room, so I'm not that critical about how it looks as long as it was clean (and it was). When I did crash I thought the beds were super comfy with really soft sheets. I haven't experienced sheets like that since I stayed at the W in New Orleans!

The Excalibur itself is a little long in the tooth meaning it does show its age but it is well maintained. I stayed in Tower 1 that had a sh*tty view (but oh well!). I was on the non-smoking floor that was quiet.

My only complaint was that I waited in line at the front desk to mail some postcards. When I got up to the clerk I mentioned it seemed silly to wait five minutes to send four freakin' postcards and asked why didn't they have a mail slot. She mentioned that there was indeed a mail drop -- outside. I'm like WTF? Please put up a sign! Jeez.

So that's it. Good price, good location. I'm sure someday I'd like a more bougie and upscale Vegas experience but then I'll have to pay big bucks for that. Ah, I can dream!

The wait time to check in was a little long, but it's to be expected. The room itself is perfectly fine - great value for the price. I've stayed at a $300+ per night "chi chi" hotel in San Francisco that truthfully cannot even compare to the room here, as follows: 

The walls were thick enough to block out 95% of ambient noise, the TV was big, the bed was comfortable (although the pillows were lumpy), and the bathroom was spacious and well-lit.

Two stars is generous. I had to think twice about it. The reason why I gave it another star was because of the customer service. The check-in line was long but moved fast. The first room they gave us was in tower 1 and the entire floor smelled of pee and it was the last room on the floor, facing a corner wall. I reserved a king size bed and there were two queen size beds. We didn't even sit down. We went immediately downstairs and complained and they immediately changed our room to a king size bed room with a better view. The bed had what looked like blood on the top sheet and I asked the cleaning lady who was cleaning the room next door to change it and she quickly did. She was very nice. The problem remains is that the entire tower 1 needs to be renovated. It is the equivalent to a run down motel 6. When making my reservations it didn't say what tower the room was in and this is the first time we have ever stayed at the Excalibur so I didn't know there was a difference. I'm going to see if we can change rooms again to tower 2. Not sure if there are any available seeing this is a weekend. This is the worst hotel as far as upkeep I have ever stayed here in Vegas. It is literally a dump.

I didn't actually stay here, I'm just reviewing the ambience. Nothing special about this hotel.It's a medieval theme. Nothing really classy about this hotel. It's kind of old school. I remembered staying here when I was a kid. It still looked the same.  My friend and I went to the arcade played a few games and left.  When we left the hotel, there were two weirdos handing out necklaces and asking my friend and I to take pics with them.. It's Vegas, weird things happens

I thought staying here would be fun since we came in for a show last year. Prices for rooms are usually on the cheaper side which is nice. The place is outdated which doesn't bother me and I guess over the last year the hotels got rid of the charge to check in early so that's nice.

My low-score review comes from 1. I need water - it's a necessity. I don't mind drinking water from the bathroom sink but the water tasted like the smell of the hotel. Musty. Then if you want to buy water you're paying $4.50 for a $1.50 bottle of water. So you run out of options for fresh water.

2. It's end of October so the two bigger pools are closed. All that was open was the "spa pool" which is a smaller pool with two hot tubs and that was filled with children (even the hot tubs) or you could pay extra money for the "adult pool." Sorry I just paid a few hundred dollars to stay here I'm not shelling out extra money for a pool that should already be included! So my husband and I couldn't swim.

3. The TV doesn't seem to be ready to go. I think you need to call the service desk. I don't want to deal with them. I tried to watch some local channel and it was really bad quality and eventually turned off onto some hotel-run ad. Not sure why television isn't included.

Also, the people that try to get you to do the time share thing - that needs to stop. A friend warned me about them before my first trip to Vegas last year but we were barely in the door after a 5-hour flight and those assholes are already on us before we could even check in!!! Then three more are up in our faces harassing us from the checkout counter to the elevator. It's a small plane you don't need that many swindlers. We haven't even checked out yet but I'm so annoyed at not being able to get water or go swimming I decided to leave a review now. 

I'll be back to Vegas but will not stay here again.
its an older hotel and the furnishings are less than awesome. but its a great location and has sky bridges to the other spots close by.

Listen, Excalibur is not great or awesome by any means. But if you're going as a group and you rather spend your money on gambling and clubbin' and not on where you're sleeping. This place is perfect.  I got 2 rooms for 4 nights\/5 Days for under $200 for BOTH rooms!  

The beds are comfy enough, the shower works, the toilet works, what else do you really need? Who spends any time in their rooms anyways?  If you're try to spend your money on havin' fun and not on where' you're stayin, this place is the best, plus the location is not bad either, you're still on the strip.

Oh and they have $2.50 hotdog and beer with a club card.  This is the best bang for your buck on the strip as far as hotels go.

Dont be fooled by all the nice pictures online and their fancy website. The hotel is nothing like the pictures posted. Instead of a 3 star hotel, it should be a 1 star hotel. The line was very long for check in even though we started it at 1pm, way before 3pm check-in time. They adviced us to keep doing the line because that line was "not a line", they said that at 3pm, the line goes up to the entrance, which is kind of ridiculous, which could mean up to 100-150 people in front of you. We did get our room early, but the room was terrible. Honestly, I've stayed at hostels that are better than this crappy hotel. There were no comforters on the bed, just bed sheets and a silk sheet that was used as the comforter. Our "view" from our window was a white wall, which was from a building next door. The window was covered by a screen (like those used for projectors at school) which unfortunately made it very bright, and the curtains went sideways up to each side of the projector screen) meaning that the curtains didnt even cover the screen and the window. We had to use the silk sheet to cover the projector screen window. I wish I wouldve taken pictures to better illustrate that. Needless to say, the AC unit was the loudest and oldest unit Ive ever seen in my life. Excalibur needs to invest in some renovations. Location is okay if you are willing to walk. I could say that the bathroom was really spacious but nothing fancy. I think thats the only good thing I could say about the hotel room. Dont stay here. Invest on something better for a few more bucks. We will not be staying here. Even tropicana rooms are better. This has been the worst hotel room Ive ever stayed at. This should be called an economy hotel\/inn and shouldnt be part of M life rewards. Such a shame to have such hotel in their chain. Stay somewhere else, please!!!!!

For being a resort on the strip, I was pretty disappointed. Of course, I knew this wasn't a five star hotel, however it is not even a "you get what you pay for hotel," as it is pretty common to have a coffee maker, mini fridge and microwave in your room now a days - at the very least a coffee maker. This place had none of those and it is an extra $22 dollars to rent one per night.

From the minute we walked into the resort, everything was pretty basic. The restaurants were all fast food, except a "Dick's Last Resort," "Johnny Rockets" and the Excalibur Buffet. We ate one meal, late night, from the hotel at the food court and it was not very good. As for the rooms, there are basically two queen-sized beds, a TV and your bathroom. Nothing impressive about it. The pool was nothing special and not worth the $22 per night amenity fee.

I was also extremely disappointed by the customer service. I've worked a long time in the service industry as a server, etc. so customer service is pretty important to me, especially when you are on vacation, the one thing I want is for people to be nice to me. When we tried to check-in there was a very long line and I had a question, so I went to the bell desk, who refereed me to the concierge, who referred me to another line. Every person made me feel like I was wasting their time. We were also barraged with "free tickets for shows" opportunities and the help also tried to get us to sign up for their time share. We were stopped literally every five feet. I know this is part of what Las Vegas does, but Excalibur did it BY FAR AND AWAY the most and it was to the point it was annoying. 

Best part of this hotel - having a Starbucks inside, a walkway that links the Excalibur to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay, as well as a separate walkway to New York New York and the location. I don't think I will be returning to this hotel again.

This is one of those cheaper resorts that's owned by MGM. For the price that you pay, don't expect it to be like MGM Grand or Mandalay Bay. 

Check-ins and check-outs were flawless, as with the rooms. 

There's no WIFI at all in the rooms, which should have been included with the tedious daily resort fee. But you can walk-up to Krispy Kreme in the food court and use their free WIFI there. 

The arcadium in the resort is horrible.

Also, the pool area can be a little better in terms of decor (ex: plant more palm trees?).

I don't think this hotel is the best but I thought it was nice and cozy. I do not see it as a problem. For the price I paid for. I am ok with it. If it was in a brand new condition, I would pay way more than I did for 4 nights. Very close by to places. I cannot complain.

Talk about deja vu. This place reminds me so much of the Nugget in Reno. It's old, has bad services and there's not a lot of games or slots in the casino. Definitely not going to stay here again. Two thumbs down.

I just stayed here for one night because it was cheap and I wasn't going to be spending much time in the room anyway. It's definitely a budget hotel, so keep that in mind. If you need a cheap place to stay on the strip, Excalibur does a decent job, but don't expect 5 star amenities because you won't find them here. 

I booked a standard tower room. The room itself was not impressive. It looked pretty old, but at least the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was kind of nasty looking. The toilet seat even had some yellow stains that I had to clean off, which was disgusting. I'm not sure how housekeeping could have missed those! The internet is only wired though, and there is only one cord, which could be a nuisance for some.  

The casino is pretty good if you're looking for low minimum tables. I played a lot of penny slots and had good luck with those. The crowd is a mix of people on college\/20 year olds budgets and some families. (I guess the castle theme is the closest to Disneyland on the strip. Dad can gamble and mom can see Thunder Down Under while the kids are entertained at the arcade). 

The resort fee does include a $20 credit at bars in the Excalibur and the Luxor, so you can kind of get your money's worth. The pool area is surprisingly pretty nice and large, considering that the rest of the resort looks pretty run down. I only ate at the food court, which had a good selection. 

The location of the hotel is pretty good though. You can even take the Westcliff Airport Express if you don't feel like taking a cab from the airport. Only $2! 

Excalibur looks somewhat enchanting from the outside, but you best not venture in unless you know what you're in for.

Room are nice enough but has a few BIG fails in my book. No wifi in the room is awful.  We were forced to run downstairs to use our tablets because who lugs computers with you for only wired internet. Definitely cut out  spontaneity. The resort fee is a total scam. No resort here. Plus you still have to pay $10 per day to work out. Not that I wanted too, but you had to add up all the fees and see that this great deal isn't all that great.

I wanted to give the recently remodeled rooms a try.

The room itself was pretty good.  The housekeeping did not clean the first day and we had to call, the next day they came really late (around 4PM or so).  The floor was dirty back by the table.  When you turned the water on, the water went everywhere because of the sink. 

At checkout the self-checkout, which was near the elevators were down so we had to go the lobby :( and wait.

I will try a different hotel on the strip the next time.

You know the saying, "you get what you paid for" - Well this hotel is the definite meaning of that.  I'll admit the price was cheap but the quality of the hotel definitely matched the price.  When we arrived and checked in, we had a reservation for a king size bed and they told us that they don't have anymore king size beds available and would we consider a double queen size bed room which ended up being a queen\/full size bed - smallest queen size I ever slept on - I mean c'mon! What was the point of calling it a reservation when it wasn't even reserved for us in the beginning.  Well we eventually got our king size bed the next day, but still it was bad business.  We also noticed the type of people that stayed at these hotels were super ghetto! It was like Compton, East LA, with Rednecks sprinkled around the place all in one...kinda felt like prison :\
Over all I will not be staying here again unless some serious re-modeling has been done to make this place appealing to the eye.

My stay was welcomed by a sales agent pushing me to go to one of there timeshare sales meets; she tricked me by thinking she was showing me the registration desk, I quickly realized I was in the middle of a sales pitch; the room was to be at the updated tower but it was poorly updated; more of a quick renovation with a door Handel missing from the closet and melody on the shower lamp; not impressed at all...
The view from this hotel is really cool at night especially, but the hotel itself is not that great.  It's kind of old and shabby.  The bathtub wasn't very inviting, even for a shower.

No fridge nor microwave in rooms.  Clean rooms yet no conditioner provided, either.  Staff is friendly. Price is decent. Had to pay $70 for parking and resort fee, which is ridiculous! Paid for a late check out yet maid service wasn't aware apparently, because when we walked into our room to get ready to leave from our late check out, after lunch, one of the maids was eating our food rather than cleaning the room! Watch your food in the rooms around here! Manager comped the resort fee for the issue, yet not sure if I would stay here again?!

Excalibur is one of those hotels that looks much more attractive on the outside than on the inside. Decent place to stay for the price though and in Vegas, all you need is a clean shower, bed. as well as working AC.

- the rooms were bigger than i thought...bathrooms were spacious and clean too
- our TV remote didn't work and the decor was worn\/outdated
- the AC worked well and we used it to keep our beer cool haha
- beds were fairly comfy and didn't notice any questionable stains
- the best part was the pool area...there was a waterfall, 2-3 separate pools, music playing, and had cool lounge chairs (not the ugly plastic ones) and free towels
- the casino had my fave penny slot machine!

Not the best but not the worst! I would stay here again for the right price.

This place is a shit show on the weekend! 
It caters to low-class ballers on a budget and looks like a Wal Mart let loose it's Friday night crowd into the venues. 
You won't see many sophisticated people in here. You will see a lot of obese people with Marlboro 100s hanging from their lip and yanking on a Duck Dynasty slot machine. There are so many other casinos to go to.

The room itself was decent. The bed was huge , soft, and clean. The bathroom was stale and old. 

Overall , I think this is a decent at best place to crash; but you will want to spend your waking hours elsewhere.

We almost always stay here when we visit vegas. Mostly because it's affordable for us cause how much time do you actually spend in the room?? Why pay 200+ a night to stay in the room for a few hours?! It's nothing fancy, pretty simple, a little old looking but always clean when we go.  Just a place to sleep and shower and have a little fun

We stayed here for a long weekend vacation before my wife started her Master's program.  We expected a fun medieval experience, since we chose the hotel modeled after a castle.  We did not receive a fun medieval experience.  The only thing medieval at this hotel is the general castle-like exterior facade.

My main reasons why we did not have a good time are as follows:
1. Too many people smoking in the hotel.  If you want to allow people to poison themselves while gambling, set up a sealed off smoking lounge.  Allowing people to force everyone around them (including your employees) to breath in their poisons is the same as saying that you do not care at all about your customers.

2. The valet was the worst I've ever seen (very rude, slow, lazy, and inefficient).  The first time we tried to use them, I sat in the valet line for 20 minutes without seeing a single valet.  The second time, I was berated by the rude valet for pulling into the guest lane before they told me to.  When I picked up my car, they refused to charge it to my room, then stood around in their booth chatting for about 10 minutes before going to get our car.  Horrible!

3. Realistically, there was no security.  We were in and out of our room throughout the day and night.  We say a security guard checking room keys at the elevator once, on the last night we stayed there.  When we did pass that guard, they asked for our room key, I flashed them the first card I thought was it, from my wallet, to which they then glanced back down at their phone (? maybe a book).  Turns out the card I pulled out was my M-Life card, not my room key.  They never even checked out names or anything.  I could have found a room key on the ground.  Either way, I could just go on the weekends, when there is no security.

4. Too many people pestering guests, trying to get them to go look at time-shares.  That is extremely bad for business.

5. It was rather sad that they wanted guests to pay extra to be able to enjoy a pool that was not crowded with unruly kids.  Those kids should have been the ones that had to pay to use a segregated pool.  It's Vegas, not Disney!

6. The spa constantly advertises a couples massage.  When I went to reserve one for my wife and I, I was told that they do not do them anymore, and that I had to go to the Luxor if I wanted to get one.  Aside from being extremely disappointing, that is false advertising.

7. Everything was overpriced in the Excalibur stores; but, I guess that is to be expected.  The worst part was that I could not buy a coke anywhere in the hotel.  Seriously?  Pepsi products only???  People actually drink that?

8. Johnny Rockets was a hotel fast food joint...  Not much to say, the food was under par for a Johnny Rockets (as expected).  And, everything was overpriced (also, as expected).

9. Gambling at the tables and slots was fine, until someone sat down next to me smoking.  I did not pay to sit around and breath in poisonous gases.

My suggestions:
1. Get rid of the smoking in the hotel!  
2. Get some security at the guest elevators, like all the other hotels have.
3. Fire your valet staff.  And, then go watch the free valet at the Stratosphere.  They were actually running from car to car.

The two star rating is only due to the front desk and the concierge, even though they could not get us show tickets.  The concierge price was about 50% higher than the list price on the websites.  Very odd.

I do not believe we will ever return to this hotel.

3.5 stars

I had extremely low expectations. The wait to check-in at 12am  did not make it better. BUT, the coupon book that they gave us had a lot of great deals. The hotel room was cleaner than I expected. I especially love the blue and white theme, which really reminded me of a castle in a children's storybook. This hotel was booked about 100\/night. Keep in mind that they have resort fees. It does not matter when you check, however early or late, they still charge you the resort fee for the dates you booked. Overall pretty decent.
Zenny at the box office was absolutely amazing! Great customer service, love that she was able to help me!

For the price and location on a sold out weekend it will do.
I could bash left n right after having stayed in Paris, Venetian etc...
It will give you a bed to do your business.
At the pool right now, picture Norm from Cheers, your local
Elementary school and a lot of housewives....that's the view.
A beds a bed right.

This place is cheap and on the south end of strip (the side that I prefer personally) the place has not aged well but it is still a viable place to stay. If you want a fun exterior but a not as fun interior for a cheap price, this is your place. It is nice if you are going to thunder down under, since it is in this hotel.

As a visitor whom only goes to Las Vegas twice a year, I have to say that Excalibur Hotel Resort offers great deals and service to individuals whom stay at the resort. Not only is it afortable but its very convient for people whom havent visited the strip, since this resort is right at the being of the strip. My experience when I stayed 3 nights were the BEST, the rooms are always cleanned, i got great customer service, When needing anything or something you can always deal customer service and they provide you with what's needed.

We booked our room through groupons. Of course, we didn't expected a good room. However, we got there EARLY. NO EARLY CHECK IN (Like most hotels) so we paid an extra $10 to upgrade. Do you know what upgrade for them is? A little bit more room and a couch (probably). 

At first we thought it's fine, at least it looks kind of decent. NOPE! Below the beds, there is a huge hole. Just right behind the beds. NO REFRIGERATOR! WTH?! we called and ask APPARENTLY, NEED TO MAKE ANOTHER UPGRADE FOR THAT! ummm...no! 

Customer service? Yeah, don't bother! We called for extra pillows and towels. We got them alright! 3 HOURS LATER! We went out & hoped they would clean our room. BTW NO CLEANING SIGN WHAT SO EVER!!! Came back  11 HOUR(S!!!) LATER. It's STILL A MESS. CALLED TO COMPLAIN TO HOUSE CLEANING. DIDN'T BOTHER TO WANT TO HEAR IT!

WORST HOTEL OF THEM ALL. I WOULD HAVE GIVEN NO STARS IF I COULD!!!!

Its funny that the average review for this place is two and a half stars because that's exactly what I'd give it if Yelp had half stars. 

The Awesome:
a. A 24 HOUR LIQUOR STORE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 

The Good:
b. The pool
c. Cabana rentals at the pool. 
d. The Spa - which all treatments were HALF THE PRICE then the Spa at Mandalay Bay. 
e. Tons of Restaurants
f. Tons of shopping
g. Walk way to the Luxor - Gamble at the Luxor, more on that later. 

The Bad: 
h. The Gambling sucks - Gamble at the Luxor
i. Cocktail waitresses had weird hours. I didn't get approached once for a drink on Thursday night, but was asked 4 times in an hour on Saturday morning at 9AM. 
j. Had to walk to another floor to find a working ice machine. 
k. No ventilation. The casino REEKS. Again, gamble at the Luxor. 

The Ugly:
l. BEER PONG. So freakin' nasty to drink beer after a ball has been in it that was repeatedly dropped on the floor.

So.. My wife & i's July fourth visit was not usual. As soon as I arrived to the elevated parking was rudely greeted by an angry at his job security guard  yelling at other foreign customers . Wtf.really ? Then I got the same anger in my earhole as he proceeded to tell me my truck was too tall to enter. What good sir why are you yelling ? Then he walks away as he realizes he's wrong then shouts at another customer ?? Why is this this allowed at a resort of this caliber ?? Strike one . !  Then my room is dusty ., I mean Gordon Ramsay pissed off angry dusty I cleaned the 3 years of dust air conditioner filters in the shower ..then my wife sat down & moved the ottoman & found some fat girls herpe dirty thong .!! Thank you Excalibur for the bad visit we will never stay here again .!!!  
I've got more details of this lack of attention , edit.!!! 09\/13\/16 Lori p . 
Please stop with this arbitrary guest relations I made calls to the front desk on my visit & nothing was done they just ignored my problems ,due to the busy holiday weekend .
That's how the mgm resorts treat  their paying customers !

tacky? yes! but the whole of vegas is all about being tacky.. but for the price i think its perfect... it's got everything you need and more... the service was good and was even upgraded to a nicer room, so i can't complain too much... their are better hotels for a little extra money but hey at the end of the day as long as its safe and clean then all you need the room for is to sleep in as most of the time you will be out partying along the strip...

Last minute stay in Vegas with kiddos. Felt this would be a better fit than the hard rock for them. 

Room was clean and service was good. Just a dated hotel.
