Biggest issue was. After check in we were stopped 3 times by sales people. Sign up for this and win two free nights, or oh they didn't give you your welcome package. Come here real quick. Go to desk and its same thing. A sales gimmick. I already paid to stay here. I don't need them to push a return stay worse than pan handlers. Especially with kids. 

We walked the strip and were stopped twice more on way in. And this is all by official hotel people. Quite unprofessional and annoying I thought 

We won't be returning. With kids or without.

i amma give this 3 stars...the rooms are inexpensive but its sort of u get what u paid for i guess.  this hotel is good for families with kids thats closer to the strip than circus circus.  

i came here to stay for our honeymoon since most people dont really stay in the rooms when you come to vegas.  plus my husband really likes the whole medieval theme and never been to vegas so i let him choose the hotel as he recalls with the castles haha.  since it was our honeymoon my mother in law had ask the hotel to make and send up a gift basket for us with champagne, fruits, cheese, crackers, and etc.  too bad it came the next day instead of the day we got there.  i probably wouldn't choose this place again unless i have too.

OK - here's my bias on this: I'm not a gambler. I started to go out and gamble one night but fell asleep reading my kid Winnie the Pooh at bedtime and never made it. So right there you know if our perspectives mesh.

Booked this hotel because I read it was family\/kid friendly and still on the Strip (plus it was cheap) and figured we'd give it a spin. Consider it spun. 

The positive: it does seem to be fairly kid friendly for a Strip motel.

What's that you say? Like saying fairly lung friendly for a non-filter cigarette? Yes, you have a point.

Also, it's fairly inexpensive. I can't think of one that was less. 

Lastly location, location, location. Good location. oh, ok - and the check in lady was nice.

Now for what I really think when I'm not trying to be mature:

1) I' incensed over the $5.99 transaction fee at the ATM.
2) Yes, you can print your boarding passes. That'll be $7 for ten minutes on the internet please.
3) room is OK. I've had as good in very small towns in the middle of nowhere.
4) In the midst of having my four year old on the bridge getting his little brain dazzled by the blinking lights I thought to myself -why am I doing this? He was as happy playing tractors in the room.
5) how did I just spend $28 at a Baja Fresh in the hotel for a tummy ache? (two - his and mine)

Which is the point. There are at least a few hotels within a mile of the that do not charge that absurd "resort fee" have a much calmer vibe, better food, a much cleaner pool with less crowding and for less money. Which is what I should have done this time. And will do next time.

Excalibur? Never again.

I've stayed at many hotels in LV and this time we stayed at Excalibur because we now have a child. It was a very child-friendly location with a "kid casino" called the fun dungeon. The rooms were nice and we had an excellent view of the strip from the 9th floor. Hotel service was wonderful. The M Life VIP check in was quick and we got to bypass the long reservations line because we had M Life comps. 

Now the not so excellent side...resort fees supposedly include all your necessities that a resort would cover. This hotel did not have wifi in the rooms. They charge an additional $20 per day on top of room fees (though our room was comped we still had to pay the resort fees). The wifi in the lobby was very limited and seating in the area was limited as well. They do have a few computers that you can purchase internet access on for .50 per minute!! wow, shouldn't that at least be free to hotel guests? They do include free long distance calls from the room but these days most people have a cell phone and a laptop and would rather have wifi than free long distance. As a person who travels for business\/pleasure wifi is a must!!

It would also be great if there were NON smoking sections in a casino where so many people with children walk through the area to get to the shops and rooms.
The staff was very helpful here and things were clean and up to date in the rooms.

I have stayed at the Excalibur 4 times, the most recent this past weekend. I was in town to see Michael Bubl, not really a Vegas person and don't even gamble to speak of, but go up once in awhile for a concert and have stayed at New York, Luxor, Monte Carlo and several others. I like the Excalibur for two reasons: Price and location, location, location! My room was in Tower 1 and it looked and smelled fresh. I didn't encounter any rude staff or see dirt anywhere and last I checked I am not deaf, blind or stupid. I had a great view and my only negative is no wi fi in the rooms at this hotel, just in the public areas. Crazy! But hells bells, it was cheap! You can spend the money you save elsewhere! I am just not that impressed with big fat casinos all trying to out lavish each other. I like old, classic hotels and Excalibur is kind of generic, but you aren't going to find old, classic digs in Vegas, it!s all about the glitz. It is nice to waltz through some of the fancy casinos just like the rest of the peasants but not be stuck with a huge bill so yay for me and yay for Excalibur! 3 stars for my room and an extra star for the hotel's great location. BTW, another reviewer complained about a rude waitress, if you visit Dick's Last Resort you had better do some research, the wait staff is supposed to insult you. I first heard about Dick's in Chicago and the word on the street is you should be insulted if they don't insult you. In closing, I am sorry for those who had a bad experience at the Excalibur, but also baffled. Maybe parallel universes are real. That's all I got.

A true 2 star hotel.  Two word best describe this hotel.  "Coconut butter".  This hotel smells like coconut butter\/carpet cleaner\/ smoke.  Your clothes smell like it after 20 mins in the hotel.

The staff are alright.  Always trying to sell you something.  I did get a room upgrade for free but it was the size of a regular room but with a rock hard king size bed with I think bed bugs and a scary soaker tub..  I am guessing it has seen it's share of action.  

I was forced to stay at this hotel because of a conference.  The only area that has wifi is the conference rooms.  I had to use a cable in the room.  

I would not recommend you this hotel unless it is your thing to stay cheap.

Been 39 days since I stayed at Excaliber and have heard nothing from them. They pick and choose I guess who they respond to on Yelp.   Looks like  I will stay at the Mirage or Treasure Island from now on since they don't care about customer service at the castle.  I

I do not recommend staying here. It's a rip off. I paid extra for a renovated room as per other Yelp reviews. I had a view of the parking lot although I requested a view of the strip when upgrading and checking in. Check in\/registration was a nightmare. Long, depressing, inefficient line. Not want you want to deal with after a long flight. Please don't include your generic: you get what's available response. That will make matters worse. Not appreciated. 

The "renovated" room I was (Royal Tower) in does not appear to have been renovated in a decade. The TP holder was rusted over. A roll was shoved in there so you couldn't even dispense the sandpaper tissue provided. The shower head was full of green calcium build up. There was a nasty looking stain in the shower. I wore flip flops to be safe. There was only one pillow on one of the beds. I asked housekeeping for another pillow twice but didn't receive one. Wifi never worked. Room was smokey, walls were paper thin so you can hear all the neighboring guests. Other rooms drunk dialing in the middle of the night. 

No interest in the pool. 

Water bottle in the hotel is $3-$4 dollars. This was the most egregious in my opinion. The food options are terrible and overpriced. 

The casino is dark, smokey, and very outdated. They have the nerve to charge a $30 resort fee for this dump.  No refrigerator in the room. No amenities. Just extra fees for basic services. There are several hard sell employees for timeshare tours around the hotel. Disgusting practice by this filthy, money hungry, poorly managed hotel. Harassing you every time you pass them in the hotel several times a day. 

I do not recommend. Even Circus Circus is a better option if you are looking for a budget hotel. Pay a little more and avoid a frustrating vacation at a rip off "resort" you plan your hard earned vacation days and money for. 

Please do not provide me with a generic response like you have with the other reviews. They are condescending and insulting. Management clearly has no interested in making this a nice hotel. Your generic response just makes things worse. There has been no effort to improve the issues that have been repeatedly been pointed out.

Stayed here just this past weekend for two nights . The price is decent, i guess for a hotel on the strip. Needs a little renovation. I liked how the security checks your card key before entering the elevator. Make sure you belong and aren't an intruder .Very comfy beds and fluffy pillows.  Overall , i liked it .

So, you want to go to Vegas.

And you don't want to shell out for Bellagio or MGM.

And you don't want to stay at the no-tell motel where you have to wonder - is that stain on the sheet spaghetti sauce? blood? other bodily waste?

You get the picture. 

Well, then Excalibur is the place for you. The Vegas version of a medieval castle, they captured the "dark that no sunlight can penetrate" quality that is no doubt quite authentic. However, it is also quite centrally located. I had a conference at MGM and Excalibur was literally across the street, which made my life easy. I'm a walker, so I traveled up and down the Strip on foot, but if you don't want to trek so extensively,  you can easily catch the Monorail at MGM. Also, Excalibur, Luxor, and Mandalay Bay are all connected by shuttle and escalators so you can wander among three casino\/hotels for the price of one! 

The rooms are budget but the cost is budget, too. The beds are clean and reasonably comfortable. There is no desk but the table with chairs is suitable for work. The bathroom is large enough, with a roomy shower stall. (No bathtub, so if that's really important to you, there you go. You'll have to shower.) Personally, my biggest gripe was no WiFi (really?) and being constrained by wired Internet. I felt like I'd been transported back to 2005. Otherwise, my room left me with no complaints. 

There are some okay restaurants and shows (the joust is fun and they have the Thunder from Down Under if you're looking to check out a different kind of sword fight) but even if you're not into what Excalibur has to offer, the location makes up for it. Seriously, just go to any one of the myriad of entertainment options within a very short walking distance. 

Overall, Excalibur is what you probably expect it to be. It's not luxurious. People crazy enough to bring children to Vegas often stay there. It's a little old and tired and depressing (especially in the casino section) but it is what you're probably looking for if you're scouring reviews about this establishment: a convenient, relatively clean and safe place to crash on the Vegas Strip.

It was way overpriced and perhaps it was due to the spring break season. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The air quality in the rooms could be improved. For some reason it always felt muggy in the room even with the air on. The bathrooms are large and spacious which is great especially when sharing with other ladies. 

I loved that we could access the Luxor via the indoor walkway. The late night hours of Krispy Kreme were also greatly appreciated. In terms of food options, donuts were the only thing I tried. Most of their options include fast food options and more family friendly places. The Champagne Brunch Buffet was decent for the price but we waited an extremely long time to get seated. 

After a long night on the town I wanted to rest and recover but as soon as I laid down all I could hear was the club music booming from outside. The hallways and windows are not fully sound proof. I'm not eager to return to this hotel.

Never again . The place was dirty. No coffee pot. No fridge . Smelled like smoke when no smoking room . Safe didn't work. Not told about resort fee. Rude at the front desk check in and check out. No tub

We booked this Hotel for the weekend, we chose the Royal tower room thinking it would be nice, just okay, we've stayed at quite a few Hotels in Las Vegas, and sadly this is the first one that didn't have a coffee maker with complimentary coffee or even water in the room. We paid for 2 buffets to be included in our package and once at check in we're told only breakfast or lunch we're covered with no additional fee but if we chose dinner we had to pay the difference, that wasn't mentioned when we chose it, sad to say I'm disappointed with this stay.

This place has lots of mixed reviews. I never wanted to stay here because of them. I came across a very good deal on Priceline for last week (Tuesday-Friday) and my Husband and I decided to take that chance. Oh well, you usually don't spend time in the room right? We arrive, no line at the registration counter as we are checking in 3 hours prior to our check-in time our customer service represenative "waives" the $20.00 early-in fee (SCORE!), we walk to our room and the room smelled good (non-smoking), high floor (28), and a very nice view of the strip! We got the cheapest room, $48.00 a day including the $20.00 resort fee. Our King bed was so comfy, carpet was cleaned, TV worked and was big, bathroom was big and clean, the towels were soft, white and had no stains. we LOVED our stay and espeically for the price! Thank YOU EXCALIBUR!

Excalibur Hotel - a medieval castle. It is a haven for children. Designed in the style of King Arthur, on the walls of the mosaic, swords and shields, and the heavy ceiling chandeliers.
Between many hotels have elevated crossings, such a bridge, not to cross the road
The impression is that all who come to Vegas for families with children living in this hotel - so many children, so often noisy and vain.
For service claims are not in the room all well. It is a pity there is no Wi-Fi.
Eating a lot for different tastes, including chic buffet. There is a children's floor machines - Fun Dungeon, where all the children and directed not to interfere with the parents play in the casino.

Chuck* the bartender sure did satisfy my craving for a delicious before-the-road bloody mary.


*Not actual name.

When driving into the Excalibur, you might imagine you're going to be entering a Disney-style environment.  After all, the castle motif looks like the entrance to Fantasyland.  Once inside, you go from Disney to dismal.

This hotel has been around for a while and is showing its age.  Upon checking in, I was informed we would be charged a $9.95 "resort fee"  that included a free newspaper, use of the fitness center, a reduced rate facial and massage as well as free internet usage.  To get the newspaper you had to walk down to their mini-store to retrieve it and show the coupon.  We all have internet use on our phones or Ipad so never needed their connection.  A facial--hardly!  The bottom line, we didn't use any of these and were still charged for them.  

The elevator entrance reeked of a less than sanitary odor. Upon entering the room, we noticed the hall light didn't work, there was no soap, and we had trouble getting the lamps to work.  The furniture appeared to be left-overs from the Clinton years, the beds were too soft, and the room cramped. Also, no coffeemaker or microwave.

The cleaning people did the minimal.  One day they didn't even come to touch up the room.  At 12 am, we had to call housekeeping just to get some clean towels and additional soaps and shampoo.

Took my daughter down to the arcade.  Hardly high-tech fun.  She blew $20.00 on a couple of games, turned in her tickets for some 99 Cent Store-type prizes and pledged never to come back again.

Based upon our experience, Excalibur is hardly of high caliber.

I see a lot of people complaining about the room and I suppose I will start there as well. I paid to stay at this hotel Friday- Monday. The price was cheaper than most, but not by much. Our room stunk horribly like bad perfume and cigarettes. The blanket on my bed had a cigarette burn in it, and the second queen bed in our room had some random short black hairs. My personal favorite was the pubic hairs in the shower!  After being already irritated by my room  I come to find out that the front desk woman Cynthia who checked me in left my debit card on file (open) and it double charged my card. I would not have been so mad about this if I hadn't JUST asked her if she needed a credit card on file, she told me she didnt need a deposit. Nothing made me more pissed off then when she told me in a smiling voice that it would only take (10-15 days) for my money to go back on my card......I'm not sure what part of I WAS ON VACATION they didn't get, but when they take a good chunk of your money it really messes with your trip! To make up for it they offered me breakfast at the hotel buffet.....I could not believe they would not do anything for me to make up for the money that THEY took! They tried to blame my bank & they said I have a shitty bank for them holding the funds.....I will never go back to Excalibur again & that it pretty shitty because this hotel has been the main one that my friends & family chose to stay at. I ended up leaving Sunday morning, because I could not stand to be in a place where I felt totally taken advantage of!
We had a great experience, rooms are better than expected! They really upgraded there rooms and services.. We will be back soon

Excalibur, our home away from home. 

Our first time staying at Excalibur was February 2015 for my husbands birthday, he was turning 34 and had never been to Vegas. A friend recommended Excalibur to us, since then we never stay anywhere else. My husband loves to gamble and play the slot machines, being MLife members, his addiction is a plus. He constantly gets offers to stay at the hotel for free and they'll even throw in playing credit and food credit. We came 3 times last year and as I'm writing this review we are driving from California to Vegas for the 3rd time this year. All 6 times we've stayed at Excalibur. We have never had a problem with house keeping or the rooms themselves. We did however have a problem one time with someone coming into our room and taking money out of my wallet. We filed a report and they checked the cameras and all that good stuff but basically they said it was our fault for not "making sure" the door closed properly after we headed out for the night. I tried getting in touch with management, see if maybe they could comp us in any way but had no luck. Still didn't\/hasn't stopped us from staying at Excalibur, we just double check the doors now. My husband and I bring our nieces during the summer, they have nice pools and a waterslide for the kids. My girls also love the arcade at Excalibur.

So we stayed here for cheer competition and my fiances first time in vegas. I was a little bummed at the service we recieved his first time in Vegas. First of all when we checked in I asked for a higher floor so he could see more of the strip but we ended up getting the 6th floor....ok whatever. Then we get in the room and I see a hole on the wall by the window...ok fine its not the best of hotels...well my last straw was the yellow stains on the bathroom carpet!!!! like really you couldnt bleach that or throw it away!!! The casino service wasnt any better either. We sat down to gamble and it took the cocktail waitress 20 min to get to us and we waited another 15 min and never got our drink...Over all not happy with this hotel.

Stayed here for a few nights in December.  Definitely not the best place on the strip, but it wasn't bad.  The price isn't bad, I think I ended up paying 40 a night.  What I did like is that it is close to some of the other hotels and clubs, so not too bad of a walk.  I think next time I'm in Vegas, I'll upgrade to another hotel, but I wouldn't hesitate to stay here either if there were no other options

The Hotel staff was nice and the bell staff was awesome . They helped us with unloading our bags and loaded our bags when we departed.  Excalibur  is the hotel you would want to stay if you have little kids. They have an awesome  food court and a big arcade for the little ones. The hotel is old  but  its very clean.  Its not like we stayed in our room much but it was usable  to sleep beds were comfortable  . Its along  the strip and its within walking distant from everything. I recommend  staying  at the Excalibur and will return for our future  visit.
Nice beds and pillows, otherwise it's a dump!  Ants in bathroom!

Great value for what we paid.

Room was huge.  Bathroom big too.  Place was seriously worn, but serviceable.

Hotel hall smelled musty (but they all seem to).  Casino was smokey (but again, they pretty much all are).  

Staff was friendly, especially the lady at the ticket booth.

Arcade downstairs was a big hit with the kids.  There is a Dairy Queen down there too.  Food court worked well for the entire family.

The pool was extremely dirty on the first day.  Foul actually.

Went to a different pool the second day (the one with the slide) and that was an entirely different experience.  Clean and fun. Enjoyed that second pool a lot.

Would stay there again if on a budget.
Great hotel and experience for the price , the hotel itself has many diverse dining and gaming :) I'm going back this summer again !

I didn't stay here but I will always stop in for some gambling and maybe a bite to eat. There are plenty of slots and tables for gambling. I didn't win this time but no fault to the casino.

This place seems to be packed all the time. I haven't checked out a show here before but they do have a deal where you can buy tickets for about $50 for 2 shows. It would be something to consider in the future or if you want to do Vegas on the cheap.

I stayed here with three of my friends the second week of January for 4 nights, which was my first Vegas trip.  It was just "okay"..definitely nothing special.  The reason we booked it was because of the price..which we soon learned why.  

Pros:
- It is connected to Luxor which was great since we went to LAX and the Titanic Exhibit.
- It was the only hotel on the strip that I actually won some money when playing the machines! (But, then again, I lost all of my winnings there too...)  
- The beds were comfy (we stayed in Tower 1, floor 12)
- Nice showers
- Thunder From Down Under (great show! Best part of the hotel!)

Cons:
- Being hassled the SECOND we walked in the door with our luggage..first by two guys that made you think were from the Thunder Show (they were not), then by people trying to get you to go to shows.  EVERY time I walked by them my entire trip, they hassled me..LEAVE US ALONE!
- The outlet fried my super expensive hair straightner. I later heard from other people they had the same thing happen...please be careful plugging in things!!
- The restaurants there are just mediocre.  Nothing special at all. When we got in at 3 in the morning once, the only thing open in the entire place was McDonalds and they were only accepting cash.  I thought more things would be open late...I didn't understand that at all. 
- The hotel room itself was VERY outdated.  Wallpaper falling off of the walls, an AC unit you'd see at a Super 8, no complimentary waters, creepy light fixtures.
- The line to check in was SUPER long.  It was the week of the CES convention, maybe they should get extra staff there for something like that?  
- At the end of the strip.  Next time I go to Vegas, I will be staying somewhere more centrally located.  It's definitely worth the extra cash to stay in the middle compared to the end.
- The $15 per day resort fee is RIDICULOUS.  You don't get any extra amenities...no coffee makers, no free breakfast, no WIFI (there is a router to hook your computer to, doesn't accommodate for 2013 with smart phones and tablets), the only thing is they cleaned our room everyday, but that is what you pay for to begin with.  That fee is unnecessary. 

All in all..did I enjoy my experience there? Meh.  It was okay.  Compared to all of the other hotels we went to on the strip, this was definitely on the low side of luxury.  Will I stay there again, probably not.  If you are trying to decide if you are going to stay here or not, if another place on the strip is a few bucks more..go there.

We were here for valentines weekend \/ President's weekend. Our friends were staying at the Venetian, and because we had waaay too many people in that room, we decided to get a room at the cheapest possible location. Excalibur was super cheap, and it wasnt bad. The rooms arent super far from the entrance (like Venetian, where you have to walk almost 15-20 minutes to get to your room), and there is a real convinient walk-way to the strip.  We spent most of our time gambling at Planet Hollywood, but the walk from the Excalibur was not bad at all. 

Honestly, if you're in Vegas, you're going to be out and about most of the day, and when you do go back to your room to change, ect, you have no time to lose. I honestly wouldnt mind staying here again.  It's cheap and convinient!

This is an awesome hotel if a bunch of friends plan on going to Vegas, getting wasted on the strip, and don't want to pay a lot for a hotel room they aren't going to spend a lot of time in.  The location is good, on the southwestern area of the strip.  I stayed here for work a few years ago, so who can complain about a paid trip to Vegas, right?  I wouldn't stay here again though, unless I went back in time to my college days where money was tight and the girls didn't care where they laid down.

After our Yellowstone trip we checked in at Excalibur for our last night before heading back to California. 
At registration, we decided to get the last 2 upgraded rooms. The rooms were smaller and more expensive than the regular rooms.. 

It was two queen beds per room, the bathroom was decent but no tub :(

My in laws room was the worst! It was the same exact room as ours but they woke up the next morning with no light! Had to shower with the door open because of that issue. I just thank God we didn't stay in the same room lol

They were constantly having to go back to the front and stand in line time after time to get new cards because the card reader on the room was not working. It was such a hassle having to waste your vacation time on having to do that.

Definitely not a way to end your trip.

Adding an extra star to my review because during my last stay, they upgraded my room gratis to a widescreen renovated room! I love those rooms! And I originally booked the rooms that were dirt cheap! Thank you, Excalibur! Not too shabby... 

People have gotta stop the hate on here- go to a different hotel if you're expecting classy digs all over the hotel. This isn't the type of place to expect five star accommodations. It's still located in a prime location on the Strip and I'll be happy to book here again for my next stay.

Stayed in a standard room (these are located in Tower I), 25th floor, with a view of the Luxor, (I believe the other view from Tower I is of the Strip).  The room had a King Size bed, large flat screen TV, large bathroom (shower stall, no tub) with hair dryer), table and chairs, and ethernet powered internet access.

The bed was very comfortable, we had no problem sleeping and woke refreshed with no pain.  

There were no problems with the room at all.  It was cozy with enough room to mill about, stash our suitcases, sleep comfortably.  The rumor is that the contemporary rooms (renovated) are in Tower II.  I wasn't expecting spectacular decor since we did not choose a contemporary room.  Aside from the carpet (not bad) and the drapes (a tad dated, but it is a medevil castle), the room felt very modern with an updated bedspread, comfy chairs and newer furniture.

We experienced a repair man that came to our room because someone called with a broken air conditioning unit and gave them our room number on accident.  (But hey props to them for wanting to fix it immediately, too bad it was the wrong room.)

The only issue was that the internet worked rather sporadically.  Even when connecting by ethernet cable it was hard to get it to work, it often said there was no connection.... this wasn't our laptop error either as it has never happened before or since.  

We DID NOT get bed bugs despite the many reviews that mention them.

We were perfectly happy.  This is a great hotel if you need to save money somewhere and don't mind a no-frills room.  I will certainly consider this on my next visit as well.
Been coming here for craps for a while- this morning, Dec. 17th, 2016 around 10am, the craps crew ARE RUDE to customers. I had very bad time and wish I had not come here this morning.

Parking costs $15. A night. No good restaurants in the "resort" the pool situation is: unless you pay you get zero shade unless you're there in the morning. It just felt like there was a fee for everything. I couldn't find a good bar. To be honest we had more fun in other casinos and did not look around. I wouldn't recommend of going to Vegas without children.

Sunday night check went smooth and staff was polite. The room was better than basic and had an excellent TV. The air conditioning was a little loud but it could be turned off without the room getting hot. I asked for and received a quiet room away from elevators and major foot traffic. At only about $30 (before all the BS fees and such) It was a value. I was also given a thick book of useful coupons. If you're looking to save on your hotel this is much better deal than Circus Circus, a much older, less well maintained hotel.
My most recent stay at the Excalibur was fantastic! I manage to get rooms for $36\/night on a Thursday and Sunday. Definitely the best bang for the buck on this end of the strip.

I have to say that Vange at the front desk with the mermaid finger nails(if you saw them you know what I mean!) is the friendliest and kindest front desk clerks I have ever come across! After standing in a long line of whiny, grumpy adults who are all ready to let loose but are having to wait to check in she was a breath of fresh air!! So I just wanted to come and say thank you Vange!! You are a gem!!

Everything about this hotel was awesome BUT...... the reason I'm rating one star is due to their poor lost and found services and their house keeping that I think keeps found items they may like and not want to turn in.... I left a brand new 130$ swim suit on the back of the bathroom door yes my fault but I called only two hours after leaving on a Sunday only to be told lost and found is closed and no one could even attempt to look for my item left behind until Monday .... Come Monday I finally speak with lost and found and they have no trace of my lost item and actually tell me that about 5 other guests from the same day reported left items behind the bathroom door and nothing had turned up for any of these guests (why even tell me that?)..... Leads me to believe they have a problem with their house keepers keeping found items!!!
Quick checkin. Was upgraded to a higher floor and moved to resort tower. Room was spacious and view was amazing.

I thought this place was like 50 years old.

Turns out it's only 20 or so.

For a nominal price, you too could be part of the living ugly.

Good location though.

This hotel wasn't ready for the amount of guests that it booked. They double booked our room even though we had made reservations months in advance. we were finally given a room (hours later).  we went out to enjoy our day\/night, when we came back we discovered our keys no longer opened our doors. We had to  go back down to the lobby at 4am to get new keys.  To top off this horrific weekend stay,the hotel has a  resort fee that they neglect to tell you about when you check-in.  However,  I asked Prytzel (my desk clerk) if there were any other fees I needed to pay when I checked in.  She said "no unless you use room service." I had to debate with my check-out clerk, Cora, about not paying this fee that was not mentioned to me at my check-in or displayed at the check-in counter. This place is terrible. We will not stay here ever again.

Stayed here for 3 days, approximately 4 days after I got home, I discovered we had brought bedbugs with us. If I could given them a 0 on the rating, thats exactly what it would be. The management has yet to return my phone call. The person I spoke to said that there was never any other complaints made on that particular room. If you look at their website you will see that there has been many complaints made about bedbugs at this hotel. I will never stay at this hotel ever again. The management sucks and could care less about the bedbug issue, cause they already have your money and there is not way to prove where it came from, I'm 61 and never have I ever experienced bedbugs. Please learn from my experience and check out any hotel that you plan to visit.

Let me start by asking, do I have to give them a whole star? This place need to be torn down and completely rebuilt.  

I started in a room in the old part of the hotel.  Rooms were old,  smelled of smoke and wet carpet. The smell was so bad I had to get a different room.  I asked for an upgrade at check in and was told they didn't have anything available, but after my brother had a tantrum they moved us to the newer part of the hotel. It was a lot better until it a\c leaked over the carpet and that is when we found the mildew. Unbelievable!  So as we were moving into our third room in Two days,  all I could say was i am never coming here again. 

Would you believe they moved someone into the mildew room later that night? This place is horrible. Did I say horrible? In case I didn't say it. Let me say it.
 This place is horrible. Oh and the smoke. It is like licking ashtrays all day long.

Avoid this place like the plague.

This place is raunchy, smelly, dirty and loud.
Avoid it at all cost!
The armpit of Las Vegas.

I ended up booking a room here on vegas.com because of the free wifi at the local krispy kreme. It just blows me away that at just about every hostel i've ever stayed at has free wifi to its guests and most hotels still charge for this service.

Anyways, one of the things going for this place is that the table limits are cheaper here versus the rest of the strip since $5 minimums seem to be going the way of the dodo bird.
 
By the way if you eat at Dick's last resort  the whole atmosphere revolves around being made an ass of or being oogled if your a good looking gal. So just giving a clue because i was there with some buddies and we were gonna stiff the bartender until we figured out the gig.

Also, if you are into the miniskirt pole dancing scene feel free to hang around the place they were all gyrating near the restaurant so if the game wasn't  interesting you had something else to view.

I guess it must go with the medieval theme to NOT have coffee pots in the room! That's pretty Middle Ages! We ended up having to bring our own, and, unless you want to pay $13 a pot (plus tip) for room service, or go wandering through the smelly, smoky casino in the morning looking for a coffee shop, I would recommend you bring one too. Other than that, the rooms were fine and we got a good deal on Booking.com.

Never again.

I am a big fan of the MGM Properties and I am an elevated Member of the Mlife Players Club, so when I was told I could get an upgraded room here at the Excalibur for basically next to nothing.  I just had to jump on it.

Big Mistake.

Amenities that were promised in the suite were not there, had to call for it but never got there.  Part of the cabinet in the sink was broken, even had the house keeping supervisor come and take a look at it, and she said she'd call engineering on Day 1.  On Day 3 when I left still broken.  A\/C didn't work either, the controls had ran out of battery so I called guest service to fix it.  Apparently they took the controls off the wall, and then cracked open the protective case for the AC unit, then and only then could I control the AC unit.

The facility itself is a bit rustic, but I mean I guess it goes with the theme.  The cleanliness of it when I went down to gamble on the floor and on the sports book, well you can tell it's been wiped down, but nothing had been scrubbed.  

I would definitely take a look at other properties in the MGM chain because I am a fan, but yeah not staying here again.

I love this place, when I bring my 6 year old with me to Vegas, this is the place to stay.  I've also stayed here child-free as well.  If you have kids with you, this is the perfect place.  Waterslide at the pool and the waterslide is connected to a shallow pool.  There's an arcade inside, the Tournament of Kings show, it's walking distance to many shops.  There's a McDonalds inside for the kids.  Even if you're staying without kids, they have a small 18+ pool, and another large pool.  The thing I love most about this place, it's very fairly priced but not gross like Circus Circus, I've always had good customer service experiences here.  The only thing I'm going to complain about....that stupid $15 per night resort fee which is the only reason why my rating is so low.  We've stopped staying here and are opting for hotels that do not charge the fee.  I don't like being forced to pay for things I will not use.  So have booked a room for my son and I for Golden Nugget instead.

This used to be a decent hotel.  I will never stay here again!  The customer service is terrible and the manager didn't have any better customer service.   The rooms are outdated and if you want an updated room it cost extra.  Why not just update all the rooms?!  This place is turning into Circus Circus.... trashy.

My friend and I planned to take a weekend trip to Las Vegas during Spring Break. We planned 8 months prior, since I checked my school schedule. Just so happened the weekend we ended up going, so many events were happening, such as the Guns N Roses concert, Pacquiao vs Bradley fight and our friends wedding. We originally had no plans and just want to wing it when we arrive. My trip to Las Vegas is long overdue; many years passed since my last visit. There are so many changes! When we finally got to the hotel after our late flight through the rain and the car rental place, we pulled up to see if we can get valet parking. The valet parking lot sign said full. We were greeted by the Bell Hop who took our bags. He hooked us up with the valet attendant and we were able to get our car valeted. Leaving San Diego in the rain to go to Vegas in 73 degree weather at 10pm was interesting. We ended up bringing the rain with us to Vegas. It rained the whole weekend we were there. We went to the registration desk to check in. After waiting in line with a few families ahead of us, I noticed the line got bigger after us. We just made it in a nick of time! We were able to get our room on the 2nd floor. The view from our room was of the Pyramid and street. We kept our curtains closed. Once we got settled in the room and had our bags delivered, we walked around the casino area. The person who checked us in mentioned to sign up for an M Life players card. This card will give your perks on discounts and play credits once you earn enough points. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We were famished the first night we arrived. We ate a one of their restaurants inside the hotel. It was a little late when we discovered that there were other restaurants on the second level of the casino. When you make a purchase at participating restaurants within the hotel, save your receipt to get credit on your M Life card. Our first night at the hotel wasn't too bad. Our room was nice, but the shower head pressure in the bathroom was very low, so it took a little longer to take a shower. Although valet always seemed full, they managed to take care of their hotel guests and provide parking. Their valet guys are friendly and on point, when it comes to remembering their hotel guests. Our second night at the hotel turned out to be a little crazy. As I was in a deep sleep, my friend was woken up by two bickering girls in the room next to us, between 5am-6am. Not good! I woke up when I heard her pick up the room phone right next to me. She waited awhile to see if the noise level would go down. Since it didn't, she called the front desk to complain that our neighbors were being too loud. They sent security up to check it out. By that time, the noise level went down and not a peep came out of that room. The security guard was helpful and friendly. He said to call back if it happens again. Approx 30 min later, they were at it again. Another phone call to the front desk. Security came up the second time and actually heard them raise their voices. He knocked on their door to tell them to tone it down. They apologized and agreed, so we thought it was taken care of. I tried to go back to sleep. My friend was riled up, she ended up going downstairs in the casino to play. I couldn't sleep, because 10 minutes later, they were at it again. After my friend returned from the casino, she called the front desk one last time to see if we can be moved to a different room. They were accommodating and provided us a room on the 28th floor. This room was on the same side with a better view and the shower head pressure was so much better. Our last night there felt more like a nice, calm and relaxing vacation. Too bad we couldn't feel like that the whole weekend of our stay. I was able to accumulate some M Life points to put toward our room. My friend was able to fix the issue of that unexpected hiccup and spoke with the hotel manager. She saved us more money that weekend. All-in-all we enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Extremely disappointed in this hotel at every turn. Will not ever return. So many other cool hotels in Vegas. We were lied to and over charged and not once did this hotel do anything for our wedding\/honeymoon. Horribly unimpressive rooms. Embarrassing for Las Vegas.

I stayed here Monday and before we could even check in we were escorted by someone who looked like they worked at the hotel to and unmarked desk having asked this guy where the check in counter was I thought we were there and they started offering free nights stay and all this other stuff for $50 cash so I give them the cash, stupid I know but figured it was legit being in the hotel. Turns out it was for a timeshare scam and they cart you off before you know what happens and then after 3 hours at the timeshare thing I left without being given the free nights or anything promised. Then went we got back to the hotel no less than 4 of those scumbag employees of theirs tried to rope me into the scam again, eventually leaving me so utterly annoyed have chosen to never walk into that joke of a casino again.

I booked on Priceline for $39\/ night and am very impressed.  The room is clean and as nice as any other room I've stayed at on the strip.  The beds are comfy and I have a great view.  Kristi at the activities desk is amazing and went above and beyond to make sure I had a great stay.

My Sister and her family returned to their room yesterday to find that two IPads and a few other itmes were stolen.  Hotel staff was not very helpful and they will not get any reimbursement for stolen items.   In reading other reviews it seems that this is not out of the ordinary.  Do not stay here!!

BIOHAZARD!

Here are a few things to be aware of before you book a room at the Excalibur:

1. Wear shoes! The carpet is FULL of hair. I had a blister bandaid on, and it picked up enough hair to weave a wig.

2. Check the MATTRESS!!! We do anyway for bedbugs, but we did not expect to find a URINE stained mattress.

3. We were switched to a new room after we encountered the pee bed. The next room was the one covered in hair, and also featured crusted boogers on the (clearly) unwashed blanket.  This was the blanket you're intended to sleep with, not the top cover. 

4. The towels were old and stained, and the room itself was furnished with items that a thrift store would probably reject. 

If you're looking for a cheap hotel and don't mind a dingy, dirty, "wear a hazmat suit" kind of experience, Excalibur is your hotel! 

If you're not in Vegas to gamble on whether you may or may not get an STD from your hotel room toilet, try the Luxor.

You get what you pay for here! Got to the hotel around 1130 and was quickly put into a line to check my bag and told check in wasn't till 3pm. As I was standing in the line I looked over to the check-in desk and saw that people where checking in. Walked over and got in line. Employee came up and asked if I was checking in and I said yes. She told me that there was no rooms available but that if I pay $20 I could get a room right now. WTF!! I have arrived at other hotels around the same time and never been scammed like that before. So I decide to pay the $20 and wait. Got to the counter and my room wasn't available so they gave me a room that was supposedly the same but then figured out that it wasn't. Ended up getting a pool Cabana for Sunday. The pool area was filthy, cigarette buds all over the ground, couch pillows had stains as well as the lounge chair pillows. When the Cabanna host opened our cabana there was trash everywhere. She quickly picked up the trash and apologized. So again, u get what you pay for.

My bf and I received an email for a special price for this place during Nov\/Dec. for low as $22.00 = with tax it was $28. however when we ckd out thats whent hey tack on the "resort fees" ah... I knew there had to be a catch! dang it. 
But all in all still a great deal. Its on the corner of Trop & LV Blvd. right across from MGM Grand, NYNY and Tropicana. CANT beat the location. 

CASINO: I had an old friend come into town taht was staying @ the hooters hotel - so we got this room the first night they wer ein town. We had so much fun here mostly b\/c of Casino wars. They fell in love w\/ that game. Ive lived in LV for over a year and managed to still never play the tables, can you believe it? NEVER. well I finally played and the lady NAMED KAREN was the rudest table person I've ever encountered or met. OMG she was so freakin rude to me. but nice to the young white guy -not being racial but sexual. Poor lady I pity her. She yelled b\/c I had my cell phone faced down, she yelled b\/c I had my cell fone faced up. she yelled b\/c I put it in my bra. (what do you want me to do with my dang phone lady? I dont have a purse to put it in.)  then she yelled at me b\/c about a mm of my chip was not in the designated circle. Really? 
she yelled, " it needs to be put in the center of the circle or you cant play!" 
wow. we took her for another $50 each (my bf and I ) and cashed out . what a wickedly ugly person. I hope that hotel knows what kind of Monster Karen is - @ casino wars @ 10pm on 11\/14\/10. 

HOTEL: now for the hotel. It was a cheaper room sO i wasnt expecting much but they had no bathtubs in the hotel, only showers so it was that sliding door business. Yuck. I was reluctant to shower there since I live in town but I wanted to wash the smell of smoke off me before leaving.. and maybe I could make it out to my car without reaking again.

Parking:  Its free but there is no connection from the parking garage to the hotel - this is strange b\/c I'd never been to a casino that didnt have this connection with the exception of excalibur and the luxor. 

BEST part of this hotel is that it connects to Mandalay Bay and the Luxor without having to go outside at all, esp. when its cold\/rainy outside. be sure to cross on the 2nd floor.

The Excalibur gets two stars only because the Chapel did a fantastic job while every other aspect was a nightmare.  The AC in the room didn't work right and I was left with a sinus issue that's had me coughing up a lung for 4 days.  We were put in tower one which is the worst.  Avoid that tower at all cost!  
Everything looks dirty except the Chapel, again the only highlight.  Basically tear down the whole thing except the chapel and the pool and start over.  
The security guards are rude when they give important information and it seems like the right hand doesn't talk to the left.  I had to walk half way around the casino only to be told that I couldn't access my vehicle due to a crime scene.  
No one cared that it was my wedding night they just rudely told me and my group we couldn't access our vehicles.  I will never stay there again.

Decent hotel, you get what you pay for. Location is pretty good on the south end of the strip. We got the upgraded contemporary rooms which were decent, but the upgrade was pretty minimal.  The resort fees of $21 a day is ridiculous and I know this is a trend throughout all vegas hotels. Im just waiting for the bed fee, shower use fee and using the tv fee. The casino itself is ok and has a basic food court and shops. Next time we will likely upgrade to a nicer hotel like planet hollywood.

Nice looking room aside from a few details here and there. Huge building so I understand why they don't have Wifi. The $15 "resort fee" feels like robbery seeing as to how they don't tell you about it til after the reservation is made. It's supposed to cover wired internet and some other stuff. There is no fridge, microwave, coffee pot, etc, all items I had in my hotel room for work in Best Western for only $10 more. Then every time you cross the casino, someone's trying to sell you a free stay within the next year. When I filed a complaint about the resort fees, their offer was to give me a free room that I likely won't ever use instead of just refunding me the extra fees.

Long story short, I won't be staying there again if I ever go back to Vegas.

this place needs to be leveled in favor of a hotel that is actually nice. i can't give it 1 star since there are far worse places to stay in vegas (think the hilton or anywhere downtown of Fremont Street). the place looks like a giant castle, which is retarded since vegas isn't exactly geared toward kids. the inside is gross, the rooms suck (horrible beds) and with the location on the strip, there should be a much better hotel here (it's right next to the luxor and new york new york)

basically what it comes down to is don't stay here.

If I were rate LILY from EXCALIBUR I would rate her 0 STARS FOR HER BS CUSTOMER SERVICE.

First off, I called and was answered by Lily and asked her if I could use a different card and she totally blew me off and hung up.

Second, I called again and she picked up again. Best part was, she actually didn't hang up this time. So anyways, I ask if I would be able to use a different type of payment since I just recently lost my credit card that was on file and she aggressively said "No. The card you booked with has to be the card you have to have when you check in." Then guess what, SHE HANGS UP IN THE MIDDLE OF MY SECOND QUESTION. 

So after searching and searching for 3 hours for my credit card when I was supposed to already be on my way from San Francisco (10 hour car ride), I try to call again, and of course it's LILY, so I ask to be redirected to someone else, who was very helpful, caring and understanding, told me I just needed my ID and a different card and we'd be set. I unfortunately didn't get her name but LILY made it a bad experience for me, even having not being there yet.

Just got home from a Vegas vacation and a 3 night stay at Excalibur. I really liked it! (Only losing a star because there was no fridge in the room and our air conditioner didn't get all that cold. When we arrived, our room's AC wasn't functional, so we changed rooms, and that one worked but even on the lowest setting didn't keep the room very cold). I found the staff to be super helpful and friendly. We frequented the Sherwood's Forest bar and the bartenders were all very nice,  especially Tim and Rikko. The pool was nice, and not nearly as bad as the reviews I've read. We didn't pay for a chair or cabana (with 85 degree temps there was no need to escape the heat and sun...it was gorgeous! ) And the pool was the perfect temp....very crisp and cool. Felt amazing! I was a little disappointed that the main pool and small bar were closed for some reason. We hung at the slide pool. There were some kids but not many and they weren't obnoxious. I loved that this place has a food court....makes eating very convenient and cheap! The breakfast buffet wasn't great at all. I give it a 3 out of 10. But it was nice that the 17.99 included sodas, juices, etc. The hotel was a great size....big enough to keep us busy but not massive like some of the other places we went. I'd definitely stay here again.

Where to begin.... I've been to a motel 6 in Bakersfield CA and have to say this place is pretty equal to that! Don't be pulled in by the fancy pools and the cool castle! The beds are so uncomfortable, the shower is aweful, checking in was a nightmare! The pools were filthy, it cost $10 to go into the adult section, $30 if you wanted to use an umbrella! The drinks were outrageous in price $25 for a pina colada $18 refills $15.75 for a shot of patron and more if I wanted a lime and salt! The pool waitress came around maybe once an hour! The pools close so early! Slide 6pm, others 7pm, adult 8pm. You can't even enjoy the hot tub at night! And let's see what else? Oh yes paying to park in the hotels parking lot $10. We come to Vegas 4-6 times a year I will stay anywhere else but here!

So upset right now....our "area" waitress "VERA"  told us several times to "sit down and play a machine."  Well... I've watched her walk around us and totally avoid me. I waited tables for 10 plus years so I tip  $1 on each drink, more on  shots. My feelings are hurt more than anything. But I can't help but call her out for going out of her way to avoid us....so rude. I don't know if i will return to Excalibur because of her :(.... Butt hurt signing off....by the way MARCIA saved the day, thank you MARCIA!!!

this is a great cheap hotel to stay at when you come to vegas!!  it's a little farther down on the strip but nice nonetheless.  it's also huge!!  my favorite thing about this hotel is the pool!!  they have a huge pool and a waterslide too!!  there are tons of chairs to lay out on and a beautiful waterfall to relax by.. they have tons of slot machines and other casino games to gamble your little heart away!!  i love the old school renaissance look of this castle themed hotel!!  check out thunder from down under for some hot austrailian men or the tournament of kings to root for your team's knight during dinner!!  i would stay here again in a heartbeat!!
Nothing too amazing most of the staff here is pushy and unaccommodating as always here in Vagus. I have more to say but I just don't feel like it.

Came back here few weeks back for vacation. I've stayed here now maybe 5 times over past few years. 

Excalibur is a simple, good location, great price hotel in Vegas. They always have some of the best room prices. Location on south side of strip is great. I've always had a clean and pretty new room. And I've never paid an arm and leg like most places ask. 

You're in Vegas. You don't stay in your room much unless your puking, sleeping or doing the dirty and Excalibur is the place. Normal hotel room, normal price, good location.  

Also, they have $5 BJ tables...quite a few usually. Breakfast buffet is good to kill the hangover and is open till like early afternoon. 

Pool is the only downside. Not the best. But go poach the neighbors. 

Im sure I'll be back.

This place is a DUMP!!!! After a week stay at the Palms for work, we decided to stay an extra night in LV for fun. The Palms was booked up and was unable to allow us an extra night stay :(  On the fly....with out checking reviews....we booked a 1 night stay at the Excalibur. From the moment we walked in, we knew it was a mistake! The line was very long and it took about 30 mins. to get checked in. The place is just straight up trashy. The walk to our room was about a 1\/4 mile, if not more, away from the casino. The towels had stains, the bathroom was disgusting and the entire room looks like nothing has ever been updated since it was opened. I will never stay here again!

I understand..."on a budget"....but common! This place needs to be torn down. If you are taking the time to travel our to Las Vegas, do your self a favor and don't disappoint yourself and ruin your time here. Spend the extra $20-$30 to stay somewhere else. I have been to Vegas more than 10 times staying at the Flamingo, Palms, Trump, Monte Carlo, NY, NY, Southpoint, etc.....and this place is bar none the worst place I have ever stayed. Have some dignity Excalibur....clean this place up!

So I stayed at Excalibur 3 nights the last week of March and I absolutely loved it. My friends and I stayed in Tower 2 with the strip view. 15th floor room #3 to be exact. Right outside the window was MGM and the NY hotel w\/ rollercoaster. Unlike other reviews we couldn't hear the screamers at all from our view. The buffet was amazing 36.00 all you can eat all day and you can even eat at their sister hotel Luxor. The room was clean. The front desk staff was nice, but the lady we had was new and her supervisor was monitoring her the entire time. There was 20 of us in line but only 2 people checking you in which was annoying but hey sometimes you have to be patient. The only thing I hated was the people in the hotel begging you to sign up for free shows\/promotions. It was so annoying they kept asking are you 25 and up. Advice just lie and say no. I almost gave them 4 stars because of that, but I'm pretty sure they are working off commission and its their job, but I literally got asked 5 times each day I was at Excalibur. Hotel was clean, no funny smell, they have a bomb gift shop across from Krispy Kreme and the slushy place. Cheap souvenirs. Another issue is that they had 3 pools,but only 1 open everyone was crowded in one pool made me think about community\/ymcas pool. I was having so much fun doing other things I didn't care about getting in I just did a 20 minute people watch and left. Would I stay or recommend this hotel to anyone. Yes! The most friendliest staff was the guy that fixed the casino machines not sure of his name but he was so friendly.

Horrible. Staying here because my friends are...no! Don't do it. I'm in Tower 2 which is suppose to be the better tower. No! Dirty. Stains. Scratched up furniture. Scuffed up walls.  I could've paid a little more and stayed at a nicer place. Never again.

The only positive was that the staff I met was very nice. 

***Update: I spoke to the Manager (Kendall) about the situation and he quickly offered different options to accommodate my situation. That effort was appreciated.***


Would I?!  After speaking with the Manager-Maybe. Mainly because I appreciate the Managers efforts and I don't like to stay at the large casinos\/hotels because it takes so long to get out of them.

Pros: Fairly clean, free parking

Cons: No WiFi, shower is 5'8" tall, constantly berated by staff to purchase packages for the future, zero mildly healthy restaurant choices, few TV stations, no decent bars

made reservations via internet 30 days in advanc for the second weekend in june 2008. according to the internet it was for the widescreen spa room paid a total of 330.00 for the 3 days thinking we were getting a nice room, we were told that the widescreen was 20.00 extra a night and on the internet was not a guantee which tower you get. We ended up in the old tower and it was musty dirty and very small for the money.
The pool was all of 3 feet all around, and the 2 water slides were closed. The snack shack was closed at 3pm, the drinks were 10.00 by the pool each, for a premixed daquari. We ate at the sherman cafe and waited in a long line, when we were seated it took over 30 minutes to get noticed and when we ordered tea and not coffee it was like we were inconvenianced the waiter, and we once again waited 20 more minutes for the tea, we left in disgused and went over to the MGM for breakfast. 
We been going to Las Vegas ans stayed in many hotels over the last 10 years, but this was the worst experance we ever had, and should of listened to the warnings about advoiding the hotel at all cost, we learned an expensive lesson

Rooms are clean. Small, but clean. Casinos are huge and smokey. 

Nothing special compared to the others. Except- the fitness room is included with your room rates. I love it! Most of the other places charge $10 or $30 per day. 

It's pretty far from the good part of the strip though. But nothing wrong with a little exercise!

I spent my birthday weekend in Las Vegas for my birthday to see Billy Idol at the House Of Blues. Initially I made the mistake of booking the first night at Luxor, I really should've booked both nights here! It was check out time, and I was expecting to be charged at least $30 for an early check in. However, Anjelita took care of us impeccably well! I was waived the early check in fee and offered an upgrade for just $10! Are you kidding me, of course I accepted the upgrade! Our room had a gorgeous view of the strip. We had a newer room so everything was nicely upgraded. My husband had stayed here previously a few years back, and said he had such a horrible stay! He was super impressed with how nice the room was and the amazing customer service Anjelita provided! We will definitely come back to visit and look for Anjelita to check us in! Parking was a bit far but it wasn't a deal breaker.

Somehow, I ended up staying at Excalibur during business conventions, often enough they turned out to have the best rate and convenience location on the Strip.   Although being in the south side of it, they have good access to the nearby hotels and freeway access.  They have very close by outdoor parking for both Towers hotel elevator entrance.

Tower I is where all the infamous dirty rooms are at, avoid staying there if you can.  Tower II is a bit newer with cleaner rooms.  Problems can general be sorted out with a nice tips to staffs.  They usually come with a coupon book with varies deals for their restaurants.  For some reasons, I actually used my free food credits since I always end up eating at other places.  Casino ranks on the low end for the Strip area, mostly average people gamble here, and high rollers rarely seen here.  At least this hotel seems kids friendly compared to the adult theme they filled with in other hotels.

Various hotel sites rated this place a three stars hotel, which is consistence with what I experienced during my stay here.

Beware the Timeshare agents!  Good for a fun, cheap crash pad with a comfy bed, but I had a LOT of trouble reaching anyone when my flight was canceled for the day. The phone system is ancient. Also, by having not booked directly I was treated like a 2nd class citizen. My biggest complaint is that they have a timeshare office in their main lobby and kiosks at every entrance and elevator, so going to and from my room meant my boyfriend and I were harassed every time: "Hi, you going to see a show? Free shows for $50 ransom money you get back after a 2 hour demo." Just let me walk to the pool in peace, please!!  As long as the Timeshare agents are in this hotel, I won't be back.

We wanted to extend our stay in Vegas, but the price at the Monte Carlo (where we had been staying) went way up, so we wanted to find something cheaper.  Excalibur fit the bill at about $65 (+taxes and resort fee.)  This hotel is old and they haven't done much to update it.  However, it's clean, is centrally located, and provides a place for you to lay your head in between all the debauchery.  It's not luxurious by any means, but if you just need a place to rest, Excalibur can provide that for you.

Everyone was great except you cannot get a drink when gambling we gambled on a roulette machine for three hours and tried multiple times to get the waitress and she ignored us and so did all the other ones we tried to flag down no one would help us it was very frustrating.

EVERYBODY is here right now. For the budget & kids, this is the spot though! There is plenty PG-13 things to do within Excalibur, MGM Grand & New York New York. Put on comfy shoes unless u hitting the club cuz you will b walking.

I stayed here over the weekend because i had friends flying in from the east coast who already booked a few rooms, and it was cheap. The non renovated rooms are a joke.  I would rather bring a sleeping bag and sleep on one of those overpass crosswalks listening to some lady say "water for a dollar" all night.  The renovated rooms are nicer and good if you don't plan on spending any time in the room other than sleeping and showering (like me).  The pool scene was pretty sad.  I watched a gang fight almost break out by the elevators.  Hotel Management was not friendly and useless resolving an issue with our room keys. The only food we found was fast food and needed to walk to the Luxor to get something decent to eat.  They also charge a $14 per day "resort fee" when you check out.  Excalibur, not a fan.

I've stayed at the Excalibur before and this will likely be the last time I stay here.  The staff are very nice and professional. The rooms are usually clean.  However,  they're now charging a ridiculous $15 per night resort fee and there is no wifi in the rooms. There is a hot spot in the rear of the casino,  but that's it. I know pretty much every hotel on the strip charges the bogus resort fee, but the level of the fees has become simply outrageous. It's just another way to make more money without jacking up room rates.  For those fees,  there should be some actual amenities provided.

You get what you pay for here. Its not the nicest but it is a fun place to stay with kids. Very friendly, the games and the ambiance are all fun and mid evil. They do have great restaurants in there. the shows are fun and the downstairs game area is a blast for sure. I recommend this place. Just keep in mind it is not a nice hotel justa fun one

I think the reviews of this place are a bit harsh.

Here is what the Excalibur is:

A cheap room with one of the best locations on the strip.  You're directly connected to NYNY, Tropicana, MGM Grand, Luxor and Mandalay Bay.  You don't get the fancy amenities of the higher end places, but if you're looking for a clean place to crash and not spend a lot of money on lodging- this is it.

The smoke in the casino might be a little worse than newer or higher-end places, but it's really not that bad.  People just have to face it- a lot of people in casinos smoke.  It's like complaining that they serve booze.  The only real negative I can say is that the beds are rather uncomfortable.  Other than that, this was a great budget-friendly place to stay for a long weekend of partying and gambling in Vegas.  Highly recommended if you're coming for the same purpose.

I've stayed at excalibur about 4 times this year already and every time it was ok. The rooms are kinda old but it's expected because the price is always low. Check in isn't until 3pm, but for 25$ more u can check in after 11am. We always book through travelocity, and have always gotten a 20$ food and beverage voucher for each guest. This last time I stayed, they only gave us one, which is ok because the places that the voucher can be used are very limited. I did ask to speak to a manager at check in about it, and had she been professional, I wouldn't be writing a bad review. Yolanda was rude about me asking why we only got one voucher. The stay was already questionable  from the moment we checked in. To end our stay, housekeeping walked  into the room at 850am, while we were sleeping. Check out isn't until 11am. We had to ask her to come back after we check out. I'd rather pay 20$ more to stay at a hotel where management has better coutomer service skills and I won't be prematurely rushed by housekeeping.

From 7\/8\/15 

Excalibur is almost towards the end of the Las Vegas strip. From the outside it looks like a Disney castle, once you get in its not so bad, its actually cute. They're are a ton of attractions here to keep you busy. 

Of course, you have shopping, restaurants, bars and gambling. Also the Tram is connected to this casino in case you don't feel like walking to the Luxor or Mandalay Bay

I've stayed in $20\/night hotels when I've paid, and $500\/night hotels when the company paid.  If you're looking to save money and stay on the Strip, the Excalibur does the job.  I've stayed at the Excalibur twice, once with a very nice view of the Strip.  Sure it's no Wynn, but it's just fine, given that it's one of the cheapest hotels on the Strip.  I was most recently in Vegas for one night on business.  I was in Tower 2, with a pool view.  My room smelled clean.  No cigarette smoke.  There is only a shower in the bathroom (no tub), which is fine with me.  The air conditioner is a floor unit (not sure how to describe it), which sits in a cabinet by the window.  It's fairly loud, which can be distracting.  The bath products are not as nice as some hotels, but in this instance, I'd rather save money.  Carpet, bedding, and towels seemed completely clean.  However, the arm chairs were a bit worn.

As far as hotels go, you get what you pay for. We chose a cheap hotel so we could do more while we were in town. The Excalibur was essentially what we expected it would be, considering their rooms are very cheap. 

The rooms are outdated but comfortable. We slept well in the beds, and the rooms were fairly quiet. 

Below are some quick notes:

Pros:
-Gambling: The casino has a good variety of games, and it's not crowded enough that you can't find a table\/ slot machine 
-Food: There are several quick places in the hotel to eat 

Cons:
-Location: Its at the end of the strip, so you will be doing quite a bit of walking or driving
-Parking:  The hotel recently started charging for parking, and it is a complete disaster. Valet refused to park our car because they were full. I feel like hotel guests should take priority. We drove around for a long time until we found the only parking spot in the lot, parked, then carried our luggage into the hotel. We had to Uber everywhere because we were scared that we wouldn't find a spot later if we drove ourselves. 
-Bathrooms: The bathrooms are very outdated. Our shower door wasn't secure and could barely shut. The shower floor was very slick, which is dangerous. Lastly, there was mold growing in our shower. 
-Housekeeping: (Not sure if this was our room or all rooms) There is no placard to hang on the door to let housekeeping know you are in there, so they tried to come in every day while we were still asleep.

Valet service: Make sure to check for damage every time your car is returned to you before pulling away from the valet person, or the damage will not be taking care of by  EXCALIBUR :( .... But I must say I was offered a free stay anytime wanted.

It was my first time staying in vegas and i wanted a cheap hotel on the strip.  I loved the place.  Helpful staff and the room was in great condition. Easy acces to the strip and all the fun in vegas.

This review is of the medieval dinner buffet at the Excalibur.  The chef is italian and the food represents that. Had an amazing dinner. Sausage and peppers are what standout here along with the sheer amount of food. Go off peak and enjoy it pretty quiet as well.

My mom and I were searching for hotels that we hadn't stayed at before.. that were "reasonably priced" and close to the Mandalay Bay Convention Center. I feel across Excalibur on Vegas.com and was surprised to see it was actually a 3 1\/2 star rated hotel. So taking the above requirements into thought, we booked it.

I don't know how this place is 3 1\/2 stars. 
It is extremely outdated. Needs some attention.
Thin Walls.
Kid-Friendly (which isn't necessarily a problem just something to consider)
Shower only rooms (at least ours was)
Not a lot of food options
Bare Minimum rooms. In other words, a high priced motel. 

Could be worse, but we won't stay here again.

I had a wonderful stay here. The check in was really fast and the price was great! Really cheap prices with really great service! The room was also really clean. My next vegas trip I'll definitely be staying here again.

My fiance and I recently stayed here for five days (Monday through Friday) and we had a surprisingly enjoyable stay here at Excalibur. We usually stay at the MGM Grand but they were all booked for conventions. We looked for a place to stay and decided on here because of the price being around $560 for the week. 
When we got here their luckily was no line and they told us the wait for a room would be about two hours. I was a little bummed but I understood because it was after all only 8 in the morning. They instructed us to drop off our bags at the bellhop which we did and they took them in a secured room. We walked around for about a half an hour and I decided to get back in line. My fiance and I while in line noticed the gentleman who helped us at the front desk called us over and upgraded us at no cost to the 27th floor and it was a newer room and in tower 1. I was a little anxious because I had read bad reviews on tower 1. 
Well when we got to our room it was very clean! It smelled clean and it was very modern and updated. The bathrooms were a tad outdated but it outdid my expectations. I did my usual check for bedbugs and found nothing but clean sheets. The beds were very comfortable and we had a somewhat decent view. We didn't care too much knowing we were just in the room to sleep and get ready. 
Overall, I give the room a job well done. And the staff a job well done also. The hotel maids cleaned the rooms every night and were very friendly and also everyone at the front desk. A tip also if you fly like we did they are more than willing to print out your boarding passes. I would willingly choose to come here again and we both recommended this establishment to our friends. Way to go Excalibur!

Dirty, horrible customer service. Room is filthy even after they sent someone to clean it again! First they tried to put our rooms on separate floors, despite being booked well in advance. Then they charged us extra to get us closer. Our room was filthy. Mystery dried fluids on bathroom floor, phone and headboard. I've tried multiple points of contact with no luck.

The food at the buffet was pretty good and the service very attentive. Not too much variety in the entrees but more to choose from in the desert section. Loved the crepes. Was also a plus that my two kids were free (2 and 4) since they don't eat anything anyway. The price is a little expensive but from what I've read decent for major strip hotels. I'd suggest getting there before 4 to avoid paying the dinner rate but getting to enjoy more options once the turnaround time starts.

I just recently stayed hear for 2days\/3 nights and I must be honest I really didn't want to stay hear because of last time I was here. The rooms were humid,stinky,dirty it just wasn't good. But man oh man was I in shock when we checked in to our room in tower 2. The beds were nice and clean the bathrooms were nicely stocked the carpet was clean. There was no bed bugs or anything that crawls in the night. They apparently clean there carpets outside everyday at around 10:30am. On top of this we ended up going to dicks last resorts which is a bar to those of you that don't know. Just as an FYI if your going to vegas on a budget like I was, make this one of your stops good food, and great priced drinks. Now enough about the positive of this hotel lets talk about the negatives.
 
1. There was no fridge not a big deal but would of come in handy since we had drink. 

2. It is pretty freaking far from the strip and if you are going to go out drinking and none of you want to be DD  a taxi will run you from $4.00 - $16.00 

3. You are near the airport and from what I heard if your in tower 1 you hear a lot of noise. I didn't have this problem since I was staying in tower 2. 

All in all this hotel is defiantly on my list again I would defiantly recommend it to people especially if you have kids pretty good fun dungeon. If you don't have kids and are on tight budget this is still a nice place to stay.

Stayed here once, for the price I wasn't expecting much.  Small rooms, outdated decor, slow room service, located at the end of the strip. Not much to do over here. You also have to pay to use their gym.  I would give it one more star but it is what is advertised but the price really is not that much cheaper than other hotels on the strip with a better location.

I don't think i will be staying here. I booked a stay here for 2 nights May 23-25, thinking this is family friendly would be perfect\/ We get there Monday night and the time for check in was atleast 30-45 min which really sucked. then i get to the front and the lady tells me they only have 1 queen when i asked for two. so i paid like $22 more . When we get up there wasn't as clean as it should of been. the blow dryer did not work . The toilet wouldnt flush. I called reception and said they would send someone and that didn't happen. I am disappointed i told them over the phone that it was not clean and wanted atleast partial refund. She said she would have a manager call me. 2-3 weeks later still no response :(

Good hotel for the price. 
Part of the MGM property. 

Well maintained, but age does show.

I been coming to this establishment for last 20 + years and have never experienced such poor customer service as I did today March 21, 2014 it took half an hour to get my alcohol beverages from an Asian employee I spoke to the bar beverage manager Cortney Norris which was very nice and polite but if you guys keep on hiring these kind of employees you will lose great paying customer at your establishment.I suggest you talk to that Asian person who took half an hour to take my order which was never delivered.

Beware of Asians as your servers as they will not get your drinks to you in a timely matter!!

PS you lost a great paying customer that pays your bills!!

Avoid playing slots at this hotel!!
My room is clean and the staff is really friendly. I'm just upset that the wifi never worked. When you think you are connected, it disconnects again. I'm writing this on my data :(

First the check in process was smooth and only took about 10 minutes. we arrived a little after 6:30 on November 6th( my bday). The front desk empkoyee who handeled our, was professional, friendly and all around a wonderful delight. The room we are staying in is 27119 in the Royal Tower strip view. Clean, spacious and a nice size. Lasty tue mattress was like sleeping on a cloud. I love this mattress so much that I would like to purchase it

so eight years ago when I got married this was a good place, with a nice show in the front, and some statues and things at the entrance, it had a really nice medieval feel to it you know?
