A tv and a toilet that flushes and spews back whatever you were trying to flush. You pay $30 for the pool (they don't tell you that the closest pool you can use is at another hotel) and subpar wifi that has issues. The buffet is okay but you're better off finding a restaurant elsewhere for the price. The Johnny Rockets on-site is awesome and gives a 25% military discount. Ignore all the people trying to get you to get discounted show tickets because half of what they say is not true. The time share that they rope you into seeing is 4 hours long, lunch on them is a salad in a styrofoam bowl and your company is overly pushy salesman that won't take no for an answer. Unless you are super hard up to not pay the full price for your tickets you're better off skipping the time share torture and just pay full price for your shows which will not disappoint you!

I stayed the Royal Tower rooms which are not nice.  Very sparse on any room amenities however the bed was good.  Our window view was a cinder block wall - why would any hotel design include a "brick wall view"?  It just seemed old and stale and dirty.  Time to blow this hotel up.

The price - okay. I got a free upgrade and it was actually REALLY nice. Nicer than New York New York's basic rooms, actually. 

I came here for EDC weekend and it was a hot mess. 3 hours to checkin? I wanted to cry. But staff was nice... they were handing out free beers and drink tickets for later (and boy did I take advantage).

The room was nice and roomy. Everything was upgraded. There was a flat screen TV in the room but it had terrible grainy reception, so it wasn't worth turning on anyway. 

What also bothered me was the fact that the folks at Excalibur always found a way to throw advertisements under my hotel door. Okay, guys. I don't want your crap, guys. 

But you know what... for the price and a place to stay, it was OK. Plus when you're in Vegas, how much time are you really spending in your hotel room?

From 14 years old to 20 years old, it was tradition that our families got together to spend New Years in Las Vegas.  Being under-aged at the time, I couldn't enjoy much.  I thought that it was evil that when I finally turned 21, we ended our tradition.  So when I first turned 21, guess where I wanted my first Vegas experience to be. That's right...Excalibur.  I graduated from Midway's Arcade and the Tournament of Kings to Black Jack and all night drinking.  Fast forward 15+ years and I'm still coming to Excalibur.  Minus the all night drinking and gambling.

Pros:
-Rooms are cheap.  Not Budge Suites cheap, but cheaper than the Mandalay.
-Great comps:  I don't play much, but own their player's card.  I get free rooms from time to time.
-Arcade:  When my baby girl and nephews are in town, this is where we go. 
-Pool is kid friendly.  
-Beer Pong:  Only when family is in.  2 AM Beer Pong gets the competitive spirits up. 
-Loose:  Not the guest, but the slots.  My parents win here and they love their slots.
-Location:  One of the few casinos on the strip where it's easy in and out.  
-Tournament of Kings:  Half price for locals and kids should experience it at least once.
-Remodeled Rooms:  Their remodeled rooms are clean and updated.  Lacking the smell of smoke. 
-$5 Black Jack
-Poker Room:  Small but there's action from tourist that only know poker from ESPN. 
-Dick's Last Resort

Cons:
-Parking: My suggestion if you're staying is valet and bell service.
-Some rooms are outdated.  Could have changed in the last year.  If you're reserving here, ask for their remodeled rooms.  It's a world of difference.
-Old:  Needs a serious remodel both inside and outside.  
-Eats:  Buffet is just okay.  Upstairs is bunch of fast food that seems to have smaller portions and cost more.  

Since I have more pros than cons, I have to give this place 4 stars.  Plus, it's one of my parent's favorites.  Also a place where I am taking my daughter and nephews when they're in town. 



PS:  Message for my little girl since it's also her birthday today.  Daddy loves you.  Happy Birthday Honey Bunches of Oats. See you soon.

Oh Excalibur. I want to give you less than three stars but just can't do it. This hotel is a decent one if you don't have a lot of money or you don't care where you stay. Disclaimer - it has been years since I stayed here, but I recently went to the casino, and it was exactly the same as I remembered it. It is very old and the designs of the rooms\/casinos are outdated.

Stood in tower 1, needs to updated badly. Spent over $100 a night on the room, not worth it. The only good things about hotel is one, the location. It's right on the strip. The 2nd thing is the casino is never dead

Its OK if you can get past that overwhelming smoky musty smell. For the price it is fine. I only stay a weekend when I go to Vegas, but if you are going for longer, upgrade to a nicer hotel. The rooms are outdated, and don't appear clean...but that may be due to the age of the hotel.

clean rooms, fast room service, friendly staff all over. 
had to find a place to stay for a week for my friend's APP convention, we got a deal here, only $30 a night. can't argue with that. 

my main concern were bedbugs, didn't get any of that. 

the pool area was solid, with its own separate adult section which is convenient. 

fun place. no major complaints. for the price, it was mad comfy.

As much as I wanted to give the hotel a five stars I can't.
The main pool is closed such a waste of space! 
It's so big and no one can't get in till summer.

Keep in mind they charged a resort FEE of almost $30 per day that supposedly covers the pool and such.

The pools that they do have available are very small and filled with kids.

The "adult" pool is small but with less people, but they CHARGE!! What?
Yes, the charge $10 per day and person!

I already payed for a better room, resort fees and now I also have to pay extra for something that should be included in the resort fee?! I'm not staying here again


Oh I forgot to mention that if you try to get in the big pool there's a lady with a whistle THAT WILL HUNT YOU DOWN hahaha

Tournament of KINGS show SUCKED. DO NOT GO TO THIS SHOW EVEN IF YOU HAVE A FREE TICKET. 

Yes the fact that dinner is a part of the show is very enticing, but stay away. Not only is the show very boring and noisy sounding, the food is very bland too. For vegetarians, the lasagna wasn't too bad, but the meaty meal was a bland chicken with some bun. The show involved repeated cheers to the "Kings" when they hadn't performed any great feat (as yet). A small portion of teh show had some decent fighting, but lasted for less than 5 minutes. Rest of it was a TOTAL waste of time. 

Go catch other shows instead. Carrot Top or soemthing.. In short, I do NOT recommend this show.

My husband and Itook our girls to Vegas for Spring Break. We booked a room at Excalibur because our girls loved the idea of staying in a castle! I was kinda iffy about staying here due to the cheap price. When we arrived at the hotel, we were checked in in no time. The staff are very friendly, and provided excellent customer service. However, I was frightened by what we found in our room. There was hair stuck to the pillows with buggers. There was blood and dry seaman on the sheets and blankets. We called housekeeping to request clean linens. Once the house keeper came to the room, she was unable to find any clean linens on her cart. All of her "clean linen" were dirty. I could not understand why dirty linens were folded and stocked on the cart. Long story short, the hotel refused to give us another room because we booked our hotel with our flight. They were unable to put sheets on our bed. Rather than sleeping on a bate hotel mattress, we book another hotel and high tailed it out of there. This is an old hotel, so we keept our expectations low, but this was a new found level of low. This hotel is cheap, so it brings in lower end customers. There was a fight going on in the bar between a customer and a bartender as we were walking in the casino. There were f-bombs and middle fingers flying left and right. This hotel is no place for a good family. The pictures for this hotel were very misleading. The rooms are smokey, damp and just have an overall dirty feel. There are no pictures of the bathrooms on their website, and for good reason. The bathrooms are disgusting.

People seem to give stars without regard to the price.  I would say this is a 3 star hotel, BUT given the fact that it's nearly always the best value on the strip, it's a 4 star.

The pool complex is good.  There is a pool for kids and one for 18 and up.  Also, you can get a cabana for a day for about 80$ during the week or off season.  The price fluxuates but it's always worth asking.  Can you beat that in Vegas?  The pool used to let you bring in an outside drink if you put in a plastic cup, but on a recent trip this was not the case.  I may or may not have purchased a half yard margarita, drank it, and re-filled it in the room to bring back to the pool, though.

The excalibur is great for the budget minded.  There is a baja fresh, with solid meals for under 10$.  Also walk by Dick's Last Resort and they'll usually hand you a coupon for a free jello shot.  Not bad.

The location isn't the best, but there is some good stuff nearby.  New York New York is right next door.  The Luxor, MGM, and Mandalay Bay are also nearby.  It's about a 45 minute walk to center strip.

While there are a lot of families with young kids that stay there, Excalibur somehow strikes a good balance.  There are kids around, but they hardly if ever bother me.  Nothing like a Circus Circus type place.  I wouldn't take my kids to Vegas after what I've been through there :)

The rooms are clean and seem modern.  I would rank them above the Flamingo, Imperial Palace, and other similar budget hotels.

I stayed at Excalibur this past week October 21-24 and thought it was an average place.  We chose Excalibur for location and our activities planned for this trip and wasn't a location we have stayed at.  We took an email upgrade offer for the Contemporary Tower room and thought it was pretty basic.  Couldn't imagine what the original room looked like that we had booked.  Cleanliness was 3\/5 - room was okay; however, the bathroom could have had a few more details looked at.  If you're looking for a dark room and avoid sunlight, then I don't recommend this room.  They have curtains on 2\/3 of the windows and a flip blind down the middle larger piece of the window causing light to enter the room.  We didn't care for that.  The largest issue I had this trip happened when I stayed at Mirage in August.  On our final night we wanted to sleep in as we had a later flight and went down to the front desk and inquired about late check outs.  Our group agreed to do the 3PM option $30.00 - I told the lady at the desk what happened at Mirage and that housekeeping started keying in, knocking, talking through the door prior to our approved check out time.  She apologized for my experience there and told me not to worry as long as we had the do not disturb sign on the door nothing would happen.  Sure enough prior to the 11AM resort check out time housekeeping made several attempts to enter the room, knocking, and calling out housekeeping.  Told housekeeping we had 3PM check out.  Whatever communication\/reporting front desk does to housekeeping has a gap and not worth the $30.00 - our sleep was ruined; we were now awake - not worth it.  Next time, I'm just going to make a sign and tape it to the front door if we ever choose to do late check out again at an MGM property.  The staff\/hospitality otherwise is fantastic and couldn't complain or speak negative on that aspect no matter what role\/job the staff has on the property.

I was pleasantly surprised. I expected a really crappy motel quality hotel but it was actually quite nice. Free upgrade, clean, fairly quiet, nice big bathroom and the beds were comfortable. 

We didn't do much except sleep and get ready to go out, so for our purposes and for the price, this hotel was pretty much perfect. We stayed in Tower 2 on the 9th floor and had a view of the pool.

this is the second time that I've stayed in the property and I must confess that all I did was sleep there and eat breakfast at Sherwood Forest Cafe, so I cannot comment on the gambling or any of the  other restaurants.

For the price, this place is a steal. They do charge a resort fee but it includes wired internet which almost every where else you have to pay for in addition to your resort fee. I think the resort fee was about 10 or 11 dollars a day and included two drink coupons (or $5 off a drink of your choice at any casino bar) and 2 games on the midway as well as the internet. 

The breakfast that I had at the Cafe was fine and Pat was a very diligent server and very thorough so no complaints there,more expensive than Denny's but better service and more convenient to collapsing into bed - you choose.

Check in had long lines, took about 15 minutes but I got put in a standard room (the cheapest) in Tower 1 and I was fine with the room and the facilities there. Check out was quick and easy but I left at 6am, it may be less easy later in the day.

If all you are doing in Vegas is looking for a clean safe place to sleep, this definitely does the job.

well........ it upset myself that I have to give a 2-star to excalibur hotel.  I used to love staying here because I get comp from mlife for as many nights I want and with a lot of play money.  Now a day, I have to pay to stay at Excalibur, but still at a discounted rate like less than $50\/night.

The reason that I have to give such rating is because I had a bad experience in my last visit.  I was using one of the towels provided by the hotel and I was using it to dry my face.  The second I put in my face, it smelled like poo in smoke (this is how bad it smelled).  Gosh, I was so mad!! It was horrible.... 

I then called the housekeeping department and they apologized and told me that they will send someone with the new towels.  A male housekeeper came over with the towels and handed them to my husband.  He just threw to my husband's hands and immediately walked away.  He threw the towels and of course the towels dropped on the floor. .... really terrible service.... 

I also tried the buffet I think it was $32 for one day buffet at excalibur and luxor.  It's not worthy.  The food is not very good, no seafood, and not really tasty. 

Now I only go to excalibur for their table games sometimes because they always have low limits like $5.

I used to stay here relatively often because they often send me free rooms. This place has gotten so decrepit I no longer accept free rooms.. yes I pay $100-$200 a night to stay somewhere else because the rooms here have fallen below the standards of a Super8\/Holiday Inn. Also, let's talk table limits. I used to love the $5 craps here... recently on an OFF weeknight, they were trying to have only $10 and up limits. I took a cab to Venetian and played $10 there. If I'm going to pay $10 to play, why the hell would I play in a slum? Also, the drink options suck here. I'm a huge fan of redbull vodka and tend to consume several while I'm playing. This joke of a casino has only this nasty Sobe stuff. It's awful awful awful. The one plus is the location.. I do enjoy it. However, the fact that I no longer accept free rooms here says something.

I was jumped by a gang of thugs on the way into Excalibur Hotel tonight. I was knocked down kicked in the face and my sister ways robbed of her cell phone. All I was offered by the hotel staff was 2 small ice packs.

The only reason this hotel gets two stars is because I got a cheap price. If you're looking for something really cheap and you don't care about any services stay here. But make sure you go gambling anywhere else but here!!!!!

Its at the end of the strip...the rooms are old and dingy.  They are small and claustrophobic.  The upside here is they have that carnival game section for kids, which is when i stayed here, when i wasnt 21 yet.  And cheap casino tables.
Did i mention the breakfst buffet is super nasty?  Soggy bread and high fructose corn syrup with colored dye syrups arent the thing.

for the weekend of May 20, 2011
I wanted to stay at venetian or something like that, but my friend didn't want to spend more than 100 a night. So even though excalibur wasn't my first choice, it did fit the criteria= affordable & on the strip.

The parking was easy to navigate & to find a spot and checking in was painless. I even got a free room upgrade (newly remodeled room called widescreen) just by nicely inquiring about the rate!  The room was pretty nice too- cute decor, flatscreen tv, huge bathroom (good for girls sharing a room), nice tub, comfy beds. I'm still debating if the room would have been worth paying extra for, but I was extremely happy with it. 

The hotel itself is on one edge of the strip so if you're trying to mostly be on the mirage\/treasure island side a lot then I suggest taking a taxi. The line for a taxi at the lobby was super packed at 1030-11pm when we decided to go out dancing. We walked and ended up taking the double decker bus, NOT reccommended! ugh it was awful! Better if you just wait for the taxi, they constantly have some pulling up anyway.

There were about 4 large pools and we avoided the ones with kids in it. Plenty of beach chairs to lay out for tanning and they provide towels. The staff throughout the hotel were both nice and helpful, no meanies.

Overall I was very very happy with this hotel- nice staff, clean rooms, on the strip, not that many children running around as I had anticipated and AFFORDABLE. We saved money staying here and instead got to see a show and do more shopping. Will stay again!

What can i say. We booked room $400 for two nights. Got there no valet parking for hotel guest becuse some ufc event was going on in. Town and everyone and their brother took hotel guest parking to watch fight across st at mgm Casino smoke filled, machines have bad pay outs. Getting a drink is very hard unless you order at bar for $12.50 a drink. Save your money go to new York new York thats were we stayed the whole time better restaurants friendly people better pay outs on slots.

You get what you pay for here! Not my ideal choice of Hotel to stay at in Las Vegas, but for the price it is not too shabby! Guest parking is horrible if you're coming here during the weekend or over the holidays. Valet is also jammed packed during these high peak times so drivers beware!

Kids everywhere & mediocre rooms. The outdoor pool (Drenched) is okay. 3 pools, music (DJ's), poolside food service, and bar.

The only plus is that Dick's Last Resort resides here! It's the restaurant\/bar where the waiters & staff are rude to you on purpose. There are a whole bunch of Dick's here, but it is a blast! Be prepared to laugh, or cry.. depending on how sensitive you are.

Don't ya'll just love a spur of the moment trip to Vegas? Well I do!!!  My girlfriend decided to go to Vegas to spy on a guy she was dating....CRAZY! But Im crazier for going along.  We stayed on a friday night and if you know anything about Vegas is that getting a room on the strip on a Friday can sometimes be...tough.  Not this friday though....the Excalibur had a last minitue deal and we took it!  $46 for two queen room yes please!  Checking in was a piece of cake-no wait time!  When does that ever happen in Vegas on a friday night???  

Our rooms had 2 comfy beds and a flat screen.  They were both very clean plus the bathroom was fully stocked with toilet paper.  The downstairs bar was selling drinks at about $8 a piece!  Not bad!  

2 things that sucked big time were:

1. Thunder from Down Under was sold out.
2. Valet parking was full so we had to self park.

I would visit again.
Everything was nice until we got our bill and there were four extra charges for resort fees. Excalibur you are scum 191 turned into 291... unacceptable...never again

So, I stayed at Excalibur on my way out West, due to a great deal from hotels.com.
Okay, so the casino is - as one previous reviewer observed - "gloriously tacky". Yes, yes, yes!
However, the room was huge, very clean, and nicely furnished. And, as tacky as it was, it was practical!
Everything you could want in a hotel stay was here - food galore, slots, table games, musical entertainment, and more.
All in all, a great deal and a great deal of fun!

We had a very bad experience with this hotel. It took an hour and 15 minutes to check in. Our kids were excited to go swimming upon arrival but by the time we got to the pool at 7:00pm, it was closed. No one had told us it closed that early. There were stains on the sheets, the bathroom lights did not work upon arrival, the A\/C was not very cold, and the maids walked into our room TWICE. The only thing we really liked were the swimming pools but I would definitely not stay at this hotel again!

Excalibur is usually my go to hotel in Las Vegas mostly because it's one of the cheapest on the strip and I usually get 2 free nights between Sunday-Thursdays.
If you've ever stayed at a motel, this is a few steps up, but with a room upgrade you can get something a bit nicer. I'm usually only in the room to sleep, as I like to have long gambling sessions.
I've been a Pearl\/Gold players card member at MGM resorts for about 3 years now, so I can use the VIP check-in line. You can become a Pearl member if you just sign up for the mgm credit card, however I got mine through gambling a lot. FYI, Pearl status does not let you use the VIP check-in at all MGM hotels; most require Gold or higher.
Other perks include skipping the lines at most MGM hotel buffets, and free parking.
You still get hit with the resort fee, which is up to about $34\/night.
If you do gamble and lose a lot at this casino during your stay with your mlife card in the machines or tables, you can go to the mlife desk and they may knock off some resort fees  (only time I checked was when I was down about 1K). From what I know, you can't use your mlife card at sportsbook, so they can't keep track of your plays.
There's a food court on the second floor, and you can walk across the bridge to get to Luxor from there.
Rack up points in the myvegas app on your phone or FB, and you can get some comped rooms or food vouchers as well. The deals were better some years back, but it is what it is.
Most MGM hotels do not have a mini fridge, so I usually just grab ice in a bucket and store my drinks in the ice overnight.
If you don't like to spend $4+ on water and soft drinks at the hotel, try walking out onto the strip a little bit.
The liquor stores next to M&M world and Coca Cola sell soft drinks and water for half the price.

Htel impeccable. Comme tous les autres du strip il se repre d'assez loin grce a ses grandes tours et son immense chateau rouge et bleu. a fait un peu penser a un chteau de sable de professionnel !

Comme partout dans cette ville l'htel est gigantesque. Suivant o votre chambre se trouve il ne vous faudra pas moins de 10 bonnes minutes pour accder au Strip.
J'avais une chambre avec un lit king size c'est vraiment le meilleur. Les chambres sont grandes, il y a du rangement. La salle de bain est spacieuse et avait une trs grande douche. Pas de frigo mais un distributeur de glaons. Nikel pour rafrachir le pr apro.

L'htel dispose de plusieurs piscines. Je conseille celle pour les adultes c'est BEAUCOUP plus calme. L'eau est trs chaude. Il y a aussi un Spa mais je n'ai pas test...

Comme tous les autres htel il a un casino et plein de restaurants mais en plus il y a une suprette. a peut servir. Bref c'est une sorte de mini pays !!

Les locaux sont propres (sauf la piscine mais une douche en sortant et le tour est jou).
Niveau situation c'est nikel.

J'ai pay dans les 60-70 la chambre.

It was the lowest priced hotel on the strip. I took the ten dollar upgrade and got a view room but got annoyed when I saw many posts here saying they got upgraded free oh well.  It's a basic motel room in a hotel. No amenities so don't expect anything but a basic room. It was clean and neat so no complaints there.  We had the strip and airport view which my son loved.  Although note the strip is noisy. You'll hear fire and ambulance noises all night. The A\/C was very effective.  No wifi. Who in this day and age doesn't give wifi???  Nothing huge but good location on the strip next to other great hotels. Clean.  Checking in was easy although Our check In clerk had zero personality.  Didn't play in the casinos so no comment there.

Stayed here from Jan 28-31. Hotel was clean and staff was very nice. I did not give it 5 stars for 2 reasons, 1. every 10 steps you have an employee asking you if you want to go see a show etc(Vegas culture I guess as this was very common everywhere) 2. If you're gambling expect to wait 20-30min to get a waitress to bring you a drink, this area definitely needs improvement. Despite that my overall experience was pleasant and would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to save some money while staying on the strip.

Excalibur is the "bang for your dollar" hotel located on the strip. It's not the nicest looking, doesn't have the most amenities or the most up to date decor.

It gives you the opportunity to be on the Vegas strip at a cheaper price compared to other hotels. If you come with kids or have a big family you are traveling with then Excalibur will offer you value in staying in Vegas.

I had a bad experience with my check in where I was offered a free upgrade offering the pool view and adjacent rooms where we could open the doors to each other's rooms. Neither of those happened and we were too exhausted from the drive to complain or change rooms. 

The pool was great for the kids. They have a single slide there for kids and adults. They have a VIP pool as well. Drinks are expensive, as you would probably imagine. We ordered a bucket with 5 beers and it cost $30.

I would stay here again and here is why: I come here to walk around Vegas, not sit in my room. I don't care to pay for an expensive hotel that I come to sleep in.

I was gambling when I decided to stay here. However I rolled the dice n things turned out good. This hotel is better than a 3star n my opinion.  The pools here is great. Only negative draw back is I wish it stayed open later than dark. Because it's hot in Vegas. Another down side is u have to walk thru the casino with ur swimming gear on because the pool is all the way near Tower II if ur n Tower I. My hubby n I love to rate hotels etc and this is above average so I gave it a 4 star.

I really am a fan, I don't like to over pay for a room I'm hardly in. Excalibur charged a mere $100\/night and the room was clean and tidy with all your basic needs covered. Check out is at 11 a.m., nice.

It's Excalibur don't expect much and you won't be disappointed. The pools are pretty awesome though.

Have fun!

Always use to come to this hotel as kid growing up for our family vacation to Vegas. Decided to give it a shot and see how it compares to the newly renovated hotels and casinos of Vegas since I've been to nearly half of them the past few years. Let me tell you from personal experience you won't be disappointed due to the rooms being very clean and modernized, the buffet is just as comparable to other standard Vegas buffets, plenty of tables and machines to gamble on, and what won me over was that the staff and customer service was above and beyond! It is more quiet and less packed compared to the newer and more popular hotels but it's Vegas so you can always go ahead and walk to or Uber to the other casinos. Special thank you to JaVi for the exceptional customer service and welcoming he brought our family as we were lucky enough to check in with him for our stay!

Jesus, why do I sit up all night in tacky casinos whenever I'm in Las Vegas?  This was the last time I'll ever find myself saying, "another Corona, please," to a waitress in tights at 5:30 in the morning, as I press the "Play Maximum Bet" button on some ridiculous slot machine (......yeah, right......).

The room.  What can I say.

Love ya Vegas.

I was really impressed special price of under 40 bucks for the night online special. MOST hotels have them right now.  The refurbished rooms are cleaner, beds are supersoft, room is spacious and no cigarette smell! The  atmospher of the casino and hotel was fun, busy and easy to get around. Checkin was quick, staff was super friendly. definatly worth the stay and new favorite on my list. Skip the buffet though, not that good.

Stayed here for 5 days, rooms were not bad at all. When we first got there since it was early we were advised that our rooms weren't gonna be ready for another 4 hours and was offered the royal tower room for an additional $60 our entire stay and we could get in our room, so we took the offer. Nice rooms, clean and spacious. Air conditioner was freezing but we loved it. The casino down stairs seems ok, I stayed there mostly and played and eat and drink. Will come back definitely.

Seriously, how is Excalibur still in existence?? I've stayed here twice and that amount of times was too many. I've stayed in the updated tower and the ridiculously outdated tower. I mean, you get what you pay for,  I know. But, it just needs updating big time!! Or just tear the thing down and put something better in!! Just saying. Everyone knows how bad this hotel is so I have nothing more to say. Thanks!!

We just got back from Vegas and we stayed at Excalibur.

PRICE: Fair

CUSTOMER SERVICE: Fair, but the lady should not have been chewing gum.

CASINO AREA: Moderately clean, Elevators were filthy with trash.

BEDROOMS: Clean and had all the necessary amenities.  The walls seemed really thin because EVERYTHING can be heard from the room next to ours

OVERALL ENVIRONMENT: Enjoyable

PARKING: We had reservations and the valet was completely full.  They need to reserve valet parking for people who have reservations. We were not happy with that.  People who came to just gamble and sight-see took up the valet parking.

When you compare this hotel to the Venetian or Paris, it does not compare. If you compare it to the motels or the much older casinos on the strip, it seems OK.

The hotel is decent, at least in the modern suites; similar to a Hampton Inn but with fewer amenities. The casino, however, welcomes you with a pungent aroma consisting of freshly discarded cigarette ass hundreds of feet outside of any entrance. It seriously smells as if they purposely spray the place with cigarette ash. No other major casino on the strip left such a negative impression as Excalibur. I get that this is Vegas and people like to smoke, but they made damn sure to make the place as lovely to visit as a castle during the black plague.
This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in even worse than circus circus I will never stay here again

Stayed here a few times never had a problem, got the basic service's all hotels offers, until the thieves reared there ugly heads. Then Excalibur really dropped the ball!!
Whilst my parents where sleeping someone managed to get into there room and steal a wallet from the counter next to the bed! Yes, you read that right, they where asleep in the room and a criminal stranger managed to get in and take a wallet from the side. That's PROBLEM 1!!
PROBLEM 2, on reporting this the next morning the hotel DID NOT offer a room change. 
PROBLEM 3, After calling the UK (for a while) to cancel all there stolen credit cards they where called at 1am to go and settle a $250 phone bill (2 days before they where to check out) The hotel did however offer to have security come up to the room and collect the cash. 
PROBLEM 4, The stolen wallet was found with all the credit cards and identification (only the cash had been taken) within 24 hrs of the incident. However nobody informed my parents. In fact the only reason my Dad got his wallet back was because he asked them to check if it had been handed in. If they had informed them as soon as the wallet was found they would not have had to cancel their bank cards and the problems would have stopped there!!!
BUT NO.....
PROBLEM 5, With no credit and no cash my parents where left high and dry. They where not offered assistance in any form. Nobody within the hotel offered to help with receiving money transfers or anything.
PROBLEM 6, RISK MANAGEMENT. After the initial report was made risk management got involved, however (in short, cause i could write 1000 words on the downfalls of risk management) RISK MANAGEMENT really means WE WILL WASTE YOUR TIME TILL YOUR TOO FRUSTRATED TO DO ANYTHING ELSE OTHER THAN WALK AWAY. After spending 2 1\/2 hrs talking with Mary (I don't give out my last name) on the day of checking out ZERO was achieved!!! Although on the face of it she appeared sympathetic she had no real power to make things right! In fairness she did ask her manager to authorized a refund. Be he refused! When we asked if we could speak to him directly we where told, he dose not deal with guests. 
After this we where escorted to check out (so we did not have to pay the late checkout fee) and left with my mother in tears!!
We will not be staying here again & i advise anyone who dose stay here to dead bolt there door (if you can figure out how) whilst you sleep, cause who knows who will be in there whilst you sleep!!!

So, I'm one of those parents that bring their kids to Vegas with me.  So sue me!  But seriously it is a bit shocking now to walk through a casino with a 3 year old and see a girl in a bikini shaking her stuff at 3 in the afternoon (and all the T & A  cards littering the ground outside,whew!).  I figure they have to learn to deal with it sometime though....  

We stayed at the Excalibur because it was cheap and still in a fairly good location on the strip.  For the price, the hotel is great.  Wonderful pool area and arcade strip for the kids, huge fitness room for me, a nice spa, and easy access to other large resorts.  The rooms were decent.  We upgraded to a nice view of the strip.  There were 5 channels on T.V but we didn't spend much time in the room.  There was only a shower stall (no bath) and no fridge, free coffee or internet access (just to let you know).  

The problem with this hotel is that everybody going to Las Vegas has decided that the Excalibur is a good deal (which it is).  It is by far the most crowded hotel on the strip.  The pool area is packed, the casino is packed.  When you try to get dinner, the dining areas are packed.  The line for the buffet on Saturday night looked like it would take a good half hour wait to get through.  I would probably stay here again, but maybe mid-week.

I booked a room for the weekend since I've stayed here before and never had any problems. This time however, I was severely disappointed. The first night there after I took a shower the bathroom flooded! My friend called the front desk and the lady who answered the phone sounded like she couldn't be bothered to help us and after explaining the situation three times she stated she would send someone up. After a couple minutes maintenance arrived and said that the reason the shower flooded was because the drain was clogged and we had a handicapped accessible shower. Later that night my friend goes to take a shower and wouldn't you know it but the bathroom floods again! We call the front desk and the second lady who answered was much more courteous and offered to have us switch rooms but by that point it was late and we just wanted to go to sleep - she did mention that for our troubles she would reverse our resort fees and that we could move the following day. I had no problem with that and thought it was incredibly nice of her to do that considering the situation. Now I get home check my receipt and nothing was refunded. It's so frustrating! I don't mind paying resort fees - I do mind paying for flooded bathrooms. This is definitely the last time I stay there!

Oh my this place is old! The rooms need to be upgraded especially the bathrooms they are so old & gross. Will never stay here again. The old school window type air conditioner was very, very loud. The casino is average and they don't invest in an air purifier so if smoke bothers you then you definitely won't like it. Even non-smoking areas aren't non smoking. I feel bad for the family as this was my suggestion and after staying at 7 other of the strip hotels I figured this couldn't be a bad pick, but boy was I mistaken. Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere.

We had gone to Las Vegas in a larger group for a friend's birthday. We all decided to stay at the Excalibar given the reasonable cost. However, we did end up realizing why the cost is reasonable. It is one of the older hotel casinos on the strip towards the end of the strip which is OK because then you can explore from your hotel all the way down. We stayed in the Royal Tower which is the upgraded Tower but even then the walls were dingy. The carpet was dingy. The room was dated. To get a players card you have to stand in a long awful line. Registration also has fairly long lines. They have timeshare people all over the hotel trying to get a hold of you too. The pool area was fair but part of the pools are closed because of the season.A lot of the slot machine had mechanical errors but the tables were decent with nice dealers and minimum buy-in down to five dollars.

It's tough for me to down rate things in Vegas. I had a love for the city engrained into me when I was younger. Excalibur was one of the few that I never really explored, but was always wanting to.

Sadly, there was some bad with the good. 

First off you are hit with the undeniable stench of years and years of smoke. For a Haligonian who has been in a city with a stone cold, steadfast, smoking ban, this was the first shock.

Second bad is the sales people who pray on people naive enough to let them take their spiel. Lines like "are you married" or "are you coming back to Vegas in the next year" will lead to a sales pitch that has you putting down 200 bucks on them, and it's "refundable at any time, with no strings attached" which is simply the mantra of if it sounds too good to be true, it is. On top of it, it's a non-stop assault. These people are situated in front of the rooms entrances which is just disgusting to me.

Thirdly was housekeeping and I. First off, we find a sheet with blood on it. Not a huge deal, and really in a huge hotel.. not a huge surprise. Called down and the guy comes up with the wrong sheet. Again, not a huge deal. Then he comes back with a full bed of bedding and hands it to us.. and walks away. Alright so making my own bed on vacation... Then to 'fix' this mistake on their end, they clean our room with a do not disturb sign on.. and lose the remote. THEN on the last morning, open the door as they knock.. walking in on me changing. Just not good at all.

But it's not all bad... 

The front desk staff are amazing. The 20 dollar trick does work, do a google search if you're not sure what I am talking about.

The hotel is a member of the MLife group, which gives you free money in the form of discounts from it's app\/facebook game, MyVegas.. if you are headed to Vegas anytime, GET THIS APP.
I saved almost $300 dollars on a 25% discount on rooms, a free ticket to LOVE by Cirque Du Soleil and bogo for the buffet in Excalibur. Message me if you have any questions.

It's a fun hotel with some of Vegas' old school charm back when they used to care if families wanted to be there.

The costumer service here is absolutely horrendous. For example, last night after walking out of Johnny Rockets one of the other guest took it upon himself to make comments about my body, after telling him to leave me be, he promptly told my friend and I that he would hit us in the face several times. After security showed we were told that we should have walked away and that we should call the front desk manager, Denise, to explain the situation. When speaking with Denise she let my friend and I know that the whole situation painted us in a bad light because we did not walk away and I just seemed angry because of the comments that were made about my body. Naturally this is something that I should just accept and let happen to me because according to Denise being verbally abused is the victims problem not Denise's, not Excalibur's. Excalibur really has done a awful job making their guest feel safe and appreciated. If you are a female looking to stay in Vegas and want to feel safe don't stay at the Excalibur because at the end of the day whatever happens to you is your own fault.

Fulfilling my sons birthday wish of staying a night in the "castle" for only $39 is a great deal. This isn't a 5 star luxury resort but it's not bad. I've definitely stayed in worse rooms that I've paid more for. The beds were comfy there was air conditioning and the bathroom was big and clean. While there was no bath tub or huge flat screen tv I think this room was good. And for $39 what do you expect. I would not be afraid to tell my family to stay here when they visit.

Stayed for 2 nights. I did not choose this hotel and would assume that's the cheapest hotel on the strip. It is an okay hotel considering that you don't plan on spending time there and it has easy access to other hotels on the strip. I did not wish to stay there to gamble or drink. it's dark and smells of cigarettes and essentially reminds you of Lana's daddy chasing music videos.  I don't have any major complaints, apart from them not providing wi-fi in the rooms, but if you don't wanna spend a lot of money or plan ending up in someone else's hotel room, go for that.
Great and cheap place to stay at on the strip. The hotel is older but who cares when your just using the room to get ready and sleep. Plus the McDonald's in their food court is on point

great for the family
great pool
gambling is great
great food court
price has gone up and they charge resort fees

06\/03\/12 to 06\/05\/12
The real thing i love this hotel but every time we go we have to pay extra for every little thing this time for view for the strip we have to pay extra the nice room extra because they did no renew the other side of the other tower like a guess from the hotel they not give nothing free 
and I'm agree they need to improve the shows and the amenities

Of all the MGM this one is the WORST! 
The only reason I gave it a 1 is because it was decent priced for Vegas and the gambling wasn't bad. Check in was messed up and the rep was RUDE!! Never set up my parking and I even had to RE-check in because she didn't do it right the first time. Buffet was avg and only upshot for 24.99 was unlimited draft beer (2) and wine. Hotel has an "odd" smell. I was here for 6 days and NOT ONCE did they change my sheets or make my bed. Will NEVER stay here again!

It is a decent hotel with nice room and i got upgraded to a nicer room on the 22nd floor and that was awesome. It was cheap too especially the day after new years. I won and and lost in the casino and it was just a place to stay in vegas.

This review is for the fun dungeon (carnival games and arcade downstairs).  This is a good place to take kids.  We played some pinball and carnival games and it was really fun even as adults.  This one is more friendly than the one in NYNY and better for kids.

As a kid, staying here was always nice cause the hotel looked like a castle! Not to mention the huge arcade downstairs!

The last time I stayed here was in 2005 with my mom and her friend for her birthday. And I told myself I'd never stay here again! I enjoy staying at hotels, and after experiencing much better places to stay, this place is horrible.

First of all, the towel's had black marks on them. Even after calling room service to have them replaced, the new ones has black marks on it too! When I got in bed the first night, there was blonde hair all over my pillow and sheets. I didnt have blonde hair at the time! It was such a horrible and disgusting experience!

I do like the shops they have upstairs and I do like that they have a Krispy Kreme! But none of that requires you to STAY at the hotel, so, I dont think I will be!

Not the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, but certainly not the best either. We stayed here because the rates were cheapest on the strip.

Supposedly our room came with free wireless internet, but you couldn't actually get a signal from our room. A friend of mine was staying in the same hotel, and his room had signal but it was too weak to connect. 

The walls are fairly thin and you will hear pretty much everything going on outside your room. We had the heater on most of the time we were in the room, because it was incredibly cold without it, and there weren't enough blankets to keep us warm at night. It was noisy and old, and it would run for a couple minutes at a time, then shut off for a few minutes, then turn on again, which made it rather difficult to fall asleep. On top of that, the curtains don't completely block out the light from outside, and the pillows are gigantic, so I didn't get much sleep while I was there.

If you even so much as glance at the casino floor, you will be harassed by people trying to sell you timeshares. Even around the shops there are a few people waiting to pounce. One afternoon I was headed for the escalator and I saw a timeshare salesman heading in the same direction. He stopped and stared at me for an uncomfortably long time, like he was waiting for me so he could start his spiel while I was trapped on the escalator with him. I took the stairs instead.

I am a review fanatic and after reading some of these reviews I was VERY apprehensive about staying here but as I've said before, always judge based on your own experience. We came to Vegas for a wedding and had plenty of activities planned so this hotel was reasonable, good location and a good choice. We arrived late Thursday (about 2am) and left Sunday night. Check-in was very easy! There is a resort fee associated with any stay in Vegas so the staff explained it covers fees such as printing boarding passes, the pool, etc. In my opinion, it seems a bit much but it must be paid. She gave us our room keys and directed us to our rooms. 

The hotel is located next to Luxor and New York New York. Its on the strip and very convenient to get to other hotels or activities around the city. The entire hotel has is a Medieval theme, which attracts kids and adults. I didn't see many children during my stay here except one morning I went to the pool area. The pool area is very big and includes a special adult-only pool. You don't have to bring a towel from your room, just show the attendant your room key and you can grab as many towels as you need. There were several bar areas, lounge chairs and Cabana's for relaxing and\/or tanning. 

The rooms were very spacious and clean. The beds and pillows were SUPER comfy- no problems sleeping at all. They have nice flat screens also. My only concern is the room doesn't come with a microwave, mini fridge and\/or coffee maker. Its strange because there is a space right under the tv where a fridge can fit. Instead, it can be purchased for a daily fee- no thank you! We didn't have a good view (not requested either) because we mainly needed a place to shower, sleep, get dressed and this hotel did just that. We had no concerns with room service. Once we arrived we noticed the safe wasn't working properly so we called to the front desk, informed them and someone was coming to fix it 4 minutes later. I'm surprised they came so quickly, especially since it was almost 3am but he came and fixed it immediately.

There are several restaurants and shopping stores located on the 2nd floor all ranging from Pizza Hut, Starbucks, Cinnabon, Krispy Kreme, Popeye's, etc. There is also a buffet, steakhouse and a few other eating places along with nice bar areas. Need some jewelry or a handbag? Bag of chips or souvenirs? No worries as they have stores for that also. As expected, the food is a bit pricey but its very convenient. Some are open 24 hours (Schlotzskys for sure) but unsure on the others. The hotel also has plenty of slot machines and tables. I enjoy blackjack and to see they had a $5 table was heaven! Smoking is allowed but don't think you can walk around the entire place and smoke, only in certain areas. While checking in, a man was standing in line smoking and the staff politely told him smoking is for the bar area only. Smoking is allowed while gambling too. 

We were in town for a special event and seen no point of renting a car so I'm unsure how the parking is. We either called a taxi or used Uber the entire trip and that went well. They do have a designated area they pick you up (per Uber and hotel rules) which is near the casino entrance. 

Overall, I enjoyed my stay and will gladly stay here again. The customer service was great by the front desk staff, housekeeping and concierge. Its in a convenient location, we felt safe at all times and whatever we needed the hotel provided. Thanks!

The stay here was decent but the room is definitely not the best considering the price and that it is under the MGM group. I was mostly disappointed with the fact that customer service was bad - I waited at the baggage storage line for a long time to store my luggage for an hour or less before I leave but no attendant came. The security came over to help me ask the front desk for the attendant but was simply dismissed by the staff that the attendants would be back but they may take a long while. Another guest also asked for it and faced the same response. I think the staff can handle the situation better rather than asking the guests to just wait. How long does he expect us to wait? I don't have all the time in the world to do that.

I don't think I will return to the Excalibur again, and won't recommend it to anyone.

Positive: Affordable if you book your room in advance and during the week just like any other hotel. Remodeled rooms are nice enough for you and your kids (my room was clean with a nice pool side view - ask for pool view!) You really do not have to leave the hotel if you bring your kids, pool has a water slide ( get a cabana early or at least an umbrella early because they fill up quickly!) Excalibur knight show is great for kids and a really good deal (includes food) just like medieval times. Video arcade is good size. The salon was expensive just for a manicure - I wouldn't go back to salon for that but the spa was okay, gym is cool with a pool view. Another downer is they do not let you bring outside drinks into pool area even if it is bought in Excalibur! THAT I DO NOT AGREE WITH, they make a lot of money already! I bought a frozen drink at Dicks (in Excalibur) and I had to finish it or throw it away before entering the pool! I guess its a separate business but I still do not agree. The casino area smells like smoke but they all do lol! My son, daughter and I had a lot of fun despite the few negatives which there will always be something you do not like. - Always be open minded before commenting and have a full understanding of the reasons why something is not the way we like it to be! :) State the positive and the negative! Be respectful and fair!, take everything into consideration!!
We had a perfectly sized room everything couldn't of gone better on this 4 day vacation. Everyone is friendly and helpful

Stayed here with my family last weekend and don't really have anything too exciting to add. The rooms were ok but could of been a little cleaner. The shower had a lot of soap scum on it and there was a black pube lying on the floor outside the shower door. The molding was coming off along the bottom of the wall just outside the bathroom. It was just ok, not a whole lot to do in the hotel except dodge the sales people trying to sell you shows every time you turn around. We did enjoy Buca's Italian Restaurant except it cost us a fortune to eat there. Will probably stay somewhere else if we visit again.

This is a great strip hotel to stay at when you're on a budget. The room was nicely decorated, the bed was super comfy, and the view was great! I also loved how there is a mall style foodcourt in the hotel, again great for the traveler on a budget!

This place is not really that great. I checked in yesterday and the door to the room was not really working because you have to literally push it hard to get it to open. I spent 5-10 minutes trying to figure out what was wrong with the door before slamming into it. If that wasn't bad enough, when I finally got into the room, it turns out that one of the lamps was not working, the t.v. did not have a signal input, and the internet was wired with no wireless options. I can't believe this hotel seriously does not offer any wi-fi options despite the fact that it charges a resort fee like the other hotels. The Medieval theme is realistic I guess since the atmosphere is dark, grungy, kinda stuffy, and you get the idea. The buffet isn't that great either. I would recommend just saving your money and trying out the new food court (much cheaper and better tasting food). If you haven't tried the buffet yet, go ahead and give it a shot, but don't say I didn't warn you!

P.S. This is my first time rating a place with 2 stars. That should tell you how I feel about this place lol.

Oh if there were only a way to give zero stars. This hotel was so overpriced considering the low quality of the service and the hotel itself. The bellboy who took our bags up blatantly tried to hustle us for a bigger tip and we didn't give him a skimpy tip! Then when it was time to check out, the bell desk told me that they do not help guests take luggage out of their room and that we could not use a luggage cart because it is a "liability." The room was beyond basic and their $15\/day resort fee +tax added nearly 50% to the cost of our stay and did not even include wi-fi, but rather wired internet. You cannot plug anything into their tv's like a dvd player or in my fiance's case an Xbox. The location is really their only saving grace. Their only goal seems to be to squeeze as much money out of you as humanly possible. I will definitely choose a different hotel next time I visit Las Vegas.
Clean rooms nice beds had no issues and pretty decent price

You pay for what you get I guess.  Except the resort fee.  

After checking in, we realized we were slapped with the $15\/day resort fee.  Fine, whatever.  We were told it included two free drinks per day so we figured that would about balance out.  Well, its actually two free drinks per STAY, not day.

Then we go to the pool, and there are no towels ready.  Isn't this what we paid $15 for?

The rooms are dingy.  The AC doesn't work right.  Its also hard to navigate through.  They also do not have WIFI...you have to plug in an ethernet cord.  That isn't an option on my Mac.  

The daily solicitations on our voicemail was annoying.

I'd rather sleep on The Deuce.

You see that castle over there, babe? I'm gonna spoil you a little and let ya stay there tonight." - quote from my obviously sarcastic boyfriend, lol.

But joking aside Excalibur ended being a decent place to lay our heads. The other two nights we stayed at MGM which does have much nicer, more modern rooms, but do you really go to Vegas for the room? No. 

The worst part about staying here was definitely checking in. Longest line ever no matter what time it was. We waited about 35 minutes total, but once we got up the man helping us was super friendly and got us checked in quickly. 

I'd most definitely stay again especially with their prices being so much more affordable than some other places around the same area.

It's a very disappointing hotel to stay at. They charge for a resort fee which idk what that means and what is it used for and the hotel rooms don't come with microwave or a coffee pot let alone a fridge. Oh and the one thing that also bugged me wad that they didn't offer complimentary water bottles.

Yes, it's a casino, but the entire establishment is so full of smoke and very loud you want to find your way out as quickly as possible. The people attracted to this place look and smell like failure and cigarettes. Pricing: ridiculous!  Drinks are $10\/beer, meals are well above the actual cost for poor to mediocre meals at almost every restaurant.  MGM has a monopoly going and it's not good.
for reals, don't do it.  You can find cheap tables here but I wouldn't stay at the hotel unless you got a super good deal and you don't mind a lot of noise.

Hopefully things will get better after some renovations. Our resort tower room had a leak on the first night and the gas sulfur smell remained for the remainder of our stay. When we asked to be moved or compensated, they waited to respond until the day we checked out. Very disappointing service and general rudeness from the staff, particularly one service member Amanda who acted as if the room deterioration was our fault. Might try again in a few years.

DON'T GO TO KEVIN!!!  
The night front desk employee who helped me named Kevin was no help at at. I paid  for my room online do when I got there Kevin checked me in told me to sign a paper charging my card with the resort fee.. Never did he talk to me about the room... I had to ask him what floor I was on.. He put me on the 6th floor and said I can only change if I up grade for and extra $20 a night and I was staying for 4 nights. So I took my room key and went to tower  1.. When I got there the room was horrible!!! First he gave me a room for a handicap person which had big isle space for a wheelchair two peep holes in the door.. Grab bars on the bathroom walls and over the toilet... Dirty air condition system and asepsis ceiling and on top of that it was a smoking room and I don't smoke.. Kevin knew what he was giving us and only wanted me to up grade so he can get a commission.. I returned back to the front desk and the wonderful Alicia helped me.. She asked smoking or non she asked how many beds did I want. If I was a local (which I was) and the deals locals have all questions Kevin dident care about asking.. She apologized for his mistakes and moved me to tower 2 which is 100 times better... Thank you Alicia for making my stay-cation better

Not a bad hotel. The first hotel I ever stayed at in Vegas being legal. It's pretty cool that this hotel is walking distance to other hotels like luxor, MGM and mandalay bay. It's near the M&M, Coca Cola stores and Arcade. Fun stuff for the kids.
The buffet at this hotel is average. I love how they have little fast food and chinese togo restaurants upstairs. I love the spicy mc chicken sandwich at McDonalds. Too bad they don't have those here in San Jose.

They have an arcade on their Lower level.

So just stayed at the Excalibur for 5 nights with my SO and a few friends and for the most part it was a positive experience. Check it went very smooth, the room was clean, up to our standards, and all the staff were very friendly. I also really appreciate the good selection of inexpensive places to eat in the food court.

We were in town for an event called EDC which brings tons of people to Las Vegas for about a week (150,000+ peak). It's a younger budget minded crowd so this place has a lot of guests. With that considered parking was horrible here. I spent around 45 minutes looking for a spot one morning after the event. This was by far the most inconvenient thing we had to deal with during our stay here. I'm sure it's much better when the hotel isn't so full with so many people driving vs flying.

I love the location and convenience of this hotel and definitely felt it was a good value. I will probably end up staying here again though I may reconsider if coming for EDC because of the parking situation. That's the only reason I didn't give the place 4 stars.

I never stayed at this hotel but Vil wanted me to learn how to play Spanish 21. Which is Blackjack without the number 10 card. Overall it was fun to play but I don't think my heart can take gambling. Vil was having a ball. Overall it was fun but I we were losers that night. Oh well...our dealer was nice but she needed to give us a break that night.

i used to like this place when i was a kid. i grew out of it. the rooms aren't so bad, but there is security checkpoint before you can head up to the elevators. don't get stuck without a key because they won't let you in the elevators if you aint got one.

I think this Hotel is pretty good overall for its location, end of the strip, and other good perks inside the hotel. Also, fairly affordable rooms from time to time through M Life Rewards!
I like that there is a food court with plenty of options, and other restaurants such as a Johnny Rockets elsewhere, in this Hotel. I think it is convenient especially for family's such as mine that can never agree on one restaurant to eat at. This place also connects to other Casinos\/Hotels which is convenient during very hot\/cold weather. Housekeeping is the reason why my review lacks a star. These employees are very rude and carry a lot of attitude when u ask them for assistance or anything such as towels, soap, or toilet paper. They are like the fast food workers who give you two packets of ketchup after you just paid for a lot of items. So I would recommend bringing back up, but of course I would also encourage you still ask them for these basic services and items that the Casino should at the very least provide due to all the money you are already spending by staying here. There is a "Fun Dungeon" arcade for kids as well.
Besides that, I haven't had much of a problem staying at the Excalibur and I feel that I will come back in the future.

This FIRST review will be based on my initial visit to my room. I will post a second review after my trip is over. 

Parking very easy! Registration was super fast! Here is my complaint. When I walked into my room I saw an open beer bottle. Keep in mind we just walked in for the first time. I walked down the hall to the housekeeper area and told them I had a beer bottle in my room. The last there said and I quote "no you don't". Serious?!? I don't even drink beer. I looked at her and said "do you wanna come to my room and look?" I was so mad at this point. Who are you to call me a liar? She said I just cleaned that room and there is no bottle. I walked her to my room and pointed at the bottle. She apologized and I told her do not call me a liar again. 

I called the front desk to complain. Lindsey helped me and offered two free buffet tickets. I also had the assistant housekeeper manager call me and apologize. 

I am hoping the rest of my trip will be better than my start. Stay tunes for my post trip review.


POST TRIP EXPERIENCE

After everything I will come back and stay at Excalibur again. I did enjoy my stay here overall. I used to stay at Excalibur all the time but then decided to switch to North Vegas. This experience might bring me back this direction. Thank you for a memorable experience!

Stayed here in november and it was pretty good. Service was great. This hotel is affordable. New bed sheets, lots of towels even though my friend brings her own towel..so I guess more towel for me! I like gambling here come to think of it I like gambling anywhere I win.haha! Anyways the crowd is a mixed of young and old and sometimes children..don't worry they hide the children in the arcade..by spongebob down the stairs in the BASEMENT lol! Just kidding but it is down some stairs.

I've stayed at Excalibur quite a few times. If you are going to pay extra to upgrade your room to a contemporary it's great. However, if you are just looking for a basic room (because after all you are just sleeping and showering in it) below basic is what you will get. My bed skirt had  a HUGE stain on it. My mom pointed it out. We even laughed about what kind of activity could possibly cause a stain that huge. And my comforter had a cigarette burn on it. Well not a comforter, but a blanket that would be suited for an animal shelter. Check in is slow, long lines. Rude bell hop that had a major attitude and was short with us. Then he stared at us and wondered why he didn't get a tip. The coupon book is nice, but they have to find a way to get you to patronize their hotel\/casino because you won't do it for the rooms. We love the location, the variety of food, the staff. Just beware that if you are looking for bottom of the barrel that is what you will get!!!

Underwhelming. Outdated. Relatively dull. 

No coffee machine. No microwave. 

"Resort fee" 

You're forced to walk through the smoky casino to reach the restaurant level from the rooms. 

If you're staying at a casino hotel, you should stay somewhere else.

The price was okay, the theme is very cool, location is great, but it could have been better.

There was dirty towel in our room when we got there from a previous guest.  Whatever, mistakes happen, didn't bother me too much.  I called and they came and retrieved it.  But then, later that evening, I get back to the room and now the lights in the bathroom won't work.  You have to push a reset button on the wall to fix this - it's as if it blew a fuse but I didn't use any hair dryer or straightening\/curling iron or anything besides just turn the lights on.  Overall, the room was below standard for the price I paid.  The TV quality was terrible and there was no fridge so you have to go to the casino floor to get something to drink thus ensuring you pay even more for your stay. 

Lastly, there are people on the casino floor, right when you walk in the resort tower, trying to get you to take a timeshare tour.  They offer discounted\/free tickets for shows but in exchange you have to pay a deposit and take a few hours out of your day to go tour a timeshare.  They are at a desk (it looks like a concierge desk) and the greeters try to reel you over when you first walk in.  It is very misleading in appearance and I have no idea why Excalibur allows this - you can find this sort of thing on the strip but when you are in your hotel isn't the goal to make the guests comfortable?  Being constantly approached by sales people makes me very uncomfortable - it is not what I want to experience on vacation.  For this reason I will not be staying at the Excalibur in the future.  I would rather pay more to not have to deal with this; I've never experienced this in a hotel before and did not notice anything like this in other hotels on the strip.

im going to be honest...i was expecting much from this hotel, i thought it was going to be bad...considering their buffet sucks.... but it wasnt bad at all!!
the rooms looked like the were newly remodeled, had a huge flat screen tv, they were modern and nice, and the bathroom was bug, with a huge mirror...i loved it!!

..and we got to walk around, and the have a lot going on!! alot of restaurants, great bars, and was ver active!...and since it was connected to the Luxor and another hotel, we went club hopping without every stepping foot on the sidewalks!

I was disappointed that this place had pretty decent reviews after staying there. My husband and I were on a tight budget but really wanted to make a Vegas trip for our honeymoon.

1. We were told we could check in early upon arrival. After waiting 30 minutes in the check-in line, we were told we couldn't get into our room for another almost two hours. After traveling for 10 hours, this was not music to our ears.

2. We stayed in one of their "newer" rooms... while the room was decorated nicely, the bed was not as nice as they made it sound. My husband and I left Vegas with lots of back pain!

3. Their staff is incompetent. Well not all of them, but most.

4. Housekeeping is SO loud. Every morning, like clockwork, we would be woken around 8-8:30 to housekeeping speaking Spanish extremely loudly in the all way.

5. The whole hotel smelled awful. Maybe it's because I am not used to being in buildings were people are allowed the smoke, but I feel like the whole hotel stunk like old cigarettes.

All in all, we had a horrible trip. Both of us got stomach bugs and we spent half the trip in our hotel. We wished we had splurged on a nicer hotel. Next time we know better!

So hotels.com had a last minute deal for the weekend before New Years (it appears many people found said deal.)

Hotels on the strip generally are priced more than I paid for the entire weekend so price wise I was impressed.

I have stayed in a lot of hotels in vegas, from the plaza (yikes), to circus circus...never..again, to the Signature at the MGM (piiiiiimp). This place was in the middle, which ladies and gentlemen..I expected.

Check in was quick and efficient, they give you a coupon book with two free drinks for the hotel bars (in case you don't want to play)...I cannot complain about this, we had a 20.00 food voucher as well.

Be aware like almost ALL strip hotels they charge a "Resort Fee" its the new thing..its stupid but it is what it is and it was still cheaper than normal. 

The room was clean, 2 queen beds, flat screen TV and Full view of the turrets in the middle of the castle. Needless to say my 2 year old was thrilled (don't ask...it just had to happen that way).

Parking wasn't as bad as it could have been, we used self park, and could usually get pretty close to the door our rooms were near. 

The shopping is decent in the Excalibur, I do enjoy that it is connected to the Luxor and if you have the chance go to Popcornopolis (holy cow).

Their buffet is subpar that would be my only complaint. Not a lot of options for the price, the presentation is meager at best. I would go to Paris or Harrah's before I would go back there.


If you are looking for a nice bed to rest in, and not be extremely pampered (to each their own for their Vegas trip) then this place is for you. My philosophy in Vegas is there is so much to see and do, I can get pampered at home for cheaper and sleep when I'm dead.

I would stay at the Ex again without issue.
I love the old king Arthur\/castle theme. The outside is lit up and very cool. Plus the tournament of kings show is Awesome!!
We stayed for 2 nights, we experienced some of the best customer service from the check in desk as well as housekeeping. We will definitely be staying here again.

Very fun hotel to stay at. It's like a giant Medieval Times. The rooms are pretty standard. This place hosts the dinner and tournament in their lower level. A good time was had by all. I think this would be a better choice for people traveling with kids. Also must try their goblets! Refills are cheaper if you buy the souvenir goblet.

I gave this hotel 2 stars. The place smells like smoke mixed with some sort of febreeze smell. Like the hotel is trying to make it smell better. Not working . The bed and pillows were comfortable. I would just work on the smell it smells really bad. The room however didn't smell like the rest of the place . Well I stay there again no.

This hotel has terrible customer service.  We stayed in a wide screen room for a week for the IBM conference.  We complained twice about our rowdy neighbour.  Security did not do much so we ended up changing rooms.  When we requested late check out, we were told by the manager that they do not compensate for guest behaviour and it was going to cost us $25 to checkout late. The rooms were dated, the beds lumpy, and sheets were like paper towel.  I will never stay here again!

Listen you don't come here for the atmosphere and nightlife. You come here for cheap room cost and convenience. Yes it's not the best looking but damn who cares walk over to another casino and use the bridge outside. Who the hell goes to Vegas and spends time inside there room?  They have a food court decent rooms and a casino floor like any other casino. Remember your room is only for sleeping.

So, I like some of you, was very skeptical of this hotel. The reviews were not the best and some of these horror stories were frightening. A few friends and I stayed here on the weekend of July 28 2017. We arrived at approximately 4:00 pm, we waited in line, which wasn't long at all at this time, and we got checked in quickly, got an upgraded, conjoined rooms for a fee of 10 dollars per night more for each room! I thought that was awesome! We stayed at the royal tower and it was definitely worth the upgrade. Before anything else we checked the beds because my biggest fear is waking up next to bed bugs, we inspected and found them to be clean! The bathroom has no bathtub but that was no issue for us we wanted it to shower. The housekeepers were also great, always restocking and cleaning out rooms in a flash. 

The furniture is a bit run down but you can definitely see their efforts in trying to modernize the place. 

Ac worked great as well. Their food court was affordable and so many options! Perfect for us drunkies who didn't wanna walk far. 

Would definitely stay again (although we try to stay at different hotels every time we visit), and I would definitely recommend.

This was our first time staying at the Excalibur hotel. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helped answer all of our questions. They provided us with multiple options for our rooms and helped us select the room that was right for us. 

We stayed in the resort tower. The room was on the warm side because the AC unit wasn't very effective. It was loud and would constantly turn off and on throughout the night. 

The housekeeping staff was awesome. One of our lamps wasn't working properly and within 10 minutes they brought us a new lamp. In addition, the housekeeping staff was welcoming and it's the small things like that make me want to come back. 

The only other down side to the room is that it just needs some updating. If it wasn't for the condition of the room I would have easily given the hotel a 4 star because the staff was great.

Man has vegas changed! The standard tower room is where we stayed since we didn't think we'd be in the room much. For the price (which I got at a STEAL) it wasn't bad. But, we had a view of the brick wall of a tower. The pillows were over stuffed. NO tub was a huge turn off for me. I've stayed at 2 star hotels that had better accommodations. Not cool. I won't be back.

OK, some of the yelper's have been kicking this hotel out to the curb.  I just stayed here over the weekend  and was pleasantly surprised.  First of all, I put my nose to the test. No vomit, nor moldy smells.  Yes, cigarettes were smelling up the place,but it's Vegas. I stayed in the tower 2 and the carpet and rooms were fine. It's not a 4 star hotel ya know. I got extra pillows, the bed was soft, and the AC kicked butt! Big screen tv. Wifi (at an additional cost.) Who cares? It was all good, EXCEPT two nights in a row the hotel alarms sounded off. Once at 11pm, & Sat. night at 3:15am.  Very loud, but then if some of the yeewhoo's staying there pulled the fire alarms, it's not the hotels fault. I would definately stay here again.  Oh, and I lost my azz playing there in the casino, and I still wrote a nice review.  How's that?

So on the Thursday before I left for Vegas my BF calls and says, "Hey lets go to Vegas for the weekend, I will book it all now. Some friends of mine are on their way now"...me: "Ok lets go!" 

Less then 24 hours later we are on our way to Vegas! We decided to stay at the Excalibur because that is where his friends already had a room. Although it is not the type of place I would have picked, it had some great positive points:

- BIG rooms. I was in Tower 1, which I thought I wouldnt like based on reviews and it was perfectly fine. We were on the 23rd floor and had two doubles, which was the only thing available, but perfect because we just threw our stuff on the other bed. 

- Did NOT smell like smoke in our room, MAJOR PLUS. 

- Cheap. 

- The Spa and Fitness center is A++. Yes, we did go to the gym for a few hours like freaks, but the gym and spa is the NICEST part about this place. We each had massages and sat in the sauna and whirlpool (unfortunately for us the male and female spas are separate). We left totally relaxed and ready to party after that.

- Room service. Do it. Their "food court" selection sucks and its gross seeing all the other guests scarfing down ColdStone and Wetzel Pretzel. We did not even want to bother with the Buffet. We spent $100 on a HUGE breakfast and didnt have to move or change from our beds...SCORE. 

- Location. Easy to get to all the other hotels and casinos where you actually want to hang out. 

So overall, would I stay here again? Yes, because for the rate and the accessibility it is great. Would I hang out there while staying there? No. But thats ok, Bellagio is just down the street.

Terrible. I am writing this review from their uncomfortable bed still pissed. So, I get a "deal" on a room from Expedia. Or so I thought.

For two nights the total will be $200+ for a shitty room. Once you calculate all the ways they nickel and dime you now, I don't ever really want to come back to Vegas.  Times been a-changin' and I didn't get the memo. If I do come back I'll be staying with my family.

Well, first I must note what started my shitty Vegas vacay. We arrive late because traffic was awful. Only to find a line with literally hundreds of other late guests. Tell me why they have like 5 workers checking people in. Why? Because it is fine to have paying guests waiting for two hours to get to their room. I guess I should choose a different arrival time, shame on me. 

I mean this room is not even on the level of a Best Western (Best Westerns' give complimentary breakfast, mini fridge, microwave, decent beds, many outlets, great TVs w\/ channels that work, nice showers, etc) let alone a Marriot, but think they can charge resort fees, parking fees, and whatever other fees that I'll see once the bill is given. Fuking ridiulous. Who is swimming in February? Who? Who works out on vacation? I for one dont! These are the things that should be complimentary because they are options many do not want or can't feasibly use--nobody swims in frigid weather. And now they charge for parking. Nah!! That's the limit.  

Save your money and go to an actual destination. Or at the very least save yourself from these prices and stay away from the Strip  because ish is lame af now. I will be staying my arse back in Cali cause I'm not with this BS. They better be glad I got Cirque du Soleil tickets because otherwise I would have went straight back home. Ugh, just ughy!!

As a kid, the first time I was in Vegas I stayed at Excalibur. I remember thinking it was a magical place like Disneyland because it's designed like a castle. Now... not so much. It's not the best hotel but you get what you pay for. I was barely in the room anyway.

Pros:
The hotel is cheap. 
It is on the strip (far end).

Cons:
There is no central air conditioning. There is a loud unit. 
Room service was extremely slow. It took a long time for my friends to get some towels.

After reading all of the bad comments posted about Excalibur, I wasn't going to stay here.  However, the price was reasonable and the location was perfect.  As far as the rooms are concerned, stay in tower 2.  The contemporary room was really nice and spacious.  Our room was super clean and housekeeping did an excellent job turning down the beds and giving us extra towels and wash cloths.  I was satisfied with  my entire stay.  I was there May 4-8 and I didn't have a complaint.  The only thing that was missing was a fridge and microwave.
