It was hard to warm up left over food, but maybe that's how they manage to keep the room clean.  I really enjoyed my stay and the convenient walk to the luxor and Mandalay bay without leaving the hotel.  The only reason why I didn't give it five stars was because of the missing microwave. I really wanted to warm up my food instead of throwing it away.

I write this review with a heavy heart. Excalibur is our "home" hotel in Vegas. We just got done with our 3rd stay in 3 years there. The 2 previous years we had no problems. 

We checked in on a Monday. We needed a handicapped accessible room. And that's all we got. No view, granted not all the rooms get a view. There was hair in the shower, and the shower was a glass door type and there was black stuff coming off the metal parts on the floor, dust on the furniture, pamphlets on the floor from a different casino\/hotel from the previous person, the bottom handle on the dresser was broken off and put inside the dresser drawer and the kicker was we found old boxer shorts (underwear) behind the t.v stand. It just doesn't seem like they care at all about the accessible rooms. Like I said, this was our first year with problems. If we need another budget hotel the next time we stay, we will chose excalibur again but I will request tower 2. It's the updated tower. 

I'm sorry excal, I still love you. I'm just very disappointed in you....

Cheap and convenient, the rooms are alright and the pool is nice for an older hotel. Don't expect this to be a luxurious resort where you lounge around all day. We didn't spend much time at the hotel, we mostly spent our days up and down the Strip. Located near the southern end of the Strip, the Excalibur has convenient access to the public bus system that goes to the airport. There's a free monorail to the Luxor and Mandalay Bar, but most of the things we wanted to see were north of us on the Strip - which is walking distance. Best thing is the medieval themed show, the Tournament of Kings. (Separate review.)

Worst hotel experience ever!!This hotel does not have toothbrush and tooth paste. The rug is so slippery but there is no slipper available!! Make sure to bring everything to clean urself if u book this hotel!!
What a cheeseball of a place. If you want to go somewhere like this, you shouldn't be in Vegas - you should be in Orlando. I didn't know a place could be comparably depressing to Orlando!

This casino is my least favorite casino; however I have attended the show the Tournement of Kings and enjoyed the food and the entertainment. The waitstaff however were completely overwhelmed with people and performed poorly to refill drink beverages and tended to the VIP guests whom received salads and fancy desserts. The outside of the casino is dingy looking and when I arrived in the casino it smelled like old dirty shoes. I had to have my sanitizer ready because I was afraid to touch anything.

This review is solely for their bars. After the thunder down under show, I went to the hotel lobby bar. I went to the bar right in front of the thunder down under stadium. I ordered two shots of grey goose and two gummy bear shots. The price for the four drinks was a little over $65 without the tip. 

I would highly suggest the gummy bear shot. It tastes just like a sweet gummy bear would taste. I do wish it was chilled a bit more so it went down a bit more smoothly. The same goes for the grey goose shots, I wish it was chilled a bit more. 

Overall, it's a great layover to get a quick shot pre or post showing of thunder down under!!!

Ok so here is the problem we ran into with this place. We didn't stay at this casino but we did attend their dinner show called the Excalibur Dinner Tournament. It's pretty similar to Medieval times in FL and NJ. The show itself was pretty cool and we enjoyed the food which offered a whole hen. That was very interesting because that was the first time eating one of those.

 it's so small and its the whole body! Anyway all was good during the first hour but towards the end of the show my asthma started acting up because their ventilation in the arena sitting area was very poor compared to Medieval times. I ended up having to go to the local hospital because of it as the show ended. Funny thing is all I needed was fresh air. When we arrived at the hospital the asthma was gone. lol

It was still a pretty good show despite that happened to me.
You get what you pay for. You swear this place was infested with the ghetto scene. Scary to visit places inside.

After leaving the MGM to come here due to the UNCOMFORTABLE atmosphere with 20 something's making out everywhere in the pool area I thank the Excalibur for finishing my trip on a good note.

My husband and I came here from the MGM with our kids, 13 and 9, and were so thankful we did.  The first room we were given was not cleaned well.  There was food all over the floor and the toilet was broken.  I have never switched rooms before but I felt that this was just not acceptable.  We went back down to the check in and waited for about 15 minutes before the lady from VIP came over to help and called us into the VIP area to check in.  After explaining what happened with the room, she was extremely apologetic and immediately switched our room to a high floor with a view.  She was very delightful and friendly.  I don't remember her name, but she was great!

The room was ok, yes, they have updated the rooms but there is still wear and tear on the dresser and the chairs are old looking, orange felt.  But, I didn't come for the rooms; I came for a better experience for my kids than the MGM.  And a better experience we got! I must say though that the bed was very comfortable and the room was clean with enough towels and products.   Maid service was very polite and brought us extra blankets when we called for them within 5 minutes and gave us extra towels when she saw us in the hall.

We went down to the pool immediately after getting settled and even though the slide pool was closed (the main attraction for my 9 year old son), we were able to rent a cabana for $25 for the rest of the afternoon (3-6).  This was great!  You get a stocked fridge, tv, and a great host and waitress, padded pool chairs and a couch.  We spent the rest of the afternoon relaxing and enjoying the weather.  A WAY better experience than the MGM!  They happened to be running a special the next day for the cabanas at the slide pool so we immediately held one for us for the next day as we had planned to spend the entire day at the pool anyways.   Another great day and great experience.  I can't tell you how much fun my kids had and we didn't have to sit in the blazing sun (it was 100 degrees that day) and they bring you food when you order, drinks and make sure you are taken care of plus all the extras I mentioned earlier.  Thank you Excalibur for having great staff!

If you have a family and are bringing them to Vegas (which despite all the younger crowd's complaints, there is a TON of things to do with kids here) I highly recommend bringing them to the Excalibur.  The rooms are cheaper and even the food is cheaper at the food court than other bigger hotels.  The McDonald's here is way cheaper than the McDonald's at the MGM.  The pool area is way more kid-friendly and the slide pool is a hit.  We will definitely come back here for our next family vacation.

I've stayed here twice only because my friends were staying here & I got a great offer, but not very happy wth their rooms. The beds are very uncomfortable, hard & woke up wth a backache. Its a no frills hotel! Their breakfast & lunch buffet are just ok. Not worth it 4 the price, the pizza tasted like it came frm a box. The good thing about their buffet is u serve ur own drinks. They have a couple stations. The guy at check in (in the vip area!) had a look on his face that said "damn I don't want to be here." His service was the same. He wasn't rude but lacked enthusiasm & wasn't helpful at all. He wasn't pleasant & barely even spoke. After he checked me in & gave me my little booklet I noticed (cause I was reading the info on the desk) that I didn't get my free drink coupons. I asked him, don't I get free drink coupons wth this promo & he looked confused. I pointed out the little sign on the desk, he looked at it & said "oh yeah." What a moron! Ay ay ay. This place does not get any stars for their svc! Oh & the resort fee is a rip off. I didn't use anything that they charge for & they still charge u 4 this. If u want good customer svc, a nice big room, on the strip at a good rate, stay at bally's! Ballys has all of that & no resort fees!

Some holidays stay with you for the wrong reasons. 
Let's see:
* The horrendous smoke in the casino
* The extremely rude security guards 
* The people banging on the doors all hours
* or the loud grinding air-con. 

Great place to stay if you were at a conference or not wanting any sleep. 

The pool and spa closes at 6pm. What's with that? 

These are not trivial things. The fun and enjoyment of Vegas made up for the accommodation. 

Oh, I forgot to mention the terrible hawkers who hassle you at every entrance. How many times do you news to say 'No'. I was thinking of getting a shirt made up. 

We checked out of here and went to the Bellagio. Spend the extra for quality service. 

One positive, the room staff tried hard to make our stay pleasant. We tipped them well but everything else was a shambles. 

Stayed in five hotels on out trip all around this price range. This one was easily the worst. 

Oh, no Wifi either. WTF!

Stayed here for 4 nights to celebrate New Years Eve in Vegas. Top priority when looking for a hotel was 1) Centrally located so we can walk as the roads are shut down on the strip after 6pm on New Years Eve 2) Not have to pay an arm and a leg. Excalibur met those criterias and served us well.

Pros:
- PRICE - probably one of the cheapest options on the strip
- LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION - indoor walkway to Luxor & Mandalay Bay. Outside walkway to New York New York
- Decent security presence - guy downstairs verified that people had room keys, made me feel a little safer
- Staff was nice - no snootiness, no attitude
- Paid for a standard room and got upgraded to a widescreen room in Tower II which was pretty nice

Cons:
- Yes, the hotel is older and has seen better days, decor slightly dated, needs repainting, overall the medieval theme is a bit cheesy unless you are less than 10 years old
- 2 of the 5 lamps in the room did not work
- Found hairs on blanket but the linens like the towels, sheets and pillow cases were clean
- Noisy on the lower floors - room was on the 3rd floor and I could hear the New York New York roller coasters
- Slightly dirty elevators (i.e. littered with used kleenex, an occasional snot smear on doors etc.)
- No fridge or coffeemaker although there was a flatscreen TV
- Valet took a long time to retrieve our car (over 30 minutes). Try to avoid picking up your car from the valet during the busy checkout times (between 11am to 1pm) or just do self park and walk
- "Resort Fee" - really an additional BS fee for Internet, newspaper and not sure what else: $9.95 + tax  = an additional cost of $11.14 per day

Really, it's not as bad as it sounds. We were in the room from like 3am to 10am daily and it got the job done. I would stay here again (unless I hit the megabucks slot machine jackpot)!

No you won't sight any celebrities here, no michelin star restaurant or anything close to that. If you are looking for luxury, Vegas style and willing to spend the price tag that goes with it, then stay at the Bellagio instead. Otherwise for the regular po' folks like me, Excalibur is a decent option. 4 stars mainly based on price and location, otherwise doesn't have much else going for it.

We stayed in Tower 1 in what was supposed to be an updated room. It had a flat screen and the beds seemed new but the furnishings were old and worn. Many of the outlets were broken so the lamps didn't work. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. But, the rooms seem to have no insulation. Our room was very noisy. 5:30am outside deliveries and vacuuming in other rooms woke us up. For the price, it met our expectations but we won't stay there again.

Stayed at the Excalibar again 2014 it was great like always it's one of my favorite places to stay for the price always get complementary nights rooms are always clean never had a bad experience at the Excalibar don't hesitate stay here thumbs up

1 star is definitely more than this hotel deserves! From check in to check out the only good thing I have to say is the desk lady at check out was very friendly. 
1st problem I booked through Hotels.com 8 rooms 2 nights each I then called the hotel to make sure rooms are linked together except for the 1 room we wanted that was smoking we obviously figured that was to be in a different tower. Upon check in I explained to the lady that when I called to verify my rooms the man I spoke with insured me even though we didn't pay extra for strip view we'd more then likely get it bcuz we booked so many rooms. Well nope the lady said no we can't do that ONLY BECAUSE our rooms were already reserved so they'd be together\/ same floor. So we went to our room located in royal tower 2nd floor and it smelled so strong like they poured bottles of cleaner everywhere an our view was of a wall. So I called front desk an they moved us to floor 20 with the view of the roof. An come to find out all 6 of our rooms were on different floors!!! I'm sorry I feel like when I'm paying that mich for that many rooms we should be taken care of! Also was told via phone we'd get 2 vouchers for buffet for booking all the rooms (we were there for a wedding) an was told at desk that no they don't do that for anyone! An my non smoking room smelt like someone had just smoked in it. Also while standing by the stairs by registration a bell hop guy was pushing the cart an I was standing there & he rudely says : Can you move! As I was already moving for him but can't just walk over the other people!!! Oh an that was after they told my friend who had jst checked  in: "were to busy you need to carry your own bags " then turned his back to her!!!
2nd for bachlorette party we were getting a limo to a strip club an waited out front well there was a man (middle age thin blk guy white limo ) says: they can't pick u up here but I can take u so we let him take us he gave us his # to call for a ride back an didn't answer an left us stranded!!! 
Rooms are outdated and the picture on the tv was horrible the only thing good was the comfy beds. I will never stay here again. It's worth it to spend a little more and stay at the Monte carlo (out fav hotel but they were to pricey this weekend) lesson learned. You get what you pay for!

This is my second time staying at this hotel my first time staying i had no issues this time I stayed and came in for a late check in I reserved what is called a run of the house room which changes  upon availability when me and my party arrived the only Queen room available was wheelchair accessible  which okay for the time being when we got to the room the carpet was coming off of the floor like it wasn't stapled down the bathroom shower looked as though it had mildew forming on the tiles we refused to shower there I called guest services and told them I wanted a new room as soon as it became available they politely agreed the next day I called guest services I was on hold for over 30 mins when I finally got through to someone she was very rude saying that there were no calls received and that I was calling too early to get a room it was only 10am and check out is at 11am she kept arguing that usually they don't know until noon but there was in fact a room that was already ready when I got to my room it was a lot better but there was no full size  mirror which the last one and previous room I stayed in had  I was just over it and decided that I won't be spending my money at this place we paid over 1000 for just 5 nights the service should have been a little better for that kind of money I will never stay here again

We stayed 3 days and 2 nights in this place and it was a nightmare. The staff that was all over the casino trying to give you free shows was like walking on a car lot with the sales people attacking you. The staff was very rude, all of them. The rooms were just plain rooms I could have gotten at Best Western! They nickel and dime you for everything. They charged us a $28 "resort fee" but refused to tell us what that covered. She said we would have to find out on our own. The staff at one point tried to sell us 3 days on a future trip for $99 but lied to us just to get us to the counter to tell us about the deal! Now I understand that the point of a casino is to take your money but Excalibur puts a whole new meaning to rip off. We went to dinner at Planet Hollywood, toured Ceasers Palace and vistied the Bellagio and none of their hotel staff bothered us walking around at all. The staff sales people followed us all the way to the elevators we had to take to get to our room!!! The hotel is old and not up to date like the rest of Vegas and their building needs serious repair. Needless to say I will be telling everyone I know NOT to stay at this hotel.

***Note: Even though you book at a cheap price be aware that they add hidden charges when you go to check in.

Was pleasantly surprised with the hotel based on reviews and their reputation for being the cheapest hotel on the strip. At arrivial we did valet for $15 all day( and can use the same valet pass for all MLife casinos as well) so that was great! Check in took  like 30 minutes. The lines were so long. The lady at the check-in was very welcoming, smiled and was glad to answer my questions. We specifically asked for the newer rooms so it was nice. I always inspect the rooms though upon entering-Bed sheets, pillows, toilet seat, shower, sink etc. Everything looked ok! We stayed for 2 nights. Did the Spa the next day for $10!Was very relaxing. Highly recommend it. U can use it all day till 8pm. Pool area was ok. One of them was closed . The kids pool with the slide was filled with many kids. So I didn't use them . Just lounged a bit. Casino playing was good to me one night. Not the next. Lots of variety of fast food places to choose from. We did breakfast buffet which was really good..great omelets and crepes! Overall a good place to stay if your on a budget but still want some R & R.

I didn't stay here but did play blackjack.

The dealers are rude and one in particular made a mistake and did not want to call a pit boss to review the play. I had to yell across the whole pit boss area over everyone and I was correct. Pit boss wasn't nice either (after their own dealers mistake)

It gets better 


Then after the hand played out he paid  me wrong and wouldn't review that play either!! They wouldn't even flip the cards back for the cameras. I left after that hand! 

Go play blackjack somewhere else. And make sure they have more than 1 2 deck shoe, tables open. Otherwise it's a scam.

Didn't get a chance to stay here but I did play here!  Some of the friendliest blackjack dealers I have played with.  Makes a big difference.  3\/2 blackjack is important to anyone who is series about the game.  Good food choices, friendly service people, clean casino.  Connected to New York New York via walkway.  I will play here again.

I am pleasantly surprised with this hotel. I can tell our room was recently remodeled. The bed is very comfortable and we have a good sized room. The room was clean and staff has been friendly and courteous.  It would have been nice if upon check-in, some kind of luggage service was available.

Resembles Disney land from outside but is nowhere close to a luxury hotel. The moment you enter the lobby you are greeted with a wierd odor that turns you off. It's way too strong and gave me sneezes. The so called tower room had a horrid view... Facing the other tower. And the amenities suck. Pillow covers and comforter were torn and room stank. 

The only things positive was that house keeping was prompt and pool area is awesome to relax. 

Oh and did I mention it's the only hotel on earth that does not have wifi and just one horrid LAN cable.., well that's ridiculous.  Even motel6 has high speed wifi... 

Next time I visit Vegas. I wouldn't mind paying a few extra bucks n staying on the strip in some pricey hotel... At least I cud brag abt it...

This place is disgusting. When we very first arrived, we opted for a room upgrade for around $50. It was supposed to be a royal tower room, recently updated, with a king bed. When we arrived to our room, it was anything but royal. It was dark, dingy, and smelled horrible. We also had a lovely view of rocks and rusty maintenance carts. Less than satisfied, we went back to the front desk to speak to a manager. She was very nice and gave a refund for the upgrade charge and put us in a new room. We headed up to our 27th floor strip view room, excited to get our vacation rolling. Once we stepped out of the elevator, we were immediately overcome with unpleasant smells. We entered our room to find that the smoke detector was wrapped in a plastic bags and dirty socks were left on the floor. We also had no dead bolt on our door because it was busted off. Nice one guys. Complaining again wouldn't have gotten us far because they claimed to be fully booked.

Moving on, we decided to check out the pool which was okay. Nothing special. We spent the majority of our time in the adults only area, which you have to pay to get in! For a pool that is supposedly nicer, it was pretty nasty. The layer of grime covering the pool is nauseating and you can see a thick layer of oil floating on the water. 

We didn't spend a whole lot of time at the casino or hotel simply because it was disgusting and smelled absolutely terrible. Do yourself a favor and spend a little extra to stay somewhere else.
Nicer on the outside that on the inside, but not bad by any means. We did not encounter any bedbugs, to the best of our knowledge. The best thing about the experience was the midweek price.

Please, please, please tear this place down.  I couldn't stand it before I lived in Las Vegas, and I can't stand it now.  About the only thing this place is good for is to walk through when going from NYNY to Luxor.  It's just so gaudy... before you even get inside the doors of this hotel, they're yelling at you, "WELCOME TO EXCALIBUR!  ENJOY THE KNIGHTS OF THE ROUND TABLE BUFFET! PULL THE SWORD OUT OF THE STONE AND WIN A BALLOON!"  You get the picture.  Hopefully the picture is all you'll need.

A lot better than I remembered, but I guess it's because they remodeled. Not a horrible hotel, but more for families. If you're coming here with a bunch of friends and want a more 'happening' scene, don't stay here. unless you're on a budget because the rooms are way cheaper than other areas of the strip. but remember, if you stay here because the rooms are cheaper, remember that cab fair to major clubs like XS or Tao will be higher since you're further down the road. So that may cancel out your savings.

A huge plus was how cheap it was. We stayed here for three nights (Thursday-Sunday) and it was about 200 bucks total. After that, it's pretty much downhill.

The check-in area is nowhere near the entrance of tower I or tower II parking areas. Let's talk about how I had to bring my suitcase halfway through the hotel to check in, only to bring it all the way back to the entrance to go up the elevators. I'm a girl, I have lots of clothes and shoes for vegas!!

We asked for a room with a fridge and were told that it would cost 25 bucks extra A NIGHT. Are you serious?! We were then told there were no rooms with views unless we paid extra. Fine, whatever, we just want to sleep there. After receiving the room keys, I found that I could not stay in that room. it was floor 13 room 66, and those are just not happy\/lucky numbers to me. I went back to get the room changed and da-da-da suddenly I have been given a room with a view, free of charge. Seriously, I thought you just said you didn't have any rooms with views for the same price?

Anyway, the room was a standard room with two queen beds. The lighting was horrible, except in the bathroom. Everything was clean, and when we asked for extra towels, they were very nice about it. The beds were comfy, and the view was decent. There was also a flat screen tv, but not much playing.

Like any hotel in vegas, the downstairs casino area is heavily polluted with the smell of cigarettes, so you asthma children beware.

Plus side, McDonalds is open 24 hours and we did visit them after partying all night.

Don't forget to ask for coupon book upon check in. We lost ours, and they wouldn't give us another one. SO SAD.

I'll give it two stars because I kept winning in the casino but PLEASE just gut this hotel and start over. ;\/  Ok fine, it was cheap... but honestly just a little more money could of gotten me a nicer stay at Luxor and even the Luxor rooms aren't that nice. Skip a meal or two, bring your own drinks and spend the money to stay at a nicer MGM property.

We decided to stay at Excalibur for 3 nights at around $120 per night (this includes the resort fees). We've never stayed on the South end of the strip, so we thought we'd try it out. We know that Excalibur is an old hotel, and you can smell how old it is when you walk in there. So we were aware we weren't going to be getting anything amazing, but we just weren't expecting the quality to be this bad.

Our biggest gripe was that we placed the standard "Do Not Disturb" door tag on our room every day, but we would come back to our room cleaned every night. This is NOT OK! We thought we were going crazy until the second night.

Also, in a Deluxe Standard Room, there is no fridge, so don't bother with getting leftovers from your meals. They won't keep. There's also no coffee, tea, water in the room. The safe we had was also broken. The room was dirty. Windows and photos were covered in hand and body prints (ew). Mystery stains on the clothed headboards and chairs. The lamp had a large water (or something) stain on it. Last, the TV screen was broken, so there was no point ordering a movie.

The only good part about this hotel was their pool. There are 4 pools and one is adults only (but you have to pay extra to be in there).

So know what you're getting before you book!

I feel silly admitting this, but the only reason I was in the Excalibur was for their buffet.

Yep.

You get what you pay for when you come to the Excalibur.  But you shouldn't complain too much.  There's a reason you & I came here, and it's because you are cheap!  Clean and cheap rooms for sure!

 This castle casino is clearly from a bygone era (the 80s are a bygone era?!  I'm feeling a little old here all of a sudden!)  Whatever they used to do out in the moats is clearly over and done with.  

If you're in Tower 1, you'll get sturdy yet shabby furnishing.  But all is clean, not a bedbug in sight (whew!).  The spa was closed, but 2 of the pools were open (it's winter still so clearly it's not gonna be the biggest draw), but the pools were only open at 10am til I think 5pm--so no early am workout aside from the little gym they have. (bring your own foam roller, or fr equivalent, they don't got any).

Most of the arcade machines were older and the wack a mole machines were decrepit.  I still ended up having fun here, skeeball and some fun shooting games.

If you're a nonsmoking or exsmoker californian, you're gonna hate the casino.  Thick clouds are everywhere.  Your sinuses will be searing with pain.  I recommend you move further up North to some of the newer casinos if that sort of thing bothers you.  If not, then light up and get rid of some cash!

by the way, whoever switches out the remote control batteries for their dying AA batteries, for shame! I know you're cheap, but let's have some class, eh?

Cool ass hotel :) I remember coming to the Excalibur when I was small. Barely, but I remember the huge castle like exterior that still looks just as cool. 
We gambled a few times here since its connected to the Luxor where we stayed. We wanted to try eat at Dick's but never made it :(. 
We did buy some Krispy Kreme doughnuts though :) something we don't have on Oahu. 
One of the great, older hotel\/casinos that you can have in and not worry about being classy or mature :)
Visited Aug 2011

This is probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed at on the strip. Not only was my view of a wall, but the air conditioning unit was extremely loud. The in room television does not offer a check out option which forces you to wait in line in the lobby just to check out!  We all know how Vegas lines are!  I am NEVER going to stay in this hotel ever again.

Yes it's cheap but that's because it sucks. 

I've only been to Vegas twice and one time I made the mistake of going cheap and staying here. From the outside the hotel looks like King Arthur and Andy Warhol had a baby and fed that baby Gerber shrooms. Its a super colorful and ugly castle. If you're five you might think it looks cool, but Vegas was not meant for five year olds.

The inside isn't much better. The decor isn't very nice and the place is in drastic need of some cleaning. I took a souvenir home with me, a piece of the railing (the end decorative piece) had fallen off and I picked it up, couldn't find anyone to give it to and put it in my jacket pocket to find someone later. I forgot about until I opened up my suitcase when I got home. I feel like pieces of the railing shouldn't be falling off...

The casino is not great. You should probably head to another casino if you want to do some gambling. The arcade is awful. I went there with my gf at the time to kill time the day we were leaving (I was 21 but she was only 20 at the time so we couldn't do too much). It was basically falling apart and most of the games were awful. I won her a stuffed dog at the water shooting horse race game. The dog had a hole in it and was missing whiskers. When I asked for another one the lady gave me attitude but finally handed it over. Thankfully this one was in better shape.

The rooms are pretty standard. Nothing special. Two nights in a row a fire alarm went off waking us up and kind of freaking us out. After the first one I just thought whatever. When it happened again the next night I was pretty annoyed and called the front desk the next morning. They told me they'd comp me a night. When I got my credit card statement I found out they didn't. That sucked. 

Of course if you're in Vegas you won't be spending too much time in the room, so if all you want is a place to put your bags then this is a pretty good option. But it's also pretty far off the center of the strip so it can be a trek to get most places.

Who actually spends a lot of time in their hotel room in Vegas anyway?!

We have always stayed at the Excalibur whenever going to Vegas. We are budget concious people who don't mind saving money. Granted, the Excalibur is not the nicest or most luxurious hotel on the strip, but it's definitely better than Motel 6 and it's a safe place for a good night's sleep.

It is family friendly- an entire level for kids, lots of different restaurants, and spacious rooms. 

On our last trip, I booked the rooms online. I checked 2 days before our trip and the prices went down. After a quick phone call to customer service, they were happy to lower my rate to the updated price. Excellent! 

I have no problem staying at the Excalibur! They have always done a good job for us when it comes to staying in Vegas!

I must say my stay here has been great. I stayed 8 days total.  Cisco live convention plus a few days for personal.  The check in line took a while  but I lucked out and got a registration guy named Harley. He was great!!  I told him it was my first time in Vegas and he hooked me up!  For a minimal fee he upgraded my room.  I loved the view.  He also made some excellent recommendations on what to do while in town..  Was very personable and if the line is not to long I would ask for him.

LONG LINE to check in! Mind you I only paid $35 for my hotel - so I wasn't too upset to wait 30 min to check in. Got to the service desk and they didn't have my reservation :-(  checked account statement and no charge even though I have a confimation #.... booked online again for the same price (booking at the counter would have been $55)... the lady was extremely apologetic and gave us free room upgrade, free drink tickets and a coupon booklet :-) we also used their free baggage checkin. 

The only downside is the shower head felt like a whole bunch of needles coming at you at once.... Otherwise a great hotel!!!!

Showed up at Excalibur to find trash in the room, burn marks on the furniture in a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor, and mold growing in the bathroom. Called housekeeping about the mold, expecting it to be gone by the next round of housekeeping--nothing was done. Unacceptable.

I loved staying here. Parking sucks though. 

Everything else was great. Room was clean, check in was nice and speedy, the pool was awesome, and the restaurants in the hotel itself are also good. 

Book early on and get great pricing. I would stay here again, but then again there are so many other hotels in Vegas!

This is a review of a walk-thru of the casino only. If you happen to be on this side of the strip and making your way down, you can totally skip over this one. From the outside, I expected more from Excalibur. Perhaps something along the lines of the regal grandeur or pomp and circumstance, typical castle stuff, you know? Unfortunately, Excalibur falls short of anything that you would typically associate with a medieval castle. This place is old! And not in a classically elegant - this is antique and beatiful type of way, but more of a this is old and smelly way. The games are reasonable and they seem to have a nice variety. One good thing is that the machines seemed to pay out a little more here. If you are in Vegas and are trying to make your rounds to each casino, you could totally skip this one and go to the next. It's desperately in need of renovations and a total make over.

Excalibur! What has happened to you? If I could write reviews on Excalibur when I was a kid, before MGM bought you, you would have been a fabulous 5 star rating - but then again, that was when you had knights and princesses walking around and the decor was much cuter and more theme-y. 

But now... you're corporatized, bland and quite frankly - horrible. The rooms are very outdated, the decor is very plain-jane, and the staff look like they've been there since the real Excalibur was known as the Sword In The Stone days. Is there anyone - waitresses included, but gogo dancers excluded, that works at Excalibur that's under 40 years old, or at least LOOKS under 40? That sounds ageist, but really.. this is a vain city, is it really too much to ask? 

That being said, I suppose that's why you're one of the cheapest hotels on the strip, right? Because everything else absolutely blows. Buffet is CRAP, do NOT do the breakfast or lunch buffet. Also, DO NOT eat at any of the restaurants IN Excalibur. I repeat and urge you of this. My friends and I (6 of us total) ate at the Buca DiBeppo that's inside Excalibur, and 5 out of 6 of us got food poisoning and spent the entire weekend in our rooms throwing up. The 6th member of our group didn't get it because she had recently gotten the stomach flu and her immune system was already built up against the crappy food, not to mention, she barely ate anything.

Don't stay here ever.. you can use the same money off the strip or at any of the other similarly cheap hotels - I bet Circus Circus is just as bad... good?..bad! as Excalibur is now.

My review is solely for the hotel room.  My husband received a discounted room rate from mlife and we ended up booking here as it was a very last minute trip.  I didn't have a lot of expectations knowing that the general price range this place charges and was just hoping for a quiet, clean room.

The wait in line was about 30 minutes, which was a bit shorter than what we have experienced at other hotels on the strip.  We were given a room in the royal tower section and found it to be very clean.  The bed was super comfy and the shower was nice and hot in the morning.  I don't know why on earth there isn't a venting fan as the mirror does get fogged up, but not a huge issue.  The wifi worked really well and I didn't have any issues with it.

Yes, the resort fee and these newly added parking fees suck.  The irony that the CEO of MGM was given some corporate responsibility award in 2015 is not lost on me.  But the hotel itself was fine and way better than what I expected.

So I am freaking pissed off.

I just finished reviewing the hotel experience of the Excalibur now I am going to review the Casino part.

I am not much of a card player type of guy cause it takes less than 5 seconds for me to lose all my money. 

So I am like the old grandma playing slot machines. My money last longer and so far I have had good outcomes with it. 

My favorite slot machine is Wheel of fortune and now they don't have it.  I was willing to play the Dollar Machine just to play that game and nothing.  

And to top it all off I waited over 30 minutes before I had a waitress to come and ask if I wanted a drink.  How fucked up is that? 

I am in Vegas where I should be wasted and spending my money like there is no tomorrow.  So with no alcohol in my system and no Wheel of Fortune make this Mexican very unhappy. 

Next time I will waste my money at the MGM right across the street.

Room: We stayed on the 16 floor in the resort tower. The room was very clean and appealing. Perfect view of the pool was a plus.  Lots of counters pace for up to 3 people to get ready at the same time(perfect for girls trips!) However, being next to the pool means starting at 9am the pool DJ is blasting music and it can get pretty loud. I'd suggest staying in the royal tower if noise bothers you. Also, the A\/C was set at 72 and our room was freezing. My guess is bc the unit is next to the hot window and will keep kicking on. We had to set it to 75 just to get to room temperature. Our TV also had scratches on the screen and came in fuzzy. Not watchable. 

Pool: several pools and a water slide make this a fun pool spot. Adult pool is $10 pp which kind of sucks. Also the chairs fill up FAST. Me and my two friends opted for the poolside package with the nicer chairs, snack and water bucket, umbrella, and prime chair seating by the pool and hot tub for $50 total. VERY WORTH IT considering we stayed at the pool for 8 hours that day. We would have roasted without the umbrella. Pool bar also has a nice selection. $23 for big a souvenir cup and $16 refills was great. 

Casino: Did not smell at all like the reviews I've read. I'm guessing Excalibur finally sprung for some air freshener bc it smelled nice to me. I also won the most here playing slots on my trip. 

Food court: Some places open for 24 hrs was awesome. The advertise that there's a McDonalds but THEY LEFT A YEAR AGO. 

Location: Not too far from the main strip but not quite close enough to walk. Monorail stop is a hefty 20 min walk through the MGM. Perfect if you rented a car. 

Overall: Nice clean rooms and worth the price. I however won't be back until I have kids. Kids would love it but if you want something Closer to the action or aren't planning on renting a car, pay the extra money and stay at the Flamingo or Harrah's.

We got upgraded from the regular tower 1 to the contemporary rooms in tower 2! I'm assuming it's because when I checked in I had to give them my id (obviously) and it was my birthday week. But we were only given a room on the 4th floor wamp wamp. I guess no one really goes to Vegas just to stay inside the room for the view of the strip lights, in which our view was just of the pool.

The whole time walking to the room walking to the room I had a big fat smile on my face and not just because I was in Vegas but just the thought that I had gotten a free upgrade. Since the guy from the front desk never told me that I was getting an upgrade just a happy birthday and what not.

The rooms were spacious and clean. The bathroom was gorgeous with a wall to wall granite counter top and a giant mirror. Perfect for selfies! We stayed at Excalibur for 3 nights and they really did a good job cleaning up after us every day.

Excalibur is by far the cheapest hotel\/ resort\/ casino on the strip. A little on the lower side of this strip but it's less than a 2 mile walk from the other end like to the Venetian LV. You're saving about $100 per night staying here rather than staying at the more upscale hotel blocks away.

It's really lively at night and since it is more family friendly than other Las Vegas strip hotels there were kids running around everywhere but I didn't mind that. At least the majority of children were tucked in the lower basement level of the Casino. They have a more arcade type setting where the entrance to the Tournament of Kings is located. If you prefer shows over night clubs this if definitely your casino.

So much better than Luxor they matched our rate, gave respect to our beliefs, then checked Mlife and made our rate even better. Chris was super helpful accommodating us, best customer service. Luxor manager Chris S. Formerly of mirage will be the death of Luxor RIP. Long live Excalibur

For the price, still decent - I wouldn't go here on a Honeymoon or to impress that special lady, but for a weekend or day in Vegas flying solo it is a room, a comfortable bed, and a TV......plus, the only $5 Gym in Las Vegas - and the gym is nice.  The number of free games, drinks, and coupons given at checkin actually covered the price of the room.

Not a fan. I knew going in that it wasn't going to be luxury from the price but it really was not enjoyable to stay there. The room was standard, but the bed was super uncomfortable with no comforter, just a sheet that felt like a curtain and we had a view of the roof. The room reminded me of my Grandma's house. I tried the $20 trick and it did not work! Ha I put $20 in between my credit card and ID and asked if there were any complimentary upgrades available. The man said well you can upgrade your room for a fee and then handed my $20 back and said I could give him that as a tip afterwards. So I said no thanks. Also, there is someone trying to sell you something every 30 feet! It became unbearable to simply walk in and out of the hotel! And our $20 drink and food credit was only available to use at the bar or the incredibly overpriced steakhouse. There's also no wifi anywhere! What kind of a Vegas hotel doesn't have wifi in 2014! Overall, just a bad experience.
Wish we got to go to the pool but they closed super early and opened not early enough. Stayed there only one night and it wasn't bad. Bathroom was big and the beds were clean. Decent view.

So disappointed because we stayed at Excalibur last year and loved it. This year was a little different and we probably won't be back.

Ok it's a very good price for a strip hotel and the location is great. It's an older hotel but that's never bothered me. Our big draw cards coming here were the location, the price and the pool. Last year they had an adults only pool where you could drink, smoke and generally not be disturbed by those under 18 (which, staying at a themed hotel like this, is harder to avoid).

So imagine our disgust when we get to the pool on our first day of ten and discover it now costs $10 a day to use the adult pool!! This is nothing more than blatant money grabbing, and left such a sour taste in our mouths. Coupled with the resort fees that don't even cover wifi in the rooms and pushy sales people at the entrances, we were extremely disappointed.

I mean really, I know the sales people are only doing a job, but one night my friends and I were struggling down to our rooms after being at the supermarket LOADED with heavy pallets of water and food, and one of those people tried to stop us...I snapped at her "Are you serious?!" A little logic goes a long way!

So unfortunately for our yearly trip to Vegas we will now have to look elsewhere. It's a good basic hotel if you just need somewhere to sleep, but for our 10 days it was too long without a decent pool area and being hassled by the sales guys every day.

We showed up on Saturday afternoon and waited 70 minutes to check in. Staff was not apologetic at all. Two employees shrugged it off and acted like this is normal. We asked our clerk if there would be any compensation and she claimed no. Upon talking to a supervisor, we were offered a two-hour later checkout only. We had to fight not to pay the $25 resort fee since we were only staying one night and our only pool time was wasted in line.

On top of this, it is an extremely long walk from self park (which only has two floors of covered parking) to registration to the rooms (which is surprisingly very far from check-in)

We were accosted twice by salesmen trying to get us to buy timeshares which is even more annoying when your hands are full of luggage. 

Room is dated though bathroom was large.

I'll never come back here.

This is like a grown up disney world. Lots of parking, rooms cleaned so so. They really could brush up on their cleaning skills in elevators, lobbies, hallways. By no means is this a world class establishment.

It is what it is, especially for $25 a night. i was totally spoiled, too, having spent the previous night at the Palazzo.

There is something depressing about this place, with the screaming children, the slot machines, the cigarette smoke, the folks on the sidewalk wearing t-shirts that advertise 'A GIRL TO YOUR ROOM IN 20 MINUTES' but I think that can be said for the entire "Las Vegas Experience."

All that being said, my stay at Excalibur was decent -- I just wanted to get the hell out of Vegas.

Yucky. I stayed here because I was forced to and I would never come back. I was in Vegas for work and this was the hotel they put us at. The food selection is absolutely pathetic and do NOT, under any circumstance, try the buffet. Most of it was borderline inedible and I was scared that I might get food poisoning. 

The rooms are meh. Not horrible, but the heater\/AC unit was super noisy and only heated the room for about half an hour before the air turned kind of cold. There was NO drinking water in the room and when I went to get some from the vending machine, it was $3 for a bottle! So I went without water in the desert. Even the lamp was hard to turn on. First, it wasn't even plugged in. Then, I had to be soooo careful turning the switch because there was almost no resistance and turning even one degree too far turned it off again.

However, I will say that the people working there are very nice. It's just too bad that they're stuck at this crappy hotel.

I mean it's cheap so I can't complain too much, you get what you pay for. I got a free room and we were only staying 2 nights so the price makes it worth it if you don't care much about where you're staying.

Cons:
-South side of the strip so it's a little far from everything. 
-near the airport so it can be loud
-walls are thin, we could hear the people next door to us clearly
-STAINS on the blankets...gross
-no fridge, so can't keep your drinks cold

Also, check in is at 3:00pm there's an early check in fee. Check out is at 11am. 

Pros would be they have some cheap tables with $5 minimum. There's a pretty nice\/big arcade if you have kids. And it's cheap.
We didn't stay here just toured the facility along the strip. It was fun to stop in and see everything.

Not bad! Our room was very clean and comfortable. I got to upgrade to the loyal suite for another $10. Sweet! Though the view sucks. The line to check in was terribly long as well. However, a lovely young lady helped me check in with my smartphone and we got to skip the extremely long line to check in. That's the only thing that sucks.

Moving Review from old Account] 

Excalibur Hotel
Categories:Hotels,Casinos
Neighborhood: The Strip
5\/29\/2011
This place was so so. Our room had some trash left in it from a guest before. Gross. I think you can find better for this price. It really isn't much. They also have some people who try to get you "free tickets" which in the end, you end up committing 2-3 hours of your morning for and paying 40$ back. Don't like being hustled in the first 10 minutes of checking in. We get charge the $15 when you get there and the internet sucked ass. Very disappointed.

I arrived on a Sunday evening around 7pm and there was a long line to check in. There are 3 computers for mobile self check-in, but it requires a code (received via email) to scan on the mobile check-in computer. I tried to get the code while standing in line by checking in online, but it said error, no rooms available. I waited in line for about 20-30 minutes before I got to the front. Once there, check-in was fast and the front desk staff was friendly and informative. I recommend checking in online prior to arriving, so upon arrival, guests can use the mobile check-in computer. It's much faster if there is no need to talk to a front desk employee. The computers were empty; no one was using them.

I got a room in the Royal Tower, which was convenient for me since I used Uber\/Lyft a couple of times, and rideshare pick-ups\/drop-offs is right outside the door next to the Royal Tower elevators. Otherwise, access to the strip\/Las Vegas Blvd is by the Resort Tower, across the casino.

The room itself is standard, with 2 queen beds. It has the basics - TV with option for express checkout, a desk, air conditioner\/thermostat, and basic toiletries such as shampoo, lotion, and bar soap (no conditioner or body wash). The room has a spacious walk-in shower, but no tub although it used to be a tub. The toilet is worn out with scratches and flushes very slowly. For a trip to Vegas with limited time spent in the room, the room is good and has all the basics one would need. My room had a nice view of Luxor (the pyramid) next door. I observed a nice sunset\/sunrise with a partial mountain view. The location is okay, not too bad with an easy walk to many other hotels.

Service is pretty bad, room looks dirty and smell like feet. The express checkout online couldn't find my reservation, phone checkout takes forever, had to use the kiosk for checking out... Not a great experience.
We just checked in and got to our "newly remodeled royal tower room and are the first guests to stay in it." It still needs work.

Checked in Valentines to get married the next morning. Desk staff was awesome and helpful. She upgraded our view which was greatly appreciated. The room was clean and comfortable with New York New York right outside of our window. I did have an item taken from my room. It was the blouse that I was married in and it just so happened to go missing after the one time that housecleaning came. Hotel offered no help other than to put me on the lost and found list. There is no way to get my sentimental item back since the maid can just say that she never saw it and that basically ends it. So yes the hotel was nice but is it worth it when your sentimental items are taken with no one taking responsibility? No! If you do chose to stay here again I would strongly advise that you keep your "do not disturb" sign up so your belongings are not taken.

Not too shabby of a location near the beginning of the Vegas strip by New York New York hotel and casino and Mgm. The front desk staff was super friendly so that was a plus but the casino was really grungy and gambling wasn't as fun as it was pretty much impossible to find someone to get a drink order in! The hotel itself seemed ancient, with a distinct musty smell(not talkin about the casino floor since it just smells like cigarette smoke) talking about the hallways and in my room. 

The rooms are nothing special.....not even a fridge. Called to see if they could help me out with some toothpaste but that was shut down with the quickness.....had an hdtv but not even hdtv service, watching tv felt like back in the 90s where it was all scratchy(I know sounds snobby but it's 2017). 

The places to eat here were ok....the buffet was horrid. I prefer the one at Caesars or aria. I honestly thought the best thing to eat here was Popeyes. It sucked all weekend too because the side of the bridge Excalibur was on was closed all weekend, so you had to go all the way around due to the construction......thank you to the friendly staff up front, this hotel needs some renovations....

I guess with age and experience, the allure of Excalibur has completely faded and is essentially a sub-par hotel compared to the newer hotels on the strip. 

I do have quite a few fond memories at the Excalibur when I was younger.  I remember being awed at the sight of the mystical castle with Merlin the Wizard standing atop one of the castle towers.  While the parents spent their time on the main floor gambling, there was a fun kid center at the bottom floor filled with games.  It was like being transported to another time and place.

However, now that I am older and have to fund my Vegas trips now, the Excalibur is cheaper than most on the strip but even then would NOT be my choice for budget hotel.  I booked a room at the Excalibur for my friends and me.  When we got into the room, it was small and felt like it needed to be renovated.  There was an underlying smell that could not be identified or extinguished despite our efforts.  There are more updated rooms that were available but appears for a little more.  The self-parking for the hotel was a little far from the hotel so it is not really convenient.

Plus, reasons to like it for nostalgic reasons are gone.  The Merlin that once stood there has been replaced by a billboard and the kid center is not so friendly or as extensive as it once felt.  It was good to know they still have the Tournament of Kings show where you get to see dueling knights fight each other for the crown.  Although at $60+ price tag, I am not sure I would be willing to shell out the money simply to reminisce

The one major perk of the Excalibur is the location.  Considering its price tag, it has a decent spot to most of the nicer parts of the Vegas strip.  Plus, it does have a monorail that takes you to Luxor and Mandalay Bay.  However, somehow this perk is not enough to justify the poor upkeep of the facilities.

Overall, I would say that Excalibur lacks the magic of most of the hotels on the Strip making it a lower tier recommended hotel.

The rooms are big and have a comfortable bed. The room lacks basics plug point near the bed. No coffee maker, no water. It charges $30 as resort fee and thats only fir high speed internet and printing a boarding pass. Pool is $10 for guests.

This used to be one of our favorite hotels but it's gone downhill fast. It took an hour and a half to check in, the kids games are half what they used to be, and when the valet stole from my car, they wouldn't even look into it because "they have too many cars going in and out for it to be worth it." Obviously if they have enough employee thefts that it's not worth investigating, there's an issue.

This hotel was very nice and clean. It was the first hotel I had ever stayed in in Las Vegas. It was at this hotel that I discovered my love for coffee. I too disagree with the nasty reviews; my experience was great.

This is the shittiest hotel ever!!! Someone put mustard on my boyfriend's car in the Excalibur parking structure and when we got back to car, it had already solidified. For those of you who don't know any better, mustard is acidic and will destroy a paint job... Especially in 100 degree plus weather. We spent an hour washing it off and when we finally did, the black mustang is now green where the mustard was. The car now needs to be completely repainted. We spent an hour reporting it to Excalibur security, and of course Excalibur was unwilling to do a thing about the vandalism which occurred on their property.  Furthermore, we had decided to spend an extra night since we didn't want to finish our vacation on such a sour note so we booked the room for another night.  They weren't even willing to give us the same rate which we had booked it for online.  Excalibur has the worst customer service out of all of the hotels on the strip, not to mention they have salespeople at every entrance trying to draw you in.  Finally, I witnessed a maid take clean towels from her cart, throw them on the floor by the door, and then hang them up as clean towels.  HORRIBLE!!!    I would give this place ZERO stars if I could.

this place does not deserve any stars. i had to put one star in order for this review to get posted.

please beware of door pushers in this hotel!!!

if you decide to stay at this hotel make sure your doors are closed all the way & all your belongings are stored & locked away!! 

worse customer service ever!! it's not worth it to stay at hotel where you don't feel safe. please please please do not trust this hotel. you can find better hotels with better security.

Oh the good old Excalibur, what can I say?  Nothing fancy and they don't apologize for it.  They've remodeled the tower rooms but don't expect anything fantastic.  

If you're just looking for basic accommodation with a casino downstairs, nothing wrong with this place.  The ice buckets are tiny and the cups are plastic.  I'm pretty sure the "new" lamps and furniture in the rooms are actually from Luxor, another MGM property, but they work.  I swear I've seen them before anyway.

If you're looking for fine dining or a fancy experience, go a little further north on the strip, but if you're a simple guy like me, it's an okay place to stay.  Besides, if you end up wanting that, it's just a cab ride up Las Vegas Blvd.

So there's definitely a reason why this hotel is rated 2.5 stars. Take a look staff, owners, and everyone involved running this place. It's not succeeding and probably never will unless some changes should be made. Such a damn shame. 

You do NOT have microwaves in the room and when asking lily from customer service she was rude and confrontational about it. We don't want to order your 18 dollar Caesar salad NO THANKS. We want to heat up our food so you guys are just not up
To par ESPECIALLY in the customer service department.

Stayed here for a few days in the newly remodeled tower. I really enjoyed my stay and have no complaints on the cleanliness of the room or house keeping. My only gripe is that the AC is so freaking loud! That it makes it hard to fall asleep.

When I got there, my room still wasn't cleaned out from the last occupants. Maybe they should look into getting more cleaners so new guests don't have to stand outside their room for 15 minutes after waiting an hour to get checked in. 

At least when I got in my room it was clean. However, this room was extremely reminiscent of a Travelodge. No fridge, everything unplugged\/turned off when I entered, and a very loud air conditioner. There was a lamp that I couldn't turn on.

Otherwise, everything was fine. Bed was comfortable and the room was a decent size.

This was my third time coming to Las Vegas but my first time staying at The Excalibur. Paid $389 for 4 nights. Had no issues with the room at all. Plenty of places to get food throughout the hotel. The Excalibur is an oldie, but a goodie! 

I'd have absolutely no problem staying here again, but I hope to stay at a different hotel every time I come to Vegas.

Unless you are one of those people that totally gets into the whole "renaissance" thing I don't think you will be impressed.  It's an older hotel\/casino and I can speak to the Casino.  Now it has some of the lowest limits for gambling on the strip on a weekend night.  I can't speak to the rooms, but considering all the other options on the strip I don't think I would choose to stay here.

This place is good for what it is. If you're looking for a reasonably priced place on the strip where you can gamble and have decent food options, this is good. If you're expecting high end or fancy stuff, this isn't for you. 

Good location as it's close to Luxor, MGM Grand, and New York New York. 

Be careful of the checkin line. It can be long.

Pros of the resort: location and pool.

Cons: Poor housekeeping. I walked into my room and it was apparent someone had napped in my bed. Pillows were mussed up along with the bolster pillow set aside on the occasional chair. There were peanuts and shells on the floor in the bedroom. Also a lot of hair on the bathroom floor. There wasn't a duvet or comforter on the bed. Just a blanket with two sheets around it.

I was lucky though, my friends were checked into a dirty room. The housekeeper also told them that she felt really bad that they slept in another persons dirty sheets. The resort had moved the previous guest into another room and not communicated it to housekeeping. So the housekeeper thought it was a refresh of the same guest. 

Not up to my standards especially since I work in the industry.
Good price it's on the strip and they upgraded the looks of the hallways and rooms it looks a lot better and cleaner

Came to town for the Janet Jackson concert at Mandalay Bay. Excalibur is your average hotel with the basic things you need at Vegas. Casino, food, sleep, shower I mean what else. It was good for us because it was affordable. We were able to get to Mandalay Bay easy!! By tram. We stayed at the royal tower the room seemed a little out dated but it was clean the bed was comfortable and the shower was clean. There was no fridge or coffee maker, but no big deal . Overall we would probably be back.
the bars rocked and the bbq place is really good

Apparently I arrived the weekend that the "computer system" decided to "crash."  When we walked into the hotel, there was a massive line just to check in. 
People were here for EDC mostly, some for the Pacquiao fight and for Garth Brooks. I heard of stories of people waiting almost 3 hours.  I personally had to wait 2 hours to get to the desk.  My horror story doesn't end with this.  After I was given my key, I lugged my bags to my room only to find out that it was already occupied.  I said, "WTF, ok the computer messed up!"  I lugged my bags back down stairs to the check-out counter to complain.  The clerk apologized etc. and I got a new room.  This second time; surprise! This room was occupied.  I was so damned tired at this point that I didn't care if they gave me the crappiest room in the house.  I asked to be given as soon as possible, fortunately by this point the supervisor intervened and she gave me a suite, some buffet vouchers.  and some drink vouchers.  I don't know if I'll come back to this place.

I stayed here recently for about the 10th time.  It's gotten better over the years, doing a little updating, and making the rooms a little nicer.  I can say it's not great but it's not that bad either.  I'd stay there again if I had to.  But there's not much to be said about the place it's really just a place to stay that's actually really close to NYNY, MGM, Luxor and Mandalay bay that you can access with the sidewalks outside.

Well this place is good for the price, for the most part clean, except for the elevator carpet. The beds are hard, didn't get a good night sleep for the most part. The roll up curtain on the window was broken and was not repaired even after I twice called for it to be repaired. The buffet absolutely stinks, worst buffet I've been to in a while and I only went in there cause I had a voucher, the older lady at the cash register was rude and didn't even want to answer basic questions regarding the food. Get another job lady, Walmart is hiring ticket checkers, I can give you a letter of recommendation, I promise. The cleaning ladies were cool and accommodating, no complaints there. The bartenders were rude, especially when you gave them the free drink voucher which you get with your stay, although you do pay a resort fee. No bueno. The price is the only thing this place has going for itself. I'm gonna say that I'll probably not stay here again. Sucks, but it is what is. I say that only because this place has potential and a little bit of tlc and this joint might be back. Plus before I forget, wtf? 1.00 dollar for every arcade game? Wow!!!
Saw "Thunder From Down Under" and it was amazing! A MUST SEE and Highly Recommended for all ladies!!!

Tried the poker room this trip.  Some of the most comfortable tables in LV IMHO, decent padded chairs too.  Well run room with great staff.  Didn't seem to be a ton of action here, but there was at least 2 tables going most times we dropped by.  I'll play here again.

Stayed in a new "contemporary room". It's much nicer than their standard, old skool rooms. Pay the extra and you'll enjoy your stay. It had a nice, big flat screen TV. Everything was clean, nice bed furnishings and furniture. Shower was a little on the old side, but it was fine. Nothing to write on Yelp about. For $25\/ night mid week, you can't lose staying here. Well, you can, just don't gamble. I will be back again.

Lounge and bar experience only.

Some of my favorite things in the world are the following - diet coke, Coors Light and dive-y dirty bars and lounges.  This places fits the bill.

I had been roaming the strip and gambling all day while drinking said Coors Lights and stopped back at my room while waiting for my husband.  I thought to myself, "hey, I bet they have something I'd like at the Excalibur."  And they did.

There was band and they were great.  You have everything you need or want at this lounge -

*Old people cutting a rug to 80's tunes.
*Smoke that hangs thick in the air (not necessary, but expected in Vegas right?)
*Low lounge chairs
*Cold drinks, not reasonably priced though

Now, the service the lounge sucks big time.  We were there for a good hour and a half and never had the server come to us.

Good place to waste a couple drunken hours on a Vegas night.

This hotel is the biggest hotel I have ever stayed in. It is Right where you need to be in the middle of the strip. Luxor, MGM , New York New York are all within walking distance. My room number is in the thousands. Out my window I see a part of the hotel which looks like a castle. My room is clean,quiet and on the 15th floor. Take the elevator to the lobby and it become a bustering city. People from all over the world are all gambling, shouting, laughing and smoking. There is a casino in the lobby area(if u can call it a lobby) restaurants, bars and so much more is down there. The current tower connects to another tower that leads to shows, dozens of restaurants and more access to gambling, arcades and a theme park. There are roller coasters, waterfalls w\/slides and a few pools with awesome music. I have met all types of people from Germany, Australia, Canada celebrating bachelor parties, and life. Excalibur has this medieval theme that makes it unique.

I have read a number of other reviews on this hotel and maybe they had a personally bad experience which marred their enjoyment and stay here.
My own personal experience however was one of enjoyment and the Excalibur met our expectations.
Check in was a breeze and room was nice and clean and had everything we needed. Some people complain about the rooms being a little small "which they are not", not being as modern as other hotel rooms, which once again I found them to be on par with other hotel chains, plasma TV's nice decor and comfortable beds. Some people even complain they do not have a coffee maker in the room but in all honesty, the hotel does not want you to spend much time in your room. While people are in their rooms, they are not in the casino spending their money and everyone knows that is why they want you there and who goes to Vegas to sit in their rooms?
I like the little coffee\/snack bar they have at the entrance to the corridor that leads to your rooms. It was nice to get up early each morning and get my coffee and a nice sweet treat and return to my room and drink some good coffee, while getting ready for another day. 
The casino in the Excalibur is very large and I love the atmosphere there. I only ever play the slot machines and the Excalibur has one of the best selection to choose from, catering to every budget, from those with a big wallet to those with less to spend.
I do hear some complain about having to walk through the casino with their kids to get to their rooms but Las Vegas in NOT for kids.........Vegas is a theme park for adults!! If you want a kiddie friendly environment, then Disney World is where you need to be, leave Vegas alone for the adults to enjoy!
Also once again the casino wants as much as your time and money as possible and so it makes sense for them to position everything so a walk past those slot machines is mandatory but I know this going in and have no problem with that.
So to review, yes the Excalibur is older then many of the other casino's and the rooms may not be as glam as some of the others but the Excalibur is not trying to claim otherwise. 
For those with a little tighter budget, you get what you pay for and on this the Excalibur delivers. This is why we stayed there and were not disappointed. 
In the end, the rooms are big enough, modern enough, comfortable enough and clean enough for stay.
Would I stay at the Excalibur again? Sure and one day I hope too!

Had to babysit my niece in the Fantasy Faire gaming area for children. My goodness is this place run terribly. The kids that run the place(yes I mean kids) were rude, and did not take their jobs serious at all. I would not come back.

We requested a non smoking room but upon entering our room it literally reeked (think hotel 6 occupied by a chain smoker). I returned to the lobby to inform them that the room would trigger my allergies. Their response was the hotel was sold out and that they would have someone go spray deodorizer. The staff was unconcerned, rude and confrontational. One lady told the other that they would offer no other option to us. I made my request politely. We left to go find dinner, upon returning we had been locked out. Returned to the lobby and they had found another room for us. This room was 100% better! Included in our stay was a $20 food credit, but it was limited to the steakhouse. The initial experience at the lobby left a foul stench. I felt the food credit was misleading. Too bad, the second room was comfortable and I enjoyed the casino.

I stayed on the 6th floor in Tower 2. Decent room, affordable prices (despite the resort fee), anything you might want to do or experience during your Las Vegas trip is nearby. Lines are long at check-out, but then just use the express check-out machines. The bell desk would hold your luggage for 12 hours. Everything was pretty great and clean and inexpensive.  I had a good time, was not disappointed in any way,  and am highly recommending the Excalibur.

Our room seems to be clean. It has large bathroom. We didn't use room service so I don't know about that. Safe was locked, I called the operator and they've sent somebody right away. Also hair dried burned up and again they have sent somebody to replace it right away. Our room was looking at a wall and trash exit of some restaurant. So in the middle of the night we were hearing metal garbage bins smashing into each other. But my biggest frustration was there was no in-room WIFI. And I got almost zero reception for my cell phone. I've really experienced being in middle aged castle, but I was expecting this in other manner not with lack of common. On top of that they charge hotel resort fee. But I was there when it is 60 degrees outside (15 degrees Celsius), so I couldn't use pool. There is no WIFI. So what is that resort-fee for. Let me tell you "just rip-off". And the computer&printer service for flight boarding passes is just plain failure. It is basically a money trap. DON"T use them.

Okay this is not the MOST amazing hotel in Vegas BUT, it did its purpose and got a very nice free upgrade! I loved the theme and the child friendyl attractions! The buffet was cafiteria food gross and diner like I HATED IT. The rooms were clean and comfortable enough for me not to complain :) Yes, I will be staying there again!

Excalibur provides a great value.  Unlike Harrah's, when they make an offer or room quote, they honor it.  The people at the reservations desk are extremely friendly and helpful. We have stayed here numerous times and are looking forward to our next stay.

I wish I could put 5 stars .. Because the begining of my vacation was great ... We checked in late Saturday ... We chose Excaibur because my boyfriend loved staying there .. I couldn't argue the price was great .. So upon checking in we get a upgrade from a room with a view to a room with a hot tub .. I was beyond excited .. We were suppose to check out Monday morning . But we were having such a good time we decided to stay an extra night .... I was even planning to return in sept for my birthday .. But then it went down hill 

Some how the door managed to lock itself with the dead lock while we were out .. Took us 30 min to get someone to open it .. I tried not to think about it ... Any ways your probably wondering why I'm so upset .. So on the morning of checking out  I was packing my make up and one rolled underneath the chair .. I  kneel down and  what do I find ?? The hugest fatest cock roach I've ever seen ..  I almost though it could have been a beetle by the size of it ... I was so disgusted ... This thing  was here with us the last 3 nights .. My great memorable vacation was ruined ... All I could think of how dirty this room really was .. There's no way they could have missed this bug if it was cleaned properly ... I felt gross knowing I stayed in that bed , used that hot tub .. I was furious


I went and notified management discreetly because i didn't want to call them out in front of other guests .. They apologized and offered to reimburse for one night that I stayed.... I didn't think that was enough But I bit my tounge ..  Now I'm driving home thinking about and although I do appreciate Excalibur for the reimbursement of one night .. I stayed for three days and still technically paid to sleep with a big dead bug ... I don't think I could come back and stay at this hotel

Run from this place!  After years of staying here we will never go back!  One hour check in the rides at Disney were shorter.  I never did see the line at a reasonable length.  They now charge for parking even for guests.  Thus driving away locals from playing there.   Homeless guy crashed in the Lobby.  However this is a rip on management the day to day people were phenomenal!  Oh did I mention an hour wait for check in?

I wish I could give a better review. We check in and go to our room and my boyfriend finds pee on the toilet.  After that we lay down and there are two spiders on the bed. Not to mention there was a dirty blanket and trash outside of our room upon walking up. We went to walk to the desk to tell someone and a worker walked by and asked if everything was find and we told him everything and he just said "hmmmmm". Will not recommend. Unless you are on a very low budget and every other hotel is booked. Thankfully once we complained the lady moved us. You could completely tell the difference in rooms. Our new one actually smells clean.

I was actually surprised how much I liked staying at this place despite the negative reviews. I've stayed at multiple places on the strip and ONE this place doesn't actually smell like cigarettes and old people the second you walk in, giant plus. The check in can be a little long, but just apply for an Mlife card and you get VIP check in (you can apply online or in the casinos). This is one of the more kid-friendly hotels on the strip with the whole "castle" appeal and an arcade downstairs called the "Fun Dungeon". We spent some time gambling for free drinks then going downstairs to play DDR and Air Hockey, like all the cool 20-something-year-olds do. Hahaha 
The pricing is really great too. We paid 63 dollars (not including resort fees) for a 2 queen bedroom with a great view of the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Tower two is a bit nicer, just because it's the newer tower of them all. They do offer smoking and none smoking rooms. 
Parking here can either be Valet or self parking, I felt the parking lot was safe enough to stay in, and it was free too!
You do have the ability to ride the free tram to get to either one of those hotels quickly, or there is a quick walkway to get on the strip.
I love that this place has Dicks last resort... A hilarious restaurant to check out if you've never been to one, you have to take everything they say with a grain of salt, but they do have a great happy hour!
I'll definitely be staying here again, had a great time.

I give a 3 star because you have good Valet, and very comfortable beds but really can you at least give us a coffemaker.  Not everyone wants to have to get dress to go get a cup of coffee and then come all the way back upstairs to get back in bed to enjoy it.   

Luckily I was rooming with someone but note to self:  This is why you get hotel off the strip.  My Travelodge is cheaper and lets you have a coffee maker and some even give you a refrigerator.    

Bathroom: Clean
Bed: Comfortable
Wall Deco: Peeling
Coffeemaker: No
Refrigerator: No
Ice Machine: Never found it.
A\/C Heater:  Worked Great
TV: Good
Floor:  Good
Shower Flow:  Good and we had hot water a +

So there you have it my review for the 11th Floor room

This is a tricky review to write because, to be fair, I was expecting it to be pretty bad. So at least my expectations were met! We paid very little for the room and were in it an average of 4 hours a night anyway - but just a few small things could have made it less crap, and for that complacency, I give 2 stars. 

Before going, you should know the following:
The hotel bar is a Dick's Last Resort. Yes, it's that bad. 
The jello shots contain zero alcohol. 

These are pertinent. Additional info:

It's well documented that it smells of smoke. That's because it is old. That's just the way it is. However, the fact that the shower is grimy and gross has nothing to do with age and everything to do with bad cleaning. The AC sounds like an aeroplane taking off, and the lifts are very slow. Again, it's old. But, the cleaning staff stand outside your door at 9am and have a very loud chat while apparently banging everything in sight with mallets, and that's got nothing to do with age. 

Mostly though, it's just bad because the casino itself is so depressingly drab and rubbish. Luxor is cheap too (and but a 5 minute walk away - so escape) but it doesn't make you want to claw your eyes out. The waitstaff look like they want to die, the dealers are robots, it's dirty, and just plain sad. The hilariously bad 'medieval' artwork will only keep you amused for so long. 

Oh, and the staff hate the guests. The 'concierge' deserves those inverted commas for her comment "it's over there" without any indication of where "there" was, then just ignoring us. The luggage retrievers take hours. 

Breakfast was the biggest plate of food ever - Excalibur's crowning glory was its hash browns. But - it is CHEAP.
