its really just one of those "themed" places you go to if you are on a budget and just need a place to crash for the night. nothing to brag about, in fact, did not resemble much of old english knights. it was meh

I stayed at Excalibur in late july 2015, needless to say i had no problem whatsoever. Check-in went smooth, we went with family members but booked different rooms, upon check-in they let us get rooms near to each other. We only stayed one-night because our vacation was cut short. But the room was clean, the restroom looked remodeled and clean as well. No complaints whatsoever, giving 4 stars because the hotel is old itself so the environment is not 5 stars.

There are NO MORE hot tub jacuzzis in the royal suite rooms and that was main reason we came. Only to find they have been replaced with plain big bath tub. Kind of a little upsetting to say the least as that was the main reason we got a room here. And not to mention we are M Life members Pearl so we get VIP treatment, did not feel that way. 

Slots are ok, find them to be a bit looser and more packed than other casinos. 

Have to hound down staff to get any answer to our questions. 

They did work with us on late checkout, you can pay an extra $34.01 (tax included) to extend your late checkout to 3pm, or they will extend till noon for free. That was a nice feature as we didn't want to get up so early after a long night. 

Overall, not too upset about much, but I kind of expected better and for the employees to not be rude, but it is what it is. The positives kind of outweighed the negative, but I still got a bad taste in my mouth about them not telling us there were no more jacuzzis as we specifically asked for that room. Still had a LOT of fun, but I could see how this could be a turn off for some people. Don't think I'll be renting a room here again.

If I could give a zero I would. Have not stayed here, or pretended to want to stay here before. It was picked as a one night, Friday night, stay based soley on the chepest rate for a "strip" hotel. The NYNY amd Luxor were a couple dollars more, and next time will be my bottom-line choice. Check in was long, but down to a science. "Look at these pictures here and see if you want to upgrade". I upgraded one room and rec'd the same room as the other, but with a higher view of the crappy parking lot. I should have known a $10 upgrade was just a way to get a few more bucks. Couldn't sit in one of my chairs because I can only assume it was used as a lap dance chair based on the stains. There is such a difference between this place and every other hotel on that corner. If a smoke-filled, lower priced stink hole is all you need to save $15 a night, go for it! I will take the higher priced hotels in the area because this is overrated amd overpriced for the accommodations. The bed was soft, but the bathroom and furniture must be 20 years in the making - crazy crappy stuff! And, stains everywhere! Have to say, employees were nice, but they arent staying in my room with me. Ugh!

Worst experience I've had in a hotel. The room type I reserved was unavailable so I had to settle for a two bed room. Check in took forever. The worst part of this hotel is the people that are in the building offering you discounted show tickets. I was told for 30min to an hour of my day I had to sit thru a presentation and in return I get compre show tickets. That was not the case. You get stuck for 5hrs listening to a stupid timeshare presentation. Then they pressure you into buying it. Don't give in. Once all said and done you get to wait the last hour for your tickets.

We got a room for $35\/night, a Motel-6 price for a better-than-Motel-6 room with much-better-than-Motel-6 amenities.  The pools are awesome.  You get a free drink pass.  Gym is pretty nice, too.  I approve.

We stayed here July 4 and we upgraded our room to the Royal Towers strip view on the 27th floor.  Check in took about 10 minutes and our room was ready early.  The room was nice although it did not have a coffee maker, fridge, or microwave.  The beds were ok for one person.  If there are two people the queen beds are small.  There were ALOT of children and families staying here and in the pool, so if you are looking for more adult activities, this is not the hotel to stay at.  The adult only pool is $10 pp per day.  Overall, the casino was fun but we only played the slots for a little while.  To me, the food court was the best out of all of the other hotels.  It is centrally located so if one person wants one thing and another person wants something else, they don't have to walk to far to get it.  Baja Fresh was the best place there, try it!  Save your money and get your bottle of liquor at ABC stores at the Planet Hollywood and your mixers at Walgreens and make your drinks in your rooms.  We did this and saved a ton of money.  We did get one of the frozen drinks though, they were so good.  Overall, it is a nice place with everything right there at your fingertips!!!

Probably the worst hotel on the strip with the worst customer service. They consistently miss simple expectations and also, continually fail to improve even with 2nd chances. 

They still charge a $30 resort fee and a $10 self parking fee... What is this resort still doing on the strip? Waste of space.

You get what you pay for. I can't say I enjoyed myself here. We just stayed 2 nights at this hotel. There was a huge check in line when we arrived. Luckily we are Mlife members and were able to bypass it. When we got to our room 2 lamps didn't work. I tried to call, but the phone rang and rang. I went to the front desk and the staff member said it would be fixed right away. It wasn't. I called the next day and it was fixed by afternoon. 

This hotel attracts many families I think mostly because of cost. We reserved a Royal room which was "updated". It had good bedding, the best thing about the room. It had an old fan in the bathroom, the towels had some hair in them and it really didn't feel clean. On the second day, housekeeping didn't leave us a floor towel or refurbish out shampoo and soap. The air conditioning was cold and consistent. The furniture in the room was old and worn down. But I've been in worse hotels. 

The casino is smaller than other hotels and it's easier to get from one end to another. We tried the breakfast buffet. It was ok at best. A lot of food items were dried out like the potatoes. The scrambled eggs were watery. The French toast and pancakes were hard. There are food court spots like Cinnabon, Starbucks, Krispy Kreme etc which are less expensive for families. 

We went to the pool in the morning. The main pool opens at 11a so there are a lot of people just sitting around. The pool with the slide opened at 9a. It gets crowded quick as do the chairs. Mostly kids at this point. I have to say there was a lot of debris in these pools. I looked in the mail pool before it opened. I saw shiny objects in the bottom. When it opened I went in and retrieved them. Necklace parts. I handed them to the lifeguard and asked if they ever vacuum the pool out. He didn't seem very co concerned. There was a lot of debris in this pool. The spa pool had bandaids and hair floating around and the water was cloudy. I felt gross. The food shop next door was ok as and there were a couple of bars for alcohol. The pool area has a couple of waitresses taking food and drink orders which was nice. You can also rent a cabana for about $175 including snacks, tv and fridge.

I'm not sure I would ever stay here again, but here's the thing, I didn't have any high expectations so I wasn't surprised at all its faults. This hotel needs serious refurbishments. But some may enjoy the old school feel. The pool was so gross and it's freezing cold as well. If you're on a budget and don't really care about quality, you can get some good deals here.

This place has never disappointed us. It may b an older hotel now, but it's always quiet and clean and the staff is phenomenal. This is our go to place because rates are decent and it's easy to get in and out of here and the adult pool section is awesome. We had a bad experience at nyny and Excalibur exceeded our expectations.

I have extremely fond memories of Excalibur from the first time that I stayed there shortly after it opened.  I've always loved the decor and it's just how I remember it, albeit a bit worn down from the years.  It's missing its moat show, which is sad, but I guess good things come to an end.

The tables are a bit cheaper than most, which is good if you're on a gambling budget.  They're the only casino that I've found that features War as a game.

I'm eager to go back to Excalibur and experience more of it again!

You really do get what you pay for for the price the place is semi doable very out dated compared to the high end hotels tho i did not have any issues witht he rooms the casino was horrible i rather go next door to new york new york the vibe is alot better i gave the casino a try and the dealer tells me hey u cant throw the dice like that extending my arm ive never heard of this i play at caesars and bellagio all the time never heard of this it really pissed me off i rolled the dice one more time i hit my point of 6 and told the dealer give me my chips im out of here this is bullshit the whole table was pissed at the dealer as i hear him trying to explain himself to the rest of the table sounded like they wanted to kill him for since last 3 shooters crapped  out right away without passing.i then gambled the rest of my 3 days at n.y n.y

Our party of 4 adults stayed at this hotel for 4 nights arriving on 3\/6\/2014. We got some decent discount deal online when reserving 2 rooms (with 2 Queen size beds each) almost 2 months in advance.  Average price of $147\/night per room excluding taxes and resort fee.
Check-in process was very smooth. The hotel receptionist was very kind in getting us two rooms in Tower 2 near the elevators on the 27th floor, since one of our family members is semi-handicapped. The rooms were clean and roomy, although somewhat dated. Sound insulation is rather poor, we could easily hear conversations in the adjacent rooms. There was no small fridge or coffee maker in the room, but there is hair dryer, ironing board and a plasma TV set in the room.
The hotel offers all the essential amenities, including few stores and a Food Court on the second level from the lobby area. There are couple of Starbucks inside the hotel (one by the casino) and few other restaurants that we did not get to try. There is access to a free tram that runs from the Excalibur Hotel to the Mandalay Bay Hotel, making a stop at the Luxor. The Hotel also has a walkway to the New York New York Hotel next door. We found the location of our hotel actually quite convenient (close to the airport) despite of the fact that it is not right in the heart of the Strip, but it's still walking distance to several hotels nearby (MGM, New York New York, Luxor, Montecarlo, Mandala Bay, etc.).
The Excalibur looks a bit old inside, some carpets near and inside the elevators could be better cleaned. But overall it is a very good hotel if you are planning to visit Las Vegas and don't plan to spend much time inside the room. Once you visit other hotels like Bellagio, Mandala Bay, Winn, or Aria, the Excalibur will look and feel more run-down. It is still a practical and convenient hotel to stay if you get a good discount rate.

I've been to this property several times for shows, so this review is for the casino and showroom only.

The Excalibur is dated.  I was surprised by the fact that I didn't dislike it as much as I thought I would.  The place is large and finding the steps to the second floor took me awhile, but once I did it, I was able to get to the second floor showroom easily.

I am always surprised by the large number of people that are in the casino.  Even when the economy was at its lowest, the place always seemed to be busy.

The showroom on the second floor, which is shared  by several productions, is a nice enough room.  The long tables with 8 seats per table can be a little uncomfortable as they have them very close to each other. If the show is good, you don't think of this.

Parking is good in the garage in the back, but it may give you a longer walk to get into the casino.  I generally try to find a surface spot parallel to Trop.

While not one of my favorites on the Strip, the Excalibur is OK for the reasons I go there.

have stayed here 4 years in a row and for the money  great location and great hotel to stay at.. want to thank Harley at the check in desk for fixing the problems with our room and making are stay wonderful.

You get what you pay for. My husband and I stayed here over the forth of July weekend. Three days total. It's a dated hotel. It needs renovations and a better cleaning crew. Our room was 80% clean. Not too bad but what I did see dirty was gross. Pubic hair and hair in general on the bathroom floor and no tub. Which might be a good think considering they don't do a great job cleaning. Overall it's a lowbrow hotel with lowbrow clientele. The parking facilities are atrocious. Be cautious and remember you get what you pay for!

Ditto to all of the other reviews of the Excalibur Hotel. This would not have been my first choice, but the group I was traveling with insisted we stay there since it's kid friendly. Really the only time it is kid friendly is in the morning while everyone is still sleeping, but on the weekends around 4:00 p,m. the go-go girls start dancing on the bar right next to the casino. From the main entrance to the elevator goes right past them and between two bars, stupid location with families coming from the strip trying to get to their room. 

Speaking of elevators, on the weekends expect at least 20 minute wait time, find the stairs early so you save some time. Just hope you're not on the 25th floor! 

Kids arcade was huge, but half of the games either don't work at all, take your money or don't pay off the tickets. Really needs to be overhauled and updated!

Were told rooms have been updated, maybe. They definately are not maintained however. Mold on bathroom ceiling, stains on curtains and carpet, typical vegas, not in the room much. Missing a lot of typical extras hotels provide, limited tv channels, no free wifi, found out later internet access was included in the $28 resort fee - whatever. 

Generally, the location on the strip is ideal, close to everything, rooms are cheap, its crowed because the rooms are cheap, drinks are expensive, didn't eat there nothing seemed appealing so went to the nicer hotels for dinner. Not aging gracefully and not what I was expecting.
The room was spacious. The beds are big  but my first stop was into the bathroom and there were pubes on the floor. Yuck   Everything else seemed cleaned but this was a big upsetting point.

When talking about Vegas hotels Excalibur often falls to the bottom of the list because it is old. However with old comes cheap and you can score great accommodation deals here! Of course it is linked up to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. It is also convenient to New York, New York, MGM Grande, etc. One of the best atributes of the hotel is the pool, or should I say pools. Finally it is often difficult to find decent, cheap food in Vegas however theer is a Baja Fresh right in Excalibur which is vry convenient!

I have stayed in many hotels over my professional and personal life. I have to say this one is one of the worst experiences of my life.  

They had people waiting at the front door acted like they were going to check you in when in reality they were pimping some Time share like presentation.  

Then we stood in the hour long queue line to check in. Having pre-paid in advance and thinking we had secured the room we looked at much to our surprise we got short sheeted.  

The room was dirty and obviously somebody had been smoking in the room. To make matters worse we had to walk the length of a football field from the elevator to get to this smoky room.

Long the way there was an abundance of marijuana smoke coming from this wing. 

The carpet is dirty and worn out the fixtures are also old and worn.

When we called to bring all of these items to the attention of management, they were very Uninterested in even attempting to resolve even one of the complaints or move us to another room.  Their attitude was basically tough shit, you screwed up booking a room with us. They did offer us to defumigate the room if we left for 2 or 3 hours. Can you believe that?!  Defumigate with what?  Another toxic chemical?  I will battle this with American Express to not pay these bastards!  

Bottom line, I will tell everyone I know what a miserable experience this place was to me and my wife. And I would never take my kids to this place.

MGM you need to do something about this, you have a group of reckless managers running this hotel into the ground.too bad I can't give it a zero. Offering up a non smoking room that has obviously been smoked in doesn't deserve to be paid for at the premium price

They also forced us into paying $28 for resort fees and the pool is closed.  What a rip off!

This is one of the cheaper places to stay, so if you're looking for a budget friendly on strip hotel, this is a good choice. They have a large pool area with many pools. I'm not a fan of the hotel setup, it doesn't have a separate lobby like many of the other strip hotels, so you have to put up with the casino noises and smells when checking in. 

Stayed in a tower 2 room, the room was spacious and clean, bed was comfortable and it was quiet. We had a huge 2 person tub with a view of NY NY across the street, this was really neat and we made the effort to pick up some bath salts to enjoy a romantic soak.

The casino is very typical vegas, noisy and smells of cigarettes, some casinos have found a way to get the smoke smell out, some haven't. This is a big hotel for families, so if you hate kids running around, maybe best to avoid. The food court is convenient for quick bites or snacks.

Overall good experience for this stay, and ultimately it's vegas for cheaper, chances are you'll spend more time away from the hotel then at it.

I just got back from Vegas. Met my son, his wife and grand child. My wife picked this place because it was "kid friendly"-NOT. Everything in this hotel is run down. The rooms, hall ways have seen better days-carpeting even in the elevators were stained with who knows what. We arrived on a week end and although I understand the "casino crowed" are not from Yale or Harvard however, this place attracts all the trailer park trash in the US. Walking through the casino after registering I've never seen so many people with facial tatoos and F_ _k You on their T shirts-this is not an exageration. We decided to grab a fast bite at the food court. A guy a few tables away looked like he was high on meth and his friend every so often was punching him in the face and yelling at him. Four employess-one was a security guard- just stood their laughing. The arcade for kids is quite run down and most of the games were not staffed. We stayed in the "better tower" which is number 2. I couldn't even imagine what one looks like. The owners haven't invested a dime in this place in over a decade and it looks it. Compared to other hotels this one is cheap-spend the extra money it will be worth it. Oh yea-the show was terrific however, you can stay at another place and attend the show here. To sum up-this place is disgusting, is not kid friendly unless your kid is hoping one day to be "trailer park trash".

They were doing construction on the floor above me at 7 am!!!! I complained to a manager and they refunded my resort fee. That's not even close to compensating me for the inconvenience of waking me at 7am on my vacation. DEFINITELY NOT STAYING HERE AGAIN. 

Update: Excalibur posted a response to my review claiming that renovations are often necessary. Someone please tell me why renovations are necessary AT 7 AM.
The hotel has a neat theme to it. Food court is decent but the buffet is a bit pricey. Great view from Tower two rooms. Tram that connect the Luxor and Mandeley in nice.

I give them 4 stars we stayed here for 2 nights in a standard room. Very clean and up dated. I was a little worried about this place since the price was cheaper then most hotels on the strip.  And the reviews are low. But I disagree  Excalibur was great I would go back  and stay here. If price is a big deal you can't go wrong staying here. 
The casino was no different then any other casino. The food choices are ok price are high but that is the same everywhere on the strip. 
One bad thing was the buffet we were lazy and decided to eat diner there. That was a bad mistake. not good at all. Do not eat the buffet here.
You are on the lower end of the strip but you have to choose  an area of the strip to stay so that is not a issue.

The rooms do not have microwaves or refrigerators. If you want one you can pay a additional 15.00 per day. So the money they got for the room or the resort fee wasn't enough especially since we didn't even use the pool.. Also we were told now you have to pay for parking that is messed up even though we didn't have to pay we flew here.. Also when leaving the hotel to go towards New York New York people bug you trying to get you to time share...  No tubs just a shower stall... Also only one place to eat when your coming back to room at 5 am should have a breakfast cafe. The only I liked was the bed was comfy and blanket felt like a blanket as opposed to sheath like other hotels.. We will not be coming back...

Excalibur offers a decent price to stay at a big hotel\/casino on the strip.  If you're looking for a bargain, this is the place to go.  You won't get the high-end experience that you'd get at a place like The Venetian but Excalibur offers clean comfortable rooms with the convenience of being on the strip at a decent price.  I used to love playing poker here but the poker room is no-more.  It's been replaced with automated poker dealers.  I don't know about all that and I'm not down to find out.  I've been to the pool here once before too.  There's too many kids for my preferance.  The place is kid friendly compared to other Vegas hotels because there's a large arcade downstairs.  They also have a large selection of fast food joints upstairs, McDonalds, Krispy Kremes, pizza, etc.

Excalibur is a great bargain if you don't mind not having great amenities in your room but who even spends that much time in the room when you're in Vegas.  If you're looking to save some money on your hotel room but still want a clean room to sleep and shower, then check out Excalibur.

On a trip with my girl friend, we canceled our reservations at the Quad and stayed here instead. With my Mlife card it averaged only $66 a night - Friday-Sunday. What a deal! 

When we arrived at Excalibur, we were lost as usual for the expansive casino\/hotels in Vegas. But there was good signage that led us to the registrar desk.

When we got there, the line wasn't too long, as it can be sometimes on the weekends. I asked at the Mlife counter if they could print me out another card, but with a rude demeanor, the staff member said they could print it for me when I check-in. So we waited in line, and got a really nice check-in clerk. I think his name was Ryan, or Brian? Anyway, he was great. Very nice, even got us a view of New York New York when he couldn't get a room with a view of Luxor like I requested. He printed out my Mlife card for me and entered my Southwest Rapid Rewards number so I could get points for the stay there too.
He gave us a room in Tower II, 17th floor, all the way in the back of the hall. That wasn't good for the nights we came up stumbling and too drunk to travel by feet very far. One night, my friend tried literally rolling on the ground to the room because she was having so much trouble. It was very comical.

When we first arrived at our room, it seemed fine. It wasn't until I walked around without my shoes on that I realized there was a big wet spot next to one of the beds. Who knows what that could be. But we tried not to think too much of it and just wore our shoes in room. 

I also sought outlets for our phone chargers. I only found one on the lamp stand. So I moved the center table and removed the plug for the alarm clock, so we could both charge our phones. That was annoying.

The bathroom was stocked with the usual amenities: lotion, shampoo, soap, and nice close-up mirror that's good for us women putting on makeup. And the lighting was way better than a lot of other hotels' lighting in their bathrooms. 

However on the last night we were there I came home craving a shower around 4\/5 am. Unfortunately, the shower heat wouldn't go very high. So I was stuck taking a luke warm shower for what spanned about an hour (don't ask me why I wanted to take such a long shower). Finally, the heat came on and I had to turn it down to a more comfortable temperature. I stayed in for another 2 hours without complaint. Yeah yeah, I know that's forever. It's by far the longest shower I can remember ever taking. 

What I liked best about the room was the huge TV and the beautiful view. Everything else was ehhhh.

When we checked out we had the hotel hold onto our bags for us while we go to a pool party before our flight. There was a gigantic line of people doing this, but when we eventually got up front the staff were nice and we had no issues getting our bags back later.

Overall, I would stay at Excalibur again because of the price. But if I'm not on such a tight budget next time I'll definitely be staying somewhere else.

Where do I start? I come to Vegas quite often so I was looking for a deal, big mistake. No parking for guests unless they already checked in, park in self parking on the roof in the heat and walk (yah my sister has a sprained ankle they couldn't care less) for this "convenience" they'll charge you $10 a day. Two beds? Extra. Pool? Extra. No guest menu no do not disturb sign. I paid for a strip view $100 extra you can see what I got. Don't stay at Excalibur, the staff are angry they work here as well and take it out on the guests. I have probably stated here more than 10 times in the past 20 years, never again.

I was so scared reading the reviews.  Not sure why people gave it 1 star.  I had an absolutely amazing time and I will definitely come back again.  I arrived around 1030am so I thought I was going to have to wait around till 3. Not at all. $20 for early check in?? heck yeah I'm in and I got a $20 food or drink credit. As I walked through the halls I was  a bit scared looking at the outdated decor. Oh My, when I Walked in, what a beauty.  Huge flat screen tv, ( forgot what channel it wad but they had done great information)nice view, plenty of space and clean room.  Oh, my bathroom was huge and bed was comfy with lots of pillows.  

Pool- 5 decent size pools with 2 hot tubs to relax in.   what more can you ask for.  Chairs weren't the best but it worked.  They close at 7pm fyi.  There was a lot of garbage but that's bc us humans don't know how to pick up garbage and throw it away. So if its dirty, its bc YOU DID IT.  People would just leave the beer cans laying around.

Casino- it was nice But didnt bring me any luck.  There was a starbucks located in the rear by the exit.  Go early since there was always a long line.  Make your way upstairs for some pretzels yogurt mcdonalds and much more.  

My experience was a good one and the price was right.  Definitely can't b compare it to the bellagio, but it was a good,.smart choice for me.

Had a great time with my friends. 
Too many people selling stuff though.
I'm  checked in, I have all of my bags strapped to me. On my way to my room, and 3 different people came up to me..... " just checking in?! Are you interested in a show? Come on over to my booth"

Other than that.  Great times at the ex caliber

Came late Wednesday night and we mentioned to the registration girl that it was my boyfriends birthday and she gave us a free upgrade to a remodled two bedroom penthouse suite with a jacuzzi on the top floor overlooking the strip. We stayed from Wednesday to Sunday and paid total $325. Wow is all I can say.
Service is poor. Room had bed bugs all along the head board. Had Bloody sheets and when requested to change them they were just flipped.

Ok, people. You realize when you book to stay at the Excalibur it's not Ceasar's, the Cosmopolitan or Bellagio right? That's why it's about half the price. If you're expecting it to be a fabulous 5 star hotel you're going to be disappointed. Come here with mid range expectations and you'll be fine. Also, tipping and being kind to the hotel staff goes a long way. We got free upgrades because of that. My husband and I ventured off to other hotels, but mostly gambled here because they have $5 tables...can't beat that. Our room met my expectations, I thought it was clean. Again, tipping a little can get you far. I would definitely stay here again. I think we'll actually be booking again soon!

First time in vegas so I don't have anything to compare this too, but I was very impressed and enjoyed my stay.

My room came out to less than 70 per night after my comp was applied, and got a free buffet. I won on the slots so I actually left with more money than I came with so that ended up working out for me. ***edit after I won 500 on slots some guy approached me and asked if I wanted to buy drugs which was super creepy***

The service was awesome also while playing slots. I constantly had a drink to sip on while gambling.

I recommend the excalibur!

If you like bed bugs, this is the place for you.

My daughter and I booked a room here for a night after hiking at nearby National Parks.

The check in was easy enough, using mobile check in but later I saw an extra 50 charge added to my room, taken out of my account. When I inquired, they told me with mobile checkin they automatically take 50 out for incidentals.  I was pissed that they didnt notify me of this. 50 is not much but it is the principal, especially after pre paying for the room, resort, and parking fees.

Anyway - up to our room. It was decent enough.  UNTIL THE NEXT MORNING WHEN WE FOUND BED BUGS ON top of the bedspread (see pic and video).

When I called down to the front desk to let them know - they were nonchalant and aloof and didnt seem too concerned.  This is sooooo gross.  We were worried sick we were taking bed bugs with us in our suitcase home, which I have heard is really hard to control once they are in your home.

We booked services at the spa. We both received massages which were horrible.  My 7 year old  could have given me a better massage, I am sure.

The pool closes at 6. Why??? it is 113 degrees out, and we are charged a resort fee, so open the pool.

Parking was easy but it was 10 a day. Good location.

No fridge or microwave in the room.

I was surprised by the lack of just basic maintenance and cleanliness.  The windows and doors were filthy and fingerprints and handprints were all over all day long.  Does no one take any pride or do routine cleaning? It isn't Disneyland but come on......

Everything in the hotel is expensive, water, food, etc. There are very few healthy choices.

This hotel is showing its age, the employees seem disinterested, and the hidden charges are infuriating.  Pick another hotel.

Came here with our kids, booked 2 rooms & we were automatically upgraded to the "contemporary" rooms. Called the concierge & had no issue getting adjoining rooms. When I told her it was our kids first time in Vegas she made sure she found us rooms with a view of the strip. Overall I was very happy with the rooms for such a great price. They were clean and the beds were comfortable. Location is great, kids loved seeing the strip at night & had fun wandering through the "streets" of New York NY next door :) In n Out & other fast food places right on the other side of the freeway.... Inside Excalibur, we ate at Dick's Last Resort, pricey but good food. And Johnny Rocket's was $14 for 1 double cheeseburger but it was HUGE (easily enough for 2 people) & soooo good.  Pool area was nice but as other reviewers have noted, very little shade. Be prepared to be in full on sun the whole time or else rent an umbrella or cabana. No one checks bags on the way in to the pool, great for bringing in snacks or drinks. I also saw plenty of kids with pool toys & small inflatables. The "Fun Dungeon" downstairs was a blast with the kids, and surprisingly reasonable game prices (many for only a quarter or 2)...  I paid the extra $20 for early check in & when we arrived the line at the front desk was CRAZY long (even though it was only a Monday!). Luckily with express check-in you skip the regular line & go to the M Life line, no wait for me :)  the only con's are no microwave, no fridge, & no coffee maker. We took an ice chest so it wasn't a huge deal. All in all, for a family trip, we would definitely stay here again. :)

Las Vegas is all about THEME hotels. Don't let the castle exterior fool you. The real theme here is. DMV meets a cattle car meets Oklahoma morbidly obese convention, meets half exploded meth lab. CLASSY!

I made the mistake of trying to save money since my Vegas trip was pure business. "I just need a place to sleep while I attend this convention" I thought." BIG deal if this place is tacky!" 

Just pay an extra 30 bucks and stay somewhere where the rooms do not smell of mustard , and where they actually care about your business.

They do not even have wifi.

We came here on a one night staycation because of a deal. The is actually ok, has a separate litte area for dining. But they stop serving at 2pm! What the hell is that. I've never been to a hotel that doesn't serve past 2pm. Maybe 2am but especially in Vegas it should be like most of the other hotels and 24\/7 that shit!
Cheap rooms. Flat screen. Has plunty of places to eat cheap. kind of in the middle to south end of strip so its a good location. No wifi.

What does $35 get you in Excalibur?  a 20th floor, 2 queen room with a fantastic view of the other tower and the back end of the castle.  

But at a price like that, how can you complain?  Its close to Luxor, NY\/NY, MGM, and Mandalay.  Its casinos have one of the loosest tables, and they have 'beer pong' tables set up so you can show off how you became Beer Pong champ at your old college frat house.  Slightly odd to find a BP table in the middle of a Vegas Casino though... And how do they expect us to order room service if no menu is provided?  Oh well, we did anyways.

But it's cheap and provides a shower and beds.  You don't need anything else.  And hell, if you came to Vegas you sleep, you're in the wrong damn city.

Ok,I am not looking to be snob about looking for the best hotel in Las Vegas,but who goes to Las Vegas to stay in a hotel room  all day.I don't care if you want the best hotel there. You just need a decent room with no stains on the sheets to lay your head on.If you meet someone believe me they will be happy with the quarters you have.

Gambling,free drinks 24\/7  and a decent bed.How can you go wrong.

Vegas=lack of sleep.

Gotta luv it.

Just stayed at Excalibur for a 21st birthday. The 5 of us really enjoyed our stay there and felt at home there due to staffs professionalism and care. We booked online for $28 a night. We asked for rooms in Tower II when we checked in. They gave us the free upgrade. The rooms were just like a Courtyard hotel room, so totally fine. The hotel and rooms were clean and could use updating but we're totally good for our trip. The hotel phone operator got us $60 KA tickets!!! We had 4th row center!! The food court in Excalibur is overpriced but has lots of options and is still cheaper than other restaurants. We gambled a lot in this hotel because we won most there versus other hotels. We will stay here again. Plenty of good parking and lots of fun at Excalibur!
We found two roaches in our room. The rooms are basic but the price is reasonable. The location is decent as well.

I'm not going to slam them, even though I could.  First, the room was clean, they called for our wake-up calls each morning, the Buffet was good, and basically, everyone that we came into contact with was nice.

HOWEVER..  NO Valet, NO bellman, SCREWED UP my wife's Anniversary Massage\/Spa Day (had to cancel)...  all in all, it was okay...  but the Spa thing was just not good...  for our 5th Anniversary, she was really hoping to do the spa, but they double-booked and we got the short end...

The Excalibur has turned into a 3rd rate piece of crap property. It is owned by the MGM Grand Corporation. They use this property to suck the money out of the families and people looking for a cheap deal. They put NO money into upkeep and maintenance. Their entire intent is to milk this property for every dime and put nothing into it. 
If you are looking for a cheap stay on this end of the strip, this is the place. Full of families and kids everywhere. If you are looking for fast friendly efficient service, look elsewhere. This is a piece of crap property. It is not really cheap, but, they make it look that way. For example, it would be approximately $40 for 4 breakfast buffets. Yikes, can anyone really eat $40 worth of crappy food. Cold eggs, bacon in a pan of grease,

A nice cheap hotel.  Good central location with easy access to Luxor, Mandalay, NYNY, MGM, and more.  The room wasn't spectacular.  Our TV remote only worked from 6 inches away and the power button on the set was MIA, but who is in Vegas to watch TV?  Who is in Vegas to sleep for that matter??  I will stay again if the price is right...

Ya get what you pay for. Clearly. What a dump. Our room had a frickin black out shade for god sakes!!!! Nothing in the room is updated, and there is poop on our window! Frickin ghetto hotel. It needs to be demolished. Totally ghetto!!!!!

Our stay at the Excalibur hotel started off a little shakey. 

We booked 2 View Rooms, each with 2 queen sized beds. When we arrived we were given 2 rooms with one king each in Tower 1. When we got to the rooms our "views" included a wall and the other room had a lovely view of some people waiting for an elevator. These rooms were fairly dated and looked worn and old.
We went back downstairs and asked for the rooms we had paid for. Once we got up to our new rooms in Tower 2, we had a great view of the New York, New York hotel. These rooms seemed to be much newer and cleaner. 
Overall, I dont know that I would stay here again, but it was awesome being able to walk from our room to the convention center in the Mandalay Bay (we were there for a convention) without having to step out into the summer heat.

The location on the strip is bit away.  However, they have a nice ramp with travelators from the strip to get you inside!  

The bad thing is I did not get ANY points or credits for playing couple of times in their poker room!  Mlife's customer service also did not help me with this. 

On the positive side, they are well connected with Luxor and Mandalay Bay with a monorail and internal corridors!

Although reasonably priced, the service of the staff here is so very poor! 1. The front desk does not explain charges clearly. While a card was to be held for incidentals it was charged on the day before checkout. 2. The beds are hard; the toilet was loud; I had to leave a note for housekeeping to clean the window [when I tell you there were so many smudges and fingerprints it looked as if a kid party had took place on the window ledge]. 3. The television stations were patchy. Amongst other issues rude staff being the biggest.  I will never stay here again even for charity!

While the weekday room rates are reasonable, the weekend rates are disproportionately higher and not justified for the room quality. Signage on the casino floor is obscured and the traffic pattern to traverse between entrances, registration, towers and meeting rooms is extremely cluttered. Be prepared to be constantly molested be employees trying to up sell the property as you navigate the smoke filled casino area. 

The food court has airport prices and is poorly laid out. The buffet is $16 - $20 and average at best. 

I was part of a convention taking place in one of the meeting rooms. I must say that the Marketing Department really went above and beyond to make that a phenomenal experience. Our convention is annual and we will most likely end up here again next year simply because of how well we were treated by the Marketing Department.

This is for the Octane Lounge upstairs near the showroom.  The bartender didn't know what a black opal was.  Non-import beer was six bucks and a mixed drink goes for eleven.  The dance floor was tiny and ducted taped to the floor.  Lame.

I had stayed at this hotel many years ago when I was younger,Now that I am older I can see why we were taken here as kids it's more a kid friendly hotel like circus circus. All in all its not a bad place to stay. I used my myvegas comp for this free room last night since we decided to stay one more day . We checked in around 1:30pm and was greeted by a nice lady named Kathy at checkout, She even upgraded the room for us since it was my friends birthday...made sure we knew where the room was explained the amenities the $22 resort fee included. Great hospitality Kathy! The room was on the 18th level in tower 2 the newly remodeled side. The beds and pillows were compfy. The bathroom had granite counter tops and was spacious. The only downfall of the room was the curtain situation was a little weird, We had to makeshift it to make sure it stayed dark. Awesome stay at the castle and if you have those vegas comps use them they pay off!

Got good rate by Internet. The lady at check in desk gave me free upgrade. They charge resort fee but wired Internet is provided. for free.

The room is very big, clean and updated with granite counter top, 5 star settings, 42 inch HDTV etc.

Probably I was just lucky. Love it!

We have stayed here over a dozen times.  This has always been a budget place, so we did not expect much.  But lately, they have not been meeting our low expectations.  Parking is an absolute mess.  They have closed off much of the surface parking because of construction.  On our last visit, it took us over an hour to park the car every day.  That is totally unacceptable.  Then we were awaken at 3 am from construction noise.  They said that they need to work around the clock for construction.  What a nightmare!  We let them know how horrible our stay was.  Despite the great rates we get because of our Mlife level, we will not be staying here again in the foreseeable future.  We our cancelling our next reservation and will be staying at Harrah's.

If you are looking for a beautiful, modern, 5 star hotel....stay somewhere else. There are plenty of options, so stop complaining like the Excalibur mislead you to believe you were walking into a 5 diamond resort that you paid a fraction of the price for. 

I have stayed here plenty of times. They offer great deals, are conveniently located, and have good options for gaming and food. You can't beat a place that is basically connected to 4 other hotel\/casinos, especially in the Vegas summer heat. Most of the bartenders and dealers are nice and I have always thought that service staff was friendly as well. I don't go to Vegas to stay in my room though. We go out all day, come back to refresh, then go out again until it's time for some sleep. That's why we almost always stay at Excalibur or Luxor. It may not be a fancy hotel, but I'm also not looking to spend all of my money on a room I'm never in. The Excalibur works very well for us. 

If you want to stay in the lap of luxury, go spend $250-500\/night at Bellagio, Venetian, or Ceasar's, etc. If you want an affordable, convenient place that leaves you more money for some Vegas fun, hit up the Excalibur.
Fabulous Time.. Quality Time With Quality! Thank You! Xo Everyone Should Visit! Little Bit Of Everything For Everyone! I Feel Like I Am In Movie :)

Excalibur Hotel is child's play compared to the elite hotel resorts of Las Vegas ... at 1\/2 the price tag ... making it a deal for you bargain hunters or families on vacation. If you have children or need a "beginner" hotel for the whole Vegas experience, choose Excalibur.

Welcome to the future site of a cool five-star Vegas Mecca. Once they tear this down and build a new mega-resort, you can tell your grandkids that you stayed here back when it was Excalibur. 

Until then, here's what you'll find ...

 * Hotel Rooms ... nothing fancy, but you've slept in worse (probably)
 * A Casino with lower table limits and more frowns
 * A small Sports Book for Dad to prove he was right about the home team
 * Food is like choosing a restaurant at your local mall
  ... Excalibur Buffet ($23 for dinner and less for breakfast or lunch)
  ... Buca di Beppo - American chain of Italian-style re-heated food
  ... Dick's Last Resort - The Applebee's of Vegas
  ... A Steakhouse with $41 Rib Eye Steak or a 3-course Sirloin meal for $37
  ... Baja Fresh - Mexican Fast Food
  ... Food Court with Krispy Kreme, McDonalds, Pizza Hut, Cinnabon, & more
  ... Octane Lounge (Fri\/Sat) & the "Lounge" are bars for adults to reminisce
 * Entertainment is great if you're letting mom plan your trip
  ... Tournament of Kings: Jousting banquet ($66) using your hands to eat
  ... Thunder From Down Under: Mom's\/Girl's Night Out ($57 - $67) - chiseled abs
  ... Australian Bee Gees - Tribute show ($45-$60) not as fun as Fallon & Timberlake on SNL
  ... Fun Dungeon is a huge arcade full of games (10am-10pm)
  ... Pool with bar & food service full of kids taking a Dungeon break
  ... Shopping is limited to mall-style boutiques for kids and mom's
  ... A Wedding Chapel - Good luck.
 * That funky aroma you smell is annoyed disappointment ... or weed

For now, Excalibur survives as a low-end property in the MGM Resorts brand (with the MGM, Luxor, New York-New York, Monte Carlo, Mandalay Bay, Aria, Vdara, Mirage, and Bellagio). Its prime location on the South end of the Vegas Strip at the corner of Tropicana and Las Vegas Blvd is the future site of something much, much better. Til then, Excalibur has accepted it's cheap existence and you should, too.

I just got back yesterday from a trip to the West...in fact this was my 5th trip to LA, 10th trip to Vegas - I did a duo trip, visited both cities which included spending the night in Vegas.  I was just there in June, so trust me... one night was plenty!!!

I've stayed at different hotels the past 9 trips, from higher end (Venetian) as well as the Flamingo, Mirage, New York New York, Treasure Island, etc.  I have means of comparison.  

Since we were spending one night in Vegas...we wanted cheap, but decent.  We didn't want bed bugs.  My sister stayed here a few times in the past and said it was fine.  I also haven't been to this end of the strip my past few trips out there, so it was something different for me.  As others have mentioned, I'm sure - who stays in Vegas in good weather and spends a LOT of time in their room???  Seriously? You sleep there, you take a shower... and most of the time is spent out and about so if you're traveling on a budget, or just don't really care... no need to waste money on the fancy schmancy hotel.  This was the cheapest I could find ON the strip...Circus Circus and Stratosphere may have been cheaper, but this place is closer to everything on the strip.  In the past, you could probably get away at a hotel without paying that stupid resort fee...these days, it's hard to avoid and you get things like wifi and access to the gym.  Yeah, I don't work out in Vegas...I do a ton of walking instead.  I do still think the resort fee is a major rip off and should just be in the room rate, so be it.  This place doesn't give out coupons to use AT the hotel with your resort fee like others I've stayed at.

I am at the "pearl" level with my MLife card so I was pleasantly surprised to beat the line with express check in ... that process was super speedy, even though I checked in a few hours after the rush time.  And yes, EVERY hotel has that 3pm "Rush", not just this one.

Yes, this place is dated...but it's cute, it has personality, it has a "theme".  There is your obvious casino, the rooms are clean, a few restaurants, a few decent stores, a pool, spa, etc.  I like to stay at a different hotel every trip out there, but I wouldn't recommend NOT staying here.  It's totally fine.

Beds were comfy, but no coffee pot in room. I forgot my pillow in the room and the jack ass at the counter wouldn't send anyone up to get it for me. I'm sorry, but, that's bad customer service. And the Buffet was closed for renovation and nobody thought to tell us when making reservation!! We would have went to another tell if we would of know that. Never staying here again!  The only reason they are getting 2 stars is because of the beds, otherwise it would have been 1.

Breakdown:

Rooms - Terrible.  The room and furniture were old and low quality amenities in the rooms.  I read that the rooms were renovated, keep in mind that we did NOT stay in a renovated room (I thought all the rooms were renovated).  Put it like this.. showering the first morning my immediate thought was to check myself for bed bug bites (thankfully there were none).

It is one of the cheaper hotels on The Strip but we didn't even feel that we got what we paid for it.  It's a nice location (the reason why we picked it) but in the future I would gladly pay more for a better room than the one we stayed.

The casino and sports book are pretty small and not very exciting.  There was duct tape on the carpet holding down some temporary wires, etc.  It just felt blah inside.  The clientele and workers of the hotel\/casino reflect the care level of the Excalibur.

My buddy ate at the hotel buffet for breakfast one morning and said it was worse than the dorm food from college (thank goodness I slept in that morning).  Every hotel has a nice restaurant anchor, the Excalibur has Dick's Last Resort.  I think that says enough.

This isn't the most extravagant hotel on the strip, but it's cheap and it gets the job done.  It's usually an older, more family-oriented crowd that stays here.  The casino portion isn't much to look at, and neither are the rooms for that matter, but it has it's own kind of charm.  They have a restaurant located downstairs called "Dick's Last Resort" which I'd recommend giving a try for a few drinks and laughs.  Upstairs they have a buffet and food court, as well as a walkway that leads to the next hotel over, which is the Luxor.  They also have a tram that takes you directly to Mandalay Bay, which comes in handy during the summer heat.  Excalibur lacks the sophistication of some of the more modern hotels, but you can't really beat the price on the strip save for Circus Circus, maybe.  I'd recommend giving it a try at least once.

Enjoyed a 2 night stay last weekend, paid $139 night with my MLife card. Our room was in Tower 1, first floor (a super plus! No waiting for an elevator). The King size bed was very comfy, carpet was clean, bathroom was spotless. Buffet was decent, not enough late night places to eat. Overall it was a good stay.

We were here for one night with the family. I was a little apprehensive about staying here, but this place is perfect for a family stay. Great service, especially at the pool and in their fun dungeon arcade. We upgraded to a Tower 2 room for $20 more and our room was clean and had  recently been renovated with modern looking fixtures including a flat screen TV.  If we come back to Vegas with the kiddies we will definitely stay here again.  I knocked off one star for their buffet, nothing was really that tasty and they didn't have too many options to choose from. Excalibur is great for family vacations but would not stay here when it's just my wife and I.

I will never stay at this hotel again. The Excalibur is the worst hotel on the strip. They have horrible cell phone reception. The customer service is bad. They are very rude. The towels in the hotel smelled burnt. I woke up one morning to find cockroaches crawling over my shoes. I wish I could post pictures to this site.  I think I am a fair and reasonable person but I will not recommend this place to anyone.
It is a good place. I mean, the room is clean and I like their kids' friendly style. Everything is good though.

Great location, but our rooms overlooked a brick wall - 2nd floor, Tower 1 -- pretty depressing of a room, unable to even know if it was a sunny day as the shade from the wall literally made for gloom-doom.   Great stores, restaurants, and game room for the kids.   Location was fantastic, easy to do the strip walk to see lights,etc.  Pool was great, rooms were clean.   I dont recommend going for the cheap rate rooms as you too will stare at a brick wall the entire time, and it's worth the extra money to look at something other than that while on vacation.

6&7 July 13

DON'T STAY HERE!
Took an hour to check in. Reception desk people are less than friendly. Requested extra pillows, given a hard time.  After third phone call they said they were already delivered. Not to our room. 
Air conditioning unit was absolutely filthy and so was room. Shower head was so plugged up was difficult to rinse my hair. 
Very rundown hotel room. No Wi-Fi either. 
Stained pillow cases and sheets. 
Rugs in hallway rolled up, stained, and frankly unsafe. 
Elevators wreaked of marihuana. 
No room service??? Are you kidding me?

Stayed here 1 week with new years. The hotel...when we arrived a nice clerk lady attended us with giving us the roomkey, she gave us good information and was very friendly. Also a plus on this hotel is they dont take a deposit hold on your creditcard for using roomservice, the Phone, for the moviechannels etc if you dont wish to have this (with lots of hotels you are requiered to do this and they can hold up to 100 dollars for each night you stay there!! so 10 nights 1000 dollars) we also got a free upgrade to a what bigger room with dining area.. ok the rooms are ok.. big rooms, big beds, screentv, but the tv was really blurry..but really dated! only the bathroom shower was new which was most important for us... in general it wasnt a care for us because we werent in vegas to spend time in the room.. the cleaning personal was very nice, we didnt need a room clean but did gave a lady some tip for giving us new towals, toilet paper etc. Always friendly. also a big plus for me was that they had a gym!! this was very nice and i was there every day. also nice personal.. you got free water they would bring to you when you were excersizing and free clean towels. the pool was heated but i didnt go in because for me the weather outside was too cold although lots of people were in the pool... also a big plus they had mcdonalds and Starbucks inside the hotel! so in the morning coffee and egg mcmuffins! what i didnt like about the hotel, i didnt think personally that there was like a cozy admosfere.. the hotel for my taste was a bit too big and unpersonal, but this is personal taste.. a good but also bad point is when you want to go to your room.. you have to show your key what is good, but there were a few "guards" with bad attitutes as if they were prison guards... a blonde bigger lady screamed at me for showing my card, while i was looking for it in my purse and i didnt crossed her yet and she already has seen me before.. she was just being rude.. the price of the hotel was ok for being during the new years eve, but also not cheap, mostly because of the ridiculious high resort fees, but on the strip this is normal so... if i would go back.... no this was a one time experience, not that is was bad, but i have seen better hotels for better prices...

From the well-lit exterior, the Excalibur exudes grandeur and a campy sense of regal chutzpah. However, upon entry, one immediately notices that the air is heavy, stale, and filled with cigarettes and regret.

Following the path to the elevators through a sea of lights and sounds to distract the guests from the decaying castle, a very large sign begging visitors to enter fast food chain "Dick's Last Resort" is unavoidable. It seems a fitting metaphor to explain the reasoning for staying at the Excalibur, though the symbolism is clouded by the graffiti of "I Heart Dicks" bumper stickers and a long row of colorful frozen cocktail dispensers waiting to be poured into the yard-long containers that adorn the necks of the Hoveround drivers that crowd the walkways.

The room itself is standard, with attempts at upgrades to keep pace with the newer hotels falling flat, but still appreciated. Ideal room temperature is difficult to achieve as the wall A\/C moans and wheezes in distress, much like a Toyota Tercel attempting a steep grade in the summer. Achieving a restful night is also difficult aside from temperature fluctuations due in part to firm, dorm room-thin mattresses and the late-night battle cries of bachelorette parties reeling from the sexual arousal of the "Thunder Down Under" playing just a few floors below.

Overall, the guest experience at the Excalibur is not at all what I expected. But, taking a page out of Arthurian legend and seeing the quest for glory being marred by unexpected challenges and encounters, it's undeniable that the Excalibur lived up to its name.

Stayed here for business as the room rate as I got a special room rate through the training agency. Definitely the armpit of the strip. I ended up having to leave a night early and, as a courtesy, I let the front desk know so they could ready the room for the next guest. Go figure I got charged an early departure fee. Also the safe locked me out with my belongings inside. Only one of the room keys I received actually worked. There was no fridge in the room even though i had the higher quality "Royal Tower" Room with a beautiful view of a giant wall. And they closed half of the pool at 6pm and the other half at 7pm. Ridiculous. Will never come back.

This hotel was not worth the money we forked out to stay here. The first room they had us in was like living in a dungeon, and it smelled as bad as one too. The second room they put us in was not as bad but I still wasn't impressed. We also had to wait a long time for them to clean the new room.  The staff was not informational at all, and it was hard to get down to the main road. It was a bit dirty and grungy... Def needs a remodel.

It was my buddy's birthday and he organized a trip to Vegas for six of us. He is the guy that LOVES dive bars, so guess where he wanted to stay? Basically a strip hotel with the lowest advertised rates = Excalibur! (MGM Property). For his package, they had a $21 per night rate. I have to admit that it was much better than I expected.

Our cab driver probably put it best when we jokingly asked him on our way, if Excalibur was the best hotel in Vegas. His answer "Yes! 20 years ago" was probably accurate.

Check in went pretty fast, there are some hidden fees, not familiar to me. $20 early check-in fee (before 3pm), $18 per day resort fee (oh, didn't you read the small print?).

Rooms are dated but have nice flat screen TVs, nothing too exciting.

The bars and restaurants on-site are decent, we spent some time at Dicks Restaurant, where they specialize in rudeness as a gimmick, but wasn't that rude. The bars with video poker were good and the staff was friendly and attentive.

I hate giving bad reviews considering I was only booked for one night. BUT, one night was enough to be pretty frustrated with the whole thing. 
First when I entered the room it smelled nice, but when coming back to the room a couple hours later, it smelled like throw up. Now I know why the room was doused in air freshener. 

NEXT, as I was going to bed there was black sticky stuff in my bed. Thanks for cleaning\/changing the sheets for us. 
The next morning woke up to find out a lamp in the corner was broken and couldn't turn it on. This was the least of my worries.
When I went to go wipe my face with one of your "clean" face towels, after I had wiped my entire face with it I noticed there was lipstick all over it. COME ON! I wasn't even wearing make up!!

Disgusted, I just wanted to get out of there as fast as I could.

Did I mention that I even upgraded my room to their "new" renovated rooms? Nice renovation.

At least it was only one night, but this just killed the entire weekend for me.

We had a very nice stay at the hotel. Got a free room upgrade as well. I think if I were to give any constructive feedback I would say they need to improve their valet service as we waited for about 40 minutes before anyone moved cars so we could unload.

I am so DISGUSTED and ITCHY. I almost always stay at the Venetian when I'm in vegas but I stayed at the Excalibur because I was offered a free nights stay. I honestly didn't think much about it. Aside from being a little outdated, how bad can it be right? WRONG. 

After staying here for the night, I woke up to my left side feeling itchy and a bunch of little bumps spread around my shoulder area. At first I thought that maybe it was from the day club I was at earlier.  I thought that maybe it was something from the pool water but that is not the case. If it was from the pool water, there's no way that it's just clustered around one part of my body. If it was an allergic reaction\/rash wouldn't it be all over my legs since it was submerged in water for four hours? 

I don't know what caused this to be exact but I know it has something to do with the bed I was laying on in this hotel! Either they have a bed bug infestation or they have dirty sheets! 

Also, this hotel was ratchet AF

Let me preface this review by stating I have stayed at Excalibur many times.  Prior to this stay Excalibur was one of my favorite hotels in Las Vegas.  I have been going to Vegas for the last 15 years.  Excalibur was an easy four star review for me, but has been going downhill.  Since I didn't join Yelp! until recently, this is my first review.  So here is the rundown:

1.  When I drove in cones were everywhere.  It blocked off various areas and made everyone confused.  When I drove in the valet part of the parking lot, I was yelled at.  Already a bad impression.

2.  I went to check in at around noon.  I was told my room wasn't ready.  I was fine with this since check-in is at 3PM.  However, the person at the counter said it may not be until 4 or 5PM.  This I had an issue with since I had show tickets that night.  I asked for the manager and I complained about the first issue and this issue.  The manager totally ignored the first issue, and with the second issue she kept saying it would be at 3PM.  I said I was confused since the previous person said it may not be until 4 or 5.  Then the person who was helping me said she never said that!  So I was already disgusted.  They said they would put a rush on my room.  I said it's not necessary since I was told it would be ready by 3PM.  They did anyways, though.  The manager wasn't too friendly.  She seemed more annoyed that I had a complaint.

3.  So with our luggage in hand, I checked some of it in while we waited.  My party and I decided to go get lunch at the buffet.  Keep in mind I already saw advertisements for their buffet.  So what do we see when we talk up to it?  The buffet is closed for renovations.  I'm so glad we were told that at check-in.  Oh wait, no we weren't.  We weren't told a thing about it.  So we walked over to the Luxor instead.  The buffet was closed the entire trip.  We were able to eat at other places, but it was annoying.  They posted ads everywhere about their buffet even after I checked it.  It was on their channel on the TV, on posters, etc.

4.  Once we got our rooms and settled in, I did my usual inspection.  The AC wasn't working at all and I discovered it had not been defrosted.  So I had to take care of that in order to have a decent nights sleep in the room.  The TV didn't work right half the time either.  Sure, you don't come to Vegas to watch TV, but sometimes you need to.  The room was decent otherwise.

5.  Now for the most part I broke even when I was gambling, but there were some annoyances on the casino floor.  There were hardly any waitresses around to take drink orders.  I waited a good 10 minutes to find someone to take my order, then another 10 to get my drink.  However, there were plenty of people around to ask me if I wanted a "M Life" card or whatever their card is.  I go to Vegas about once a year, maybe once every couple years.  So I don't want the damn card.  But they didn't stop asking.  I finally blew up at one of the people and said I am tired of being asked and I wanted to be left alone.  They said it was their job. The other annoyance is that they had other people on the floor pushing show tickets and other crap.  It was the worst I have ever seen.  I went to other casinos and did not have these issues, so it could be an Excalibur thing.  However, the dealers at the tables were nice and the casino floor was clean.  A friend of mine did have someone, possibly a prostitute, hit on him when he was gambling at 4AM.  So security could be better.

I picked Excalibur since I love castles, dragons, etc.  However, I won't be staying again in the future unless I see some of these issues are resolved.  I'll visit for the shops, the wonderful Tournament of Kings show, etc.  But I felt like I received horrible treatment by the employees there.  They were more concerned about making money rather than making sure I was satisfied.

Rooms has been remodeled recently. Very nice modern upgrade. Only thing bad is that you have to pay another $8 parking everyday other than the $29 for the resort fee. So if you got the room for $59, its like paying $100 with tax. Thats how they get you to believe you are paying cheap. This parking fee applies to all mgm resorts. Dont be surprise with this. Rooms smells funny as usual but excalibur is in the middle of the strip which also an arcade underneath which is good for kids. Just dont expect much and dont compare it to ceasars palace or bellagio.

This hotel has definitely gone down!! Ive stayed here plenty of times in the past, but the past two times have been horrible (most recent was last wk)! Some of the rooms are upgraded, but some are still old. The ventilation system is poor in this hotel! My boyfriend likes to gamble here late at night, which is the only reason why I would step foot back into this hotel.

I think this is a great value hotel.  I never come here with children, but this place is filled with 'em, so if that bothers you, go elsewhere.

I have stayed here for as little as $27\/night!  

Easy access to the tram that goes to Mandalay Bay and Luxor.  Bridge walkway takes you over to MGM Grand.  There is a McDonald's if you wanna eat on the cheap, and there is Dick's Last Resort which provides an interesting and fun experience.  They also have free music\/dancing at night.  The 24 hour cafe is also pretty good, especially for the price!

I agree with another Yelper in that I am surprised that this has such bad reviews.

I really like this hotel.  Again, it's not a five star place, but it's one of the best places you can stay for the money.

I've stayed here about 4 times and I am sure that I will stay again.

It's like you took a strip mall in rural Alabama, compressed it into a building, and made that building look like a Disneyland castle. This place suffers from droves of cheap hoes in Forever21 outfits and their boyfriends in cargo shorts. 

But that's no reason to hate on it as much as people seem to. It's a cheap, kinda downtrodden hotel - you're getting what you pay for. My biggest criticism was our shower. NO WATER PRESSURE. No tub. Housekeeping also only seemed to appear once every couple days, but they were super sweet when they did. Staff was nice. Casino was aight.

You can kill yourself on all the carbs upstairs. Pizza Hut, Buca di Beppo, Cinnabon. Food generally stays open late, but if you miss it, there's a 24-hour store with a decent selection of fresh sandwiches.

Shout out to the gym facilities - clean and lots of options for working out. Pretty peaceful in terms of attendance. Thunder From Down Under, the Aussie strip show, has its residence in Excalibur, so on any given day you can work out alongside these hella nice bodies. That's either going to excite you or intimidate you ... I was intimidated. The spa facilities were also nice - it costs $10 to use the base level rooms, which include a TV lounge with fruit, NICE showers, and a sink area with lots of extra products and a hairdryer.

The pool ...... yeah. Don't know. Seems nice, but again, hoes everywhere. Basic, basic hoes. It is nice they have an "adult" pool for $10 entry - fewer people in there and a bit more peaceful. But like everywhere else in Vegas, loud music curated by a DJ.

This place compared to the rest of the strip. The rooms are basically for you to shower in and get out as quick as possible. Didn't feel that clean or anything. But hey, you come to Vegas to be out and about, not locked up in your room. It's cheap if thats what you are looking for. But the next trip, we're definitely staying elsewhere. I think the only fun spot at Excalibur is in the casino, called the party pit, where they have ladies dancing all night for your viewing pleasure.

It's been some what 11 years ago that ... I have not been to Las Vegas and 11 years later here I am!!! I'm back in Las Vegas on a three day trip!!! The Excalibur Hotel for me is one of the most nicest hotel that I have ever stayed at!!! And also the Excalibur Hotel reminds me of Disneyland!!! The things that I like most about the Excalibur is the Interesting slot machines that they have and Wonder Woman is one of them slot machine that I played!!! And the other things that I like most about The Excalibur Hotel is the food court that they have for you to eat at and also I love the shopping areas which is near by the food court!!! If your at the Excalibur Hotel shopping around go to the Welcome To Las Vegas Souvenir Store it's my most favorite place to shop at!!! I definitely would wanna come back to this beautiful castle in the near future!!!

Horrible. Horrible. Horrible. Made reservations online for a queen room with 2 beds, non- smoking. We were arriving late so already or stay was going to be short for the evening. We called and confirmed our reservations and let them know the approximate time of arrival. When we arrived it was 11:00 pm it took us 20 minutes to park, 30 minutes in line waiting to check in. So when we finally got up to the counter the lady said we have no non smoking rooms available, I said okay but that's what our reservations was for, she said ok, well the room you are paying for is a standard room I can upgrade you to a room on the first floor if thats okay and it will be normally $30 extra but we will give it to you as a courtesy? We said sure and thank you... We walked 30 minutes back to our car, moved our car closer to tower 2, brought all our belongings inside, only to find out its a smoking room, as our eyes started burning, my son said, Man mom it smells in here, I said yes, let me call the hotel, the first time no answer, the second time a clerk answered. I explained to them the situation and the front desk said yes that's the only room available with 2 beds, we can give you the king room, we said fine. She said we only have one bellmen so it's better if you come get the key yourself. We said fine, only to have to go get back in line and wait another 25 minutes. Finally, we made it to the front counter and exchanged our room keys, ended up with a room facing nothing the back of the castle, lol. AT 2:30 am, we finally got into our room. 3 of us in a bed and 2 on a air up mattress that we brought for our relatives house at our final destination, check out was at 11.....so yeah, no real sleep... lesson learned. Check in early, and just pay extra for nicer rooms elsewhere... :-( - Just adding to this after waking up, this bed is the worst, hardest bed I've ever slept in.

I hate to say it, but the magic is gone in this resort. The casino drink service (which used to be great) is horrific. The great little perks like the 24\/7 McDonalds is replaced by an expensive "breakfast fast food" restaurant, and it's basically a McDonald's! Ice machines on SEVERAL floors did not work (I told numerous staff and maintenance workers). The "24 hour" Johnny Rockets was closed when we stopped in at 5am! The casino machines are tighter, the machines we did play are gone, and the overall feel of the place is not as exciting as it had been in the past. NOW, the icing on the cake is the new PAID PARKING MGM resorts has implemented. What I used to love about Excaliber is the ability to park right outside my tower entrance. Now, I was basically forced to park in the farthest reach of the parking garage. The lot is redesigned in a manner, that it takes some serious navigation and driving to find your way in\/ out. What used to take minutes to leave the resort, now takes over half an hour! Out of frustration I did pay for valet one night. When I returned later in the evening I was TURNED AWAY and told it was full! So they basically sold my PAID Parking spot and I had to self park (again) in the farthest corner of the garage . I will not be returning to a resort I once loved, and I seriously will reconsider staying at ANY MGM resort I the future. This is a review I never thought I'd have to update, but after talking and listening to many other hotel guests, i feel I am not alone in my experience.

I haven't stayed here since I was a child. I usually stay in Palms Place and Mandalay so this is a major downgrade from what I am used to.  I'm in a "renovated" room.  Still feels really old and claustrophobic.  Staying here because I have a friend who is also staying here and we wanted to be in the same hotel together.  Would never stay here otherwise.  This place is a landmark of Vegas but it needs some major improvements.  I feel itchy just sitting in the room.  I'm hoping there aren't any bedbugs.  I am in a non smoking room but it still smells old and musty.  I have a view of the Mandalay from my room and I'm staring at it wishing I was there.  Will never stay here nor recommend it unless you want  a dirt cheap hotel.  If I'm on vacation in Vegas, I want to feel like I'm in Vegas.

We're prejudiced.  We got married here and so we love the place!  We always visit when we are in town, but we don't really eat there....and we don't stay there.....we just usually try to play video poker.  Oh and now they have the Paradise Fishing game!  So much fun!
Nice theme, but only went there to eat, play arcade games, etc. back in the (19)80s and (19)90s. ;)

We stayed at the Excalibur last week, thinking it would be fun for our 5 year old.  He was excited, thinking that we were staying in a castle. The hotel and rooms were decent and it had some good restaurants, but the idea that it is a family friendly hotel fell short.  The pool closed at 7 pm (the water slide at 6pm).  What a better way to spend family time but in the pool, and a little later when the sun isn't blazing down. The pool hours really need to be extended.  You should also be able to use the jacuzzi's in the evening.  We were also disappointed on the game floor (dungeon).  It didn't open until 10:30 am, and even then, none of the carnival games were attended. The only option was video games. My son was really disappointed, as we planned to spend some time there before heading home on our last day.  It was also extremely annoying to be stopped 5 or 6 times anytime you walked through the hotel, by the people trying to sell you dinner packages and other entertainment tickets.  They don't take no for an answer. It was not a pleasant experience and this actually made it kind of stressful to walk through the hotel. Also, my son was injured on one of the doors going into the hotel.  His toe got stuck under the bottom, and it sliced his toe. It was gushing blood and he was screaming.  There were several hotel employees standing nearby and no one offered any sort of assistance.

if at all possible, stay away from here.

honestly, the rooms aren't really that bad but the ones we were in were outdated and kind of nasty. the shower head was weak and during the winter you want to take a warm shower, but it came out with cold to lukewarm water. the carpet is also kind of dirty, you can tell they dont vacuum too much because there are crumbs here and there and sunflower seeds. and the smell of smoke is all over the casino floor. other hotels have  better ventilation systems.

DON'T SAY I TOLD YOU SO! I KNOW... I KNOW.... I SHOULD'VE SEEN THIS COMING.

For less than 80 bucks a night... I should've known it was going to be bad. But at the time when I was booking the room it seemed good. The price wasn't bad at all. When I arrived, I had to walk through a huge cloud of smoke just to check in. Excalibur is by far the most populated hotel with SMOKERS.

 WARNING: Parents, don't take your kids here. You want  them to live a long and healthy life.

The room was just OKAY. =\/ It was standard, i guess.. All i needed to just get through the night. Good thing it wasn't a rat hole. It was decent. It's not like I would've been staying in the room throughout my whole vacation.

If you just need a place to crash when you're in Vegas doing your thing, then this is good. You get a decent room with a bed and a bathroom (which, if you think about it, that's all you need), then pick this. Well.. That is if you're ok with people smoking 24\/7. If you are more on the luxurious side, I'm sorry. You're gonna have to cough up a few more bucks and its not gonna be here.

Excalibur gave me the best 21st birthday party ever (week of October 17th) There was always something new to do.  Easy for a group of 3-5 people to stick together and not get separated. Great rewards program, and easy access to the rest of the Strip.  I seriously fell in love with Vegas at this hotel.  I can't wait to come back.

My daughter and I stayed here 11\/4-11\/7, and we Had a great time at the Excalibur.  We arrived around 2:30pm, & Check in was fine, I'm an Mlife Pearl member , so I utilized that check in line,but the regular line was not long at all. We had a Resort Tower room, on the 24th fl, overlooking the pool, part of the city, & red mountains. The room was fine, clean linens, clean towels, comfortable queen size beds\/pillows. No smoke smells. Basically,what we expected for the price (Pd $255 for 3nights, this includes the resort fees per night, we booked our stay 2mo. In advance). We shopped, gambled, drank and ate there. The casino floor is smoky, but so is every other casino floor we visited.  We walked quite a bit, as Excalibur is at the end of the strip, but the weather was perfect so the walk to each casino was great.  Try Cocco's for breakfast; it was great ( the best hash browns). It's about a ten minute walk away (on Tropicana blvd). Anyway, if ur looking for an inexpensive, clean, no frills room, check out Excalibur..
what a creepy little shit hole. LOL it needs to be remodeled. This is where all the weirdos hang out.
