I Love this Hotel! Our View was Amazing. The rooms where really clean. Me & my Fianc also really enjoyed playing Craps here. The Vibe was great. & we took home a lot of Money! Where defitnetly going back to Vegas & Excalibur is our Hotel Reasonable Price & worth the stay..

Two stars at best. The toilet ran all night ( very loud). Two trips to the front desk, and no results. The rooms were only cleaned  1\/2 way. The towels were clean but the beds were horrible! They were caved in and hard as a rock. The air conditioning struggled to keep the room cool when it was only 80 outside. The room also had a very strong mildew smell. 

I found that most ( not all) of the staff seemed to by annoyed by any question you ask them. 

The buffet was a joke. The food was decent, but the server was horrible. At 9am he was pushing two shots of Tequila. I found it it funny. However, he never cleared any plates from my table, never checked on me after refusing tequila, and asked for a bigger tip as I walked away ( I tipped $3). 

I have never seen so many guys walk through a casino shirtless in my life.  No security intervention. 

I was really looking forward to this visit. Now I can't wait to leave and find another hotel. 

Management 1 star
Cleanliness   1.5 stars
Security         2 stars
Customer service 2 stars. 

I am very disappointed. I have 30 min until checkout and nobody has called or come by to check the problems we addressed 24 hours ago. Management, here is an opportunity to make things right.

My sister and I have never been to Vegas so we decided to take the trip together and make a long weekend of it.  She booked our room at the Excalibur Hotel and if we ever come back to Vegas we would most likely pick another hotel.  Not that the Excalibur was bad, the price was right and they are located conveniently at the end of the strip across from New York, NY and the MGM Grand.  They gave us a free upgrade to the newer remodeled tower two with a great view of the pool for free just for asking (thank you yelp tips).  I just think overall I would want to stay in a newer hotel that had more to offer like better rooms, pools and restaurants\/bars. Still it's really not a bad choice if you just want a cheap, safe and clean hotel room on the strip with a decent pool area. 

The room that we had was really nice and very big.  The shower and bathroom were huge!  If you are in tower 1 the rooms are older and smaller.  One of the best things about staying in tower 2 other than the updated rooms is the fact that the elevator exits out right to the pool.  All we had to do was go downstairs and walk through a door and we were right there.  

They also have a couple restaurants but nothing upscale and they have the Thunder from Down Under Australian strip show.  Otherwise the hotel was underwhelming.  Great I think if you have kids its seemed the hotel catered to families more than lets say Hard Rock would.

I was here for four days and I have to say, this is a great location if you want to stay on the strip. My stay in Excalibur wasn't really all that bad, the check in was prompt and easy, the room I got was adequate and the service was great. it was good enough for me since I wasn't planning to spend half my time in my room anyway. The parking was kind of hard to find, but my one true gripe would be the pools. So greasy and nasty. Other than that, it's a great hotel to stay in if you want something nice but inexpensive.

Was gibt es dazu zu sagen ....ich sage mal 2 Nchte im Excalibur sind mehr als genug ....auen Hui und innen Pfui ....Das von auen als Mrchen anmutende Hotel , erffnet sich im inneren als sehr stark gealtertes Hotel ....die Zimmer sind in einem desolaten Zustand der selbst den 80er Jahren nicht gerecht wird ....alte Bilder und alte Sthle werden sie erwarten ....im Bad schon die Fliesen gesprungen und der Duschkopf wrde in jedem Museum im besseren Licht erstrahlen ....schmutzig und kaputt ...ber die Sauberkeit getraue ich mich nicht gar nicht zu uern ...ich bin nicht pingelig als alter Bundeswehr Veteran ....aber das geht gar nicht !!
Dazu gibt es noch einen wunderschnen und sen Marihuana Geruch auf dem Flur ....vielleicht erleichtert es die Anwesenheit hier mehr ....ich komme nie wieder !!!!

Never stayed at the hotel, but has been to the midway fantasy faire. I used to enjoy circus circus midway more, but now I like excalibur more. Do you want to know why?
1. The worker there saw that I ran out of tickets and went to get some right away, while theres barely any workers there that help you with anything!.
2. The prizes were not impossible to obtain.
3.Theres a nice looking fountain in he middle.
4. They have that one shooting zombies game I really like.
5. They had the game where you put a quarter in and the arm moves to try to make the prize fall down, but it was out of order..that is my favorite game, circus circus doesn't have that game anymore either. :(But at least they have it at excalibur, its just out of order.
6.Claw machines have better prizes.
7. theres this nice lady that works there that pointed out there's 10 tickets hanging out of the machine, and gave it to me. :)
I will probably go back just to see if that lady is still working there!!
Compared to the mean workers at Circus Circus..:(

Although the rates are good, I just spent three nights there.  Bottom line - you have a lot of other choices - choose somewhere else to stay.  The people are nice but the bed was like sleeping on a hardwood floor, (and no you don't spend much time in the hotel sleeping in Vegas when you get such bad sleep, it's hard to get up and stay up when you have a sore back), carpets were old and the room was not clean.  None of the express check out machines worked and there was an inch of dust on them (take them away if you aren't going to fix them).  Spend a little more and get a decent room somewhere else!

Pretty fun themed casino like out of Camelot, but with all the modern amenities. This I would say is one of the easier hotels to get lost in though as far as Vegas goes. Unlike many other hotels in Vegas though, I'm not a fan of many of their dining options. The Beware of the "body snatchers" prevalent at this property who REALLY press you for the time share sell. While dated, it's still a fun place to kill a few hours.

Cheap yes. 

OLD, BASIC, lots of cosmetic blemishes. NO COFFEE OR FRIDGE!! but clean. 

Made the mistake of not eating at all the hotels I was at thinking I would eat when I got back to the Excalibur. NO FOOD After 12am. ONLY McD's... Room service took 1hr 15mins!!! 

JACUZZI ROOM, not worth it. it barely works takes 40 mins to fill and the jets don't do much. WAS CLEAN! 

There is a small window to look out on the strip. but mine was dirty on the outside. 

For the price it puts you on the strip.

Terrible. Checked into room. Beds weren't made, blankets and comforters were tossed on the side table, there was a bag of trash sitting in our room and the bathroom had towels strewn about and the water in the sink was still running over an ice bucket left in the sink. With as much as I paid I also expected a fridge but I would've settled for a room without trash everywhere.

The room had hair all over it. I mean hair from the nether regions of the previous occupants or something. It was even an upgraded room.  The sink had hair and chucks of some mystery matter in it. 

The floor had chips on it and the sheets also had stains.

The bed was nice, although I was afraid to sleep in it, considering the things that I could see already, what lay beneath?

Too many kids running up and down the halls, reminded me of my childhood, living in low-cost housing..

I complained (to a cute clerk-that was a nice surprise) and he quickly apologized, and checked me out (double entendre).

From there I went to Krispy Kreme and mooched some free wifi from them (since all the EX has is wired internet)..and booked a room in the Mandalay Bay. Go there instead.

In general, our stay here was not bad, but it wasn't great either.  We spent the night in Vegas on our way to Disneyland, and thought we'd stay on the strip to hit a buffet or see an attraction or two.  This was the hotel that we chose online, mostly due to its proximity and cheap price.  So the hotel was not bad.  It was fairly clean, but lacking in common attributes such as in-room coffee, fridge, etc.  The bed was ok for me, but uncomfortable for my wife.  We "upgraded" to a king-bed-room, and because of that we were honored with the privileged view of an industrial sized air-conditioning unit outside our window.  Now I know this is Vegas, and to be honest, this really isn't my scene.  But still, this hotel makes no attempt to even present a clean appearance or be anything special.  When we left the hotel to walk on the strip, there was vomit on the sidewalk two steps outside the hotel door.  There was somebody passed out in the bushes at the hotel.  The presence of smoke in the casino and shop areas was very strong compared to other places we went.  So yeah, not that great, but what do you expect from a bargain place in Vegas?  If we ever come through Vegas again, I think we would either step up to a nicer place, or more likely stay at a more "regular" travelers hotel someplace away from the strip.

Pro's
-The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. 
-The bathroom was super nice, the vanity was huge. The shower was also surprisingly nice.


Con's
-The room didn't have a mini fridge. I can't remember the last hotel room I stayed in that didn't have a mini fridge.

-I called guest services to get connected to a shuttle service. It took me 3 tries and almost 45 minutes to complete this task because no one would pick up at guest services.

-I'm pretty sure they were shooting for the retro feel with the decor....but because of the way the walls were painted and the carpet, the room instead made me feel like I was staying the night at my grandma's house, the only thing that was missing was the couch wrapped in plastic.

-I was not a fan of the dodgy looking bath mat they had to put down.

That being said, if you are going to be in Las Vegas, I doubt you will be spending that much time in your room (I know I didn't). This is the cheapest place on the strip that you can stay and was clean and safe. It got the job done.

I understand the concept of Excalibur...At one time, Circus Circus built up that side of the strip with three themes: Pan Asian upscale(Mandalay), Egyptian(Luxor) or Medievel, which brings us to our current review

Now that it is part of the MGM, which owns almost everything on the strip, Excalibur is now the value destination in MGMs far flung empire.  As such, rooms are now $70, so certain expectations must be tempered

On the plus side, the rooms are a relative bargain. The location is somewhat central and the exercise room is actually good with plenty of treadmills and weights..surprising

On the minus side, the physical plant has been treated like the proverbial damsel in distress.  The elevators are slow.  The hot water seems tepid in bathroom  The staff seems to be in need of motivation...They need to reinvest..yes I am aware of the renovation...now finish the job

At the same time, MGM has its hands full with billions in debt from City Center so it doesnt seem likely...and in their partial defense:  What do you want for $70?
This Hotel\/ Casino is dated but an Icon of he Las Vegas strip.

You need to pay for parking now $5 1-4 hours or $8 4-24 hours. That was a not pleasant surprise for  us because we were driving to get to Las Vegas and last time we stayed in Excalibur there was no parking fee. In general, rooms are nice and clean. The front desk staff is very friendly and tries to satisfy you as much as they can. Location is good and worked for us very well because we like to go to hard rock pool, but if u wanna gamble and party in Wynn and hotels near it u should take     a cab because it's a long walk.

Stayed here during Labor Day Weekend 2011.  This hotel was the cheapest vacation package I could get for this popular holiday weekend through Orbitz.  Not the caliber of hotel I tend to gravitate, however for a quick Vegas romp, this did the trick.  Actually, the "twenty dollar sandwich" did the trick and made all the difference:  http:\/\/www.thetwentydollartrick.com\/

My package came with a standard room.  After researching the Internet, the consensus was that Tower 1 rooms were sh*t and I needed to get upgraded.  So I discreetly inserted a folded twenty between my state ID and credit card when asked for identification at registration.  I asked if I could be upgraded and the receptionist acquiesced and placed me in a non-smoking Tower 2 Widescreen Room  with two Queen beds and updated decor.  Despite the somewhat uncleanliness of the bathroom, it suited my needs and the comfy beds helped me get some needed rest between my exploratory treks during the insanely hot days.  The air conditioner worked like a breeze and maintained a comfortable 74 degrees always.

Including the stellar receptionist that upgraded me (well, motivated by money), the staff throughout remained helpful and pleasant.  The theme and general casino was tacky (as was many of the clientele), but suited those that tend to enjoy the 90's Vegas theme vibe or those who rather spend their money at the casino rather than on a glitzy hotel room.

#Yelp 365:  038\/365

The pool was fun! The room was spacious and there was nothing wrong. BUT when I went to shower the drain was clogged! I asked guest services to come up 2 different nights and nobody ever came. I even checked to make sure the do not disturb sign wasn't hanging on the door. It wasn't and I had to shower with water at my feet ankle high. Ew!

Gross me and my gf went here for route 91 and revised when we woke up we slept in bloody sheets from whoever was there before us.   Don't go here spend the extra money and stay somewhere else.   Oh and the buffet was horrible and you will end up on the toilet.......

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!!  If I could give this hotel negative stars I would!!! This was the worst experience I have ever had at any place I've ever stayed, let alone in the city of wanting to keep you coming back. I booked two rooms one king and one with two twins for my sisters cheer comp this past weekend. We got in Thursday and stayed until Monday. I booked deluxe view rooms on my MLife and they were anything but a view. Unless your version of a view is waking up at 7 am in Vegas due to power drilling a pool, and your view is an empty pool full of noise. After waking up the second day (Saturday) I decided I had had enough and went downstairs and asked to speak to a manager the manager DENISE was working on something so the Luxor manager helped me and  they said that they would be working on the pool every day of our stay!!! WOULD HAVE BEEN GREAT TO KNOW THAT WHEN WE CHECKED IN!!! so I stayed that was completely unreasonable and what could they do my sister needed good rest for competition, they said no later than 12 we'd be moved. (I went down at 8:45 am) and that they'd take some off the price for that night. I stayed we had to be moved by noon due to her competitions and needing to get ready. By 12:15 we still didn't have a room so again went there and tried to figure out why... Spoke with Denise again and she had a paper slip sitting at her comp saying oh yes I know I have something saved let me check... So they checked and sure enough the rooms weren't ready yet (needed to be cleaned) so I said how long she said I'm rushing them shouldn't be more than a few minutes we will call up to your room as soon as they are ready... At 3:30 I finally called the front desk and asked to speak with a manager.. The rudest person I have ever spoken to in customer service to that day (worse will come after) she said she had no idea any of this was even happening not did she hear anything about us she then said that I only had 3 options because she didn't know anything about it this is all she could do (mind you she was the manager of the hotel for the day) 1. I could be downgraded and have no king bed (still paying the same) 2. I could wait for the room that still wasn't clean (from 8:45 am) and I could move into one of the rooms and move again once the second was ready 3. Or I could have a refund for ONLY the nights I hasn't stayed and we could leave. So we ended up moving to one room while the other got cleaned. At about 4 we got to get into another room. Survived the next two days until we got to check out. By booking through my MLife I had a review of my bill it was not what I was told I was being charged not is what I was charged so went to the front desk was again told that they fixed it and I would only be charged 275 then looked at the statement and was actually charged almost 100 more for both rooms went back to the hotel and they said no only 275 was charged according to them rechecked their math with the bill they printed and the price that was deducted from my account was actually charged. So I called guest services and she said despite the fact that 3 people told me I would be charged 275 for the whole that didn't include a deposit we had already paid so in total we paid 50 more than we were told. Despite talking to someone in guest services I was told by the person that I had to call back between 5am and 2pm tomorrow and speak with Denise because she didn't know anything even though she read the notes to me and we added it up she claimed it might have been a communication error and that she couldn't do anything. Needless to stay my card has still been charged 100+ more than I was supposed to be charged and I still have to call back tomorrow and I will never be staying here and I will tell everyone I know to never stay here! Horrible horrible horrible.

Here is the deal with The Excalibur ( like King Arthur would say it). I went to this place the first weekend it opened up in 1990. I was 12 and thought it was the greatest. I have since been as an adult. And you know what? It is still ok in my book. When you go to Vegas you are not going for the room. You are going for the booze, hos, and craps. Most of the rooms have been updated and are nice enough for what they are. The gambling can be dirt cheap on the right day and time. Booze, well you should bring your own so you aren't doling out money for it when you could be using said money to throw dice. Hos. They are not top notch here, as the crowd the Excalibur attracts is more likely to watch NASCAR then the E! channel. Wait I have stayed here. HMMM. Go somewhere else and find hos and bring them back here. It works. 

Bottom line: The Excalibur doesn't try to pretend to be this new fancy schmancy hotel and rip you on the room price. The casino floor has a lower ceiling and the smoke can be stifling. But there is a 24 hour Krispy Kreme where the donuts are fresh at 4am. 

3 stars for the hotel, .5 stars for the Krispy Kreme, and .5 stars for the fellatio you can get back at the room = 4 stars

Was at the Excalibur for Memorial day weekend (5 days total). Check in easy enough, however we were told we were getting a free upgrade! Lol carpet stained, smelled bad, beds were hard as rocks! Could have sworn it was a box spring. Sheets and pillows were filthy stained as well as the towels.  View was of the roof. Staff still enters room with privacy tag up to change linens with more stained linens. And no wi-fi had to hit up starbucks to get a signal. Who doesn't have wi-fi? Everywhere else had wi-fi.

    Leavin tower every day we were harassed by people trying to sell time shares and dicount show tickets that were crap. (They say free but they are not.) Big scam. Every day it was same people and same pitch. Unrelenting

     We did breakfast buffet,  unimpressive. And way overpriced. Had upset stomach the entire day after eating that food. It was all bland. Would have been better off eating mcdonalds every day. 
    
     Gambling in Excalibur cocktail waitresses we're non existent,  but when you got one they were abrasive and by comparison of the other casinos very old and unattractive and rude to match. 

     The large pool was closed all but one day! But they kept the adult pool that you have to pay $10+ to get into open with 3 patrons (4 lifeguards). I would say bad idea. Drinks were super expensive bring at least $40 cash with you to drink at the pool. 

     I will probably never stay at the Excalibur again it is out dated and under staffed to keep up on the hotel and casino. This will contribute to further deterioration of the casino. (Resort fee?) Ha what resort? Small uprade to motel 6 but with a casino inside.

I stayed at this hotel after they remodeled it last year. The lady at the front desk was very nice. My room was beautiful and clean. I only wish that they had microwaves in the rooms. For the amount of money i spent for the night,  I feel that a microwave would have been appropriate. I enjoyed my stay here, but the only way I'd come back is if I had no intention on reheating any of my food.

Don't stay here unless you really have to. There is no internet wifi in the rooms, they give you a short jack to put into the side of your computer... too bad I only had my ipad. Not to mention that the TV channels suck. I would't complain about that if they just had some stinking wifi! I mean why make me pay resort fees for such a shitty hotel? Last but not least, there was a bug in my room my last day I stayed and never been back since. Save some extra cash and go elsewhere.

We stayed at Excalibur during a convention.  It is a cheap hotel.  4 nights $277 plus $80 for resort fees- in the heat of summer.  You get what you pay for.  The staff is polite.  We did have 2 people at the Business Center desk who went above and beyond to help us.  Check in was fast but not very friendly, just polite.  The people at the doors selling tickets to shows are aggressive!  We learned to just say "Conference" and they left us alone.

The hotel itself is a bit run down and needs a remodel, but everything works.  The water pressure on the 14th floor is not great and the toilet looks like it is going to overflow every flush.  The AC worked really well and yes, it was a little noisy, but that was a plus in drowning out the traffic.

The pools were nice and there is a bar\/restaurant there.  There were 3 pools and lots of children.  It was not super busy, so we had no problem getting chairs.  But the pools close early

Location is okay, depending on what you want to do.  If you are here for a convention at the Las Vegas Convention Center, stay somewhere else.  There is a free tram between Luxor-Excalibur-Mandalay Bay.  It is an easy walk to New York New York.

Wireless is in the public areas but in the room, its wired.  That means a slower connection and you must have a laptop to plug in.  It has the modem plug.

The buffet is okay= $23.  If you have the energy, I would suggest going over to the Luxor buffet  It is much better.  The buffet is over at 10pm.  You can eat on the cheap at the fast food restaurants- McDonald's, Pick Up Stix; Hot Dog on a Stick; Pizza Hut; Baja Fresh and a couple of others.  Johnny Rockets is also here.

It was worth it to me to use the free valet service.  For a few bucks- your car gets parked in the shade and is brought back to you.  Love it!

The hubby and I spent 3 nights for valentines. The hotel is really nice, we got a king size bed and wow the bed and pillows were really soft, the bathroom is big with a big shower enough for two people. The room comes with a 50 inch flat screen. The employees were really nice especially the housekeeping. The casino is big with lots of slot machines. We had a really great stay at the Excalibur and we will definitely stay there again.

Fabulous! Super affordable, and just enough. Stayed here for a Friday and Saturday night - and had a great time! The Excalibur was clean, service was fast when I requested extra blankets\/pillows\/towels, and we partied LOUDLY in our room with no complaints!

It's a little farther from the main part of the strip, but everything's pretty much a walk away anyhow. 

If I'm looking for a good deal next time, I won't mind looking into Excalibur again.

Decent food selection, including Buca Di Beppo, Johnny Rockets, and mediocre buffet.

No coffee maker or fridge - major disadvantage for extended trips.

I reserved a smoking room, but was told at check in that "reserving a smoking room does not guarantee a smoking room".  Leaving my room to ride an elevator to smoke was a nuisance, but so is packing up and changing rooms (which in their defense I did not have the time this trip to attempt).

The room I was placed in was adjoined to another by a locked door.. This would not have been an issue if not for the complete lack of sound dampening.  I do not have the greatest hearing, but everything in the room next to me was audible - I could literally hear someone unzip their luggage in the neighboring room.

Room was cleaned well every day, so +1 to the cleaning staff.

Being a common Vegas traveller, I would rate Excalibur about in the middle of quality\/service for the area\/price.

The rooms were typical, the outside makes it look like it belongs in a Disney movie, and the drink girls could be a little younger.

However, I love the dealers here, they talked a lot more than dealers at other casinos and seemed a lot friendlier. The dealers are what made the casino for me.

So i decided to upgrade to the royal package. With a huge tub! When i walked in, a weird smell came from the Bathroom. The tub was very cozy! And the view was amazing! They don't provide a fridge unless you ask! They dont offer! 25 dollars extra. ( not sure if it's per night). There is no coffee maker! I like my coffee in the morning! The shower was big. I liked it. Except no shelf to put your soaps and stuff except on the floor of the shower. Gross! The blanket was very warm! Thin yet warm and cozy. I went to use the Outlet to charge my phone. It didn't work. So i unplugged the clock to use that plug. I also went to use the iron. That didn't turn on.  Considering that i paid 200 a night. Everything should have been perfect from the beginning. I wanted my money i spent to upgrade from regular room to royal package back.  They didn't. They said they have a maintenance guy to fix some of those things. I didn't have time to call. I was gone all 3 days just about. He looked at me like i was lying. Honestly i give this a C in my book. I won't stay there again. At least not anytime soon. Oh and Don't forget...bring your own coffee maker!

The updated tower is great with comfy beds, a flat screen tv and nice bathrooms at an unbeatable price.  The casino is tacky and old but I kind of like that.  The location is perfect.  The redone pool is nice.  The staff are usually unfriendly in general and we had a huge mess at checkout with my overcharged credit card that they NEVER fixed nor returned a phone call for and I had to do a charge back through my bank.

This is based on my gaming experience only...I did not stay at the hotel...My fiance and I went in to gamble at the casino...first we noticed the casino seemed dingy with the old carpet....I sat down to play blackjack and tried to use my players club card ( which I had been using all day at Mandalay Bay and the Luxor)  to play $10 a hand blackjack.  Their pit boss came over and said "you cant use the players club card unless you play $15 a hand blackjack"  And he wasnt nice when he said it.  That turned me off since it had been honored and I was given credit at the other casinos and this place didnt seem as nice as the other two.  Later as we were walking through I noticed an EMS crew had come in with their stretcher.  Being a medic myself it perked my interest and I watched from at least 50 feet away.  Next thing I knew I had a security guard in front of me telling me I had to move on.  I was not interfering from my vantage point and could have easily sat down at a slot machine just several feet away and im sure nothing would have been said.  It just left a bad taste in my mouth and I care never to go there again....

Very disappointed with this hotel, will never stay at a MGM resort again. No matter if you are a guest paying you still have to pay for parking. They lie to you about what you room will be over the phone and then change it when you check in. The casino itself is nice but to manu issues with parking and checking in

Ugh so frustrated. My Fiancee and I stayed here the night before our wedding. Had the MLife rewards checked in and the lady at the desk seemed very upset to have to check us in to the hotel. I said there were 2 of us. She didnt ask if I wanted to add anyone on to the room. This would have helped as the next morning while im with my maid of honor at her hotel his key didnt work and he couldnt get back into the room. The front counter person was not helpful and Thank God his best man was in the room at the time or he would not have gotten back in. They made no attempts to contact me from the desk or understand that this was our wedding day and try to make it less stressful as he was carrying our wedding cake back to the hotel room. Just a general lack of service. To top it off got a Sorry for the lack of service email. I responded and have not recieved anything back. The sorry email stated that we pride ourselves on Exemplary Resort Experience. Well in my book this is not anywhere close to that. The food was no better than "Hometown Buffett and for the price feel like we got taken on all accounts. Completly Not Satisfied.

I was honestly upset the moment we walked in. We booked our stay over a month in advance from hotels.com. it was just my husband and I. We left the kids with my mom for a romantic getaway. The front desk guy informs us we get a room with two Queens  (that honestly were doubles we have a queen at home and these beds were smaller.) There was gum on the floor from the previous person and dust was hanging from the fire sprinklers. I will say I like the location and the tiny beds were at least very comfortable. I do like Dick's and their drink choices. I haven't decided if I'll stay here again. Honestly the bed thing made me mad!

Old smelly hotel, they are in serious need of an update. Come on Excalibur it's 2017!

Won some money playing black jack and now I might have lung cancer. 

Great little arcade downstairs though.

As a kid that grew up in Las Vegas the Excalibur has always been around.  My father helped open the Hotel and I've had several family members work there in years' past.  I've gotten a chance to eat at almost every restaurant they've put inside that place at one time or another.

Hell, I practically spent a good portion of my childhood in the Fantasy Fair downstairs LOL.  Anyway as time moves along things change.  Obviously, anyone that has been and reviewed the Excalibur has stated the obvious; the hotel & casino are dated.  The rooms aren't modern or sophisticated, the table games and slots are old and cheap.  The restaurants are all three star or below, with the exception of Sir Galahad's, which is now referred to as "Pub" and Prime Rib... classy.

Excalibur is good, cheap, three-star fun and entertainment.  I'm not sure how long this "seasoned" hotel will last in the new world of Vegas, but if you have a chance stop by and enjoy an old favorite of mine.

Yea..... I have not been to Excalibur since I was a kid and will probably be awhile until I visit again.

Excalibur was definitely one of the best as a kid.  To kids, medieval anything was cool (at least to me haha).  Knights, dragons, princesses, and wizards are all images I conjure up when I think of Excalibur.

However, stayed here with a group of friends recently and man... the magic of this place is gone.  The water "moat" at the front is dry now.  It definitely shows its age and the crowd... is less family and more... odd.  With cheap prices, Excalibur now attracts the weird.. odd crowds and there's a lot of them.  Perfect example being this old dude with super long hair just spitting on to the carpet on the casino floor.  Nasty.  The whole place just feels... dirty.

The midway games are still there but price has gone up per play so Circus Circus is still the best. 
 
As for the rooms... old old old.  TV still the old school tubes, dark lighting, and beds creaks.  They were better than the low end hotels on the strip but it's due for a change.  In fact, the whole room needs to be spiffed up a bit, but I can understand why Excalibur\/MGM would not care since now Excalibur markets toward to cost-conscious crowd.

If I decided to go on a spontaneous one day trip to LV, then maybe I'll think of Excalibur.

This place has really gone downhill since I last stayed here. The safe in the room did not work. They only provided three bath towels. The room looked dim and dingy.  It does not feel clean at all. Will not stay here again.  The resort fee is a joke.  I thought we were going to have free Wi-Fi, bathrobes, And a newspaper in the morning. Nope! You can't even pay for Wi-Fi in the rooms.

I didn't even stay here. I just walked through it and got the worst case of the creeps I have ever experienced. 3 words. Drunken. Old. Gamblers. Not pretty. Actually it is extremely depressing. Remind me to never walk through there again! Couldn't WAIT to get back to my hotel after this! (p.s. stay at the four seasons)

I dont know why so many people trash this Hotel, of course its not fancy but its ok, and also in a great location, just dont eat there,, the food is bad... and dont stay there is you dont like kids, I find the whole theme lame, but its not one of the worst hotels on the strip, if you find a good deal then stay there... 
One cool thing is the Tournament of Kings show, its about $50 per person, but you get to have dinner (consisting of soup, bread, chicken and pepsi... dont remember if im leaving something out, sorry..., you can have alcohol but its $$extra$$) and you get no fork or spoon, eat with your hands baby! you get to cheer on whatevers character zone you are sitting in, they all fight and its a good time...

The price is good and the locations is great. Very central. Check in took a long time. We have a regular double queen room. The bed is awful. It's like sleeping on cardboard. I barely slept and had to find a patch on the very edge of the mattress that didn't hurt to lay on. A friend is staying in one of he upgraded rooms and said he couldnt sleep at all for the same reason. I can deal with older hotels with few amenities (no coffee maker, fridge, iron, glasses, etc) but I at least need to sleep ok. Worst experience. I'm too tired to really function at the conference I'm attending.

This isn't a bad place to stay but the employees could work on their communication. For example, I had someone walk in on my while I was getting out of the shower. I paid for the early check in, so either it was an employee who had not been notified of my check in or it was a customer who had been double booked. Other than that, great customer service downstairs!

This is not a good hotel.  It's cheap, which is probably its only allure.  Here's what I didn't like:

The air conditioning in our room was so loud that it sounded like someone was vacuuming in the room every time it turned on.  Woke us up all night.

My bath towel smelled like smoke.  We are non-smokers.  I know, in Vegas, people smoke.  But, it would be nice if they would launder the towels to not smell like smoke.

The window shade had holes in it.  One bedsheet was torn.  Another had a cigarette burn in it.

The shower was low-pressure and the spray pattern was poor.

Only one bar of soap in the bathroom and the body wash was terrible.

An HDTV showing all standard def and very limited channel choices.

Loud neighbors and drunk people.  As soon as we got to our room a drunk guy kept pestering us for directions to the room he was looking for.  We had to repeat the directions several times.  We were tired and trying to just get into our room.  Then, that night people hollered down the hall, whooping and carrying on, at 3 a.m.  Then, proceeded to retch and groan for the next half an hour.

I have stayed in some nice hotels.  I am not comparing this budget hotel to those.  I am comparing it to similar places like the La Quinta Inn or Holiday Inn.  This is not a good hotel.  Honestly, you can pay about the same or maybe a little more and get a much nicer stay.  I suggest you do.

I must say this place is pretty nice for the price we paid! We went to the Tournaments of the Kingdom show, well since we got the tickets for free. Worth the money to watch I must say if you can get them half the price. During the show, they did not provide any eating utensils. Basically, they wanna create that medieval style of eating with bare hands. The show is good but the food is just so-so. OK back to the hotel. It has a tram you can ride for free to Mandalay Bay and Luxor. So, it's a plus if you wanna go casino hopping, coming back from the hotel drunk or just trying avoid the hot weather. They have 3 pools, 2 hot tubs and also spa service too. The room and bathroom are very clean and it also has a widescreen tv, which is awesome! They also cleaned our room daily, changed the towels, provided new shampoo and soap and made the bed. On the day after we checked out, we have a lot of spare time to kill before our flight but it's inconvenient to walk around with the luggage with us. Guess what, they provide locker for free! Overall, I'm very happy with the stay in Excalibur....

To put it bluntly, I wasn't expecting much so it could have been a lot worse but  I was still left with a strong desire to never, ever stay here again as long as I can help it. 

Yes, it is one of the cheaper hotels on the strip and you could certainly do a lot worse, but I had no idea that this place had gone downhill this bad. Most of the character has been stripped out of the decor and theme, so all you're left with is a dirty feeling everytime you walk into the place. I know this place is now 21 years old so it's seen better days, but other Vegas hotels are as old or older and still look fairly new. MGM either needs to step-up the renovations or demolish and start-over.

In the casino, the smoke is awful and the deodorizer they use to try to minimize it just makes things worse. Better ventilation is definitely needed in this place. 

The hotel room was decent enough, we were "upgraded" to a Widescreen Room in Tower II which is apparently "recently renovated." Some of the decor looked fairly old, but the room was clean enough for the most part I guess. Wired High-speed internet (which is part of their now mandatory $12.50\/night resort fee) worked well, although I would have preferred some sort of Wi-Fi. 

Best part of staying at the Excalibur is that you can look out the window and see all of the much better hotels you could be staying at, what a treat! Next time we'll book something on the north end of the strip, which is much closer to where the action is. 

Avoid Excalibur if you can help it, as I'm sure you could find something better and not necessarily break the bank.

The price for rooms just does not at all reflect the run-down rooms, casino, pool area and amenities in general. The gal at check in was less than a pleasure to welcome us for our stay. Staying at the hotel did not give us really any benefit for any of the hotel offerings. A stupid coupon book that didn't have much savings was what we received. So we booked on groupon where it said we get a $20 dining voucher. I booked here vs. priceline and what an idiot I was. The total price on priceline included the resort fee, groupon's did not, and EVERYONE got a $20 dining credit in this coupon book I mentioned, which was only good for one restaurant and one bar location - a disappointment. Then the coupon book did include $10 discount on tickets to the Tournament of Kings which was the whole reason we came to Vegas. I had, again like an idiot, booked ours in advance... I told the person we were staying at the excalibur and even asked if there were any specials or discounts for hotel guests, but paid full price. Then when receiving the coupons I took them to the booking desk and they said if we returned them and re-booked at a discount, our seats were in danger of being lost and that everything but the last row in each section was booked for the 6pm show. The best part was going to the show (deciding not to risk our seats) and seeing so many empty four-in-a-row seats in the second and third rows. Totally felt lied to, nickel and dimed, and we will not be back.

I will have to agree with some of the other reviews that this hotel is ghetto.  But hey it was cheap and I enjoyed myself.  They have some awesome shows here.  I got to see Thunder from Down Under...AWESOME show...I wanna go again and again. :-)  Also went to the King of Tournements show...that was a lot of fun and the food was yummy.

One thing we got caught up in was "Get free show tickets, ask us how".  So they send you on one of those stupid Time Share things...they told us it would be 2 hours at the most....they ended up wasting almost 4 hours of our time.  We were pissed.  And those Time share peeps won't take no for an answer.  The then the lady got pissed when we told her we didn't want to buy anything..but this has nothing to do with the hotel.

Anywayzzz back to the hotel..the rooms were decent, the pillows sucked tho!  you need like 5 of theirs to equal a normal pillow...

I'll be going back here for the shows.  Not sure if I'll stay here again tho.

With every visit, this place seem to go further into the toilette.  I knew I should have book at MGM again. The price was right for our short visit, or so I thought, $29 per night, but then there is the $24.95 resort fee per day, and since my husband is a diabetic, we needed a fridge for his insulin which they have removed all fridges from the rooms and now charge once again $24.95 per day to get the fridge back for your stay.  We just got some ice and kept the insulin in the ice bucket for the trip.  Extra tip, don't play slots here either, we lost here, went over to NYNY and won it all back and then some. Don't think we will be staying here again.

The entire lobby is very smokey. The lamps were broken when we arrived, and service took a while. The sheets weren't very clean and the bathroom just was not up to standards. Overall, a good place to crash for a night or two, especially for the price. But nothing fancy.
Good value for money, the rooms are a bit dated and had condensation on walls. The knights of the round table dinner show was great, very similar to whats in the movie the cable guy.
stayed here yet again! and didnt dissapoint, although too many kids at pool, i need to go to an adult only pool. gym is great!
Only here for the night... Checked in smells horrible like smoke.. They gave us an upgrade for a suite nice of them but the room reeks like mold or humid  I hate that smell... Never coming back

I felt like we were staying "on the wrong side of the tracks" almost like the Bellagio was laughing at me when I hailed a cab back to the Excalibur.

I'd give you three stars for being A-OK, but why would I when two gives me the option of saying "meh, i've experienced better" which I have.

Its like a Motel 6 on top of a casino.

the rooms have just the basic amenities and by that I mean some lighting and a TV with a couple of channels - but who cares I was not there to hang out in the room.

I reserved two rooms for two nights so you can imagine I was on a budget - i'd have booked at the Easy 8 if it were an option.

But honestly, if I return to Vegas with say, my husband, I would not seek out the Excalibur as an option.  Even tho we had a great view of the roof.

It really sucks to have to write this review, but I feel that I have to let other people know about the experience I went through. I stayed at Excalibur about three weeks ago for my 25th, I used to stay at Excalibur all the time as a kid.

However, the next morning I woke up with welts ( and what clearly appeared to be bites). I gave it two or three days, and because I am a full time student and work full time I did not have time to see a doctor. After comparing pictures of my arm to google images, I realized I was bitten. I saw a doctor, pharmacist,and nurse, all of whom said I was clearly bitten by something.  I called Excalibur and was told someone would contact me regarding the incident. I waited about 7 days, and no one called. When i called back, the initial operator had not taken down my information (basically they never had record). 

Finally someone took down my information and took my statement. I suggested that I send them pictures, as I was documenting my arm and chest the entire time, and he refused, claiming they do not accept pictures. 

I was told someone would contact me within 2 days, never happened. I called back a couple days after my statement and left a message.

no reply.

I called again and was told I would be called within 5 days, since someone was going to inspect the room and let me know what they found.

That never happened either. 

I left a message, no reply.
I finally was able to get ahold of someone today, and I honestly wish I hadnt. 

She informed me that they were going to do absolutely nothing about my claim,s ince they found no bugs in the bed.  Take into consideration, its been about 3 weeks since I was there, and I am not claiming it was bed bugs, I just know it was some type of insect. 

I asked for a copy of the report from the inspection agency and was told I could not see it.

I asked for the name, and I could not have it. 

I basically could get NO proof that an inspection ever took place.



I am extremely disappointed in the Excalibur and the lack of compassion for a guest who paid $220 a night to stay in a contemporary room (which by the way is on sale on their website right now). 

I will NEVER stay at the Excalibur again.

I will never stay here again 3 main reasons. 
1. Hidden resort fee of 18 bucks a day no biggie but then they charge u for things like using the pool fitness center prepare to get nickel and dimed 
2. Every were I turned some person was in my face trying to sell me a time share FYI if some person offers u a free show or a welcome package it's a ploy to get u to a time share sales pitch
3. Poor poor service and restaurants and very pricey not a fun place
 
In short I go to Vegas to gamble drink and see a show I don't care what my room looks like but what I will not tolerate is being treated like a pice of meat or interrupted from gambling by some low life selling time shares. Do not stay here pay more for a more central strip location

I never thought I could get emphysema from just walking into a place. Within seconds of entering Excalibur, the stench of smoke filled my nostrils, my eyes began watering, and my lungs burned with each new breath. My only reason for setting foot in this hotel was to skip the tram and cross through on my way towards Mandalay Bay. Never will I make that mistake again.

I'll be straight up- This place is a hole. It's like MGM Resorts built it in 1990 and then never checked back, letting it fall into total disarray.  The carpets appear to have never been replaced, which explains the heavy stench of old smoke. Signs are placed in front of out of order moving sidewalks and doors are dirty. Their signature restaurants are Buca De Beppo and Dick's Last Resort. Gross. Speaking of the latter, the host of the MLIFE channel visits Dicks on one of their spots. Normally she is one of those people that is overly smiley and fake in every place they feature, desperately selling you on anything MGM related and telling you how everything is a must visit. Not even this lady could keep a straight face on the Dick's spot. The fear and desperation in her eyes to escape was clear and I found myself yelling at the TV, "Get out while you still can!"
 
Hmmm maybe Excalibur is this way on purpose. Like it's a prison of sorts for bad or incompetent MGM employees, where they get left to suffer and die (or just get fed up and quit). Regardless, skip this one while you still have clear lungs. New York New York is right next door and infinitely better.

The first day I arrived I was told that there weren't any two queen size beds available in non smoking. I had to take the king size bed and a roll away bed for the first night. The room was clean but was very noisy due to ac.  I had to call the next day to see if there were any rooms available and was able to move to a better location in the tower overlooking the strip. The hotel has very old decor and its at the end of the strip. It was away from everything and no parking at night. I was told there would be free drinks if I gambled but no one came to take our drink order. At the rio I got drinks left and right for free. I just had to tip. There are too many younger kids running around the casino. I wouldn't stay here again.

What's with all the one and two star reviews? It's a freaking hotel, it's not a resort on Fiji. Cheap rooms, pretty spacious (able to fit 8 of us in one standard room), responsive and attentive staff, beautiful views of.... well, no real view but whatever we could catch the glimmer of lights in the background. 

I had a fine experience, and the casino may have been slightly depressing with those "sexy" girls dancing about and no one watching them, but I had a good time, and I'm sure if you use a couple of those free drink tickets they give you upon check-in, you will too!

Oh but PS $5 a person to use the jacuzzi. WTF? Even the Holiday Inn is free!
I stayed here multiple times, nice clean rooms, good casino with a variety of games, and the best part is you can just walk right out into the strip, no need to pull out the car for the entire trip.

We were looking for an inexpensive room on the strip.  Our plan was not to stay in the hotel very much and just needed a comfy bed and shower.  We set our expectations appropriately.  Our room was located in Tower 1 which is where the older rooms are. I believe you can get the nicer rooms in Tower 2 for $30 more a night.

The bed in the room was very comfortable.  The room had a TV, table with two chairs, a couch, and a shower and single sink (with a hair dryer).  The room also had a safe and an iron.  There was no mini fridge or coffee maker so plan accordingly.   There are coffee places within the hotel (do not go to Castle Coffee...stick with Starbucks or Krispy Kreme).   The closet had hangers.

WI-FI is complimentary, but it is slow as heck and has an inconsistent connection.  If you need to do work while on vacation, I would suggest getting your own hotspot to use or planning to work somewhere else.  It lead to frustration and took entirely too long (a couple hours)  to do one or two things that should have taken 5 minutes.  

The pool, gym, and spa are located in Tower 2 so it is a little bit of a walk (5 minutes) to those areas from Tower 1.  Not the worst thing except you have to walk through the casino in your bathing suit or workout clothes.  

The gym was by far the best thing about this place!  I went around 7:30am on Friday morning and much to my surprise it was packed.  There is no cost to use the gym (it's built into the resort fees) and you do have to sign a waiver before you go in.  

The gym was fully equipped with treadmills, bikes, ellipticals, free weights, kettlebells, mats, and foam rollers.  There is one stairmaster (which could probably use some maintenance, but it did what I needed it to do). The attendant was handing out towels and water bottles as we worked out.  The gym overlooks the pool so you could probably be thoroughly entertained while working out.  There is a restroom located in the spa adjacent to the gym.  

Saturday night (Sunday morning 2am) we got back to the room and wanted to eat.  We were shocked to see that room service only operates from 6am - 2pm so we ventured out to the casino to find food.  All the restaurants were closed with the exception of Johnny Rockets.  So we went back to the room and ate snacks.  I would suggest planning for that too.  How come everything is closed at 2am?  Isn't this Vegas?  lol.  The hotel has several places to eat with a food court upstairs.  Just don't get hungry in the middle of the night.  

The hotel is located within walking distance to New York New York, Mandalay Bay, MGM, and Luxor.  There is also a tram that will take you to Luxor and Mandalay Bay.  We caught a cab to Bellagio and it cost $8 one way plus tip.  

Excalibur has a couple stores where you can buy essentials (in fact they are called Essentials).  

There are 4 or 5 pools here.  We grabbed towels and planted ourselves on our lounge chairs.  There were two bars that I noticed and a DJ.  The music was great.  I saw a couple of waitresses, but I wasn't sure who they were serving.  The bar was good.  They were able to charge our room for our drinks.  Be prepared to take your ID to the pool if you want to get a drink.  They will card you.  The bar had all kinds of fun drinks (skinny lemonade was my pick) and beer with ice buckets.  My drink was $13 plus tip.  Not cheap by any means, but it is Vegas.  There was also a little store at the pool where you could buy sunscreen, swimsuits, hats, etc.  I didn't look so I couldn't tell you the prices.

Overall it was a fine experience.  It's not upscale by any means.  It is an older casino\/hotel.  If you are just looking for a place to sleep and you are not worried about image, you can't go wrong with Excalibur.

one of my fave hotels in vegas. sometimes the cheaper rooms can be kinda crappy but the newer ones are nicer. we had a great experience with customer service. someone butted in front of us in line- blatantly like on our way to the counter. it was pretty rude and i was def irritated after an almost 7 hour drive. anyways, the lady at the front desk was si kind she gave us a free upgrade! the room was nice but didnt have a fridge. which kind of was upsetting since i like to always bring my own beverages- but whatever. i love the casino here and the bars. its a big space and seems ventialted well with all the smoke etc in vegas. i stay here a lot and will keep staying here. the pool is awesome too! probably my favorite.

This was my first time in Vegas and was very disappointed the housekeeping wasn't rude but would knock on the Door and barley announce themselves before entering your room then there's the constant harassment by hotel employees trying to get you free stuff which isn't really free and they don't stop I was there for 3 days it would get to the point where they would completely get in your face I would be talking on the phone and they would completly interrupt you I don't think I will be returning if ever

The hotel to start the strip. One of the more older hotels and price friendly. We were going out to Vegas for a bachelor party so got rooms here. All you really need is a room to sleep since most of the time your up and about the town. Our room had two queen beds, AC and was kept very clean. The only problem we had was that the restroom door didn't lock. Called down stairs and they fixed it by the next day. Would stay here again when making a vegas weekend trip.

Talk about Ghetto. Yeesh. 

The Excalibur is icky even by 3 star standards. Sure, it's got the Medieval theme, but it's not like an "authentic" Medieval theme, it's like the Fairy Tale cartoon version of Medieval. I am pretty sure no one over 10 is gonna buy the ambiance of this place. I don't even like walking through the casino. Really, the only reason to go there is to get on the tram - or maybe, if you came to Vegas with kids. But why would you do THAT??? 

Sure, it's cheap. And the room definitely reflects that...but I'd rather stay at the Imperial Palace - someplace less in disguise and more straight-up cheap. I can't specifically pinpoint the reasons why I will never stay there again - it just left me with a very "unwashed" feeling - even years later (I stayed there in 2001). 

Expedia tells me they're remodeling some of the rooms -- I wonder if they can do something to the outside too? To make it less Disneyland Princess Castle...

I like the fact there is no smoking. We were told the beds in room will be kings and they were not. They were queens. There was hair all over the floor and counter. I called desk they said they would have someone come up and clean it. The woman clean the counter by placing hair on floor. She didn't sweep at all. Just used towel to wipe it up. When she left there was still hair on floor and counter.
The bed sheets were clean, except for the little spider hanging out on a pillow. We did have to get more towels. A room for four people with only two towels. House service did bring up extra towels and pillows within a timely manner.
The staff and dealers are rude. My husband and I got a fairly good deal to stay but the service we received and the overall quality of the casino was not worth the money we saved.

Spent a long weekend here and did enjoy the stay. The room was clean but outdated. Not sure about the low hanging light over table area as I hit my head on it several times. Better off sitting on the bed! Stayed on 17th floor with great view of the Strip, room was cleaned daily, kudos to the housekeeper and did not have cleanliness of room issues that other reviews stated. I'm definitely a neat freak, think Felix Unger from The Odd Couple, so if the room was not clean, I would have been all over it. Casino was decent, and liked the food court options. Only complaint was the resort fee was a bit much for what you get.  Tried to go by the pool and no empty lounge chairs. Attendant tried pushing renting the premium seats or cabanas which really felt like nickel and diming the client. There were security quite visible but didn't feel the place was unsafe. Security was noticeable in most of the casinos we visited. So, not a bad place but they need to up the amenities for what they are charging as their "resort fee

It took us over two hours to get into our room from unloading car very few valets very few bellhops slow service we got to our room got unloaded only to have a stranger show up with a key that fit our door who said it was his room. We were given a second room only to find out later that the television did not work then we were given a third room only to find out that the view of the strip was now a view of the roof we would check out but we bought five nights prepaid nonrefundable this is Saturday, 20 February if you're reading this Excalibur you need to retrain your people. We won't be back. 
Part Two:
Its now past midnight and our room has not been cleaned , it might be due to everyone in the hotel being awakened by the very loud fire alarm at 3am and again at 4am scaring everyone awake. the maid just showed up at 12:45am. This has been the worst stay of any hotel we've stayed at. These usually are signs that a hotel is on hard times. I wished we had not booked five nights. Two more to go, stay tuned.

I was more impressed with Circus Circus when I stayed there. They could use a much better makeover on their rooms it's really old and unattractive as well as gives you an impression that it's dirty. The environment in the casino hasn't changed much over many many years the kids arcade and gaming is still pretty cool a bit high-priced but it's fun. As far as the gambling I don't gamble so I really wouldn't know.

This is the hotel to go to if:

1.  You've only got 4 people in your party
2.  You want to go real cheap with hotels but still want to be on the strip
3.  You're down to walk to the more happenin' hotels\/clubs

I've been here several times with smaller groups, and it's always for a good deal.  Nothing spectacular about the rooms (but who stays in all day, anyways?).  There are a couple places to eat (mostly wings), but really-just make that trek toward the more popular places-it's good cardio.

Our bags were checked when we arrived and got out of the taxi. The registration line was very short and even though I was early I was able to pre-check before hand. We booked the newer tower and had no problem at all with the process. I enjoy this hotel and this is my second or third stay. I recommend this hotel to all friends and family.

Like most folks said, this is NOT the greatest of hotels. However, it's got the tram to Luxor and Mandalay Bay and the location for the price is great. It's not right smack in the middle of the Strip but it's walkable.

The room service was also  a little annoying. The clean up was half assed and the housekeepers were all shouting at each other at 9 a.m. on a SUNDAY morning? Don't they know people are sleeping off Saturday night?!?!

Dick's last resort is also a fun spot to stop by and have some appetizers and drinks.

I just checked into the Contemporary Superior Room and am definitely not impressed.  Mlife website states that the room has a spa tub in the room.  It has a large tub separate from the bathroom but no jets!  I call the front desk and they said that it was changed to only a tub.  I do not recommend this room.  Save your money and get one of the other rooms instead.

**Edit 12\/8\/13** When I returned to my room, I found that key card was not working.  Security had to come up and let me in.  The reason why I needed security was that the front desk employee that took my credit card at check in did not swipe it into the computer system so my keys were deactivated until I paid my balance.  After a long day, I had to run back down to registration to take care of the credit card issue.  The manager on duty did refund the early check in fee ($20 to check in before 3:00 pm).

everything was great. awesome really.  until the last day of my stay when my friend and i had bed bug bites popping up all over my body. disgusting.

i was in the NEW TOWER by the way.

This place is ugh. I've stayed there a couple times. I paid extra for a view and got a view of a gas station and fast food place. If I looked all the way to the left I could see part of New York New York.

I was playing Keno and they needed to do something to the machines and the lady was very rude. House keeping could use some training. And good luck finding a cocktail waitress after 1am.

I swore id never stay again, but I have two comp nights and paying for two more nights. This will be my last stay for sure. I'm going next week but will go to other casinos to gamble. 

I'm only giving two stars because the lady that checked us in was very nice!

This play used to be the spot - at least in the early 90's.  From the Magic Show, nice arcade and huge buffet, this place is definitley an older hotel.  I would compare this to the Sahara Hotel.  Casino is huge and the pool is cool, has a slide, but aside from that, there are too many options to have to settle for the Excalibur- especially if you are paying.  If it's free, I wouldn't mind.  It's on the Southern Most End of the Strip.

Would not recommend this place, took kids here for a small getaway, the casino floor was ok but old and dirty.  Not to mention the people asking you I'd you want free show tickets every 5 feet that was horrible!

The hotel part smelled terrible, room was pretty dirty three was so much dust in the fan vent out was gross!  The doors do not close all the way unless pushed or pulled.  Even if I had a free night I would not stay there again.
The hotel staff were very friendly! My room was very mediocre. My biggest complaint was a lack of refrigerator or any microwave. This is unacceptable!  Never been in a hotel without both:(

One of the older casino\/hotels on the strip and the rooms do show it. But I have to admit that it's a pretty large room and they are very clean. You get a nice big flat screen TV and an Ethernet cable is provided for internet access if you bring your laptop. The beds are very soft and comfy. So aside from it being a little old, it wasn't too bad. 

What I didn't really like about this place was the service. I didn't feel like most of the staff was that helpful or friendly. There is a $15 resort fee for everyday that you stay at the hotel and that includes two free drinks. When I tried to go redeem the drinks the guy that worked at the bar wasn't very helpful and he became just downright mean when he saw our coupon vouchers for free drinks. 

I guess for the price ~$38\/night it's a pretty good deal. I didn't really have a super bad experience here but I felt like it also wasn't super good. I don't regret staying here but I think I'll try to book another place next time. 

I do have to say, they were pretty nice when they weren't able to accommodate my request to have two rooms right next to each other, because they ended up upgrading our rooms to rooms with view for free (which normally would have been an extra $30 upgrade fee).

Peaceful weekend and my room was very clean. Excalibur has made some room upgrades. Not too pricey depending on when you book your room. Excalibur is in the heart of the strip and take advantage of the monorail to different casinos.

Aww, come on people.  This place is pretty cool.  I've never stayed here, but I've visited numerous times.

The exterior is fantastic - and quite glorious at night.  And Tournament of Kings is pretty sweet.

I will say that the interior seems cluttered and crowded...and that most of the people I've encountered inside are rather sketchy...

But whatever, it's a fun place to visit!

Call me King Arthur cause I stayed at Excalibur and pulled the sword from the stone.  Now where the hell are the knights of my round table at?!

Stayed here Labor Day weekend with the fams back in 2006 when I turned 21 cause my parents are cheap and it was the cheapest hotel on the strip for the weekend and we were able to cramp 6 people into 2 beds.

Parents gave me $200 to gamble away, but I ended up spending it all on drank, bottle service, and titty money when I met up with one of my homies who's cousin was having his bachelor party that weekend and his other cousin who runs her own bachelorette company in Vegas and knows all the club bouncers\/owners was escorting us in and out of everywhere.

My fondest memories of Excalibur were as follows:

1 - Forgetting my tooth brush at home and having to buy a ghetto $3 one in the convenience store downstairs.

2 - All those THUNDER FROM DOWN UNDER show posters.  This is a pretty homosexual memory if you know what posters all over the walls here I'm talking about, but the title THUNDER FROM DOWN UNDER just always made me bust up laughing.

3 - Don't eat Del Taco in the hallway of where your room is drunk at 5AM or you might get escorted by a big ass 6' 6" black security cop (that could've passed for a low quality porn star) that will escort your ass all the way downstairs to the front desk and ask your drunk ass what room # you are and call your parents at 5AM and ask them if you belong to them and then escort you all the way back up to your room.  At least I got the side of a bed to myself that night since they were all awake by the time I crashed out that night.  I swear to God, cops love me no matter what city I'm in.  Surprised my parents didn't say anything to me the next day of smelling like alcohol and cigarettes.

Ghetto hotel though, I'm guessing people only come here because it's cheap and has dragons on the towers and the monorail connects it to Luxor and Mandalay Bay.  The pool was alright, but nothing special at all by all means on Vegas standards.  They pay a person to check if you have a room key over here when going up on the elevators.  Something tells me someone got hunted down in the past over here, so they had to do that for security issues.

At first sight you can tell that this is a hotel that is more out dated than others on the strip, but that is not the issue. When staying here the house keeper barged right into the room 3 times. Starting at 8:30am it was one simple knock, then a "Hey! When are you leaving?"...smh. After reading another review this morning about a girl who stayed here last night that got her laptop stolen while she was sleeping in the room! I don't know why anyone would feel comfortable staying here.

My favorite place to stay on the strip! Because if you are a real life princess, like I am, why wouldn't you want to stay in a castle?
I love the Resort tower, those rooms face the strip! 

Every day the maids do an excellent job of making the rooms look amazing when you come back in for your mid- day nap ;) 
Also, this place is the home of Thunder down under!! Who could complain about that?

I've always had a good time here. The rates are agreeable, they have plenty of food\/coffee options and I feel at home here!

Avoid if you have any expectation of business functionality.

The hotel itself is dated, which is not a massive problem, but for business, the Excalibur is a terrible option.

Our group of six people (across five rooms) were charged nearly $600 overall in our five-day stay in part to access the internet. For a sum that could have bought three new laptops, we received a slow and instable connection preventing us from getting work done, as well as cheap cat-5 cables with broken hinges exacerbating the problem. 

Several in our group were almost entirely unable to access the web except for short bursts, and subsequently suffered a loss of productivity that hindered the business part of our business trip and ultimately cut into our time to do other things in Vegas. 

The tattered and seedy vibe was tolerable, but the charge for services not rendered was inexcusable. Food options in the hotel get fanciest at Dairy Queen, and also, don't expect to peacefully walk through the lobby without getting accosted every. single. time by people aggressively pushing timeshares.

Disgusting, smells like smoke, kids arcade is old and employees angry! Too old ladies who worked there were arguing about a customer asking for change. Won't ever be back! They need to bull doze this place.

We stayed here in March 2012, and we had a great experience. Really for the price, you can't beat it. Sure it's not the Paris or one of the more upscale hotels but then again, like I mentioned, can't beat t he price! I also have to give a shout out to the housekeeping staff! They skipped our room during the afternoon and when we got back at midnight it wasn't clean. I called them and they offered to send someone down right then. How awesome is that? Next time I think I would like to spring for the extra money and stay at a more luxurious place, because its fun. But I wouldn't take Excalibur off of my list. Also love the new BBQ place Lynyrd Skynrd with the karaoke!!!

We decided to spend great weekend on the strip and booked the Circus Circus and lord don't Ever go there it's cheap, dirty ! So we called here and they were able accommodate us last min in the Royal Tower, great staffs and service!

Tacky, stinky and rude!  We've been to Vegas many times, but this is the first time we have been to the Excalibur.  We chose this hotel because we had the kids with us and figured it would be more "kid friendly" at the pool.  Yes, the pool is kid friendly, but the hotel itself is the WORST.  First thing when we pulled into valet, the guy rolled our luggage to the curb and "informed" us that he does not share tips with the other bellmen so he would need his tip right then.  So rude!  For rolling my luggage 10 feet?  Yes, I might tip you, but never if you ask for it!  Then as we enter we get hit up immediately by pushy sales staff trying to sell shows and push another property.  No thanks.  Unfortunately, every single time we enter or leave our room, they attack us.  So tacky and rude!  Now to the smell.  Gross, yuck, disgusting, stinky hell hole.  I hope that describes it enough.  Walk into most other hotels on the strip and then walk into the Excalibur.  Tell me if you feel differently.  Blah...worst Vegas hotel experience ever and one time we stayed at the Four Queens and had a speaker outside of our window from Fremont Street!  Oh yah, and every time we walked through the casino with our kids, someone was harping on us.  Hellloooo....we were staying there, how were we going to get our kids into our room without walking through your stinking casino??  They weren't gambling, they were walking through (one in a stroller).  Give me a break!

Got to the hotel with a voucher from take a break travel. Which me booked 45 days ahead of time. When we put the $100 deposit take a break travel told me all i will need is to take my voucher for my 2 day stay to the welcome center at the excalibur.

I was excited to go to las vegas. Got to the welcome center and was told we had to take a mandatory tour so we can get our $100 dollar deposit, which was to go to las vegas timeshare tour again. Which we took in October and lasted almost 5 hour trying to get us to get a time share. Plus we didnt even know what we were getting into when we took the offer for free or discounted vouches.

 The people at each entrances of the hotels are volchers. Trying to get people to get discount shows and etc. Its sound like a hell of a deal but there is a hidden message and catch that they should mention. All i knew is that we were going to a tour but not for time share. They do not disclosed or requirements to get what they say we are getting. I came to vegas to have a good time. But get wheeled in to go to another time share tour . 

The person that attended us at the welcome center by the name of jay was checking us in. Had us fill out paper work ask for our identification. Then he  explaining to us we had to take a time share tour. First thing he said you HAVE TO TAKE THE TOUR TO GET YOUR DEPOSIT BACK. I was upset already just having flash back from the first tour i took.

I was keeping my cool but i was buring inside. So i told him i wasn't told that i had to take the tour to get my deposit back.  He said it was mandatory. So i was like ok fine if i have to i will but i didnt want to. He kept suggesting to take the tour same day when we got there. Not to mention we  traveled 4 1\/2 hours from Los Angeles. I was tired and wanted to relax. He as well is giving us credit for gabling and for dinner. So we ended up with a bunch of bs credits. That's included to take the tour.

Couple hours passed . So me and my husband were talking that the tour is bs. They never told us we had to take a  mandatory time share tour. So we went back to jay told him we wanted to cancel the trip. As soon as we said that things changed. He ask why. Because we didn't want to take time off our trip not to mention its our 6 year anniversary. So we wanted to cancel, he right away started type away at the computer. Then he said what I'm going to do is not have you guys take a tour. Why couldn't he just said that the first time.

Me and my husband was having a bad day when they mention i had to take a time share tour. I just can't understand why he couldn't just have us given our room only and not take the tour. I understand we have to make a living but that wasn't the way to do it. So he finally got us not to go on a tour and with no credits because weren't taking the tour. So that means only 2 night stay and That's it. Which i'm ok with that what i thought i was expecting.

I was even more upset so i walked away and they still wanted us to stay. 
P.S called take a break travel after we left vegas for my dispute at the welcome center. They confirmed i didn't have to take a tour. They even mention we never have to. It was only was supposed to be a 2 night stay thats it.

So what we did how upset we were, we got our own room so we didnt have to deal with the welcome center. Feeling like they own us, since they have all my information. Thank you to the excalibur i give them 5 stars. I got a great deal for 3 day same price with resort fees what i was spending with take a break travel. Couple hour pass. I had my husband take the voucher back and force them to cancel because i still didn't feel comfortable. 

We ended up enjoying the rest of our 3 day stay. Just knowing what the welcome center tries to hack people to go to a time share tour when they dont have to. Were i stand right now, Im now out $100 dollar negative. Because i cancel my trip. All because he said i had to take the trip, then i go back tells me i dont have to.  He had the nerve to switch his mind up. That's just shady business. Please if anyone reads this dont do what i did. There going to come after you with alot of bs info sounding that your getting discount deals nope wrong.

Considering all that goes into bringing a package together to make your stay and adventures in Vegas a pleasant one, I can say the Excalibur delivers!

I could have opted for fine resorts north of $222 per night, with $60 breakfast daily and $100 spend for three nights, but decided instead for the $50 a night, king bed room here, I think I nailed it!

With resort fees and taxes, the $150 base rate goes to $250, for three nights.

I flew in. Got the Showtime Shuttle at $16.50 round trip from Terminal 1 to hotel - do tip the diver, friendly guy with a boom box playing. 

Upon arrival at airport, I checked into the American Express Centurion Lounge - had complimentary food, drinks and snacks there, making time for the 4:00 p.m. check in time. I also tried the Priority Select Lounge, the Club at LAS lounge, compliments of AMEX, and got complimentary snacks and drinks there, as well. By this time, it was close to 5:00 p.m. and headed for hotel.

Check-in was seamless. My room was not ready (it would have been a lower floor, like 6th floor, and was offered a room in 9th floor). I said: go higher! It's too noisy at the lower floors. I was set on the 20th - view to airport and Luxor. Pretty decent view.

I was given the option to leave the tab open on my credit card for room charges. I left my tab open for the 3-night stay and they told me they would tap my card with $350. I said: fine~

The biggest drawback for me is that the room is not sound proof. You can hear all the noise from the airport and the ambulances on the street. It appears you could even hear people on the street - noise level is constant and mild but annoying. Therefore, I'm knocking down one rating. (Mystery solved: The window was open a bit - I closed it and though still noisy from the airport and ambulances\/traffic, the white noise is more bearable with the window closed).

The TV in the room offered 2 shows for $75. You can only purchase the package in person at the Box Office (the box office at the 1st floor closes at 10 pm and the one at the 2nd floor closes at 11:30 pm). The Blue Man Group at Luxor is advertised for a few bucks more in the TV ad but upon requesting it at the box office, it's not part of the package until after New Year's. A little bait-and-switch there it felt. Same thing for the Tournament Dinner: it's advertised but not available. So, I settled for the Bee Gees and Fantasy for $75 - BUT HERE COMES THE KICKER: they add a FEE which brings the cost to $89, and you don't get the M Life discount (about 10% I was told to expect by the clerk at Players Services). So, you have to be a little flexible, I guess, with the padding in prices that goes on in here - otherwise, these little quirks could pile on to ruin your experience. I charged the shows to my room but my credit card was immediately debited via the room's open tab.
