To my surprise, the hotel is not as smoke fogged inside as in the past. Perhaps because I'm comparing it to the Indian Bingo & Casinos in Southern Cal. I purposefully did not bring my best jacket or clothing because of the cigarette smoke smell factor. So, far, it's not as bad.

Tips:

- Get the M Life card -- their players & MGM hotels loyalty program -- (you'll get spammed with emails though); I had one and secured the room rate through it. The price per night was competitive relative to the same hotel compared to AAA, AARP and AMEX travel. I got a better deal through M Life but did have to pay about $55 in advance at time of booking a couple of weeks back. - They offered me to apply for the M Life Master Card credit card but I declined.

- Book your shows as soon as you get there - they sell out sometimes. 

- The $75 for 2 shows is still a deal, even though with fees it is actually $89. The box office staff are very friendly.

- Bring your own bottled water. There was none in my room - not even a pay-as-you-go bottles.

- Wi-Fi is complimentary in the room but for some reason it only worked with my phone and not the tablet. Perhaps it's only one device at a time.

- The King Tower room have a "1" in front of the room number and the other tower has a "2".

- You won't need a jacket in the casino floor - it's very warm.

It's my first night and I just got here - I'll update this post as needed regarding food, amenities and overall stay, time-permitting.

Stay here if:

1. You enjoy being solicited every time you walk through the door or head for your room.
2. You love the stale smell of vintage cigarettes from 20 years ago.
3. You like housekeeping that does not respect your "do not disturb" sign
4. You like beds so cushy that your body sinks down and pillows so fluffy that your head is perpendicular.
5. You do not have extra money to spend and have exhausted all of your other options for accommodations.

Even despite #5, just go stay at a hostel or couch surf.

I recently stayed here on a trip with a few buddies.  I haven't been here in years...in fact I think the last time I stayed here, I was still in either junior high or early high school.  They have changed up the look of the inside of the hotel rooms to look somewhat up to speed with the times.  No more cheesy castle or medival wallpaper on the interior.  I was even surprised that they had a decent sized flat screen tv in the room.  There was free Wifi and a free ethernet cable hookup in our room...too bad I didn't know about that ahead of time as I would probably would've brought my laptop with me.  As far as service, I was also very surprised at how often the room was checked to be cleaned, and how prompt the room cleaners were.  The one low point of the trip though had to be the attitude of the front desk person who checked in our party.  Albeit, our room was comped, apparently she gave my buddy a hurry up and get out of my face demeanor because I am too busy to deal with you.  The casino itself was very good to me, and I personally thought the slots were "loose" and good to me.  I won over $100 in cash from the slots there...all in all a cheaper alternative if you are looking to save some cash on rooms on the strip.  The fact it is also directly linked through walkways to the Mandalay Bay and the Luxor is also a plus if you plan to shop or catch a few shows in the adjoining hotels.

Poor service, bossy salespeople, nothing for kids to do. Huge disappointment. As soon as we arrived to this hotel, we were approached by a woman who offered us show tickets. We didn't even have a chance to check in before they start pushing us toward the ticket booth and trying to get us to tour one of their towers so that we can buy a time share. Second-most, EVERYTHING closes at midnight, except for the hamburger stand near Tower I. Is this why they say that Las Vegas is the city that never sleeps? WHO does that? Build a reputation on being an all-night town, then starve the people who are your bread and butter once midnight hits. The icing on the cake, this morning we are awoke by a fire alarm, someone decided to pull, and the voice of a loud, obnoxious woman telling us there was a fire alarm. Really? DO I NEED THE VOICE OF GOD TELLING ME THERE IS A FIRE ALARM? It turns out that the alarm was a false one-thanks God. But now I am up at 8:52 a.m., after a long an exhausting night, because of someone's rude behavior. I call the front desk, and the manager, Michael, told me that the hotel doesn't compensate for that type of behavior. Really? This hotel makes billions of dollars a year in revenues and can't offer a free breakfast to a family who was up most of the night and have been so rudely treated? Give me a break. Complete joke. O and did I tell you that there is hardly anything for the kids to do here, in this so-called kid hotel? No movie theater, bowling alley, no rides, no shows for the kids, all we get is Thunder from Down Under. COMPLETE JOKE. Stay away, unless all you care about is cheap rooms, rude service, and lackluster gaming.

I stayed there last weekend for a cheer compition. Nice hotel. We were on the top floor in tower two. I would recommend this tower over the other. I didnt go in any rooms but I hear its not remodeled and there cheaper. We a nice view of the pool, which by the way is pretty cool four pools I only went down there once but there was a water slide. Nice location on strip also. Not far walking to anything. Also they had a Dicks Last Resort in the hotel dowstairs. Pretty tight I had a good time. I would stay here again. It was the cheapest I could find. $600 for three nights Thurs, Fri, & Sat. We had a flat screen and nice beds. The ice machines were always broken that was annoying but it was really warm so it was understandable. Decent for the money I'd say

I have stayed in the old and "new" tower, respectively. If you get the chance to choose between the two towers available, definitely go with the new tower (Tower 2). Overall, the stay in Tower 2 was really good, but Tower 1 was simply miserable.

It's not a hip and fancy hotel - sure enough. But you're still a paying customer, so there should be some type of standards that has to met. (It is super cheap to stay here!) The casino feels very old and tired. Beauty may be skin deep, but ugly goes clear to the bone. And this hotel is not an exception.

I realize that Excalibur is targeting certain type of people. With that said, I didn't spend any time in their casino, nor did I try any of their restaurants. There is a little walk across the bridge to MGM, but it's not that bad. You're walking around in Vegas anyway so this can't be the deal breaker. However... Excalibur... Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning...

Tower 1:
- Old CRT TV
- Old carpet
- Old interior
- Bad smell in the room

Tower 2:
- LCD TV
- New carpet
- New interior
- No smell (which is good in contrary to Tower 1)

Would I return to Excalibur?
No.

Ok I am going to give one more chance to Excalibur. I will update after my stay..I certainly hope this stay is better than the last.. I would not like to review solely on the check in but this time it was smooth and even got an upgraded high floor room with a SW view over looking Luxor and Mandalay Bay.. More to come

Stayed here for my bff's vow renewal ceremony,they were married here 10 years ago. More run down than 10 years ago. For the price I can't complain. We enjoyed our stay here very much,once again for the price  it was no more or less than what I expected. Very convenient location to the strip.
5 Stars because Thunder From Down Under is here!

i dont remember much about the Excalibur, only that it seemed like the most ghetto Las Vegas hotel on the strip.  

But it was pretty cheap!  and I hardly stayed there during the day or night.  
We also had an EXCELLENT view of the strip! Mostly of Mandalay Bay and MGM.  Eh, still good.
Ok rooms,alittle old, but great pool with slide for kids,great location for walking out side the Hotel on the strip....

I've been getting lost and p.o.ed in this hotel since 1998.  Even stayed here once out of desparation, much to my chagrin.  All other properties in Vegas, including MGM properties, have signs clearly directing you to all the restaurants by name.  A restaurant changes, they change the sign.  But apparently Excalibur cannot be bothered.  There's just a general sign at the escalator that says "Restaurants" implying that all the restaurants are upstairs.  But they are not.  

Once you get upstairs, you'll find a couple of banners above the escalators that try to explain with oddly placed arrows where specific restaurants, registration, etc. are located.  But the banners make no sense. It's so annoying.

Also, this hotel was rundown in 1998 and is doubly so today.  It smells funny.  The smoke over the years has inflitrated every nook and cranny, making the whole place smell like a giant, nasty ashtray.

Since it is part of the weird, circuitious path that allows you to traverse the Strip in mostly air conditioned comfort, sometimes it becomes a necessity to come here.  Or if someone's band is playing here.  Over the years, I've seen more live acts here for free than anywhere on the Strip. But otherwise I try to avoid it if at all possible.

2.5 Stars 

It's older, the place needs some work, the rooms are OK.  But ... the price was amazing ($29 \/ night for standard 2 queen beds and older TV (tube)).  

I did appreciate the coffee shop at the base of the elevators in Tower 1 (did not have to hike across the casino to get some java).  

If I was here with my spouse, I might have upgraded or stayed somewhere else.  But don't need a widescreen TV for "casino cable" service (12 channels - 3 are Vegas ads).  

Also centrally located in the southern strip, so you can get anywhere else by foot or tram.
One of the oldest hotels on the strip.  Rooms are somewhat nasty, but the location is good.  Casino sucks.  This place is for midwest tourists on a budget!

What hotel

On the strip

In Las Vegas

On the strip!!!!

Puts you in a room

A "front desk $20 upgrade" room

WITH SHEER CURTAINS

Allowing light in at

      Midnight
      Morning
      Evening
      All hours

To shine through

In full force?


http:\/\/i1.tinypic.com\/6sm1xfr.jpg

(I know

It looks like a wedding budoir

Or a dress Mariah would wear

I had to improve somehow)

If you're going to pay their rates, go spend it somewhere else.  The employees suck big time!  Nobody cares about you, they just see you as "tip money".  They look at you and figure out how much you are worth and talk with you accordingly.  Front desk has the worst customer non-service ever.  Ask questions and they mumble answers and point to a booklet and tell you what the upgrade price is and make you hurry to answer them.  They don't tell you that if you join the "M" club, you can defer your upgrade from points.  We had to learn the hard way.  We "upgraded" and I wouldn't call that an upgrade, we faced a wall with a\/c units.  Ugh. Rooms were "dark".  Someone broke glass in the hallway and it took four days for housekeeping to notice and finally vacuum it up...duh.  If you are going to pay the price....go to Bellagio or something comparable, this hotel doesn't need your moola.  You can lose it in the machines...that would be maing better use of your lost money!

Just say no. Don't want bedbugs? No problem-you can pay extra and get a "remodeled" room that doesn't have them. Want to daily park? No problem-there are only 5% of the required parking capacity but pay for that, and then after driving around for an hour you can double-pay for valet. But, there are no "regular" valet spots, so you can $30 more for a premium one. Want an extra pillow so you can sleep with more than the single flat pillow? Well in this case you'll need to buy that yourself as they don't have any. You should feel bad though as they'll repeatedly let you know "... nothing we can do." Never staying here again.

I have stayed at Excalibur for conference past few years.  I felt the service actually got better every year.  And now they finally included wifi service!  Thr price is unbeatable - $35-$55 a night plus resort fee of $12-$20.  The room is not fancy, but very clean and updated.  It's conveniently located at strip, a bit toward the south. There are coffee\/breakfast shop right at the elevator to the room for both towers.  They are Baja Fresh, Dick's resort restaurant, and burger place in the casino area, and a 5-min walk to the food court with McDonald, Yogurtland, Popeyes, Buffet, Steak house and others on the way to Luxor. 

If I am coming for a romantic vacation, this is probably not the place to stay. Otherwise, this is a decent hotel to stay.  I keep coming back to this hotel every year.  My conference is at Mandalay Bay, I walked to the class every morning for exercise and took the free tram back at evening.

So I have stayed at the Excalibur about 5 times in the past year. Its located on the south side of the Las Vegas Strip on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and Tropicana. Its surrounding hotels (safe walking distance)  MGM, Tropicana, New York New York, Luxor. 

Here is the thing about the Excalibur. Its an older hotel. Tower I has the older outdated rooms with no views. Tower II has the upgraded rooms with the flat screen TVs and the views.  Excalibur is reasonable in price for being on the strip. Its definitely not the best hotel on the strip but the price is worth staying on the strip and you save money in cab fares.  There is a tram that can take you from the Excalibur to the Luxor and to the Mandalay bay. Its free. Its also walking distance to the MGM where you can catch the MONORAIL which is a tram that you pay $5.00 each way and it goes from the south side of the strip starting at MGM up to the North side of the strip ending at the Sahara. There are plenty of stops in between for the hotels\/casinos on the strip. The monorail is worth taking if you don't mind taking trams. My advice is to you is to go to any or all of the Vegas casinos and get a PLAYERS CLUB CARD or members card. They are free. You can put them in slot machines to earn points or give them to card dealers to earn points. In return they email you cheap hotel deals for the vegas strip casinos. It is worth it and it is free. That might also be another reason why I keep visiting Vegas!
 Also, on a quick note there is a restaurant in the Excalibur called DICKS. Be advised it is not a place for children or sensitive people. The staff is purposely rude and crude to people (hence the name Dicks). They hold back nothing and dish out a lot of vulgar trash talk so be warned. If you don't get offended easily you should definitely take advantage of the Dicks experience.

You have to piss me off pretty well for me to give you a one-star review, and this hotel managed to just that. The hotel staff was some of the most incompetent set of nit wits I have ever had the misfortune of dealing with.

After a long day and night of walking around the strip, we stumbled back to our room. We went downstairs to ask the front desk for a roll-a-way bed since there were four of us in one room and gave them a credit card number. After an HOUR passed, we called again and they said that they had no record of us calling or giving a credit card number ._. My roomie went downstairs AGAIN and was told that they had no record of us requesting\/paying for a roll-a-way bed. After pointing to the guy that took the information to begin with, they apologized and said that they would comp the beds and send them up.

All of a sudden, a few days later, they take away the beds, even though we still needed them, AND charged my roomie's card that supposedly they didn't have on file to begin with! The staff was rude and kept contradicting what other staff members were saying. The front desk staff literally has no business being in customer service.

Also, the timeshare people are pushy and annoying. Only one tower has decent rooms. No wifi (WTF!) and the wired internet runs at a speedy 1mpbs download and a .005mbps upload. The pool has NO shade unless you pay for it. The only good thing? A really nice worker at the craps table who explained to us how to play. Never again. If I ever come back to Vegas, I am staying FAR away from this hell hole.

The slots aren't worth playing and not just because ppl don't win at them that's all slots but in the 3 hours my friend and I played we weren't asked once by the cocktail waitress if we wanted a drink so after spending 400.00 and even more sober than we were than first started we were a little peeved. Planet Hollywoods slots not only pay out better but their waitress' come up to us before we've played out first penny

As a young adult, this was not the place to be in late july. Had a youth Basketball tournament going on which swamped the place. Little kids everywhere anyway. 

The GOOD was that tables were $5 and I saved $100 on my car insurance. 

I was also on the 17th floor, at the end of the hallway. And I get hit on by alot of prostitutes this trip for some reason. who knows.

Updated rooms my *ss!  The curtains and bathroom walls had stains.  The clothing drawers were old and had chips and scratches on them.  The television channels were lacking, while there was no guest directory in the room.  In addition, there was no deadbolt or secondary lock on the doors so anyone (like the staff) can easily open the even when you're inside.  The most surprising part is that the bed mattress is not laying on a box spring, but one that is made completely out of wood!  WTF!  Talk about old school!  The rooms as well as the casino as a whole was filthy and very dusty.  I would have given the hotel one star, but the buffet made up for it with the very organized staff (using two-way radios), quick changing transition from breakfast to lunch to dinner (prime rib included), and the vast majority of all-you-can drink beverages at the self service station.

The basics in hotel amenities were not met. I've never in my numerous travels and staying in hotels have had to call guest services multiple times to simply be hung up on after being respectful and courteous as a patron to only ask for additional towels, nothing ridiculous (2 was the number to be exact). Quite frankly I'm disgusted with the lack of caring of particular individuals in their position to represent the hotel in its entirety. No real issue with the hotel itself but if it reflects the personnel it hired I don't know what can be said.

A+.

Excalibur meets some very basic needs for a hotel in Vegas. Amazingly it's the only one that meets them all. And yes I've stayed in nearly every hotel on the strip.

1. Friendly check in staff. They put you where you ask. In my case I know the rooms facing the courtyard are the queitest, and have comfy beds. 

2. Affordable. Weekday nights including resort fee are roughly $60. You get a $20 coupon to the steakhouse so it really is only about $40 a night

3. Fun casino. Plenty of slots. Fun feeling, and machines are a bit looser than other casinos on the strip.

4. Parking. On most days you can find a parking spot near the elevator for whatever tower you are staying in

5. Making you feel like a valued customer. In all of my times staying here and dealing with employees I've never once felt underappeciated. I mean heck I was using a $20 coupon at the bar and getting exactly $20 worth of food. One would think the bartender would look down on me. Nope always a smile.

Place is really a hidden gem. Other MGM properties could learn a lot from this place. As a result they probably make tons of money. With little overhead. Being nice costs nothing.

Stayed here several years ago for a wedding. We were only here for a few days and at the time I was underage so I don't have much to say about the nightlife\/gambling. We didn't know our way around vegas as far as rooms\/upgrades and such since we're from Jersey, so we got stuck with a room that was located smack on the first floor. I remember it being relatively noisy, people knocking on our door all night. The room itself was a standard hotel room, no frills or fuss. It was a bit smelly and there were stains on the sheets but it wasn't anything I haven't seen before since my family and I are used to staying in budget hotels. Since I was a kid at the time, the pool was the only thing remotely interesting, and I have to say I was pretty impressed. There were several pools, even one with a waterslide and it was relatively family friendly for the most part. Try the breakfast buffet. For the most part, the hotel was okay especially for those on a budget. Close proximity to the major hotels\/main portion of the strip which is another plus.

I stayed here with my boyfriend for our 3 year anniversary. It wasn't the best looking hotel. The rooms were mediocre; reminded me of a motel rather than a hotel. The outdoor structure of the hotel is beautiful, but the inside needs a desperate upgrade. The buffet was ok; I had better ones off the strip. The only reason why we chose to stay here was because of the affordibility. Big mistake! I'm sure there were other affordable hotels on the strip that we could of stayed in. Lesson learned!

This hotel was cheap when we stayed. $29 (plus $28 for the resort fee. Which everyone is required to pay fyi if you havent stayed in a vegas hotel before). The beds are clean, but the bathrooms need an upgrade. It Looked really dirty so we didnt use it. The rooms do not have a fridge! Very hard when your toddler still drinks milk constantly. 

We checked in at 6:30pm and the line was very very long. It took us about 35 minutes to reach the front desk. Customer service was good. Very friendly staff.

Pro of this hotel is that it has a lot of places to eat inside. And its walking distance to coca cola, hersheys, mgm, new york new york and a few other good places

This is a *family* review of the hotel.

We chose the Excalibur because it was cheap and it was a Castle---the easiest choice for any parent taking their 4-year-old princess to vegas.  (We chose this over Circus Circus because of the proximity to M&M World & Rainforest Cafe). 

I was leary of all the negative reviews, but we took the chance anyway.
Here is our 2 cents:

1.  The 2-room suite in Tower 1 was updated and very nice.  King bed was super comfortable; two bathrooms, extra large jacuzzi tub; two tv screens.  Very clean.

2.  The double-queen room was NOT updated, but was VERY clean.  Bathroom was large, no tub, nice shower.  Nothing special, but for a $40 price tag on the strip, we had no complaints.  (There just wasn't anything "pretty" or "special" about the room.

3.  The pools are located near Tower 2.  If you want a room near the pools, then expect to pay a higher price because Tower 2 is considered "contemporary" accommodation, meaning ,they've been upgraded & remodeled.   Convenience is key when you want the pools, otherwise you'll be walking a mile from Tower 1 thru the heart of the casino each time you come\/go.

4.  The Excalibur is NOT the hotel for the young & hip.  Most of the crowds we noticed are older adults, or families.   This was nice--we were not barraged with obnoxious drunkards or "sex." as stated in other reviews.  

Yes, there are a lot of rednecks here, but this has a few positive benefits!
a.  Rednecks spend most of their time playing the slots, so they don't bother you.
b.  obnoxious youngsters trying to get laid do not hang out where the rednecks stay

I will say this:  our weekend stay was quite pleasant.  The kids & families around the pool were polite (i'm really not kidding) and friendly.  We never once felt that we needed to shield our daughter from anything.  

Based on other reviews we thought this would be the skankiest hotel ever, but it was quite the opposite.  I think theme-hotels are outdated, but there was nothing wrong with this hotel at all, unless you want to compare it to all the swanky $400\/night hotels down the strip.

BONUS:  convenient walkway to the Luxor--which is a huge hit for youngsters.  Also, a tram connects Excalibur, Luxor & Mandalay.

M&M World is 0.5miles away from the front entrance of Excalibur.

We stayed in Tower 2 on the 23rd floor. 

This was my first time staying here just last weekend and we "upgraded" our room on the drive from AZ to NV and apparently the "upgrade" was just a flat screen tv and slightly bigger room. Disappointing.  The curtains were dirty. The nightstand was dusty. Our table was not clean. The bathroom floor was not clean. The AC smelled really gross at certain times when it was running. We thought there was free wi-fi but there was only a cord to connect your laptop to the internet. We were unable to fix the clock radio to say the correct time..at least 3 adults tried and we failed.  Got into our room by 1230 or so and turned down the sheets in our bed to find crumbly stuff, not sure what it was, so we had to call room service to come change the sheets which they did.

We put our trash can out in the hall to make sure it got emptied and people starting filling it up with their own trash. So we put it in front of the janitor's door and never saw our trash can again. 

Other things I did not like: the hallway smelled disgusting (like vomit someone said)
The ice machine ran out of ice and was never restocked the last couple nights we were there so i had to go up or down a floor to get ice for my ice chest since there was no mini fridge in the room. There was a safe though.
The pool was not that exciting but it was okay. 

They did take off the upgrade fees when we checked out but other than the fact the outside looked cool obviously and inside there were some good places to eat and shopping , i'd not want to stay here again.

We loved the Oxygen Bar near the taxi drop off. It is one of few remaining oxygen bars in Vegas and it was very revitalizing and surprisingly not too expensive for typical Vegas prices. The night of 7\/15, a young lady named Alex was our host and did a great job, even upsold me on their essential oil spray, Willow Wonder. Best souvenir I've ever brought back from Vegas! Great job, Alex! You were a wonderful host and salesman and deserve a raise!  We will be back, and all of my buddies at the airport are jealous they didn't hit you up this trip too!

They really can use a makeover here and the lines for check in are completely ridiculous. Nothing about this stay really impressed me. They have a few descent places to eat here and the arcade was ok. Don't think I will be staying here again for the lackluster environment and the fact that  they charge daily for parking, and the parking itself is another nuisance. Maybe this place is good to take kids like Circus Circus is.

My fam and I are staying at the Excalibur and decided to eat in the building. We decided to have a late dinner around 10pm (yesterday). My bro and I asked for a table for 2 and the host insisted the bar, but we wanted a table. The wait was 10 minutes which was fine. We waited outside and watched many excited women run to the thunder down under show. 10min later we got sat and I wondered why we waited if half the restaurant is empty? Probably understaffed for the night. No biggie, I wait tables in Houston, Tx...I understand. Waited 15min...no one acknowledged us. Then a nice lady came up to take a complimentary photo of us and left. 5 min later still no server. Which was funny because there was a comment\/review card on the table. The first question was: did you receive drinks within 2-5 min. Something like that. My brother got impatient so we left. Restaurant was clean and I saw the bus boys cleaning. I love the food reguardless. Food is a 5 if I could rate it. The portions are fabulous, but unfortunately I never got wait staff to take our order. Got chinese instead in the lobby next to popeyes. We got our food within 5 min! Maybe next time we visit we'll try again!

Elavators are slow. Valet is unorganized.  Not the best hotel I've stayed in on the strip. It served it's purpose for a nice 3 day trip. Just want to get away and do not need all the bells and whistles of a 5* hotel this is a good choice.
Loved the stay! Check out the gym, its really nice and up to date! They also have the knights dinner show !

Was a great hotel..royal tower had been upgraded..they Comped us a refrigerator. Staff was friendly..I've stayed at other hotels in the Vegas area and this had comfortable bed and pillows. Noise level was descent. Will stay again

Pro: the receptionists and cleaning people are very nice and sweet

Con:
1- I arrived at 2:30 pm on Monday Jan 2nd and had to wait in line of 250 people to check in. The line was 1 1\/2 hours long
2- out of 30 stations for check in only 16 were opened
3- the hotel and beds, rooms, bathroom are all very old
4- the casino is real dirty
5- restaurants except (the Camelot steakhouse) is horrible and overpriced, do expensive that I went to next door hotel to eat. I have already provided feedback on Camelot.
6- two rooms over from me ordered room service, the leftover was in hallway for exactly 38 hours!
7- the price of hotel, if you make advance reservation is twice higher than if you arrive to Las Vegas and make reservation. I paid $132 a night vs. $64 when I got to my room

Don't recommend this place.

AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!! Customer service here is terrible. I paid for a reservation and when I arrived, I was told they had no record of my reservation. I showed the manager my confirmation number and my bank statement. It was to no avail. The manager Tichelle Wood offered an apology, but did not resolve my issue. I could not believe the lack of training and professionalism. I would never recommend anyone to stay here. It's old, dirty, stinky and lacks trained employees.

Of all of the hotels of the same price range, I would rate this one the lowest.  The room is very dated. The furnitures are extremely old n dated (badly scuffed). No power outlets except for the one in the bathroom. Of course, one can always crawl behind the dresser or unplug the lamp. I do not think power outlets by the desk is too much to ask for. There is no safe and small fridge. The pillows are nasty.  The room, bed and bathroom are clean. The toilet flushes and there is hot water. This place is one step above Motel 6. But motel 6 does not charge you for bringing your dogs and it's cheaper.

Its cheap, but its a step up from the Tropicana where I stayed in June. The Excalibur is cliche, but it doesn't try and hide it. The prices draw you here, its still on the strip, and the rooms are clean.

I wish there was a damn coffee maker though...I can deal with no fridge, but no coffee! 

Its weird they replaced the classic wizard with the dick's tavern guy? 

I don't get it.

We spent alot more time here than I would have had we not had a bunch of BOGO drink coupons from our stay at the Luxor next door.
You can tell the wear and tear inside, its not one of the newer, fancier, artsy\/designer type hotels, its more old school Vegas.
Service at the bar was slow, people here a bit as well. 
Not the best or the worst, they did satisfy my middle of the night Krispy Kreme craving so an extra star for that.

The pool. Was amazing. On Saturday, we hung out poolside, had a DJ that was just sick. 
The food was awesome, not one place was bad. The bars were actually really nice there. The club was ok. The rooms were very clean and for the price it as totally worth every penny. They had a large variety of games. Poker tournaments, roulette, blackjack, slots of all types, we love wheel of fortune and of course craps to name a few. Everyone was very nice. The shuttle to and from the airport was a plus. However, do not expect a direct drop off. So if you are flying from FL to LV and then you drive around for 20 mins, it will annoy you. But, it was very cheep, like 12 bucks. We did have an issue with our bathroom sink. 
We called housekeeping and in 10 minutes the problem was fixed. Thanks and good luck!

What an awful hotel, you think you are getting a great deal but by the time they insert all of the fees ($28 for a resort fee.) You might as well go somewhere w no fee, it would probably average out. The room I stayed in Tower II room 70 oh lord where to start? The nicest part was the bathroom and they were not nice, walls are paper thin, the cable wasn't working and I was ignored at the front desk. SOMEONE HAD SHOT THEIR DNA ALL OVER THE HEADBOARD!! No joke, I was disgusted but they let me know they were booked but they were sorry I had no other options but stay in the room I was in. Hallways were neglected with glasses,bottles,beer cans. They are not kept up well at all. In all dark and dingey w awful service. STAY AWAY!!

Pathetic is one word to describe this hotel. 

The rooms are dingy. 

The elevators are super slow. 

Most of the lights in your room will not work. 

They don't even have Showtime or HBO on your room TV. 

And the entire hotel smells like stale smoke. 

What else should I of expected from a hotel that prides itself on the number of beer pong tables it has? 

And don't get me started about Saturday night at the casino. 

The hotel basically turns into a whos whos of wanna be Las Vegas gangsters. I will give Las Vegas wanna Be's some credit. 

At least they keep their pants up above their ass unlike their California compatriots. 

Yuck!

I booked a NON SMOKING room 4 months in advance.  On day of check in I called to make sure my room would be held. The employee on the phone quickly said they would hold my reservation and HUNG UP ON ME without taking my name to note a late arrival. 
Upon checkin the front desk clerk asked if a SMOKING ROOM WAS OK, I said NO. His response, "Well that's all we have". 
Then the COMPUTER SYSTEM CRASHED. 20 minutes later, I had the keys to a room that smelled like a WET ASH TRAY. 

Rude service on the phone
Rude service at the front desk
Complete disregard for my health and comfort 
Did not honor my request for non smoking

The hotel itself is an older facility & as we usually stay at a strip hotel, only when a convention or seminar we are attending is in Las Vegas, we had not ever frequented this hotel or casino.  

We did a little Super Bowl staycation & were upgraded to a suite.  It was surprisingly lovely. Lots of drawer storage, a separate living room & small dining room \/ wet bar & refrigerator.  They even have 2 washrooms in the smaller sized suite.  The bathroom floors are marble, jacuzzi tub, & granite sink tops. 

The furniture was in keeping with the castle motif & appeared very clean & nicely kept.  
The bed was very comfortable & we had a TV in the living room & the bedroom. 

The Super Bowl Party was on the 3rd floor and there was an assortment of foods and deserts  to choose from.  Drinks were also included.   Our waitress Bobbie was very kind & kept our area clean & our drinks filled up.  She made our Super Bowl Sunday a very fun experience!

We reserved our room online and they did not have it when we arrived. Instead of a standard, non-smoking King we got a standard non-smoking queen, but no big deal. I did not get a gross hotel feel from it, though there was hair and a used q-tip in the ice bucket. Hotel staff seemed a little too morning work oriented for Las Vegas though. House keeping came EARLY the next morning-I think our door opened around 9:15am when we were still in bed, but she came back later. The next morning power tools started around 8am.
For $35 a night, I can not really complain, but there is no coffee pot or microwave in the room and you have to pay extra to use the pool. There ie internet in the room (cable, no wifi)

I dont know why everyone bashes the excalibur. I recently stayed here and it was great. Everything was clean, nice flat screen tv, walk in shower. Got upgraded for free too. :)

The pool was off the hook!

This is not a great hotel. DO NOT GO HERE if you want to stay with your kids after 7 o'clock pm. There is no bathtubs in any of the rooms unless you get a suite. They charge their guest $10 for parking a day. $10 to use the pool after 7 pm (adults only) NO KIDS ALLOWED. Suite's are $50 more then the regular rooms and only offer 1 bed. Toilets leak. Showers don't have shelves for toiletries.

This place is is a wreck. Years ago it was the first hotel I came to when I had my fake i.d., it hasn't had a dime put into since then. 
The rooms are filthy, the bad and towels are stained and falling apart. The ac units are loud, just...wow. 
The food choice are at the level of Walmart and the buffet is inedible. 
The worst part and oh how annoying, you can't walk 10 feet in the hotel without someone trying to sell you a timeshare. I mean 10 feet! What a buzz kill. 
The only saving grace about this dud was the pool area. It's nice and looks new, if the timeshare assassin hadn't accosted me I would have given it 2 stars. 
Run away and look forward to the day when they blow this place up!

Horrible experience! Took our kids for my birthday. Water slides were closed but no mention of that till we walked down to the pool to find out ourselves. No mini fridge, no conditioner. You are forced to buy water for $3 per bottle inside the hotel. Their are time share salespeople waiting by every elevator and entrance of the hotel trying to get you to sign up for a tour. They are relentless!!!!!!!! My two kids suffered from asthma the 2 nights we were there from people on our non smoking floor smoking pot! This is the smokiest hotel I've even been in and I have stayed at plenty. They also charged me an extra $200 on my credit card that I am fighting to get removed now. Needless to say, terrible hotel! We rearranged our flights and left a whole day\/night early but they wouldn't refund that night. I would stay clear of this outdated smoke filled hotel at all costs. No family friendly at all. Also we had to 1.5 hours to check into our room. Very outdated hotel.

Stayed here for wedding in town for three nights. They attacked us at the hall about going to a time share property even before we had checked in and several times. I felt like i had to fight them off! The room was just okay, no wireless internet, you have to have wired internet. If i would of know that i should have brought my laptop, but what about the ipad i had, no way to plug that in. The floor we were on was one big party all night and when i called the desk it still didn't stop. I say the price was better than any other hotel in the area, so we know why now

Hear me out on this one before you judge the rating.  This is definitely not the nicest hotel on the strip and it is far from it.  But, if you're a college student who wants to stay somewhere on the strip within walking distance of most places or you can take a cab without paying a crazy amount, then this place is the place I'd recommend.  Most of the time the rooms well below what you'd pay if you stay just across the street at the MGM and for what it is, it's pretty good.  There are other cheap places to stay at on the strip such as IP (The Imperial Palace).  Even though that place is at a better location, it is much much crappier than the Excalibur.  

If you're looking for luxury, don't stay here.  Fork out the money and go down the strip to the Venetian or Bellagio or Wynn.  If you're a broke ass college student who wants to go to vegas and probably wont spend much time in the room anyways as I once was, then this place is good.
Booked with three separate reservations through MyVegas rewards, I have had to come down to two times during my three day stay to replace the keys not working.

Just to begin this review of this hotel, I want to say that you should be warned that as of right now this place is going out of it's way to sell it's time share called The Grandview.  We were constantly and irritatingly molested by Philipinos in suits at every single entrance to the hotel and casino.  Even walking over to the Luxor we were molested to recieve "free gifts" that required you to give them $50 to go be at the mercy of some stupid time share demo.  Having to tell someone you aren't interested ten times a day when you use the bathroom next to the doors in the casino is unacceptable.  And they are just doing it to save money on advertising.  MORONIC!!

Now for my review of this horrid hotel:

For staying in one of the "new remodeled rooms", I had many baseline expectations that weren't met at all, when I put down these baseline expectations, note that we moved to THE ORLEANS after only one day staying here for 1\/3 the price and had the opposite of every single one:
1) The internet was cable only and as a computer geek, even I couldn't get it to work no matter what I did.  No WIFI to speak of.
2)  No coffee maker, something that is standard even in every Motel 6.
3)  The sheets had several rips in them.
4)  No water pressure to speak of in the shower.
5)  Old concaved mattresses.
6)  EVERY line, from signing up for "MLife" to checking\/out was about 30 minutes long.
7)  Computers when we finally did get up to the head of the checkin\/checkout lines, were down BOTH times.

For the price we paid for the room, approx $99, for the one night, we SHOULD'VE had:
1)  Refrigerators in the rooms.
2)  The "WIDESCREEN REMODELED ROOMS" in Tower II had no HDTV to speak of, the reception was so bad that the 27" tubed tv from 1995 in The Orleans put it to shame.  Their technology should be well upgraded by now, it's 2011 and when you "remodel" something, it pays to update the hardware.
3)  Where is the WIFI?  This was a MAJOR complaint, for the price of these rooms, you would think it wouldn't take much to put WIFI connections throughout the building and create a sweet network.  I could do it and I'm not even a professional.

All in all, the bad things outweighed the good things, which were really nothing that great that I couldn't get it anywhere else or expect any less.  If you want to be molested by Philipino imports every second and be in a dirty expensive hotel then by all means, go here.

If you want an awesome experience with no lines, great food, wifi, and don't mind being off the strip at $35 a night, then go to The Orleans.  Great GREAT experience here.

Bedbugs bedbugs bedbugs!!!!I have never stayed at a hotel with such poor customer service and lack of hospitality to say the least. BEDBUGS in our room made the whole trip a nightmare. Spent 25 hours waiting for our laundry that they sent to Phillip's cleaners to "decontaminate" our items. Multiple pieces of our most expensive items coincidentally went missing.  Spoke to Kendall assistant manager of the front desk and Margarite  manager of the front desk who had no compassion or urgency to help us. I just cannot believe how many hours we spent waiting around for a new room, our laundry, phone calls that were promised to be returned & were ever returned. Highly discourage any of my family \/friends to go there again

Casino Review 

They have a blackjack machine.  I have never seen one of these outside of this place.  I am afraid of sitting at a table and screwing the other people up, so I sat at this machine.  It was fun fun fun!  I made money! yay yay! haha

I agree with previous reviews. The place looks old and tired. A few
years ago I would have suggested this as the best choice for 
families with young kids--not anymore. Pool is disgusting. Alot of
people are attracted by the cheap rates,but if you shop around you'll
find similar deals at much better properties.

This hotel wasn't bad. A little dark, so it works with the castle theme. lol Cool decor for kids\/adults. It was a decent price. Not as fancy, but didn't really matter to me since I didn't go to Vegas for the hotel stay.  Out of the two nights I was there, I only slept 3 hrs.

As many have said, this property has not been updated in ages. That being said it is a hell of a deal when you're averaging between 30 and $40 a night stay on the strip. It's kept pretty clean and the valet service is actually better than average for Las Vegas. A great place to stay if you're in Vegas on a family vacation with kids. The tournament of Kings is always something to experience. Dinner and a show. For one great low price. I deal with a lot of out-of-state customers who stay at this property and enjoy it.

My fianc and I have 0 complaints whatsoever.! We really enjoyed our stay. For example, my fianc and I had bought some toothpaste with us. Housekeeping inadvertently threw it away. I called to housekeeping and asked to speak with a manager. Antonio called back immediately..found some toothpaste that they don't even have and personally bought it to me.! Thanks a lot.!!

First and foremost: no WiFi.  That being said, we couldn't locate WiFi much of anywhere.  Well, not free WiFi, anyhow, which doesn't make sense to me.
This was my first trip to Vegas and I've got to say: I probably won't stay at the Excalibur again unless somebody else is paying for it.  That's not entirely true.  The room was a standard hotel room, not what I was expecting in a casino.
The bed wasn't uncomfortable, but it could have been better.  I'm probably jaded because of my satin sheets, but I slept just fine.
I didn't have any problems with the staff.  In fact, everyone I dealt with was nice and courteous, but mostly unobtrusive.  The cocktail waitresses on the floor only forgot one of my drinks.
Overall, staying here wasn't a bad experience, but it wasn't overtly impressive.  It's the kind of place you'd stay if you're traveling on the cheap.

Update: I've been informed that Krispy Kreme has WiFi.  I'm assuming that's the one in the food court, but I can't test it.

Definitely check out Dick's restaurant downstairs! When the evening\/night hits, make sure to carry your ID with you if you leave your room or good luck trying to get back up. McDonald's and Dunkin Donuts is open really late in the building. 
Located somewhat on the end of the strip and the pool is nice.
The double bed room we had was nice and looked newly renovated based on what my friend said. The Roundtable Buffet was really good. However there was no refrigerator.

Despite the bad reviews, and my last experience I had at Excalibur, this last one was a pretty good one. 
My boyfriend & I arrived the day after my 21st birthday on November 7th of 2014, we were beyond exhausted, I was ready to pass out the moment I walked off that plane, and the fact that I knew I had to wait until 3pm to check in already made me want to cry. 
The moment we got to the front desk, our agent was really accommodating. And even know they almost didn't accept my boyfriends company card to accept our payment for the rest of the balance I'm sooooo glad they did. I could tell the supervisor was pretty pissed and she clearly showed it on her face(she was rude) when our agent accepted our payment anyway. And she also waived our early check in fee for my birthday! Pretty sure her name was Ilene, or Ivette, something like that. She was amazing. Her supervisor (can't remember her name) not so nice. 

Now on to the room....the time before this past time my hotel experience was horrible so I made sure we stayed in one of the new rooms that the Excalibur offers. We stayed in the contemporary tower king view NON SMOKING room for 3 nights and it was amazing! A little small, but still really fun. It was really clean every time we entered the room after a long night of partying. The bed was so comfortable the moment my boyfriend and I layed down, we passed out. they could've had an extra blanket or two since it's freezing in there, but other then that so comfortable. We had a really great view and no problems with our room at all.

The rest of our stay was amazing. Except for the annoying people by the elevators trying to get you with show tickets and packages also at the entrance of the hotel. One night I had to put a lady in her place, they never hassled us again. 
So besides those annoying people, the horrible cigarette smoke in the casino(it's Vegas), and the really rude supervisor. We had a great time. 
We probably won't be coming back for awhile, gonna try something new for our next vegas trip. But I'd definitely recommend the excalibur for anyone trying to go to Vegas, not spend so much on a room and still have enough to have a great time.

Over priced, charge you a resort fee for things you can't even utilize. Only good thing was the shower pressure. Toilet backed up and it took them 1 hour to come and fix it.
Booked online for $69 and ended up giving up an additional $80 in fees. Last time

I spent two nights here last summer. A couple oddities about this place:

1) No microfridge in the room. Considering we're in the desert, having access to a device that can instantly chill beverages would be much appreciated.

2) The layout seems rather clumsy and it's easy to get lost, especially if you're a n00b like me. This could be a way to promote gambling though, so it's a moot factor here.

3) While checkin for us was relatively harmless on an early Saturday evening, the following day the checkin line extended all the way to Carson City. I noticed a couple reviews from last August (when our trip took place) commenting on this issue, that some people had to wait hours just to checkin. If I was stuck in that line, I'd be pretty pissed. That would deter me from ever coming back. Hopefully they've since fixed whatever the issue was.

The buffet was really good. Extensive selections and a massive dessert bar. Price was okay too. They were in the process of adding more parking which I think was desperately needed so by now that should have taken care of itself. 

Overall it's big, loud, you're gonna get lost a few times, but it's a place to stay. I'd come back, but I think after my last visit I determined Vegas just isn't for me. I don't care about gambling or the nightlife. Eating good food and spending money on stupid trinkets while exploring the history is really what I came here for. So, you know...whatever. 3\/5 seems okay for this place.

We came specifically for the games.  

I came in empty-handed and I walked out w\/ a pink skunk.

"Thank you, brother for winning this for me."  

If you are wondering, the boyfriend lost to his brother at the game (haha).

Stayed with my 16y\/o son, June 3-7, 2013.
No problems with the hotel. It was clean, front desk gave us a room with a Strip view just for asking. Never a problem with the time share people, we just said 'no thanks' when we walked past them and some even got to know us since we stayed for 5 days.  The sheets on the bed were very soft.  Bathroom clean.  I wish there was a tv guide or something to show us what was on, besides what channel was what.  We stayed in a Contemporary Room.  2 queen beds, non smoking.  In Tower 2 on the 23rd floor. Room 23209 I think. It was room 9 on the 23rd floor at least. :)  

Food court has a McDonalds, Cinnabon, Hot Dog on A Stick, Popeyes (who got both my orders wrong...), Krispy Kreme, Tropical Cafe and chinese food I can't think of the name, maybe another but I can't remember.... Prices where about the same as our local ones, maybe 1-2 dollars more. 

I made the reservation through the southwest.com site when I booked my airfare. 

Air conditioner worked great, no smell, all lights and outlets worked great.  We called the concierge once and got a great recommendation for dinner that wasn't very pricey.  Iron and ironing board in the closet. 

The only thing that keeps it from being a 5 star for me is that there is no fridge in the room. Maybe you can rent one, but there is no free one.

I would stay here again. Unless I won the lottery, in which case I would stay at the Venetian. Duh.  :D

I have yet to stay here, I stayed across the bridge at the Luxor Hotel & Casino. But I'm here to review Excalibur Just by spending time in the Hotel\/casino. When you first walk in to the hotel\/Casino you get a overwhelming smell of smoke, which is obviously what to expect in a casino. .BUT it was extremely hard to breather, it was very stuffy. They need more ventilation. The selection of gambling choices is very nice, better than the Luxor I must say. && for FOOD there is a huge selection of different foods to choose from. I probably would not stay here though, due to the fact I had a hard time Breathing.

I like Excalibur.

There, I said it.

I'm sorry, but I do!  For the past 11 years, we've visited Vegas at least once a year and I'm pretty sure we've stayed here 6 or 7 times!  Yeah, it's cheesy.  Yeah, it's dated (I hear Tower 2 is better but we stayed in Tower 1).  Yeah, there are much nicer looking rooms at other hotels on The Strip.  But considering I'm only in the hotel room for only a few hours a day, I'm OK with all of this.  Besides, as someone who worked in the hotel industry for over 5 years, I know that just because a hotel is new and nice doesn't necessarily mean it's clean...lots of gross things can happen even in the nicest of hotels.  But I digress.

For us, the rooms are always clean, the bed is crazy comfortable (seriously - best night's sleep I've had in awhile) and it's cheap!  I'd much rather stay here and save $40-$100 to spend elsewhere than stay somewhere else that's "nicer".  

Also, there are a lot of good food choices near Excalibur.  Very important - we've stayed at other hotels before where they don't have the best choices and you have to venture pretty far away for a good meal.  When you're on a strict schedule, having good food close by is important.  

I don't use the pool or the spa, so I don't have any opinions about those but I've heard good things.

So, yeah, it's not perfect but it gets the job done.  And that's all I can ask for!

No, the Excalibur is not a fabulous luxury property. But if you want an inexpensive room with all the conveniences of staying on the Strip, it's a good place to stay. I've gotten rooms here a few times when I've been partying at the nearby properties and did not want to drive home. I come here when I want a cheap and easy place to sleep and not much more. Check ahead for cheap deals; when I've stayed I usually got some pretty nice perks like restaurant credits and such. No, this is not the kind of hotel where you'll want to chill in your room for long periods of time. It is; however, the kind of place that works really nicely when you just need a place to sleep and store your items. It is a rather old hotel so just don't expect more than the bare minimum for your room.

I'm becoming a snob.  I much prefer the Cosmo, THE Hotel or MGM Signature but what the heck it was a conference rate.  It just sort of makes me think of that creepy neighbor as a kid with the strange relatives who visit wearing shorts black socks and sandals.

I first experienced Excalibur around 1996 or 97 shortly after it originally opened and really loved the place back then. I have to admit that I haven't been back inside the place until recently... but boy... have things changed. I would say it is your average casino\/resort on the strip and that the room prices are fair and can sometimes be some of the cheapest in Las Vegas. It has a great location right next to Luxor and NY NY and a stone's throw from places like Mandalay Bay and Caesar's.
That being said, I would use the term "run down" to describe my room. The walls had stains, the curtains had stains, and the carpet had stains. I even had some very small spots of mildew in the shower. Look, I'm not expecting the Four Seasons here, but I do expect it to appear clean. We also experienced problems with the air conditioner... it seemed to only blow warm air. We called the front desk and they had someone fix it while we were out. When we got back, we just let the A\/C run because we were afraid to touch it and have it blow hot air again.
As previously mentioned by some other Yelpers, the parking can be a bit far if you get stuck way out there. Not too bad of a hike unless you're stuck in 104 degree heat.

Not bad if you are on a budget.
A $27 dollar room? = You get what you pay for.

Overall: a very pedestrian experience.

PROS: cheap, great location, prompt fix of A\/C
CONS: dirty, run down, in need of a lot of TLC, parking can be a nightmare if you get stuck way out there.

Budget hotel. Huge, but because it's a castle, the hotel os over run with kids. Just as much as Circus Circus. I took in Tournament of Kings, which was a great show. Buffet does leave a bit to be desired as well. Excellent location on the strip.

great place to party,
 haven't rented a room...
I gotta give it two not one because I love the medieval times, but this place needs a serious renovation!

This is a budget friendly hotel. 
The best part is having Dick's Last Resort and the ability to take the express Tram to Mandalay or walk across the street to Coyote Ugly and Dualing pianos. 

The rooms were fine, but didn't have a fridge or mini bar. Be sure to upgrade to the contemporary room, otherwise the rooms are pretty old. 

Parking is free

The roulette tables are old and slow. The attendees are pretty dry and unhelpful. Even when you tip them, they just slide it to the side without a thank you or anything. 

The casino still allows smoking, so prepare to either wear a mask or be congested if you aren't a smoker.

This is an older casino\/hotel.  The price is lower than other spots on the strip however, it is worth the stay if you are wanting to save money.  The rooms are older but the price comparison the hotels next door.  Also, these hotels are all owned by the same company.

MGM, Excalibur, Luxor, and NY NY.

You pay for what you get. We stayed in tower 1 which we were told will get renovated in July 2015. It is showing its age. Our room was dusty. My wife and I are sensitive to dust and couldn't stop sneezing during our five day stay. Almost checked out early because of this. Hopefully the quality of the rooms get better after the renovations. Until then, I would not stay here again.

I dont understand why the ratings are so low here... Unless your staying at MGM or the Palms I think you really have to understand how the rooms are in vegas. The room I stayed in was an older room which was fine with me, how long are you actually in your room in vegas anyways?? The bed was THE MOST COMFORTABLE BED! The room was really dark (which was fine with me because I could sleep in just fine!) Yes, there were a lot of parying going on when we stayed and I dont think theres much of a noise curfew but what do you expect?. Theyre is a little bouncer guy sitting at the elevators to make sure you actually stay there which is good, unless you dont carry a key or have limited ones! The casino was okay, didnt really gambel there much. I walked over to MGM (they have a walkway that connects the two) They do have quite a bit of places to eat there which is good if you have the munchies but most close at night.

My father in law owns a time share at the polo towers so I usually stay there but... If I couldnt, Id think about staying here again for sure. You deff save money!

In order to review this establishment properly, I have to put my review into context. First, we paid $150 + taxes & resort fees per night. This is probably the lower end for hotels on the strip. Secondly, we stayed in Tower 2, which is the newer of the two towers.

That being said, our room was average. It was clean and provided all the amenities one would expect out of the 3-star hotel. The plus side is that Excalibur is also a casino hotel, so you get that "Vegas experience" without emptying your pockets. Having the tram there is nice too.

The I'd probably give the hotel staff somewhere between two and three stars. I didn't have any trouble checking in, but my girlfriend did. The manager was able to sort it out, but not before the robot employee complicated the process.

Side Note: The lot where we were parked was adjacent to our tower, making carrying our luggage up to our room quite convenient.

It was my first time staying on The Strip, and overall, the stay was pleasant. If you don't want to burn a hole in your wallet and you want to stay on The Strip, I would definitely recommend Excalibur.
Remembering coming here for concerts and dinner. Been to the buffet a few times. The last concert was for Andy Lau, the sound system was horrible.

I stayed here for one night in the cheapest room last Saturday, because they gave it to me for practically free, and given how crummy the average rating was, I really thought I was going to have gotten what I paid for ($34, i.e. just the "resort fee"). I was very pleasantly surprised. Now, granted, this was *only* because I got a sweet deal - it does absolutely feel like a cheap hotel still, and the casino area feels dingy and old, but if you're only here to sleep, you only have to walk through the casino area for a few minutes. 

The room itself was... pretty nice, really. It had a comfortable bed, a decent amount of space, a perfectly functional shower, a perfectly functional toilet, a perfectly functional AC, the wifi worked and was reliably fast enough to do things on, nothing was notably dirty or dusty... I had no complaints. It was clearly not a luxury room, but I've seen much worse. There was even an online checkin and checkout system, so you never had to deal with the checkin line. 

Obviously this would depend on the price, but I was worried I'd be sorry staying there even for the price I paid, and absolutely not - I'd stay here again in a snap if I got a good price again. (Obviously I can't make any guarantee that my room was normal - maybe I just lucked out, in which case, I'm glad I lucked out.)

Only major complaint right now, which may have factored into why I snagged an almost-free Saturday stay, is that they're doing some construction on the convenient walkway between Excalibur and NYNY, which means you currently have to walk all the way around to MGM and then cross on the other side of the street (or at least that was the case last weekend), which is a pain - hopefully they finish that soon.

Crap.  Crap.  Crap.

Went here figuring out that rooms don't matter too much.  It was cheap.  I'll give it that.  But that's all it's got going for it.  Some random false alarm at 2 am doesn't help its case either.

We stayed here over Thanksgiving from the 20-23 in Tower 2. I was a little bit nervous after reading some of the reviews after we had already booked the room,  but I have to admit that a lot of the people that have posted on this are way off. 

First of all, our room was very clean and I didn't come away with any "bumps" from any bed bugs or anything like that. Secondly, for the amount we paid ($150 for 3 nights), this place was awesome! And it was only that expensive because thanksgiving night was higher than the others. It was just like the place I remember from when I was young and we had the whole family with kids and everything.

Also, one note I also want to make is that it can be really hard to find $5 blackjack tables and they had them, however during peak hours they changed them all to $10 tables. If you were already sitting there when they moved the tables up they grandfathered you in at the $5. 

Overall, resort fee and everything that everyones complaining about, I'm going to give it 5 stars because it was everything I expected for the value and didn't have a single issue. I will say that the timeshare people are annoying, but you can shake them pretty easily.

Well to start off, the check in line was long, but was handled efficiently. Seth checked us in and was very professional and efficient. Upon getting into our room, our non-smoking room the smell of smoke was at an all time high. I went to lay down and noticed the covers were not clean. I then pulled back the cover and there was a lot of hair on the sheets. I immediately called the front desk whom transferred me to housekeeping. Housekeeping apologized and sent someone up to change the sheets. (Which I feel we should have been offered another room considering we had just walked in the door and the bed was nasty) Considering this was a special weekend for us, I decided not to complain. The TV was horrible, there were no signal on most of the channel and when we did get a channel is was very blurry! UGH! The bathroom was very big and clean so I thought until I dropped my phone on the floor went to pick it up and ..... there were nasty stains all over the floor under the sink! UGH x2. My husband and I had dinner reservations so we started to get dressed an hour before and come to find out the iron did not work. We called housekeeping again and it took them 30 minutes to bring us another iron... (Irritation on high now). Upon returning to our room for a long night and few drinks there is line to get to the elevator to get to our room because apparently after a certain time you have to show the security guard your room key before you are allowed up to your room. UGH, AGAIN!!!
Needless to say I will not be staying at the Excalibur ever again.
The only positive thing I experienced here was Dick's Last Resort. Place is very fun to visit!!!

A cheap stay on the Strip, and it's connected by indoor walkway to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Decent fast food in the food court (like Krispy Creams, Auntie Anne's, and a Buca de Beppo). The room was plain as can be and had wired internet connection. At least the wire was long enough to reach most of the room. 

The rest of the place was kind of like the room: plain and serviceable. A castle theme is right up my alley, and this place does a fair job of it. But the Lynyrd Skynyrd restaurant is a menace. Karaoke is fun when you're doing it, but listening to the horrible singing while trying to have a decent game of poker was annoying. I feel bad for the dealers and servers in earshot of this place.

Me and my boyfriend stayed here for easter weekend and also to celebrate my bday . We stayed in tower one it was pretty nice, descent. The room was nice updated bed was really comfy the restroom was ok... The only thing that suck was my view and that it didn't come with a mini refrigerator and how it's almost one of the corner hotels. Other than that it was great.

This place is absolutely hideous.
I have not spent a lot of time in various Vegas hotels, but the large cockroach that I saw in the bathroom this morning coupled with the lack of a refrigerator apparently in every room puts this hellhole the at the bottom of any list.

Not to mention the upgraded suite that has a lovely view of a cinderblock wall.  Or the room chair with a gross stain that I don't even wanna think about.

Really disgusting...

I love the Excalibur. In fact, I just got back from it yesterday! This is pretty much the only place I stay in Vegas. I usually can get a room for 2 people (but you can have 4 because of two beds, it will be our little secret) for like $50 to $65 per night. Weekends are usually about $75 to $80. That is crazy. Sure you might be able to stay in a nicer place for a little bit more, but the reason I stay here is because I play here. They have a great poker room with limits as low as $1 to $3 spread. The dealers are super nice too. Before June, you used to be able to get a free buffet for every meal if you played in the poker room, but they have since done away with that :(. I usually buy in with $40 and sit there for HOURS getting free drinks!! The rooms themselves are great too. Eat me if you can't sleep in them. You shouldn't be in them for the majority of the time anyway. They also have high-speed internet in the rooms for $11 per day.

BED BUGGGS!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!

We booked a 2 nights stay and on the second night we got bit up by bed bugs. So nasty!!! Once we turned the lights on they scattered in every direction!! Security came up to make a report and once he pulled the sheets....dozens of them. To think we were sleeping on that is disgusting!!! The manager then asked if we wanted to switch rooms?!! What kind of question is that?  No i love waking up in the middle of the night, half drunk, and getting bit from head to toe. Idiot.


So as the security guard was catching the bed bugs in coffee cups we packed up our belonings and headed to a new room to shower and leave this nasty hotel. Management or house keeping or security never once checked up on us. Horrible establishment!!! 

DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! BEWARE OF CREEPY CRAWLERS!

The interior of the hotel seemed somewhat outdated. However, everything was clean. I stayed in the Royal tower, King bed. The room was spacious and clean. The channel selection on the tv was not so great. The entire hotel also has a particualr smell that some may mind. It was not a big problem for me. I would stay again due to it being a fairly good price.

This reminds me of the song Inner City Blues and Donny Hathaway's "In the Ghetto"

Two BEAUTIFUL songs, and I conjure them to cope with how incredibly disgustingly awful this joint is.  Dingy is a good word.  It is like an endless universe of cigarette smoke stumbled in here to destroy any hope you could have with dealing with this place.

Coyote Ugly?  Are you kidding?  The casino is weird, the dinner is sooooo bunk, I am sure the buffet was okay but I was running out with my finger ramming into my temple in panicked irrationality.

I wouldn't even go inside later to get to the tram quicker.  Please.... don't make me go to white trash disneyland strip mall again.  Please.

Oh yeah... Dick's Last Resort?  funny... you can get "crabs"  hahaha... but it kills the awful theme, you know?

Personally I love this place. It fits my price range, not too cheap, not too expensive. Plus its close to a lot of other stuff on the strip. Why would you want a crazy expensive room that you're only gonna sleep, shower, and crap at? Just save some money and stay here. Everybody dance now!

I was really scared to book here because of some of the reviews. Seriously though what more can you ask for inexpensive rooms on the strip & they WERE NICE ROOMS! We stayed in the resort tower which has been recently remodeled. NOW my only concerns as to why I would probably not stay here again or some changes that they should consider making our 1.) really you're gonna charge me everyday for parking when I'm already paying a dang resort fee!?! 2.) no mini fridge in the room??? Even motels have those.... From just the resort fees I paid you you could buy a mini fridge for that room. 3.) get rid of those dang annoying employees that try to stop guests every 50 feet. GUESS WHAT NO ONE IS WINNING EXCALIBUR because you have an employee that feels like crap for being ignored all day & then you have guests that feel harassed. Get the picture? Also to the people complaining that there are no bath tubs in the room. You really wanna lay in a tub naked where thousands of other people have been before. We all know hotels are cleaned they ARE NOT DEEP CLEANED. Baths are to take at home!!! YA NASTYS. Oh also I'd like to add wifi is pretty fast.

MUST READ ENTIRE REVIEW 

One of the worst places to stay in Las Vegas. 

Its bait and switch here. The room showed online is not the room you'll get.

From the minute you walk in it will be regret if you stay here. The stinch of cigarettes and foul oder that reaks from the entire place will drive you crazy. On top of that the staff is horrible. You are honestly better off at a Motel 8. Hands down has to be the worst hotel on the strip. 

CONS:
-DIRTY
-NO WIFI
-PHONES GET NO RECEPTION
-FOUL ODER
-STRONG TOBACCO SMELL
-SPIRITS ARE WATER DOWN TO THE MAX
-TV CHANELS ARE HORRIBLE
        * No premium channels
        * Scattered blurry channels
-STAFF IS THE WORST
-ROOMS ARE IN HORRIBLE CONDITION


I've stayed at Motel 8, MGM Grand, and Aria. Without a doubt this hotel is horrible. 

Disgusting Popcorn ceilings, non-functioning irons, old foul sheets and blankets. 

I choose this hotel to save money and would of rather spent the extra $50 to go elsewhere. Reviews are bad here for a reason .... Don't make the mistake I made.

Good for the price! In a pinch I found myself staying here and really why do you need luxe in Vegas? Most of the time I'm out and about and when I'm done, I'm just looking for a place to crash. Is it old? Yep. Kinda smelly? Uh huh. Ghetto with tons of kids running about? Absolutely. But if you're looking for a place just to rest your head and you didn't plan ahead Excalibur fits the bill. It's loads better than Tropicana which is about the same price. Plus, it has the Tournament of the Kings which is hilariously corny but fun and cheap either way.

Pretty much everything I said in my initial review of Excalibur nearly 5 years ago still stands, but after staying here again recently, I was really disappointed with the lack of cleanliness, and the fact that they still don't have simple amenities like WiFi in the rooms.

I arrived here after booking this place for a decent price a few months ago ($195 total with tax to arrive on Thu and check out on Sun), and was immediately hit with the "resort fee" of $20 per night during check-in, which was over and above what I'd already paid for the room.  The woman who got me checked in (Carla) was very friendly, but it seems that Excalibur books people into the cheapest rooms possible initially, then offers several "upcharge" options; There's a laminated display at each check in desk with photos and options like "Get xyz room for $20 extra...get a room with abc amenity for $40 extra", etc.   On this trip, I simply needed a place to sleep, shower and check e-mails a few times, so I stuck with the basic room.   She asked if I wanted a high or low floor, close to or far from the elevator, etc.  She gave me exactly what I'd asked for, and I ended up with a pretty incredible view of the entire strip!

When I first walked into in the room and sat my bags down, the first thing I noticed was that everything was coated with a think layer of dust!  The side of the TV stand, the telephone, the alarm clock, etc. everything was dusty, as if simple and basic cleaning never takes place here (see the photos I posted). The chairs were stained, there was no proper desk in the room, and when I moved one of the chairs, there were peanuts and other crumbs from a past guest.  General cleanliness evidently isn't a priority for this hotel?!?

Know also that there is no WiFi at all available in the rooms.  While high speed internet (the speed actually was quite good) is free, the only way to connect is via a CAT 5 cable that I was unable to find until I picked up the dusty and crusted phone receiver and called the front desk, only to be told it was stashed under the TV.  I was a bit surprised to find that, in 2015, there was no WiFi available at all in the rooms, paid or not.

As mentioned in my last review, it's a bit sad to see that they haven't maintained this hotel better than they have.  Excalibur was the largest hotel in the world when it opened in 1990, and lots of things here are really showing their age.  IMO, it really wouldn't take much to bring it up to a point once again where it looks and feels newer while still keeping the medieval theme, starting with some newer paneling for the elevators and some odor neutralizers for the casino floor!  Seriously, this place smells like the old Tropicana did 10 years ago before her facelift.  Now the Trop has no odor at all, Excalibur should take a lesson rather than spraying the sickly sweet air freshener they seem to try and use everywhere to mask the smell of old booze and cigarette smoke!

We had made reservations several months ago to stay here next week.  In the meantime, we went to Luxor to see Blue Man Group in June and had to pay for parking. Didn't think much about it since we weren't staying there. This morning, my husband asked me if we had to pay for parking at Excalibur since we were staying there. I said of course not, but I will make sure. I was WRONG! Parking is NOT included in the $30 resort fee! Its $8 per night!  Umbrellas at the pool in 109 degrees heat are not included in the resort fee either! IF you want an umbrella, that will cost you a min. of $40 per day, during the week. Higher on weekends\/holidays. The reviews on the buffet (included in our reservations) were horrible! The reviews on the service at the pool were horrible. In fact, not a lot of positive reviews on anything. 
We usually stay at Green Valley Ranch in Henderson (15 min. from strip) for FREE! (because we gamble quite a bit) We thought we would try something different and stay in Vegas....BIG MISTAKE!  We cancelled our reservations at Excalibur. After paying the $53 cancellation fee, we are saving $377 staying at GVR, knowing we will have an amazing stay!.  NEVER will we "try something different" EVER again. 
GVR has the BEST pool, heated year round. 1\/2 sand bottom 1\/2 regular. Plenty of umbrellas, comfortable lounge chairs and amazing service. Infused water available at 2 different locations, comfy towels. You are treated like every staff member is so happy to see you.....No charge for parking\/umbrellas.
Rooms are amazing with huge bathrooms.....even the less expensive rooms.
They have military days on Mondays. Vets\/active military get free coffee, 2 for 1 buffet, and other perks. Wed. is senior day if over 50.  $4 movies (recent releases, on site), free coffee, 2 for 1 buffet, and other perks.
Excalibur offers you.................NOTHING.
Don't settle just to be on the strip. What you save at GVR will pay for a taxi, and the appreciation you feel from the staff is priceless.
The adjacent outdoor mall with fun shops, coffee houses, restaurants, water feature for kids to play in is also a plus.
Excalibur treats you like peasant's, GVR treats you like royalty.

Stayed here with a friend for a quick Vegas trip. The rooms are large and clean but it was the casino that really was negative for this place. I'm not a smoker and I live in a city where smoking indoors is illegal so I wasn't prepared for the all the cigarette smoke that seems to envelope this place. I doubt that carpets have at all been replaced since their opening. The smell can really get to you and for me I had a headache and watery eyes. 

The pool at the resort was ok. the adult pool was rather small and they sure do overcharge for the buckets of beers. 

For my next trip I think I'd do better to stay further down the strip near everything and also a much cleaner\/fresh resort.

I stayed here two weeks ago with three friends and we figured that we would stay somewhere cheap and spend on other items: food, drinks, clubs, etc. It's Vegas. Who stays in the room anyway? 

The bathroom and shower were shockingly large and the bed was actually one of the more comfortable hotel beds I've slept on. Not kidding. 

The pool was decent and if it weren't for the fact that I, in true scatterbrained fashion, left my bikini at home...then I would have enjoyed the pool and the pretty people it showcased much more. 

The BEAUTIFUL view our room had of a brick wall, however, was not ideal. Nor was the general quality\/smell\/atmosphere of this hotel. 

Moral of this monologue: you get what you pay for.

Dirty ... Spend the extra money and book at a cleaner hotel. Even though they have housekeeping "clean" the rooms, the sheets are still not changed. So gross. It was too late for me to change locations but if I could have I would have. 

The only star I'm giving them is the fact that there is a lot going on in the hotel, which keeps it "interesting

The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were clean.  The shower is HUGE.  We stayed in Tower 1, there was a pretty big flat screen tv (even though Tower 2 is supposed to be the "widescreen rooms").
