When I booked the room it was 50% off since we were traveling during the week. I told the computer there would be a second and third person and paid extra at the time to have them added. I didn't understand why there were still only two sets of towels for four people (because why do they ask, I know it's to collect the money, but at least give us the amenities). In any event, I called for towels and they came right up. 

Our toilet clogged and maintenance came up to fix it - they believed that the floor below us was having a problem which was wrecking havoc on the 25th floor (where we were). They had to come four times to plunge it and took hours each time. I'm pregnant and have two kids with us so the toilet not being stable was a bit of an issue. 

Finally, they had a problem with my credit card and ended up pending over $1000 on it (rather than the owed $300 plus $50 A DAY in potential "amenity fees"). Thank goodness that wasn't my debit card because that would have created a real spending issue for us. They were able to fix this upon check-out (which meant we had to wait about 30 minutes in line rather than using Express) and even waived two "resort fees" which saved us about $70. I appreciated that. 

This is not a fancy hotel. It's adequate for lodging but the price is right (if you don't tell them you have four people, anyway). It's location is what I think keeps it in business - near M&M's World and Coke as well as easy to navigate to New York, New York, the MGM, and Luxor, etc.

I stayed at the Excalibur in July of 2015. 

 The Good: we enjoyed their buffet, food court, and  . My kids had a good time at their arcade. 

The Bad: pool was so overcrowded! Could barely move. The room was very run down and paid quite a bit for it! Check-in took a long time and had to wait a while longer for our room to be ready. 

I would not stay here again.

I stayed here back in August of 2016 for a weekend with my friends.  It was the first time I actually came to Vegas and as a whole the hotel and casino was very accommodating especially for the price.  Compared to other hotels on the strip, this hotel is much cheaper.  They have a late checkout option which is worth considering if you're trying to maximize the most of your trip.  The pool is pretty huge and is nice, but is more geared for people who are coming with their kids.  The casino has some of the lowest minimum bets during the day time, so I preferred gambling here over some of the other casinos.  All in all, it was a very decent casino, and I'll strongly consider booking my stay again for my next trip to Vegas.

So the prices are really decent, but with that being said let's get to my overall experience. 
My husband and a group of friends were in town November 12-14th for the big boxing match up of Pacquiao vs Cotto. 
I know as much as most people know that when you go with a big group of friends- you are never in your room but a few hours to sleep, change, shower, and actually that's pretty much it. Had we brought our two kids it would be a different story. 

We stayed in their wide screen room in Tower 2. The wide screen rooms were completely renovated and looked really nice actually. Very sleek and modern. 
So we checked in pretty late on Thursday night, nearly 11pm. We then dropped off our luggage and met up with friends. When we got back to our room at 430 am we noticed there was no remote control to the flat panel TV- again were in what they called the wide screen room. Not wanting to be charged for someone else taking a stupid hotel remote I quickly called to the desk to let them know and to bring one up. You would think that at 430 am on Friday morning they would be quick to bring it up. NOOO... I called twice once at 450 in which they replied it would be any minute now, then again at 515 to try and cancel it since I was falling asleep- to which they replied they couldn't stop him since he had been dispatched already- REALLY? you couldn't get on the walkie talkie think he was obviously carrying with him to tell him the guests were asleep?!?! nope.. nada.. didn't happen my friends- 535am and "POUND POUND POUND" not even a gentle know but an angry pound pound pound... quickly got me to the door where a not so friendly bellboy shoved the remote in my hand and quickly left... WTF.. so of course I went down the next day and complained.. and they were nice enough to refund that whole night to me... and I got comped for food.. yay... 
The buffet was okay.. the drink service was great. I was on a budget and this place fit perfectly into it. I would probably come back for our next visit.

me and my wife came to the hotel at around 11am to only find out that the check-in is all the way at 3 pm . Since my wife was tired and we already had waited for 1.5  hour i went to the recertionist and was informed that for approx.$30 they can give me the room on the spot, immediately, and after i agreed and paid  the fee we went up to the same room that was given to us on the first place.
my question is why are they making people wait if the room is already cleaned ?
i`d understand if the room is not ready or cleaned and then for $30 they give me another room that is already been cleaned but that was not the case, it was just greed and they wanted us to wait and see when will we pay the extra $30 , that is not what I or anybody else calls HOSPITALITY!
I would never go there again!

Not. Going. To. Stay. Here.  EVER! Again.

The kids enjoyed the ONE simple water slide at the hotel's pool, but other than this, I could never lodge here again ever. I don't know, call me high maintenance, but I like my hotels a little more upscale. That really just sounded totally snobby, but it no way did I mean to be, just using words to describe the hotels I would prefer to stay at. 

This place is ideal for those who are on a budget and not caring to stay at an older, less modern hotel with minimal amenities. If you come to Vegas to party and the hotel room is merely a place to spend a few hours in to sleep, then this place will work for you.

Put it this way I rather stay at the Stratosphere than this hotel. I've stated at Treasure Island and loved it, stayed at Stratosphere and was ok, stayed at Ballys it was good and the last one I stayed at was New York New York and loved it I should've booked there but noooo I wanted to try a different hotel... bad idea.
All bad from the moment I checked in till the moment I checked out.  The worst part was that I woke up every day with different bug bites I am pretty sure they were bug begs, my boyfriend had bites all over his body too.
The list goes on Long Lines, no fridge, no safe, light in the bathroom went out twice on us, no mirror to take pictures (everyone likes pictures or at least to check out what outfit you will wear for the day) closet to small, dirty carpet and chairs and paying for parking is stupid we already paying for the hotel no need for that charge. Encounter a rude racist lady all I was doing was asking her to direct to me the elevator and she was such a bitch I called her out too. Soo disrespectful! Will not stay here ever again. Hotel location not the best. WIFI did not work. Parking was very tight. Will not recommend!

Ya ya ya i know wtf am i doing staying here.

So i go into the room.  The shower wall has a HUGE ball of LONG hair stuck to it.

I drop my mascara.  The toilet has PUKE all down the side of it.  

My best friend stayed here and when she put her key in and opened the door, there was a couple fucking on the bed.

Need I say more?

Would not recommend! This was my first time in Vegas and I chose this hotel because it was the cheapest on the strip. When we first got to our room, they gave away our 1 bed King, so my wife and I had 2 queens. Then when we got to the room we had little hairs on our towel. So we requested more and when it came, it smelt like smoke. So every day we got new towels and they all smelt like smoke. 
So being my first time, I didn't know you don't get a refrigerator in the rooms, so when I called about it, the lady on the phone was very sarcastic about it. 
The only good experience is the bell mans, valet and waitress in the hotel. Everything's else sucks! 
I will now be coming back to that hotel.

I stayed here on 8\/16 & 8\/17 of this year. The staff was lovely and the room was clean. I do understand the reviews about the age of the hotel - but you get what you pay for - if you are wanting extravagance perhaps a medieval theme hotel is not really for you. It is an older hotel so it is expected that there would be some wear. Also the overwhelming smell of coconut to cover the years of tobacco is one of the first things I noticed on the casino floor. 

 I found the staff to be very responsive - and I tend to be a bit high maintenance. Our TV did not work when we arrived and we went to dinner and came back and it was fixed. We also required a few extra blankets and towels and they brought them up by the truckload - even though I called at 4am.

As far as security is concerned; we had accidentally left our door open during the day and within 15 min security was at the door to check that we were ok. I did notice there was not a chain lock on the door and perhaps that would help with the reviews regarding thieves.  

The pool was nice even in 107 degree weather. It was full but we were still able to find 5 loungers in the middle of the day together. And the music was nice but not too loud or distracting.

I was a bit disappointed that the valet was full the whole time we were there - that is one of my favorite features in Vegas - free valet parking.  And though it was a bit unorthodox to only have a shower (no tub) but I did not miss it at all. 

Also it would be great to have wireless Internet - even if it is only for resort guest - the wired Internet was not helpful for our cellphones and iPads. 

When we went to depart the c\/o was a breeze done through email and they stored our bags so we could wander through Vegas without melting our souvenirs. 

Overall I am pleased with my experience at Excalibur.

My husband and I stayed here for two nights while in town to see Weird Al.  Upon arrival the valet was full and the parking situation was confusing. Finally we lucked out and a car left so we were able to snag a spot. 

We entered in a side door near tower one and the nice gentleman checking to make sure only hotel guests entered the hotel portion pointed us in the right direction. 

While checking in the guy that was helping us seemed nervous mentioning that the only rooms left were on the first floor since we had reserved a king bed. He genuinely seemed relieved when we didn't care. He was very friendly and checking in was as smooth as I could have hoped for. 

The room itself was definitely out dated but it was clean and comfortable. As we were only there for two nights I left the do not disturb sign up all day since I prefer to not have people enter my room. Because of this I'm not able to comment on their maid service. 

As for the casino we played the slots and video poker for many hours going up and down. We also played black jack at one of the tables for a few hours. The dealer (Shar) was very nice. Ultimately we broke even, not bad for two days gambling and drinking. 

My main complaint was that the waitresses did not come around that often and on more than one occasion we went over an hour before someone came around, even when we were at the tables. Once we had a waitress come once she came back quickly because we tip well, but when sitting down in a new area having then come over initially was definitely a problem. 

Overall this was a good place to stay for a good price in a good location. I would stay here again.

Good place when I went to it years ago (1993) when the motion rides were working, the carpets seemed fresh, and it was really family friendly.

Not the same way anymore, judging by the way they had dancing girls shaking their stuff to blaring music at the bar near the entrance.  The waitresses still wear the same bland outfits though, and in the cases of some of the very mature (read old) ones, that's not a bad thing.

We just played the slots here for a while and listened to a band playing at the Octane Lounge, as the rather beat look inside of this hotel doesn't exactly scream "stay here!".

Arrived at Excalibur at 4am with a 2 year old who was very fussy and tired as a last resort, cheap room until we had to check in to the Mandalay the next day. When we first arrived, 2 agents were both with different large families who were complaining about something. I waited in line for *45* minutes along with many other frustrated people. There were two "managers" on duty, or whatever they were just standing there looking like idiots. When we would ask them for help, keep in mind some people were just asking for new keys because they wouldn't work, they put us back in line and didn't apologize for anything. As I finally came up to the counter, the woman gave me a bitchy look as I asked her if she had any half day or special rates, (we were staying for 3 hours) and she snapped at me! THE RATE IS 80 DOLLARS, IF YOU WANT TO GET A CHEAPER RATE, BOOK AT HOTELS.COM. So my fiance went and called hotels.com, and after being on hold with them, walked back and was told that they don't do same day reservations since it was before 3 am. Went to sit back down and my daughter was screaming at the top of her lungs and throwing a fit. They kept staring at me, and did not care to help, after everyone had ending up walking away because of the wait. I am not impressed at all. I can appreciate the atmosphere of the Excalibur, however the customer service is terrible, and they should be ashamed that they would ever treat guests that way.

Very unprofessional. And very offputting.

I wavered between three and four stars for this place, but since I'm attempting an overall rating, I went for four.  The lady at reception was really nice and informative.  Since my booking came with a free buffet for two, she pointed us to the best one on the list, which turned out to be delightful.  I was actually nervous after reading a lot of reviews about this place reeking and being run down, but was pleasantly surprised when I walked into a fresh, clean room.  The water pressure was slightly weak, but it wasn't unbearable.  Also, what really pushed me to the fourth star was the view.  Half the time, we found ourselves just sitting, pregaming and admiring all the wonders of Vegas out of our window.  This is definitely a hotel where you get what you pay for, but considering you aren't paying much, it certainly beats a motel six or econolodge!  I would definitely stay here again!

Best thing about Excalibur was Buca Di Beppo. Employees were very nice there and had good food. They are the only restaurant at Excalibur who let you charge on your room. Hotel room needs to be updated. Barely supplied towels, had to request more. A lady staying at Excalibur warned us to check for bed bugs because she found one herself. Luckily our room did not have any. Water at Starbucks is normally free but they charge you $2. Valet was $15 for 24 hours which is absolutely ridiculous. Excalibur is not as kids friendly as I thought it would be. Pool was nice, had a water slide for kids. All in all I would not recommend this hotel and would not go back.

Just stopped by to check out  Popcornopolis. Ended up trying a couple flavors BBQ and Pumpkin Spice. Both were good, bought a bag of the Pumpkin Spice. 

Service is good, we were greeted right away by one worker then later offered samples by another.

As for the Excalibur itself we never stayed here so it's hard to review it. Maybe about ten years ago we ate at their steakhouse which was good. 

Casino looks good, lots of table games and good mix of slots. Though I've never won here I still come to try my luck. Good location and you can catch the tram to the Luxor or Mandalay, best of all it's FREE!

Cheap fun place the croupiers were so friendly and helpful. Our  room was clean and had everything we needed.  The bed was very comfortable we had a widescreen tv and a great view of the Luxor and airport.  Walls are on the thin side but I have found this a common problem in Vegas. The bars are fun and the cocktail waitresses come around frequently. It is an economy hotel if you are looking for 5 star quality then this is not the place for you if you are looking for a cheap fun place close to everything then come here
Fun place, really really expensive but you're in Vegas so what do you expect. Friendly employees and Great atmosphere.

We stayed there this past weekend, and i have to say the staff at the front desk, well Micheal, what a great young lady, very sweet. so we check in around 7pm and finding the front desk wasnt hard to find. the room was not to far from the elevator for one. the pool was quite nice but wasnt heated as much as i liked but that wasnt bad, for being in Las Vegas. 

okay the neg. one of our room laps had a shortage so if you touch it, it made a strange sound and blinked. On our second night my friend noticed that our sheet had a rip on the side of it. The pillows.. well only three. which was odd. Were very flat.

Good... The room was a nice size, flat screen, bathroom was really good. Our room was on the 25th floor and facing New York, New Your and MGM. and what a view .. OMG we sat looking at the rids and the lights. Great ROOM.. Great ROOM.. 

Nice Hotel, and would stay there again..

I thought that I read somewhere that Excalibur had remodeled their rooms?  If that is true, they got ripped off!!  The room we were in was old, dingy and outdated, other than the flat screen tv (maybe adding this constitutes a "remodel?".  I would compare it to a cheap motel, rather than a hotel on the Las Vegas Strip.  Also, the parking situation is ridiculous.  I understand that I was there on a Friday night, but how is your valet full? Once I got parked in the garage, it felt like a 4 mile walk to the casino.  It does seem like they are trying to jazz up the place, with the additions of the BBQ restaurant and burger place, and Dick's Last Resort.  But this place is old and played out and could use a major overhaul, especially for the rates they are charging.

Of all the hotels I've stayed at, I always enjoy every stay at Excalibur. It may not be the most luxurious or prime location, but it's on the strip, good rates, and there is so much to enjoy in the hotel--shows, bars, restaurants, casino, amenities, etc. Another important note, I've never had any issues with my room or reservation. :)

Wonderful hotel! Fabulous place for families to stay. The Buffet was the best- all day passes were worth the money. The tournament of kings was wonderful to bring my 3 year old. And the fun dungeon was A++!!!! Once the kiddies are asleep , Th adults can go downstairs to the casino, and the mums can check out the Thunder from Down Under make revue if they're feeling adventurous ;-) I recommend this hotel!'

Came here on a business convention and was quite disappointed. We had asked to be put all on the same floor but we were spread out throughout the hotel. When I got in my room, it smelled of extremely strong cinnemon and their spray air freshner. The window was bolted closed. The bathroom door knob was broken and the toilet handle kept getting stuck so the water kept filling the tank. I had asked for a different room after a few hours and I was moved to a different floor. 

In the new room, the bed linens were old and thin with holes in some areas. The air conditioner unit was old fashioned so it was either on or off. The only good thing about the room was that it was quiet. 

One co-worker walked into her room and it smelled of smoke... being a non-smoking room, she requested a different room since she couldn't breathe. The bedspread had cigarette burn marks on it and the pillow case was full of holes. Don't the cleaning people inspect the linen before they use it? I saw the pillow case and it looked like it should have been a rag! She was not happy with the room and requested another change. Third room was still atrocious but we were on the same floor so she kept it. 

One other co-worker walked into her room and checked out her bed. There was a bug on her pillow. She called housekeeping who denied there was a bug on her pillow even though my co- worker was staring right at it and watching it walk. Housekeeping didn't even show up. They offered her a room change which she took. We ended up on the same floor. 

The other 3 co-workers all thought the Excaliber was a complete dump and was asking why our company sent us to this place instead of somewhere more nice. Our company responded with because they were very cheap rooms! The others were not happy with their room but did not say much except that for sure next year, we will insist we are roomed at a much much nicer hotel. 

One good thing was the tram from Excalibur to the Luxor and there is a bridge that you can cross to go to New York New York. But I will never stay here again.

DO 

NOT

STAY 

HERE.

Our room got ROBBED by a crackhead that broke through our hotel room window. Somehow their crappy security let him get through to a restricted area, allowing him to break into not just our room but FOUR OTHER HOTEL ROOMS!!!!!!! The workers here were VERY rude to us, & not accommodating or sympathetic at all. We asked to be reimbursed for the items that were damaged and stolen from us and they did not give us JACK!! The least they could have done was reimburse us.

And on top of all that, our room was DISGUSTING and the entire hotel smells like SHIT!!!!!!!!! 

Seriously, do not stay here. Worst hotel on the strip.

P.S. Their buffet effing SUCKS!!!! Also, we had a view of a BRICK WALL!!! WTF????

Meh is the best way to put it. 

My review is based on the general areas like the casino and eateries. The place is nothing special. It looks cool from the outside, who doesn't like big castles? The gaming floor is pretty big but it's just like every other Strip hotel. Nothing crazy that makes me want to stick around.

The people there are not very friendly so that knocks off a star. I don't think I'll return.

They have alot of food options on the second floor. The food court is always open and ready. I love baja fresh. They have an awesome shrimp burrito. The fun dungeon downstairs  is filled full of carnival games for the kids and arcade games. The rooms are average. Tower 2 rooms are better cause your right by the  pool and gym\/spa.

I spent Memorial Day weekend here strictly because it was the best deal on the strip that me & my buddies could find. Plus, we didn't plan on being in the room very much anyway. There were 5 of us, and it ended up being about $100 each for 4 nights. That's means more money for boozing up. 

The hotel room was better than I expected, it looked clean, nice big lcd tv, pretty spacious overall. There was no view of the strip where we were staying though. The buffet suck big ass too. Luckily, I didn't spend much on it (2 for 1 deal = $10 each). There was a food court with the standard food you'd expect to find: McDonald's, Quizno's, Krispy Kream etc. There was also a Dick's Last Resort.

The pool was cool, but there were way too many granny's and kids around. I was almost ashamed to be hungover and reek of alcohol around them. 

The best part of the Excalibur though, was the Party Pit. That place was the business.

Stayed there for two nights beginning June 26th and checking out June 28. From the time we walked in to the time we walked out, Super Star Service. The room was very clean and when we needed anything, they had it to us very fast. One of the best resorts in Vegas.

Stayed at the Excalibur this past weekend, the location was great. Easy to get to the Mandalay Bay and New York, New York hotels. Cleanliness of any hotel room are always my biggest thing so I can say I was quite pleased with the condition of my king size room. The bathroom was also spacious and clean. Hotel staff were friendly and I loved that Johnny Rockets was right in the hotel for a quick bite to eat. I have no complaints other than not knowing the shuttle had to be scheduled 24 hours in advance for trips to airport. That wasn't mentioned when I checked in. I would stay again and recommend this hotel.

My family and I stayed here March 30th for 3 days! The hotel room was nice and clean. Plenty of towels. The bathroom was clean. The beds were comfortable and the pillows were soft. We had a nice view of the strip, Looked very nice at night with all the lights. My kids enjoyed the fun dungeon! Lots of games. We enjoyed our stay!!

Employees at the hotel were very friendly and attentive. We were informed the hotel did some type of renovation. We were supposedly "upgraded" to a resort king room . When we got to our room the first impression was terrible. The strong, foul, odor of smoke was overwhelming.  Bed sheets were dirty and appeared to have blood stains on them. Bathroom was disgusting and not even properly cleaned. We found a sock in the bathroom which obviously no one swept or mopped floor after previous guests checked out.

This is not the hotel for you if you want a VIP experience. But if the hotel is needed just for a place to sleep and\/or be hungover, this place does the job. Nothing fancy. My room and bathroom were pretty large. Basic services. NO COFFEEMAKER! There are quite a few coffee places on the main floor though, so that's not a problem. Seriously, for a place to crash after days of exploring\/partying, this place was perfectly fine. 

I switched from another hotel in the morning and was a little peeved that I had to stand in line for over 20min just to check in. And I was early, so had to pay an additional fee. But whatever, it is what it is. 

I ate at Dick's and went to the Thunder show twice, so really enjoyed the offerings they had in the hotel. I'm not a gambler and didn't spend a dime in the casino, but they definitely had lots going on.

Price is more than worth it. If I go back to Vegas, I will be staying here.

I stayed here in May, it was okay.  The room, although non-smoking reeked of smoke, but was clean.  The hotels are a walk from the main entrance though, so bring a rolling suitcase! 

TOO many children, which I find hilarious since they have the party pit with the half naken women dancing around on stage (which is rather entertaining none-the-less). 

We didn't have any luck at this casino though and the table hands were unfriendly.  I always like to have friendly table hands who help make gambling fun.  Even if I'm losing money, if I'm having fun I'll stay a while.  It's no fun to lose money with no smiling though haha.  

Dick's Last Resort is a must visit for those not faint of hear (NOT KID FRIENDLY).  It's my favorite restaurant and probably Excalibur's redeeming factor.  If not for this restaurant they would probably only get 2 stars from me.

In the end, you get what you pay for.  It's cheap and it will do.  Who really spends that much time in their own room in Vegas anyways?

The big castle in the front will definitely draw you in and you'll spending the night in a castle, minus the extravagance. 

The hotel has a lot of rooms and a lot of floors! The ground floor houses the casino and the floor above that has the food court and souvenir shops. Food court consist of: Popeyes, Hot Dog on a Stick, Cinnabon, Krispy Kreme, Yogurtland, Starbucks, Chinese food, etc. 

The room itself was decent, it was comfortable and fairly clean. I did notice stains on the chairs and curtains. There were dusts around some of the cabinets and tables too. The bathroom was fairly spacious with a shower and long sink area. 

There's no complimentary breakfast here so you can order room service or go to the food court. Overall, decent stay, not bad nor entirely great but it didn't smell and and we didn't find anything alarming. It's about 8 mins from the strip by car (~20-30 mins walking) so you can take Uber at the Royal Tower pick up area or go to Monte Carlo for a free shuttle.

Let me say I been to vegas many time and stayed all over the strip. 

I booked the hotel through a getaway package with jetblue. The price and the review made me a little worried so I booked the contemporary room.

My plane arrived at 2 and we got to the hotel at 2:30. I got in line for check in and it was long. I swear this line was crazy. Maybe bc of the time and it was at check in time but was it long. I got to the front and ask if I can check in a little before 3 she said yes and she was very nice. Then we decided to upgrade with a view of the strip. 


When we got into our room. It was very nice and clean and a perfect view of the strip on the 27th floor. I was very pleased. It came to be like 70 dollar a night with the resort fee and all the upgrade. Please see pic below. Everyone on the floor was supper nice. The cleaning lady and staff was on point. The only draw back for the room is the noise from the street. Even on the 27th floor out of 28 you can still hear it. So consider getting a view of the pool for noise purposes. 


We stayed an extra night due to flight cancellations and they accommodate it. 

We got the 20 bucks early book and we used it for 2-3 drinks at the bar and got some coconut water. And just tipped like 8 bucks 

The spa was amazing. For an extra 10 bucks I used the sauna and steam room and my skin felt brand new

I hate the timeshare people. Get a hint when I make no eye contact. 

Overall, I would stay here again in the contemporary rooms. It was a good time and it exceed my expectations. The spa would bring me back bc it was nice and quiet and I was alone.

Stayed there from 20Jan11-23Jan11 in room 27219. Was very nervous at first because of all the negative reviews. The last thing I remember about this hotel was how bad the smell was from my previous trip in 2006 & 2008 but I was surprise to see how things had changed. The smoke\/cigarette smell is not longer there..I mean not as bad as before. If you get down there early enough when everyone else is still in bed you could smell the nice airfreshner smell.
I'd return back to the same hotel anytime.

Shhh...what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas.

Was only here to donate $1 to a progressive slot with a $10 million jackpot and have dinner at Dick's Last Resort.

Whoops, secret's out!

I was verbally assaulted at the pool, tablet was scratched, and the recreational supervisor Jurgen was no help and extremely rude in my opinion. His ONLY choice was to move US to a smaller pool. No compensation or discounts, nothing. We moved immediately to the MGM. Where the staff gives a shit about the safety of their guests. We even got a free dinner after we told them about our ordeal.

Recently stayed here for 3 nights. I arrived at 11:00pm, so the wait at check-in was not bad. I probably waited 10 minutes. I saw the line the next day during the afternoon and there was at least 100 people waiting. So if you come in the afternoon and not an upper MLife member, prepare to wait. I consider this hotel a budget strip motel, so do not expect a 5 star hotel.
I booked a royal preferred king room. I was a little disappointed they put me on the 2nd floor, but getting downstairs was quick. Also, I did not plan for being in the room much, I am only there to shower, sleep, and shit. Room was relatively clean. It was not immaculate, but it was not filthy. Bed was a little on the soft side (I prefer more of a stiff mattress), the pillows were a little to fluffy (I prefer more of a flat pillow). Air conditioner was a little noisy, but kept the room cool. There was a constant noise happening, kind of like being in an airplane during flight. It was not coming from the room itself, but it did bother me the first night. Water pressure was a joke, I feel sorry for anybody with thick long hair. House keeping was there daily and replaced all towels and soaps. Wi-Fi was OK, seemed at little spotty at times, but I was just checking e-mails and not trying to stream anything.
Self parking is $8.00 per day (I know people are upset about it). When you first arrive you get a ticket at the gate, but then use your room key to get in and out. Parking was charged to my room. I did not use valet parking. There is a designated Uber and Lyft pick-up and drop-off point.
Casino looked clean. I am not much of a gambler, as I live next to two Indian casinos and able to gamble when I want. Everyone I encountered was friendly. Yes, this is an older hotel. Like most casino's people are allowed to smoke. It does not bother me, but expect it. It is not as bad as it was, say 20 years ago. Ventilation seemed pretty good. Your in sin city not Disney land. There is a variety of food shops, but expect the higher Vegas strip prices. Easy access to NYNY and Luxor casinos. I did not use the pool and  I did not use the tram.
Would I recommend this hotel? If your on a budget, want to stay on the strip, and not expecting 5 star resort with Michelin rated restaurants. Well then you can try your luck here. Will I stay here again? I don't know yet, I will check out other options, but I would not mind staying here again.

I feel like I'm way too nice with my hotel reviews, but if there's a clean bed and nobody bothers me I'm more than happy!!

Honestly though with the way hotels on the strip is going with charging parking fees, it's slowly starting to feel like I'm nickel'd to death except these nickels are 20 dollars a night for parking at a resort that I'm staying at. Like honestly, it's such a rip off. The MGM hotel that doesn't is signature and that's because they have mandatory valet service.

Excalibur is one of the cheapest hotels you can stay at that is on the south strip and you really can't be too disappointed. Hotels aren't meant to stay in while awake. If you're looking to go out and have fun Circus Circus might be the best bet but if you're looking for a bit more comfort to rest up in then Excalibur is your hotel.

I felt like I was in Disneyland when I stayed here -- maybe because I spent more time in Fantasy Faire playing video games and winning stuff animals than actually playing in the casino. The medieval theme might be too much for some, but I thought it was cool. The rooms were fine, nothing special, just the view of the castle from our window. 

Do not check-in between 12:30pm - 3:30pm, it gets really busy and you'll be in line for an hour. There are check-in kiosks, but most were out of service when I tried it and the ones in-service, the lines were also long. 

I've lost some money already and was not planning to play anymore the first night I was there, but Pat G. wanted to try to win so I followed him around the casino. We sat at two empty slot machines next to each other, I watched him play. After a few minutes, I wanted to play so I inserted $20 into the machine. Pressed the maximum bet (3 credits), pulled the lever, hoping to hit something big OVER and OVER again until I had no credits left. I did not want to loose anymore money, but I wanted to win so I put in another $20. Only $7 dollars left, and what do you know...?!?!

WHEEL-OF-FORTUNE
WHEEL-OF-FORTUNE
RED SEVEN

I looked over at Pat G. and told him, "I think I won, I think I won!" We waited for the machine to stop ringing, seemed to have gone on forever. After it stopped, I printed out my voucher and cashed it in... SO COOL :-)!

4-stars because I won playing the WHEEL-OF-FORTUNE!

This place is not bad! C'mon people! Compared to the rest of the hotels on the strip, this hotel is significantly CHEAPER!

I last stayed here about a year ago and paid $30 for one night. I didn't spend much time in the actual hotel except to sleep and it was very clean and enjoyable.

However, when booking this, I was so hesitant due to a previous stay from 6 years ago. 6 years ago, the room smelled so musky and the beds were so lumpy and squeaky. But I told myself that it wouldn't be bad since most of my time was going to be spent elsewhere. 

Needless to say, it was great! The room was much cleaner from the one I stayed in 6 years ago and smelled clean!

No issues here.

I was here for easter weekend. I came here because I got a good rate being an M Life member. It seems even the cheapest rooms are updated to contemporary status (I stayed in Resort Tower King), not like those pink sheets with medieval bedrest, and medieval chairs and tables from years ago. Wifi is also very fast. Personally, I like the updated contemporary style. Still, I would have preferred thicker bed sheets, and harder pillows.

The Buffet is also updated in terms of type of food, and ambiance, to being comparable to other Vegas Strip hotels (unfair to compare to Bellagio or Wynn Buffet though). The Pool is also big, though there are more kids than adults. There is an adult pool, but you have to pay $10. Maybe that's why it was empty.

Basically, this is an "Inn" in a 4000 room building. If I get M Life discount rates, and 2 free buffets (which I did), I would stay here again.

I've stayed at this hotel before and the first time wasn't bad at all. This time though? Horrific! I'll never go back. We stayed in room 19248 and the bed was like sleeping on the floor it was so hard. The last time we stayed there the bed was comfortable, normal. This one felt like we were sleeping on just the box spring. We ended up leaving a day early. Thankfully they have checkout online so I could do it from the comfort of my own comfortable bed. Also, they need to get the parking situation fixed. We had it so we used our room key to get out of the parking lot, 2 of the 3 times we used it an attendant had to call for someone to open the gate cause our key didn't work. Never again. Waste of money.

Perhaps the days where Excalibur was a shining gem on the strip have passed but I'd consider it a very good option if you're bringing your large group or family here. It is a good value and from what I remember from the past they have certainly kept up the rooms to be acceptable in fit and finish. The casino has what's important, the pool is clean and there are bars. All the basics are there. Yes, it's located at the end of the strip but if you're willing to walk a little it's really just fine. I'd come back again.
Usually the classic hotels are bad this one is no exception my friend is staying there for the weekend and the place its not bad, I was expecting worsts, so I guess is a good thing

If you're like me, you probably don't go to Las Vegas too often, but on the rare occasion you do, you want to stay somewhere nice. Now I'm not the most knowledgeable person, but one thing I do know for sure, is that Excalibur is NOT "somewhere nice". I've stayed at Excalibur twice, but since the first time I went it's only gotten worse. The rooms are TERRIBLE, I really can't say it enough. The buffet is kind of sad and needs to be updated. I don't expect Excalibur to be Ceasars Palace or The Bellagio, but for just a little more money you can stay somewhere 20x better. In fact I would recommend most people to avoid staying at any of the MGM hotels unless it was New York-New York or the MGM Grand. Also the employees are rude and have no manners. If you want to stay somewhere nice and have a good time don't go to Excalibur. Spend the extra money, go somewhere else you'll be glad you did. Lastly I want to point out a very important fact, the rooms don't have Wi-Fi... Come on guys... it's 2014. You should have had this figured out years ago.

Cheap rates for this hotel. The room was decent the bed was comfy. The only thing that bothered us was the sewage smell. It seemed as though they tried to cover it up but it made it worse. It hit us every time we walked into our room. 

Overall we had a good experience with staff and our service. Would stay here again because it was cheap, the location wasn't that great but it was easy to deal with. 

Easily a 3.5 but good enough to round up.

This review is for the experience I had purchasing tickets for a show at the hotel. I did not stay in the hotel and have no idea how the rooms are or anything like that.

Here goes: we bought tickets here for Thunder from Down Under and Tournament of Kings. They have a package deal where you can get two shows of your choice for $75 a person which is a pretty good bargain. Our Thunder tickets were for Sunday night and our Tournament of Kings ones were for Monday night. We worked it out perfectly that we would go from the Lion King show we had tickets for at 4pm to Thunder which was scheduled at 9.

As I mentioned in my Mandalay Bay and Lion King reviews, we found out that the 4pm show had been cancelled and we weren't informed. Panic ensued. When we bought our tickets for the Excalibur shows we were told there were no exchanges or returns, so we had figured that we just wouldn't see the Lion King, which was a total bummer.

We went back to Salena at Excalibur and explained to her our issue. She was very accommodating and switched our tickets for us. We were relieved and thankful. Salena was professional and made us, the customers, really happy and I'm so thankful that she was able to help us. She really saved our trip.

Thanks Salena!

I'm a firm believer of "you get what you pay for", especially when it comes to the strip hotels in Vegas. I found Excalibur to be a great hotel for the price, and one of the more kid friendly hotels. Nothing fancy, but not too trashy either!  And a pretty decent location - I felt like we were right in the middle of all the action!

They have the "Fun Dungeon" - which is a decent sized arcade located downstairs, food court on the second level (up the escalators in the middle - open late!!), 4 pools (one is an adult pool that you pay to use, and one has a water slide), and of course, the obvious, a large casino floor.

My friend and I stayed in a 2 Queen bed room in Tower II (which is by the pool), on the 27th floor.  We had a great view of the NYNY and the strip from our window.  Our room was clean, but the beds were not very comfortable.

We found the staff to be helpful and friendly (although as other people have said - the people that want to give you cheap show tickets for doing a timeshare tour can be obnoxious, and they're pretty much by every entrance - just say no thanks and keep walking! We got suckered into it and it was NOT WORTH the cheap show & free buffet passes IMO).

Overall, I'd stay again!
Great hotel, but isn't as kid friendly as I thought. The rooms are quite small, but are nice.
Went to visit my cousin at the hotel and was charged $15 for parking!! Ridiculous!!  And no break for being a local. I take staycations, but I won't stay at the Excalibur ever again!

Came here with my tour group and was pleasantly surprised. The Excalibur has undergone some recent renovations. They have included a kids arcade complete with Fairway games. The rooms are well-appointed and they've simplified to a simple shower rather than a shower-over-tub. Probably one of the more family friendly resorts.

Arrived early evening.  Check-in line was long, BUT we used one of three self-check-in kiosks and had our room keys in minutes.  Our room was a Double Queen in the Royal Tower just around the corner from check-in.  Plenty of elevators.  Room is very newly remodeled and is just right.  New carpet.  Clean bathroom.  Plenty of towels.  Minimal toiletries, but I bring my own anyway.  No refrigerator or coffee maker, but I don't require those.  Did have an in-room safe, hair dryer, iron and ironing board, flat screen TV, desk, and built in sofa that could have been a bed.  New furniture.  Very comfortable beds and good pillows.  Nice linens.  Plenty of towels and full flow shower with plenty of hot water.  Older window-style air conditioner, but it worked and was quiet.  Good lighting with those great built in reading lights on each bed.  

I have no idea where the dissatisfied reviewers stayed, but my room was great and I had no complaints.

I love this casino.  If you're a poker player and enjoy reasonably priced tournaments all day, this is your casino.  Four tournaments beginning at 9:00 a.m. with the last one starting at 8:00 p.m.  Average 2 to 3 tables per tournament with both 1\/2 no limit and 2\/6 limit spread games available before and after.  I love this poker room.  Well run with good dealers and decent comps.

The casino was being remodeled with new carpet being installed.  I look forward to enjoying it in a few months when I go back.  Good games at decent prices during the day and during the week (i.e. $5 crap table).  

Good drink service.  Several bars throughout the casino.  Starbucks in the casino.  Several eating options in casino and on second floor.  

Note:  If you're just looking for regular coffee in the morning, avoid the long lines at Starbucks and at the kiosks just outside the elevators and head to the Lobby bar.  Play some quarter video poker and drink all the free coffee you like.  No lines.  

I love Excalibur and love the location.  Again, for a poker player, there is Mandalay Bay and MGM poker rooms just a short walk away, but I spend most of my time in Excalibur poker room.

I have been staying at Excalibur for the last 15 years (ever since I turned 21). I have stayed there maybe 10-15 times. I just took my kids and wife there for the first time. It was also my first time being back there in about 3-4 years. To put it nicely, the place has turned into a dump! from the check in to the check out, it was one nightmare after another. Not only they didn't have a room for us when we arrived, once we finally did get the room, it was filthy!  I was disgusted to get into the shower even. To make a long story short, I will never ever go there or recommend it to anyone ever again. They charge you one rate, then once you get there, their salespeople try up selling the crap out of the rooms. $5 bucks extra, if you want a room, $5 bucks extra if you want a remodeled room,$10 extra if you want a flat screen TV. It is insane!I know it's not the Bellagio, but it had never been like this.

I think it's time for this hotel to be replaced.  This casino just has no self respect. We visited around midnight last Monday night. We were there for just an hour and my husband was offered drugs 3 different times and then  offered "ya know" by a hooker. Come on Excalibur! This is suppose to be a castle not a halfway house. Clean it up or blow it up!

I usually stay here 1 to 2 nights and everything is always amazing. I have no complaints. Rooms are clean and beds are amazing in the royal tower. Beds are comfortable and soft. View was amazing. Yea of course carpet is dirty in the hall ways because so many people walk down it. Overall great hotel for a great price.

Not everyone can be a King or Queen, but at least at Excalibur guests can stay inside an enormous castle-- for cheap!

At over 20 years of age (opened in June of 1990), this hotel is now one of the older ones on The Strip.  The decor and furnishings in my guest room were kind of dated, but the room was clean and comfortable enough-- and had a view of New York New York and it's rollercoaster across the street.  Check in and check out were a breeze, and a $20 credit for food and\/or drinks at several hotel bars (plus a whole bunch of other coupons) was included.  The room rate for the night I was there was only about $30, but even after the $20 Las Vegas 'resort fee' was added I felt it was still a good deal.

This property is IMMENSE; I found myself getting lost here repeatedly.  Of course, I'm sure that's intentional since nearly every path leads back through the casino floor or past shops and restaurants en route to another casino floor.  Once inside, it's a bit of a challenge to escape to the outside world again!

I was a little disappointed to find that Excalibur's "Fun Dungeon" is NOT, in fact, an S&M-themed brothel, but rather an arcade and midway.  Oh well...

Checked in last night and noticed hair all over my bathroom floor and counter. Not to mention bathroom counter had drink stains near ice bucket which means it wasn't wiped down. Then went to shower today and theirs longggg dry hair stuck to my shower walls in multiple areas. That's disgusting. I know housekeeping can be tedious but cleanliness is highly important in quality of service. Then walking in my room my feet caught hair. Ugh. The night stand has clearly visible drink stains everywhere as well. I left notes everywhere for housekeeping. If it's not thoroughly cleaned today I'll have to call guest services. I don't do nasty bathrooms. Should have paid extra and stayed somewhere else for four days. 

I wound up cleaning my shower and wiping down my room. The next day I was in the room when housekeeping came and only wanted her to clean my bathroom and wipe down the phone table area and remove trash. What I did notice was rhey only rinse shower, no disinfect is used, she half wiped the bathroom counter and used s dry towel to wipe the night stand area which did not remove the previous guests glass stains. No vacuum is used at all which makes no sense. My third day the damn toilet overflowed all out onto the carpet area and I had to call for a room change. That was annoying. Overall a 0 star if I could rate and I'm probably not covering everything. Very disappointing.

Location great, gym very nice, New Tower Rooms very Nice, Price point Great.  These are the main aspects I look at for a hotel.  Excalibur has it all.  No need to pay 3 or 4 times as much a night to stay at the MGM or Mandalay Bay.  If you dont need that Pirates of the Carribean Horsecrap then go to The Excalibur.  I like how you get a package with two passes for their Gym\/Spa..  You can walk or take the tram to so many hotels from this location and the new tower rooms are quite nice.  Very solid Mattresses.  This place is great and a great price point in Vegas.  Spend your money on booze, food and gambling and stay at the Excalibur which is a solid place.  Big ups to my boy King Arthur.

My boy Nick Smith says $5 Blackjack Tables are dope also

Second and last stay here... If you want zero customer service and the overall impression that everyone working here is simply annoyed that you would expect anything from them other than to take your money and give you your room keys.. This would be that place. This was not my first choice.. I was ready to book the prestige experience at the Palazzo Siena Suite but my husband said that we should just stay at the Excalibur since we had so many shows and sightseeing trips planned and would not be spending that much time in our room. We stayed July 2nd-July 5th. The absolute kicker was on the night of the 4th when we went to watch the O show at the Bellagio and came back to the Excalibur in our rental car only to find out that they open all of their parking to the general public on the 4th which meant absolutely no parking for hotel guests, if you happen to be looking for one on that night, which meant we had to go searching for somewhere else to kill time until 2am when it cleared out enough to find parking spot. Who doesn't put their guests first.. That would be Excalibur. Needless to say we will be avoiding Excalibur as a place to spend our money on rooms or on the property in general. Their loss, considering we dropped a few thousand there between our room, shows, gambling, shopping, meals and drinks you would think they would do a little more to keep us coming back... Lesson learned, the next trip will defiantly be spent at a resort who knows and believes in making their guests feel welcomed, pampered and valued.
Room smells, ugly view, for 500 for two nights? Dont book through booking.com either. The worst hotel ive ever stayed in.

The Excalibur is a fine establishment and house to many lovely bars & shows such as the Tournament of Kings and Thunder Down Under (both being entirely worth the trip). It also has some cheap table games like $5 roulette (Suck it, MGM Grand!). Apparently, however, I am not the only scumbag who loves a good low stakes table game: there are a ton of interesting specimens who also love them some Titanic themed slots and are more than happy to make the place smell like vomit (Seriously. You can smell the awesome aroma for yourself or take my word: I saw a classy lady spit into a trash can). Also, the circulatory system in the building must be pretty ancient. Almost as if it were... medieval...? Be prepared to walk away feeling in your lungs like you smoked a pack yourself... Not to mention the utterly sexy smell. Thanks, Excalibur! But, not really.

Love this place, if you go get a new remodel room strip view its clean and nice, great pool and bar area, fun casino. lots of food choices to eat at and shops to go into. connects to mgm grand, new york, luxor and madalyan bay, really cool castle like hotel and has little mini markets, spa runs an early bird specail from 8 to 11 am check that out 70 for a 50 min message and you can use the spa sauna, steam room and hot tub and specail showers til 8 pm, if your looking for a hotel with great rates and beautiful and clean with really comfy beds stay here!!!!

After requesting to check in at 11:30 and not 3, the check in person was sentimental to our cause. Our flight is cancelled for 2 days. He allowed us to check in early and upgraded our room. Room is great, doesn't smell like smoke and got a strip view.

Went to the bar,  played BJ for 80$ and the old guy got mad when we asked for another round cause "we weren't playing" and there were "cameras all around".   I'm sorry that you have been ignoring 2 of the 4 ppl at the bar and we were near our end when we finally got your attention.   I had to wave you down.   Hope they catch that on the cameras.  Yay we got 2 4$ drinks comped playing 80 at your bar.   Won't be coming back here.

Overall, I'm not impressed with the rooms here. I received a room with 2 double beds in a non smoking room. The room smelled like smoke and if you leave your clothing out, it smells like smoke too! With that being said...the whole casino smelled like smoke. They need to install air ventilation and purification system throughout the entire resort.

There wasn't a refrigerator or a microwave available. I had some medications that needed to be chilled and had to improvise by storing it in a bag full of ice I set in the bathroom sink. 

I wasn't too worried about having a microwave since I dined out every night but not having a microwave meant I couldn't bring back my leftovers if I decided enjoy my meal again. Really, they need to upgrade their rooms with 21st century amenities.

The beds were made and the rooms were tidied up daily. The bathroom also was kept up the entire time I was there.

Prices vary. It cost me a little more because there was 4 major events happening in town that weekend. Usually, the rates are cheaper if you stay on weekdays. Weekend stays are rather more expensive. 

I'll probably visit here again because they have an awesome steakhouse and buffet, and good deals on tap beers at Dicks Last Resort. But sadly, I will not stay in the hotel here again.

Have stayed at Excalibur many times throughout the years. I had called while on the way to Vegas driving to reserve a room. Was told on the phone that would be cheaper to make reservation online because I would be charged 10.00 to do over phone. What the heck? So went online reserved room. Got a email and two rooms were reserved instead of one. Called to resolve the problem. Was hung up on, put on hold indefinitely, told I could not get money back cancellation policy was 48 hours. Finally after 2 hours decided to deal with once in Vegas. The girl who helped us check in was very helpful. refunded money, upgraded us, and gave us a late check out. After checking in and paying it was the same price as I was quoted over the phone. They don't tell you online that there is a 20 resort fee. 

Another thing is make sure you eat before it gets late. The food places all shut down. This is something new since last time I was in Vegas. Always had a 24 coffee shop open. After walking upstairs and downstairs and all around per the staff telling us of food places that may be open. We ended up at 2 in the morning at New York New York which apparently is the only restaurant open near Excalibur for food.

My review will be divided into two parts: hotel stuff and fun stuff.

Hotel stuff:  The room was small but fine, even for 4 rather boisterous and bedazzled ladies.  But something crazy was up with the air conditioning or something, because no matter what setting we chose, even "off," the room was constantly humid and muggy.  We were only on the fifth floor!  Hotel rooms should not be MUGGY.
Also, the maid service left a bit to be desired.  We never had enough towels, and they didn't pay attention when they refilled our toiletries in the morning, so we ended up with three body lotions and no shampoo.   ??
Hotel stuff: minus.  For the price, acceptable, especially if you do Vegas right and don't spend any time in your room.

Fun stuff:  I really liked the casino- it's not too elegant and somber like some of the other hotels, making you feel like gambling is serious business and you can't have too much fun.  The dealers are wicked nice, although some of them get a little pushy asking you to throw down for them on the craps table.
I ate at the Sherwood Forest Cafe (all night) and it was a bit overpriced for what was essentially a diner, but it was nice to be able to get real food at any hour.
The pool area was not so great- just plain pools, not many chairs, and they boasted about a daily party each evening that never materialized.  Ouch.

Stuff that was AWESOME:
-Thunder from Down Under:  classy male strip show with muscle-y, accented guys who clearly have a ton of fun and don't mind if you get a little grabby as long as you "handle with care."  (Direct quote)  Ladies, I HIGHLY recommend this one.
-Dick's Last Resort: makes no apologies.  Loud and rude and drunk and crazy and half naked, and that could describe the waiters and bartenders or the patrons.  Kickass live band that plays anything you ask, and the final nail in the coffin of awesomeness would be the paper hats the bartenders make patrons who strike their fancy.  One fiance wore a hat on his head that said "Hello wedding bells, good-bye blow jobs."  And my grandma (yes I went to a bar in Vegas with my grandma) was given one that said "I can't believe my granddaughters are such whores."  That's right.

Excalibur:  keeps it real, which is hard in Vegas.  Not the most plush environment, but comfy, and not overwhelming.

With the boyfriend in Vegas for 3 weeks for work, what could be a better excuse for a little getaway? NOTHING.

Because he's rooming with another guy from his unit, we figured it would be better for us to get a little alone time and booked a hotel room at Excalibur and was pleasantly surprised. Having previously stayed there with my parents as a kid passing through vegas, a lot about this hotel has changed...and for the better, i think. Here's the breakdown:

1. Located on the South side of the strip, it's slightly far from the center, but close enough to feel part of everything :)
2.  Rooms are decent sized, have a huge bathroom and offer the usual hotel amenities. I did notice there was no mini fridge, which i thought was a bit odd, but who wants to save food in their room when you have the whole strip to walk?
3. The atmosphere here is typical vegas [loud, fun, full of music, booze and  fun!] but I was consistently annoyed by the sales people attempting to lure you into a conversation about "free tickets" when in reality nothing is free...unless you "sit in a short presentation about one of our condos" which we kindly replied with "NO!" and learned to not engage upon approach.
4. This hotel has expanded quite a lot since i've last been here. The second floor is now a food court\/mall combo full of just about everything you could want, including booze.
5. Because this isn't the nicest hotel on the strip and closer to the south, we found the prices to be relatively less expensive than the rest of them!

Because i didn't spend much time in the hotel [except to change or eat dinner once] i wouldn't mind staying here again.

After reading the reviews on Yelp I was a little worried about what we might encounter during our Stay at Excalibur. Luckily, I was pleasantly surprised! Check in was quick and the staff was friendly and helpful. I had 2 rooms reserved for our group, and they were able to accommodate us by making sure our rooms were right next door to each other. The rooms were a little worn, but clean. The bathrooms was a good size so us girls were able to get ready at the same time. 

The pool area was nice; we got there at about 10:30 on Saturday morning and were able to get 5 chairs together at the adult only pool. They had a DJ playing and the crowd was really fun. Someone brought a volleyball and a big group of us tossed it around in the pool. I really liked the atmosphere; very open and friendly. They had the Captain Morgan girls there promoting, so by purchasing a cocktail we got free beach towels!

True, the Excalibur isn't the most luxurious hotel around, but I thought it was a great value and I would stay here again. I don't come to Vegas to sit around in a hotel room, so I would rather sacrifice a little luxury so I have more money to spend doing fun things around town.

Please only stay here if you don't care about your surroundings and are only looking for a place to rest your head on the strip.

Please MGM update this casino. Good job on the Wide screen rooms very clean and sufficient. But other than that please gut everything.

I feel bad for the horses in the back parking lot inside their dirt pit next to the freeway. Everything is broken and the staff is rude. The concept is great and could be very cool. Just spend some of your billions of dollars and fix at least the entry way.

We just came in to check it out. It was, of course, medieval themed and it kept with the whole castle theme pretty good....except for the whole Sponge Bob thing it had going on. If I had more time I would have checked out the tournament of kings dinner show but I do understand it is as good as dinner shows go.
NASTY HOTEL !!!!!!!!!!!!!!! When you come in smells like some one DIE IN IT !!!

I lived here for three nights, first floor, 1172, nothing fancy, but still enjoyed it overall, no complaints.

The hotel looks amazing outside, just like several Disney castles, and the price is not expensive at all. The inside doesn't feel like a castle, but still a very good casino. I did not try the buffet here, but the price seems fair.

The rooms are clean and big enough, bathroom as well. Cleaners are good at their job, they clean your room very well. That's all you need for a casino\/hotel in Las Vegas.

We stayed here many times in the past, because it's reasonable and on the strip.

This casino is a no frills establishment. But it serves our purpose. Don't expect to find a coffee maker or frig in your room either. I tried out the pools and hot tubs during my stay there, for the first time. It was nice and relaxing... You can even have drinks too while hanging out at the pool area.

My biggest BEEF was with a cocktail waitress, she would NOT give me a bottle of water that I asked for when passing by her. This occurred while while I was staying at the casino and gambling for three days. That really "RUBBED ME THE WRONG WAY"!!! No one should be DENIED a small water bottle when asked. Management needs to do something about this... 

If they want me and others to continue to stay and gamble at their casino, you should be able to ask for a  small bottle of water, without any grief.
Cheap, feels dirty, and quality is just not there. The only plus side is that it's on the strip and really connected to the surrounding area, and the stores on the second level.

The hotel room itself was decent, and looked clean. We got a room with a view of the back where they load and unload supplies for Dick's Last Resort. If you are a hotel guest, you basically pay a full day for parking each day. 
Also, the buffet, if complementary, would be mediocre. However, if I had to pay for the food, I would be pretty darn disappointed. They do rotate between Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner.
Definitely a budget hotel. We thought we found a good deal on Groupon, and now I don't think it was a good deal after all, ha ha ha. Don't worry have fun. They'll just surprise charge random bogus shit to your deposit, so you'll probably get less than half of your actual deposit back anyway. Woohoooo
The highlight of my stay was Bucca Di Beppo, food was delicious, and service was great.
Oh, and Dicks last resort is there, and it has a daiquiri bar with fun flavors, didn't try it, but I like that about the hotel too
Location on the strip was decent, wasn't in the middle of all of the action, but I liked that. You can catch the monorail up north a little if you're looking for a poppin Vegas night life experience. (You would have to walk or take the shuttle to MGM Grand, and get on from there)

This is a hidden gem on the Las Vegas strip.

It's a great price for what you get. We have gotten rooms here as cheap as $25\/night. The rooms are very spacious and most of them have already been newly renovated with a more elegant look and LCD flat tvs. The bathroom is large with a lot of counter space. 

The parking for the hotel is not too far of a walk, as most of the hotels on the strip are. We have never had a hard time getting parking. 

The hotel is in a good location. It's close to everything if you wanted to walk or drive.

 There is not a good restaurant selection in the hotel but they have a 24 hour food court with a McDonald's and full fledged Krispy Kreme! You can watch the donuts being made! They have recently opened up a Baja Fresh inside as well and have 2 Starbucks locations as well. 

And the best part is you have easy access to 5 other hotels\/casinos. You can go to Mandalay Bay and Luxor without going outside by walking or you could even take the tram. You can just walk across the bridge to MGM or NYNY. 

Customer service has been great and we have even been upgraded a few times at no cost. We have always had a pleasant experience here.

 ^_^*~
Proximity to the strip wasn't bad. Hotel pool was amazing... But our room had roaches!!!!! Only gave 2 stars because they sprayed our room and have a refund. I appreciated how they handled it

Several things about this hotel made me not want to stay there again, despite the cheap price. The tv had only like 4 channels (what?!). I know you don't go to Vegas to watch tv, but come on. The valet was constantly full.  There was no mini fridge in the room, but we could pay $25\/night for one. Uh...what?  What exactly does that ridiculous  "resort fee" cover then?

Although I understand the need for parking restructuring at the casinos, but this is insane. I have stayed here for years and have never been more disappointed. As a hotel guest, you should be allowed to park even if they charge you, there should be a spot for your car. I will take my business and my money elsewhere!!

So i know this place is bad so I can't give them a 1 star because I was expecting something sub par.

This hotel is MLife's cheapest and oldest hotel.  Perhaps the strips oldest...

I came in with an open mind so I asked to be upgraded in their renovated new rooms. The standard rooms are $20-32 but the upgrade added another $20 plus resort fee of 26 or something like that, the nightly rate became $100 something. 

I love the dealers at the craps table and the poker room is pretty descent.  They even have me comps for the buffet and comped my resort fee. 

So I almost gave this place a 3.5-4 stars until 7am and .... Drilllllllllling started happening next to us.  Apparently our room was so new that they put us next to a room that was still under construction. Oh boy were we pissed.  The drilling and hammering happened for 4 hrs.

So we had no sleep but I contacted the front desk and the refunded everything for us and gave us a late check out until 5pm.  So I'm happy about customer service.  Im not happy about our room being placed next to a construction room, that is a big no-no in the hospitality industry.  Hotel hell should come to this place and help them.

As a landmark in LV, they should really do something about clientele experience. It's supposed to be a castle, and we should be treated like royalty.  M life can do better for their most affordable hotel.

I've had a better sleep in holiday inn.

Cons:No room in the entire hotel has a bathtub. The towel rack fell out of the wall when trying to get towel (on remodeled room). Front desk was less then enthused to help anyone. Pros: beds were comfortable and cheap.

I don't understand the bad reviews.  There is nothing special about this hotel but not bad IMO.  You get live music at the bars.  Beds and pillows are comfortable.  My only complaint is the grand view reps trying to earn your business.  Self parking and valet is available.  And you have a bridge to connect you luxor and mandalay bay.  Overall its not a bad hotel but at the same time there is nothing great about it either.

In preparation for a Vegas list I am putting together for future reference, I am back tracking on this review from a few years ago when I saw U2 and spent a few days in Vegas. Never stayed at the hotel, however, love browsing and spending time here 'cause my kid at heart is at play. I love watching the Krispy Creme donuts being made here...taking their spa bath in hot oil and then showered through a sugary waterfall. Staff are always nice and friendly. If you're one of those people whom can't stand kids, this isn't the place for you. There are a lot of dragon and fantasy themed shopped for my inner geek.

First off, we only ended up staying here because of an impromptu trip and needing a place to stay immediately.  The rooms are unimpressive and the atmosphere was ehh.  Only go to the buffet if you like macaroni salad and little night life.

The only reason this isn't a 1 star review is that we didn't get stabbed.
didn't stay here but we gambled because they have penny video poker! Love it

Reserved two rooms under my name. One was for relatives and this was their first time in not only Vegas but the USA. I really wanted to wow them with this trip. They saw the CASTLE of Excalibur and were WOWED! It went downhill from there. Entered my room and the Cheetos from the previous guest were spilled and still on the floor. I immediately called housekeeping. I wasn't upset because "stuff happens" and we all make mistakes. I later asked my guests about their room and they conveyed that there was still pee on the toilet seat from the previous guest. Now I am frustrated. Still, I don't make an issue of it. We check out tomorrow, and I requested a late check out beyond the 11am standard time. The lady I spoke to was nice and said she could give me 12 noon. I said I needed at least to 2pm and she said Ok. Later, it dawned on me that I did not set up the late out on both rooms. I called back and the operator says she sees no record of my 2pm out time. If I wanted that I'd have to speak to the front desk. She transferred me to Molly who says she couldn't help me unless I paid $30 additional. That is ridiculous. She says did I get the name of the original operator. Who gets names of operators on basic requests? She transferred me to some incompetent named Mark who is playing the role of a real manager. He can't possibly be. I explain my situation and he is like well you should have got the name. He finally agrees to give me the 12 noon late check out and he won't charge me. The same late check out I had before I spoke to this this this... you pick a name. In the end he "allowed" me a 1 pm on one room only. So I basically ended up with losing an hour after all of the "help" they gave me. I asked to speak to the General Manager. He kept trying to give me someone named Molly. He was doing his best to hide the actual GM from me. I told him give me the name or I'd just call back and get it from someone else. That's when he gave me the name Drew Espinoza, which still might be a lie. But at least that got me that 1pm. Not impressed at all. At least Medieval Times was good!

I stayed here for free one weekend with some friends.  Lets just say even if it was free, I would not stay here again.  The place is just rundown I guess that's part of the whole medieval thing.  The rooms are horrible, It feels like you are staying at a trailer park and there just isn't much there at the hotel either.  Not a very good place to find a nice restaurant or for shopping.

I'm always iffy about this hotel. I've stayed here a few times...and each time I've had a different experience. I like their casino. I seem to win here a lot for some reason. The rooms are your average room. Small, two queens, okay bathroom. The views are just of the hotel. I like how they have regular eateries here instead of having to eat at somewhere expensive. Kid friendly upstairs and its close to mandalay, MgM and new york york which is a plus.  If I want to stay on the strip for cheap, Excalibur is where I'll go.

Excalibur very pleasantly surprised me!

I hadn't stayed with them in over a decade, but a comped room and buffet thanks to my aggressive MyVegas slot and blackjack play (http:\/\/myvegas.com\/) recently brought me back.  I don't know if all rooms are like the one I got (I think I was upgraded 1 level from the bottom), but mine was very obviously completely renovated, and super clean.

As an MGM Pearl card holder (2nd tier players card), I was able to skip the check in lines.  This is a pretty nice perk, as I believe it's usually Gold (3rd tier) and above that get that benefit at other MGM resorts.

The buffet surprised me as well..  I mean, the last two proceeding buffets I've had recently were Bacchanal and Wicked Spoon, and of course it's not like those.  But at a fraction of the price, and the fact that it has improved greatly from my last time having it, I'd definitely recommend.

Excalibur is currently slightly cheaper but in better shape than Luxor.  If you're going to Vegas on a budget but want some decent quality, definitely consider Excalibur!

PS - The resort fee is currently about 20 bucks.

So I stayed here last weekend from Thursday to Sunday.
It was my first time in Vegas so I didn't really know what to expect.. but as the weekend went on and I walked inside some of the neighboring hotels, I suddenly realized this one was more on the low end side.
The casino looks clean and its spacious... and of course they have a girl dancing by the party pit, half naked.
But the hotel part wasn't as good.. 
the employee sitting behind a stand where our rooms were by, was VERY rude. 
My friend asked him if he knew where our room was. our paper said 8-10-48 and we didn't know what the heck that meant. 
He right away snaps at my friend and says (after sighing) "It says it right here! 8th floor and room 1048." daaaang can you say rude?! He was talking to her like if she was stupid.. Obviously we didn't know what the numbers meant, otherwise we wouldn't have asked!

So we get to our room and its TINY! yea it had the 2 beds we asked for, BUT there was barely any walking space on either sides of the bed. The heater for the whole tower was on I guess because it was wayyy too hot! every night I had to sleep with the AC on :(

Oh and I almost forgot to mention.. We didn't get any room service till the last day we were there (saturday) when we arrived on Thursday! and it was only because we flagged down the lady cleaning and asked her to go to our room. 

Next time I will NOT be staying at this hotel.

This isn't the ideal place to stay for people my age because this place is ancient compared to the more happening places on the strip, but there's a lot of value in Excalibur's low price-per-night establishment.

As an Mlife member, I absolutely have to stay at an MGM-operated resort while in I'm in Vegas, but because I was here for business, I needed to keep costs low, and I was luckily able to secure some rooms for around $30 a night--again, not bad for a strip hotel.  Through some sweet talk, I was able to upgrade my room two tiers for free, but there really isn't all that big a difference with them.  Tower 2 has better views than Tower 1, and that's really all I can think about it.

My biggest gripe with Excalibur is that there's no Wi-Fi here (yet), so that prevented me from getting any work done in my hotel room.

The gambling here is so-so.  I like that the craps table (the minimum actually goes as low as $5) has all the bonus bets that the MGM Grand has, and I noticed that it's pretty much like that for all craps tables operated by MGM.  When I lose I normally bet at another casino, as long as it's an MGM one, and that strategy has been working.  Excalibur is within walking distance to Luxor, Mandalay Bay, New York New York, Monte Carlo, and the MGM Grand, so it's easy to stay within the mLife confines.

But what really gives this place its value is the fact that it has its own food court, and places like McDonalds are open 24\/7, so yes, it's the perfect time to stock up on Spicy McChickens when things aren't going your way.

Plus they have Dick's Last Resort!  Never tried it yet, but I felt that was worth mentioning.  

Excalibur isn't a bad last resort if your wallet's shy.

(We hated this hotel. It was horrible. They offered to "upgrade" our rooms. If that was a upgrade then I would like to see what a down grade was. Our rooms were smelly. Very outdated and we booked a King room. We were upgraded to a double. We called and told them and they said we could move the next day. The next day we had to hang around until noon so we wouldn't miss out on moving rooms. When we got to new rooms they were still disappointing. They were non smoking rooms but had cigarette butts inside the window seal. There was hair all over the bathroom floor, including pubic hair on toliet. The rooms need to be updated very much. The beds are hard and very uncomfortable. This room the tv didnt work and we had to call down two days to get this fixed. The only positive thing about hotel was the food choices. They had a variety and not all of them would break the bank. As far as rooms go, I would never recommend Excalibur. Total let down!  Oh the other thing nice was the location. But I can have the same location at the Luxor. It is a wonderful hotel.

Wow. 
So Ive been coming here since I had down there ( i guess its appropriate if were talking about city of sin?). 
Man has this place stayed the same. But look deeper and youll find remodeled rooms!
I stayed in the "Flat Screen" room that was on a completely remodeled floor. The rooms were so clean and chic and had this HUGE flat screen TV- just like the fancy hotels down the strip.
Oh yea, and this place has AWESOME low limit tables and is close to the Tropicana, MGM and NY NY (walking distance), so many pluses for that. 
Also, for the drunkards PLEASE check out the 24hr McDonalds upstairs after too much drinking.
24 hour McDonalds....BLISS....esp after drinking. 
A+++++++++++
Oh yeah did I mention that their service rocks too... I got sick coming here and wanted a place to rest and they let me check in at 10 in the morning!

I love how bright everything is and Naomi at the front desk was such a sweetheart but my only issue is that the room we are in is a bit outdated. I did expect it to look more medieval being a castle but I guess I was wrong. We are staying in the resort tower.
