I'm just assuming that the more expensive rooms are the ones that are more up to date. I'd definitely stay here again if they do some renovations.

Ok Excalibur isn't a great hotel. It isn't. 

However, I do like that you walk downstairs and there is a ton going on. You can walk across the little bridge to New York, New York and grab a slice of pizza. Um... there's a pool. It's cheap. The room was fine. Internet was included in the resort fee. I guess that's really all I have to say about Excalibur. Haha. Stay there if you don't want to spend much and you won't be in the room too often... like my friends and I.

I made reservations here for my mom's 50th birthday. We were a party of 25 and it was great! Everyone had a great time and more than enough food to eat. Everyone left happy and with satisfied tummies:) The staff was great, attentive, and didn't rush us. 
It was a great experience and I'm pretty picky when it comes to restaurants, and I was very pleased, definitely would recommend  Buca- Excalibur to anyone who is looking for delicious food and friendly, professional staff. Thank you Buca staff for making my mom's day special!

You get what you pay for. Cheap rates, but the service and maintenance of the hotel isn't that great. The walls in Tower I are pretty thin as well. Not sure how Tower II is. Probably not staying here again in the future.

Would not recommentd.  The rooms were very outdated.   Our room also had a weird smell to it.  During our stay we got locked in our hotel. Locked in. We had to call room service to let us out of the room !   Worst stay at a Las Vegas hotel so far.

This is the second worst casino I have ever visited in my entire life.

THE BLACK BOXES ARE RIGGED.

stayed there for 3 days. They started charging for valet service and self park. cost us 36 dollars plus the same resort fees. They said all M-Life casinos are going to start charging. Guess its time to find other casinos, to stay at

Stayed here this past weekend! Took my two daughters and my wife. The whole experience was awful! 

Arrival
Got there around 1ish and was told our room wasn't available. THEN was was told we could upgrade for an additional $15 a night to the Royal Tower room which looked exactly like the room we booked with a better comforter... An obvious sham to get us for more money, but to get my wife and kids off of their feet after the plane ride I opted for the other room at the higher price. 
There was a special that said if you upgrade you received free buffet vouchers which we showed them on the website. They refused to honor it. 
Went to the pool and was bombarded with tons of rap music and profanity (which I personally don't mind) but thought it a bit in appropriate for my 5&10 year old daughters at the kiddie pool! 

If that wasn't bad enough there was an overly aggressive salesman trying to check out a timeshare for the place that had treated us so horribly. 

And lastly adding insult to injury we decided to take them to the "Fun Dungeon" arcade that supposedly was to close at 10pm but when we got there at 9:15 half of the games were already shut down and after we had changed $50 into quarters the staff proceeds to go around unplugging machine after machine. The only game my daughters were able to play were 1 game of air hockey and 1 race car game after I had to literally argue with the attendant who kept repeating "We're closed" despite the fact I kept showing her both my watch and phone that said it wasn't 10 yet!

WORST SERVICE EVER HERE! WORST VEGAS TRIP OF MY LIFE!

Booked a 2 room suite for my sons 21'St birthday.  This hotel was so disappointing.  

The rooms need major renovations, plumbing work and detail cleaning.  The master bathroom was missing the seal under the shower door creating a flood on the floor. The shower head was fiercely strong causing pain if it touched any sensitive areas.  Mold was on the frame of shower door.  Carpet was also dirty and needed vacuuming in missed areas.

The throw pillows on the furniture had ripped fabric.  The second bedroom, bathroom area (adjoining room) had a sewage smell that was like rotten eggs. 

Worst part was I failed to inspect all the bed pillows ( both sides).  I woke up and realized I had slept on someone's blood.  Not like it was laundered but still stained.  It was obviously not changed out after the last guest.  Oh how I wish I would have discovered it came from me or my husband but no.  It was not us :(.   

Thankful we only stayed 2 nights.  I could not take another night.  Upon check out we informed the manager.  We would have done so immediately but I'm certain half our short trip would have been wasted getting this sorted.  She did refund the resort fee though I'm not really sure what we benefit from that fee anyways.   Between the show tickets, hotel, food, drinks spent with the MGM brand I am so disappointed!

We got killer room rates through Facebook!  The front desk was excellent and when we told Kathy we booked through Facebook, she got all excited and bumped us up to a room with the flatscreen and lounge.  Room was great - but the pillows sucked.  Too small and too soft.   Casino was excellent.  Craps teacher, I think his name was Willis, was great! 

My biggest disappointment was the spa.  The attendant was less than attentive.  The one shower was out of body wash and when I pointed this out, he said he knew.  Then do something about it.  After preping for my massage, I had to parade through the women's waiting area, down a hallway full of women until I finally got to the massage room.  Not quite the "spa" experience for a man.

I love the Excalibur, but next time, I might try a different spa.

The last time I stayed here was when I was a kid!  It hasn't really changed much. 

We just had a regular room, which was alright and spacious. It was clean, but smelled like 1987 when we walked into the room.  Old school air and regular definition TV.  A bit shocked they didn't have any movie channels.  

Place is great for the price, definitely not high end. My son loved the dungeon, but not many employees for the games.  

The reason for the 3 stars is customer service. House keeping was upset when I asked for 2 more towels. It was my wife, my son, and I in the room. It came with 2.  My wife uses 2 for just her hair!!!  Like legit, she was pissed, like when you ask for more sauce at McDonald's pissed. 

Front desk was rude too when we checked in, but they were hella busy. So I kid of understand that. 

Maybe the employees were floating from their usual job at Dicks restaurant (where the servers are supposed to be bleepholes (also located in the hotel))

Doubt I'll stay here again, unless they pay me.

I stayed in a widescreen view room on the 22nd floor in tower #2. The room was quite nice but I wish they had more to them like a refrigerator, a microwave, and a small sofa. Not too much to ask nowadays. The room was very clean and comfortable, and the view of the strip was spectacular and exactly what I asked for. It was one of those newly remodeled rooms and pretty much everything in the room was remodeled except for the main dresser, which was severely scratched and awkwardly out of place in an otherwise good looking room. I felt like they cut corners when it came to that.

I also would like to say that the Excalibur should be ashamed of those pests they have working at the entrances who harass you as you walk in and out, trying to get you to buy stuff. I should be able to walk through the lobby of my hotel without having to worry about being harassed by these people, especially after already paying hundreds of dollars. And on top of that, there's the mandatory $15 daily resort fee for WIRED internet (not wifi) and other crap I don't need. It's just not a good way to treat your customers who are there to relax and have a good time without being harassed and chased every time they walk in and out of the place. This is the main reason why I will likely not stay at the Excalibur again, and i'm sure i'm not the only one who feels this way. And its a shame because I really did like my room.

Disappointed all around. From beginning to end. It started with checking in. We arrived on a Friday AM at 9ish. My friend is an Mlife card holder which gives you a separate VIP check in line. They told us that they don't open that line until 9am and sometimes 10am... Which is it?! 

After waiting 45 minutes in the other line we were told it was an extra $28 for early check in. Who charges extra?? According to my friends Mlife card they quoted a $20 fee for early check in, but we were told that was an online check in only and wouldn't apply. Whatever that means... 

Our room was basic, which was to be expected. I wasn't expecting MGM style. But it wasn't even properly cleaned! There was a substance on the bathroom wall, and I found a piece of candy on the floor clearly from the last guest. Gross. And there was no fridge. I don't think I've ever stayed in a hotel without a fridge. 

I went to get ice one afternoon and a police officer asked me to move so he could check behind the soda machine. He was clearly looking for someone! Didn't exactly make me feel warm and fussy! And we saw Las Vegas PD on our floor two more times later that day! WTF?! 

Overall the service was subpar, the room was outdated and not clean, and we didn't even feel safe at one point! Two thumbs down... Won't be back...

We were quite surprised to find a very nice room, clean and comfortable, with very comfortable beds. Our room was in Tower II. After reading other reviews that were not positive, we didn't know what to expect. It was quiet with very nice staff. Check in went smoothly, a little bit of a wait, we arrived about 5:30 PM. 

Needed to print my airline boarding passes and the wonderful concierges printed for me!!!

A good place to stay! Location can't be beat! We will stay there again!

Fill thine horn with oil...........and Go!!!!"

I was worried about staying at Excalibur after hearing bad things about it.  

Boy was I surprised.  

Check in was smooth.  I checked in at 230am and the line was long with some folks from England???  There was only one check in clerk and someone saw me standing in line and quickly checked me in.  Why something like this doesn't happen in other hotels (or in supermarkets for that matter) I don't know.

I really liked the idea of putting a map of Excalibur on the back leaflet with my room key.  This made navigation a breeze.  Some hotels assume that you know the entire layout of the place.  

Ahhh the room..........A very, very pleasant surprise.  I rented a room on the 25th floor with a 42 inch plasma and a view of the Strip.  I got more than I bargained for.  The room decor was modern and the walls were a earthy brown.    

The first thing I do when I enter a hotel room is to sense a smell.....any smell.  No smells when I entered the room.  The carpet was extremely clean and the bed sheets didn't have any burn holes or other horrifying stains.  The beds were comfortable......very comfortable and the cushioned headboard was a welcome delight.  

The bathroom was a bigger surprise.  Granite countertops and enough towels to last me the entire trip (I stayed 2 days).  No problems with the water pressure nor with toilets that didn't flush.  

The Sherwood Forest Cafe and Sir Galahad's were OK.  I really wish that all Strip hotels in Vegas would just put a IHOP or Denny's or a Waffle House inside and spare us from eating horrible eggs and other unpalatable breakfast foods.  

The cocktail waitresses dressed in medieval costumes was gimicky, but I was there to gamble and the sports book was where I spent most of my time.  The casino itself was ordinary and there wasn't anything that made me say 'wow', but there wasn't anything there that made me say 'yuck' either.  

All in all......Excalibur wasn't a bad experience.  Really 3 and a half stars.

I stayed in Tower II - Widescreen remodeled room. It looks much nicer than the regular rooms. But the first thing we noticed was a blood stain on the sheet, which they quickly replaced after a call. The shower had very low water pressure and there was no tub. Also no fridge or microwave. The iron was messed up\/ no steam button. 

The smell of the lobby is pretty bad. It smells more like dust and smoke than most of the other hotels. The crowd there is pretty ghetto. I wouldn't bring kids here but then again I wouldn't take kids to Vegas! They were arresting some cholo just a few doors down, escorting him out of the room.

To top it off, the front desk customer service lady wanted to charge us $25 for a one hour later check out... on a Sunday! Then she lied about being the manager when we asked to speak to the Manager. 

On a positive note.. it's a good place on the strip if you want to stay on the South side. The bed was very comfy and the flat screen TV was cool. But who watches TV in Vegas?

Bottomline.. I won't stay there again.

As I write this I'm confused at their rating. 21\/2 stars? I was just there for three days and could not have been more satisfied. I have stayed at several resorts in Las Vegas and will have to say that I will never visit anywhere but Excalibur in the future.
Other hotels were good, but Excalibur puts the EXC in Excellent.
I have never been treated so wonderful by any staff in the world, and this team appeared like they loved their job and was genuinely happy to be caring for my needs.
I can go on and on, but I will just have to say that I highly recommend this hotel to any visitor to Vegas.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for a few nights in February. We were in town for a friend's wedding. Since they were getting married at the chapel in Mandalay Bay we chose the Excalibur because the price was right(we paid roughly $50 a night through Booking.com), and it had a tram that stops directly at the Mandalay. Our room was in Tower I, on the 15th floor. 

The pros: 
The room was very clean. We opted not to have room service, as we were only staying two nights and we managed to clutter it up pretty quickly while searching for things in our bags. :P Bathrooms are kind of outdated, but they too were clean, and had a hair dryer and fluffy towels, hot water, and a properly flushing toilet. 

The beds were SUPER comfy. Blankets were kinda thin, but the heater in our room worked(a little too well, we had to shut it off in the middle of the night because we both woke up roasting!). Pillows were nice and fluffy. 

Check-in staff were very friendly and nice. We ended up getting in MUCH later than anticipated, about 3 in the morning, and the lady at the front desk was courteous and understanding of how tired we were, and she got our room together in record time. 

It was quiet...until the morning we checked out, when a family with three loud, obnoxious, ill-behaved children checked in next to us and we could hear them running around, jumping on the beds, kicking the walls, and screaming their heads off. They woke us up at about 7am. Not okay. I informed the front desk of this at checkout and they said they would send someone to take care of it, in case there were people on the other side of them. Not sure if it happened or not, as we were on the road five minutes later. 

It has a good location. You can take the tram to the Luxor or Mandalay, and there's a pedestrian walkway right at the entrance so you can get to the MGM and New York New York quickly. Lots of food close by too. 

That being said...

The Cons: 

The resort fee, which is annoying, but almost impossible to avoid anymore. Nearly every hotel on the strip charges a resort fee now. 

Parking and getting to the front desk is not easy. The parking lot by the hotel is always full, so most likely you'll end up parking in the garage, and then lugging your stuff either through the casino back entrance and up to the front desk or around the outside of the building, during which you'll have to avoid taxi drivers and valet attendants parking cars to get to the front entrance. Both of those options suck, especially at 3am after a six hour drive. 

There seemed to be way more more salespeople harassing us about timeshares\/freebies\/giveaways\/etc. here than at other hotels. By the end of our trip we were planning out our route so as to avoid them. If you say no and ignore them they continue to follow you unless you get really aggressive, and that's just rude. 

The facility is in DIRE need of a renovation. It opened in 1990 yet the carpet and wallpaper look like they came out of the 70s. Carpet and walls in the casino and hallways reek of cigarette smoke, and look nicotine brown to match.  It's a casino, I get it, but it's really, really bad. They could at least shampoo the carpet. 

The elevators creak a lot, they probably could use some maintenance too. 

They're taking out most of the Camelot stuff. Not good, in my opinion. At this point it looks like a very gimmicky, half-baked theme that feels like whoever is in charge just doesn't care, which is disappointing. The buffet now looks like a sterile hospital cafeteria, which certainly didn't whet my appetite(or hardly anyone elses', either. It was practically empty). If this is the direction they're going I don't see it succeeding, which is sad, because it used to be charming. 

There's a lot of potential here. They have the arcade, and the Tournament of Kings, and if they updated the decor, found a good mix of modern and medieval, I can see it being a big hit with families, which I believe was the aim of it when it opened, from what I've read. 

Verdict: It's a good place to stay if you're looking to establish a base and don't mind either walking or forking over cab fare to get to other places on the strip. Is it worth the $50 per night? I think so. Is it worth the $189 per night they're charging on their website? No. 

It wasn't bad but we'll be looking at other places to stay for our next Vegas trip, closer to the middle of the strip.

Stayed in a queens room in the resort tower last night. The room was quite dated. While the price was good, the resort fee was a little excessive for facilities we did not use.  The AC persnickety but maintainable came quickly when called. The pillows were flat and the mattresses were worn. 
Check in entailed long lines. The facility was clean, though. 
We only stayed one night.

This is a two-star hotel, so I'm giving it two stars to be accurate. But I'm also not thrilled with the Excalibur. So the rating can be explained either way. 

We're talking cheeeeeap rooms here, people. I paid $30 a night to stay here for a week; compared with NYNY across the street charging $190 on the same days. When I travel for work, I travel cheap. So this dumpy place works. But no way would I skimp and book this place for a vacation. If you're like me and enjoy luxe and glam accommodations with your travel, stay the hell away from here. 

Some irksome things: 

- no one at the valet when I rolled up around midnight on a week day
- no one wanted to help me lug my giant printer up to my room (liability reasons)
- no one in general to take my luggage (so I had to make two trips)
- two lights were out when I got to my room
- cord to the wired internet was broken
- my door wouldn't auto-lock on closure one night, so I had to slam it multiple times until it decided to wise up...
- ...this turned out to be a bad idea, because I got back to my room and it wouldn't open T_T

But this whole review isn't one big downer. Any staff I actually encountered throughout Excalibur, for the most part, really amped up an otherwise lackluster stay. 99% of the people working here are all smiles, all service, all the time. It's nuts.

- David, technician, just awesome. Great personality, super fast, knowledgeable at what he does. Doesn't come on up into your space and leave a mess.
- Angel, front desk, I actually like you. I know how it is to be exhausted and just wanna go home, and you know what, I'm glad that whole thing we had to deal with worked out.
- Everyone working at Dick's who would "compliment" my blue hair every day. You dudes are funny.
- People trying to get you to sign up for Mlife. How can you guys be so friggin friendly after hours of getting the shutdown??
- The security officer in Tower II who was such a gentleman! I'm sure watching a tiny woman carry an industrial sized printer around would worry any chivalrous heart, haha; but he was so courteous and helpful, I'm sad I don't remember his name!

Alas, there are so many more names I can't recall. The first technician who came by to fix my internet. The guys working the valet at 1 am. The security who had to bust me into my room. I could go on and on. Bottom line, know that every one of these awesome blossoms keep the gears of Vegas well oiled and contributed to a work-stay that was far more enjoyable than it should have been. Peace.

I had an issue with Orbitz and booming. I remained calm and stayed nice. In return they helped me out and both Manager and check-in clerk were very understanding and helpful. The rooms are very nice, clean, and upgrading is worth it!

Ok, this is my 3rd trip this year to this resort. Since I stay here so much I've been lucky enough to upgrade to a pearl M life member :). It comes with many perks, like V.I.P check in. So, I was super excited being able to go to the "special" line for the first time.  The line was very short, which was great, but Rosa was extremely rude. From the look on her face you thought she didn't want to be there. She didn't crack a smile the entire time she helped us. Seeing how I've stayed here numerous times Im use  to the staff at the front desk being friendly, she was the exact opposite. There are a few rooms with seating areas that I love and we asked her if that room was available on a smoking floor, she said no I don't have one clean, and just looked at us like oh well. This wouldn't make me upset if in the past other front desk staff hadn't been so helpful. Luis at my prior stay told us "hey the room isn't clean but give me 30 minutes and I'll take care of you". Not from Rosa, she didn't even care when we started asking well do you know time frame, or are there rooms like it? She seemed like she couldn't wait to get us out of her face. I even had to ASK for the coupon book that is given at checkin. Why did I have to ask for it?. Keep in mind this is the MLIFE check in, 1st experience that she completely crapped on. It really put a bad taste in my mouth. 
 Aside from the utter lack of customer service provided by Rosa.  Anthony (concierge) was super nice and helpful, Sherry(buffet) was great and suggested activities we could do that evening. The room was nice and clean as always and couldn't beat the rate. But I strongly suggest if you're next in line and Rosa helps you , allow someone to go in front of you. Don't allow this woman to start your trip off the wrong way. I really hate writing bad Yelp reviews but her lack of friendliness, compassion, customer service and complete lack of eye contact and smile was completely horrid. I've never had anyone treat me this way at this resort and it was highly disappointing.

Bed Bugs!!!!! Stayed here to break in the New Year and got attacked by Bed Bugs! The stuff the front desk managers made us go through to get us out of the room was very unprofessional! They sent our clothes out to get cleaned and we waited over 24 hours to get them back. Nothing like spending your New Years Eve in a room infested with Bed Bugs!

After I read a couple of reviews on yelp about how horrible this hotel was, I reconsidered my reservations. I had booked and to my surprise it wasn't bad. The staff  I encountered were very friendly. We were helped by Cora in reservations, we asked if there was any rooms available in tower two (b\/c I had read horror experiences in tower one.) and with out a hassle she exchanged our room and went above and beyond by including a great room with a wonderful view. Also, the cleaning staff had a wonderfully clean room and tidy lobby\/ restrooms (Way better than the treasure island).

If I must point out anything it would have to be 
the hotel lobby\/casino and hall ways. The place needs a little sprucing up in my opinion,It's a bit vintage even for medieval times. 

Over all this hotel is conveniently located on the strip, walking distance from some if the hottest night clubs and shopping destinations. If you encounter buyers remorse, rest assured b\/c this hotel is budget friendly. Keep the fantasy going all in all I had a blast,  will certainly book here on our next Vegas trip.

Excalibur is an old relic left from the 80s when Vegas reached out to families hoping to tap little Johnny's college fund because dad has an "unbeatable" system. There's no night spots to speak of and the rooms are average at best. But who's sleeping? Despite these negatives, it is probably my favorite place to gamble. The dealers and the bosses are friendly. The cards are dealt at a comfortable speed. And the drink ladies came around very often. This definitely is in stark contrast to Mandalay in particular where it was all business.

This place really sucks. We did not stay there but had to travel through it several times on our way to Mandalay Bay.
The hotel is very old and smelly.
The $25 all you can eat all day-is a joke. The lines are long and the food it awful!!! The only thing that was edible was the pot stickers.
Everything was stale and gross.  A total waste of money. 
I should of payed the extra $10 bucks and ate at the Mandalay Bay Bayside Buffet instead- which was absolutely amazing.

To be totally clear, this was probably the cheapest possible room as I only needed it for a few hours when we first arrived to Vegas in the wee hours of the night. Comped room by MyVegas. Still gross, lol. The customer service is good, everyone was friendly. The rooms? Um.... I wasn't sure of how clean it was. Or maybe because it was pretty outdated. I saw a bug at one point, but we told ourselves it was a free room and that we were only there to freshen up and have a few shots until we could check into our other hotel. I'm sure the more upgraded rooms looks tons better. Check in and out was fairly easy and quick though. Also, the customer service was good, the lady at the front desk gave us a free upgrade... I think it may have been for the view? There were no lines and this hotel is very family friendly.

Casino only. 

Why is it that in Vegas, small sleazy places are fun, but massive sleazy places are just gross? I don't know what it is with Excalibur -- maybe it was the drunk dude barfing into the garbage can in the middle of the casino. Yes, bad timing perhaps.

it's not quite what i'm used to when i'm in vegas, but we were on a budget vegas trip (coupled with 175 bucks in airfare roundtrip for two!), so the excalibur fit the bill. the first floor stinks and the elevators are slow, but what can you expect for one of the cheaper hotels on the strip? it's better than staying off the strip but sometimes, it's just worth it to plop down some cash to stay somewhere nicer.

Plain and simple. Rude employees ! Our machine would not cash out, so we hit the assistance button. Took them more than 15 minutes to arrive and on top of that both employees were smart asses. If you do not like your job and do not want to assist please do us all a favor and go somewhere else.
My room smelled like someone has been smoking in for a decade, even though they said this area of the hotel is non-smoking. No microwave or fridge available. So disappointed!

Excalibur is an economical option to stay on the strip. Nothing fancy here. The rooms are outdated, but it served its purpose of being a place to sleep after packed days of Las Vegas activities.

There are a lot of quick food options. We stayed in Tower II and there's a Baja Fresh right next to the elevators in the lobby. I ate there twice and it was one of my more reasonable meals during the trip. 

The only thing that really bothered me was being charged fees to receive packages at the hotel. I've stayed at many hotels while on business and have never paid any fee to accept a package. For a hotel that also has a "resort fee", I'd think this would be a complimentary service for their guests.

I'd probably stay here again, but will definitely consider other options as the rates aren't that competitive to some other hotels on the strip.
Hotel stay was ok for the money. Avoid the buffet at all costs; food tasted bland.  Yuck.

Didn't stay here. But had dinner and parked in the garage. Parking used to be free but now they're charging $5 after the first hour. I would have no problem paying if they upgraded the parking area. Parking attendants let you in and then tell you there are no parking spaces available. Once you finally find a spot on your own after driving around for 30 mins (1\/2 of your free hour already gone), there are no safe areas to get into the hotel. You're basically going through what looks like a service entry way and trying to dodge the traffic on the way over. We were lucky that it was raining too. Seriously, if we have to pay to park now- a safe, covered walking area would be nice.

My friends and I had been planning this trip for months, so in the spirit of saving some cash, we decided to go with a more reasonably priced option. We booked a room for 3 nights at $96 a night.

The hotel was easy to locate and parking was not much of a hassle. Registration\/check in was speedy, we arrived around 6:30 pm. I mention the time because as I walked through the hotel the following day  in earlier hours, the registration line was extremely long.

Our room was located in the 25th floor in Tower 1. The surprises started when we came into the room. The beds where not made, there were soiled towels all over, the restroom was a mess. Pretty much we got checked into a room that had not been checked to see if it was ready for new guests. We called front desk and they immediately transferred us to a new room. We were moved to floor 27. The room seemed clean from first glance, the restroom looked cleaned, and the beds were made. The surprise in this room came  the following morning. Unless the Holy Ghost came and raped me, the cleaning crew missed a USED condom in the sheets. Disgusting and completely unsanitary, who could have know what STDs the person who wore that condom had. Are they just making the beds and not changing the sheets? I'm sure that enough money goes into this hotel for them to provide quality rooms to their guests.

I'm happy for person who got laid and had fun, I know I didn't lol. 

I'm will definitely not be spending my money here, ever again. 

Lesson learned, spend more money and save yourself the crabs.

One of the cheaper hotels on the Las Vegas strip and well, you get what you pay for. 

Cons - The air conditioner was a nuisance that would never turn off because the thermostat didn't work. Maintenance was quick in fixing the problem. Even when we wanted it on the temperature was hard to control. 

The room was not clean upon entering we found empty beer cans and a dirty floor. Maybe they need to upgrade their vacuums because it seems like a common gripe among yelp reviewers. 

Literally ever time we walked to the elevators there was somebody trying to sell us tickets for a show or a time share. It got rather annoying.

We paid a little extra for a strip view which was nice BUT noisy. We heard the NY roller coaster and every helicopter tour, plus sirens. So caution there. 

The beds were hard as a rock and gave my husband a back ache.

Pros- The price definitely. In Vegas you shouldn't spend much time on the room anyway. 

Great Casino, sports bar and atmosphere. Good restaurants and gift shops.
I stayed twice at the Excalibur and both times everything was perfect! Nice staff, comfortable room, great location and unbeatable price! Oh and there's Buca Di Beppo!

No complaints about this hotel. Have stayed here numerous times and it has never failed. Has all I need which is a decent clean room, comfy bed, and a good sized bathroom to take care of business. Will be back late August and I cant wait. Granted there is better looking hotels on the strip but I dont go to Vegas to stay cooped up in a hotel room so I'd rather save my money for gambling, food, drinks and shows. I love going to Vegas to get out have a good time and explore. If you're looking for a high class hotel and your on the materialistic side then STAY AWAY and go drain your wallet elsewhere.

OMG, I can't stand this place. It's so noisy, like there's no insulation! You hear everything outside, we didn't sleep for days. The rooms are dirty and the AC doesn't work. Check out time is 3:00...so they came into our room twice (Once without knocking!) between 1:00 and 2:30. I know they're used to drunk assholes, but we prepaid AND told them what time we're checking out! I'd rather stay at Motel 6, at least they know how to treat people. : |

The best: very comfortable bed. 

The worst: Crowded. 

We pay around $150 for one double bedroom and one triple.

I don't know about the hotel but the Tournament of Kings was pretty cool.  My girl and I wanted to see a show and have dinner and what better then to knock the both out in one try.  This was really cheesy but that is what we like about it.  We sat in Spain, so we rooted for the King who was knocked out of the tournament second.  Oh well,  our dinner was very "rustic".  A whole chicken, a big piece of steamed broccoli, some fried potato's, and goblet of tomato soup.  Which we had to eat with our hands.   Kazaaaaaah.  The acrobatic little gymnasts finished it out with an incredible display of athleticism.  Jumping and flipping like mad, mad I say!!  Ye show was fun,  but now on to a tavern for a pint of mead....
I love this hotel.  I have the MLIFE card, and they send me great deals.  They have great customer service.

Good stay for first time visit in las vegas!!! The only complaint is the $10 parking fee, there is a big casino floor with lots of bars and places to eat there is a food court on the 2nd floor as well as a buffet. Stayed here because it was cheap $45\/night not including $35 resort fee. Located on the strip near Mandalay bay

I will NEVER stay here again.  We left early in the morning to eat and shop.  Came back to the room about 2PM to rest our feet for a bit before we went back out again and when we walked in, both the beds were NOT MADE, so we checked the bathrooms - it smelled like it had been clean, however, ALL THE TOWELS I HAD HUNG UP SO WE CAN REUSE TO HELP THIS HOTEL CONSERVE ENERGY ENDED UP ON THE FLOOR!!  (I did upload pictures.). I'm assuming that housekeeping probably just sprayed air freshener and left.  So I called housekeeping and the lady I spoke to, forgot her name, said she would let the super know and they will get someone to come back and clean.  We left at 3PM and came back about 8:30PM and, of course, the room was still THE SAME AS WHEN WE HAD LEFT IT!  So I called housekeeping again and spoke to Natasha.  She didn't apologize when I told her the situation and asked for more towels and another bar soap.  She just said she'll send some up right away.  

*Finally received towels and more toiletries at 8:50PM.*

Word to management:  I would really hire people that want to keep the hotel clean and up to par.  Just spraying cleaner in the bathroom and then leaving it more of a mess than the guests that are staying there is HORRIBLE.

My friend and I recently went to Vegas for 5 days. We stayed in the Excalibur. This is the farthest down I have ever stayed on the Strip. We arrived about 11:30 am. The registration line was huge. It probably took 20 minutes to get to the desk. The resort fee was $140 (including tax) for 5 days. The original $125 was bad enough and then get another $15 out of us. We were then informed that our room wouldn't be ready until 3pm. BUT for an extra fee of $28 we could go to our room right now. So, what you are saying is the room I reserved will sit empty until you call me to tell me I can check in. That is just money grubbing. The room was ok. I have been in better, I have been in worse. Very touristy. It was like the cattle had been released from the barn to graze on the expensive grass. When this hotel was built it was cool. Now it seems outdated. There was no flair and no charm. The only bright spot was Buca Di Beppo. Love that place. This was my last stay on the Strip. I used to think the Strip was the shit. We had more fun on Fremont and the casinos off the Strip. The MGM Resorts company has squeezed its last nickel out of me. The best part of this review is the corporate email that will be sent to me about how sorry they are about my bad experience. Refund some of the money I spent and maybe I will accept it.

To be fair, if this hotel were anywhere besides Las Vegas I would of given it at least two or perhaps three stars. But with so many options in Vegas, this would truly have to be a last resort. The only place on the strip that I can think of that was equally tacky was Circus Circus, and surprise! They are owned by the same people...

Okay, so it's old.... fair enough. Kid friendly, okay. But... Why put yourself through this if you are in Vegas and have so many options? I promise if you book your trip in advance you can find a great Deal at the MGM, Mirage, Treasure Island, Paris, or NYNY, etc etc... all which are a step above this mess.

What a sad, tired, shit hole this place is. It's one of the cheaper properties on the strip, so this shouldn't come as too much of a surprise. But it's a sad, tired, shit hole nevertheless. Unless you're hellbent on staying on the strip, you'd do better to stay some place downtown (even if you want to gamble).

Our room was a cinderblock tomb covered in wall paper, and furnished with two queen sized beds and a flat screen TV housed in a cheap armoire. It was kind of gross. The walls were bare--not  even bad art, or framed mirror, or anything--giving the room a prison cell feel. The toilet flushes noisily for 5 minutes per flush. This 22 year old property still has no Wi-Fi. You have to plug your laptop into this movement-hindering tether from the 20th century called an "ethernet cable" in order to get "high speed internet". Miraculously, my laptop had a port for this anachronistic plug, so we did have an internet connection. That doesn't stop Excalibur from tacking on a 'resort fee' ($15 per day) to cover this 'amenity' (along with the outdoor pool no one uses in December) like the more modern and upscale properties on the strip. 

The casino floor itself is run down and sad, and anyone staying there primarily to gamble must surely and sadly migrate up the strip to more interesting venues. The low ceiling and poor lighting are kind of depressing. This doesn't stop Excalibur from charging regular strip prices for drinks ($10 a pop) and food ($35 for the "all you can eat" buffet). After one night my girlfriend and I treated it simply as a a place "to crash", entering and exiting our hotel via the elevators near the exit, and visiting only to sleep.

It's a joke that this place continues to try to hang with the more upscale strip properties, especially without a willingness to upgrade or renovate. My advice for an old, rundown property like this? If you're going to be a cheap shit hole, behave like a cheap shit hole. Drop the premium strip pricing on food and drink. Drop the 'resort fee'.

We bought two rooms for 2 nights each off one of the discount sites...BIG MISTAKE. Dirty Filthy Disgusting place with horrible service.

-We paid $40\/ night for two nights,  found out we were not allowed to ask for adjoining rooms or same floor before check in....What a joke.
- Got there and found out about $15\/Day FACILITY FEE thus making the rooms same price as the hotels we WANTED to stay in...."F*cked at the drive through"  though I'll but they all do this now..buyer beware.
- We were practically GANG BANGED by the TIME SHARE PEOPLE rabidly working the lobby(EMPLOYED BY THE HOTEL FOR THE HOTEL!), which is exactly what we DIDN'T want after being up 24 hours and in the car for 5.
-Asked for adjoining rooms and were told none available and if we wanted to wait another hour,t here "might" be...WHAT A JOKE.
- No Parking except in back lot garage 300 yards from building, so when we finally checked in, I moved car to Valet for luggage help....one guy came out and unloaded our luggage onto cart, then told us to go find a valet...once we did, the luggage guy informed us that he wouldn't be taking our luggage to room, someone else would.  He took us to desk and told us to leave luggage and they would bring it up later...I told him no, I was not leaving laptop and would just take cart myself....Desk Luggage guy told me, "No , you can't take cart, its our policy, you can just wait, were busy (I had been up 26 hours traveling and working.).....SO, we got to WAIT for SHITTY service and tip THREE people to get our car parked and our luggage dropped at room... when we got settled, our friend left something in car, VALET told them they were busy and wouldn't bring the car around for another 90 minutes....
-FREE WIFI is on an unsecured network!
- In the meantime, wife went to  check into OUR room and found VOMIT ALL OVER BATHROOM AND BLACK PUBIC HAIR ON PILLOW CASE.....she called desk and they informed her "that room is marked clean, its OK..."  When she demanded another room they asked her if she wanted to pay $30 for a "VIEW fee" to get a room with a view.....WHAT A JOKE.
- I met our traveling companions in elevator and told him this story, the girls next to me informed me that their room was just issued to them with the words "I LOVE YOUR PENIS" written on the mirror in Sharpie.....the desk also told them the room was marked "CLEAN"

well, at least there is PENIS LOVE in the universe...Stay elsewhere.......Don't pay for the view, and love thy neighbors' penis...

Stayed here in Feb 2016- just the worst. our hotel room was not clean, when I went to take the sheets back on the bed, boom NASTY STAINS, I know its Vegas and people wear tons of make up but if its truly a stain that they don't get out by washing...just buy new sheets. I mean this is a hotel they should have some money to do that. When they brought new sheets the fresh clean one had spots of brown, I showed the house cleaning lady (she was awesome and so nice!) and she said "EW!" and got me a new one that we looked over. I had to have them  come 2 times this trip. They refunded my resort fees, that was nice but I'll never stay there again.

We did a quick 24 hour turn-a-round and the Excalibur was great! I do not know how we got the upgrade but I have to say THANK YOU!!!!! Totally made the trip even better. The staff was really friendly and helpful. Will go back again!

IF YOU VALUE YOUR OWN OR FAMILY MEMBERS' LIVES, DO NOT STAY AT EXCALIBUR HOTEL. 

This is the WORST hotel stay my ENTIRE life. Our room got broken into while we're sleeping and the bugler took three iphones and all of our cash with a total value over $2000. There were 4 of us staying at the room and even my friend's phone that's charging at the most inner corner of the room was stolen. All of us were traumatized and feared for our lives for the rest of the trip. What if one of us has woken up and got hurt by the bugler? 

The burglary happened last Saturday morning (8\/24\/2013) between 5 a.m. (when we went to sleep) and 8:30 a.m. (when we woke up). It is amazing how the bugler took his time and scoped out the room and only took cash and iphones (not credit cards\/ipad\/laptops\/jewelry) in such as short window and managed to not wake one of us up. 

What did the hotel do? NOTHING! The security came up and took statement and referred us to the "Risk Management" department, which conveniently was closed for the weekend. The security taught us how to "dead bolt" lock the door after the fact (you have to turn your door knob upward with a 90 degree angle). There was no instruction on the door for such unconventional locking method. However, after the front desk manager moved to another room, BOOM, there was a sticker on the door showing how to dead bolt the door. It led to us to believe our original room 9206 was a repeated burglary room. 

The entire Saturday was a waste talking to security, front desk manager, hotel manager and they all said they have no authority to do anything and we would have to wait for the "Risk Management" department to come back to work on Monday. We followed up on Monday and the Risk Management receptionist told us that "we're still just getting the report in; you will have to wait until one of the investigators gets the report". We called repeatedly and she just kept on referring to the investigator. Excalibur is truly amazing on how they just continuously pointing fingers to another person\/department. I called again yesterday (8\/29\/2013) after 5 days of the actual burglary, the receptionist said "the investigator assigned to your case has just stepped out of the office" and of course she never called me back. I called again today and Risk Managements' automatic answering machine is on again. I'm assuming they have the Friday off for the Labor Day weekend. 

We checked the reviews on tripadvisor and apparently burglary is a repeated offense in Excalibur. I'm seriously thinking to start a CLASS ACTION SUIT to get justice, and to save future customers form our traumatizing experience. If you have experience with your belongings getting stolen at Excalibur and if you're interesting in joining the CLASS ACTION SUIT, please send me a message.

I will give Excalibur a zero star for the following reasons:

1. Repeatedly burglary offense.
2. No security camera on the hallways.
3. No process in place for burglary events. 
4. Hotel manager don't have any authority to help us.

I love MGM properties, but this place is garbage! 

My sister and I had a two night comped stay through MGM's app called myVegas slots where you can earn loyalty points to purchase various comps like free rooms food ect... 

We booked a double queen smoking room. They put us in a non smoking room. When we called to get a room change, it took 25 minutes for the bell man to arrive. (Which cut into some serious drinking time) When we arrived to our second room, the window was covered in graffiti! How can you miss that?!? The house keeper threw my $500 prada sunglasses on the floor so that he could climb on to the table to clean it! 

When we told our story to the front desk manager, she lied to us about the buffet comps she gave us... so we got screwed out of that too! 

We were playing at a slot machine and got ignored by two cocktail waitresses. We finally got a hold of one and she was one of the rudest people I have ever met! Pointing at me like I was some dumb 21 y\/o that wasn't going to tip her... 

Forget this place and stay at the tropicana!

This is a decent choice if you are looking for a less expensive stay on the South Las Vegas Strip. Yes what you read here is true: The rooms look and feel dated. The selection and picture quality of TV is weird and almost random (one plus: the only cable news station was MSNBC; if it had been FOX it would have been unforgivable).  But the pool is fine (no it's not the MGM Grand or Caesars) and the staff was super friendly to me. The room was clean. If you are LV and aren't planning on using the room for much else than a bed to sleep in while all the fun goes on elsewhere this place works. Also, if you have AAA you can get a 10% discount - this is way cheaper than a lot of other options.

Where are the merry minstrels? Hilarious harlequins? Banquet halls with wenches who serve you roasted pheasant and Diet Pepsi? Didn't you know? They exist only in Medieval lit'rature! *laughs* If you're expecting a magical experience at Excalibur Hotel, you will be disappointed.

A while back, several of my cousins and their friends came to town and booked their rooms at the Excalibur (must've been a group rate).  Having not visited the Excalibur in years, I thought I'd tag along with them and see if anything changed from the last time I visited.

When you first enter Excalibur, you'll be hit immediately with the stench of smoke that's been absorbed by this place for the last 20+ years. You may also notice how dark and dreary it is (like a real castle, perhaps?). Talk about lacking in the enchantment department. 

Parents might think this place is kid friendly because, well, it's a hotel which resembles a castle that would make any kid in a stroller scream with demands to, "go there, NOW!" Unfortunately, parents, you're a couple of decades too late. I can speak from experience that this place was fun for kids back in the 90s, and I'll leave it as that. *hem* The only spot here for kids is its arcade, which is located downstairs. The arcade area is small, and there are too many games shoved into such a tiny space. Basically, it's a torture chamber for kids and adults.

Excalibur's "private quarters" aren't really suitable for a king, but hey, it's an affordable place to stay for the night, especially if you're on a budget and don't mind sleeping in sheets that: "look like they can be used for wrapping dead people in", as noted by my cousin's friend. The rooms may be smaller than other hotel rooms on The Strip, but my cousin and his friend were fortunate enough to receive a room that overlooked the parking lot; I thought this compensated nicely for the lack of space.

Visiting this place is one thing. If you haven't been here before, then why not visit, even if it is shabby, to say the least. But staying here for a night or two? I wouldn't recommend it; although, it is a step up from the Motel 6 and Imperial Palace (definitely not suitable for an emperor). I'd think twice about booking a room here.

I thought that I scored a deal when I booked one night at Excalibur for $45 but it was a wake up for me when my hotel had a view of a brick wall and when I asked for another room; I was told that I would need to pay more. When I check-out I was told that I would need to pay $15 service fee which made me even more angry.  I did checked in earlier and the parking was free, free wi-fi but no refrigerator in the room. It was fine for one night but I will not stay there again.

Another casino that hasn't aged well, this is not one of my favorite places in Vegas.  I only come here when friends force me to meet them here when they visit.  The most recent visit reminded me why I don't like this place:

- It feels dirty.  I'm not going to say it's a dirty place, but it feels like it.....you know how a place looks\/feels when it hasn't been taken care of well?

- The customers.  Many of the customers were rude and had a lot of attitude....this isn't the streets.

The only thing I enjoy about the Excalibur is the Tournament of Kings Dinner\/Show.  It's a little entertaining and the food is OK.....it's the only thing that kept me from giving the Excalibur 1 Star.

Return Factor - 17%

Oh my dear lord. This place man. When I think of Vegas I think of a Disneyland for adults. I mean there are people who are out on the strip night and day handing out cards with naked women on them. This place is called Sin City for a reason and with all the places you can take your kids on vacation in the world I would suggest avoiding Las Vegas. Well most adults (with a brain in their head) feel that way but I have some sad news folks, according to Mary the Manager of Guest Services at The Excalibur they only care about catering to  families with kids and making concessions and accommodations for them. If you are apart of any other demographic, which every other place in Vegas caters to, this place could give two shits about you. Well Mary should consider another profession that has nothing to do with customer service. I was excited to stay here despite the reviews and now I see why they have the reviews they have. Thank God we got comped for 2 nights because it would have been such a waste otherwise. 

They have no good options when it comes to late night eats. They have McDonald's, Krispy Creme, and Starbucks. Wow how nice. I go on vacation to eat the same things I can get everyday at home. How about no. The McDonald's BTW has the crappiest customer service ever. They run out of everything and are pretty much useless. This place used to have a cafe that was open all night and now it is gone. Mary says that the families do not usually get hungry late at night so they see no reason to have alot of things open. Ain't that a hoot? People who are expected to gamble and drink all night are not expected to want to eat anything half way decent. 

The room was ok I guess. I was disappointed by their lack of theme in there. I realize that alot of time is not spent in the room and too that it does not matter. For me and my husband though, we pace ourselves so we do spend some time in the room so it does matter to us. I like the cheesy themes in Vegas. It is part of the fun. NYNY was WAY better at keeping the theme throughout. It is a damn shame too because The Excalibur has a wonderful theme to work with. As far as useability goes the beds were comfortable and the TV was nice and new. I liked the marble countertops also. The rest of the furniture was old and banged up and the room did not have fridge or microwave. What the crap?! Even the Travelodge has that. There was no bathtub and the shower and sinks took FOREVER to drain. This was a room in Tower 2 which was an upgrade from the room we originally booked which was a standard room. This was supposed to be one of the newer rooms. It did not really show. We only got upgraded after they had no king sized beds left when we reserved one and I sarcastically asked for an upgrade. After the guy thought about whether to take me serious or not he decided to upgrade us to the contemporary room with a view. I would hate to see what kind of room we originally would have gotten. 

As far as the casino goes I had a good time there. There was two Roulette  dealers that made it worth my while. Dave and Sandra were awesome and alot of fun. They made the table hot and even when you lost they were at least super nice so it did not sting as much. The slot machines where the same as everywhere. I can't say anything negative about the casino really. They had four 4 $5 minimum Roulette tables open which was great because that tends to be a popular game and getting a seat takes a while. They also one $10 minimum table for the bigger betters. They had some video Roulette machines and also had an Organic Roulette which has a real wheel that is spun by a machine. It has eight video stations and the minimum bet is $3 which is nice. Roulette is my favorite game and it nice to see alot of options for it. The cocktail waitresses came by often. 

Besides this place crawling with kids it is also crawling with annoying timeshare salesmen. They wait outside the towers to jump you as you leave your room. They are at the front doors, outside restaurants, pretty much everywhere. They ask you if you want free tickets to a show. They want you pay a $99 deposit for a 2 night stay at the hotel and tickets to two shows if you sit through their 3-5 hour timeshare presentation. You have a year to redeem this. We already knew this and tried avoiding them at all costs. I even told them my husband was a one night stand. You answer no to all their questions and they still don't get it. They are pushy and annoying and I would recommend that the Excalibur get rid of them. Guests don't like to be harassed. Or at the very least give them stipulations to take no for an answer. I actually yelled at one as we were checking out because she would not leave me alone. They were at NYNY also but not nearly as bad. 

Overall I will never stay at this hotel again even if we get comped! I will only come back here gamble if Roulette is lacking elsewhere and eat at Dicks. There are too many other cool places to stay in Vegas.

Yeah it does smell like smoke when you walk in. Who cares, I have asthma and it didn't bothered me.

Very clean. Stayed in tower 2, no complaints.

The staff was friendly.

I definitely will stay again
It was a fun place check in took a while but staff are pretty friendly service was good food was awesome can't wait to go back

I ended up staying at the Excalibur for one night because my flight was delayed till the next day.  So the airline put us up at the Excalibur.  So my review strictly just about the rooms.   We were in Tower II.  Get to the room and ugh.  On the ninth floor and my view is of the vents on the roof of another building.  I search for light switches and there are none.  Um, the lamp still has a pull down string to turn it on.  The AC is old and makes a boat-load of noise.  I look at the bed and the bed spread and pillows are brown and discolored. GROSS!!!!!   There is no tub, it's just a stand up shower.   A little disappointing for a hotel on the strip.  They definitely need to renovate and upgrade or tear it down and build something else!!   The one plus... there were about 300 of us lined up at one time at the front desk... the line did move pretty fast!

Great Stay! Vickie at the front desk was fantastic, a great help with checking in. The hotel is not very fancy but the best value in Vegas. Rooms are good size and an even better price. TV's are not very high quality but not much time is spent in the room. The casino is large and has many different gaming options. The food court has good variety and decent prices as well. The sportsbook isnt fancy but a great spot to watch games and make bets. Make sure to sign up for M life and get a free coupon book for the hotel and other destinations on strip. Housekeeping is good and very prompt when calling for something. Overall A Experience! Will return for sure!

Upon entering with our bags, we were bombarded with hotel staff "salesman" asking us where lived, how long we've lived together, etc. I didn't answer and they were asking just to try and sell us on stuff. We finally made it to the checking, and then up to our room. It was a nonsmoking room but I could definitely smell smoke. The room was an upgrade, but only in the TV and granite counters. The rest was stuck in the 90s. Other negatives: the shower head was horrible, and the placement of the toilet paper roll (you have to break your back just to get to it).

I don't think I'd stay here again. Maybe next time I will stay at the Paris.

I booked a two-night stay through Groupon Getaways.  I thought it was a good deal.  Exalibur is so pretty from the outside but our room was very disappointing.  We've stayed in nicer motels!  We also had a terrible view.   We got a $20 drink voucher so I decided to use it at the bar closest to where we checked-in.  The old bartender with glasses had the worst personality and he made the most disgusting pina colada.  We ended up dumping our drinks.  On a positive note, there are a lot of places to eat in Excalibur and it is in a good location.

This place seems to get kind of a bad rap, I really don't understand why. For the price you're paying and what you get its not so bad. We stayed here about 2 weeks ago, we payed just over 300 bucks to stay Friday to Tuesday which was the bast deal I found for a place on the strip. We stayed in tower 2, it was really quite nice, 2 beds, a flat screen tv, and a bathroom, we didn't spend much time in the room so it was perfect for what we needed. My only complaint was that i never got any cell phone signal in my room but i can also blame AT@T for that. The casino is kinda cheesy and I don't really like playing there, the pool was nice but the cabana we rented was kind of a let down, they advertised a platter of snacks and we got 2 fun size bag of lays BBQ potato chips LAME. I would stay here again if i was trying to do Vegas cheap, but i think I'm going to stay some where a little more classy next time.

If I could give no stars I would. I talked to a woman on the phone who told me the room total with fees and tax was 851.20$ when my friend got there they charged her 922 when I went to the front desk to ask what happened the broke it down for me as if I hadn't already done that myself. The manager came over and told me that I was informed of the real total in an email confirmation "but not obviously enough I guess."  Rude and not helpful at all. Just be use I look young doesn't mean I don't know when I'm being taken advantage of. When I checked out me total was 955.  With a very confusing break down even though the front desk told me my total would be 922. The shower broke in our room and I told the front desk they said there are no other rooms I can put you in but a one bedroom and we were staying in a two queen room. It took 2 hours for anyone to come up to even look at the shower at 2 in the morning. Then the man working on the showers for an hour says it'd be faster if you call the front desk and ask for another room. I call and they suddenly had a room available it took them another 1 1\/2 to get us room keys and move us.  The shower was fixed by the but the bathroom was trashed and mud and rust everywhere. I'm never coming here again.

As soon as I entered from the entrance closest from the parking structure, I was winded by strong cigarette odor. It's understandable that the hotel this old and since it is allowed to smoke in casino area but the area that the kids were playing was as bad as casino area in terms of cigarette odor. I walked up to the front desk to check in but the hostess was pretty cold and not so welcoming. Went up to the room and omg the carpet looks so out dated and old that I didn't feel comfortable walking bare foot...

Went to Vegas the weekend of October 13-17th for my cousins wedding. We got a great deal on a room at Excalibur. 

We enjoyed the room- nothing fancy but clean and upgraded. My sister stayed at Luxor and other family at Mandalay Bay. It was very convenient going back and forth between hotels with the connecting walkways. 

The pools at Excalibur are really nice (nicer than Luxor for sure).  

I have nothing negative to say about Excalibur hotel. I would stay there again.

I would have rather stayed at the super 8 motel than this place ever again. I stayed here 3 years ago ANC the room itself was dirty and there was a unidentified red streak in the wall that looked like blood. It never rains in Vegas but the one time it did was when we were staying here and it was the most rainfall recorded in years... The room 2 doors down's ceiling collapsed and the whole floor smelled like mildew. Not one person checked up on us or anything and when we said something about the smell the didn't move us or anything. I will never stay here again and will tell everyone else not to either.

My husband and I picked this hotel because we got a good deal with Southwest Airlines Vacation pack- it was between this one and Circus Circus (and I've heard HORRIBLE things about circus circus). 

Excalibur is nice- hey ... its a hotel with slot machines everywhere ... 

We had an earlier flight and got to the hotel before our room was ready. The lady at the front desk said she got us a great room and for us to check our bags while we waited for the room. 

The only bad thing about this hotel- there are these reps from some hotel for time shares- they told us it would be 2-3 hours and don't want to buy and you get discounted show tickets ... LIE! 4 hours later and horrible experience there ... I think I would have rather paid full price for our shows. *** 

***this is nothing about Excalibur ... just what happened there*** 

When we got to our room- we had a view of the strip- Awesome room! BIG SHOWER! For the price- we did well. 

Only negative about our room was we had 1-3 ants every day ... not too sure what that was from? 

The hotel also has an awesome buffet- $29.95\/person for ALL DAY! You can come back as many times as you'd like. For Vegas, this is a great deal! 

Shows: Louie Anderson (if you stay here you get buy one\/get one free tickets), Thunder from Down under (didn't see this) and some cave man show (we didn't see) 

All in all, we had a nice time at this hotel. If you come on a budget, its not bad- if you have all the money in the world ... stay somewhere else.

We stayed at the Excalibur four days Oct 16-19. We got in at 230am. Checked in right away. Very friendly staff. We had great customer service. They even upgraded our room after I stated that we've never stayed here and this was our teens very first experience in Vegas. We got a nice room. Two queen beds, 27th floor overlooking the strip. It was a beautiful view at night time. 
The most amazing thing was that they had security at each entry to the elevators to rooms. They asked to see your key card each & every time. Made us feel welcomed and comfortable. 
The only down side, the main pool was closed for the season. They had 1 pool open and it was kinda overload with people, and some children. The pool that had the slide was closed too. The only part open was the slide. 
Parking wasn't as bad as I thought. In the casino they had very friendly staff and waitresses that were always quick and efficient. 
I liked how they had things spread out & in walking distance to other nearby Resorts. 
Excalibur we will be back again. Thank you for the upgraded remodeled room and the view!

Ew, this was hardly worth the $44\/night I spent to stay here. The bathroom looked like something straight out of a Motel 6, and the mattress and comforter weren't much better. The hotel shampoo basically ruined my hair for 48 hours after checking out, and I had a hard time sleeping with such thin walls. We were lucky enough to get strip-view rooms, which was pleasant enough. Too bad Excalibur is so far from the center of the Strip that it wasn't much of a view. I will never stay here again. At least if I stay at some crapfest like the Tropicana I know what to expect.

This is actually my first "Yelp review", and regretfully, I have to begin with a negative one...DO NOT STAY HERE. 
My fianc and I booked a "preferred  King room" , and paid the "all inclusive" rate in advance. 

We were stopped in the lobby by two hotel employees, who made it appear as they were checking us in, as they attempted to hustle us with a time share "schpeel", all while we tried to make our way to the near hour wait to "check in" to our "pre-paid, all inclusive, pre-checked in...simply pick up your key", room. 

Summation: we were told by Kayla, that our pre-paid, preferred non\/smoking, King room, "might not be available...", then when I said that we would contest w\/ Am Ex, she suddenly came up w\/ a room...at the end of the long, long hall, that smells of cigarette smoke--which I am allergic to--hence the "non-smoking" request. 

When I called to ask about being moved to an actual non-smoking room, I was denied this modest request - then put through to a manager. Her answer to the problem? "...you got exactly what you paid for, you booked through a 3rd party, we can't do anything, we will bring in a machine, air freshener, etc., to take care of the problem."  REALLY??!!! I was then told to "take it up with American Express." Verbatim. I. Am. Not. Exaggerating. Oh, and "we will not refund the resort fee, period".

Having travelled all over the country, and Europe, my finance traveling the country for over 2 decades, weekly, for work, and having a son in the hospitality business (5 star, and yes, this is 3 star, but really???), for a decade, I have NEVER been treated so rudely, anywhere, and blatantly ignored for a simple customer service request

Asking to moved to a non smoking room is a minor request!

We have travelled across the country for many years  So I expect much more...not rude treatment, being hustled for a timeshare, and asked to "leave the room" for a while while they de-fumigate and spray??!!! Spray what? What chemicals are being sprayed? Who does business this way?  Certainly not a legitimate customer oriented organization. 

What a sham!


BEWARE!!! Is this a reflection of MGM and their customer satisfaction\/customer service? 

The mantra here seems to be, "too bad, we got your money, your tough luck, HA HA...take it up with American Express".
Don't waste your money...there are MANY hotels here, find another one. 
I thought that staying in a castle, I would be treated like a princess, not like I had been put in the dungeon.
Wow. Gross gross gross. I stayed here Memorial Day Weekend 2007. The whole place reeks of cigarette smoke and I've stayed in nicer and cleaner rooms at a Motel 8.

How cool was this place when you were little?  Seriously... it was like Disneyland minus the rides.  Well guess what?  You're not a kid anymore and the place is about as cool as Disneyland minus the rides.  Did I say that already?

The hotel hasn't changed much over the years.  The rooms are decorated with ordinary hotel furniture that has seen better days.  It's a great place for you and some friends to crash especially on the strip but if you're bring a date... go somewhere else.  Unless he or she has a castle fetish, spend a few extra dollars to stay at some place nice.  If you've read my reviews.  I always refer to the old saying, "you get what you pay for."

Take a look around the internet.  I've often seen discounts for Excalibur rooms on their hotel website, expedia, or american express website.  The discounts I've seen and used from american express are discounted rooms and a $25 dollar credit towards dinning.  (I suggest eating at the Sherwood Forest Cafe.)

Ok hotel if you like empty promises.  We booked last minute directly through the hotel and purchased the promotion with free buffets and a king size bed for both nights. Needless to say that all changed upon our arrival. It's a total shame that the hotel does this. We had our email receipt which does not include their hotel policy and had to negotiate\/complain in order to get what we had purchased. Upon check out we discovered some discrepancy and while we waited for the manager we watched as two other customers were visually angry and arguing with the check out employees. Just sad!  I have never stayed at a hotel and seen this. I do not recommend this hotel unless you are willing to fight for what you paid for. In the end the 2 stars is because we slept well with minimum distraction and finally had out bill resolved at check out. (I think mostly because we talked to the manager rather than chewed him out)!

First of all ass soon as u get here, your expectations are raised up because the hotel is castle theme and it's about Excalibur. Although, as soon as you go into the hotel and into your room, it's as dusty and dirty as it can get. We had multiple yellow stains on our bed and our room smells as bad as rat poop. The bathroom, specifically the toilet, is is so sticky that as soon as I got out my butt was almost stuck onto the toilet seat. If you're planning to go to this hotel and have high expectations, don't expect them to be met. If zero stars was an option I would've put that instead. Frankly, I would've had a better time at circus circus hotel

Like Corey W.'s review, I too was pleasantly surprised, as I had girded myself for a nightmare after reading the Yelp reviews.   I was with a large group, and I was able to warn them about the room doors not closing and that 'ruffians' roamed the halls pushing on doors looking to gain entry (I never saw anything like that, but my room door DID fail to latch tight on its own, as did many of my friends).
My standard, 2 Queen room was spacious, modestly appointed, with a large bathroom (two adults could easily be busy in here without too much trouble).  

NIce flat screen, color TV with adequate cable service (by adequate, they had AMC, which means I didnt miss the Walking Dead), no its NOT HDTV, but it worked FINE.  

No WiFi, but guess what, WIRED LAN is BETTER by far, i had GREAT thruput.

No Fridge.  No microwave.  No coffee maker.  I knew this going in, just re-iterating the irritating.

Bed, clean, not very comfortable, lots of so-so pillows.  Free in room safe.

Resort fee - why?  Nothing 'resortish' about the place.  Just because you have a pool and gym doesnt mean you're a resort!  Free drink coupons only for beer\/well drinks?  I'm in a CASINO - drinks are FREE for gamblers.  What am I an IDIOT?  When I pay a RESORT FEE at the HILTON WAIKALOA (a REAL resort), I get TWO FREE Specialty drinks EVERY DAY!  So -1 star on value because of the redonkulous resort fee.

oh yeah that AC is loud too, everyone is right about that.  Another odd thing was lack of direction if you self-park.  The lot is dark.  There's no marked walkways, no Glowing neon signs leading the obvious path to check in or the casino.  I thought that was really weird.

Good selection of restaraunts.  Oh, if you're MLife pearl or above you are 'elite' and check in in the private section - I didnt know and waited in line with the rabble.  RABBLE I say! :) 

CASINO RATING **** (4 out of 5 star)
Wow, very surprised.  I didnt see ANY of the terrible 6\/5, just standard 3\/2 blackjack, looked like they had DOA, DAS, dealer hits soft 17.  And low limits to boot, $5.
Craps, wow $5 low limit, SWEET, 3x4x5x odds, AWESOME, but the dealers were rough, WATCH YOUR CHIPS (-1* for clumsy dealers).
And player rating is MANUAL at the tables, thats very unusual these days.
They had a Great progressive video poker bank by the Baja Fresh, that I played almost nonstop hoping I'd finally hit that Royal for $2200...alas, no, but it was 8\/5 JOB, about as good as it gets.
Vegas standard, American two-zero wheel on roulette (terrible house advantage, only idiots play American roulette).
So, surprisingly, this is a GAMBLER FRIENDLY place, especially if you're new or learning with low limits.

This is really 3.5 stars, I have to say, because the Excalibur really isn't bad at all, especially for the price. This was the first place we stayed at on our epic road trip across America, and it did us well. It was comfortable, clean, and close enough to everything else on the strip. There really wasn't much to complain about this hotel since we weren't trying to stay in the room much of the time. Sure, if you're used to staying in fancy hotels all the time, the Excalibur might not seem up to your standards. But for recent college grads like us, it was mighty fine. 

An average of 60 dollars a night when almost everything else was 100 or more. The best place to stay on a budget that isn't off the strip.

What a nightmare we have 1 hour in line waiting for check in and we have like 50 persons in front of us 
Why why is only like 6 cashiers whyyyy

My wife and I stayed here last week during our honeymoon and were unimpressed to say the least. As soon as we walked into the "resort" we were approached by a man who we thought worked for the hotel. He talked fast and promised us a free show because we were on our honeymoon. Long story short it was a scam for a Time Share. This was not the first time we would deal with these people as we quickly learned they were posted at every entrance in the casino and would approach you every time they saw you. We had one lady come to us 2 times in a ten minute time span. Once we got to our room we quickly noticed that hanging from the ceiling were two Q-tips. We called house keeping to have them come and clean it for us. After that we called the front desk and explained what happened and were basically told because housekeeping fixed it for us they wouldn't do anything. Needless to say we spent the remainder of our honeymoon anywhere but our room and casino. I would stay as far away from this hotel as I could.

The first time I stayed in Vegas, I stayed one night in the Excalibur and decided I'd return because I didn't see a point in spending so much money on a hotel room when I'd never be there. The second time I visited Vegas (most recently), I stayed at the Excalibur for five days. What a mistake! 
There's no WiFi here and I really could have used it for business a few times while I stayed. Sorry, but my iPad doesn't have a huge port for a jack on the side! 
No coffee machines in the room?! Even the cheapest hotels I've stayed at have something that will produce hot water! Come on, people! 
Beds sucked. I guess the first time I stayed in Vegas, I really was just too intoxicated to care about the comfort of my bed. Not this time! Woke up sore just about every morning! 
People were constantly harassing me and my friend to go to these timeshare conferences for free tickets. GO AWAY. 
Let's just say I had my fill of Excalibur and will not be returning. Next time I go to Vegas, I will shell out the extra money for a DECENT room.

After you've been to Las Vegas for an hour, the glamour wears off.  The arcade below the Excalibur? It makes Chuck E. Cheese look rather classy and educational. There's a metal claw over stuffed animals where you put your quarter in and the claw doesn't even move. It's broken, if not enough to have not taken your money. And you're staring at this metal claw thinking, "Ew, I'm underneath a casino. What smells like swamp water?"

I like Treasure Island.

This Hotel  -  along with the rest of Las Vegas - has gone too extreme with the Security...  One Bicycle Security Guard ( Joseph ) followed me around the parking lot. So, because of my experience with Joe the security guard -  I took my gambling money elsewhere...and  - Just like other reviewers have written - on another day -  I was asked for my ID... Hey, Las Vegas! I am on Vacation! ...Not visiting a third world socialist country!!! This is still America right??? I go to a Casino to have a fun experience - not to be treated like this.

Not that exciting, it's a hotel room with two beds and a TV. The thing I really wanted was a tub, not a shower, so I could take an Epsom salt bath to help my back after too much partying.  We didn't gamble or eat or drink at Exalibur, but can I just say having beer pong in our gambling\/drinking area right next to lobby registration is a bit odd.  Shouldn't that be at a frat party or something?
It is by far the worst hotel On the strip bug also the least expensive so you get what to pay for.

I really didn't enjoy our stay at the Excalibur. If I could give it a zero I would. First we had to wait an hour to check in! Total bummer. And then they gave us a room on the very bottom floor with a terrible view of a wall and air con unit. And then as we were going to sleep, I saw a cockroach!!!! And when I woke up I found another cockroach, but this one was dead, but very large and our counter was covered in ants. In all my years of staying at hotels, this was by far the worst experience. It was disgusting. 

My son is allergic to cockroaches and the whole time there he was sniffling. It's awful that a hotel we paid good money for would make my child sick! 

Never stay here!!!

There are two tram stops here. If you're coming from Mandalay Bay or Luxor the first stop gives you the impression that's the last stop...so that you will walk through the casino....however there is one more tram stop which is at the corner of the strip.

We've been to Vegas twice not and every time we end up here! We love this place!  the pit boss' and dealer's are great! Super friendly! Grabbing a bite at Dick's last resort and the 100oz margaritas doesn't hurt either!
