We were actual guests at the hotel unlike some of the other reviews that just walked in the place! At check in we were greeted by Gordana, she was beautiful on the inside and out! Why do I say that because she took her time to listen to our needs and even shared some of her own story which made it feel like a much more personalized experience. 
Our room was a standard king room with a great view of the strip. What I thought was brilliant about the pricing is they have a chart at the check in window with all the upgrades and how much each one cost. No question is left unanswered!
Like other reviews said if you're looking for a lavish trendy over priced hotel this place probably isn't for you. If you don't mind a little dated carpet and decor the location is awesome!! You're located next to Luxor, NYNY, MGM Grand and about 1.4 miles walk to Paris and Caesar's palace. Truly Excalibur has a great location. 
We ate at Johnny Rockets ( another review) Baja Fresh ( another review) and spent time at several of the bar areas. Everyone was friendly and the service was amazing! It seemed everywhere we went there was a friendly bug! Sweet!
My only two criticism are 1. The swimming pool closed at 7pm! We had slept in and gone to see the Body Exhibit and ate dinner and planned to take a swim before catching our show but lots of people were turning around and leaving at the door....we couldn't believe ANYTHING in Vegas closed so early. The pool actually looked very nice but we never got a chance to enjoy the pool. What a disappointment. 2. There is a strong smell of smoke mixed with a strange perfume smell that is not really appealing. If you're spraying a scent into the casino I'd suggest to marketing to try a different scent. I've heard a hotel in Miami sprays Michael Kors original scent and they get lots of business and compliments on the smell. I'm disappointed we didn't get to enjoy the pool....but otherwise all the staff and accommodations were amazing. This is a great place to stay and bring the family or couples either way. This last visit was just my husband and myself. Give 10 Stars to Gordana! She is excellent customer service!

Just started using yelp and wish I had been a user before my Vegas trip! I get offers of free rooms all the time in Vegas (I go at least 2-3 times each year) and decided on Excalibur for one of my freebies. It wasn't worth it ! Free or not, the room were old and terrible and the walk from check in to the rooms was about a mile long. Service was OK but when the room is this old not worth the stay even if it was free.

My initial reaction was to rate it two stars, but I reconsidered after pondering the outstanding customer service by the staff,  I'm a 47year resident of Las Vegas and I recall when poor customer service was a sore spot for this resort destination. I've been away for six years so this is the first time I've come back as a tourist, so I have a new perspective (I lived here and never stayed in the hotels.) So for that 5 stars, but 2 stars for the rest. We were offered a no-charge upgrade to the "recently renovated" Royal Towers but couldn't see that renovation aside from updated bathroom fixtures.  Room was very clean, bed very comfortable, room service was great and reasonable. Camelot Steakhouse was outstanding, but the other food offerings were too pricey. Pool area very small, and there was one of many upcharges for an "Adult Pool" for $10 a head. Stale cigarette smoke permeates even the non-smoking rooms of the "Royal Tower" but given the age of this resort I imagine that's a given. Another upcharge is a daily fee which includes internet access, but it was down for the first two days of our stay.

I have been here a handful of times and always had a wonderful experience. Today (8-23-16) has been the worst check in experience ever. So far we have waited 30 minutes going on 45 just to get to the front desk. This is ridiculous.
Checked in at 12:44. Wasted 40 something minutes of my vacation.

The exterior, from afar, is spectacular in that kitchy, over-the-top Las Vegas way that I love.  Beautiful.  Especially at night. 
The interior smells like a daycare about to be closed down by the state for unsanitary conditions.  Along with that smell comes a multitude of Ritalin-deprived children and their corresponding overweight, fanny-pack sporting parents.
I'm sure without checking that the rooms are every bit as sweet as the casino area. 
If this place had the best VP pay schedules in town, which it does not, I still would never set foot in it again.

I am rating this for the hotel room which was non smoking and was spacious and clean with two comfy queen beds so I cannot complain it was a solid A-OK.  The bathroom counter was long and had double sinks and was ample enough for two ladies and all their gear! We stayed in tower 2 and the room was a nice reprieve from all the cigarette smoke in the casinos and on the strip.  Overall the room was fabulous it just was not located centrally enough on the strip for me.  I found myself walking much more than I wanted to on a hot summer day since everything we wanted to see was closer to the Paris, which doesn't look too far on the map but it is! The exercise was good especially with all the visiting of buffets that we did, but to get to shows and stuff 4-5 casinos down the strip all dressed up in heels the Excalibur is just a little too far to go.  If you are doing stuff at Luxor or Mandalay Bay then its not bad but in my opinion you only need to come down this far once during your trip to see these 3 casinos on the far end. This is one of the older casinos and there isn't really too much going on in here, no big attractions really but for the price of this trip it couldn't be beat so thats why we ended up here.

Uno de los gigantes tradicionales de Las Vegas...necesita una remodelacion URGENTE. La alfombra del pasillo estaba pegada con cinta!! Como en todos los hoteles de Las Vegas ultimamente, la fila para la recepcion era larguisima y despues de un viaje tan largo a Las Vegas lo unico que queria era llegar. La recepcionista que me toco me quiso vender upgrade de habitacion pero cuando le hice una consulta sobre una revista de Las Vegas me dijo que me acercara al sector de resort....que hubiese sido otra fila enorme. 
Menos mal que no hice el upgrade! Despus de caminar dos cuadras por un pasillo con una alfombra rada llegue a mi cuarto. La habitacin era vieja, las cortinas olan a polvo. La cama tena sbanas viejas pero ninguna frazada, ms bien algo grueso y viejo con mal olor. El aire acondicionado hacia el ruido de una locomotora para no dar nada de aire fro. Horrible. Un desastre por donde se lo mire! 
El starbucks dentro del hotel era el mas caro que vi!
El bano era anticuado y la alfombra de la habitacion estaba vieja y sucia. Diria que lo pensaria antes de ir a este hotel

Better than I expected. The casino was not smokey and it actually smelled pleasant, like fruity shampoo. The room didn't have a coffee pot, microwave, or fridge. You don't go to Vegas to stay in but we had snacks with us we couldn't keep. Pool was nice. If you just need a clean place to crash and shower this will get the job done.

Meh. I've experienced better" is exactly how I feel about this motel. Sure it's on the strip but even then, you can find better deals that will lower hotel rooms even if they are on the strip.

Staying here, the room is dark and feels dirty, kinda like a motel room =\/.
Look around, you can find a lot better =)

How many people can say they spent the evening in a castle? Lol! But seriously though, Excalibur is one of the older hotel\/casinos on the strip but what it lacks in modern design more than makes up for it in its charm. The room I stayed in was in the Resort Tower and is a very simple yet comfortable room. It has all of the amenities that a guest needs to make their stay comfortable which is mainly a bed and a clean bathroom. My only gripe about the room was the ridiculously loud A\/C unit. Thankfully it wasn't really warm and I just turned it off before I went to bed. 

The casino floor offers the newest in slots and all the table games offered anywhere else on the Las Vegas Strip. It's pretty sizable and a gamer has many opportunities to try their luck and not have to wait to play. I wish I can say the same about the tables. The craps tables were all full and crowded as well as the blackjack tables. When I was able to sit down and play, the dealers were all very friendly and were very helpful when I had a question about the game I was playing. 

The Excalibur also boasts (at least in my opinion) one of the best shows the City of Las Vegas has to offer which is THE TOURNAMENT OF KINGS! (You thought I was gonna say The Thunder from Down Under, didn't you? LOL). It's a really great show that boasts some incredible live action jousting, sword fights and overall great entertainment. The food isn't bad at all. You eat with your hands (in keeping with the Arthurian theme) and the drinks are sorta stiff. 

The hotel also offers some fast food eateries on the second floor of the casino level if you'd rather eat quickly and the hotel also has a killer buffet. 

The parking situation kinda sucks and I highly recommend parking your car and leaving it there until you checkout. If you must leave, take a taxi or else you're assed out on parking. 

All in all I really enjoyed my stay at The Excalibur. Although it wouldn't be my first choice, it certainly wouldn't be my last either. 

Till next Yelp!

The quality of rooms here are great and it's within close proximity to Luxor, Mandalay bay and New York, New York making it easy to cut out the extra cost of uber and lyft for a day or two if you're new to Vegas.

Hum, how was my stay?  Well I booked third party and am actually glad I messed up because since my event didn't work out, I was able to check out without any hassle.  I did wonder why the hotel still felt the need to charge me then refund me when I checked out early.
On to my stay....check in was easy.  I booked online so there were no complications there.  Isabel (front desk clerk), she was great.  Pleasant, friendly and knowledgeable regarding any questions I asked.  Even when she had to tell me no, she was always polite about it.
I go to my room.  Open the door....the most musty stale smell ever!   My first thing, check the bed for bugs or anything weird.  No bugs, but I did find hair...and lots of it!  I go to the bathroom; same thing...way too much hair & it wasn't even mine...it looked like a mixture with dog hair as well.  I call housekeeping.  Some rude chick named 'Brenda' and says "we'll get there whenever because we have more people ahead of you".  I say okay & go talk to the manager (her name starts with a T).  She was pleasant.  She even gave me some extra accommodations and fixed the issues I had with my bill.  All pleasant attitude and helpful.    They change me rooms and I still find eyelashes and a few hairs in my bathroom, but after a 6 hour drive, I just end up saying forget it.
This hotel seriously needs an upgrade tho....the internet IS NOT WIRELESS!!  I literally had to plug my lap top in....so if you are an ipad, tablet type, no internet for you.  The resort fees are a bit much especially for things that should come with the hotel...who pays to use a gym while on vacation....the TV doesn't have any hook ups, no HDMI, no USB...so you won't be watching your own stuff and there are no cable channels!
A few good things; there are a lot of restaurants inside and places to eat with variety.  So you can get practically anything you want inside the hotel.  I ate at Bucca....very good food.  I'm not Italian so I have nothing to gauge, but I like what I eat there.  The service is quick and the utensils and plates are clean...
The gambling is decent....no huge jackpots, but I didn't feel totally ripped off.  I would say all and all, my trip there was okay, but I probably would not book at the Excalibur again.

I have decided to update my review because someone from guest relations (NOT Lori) reached out to me about my stay. She came through for me. Although the quality of the rooms (I've been assured that they're going to be renovated) were not up to par, Excalibur's customer service is solid. Thank you.

This hotel was cheap! It basically got the job done. Its a bit DINGY but hey, you get what you paid for. 

The pool is actually nicer then i thought it would be, its big, clean and really nice.

The front desk and room service employees are extremely nice.

All in all, its not that bad!

When I checked in, I was charged a mandatory $12 per day charge for Internet use. I only brought my iPad and soon discovered the hotel does not have wi-fi, only Ethernet. I called the front desk to have this charge removed since I was paying for a service I couldn't use. The manager couldn't have been any ruder. I have so many choices of places to stay while vacationing in Las Vegas, but my choices just narrowed by one. A simple "Sorry, but we cannot waive this fee" would have still aggravated me, but likely wouldn't have chased off my business. But that was not the case. This hotel just lost a frequent guest as a result of one brash woman. Try The Tuscany off Flamingo if you're looking for a great room at a great price. Do yourself a favor, avoid the Excaliber.

I did get an email from guest relations at the Excalibur admitting that they can't at all guarantee their rooms as rooms are assigned when you check in. I do not understand as to what the purpose of a reservation is if you can't get the type of room you want. Things were a lot better when Circus Circus once owned this property and now it is run and operated by MGM Mirage which own several properties around town. I would not even bother going to any MGM Mirage properties in Vegas as you will not get the room you want and plus you will have to fight them to get your money back weather you stay there or not.

Came in here again the other day in the afternoon to play some $5 craps. I love the dealers here b\/c most of them are personable and they seem to do the same game all the time so they seem to have a lot of knowledge about one specific game vs other places where the dealers deal a bunch of random games and don't seem to have a specialty. The 21 and roulette dealers are also nice but I spent most of my time at the craps table and the dealers made it fun, although I lost money lol. Good place w\/ a great staff.

My friends and I stayed in one of the non-renovated rooms, and it certainly is due for a renovation (with the old school A\/C and CRT TV) but in Vegas, you are not going to be in your room very much. The location is great, right on the strip and inside access to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. The buffet is huge, cheap ($25\/all day), and decent for being a buffet. The rooms do not have coffee makers, but I suppose this is to get you to go gamble or spend money to get some.
The casino part is okay, but more tightly packed than some of the neighbors (Luxor, Mandalay Bay, New York New York). When gambling, the drink service was much more sluggish than the other casinos I went to. When I'm losing money, I would at least like to do it non-sober. Staying here is okay (and cheap) but I would rather gamble and people-watch elsewhere.

I am leaving 3 stars for only one reason. That reason will be revealed later in this review.

First I have to say that some people that have reviewed this hotel really need to be more aware of what is going on before leaving reviews. You people leave negative or lower reviews based upon stuff you know nothing about, but think you do. For instance:

#1 - 1 reviewer sad that the Excalibur does not even have amenities like "WIFI." News flash genius, yes they do. I have stayed here for many years and they have had WIFI for many years. In fact they used to have hard wire internet in each room with a modem in each room and then they went to WIFI. That reviewer left that review pretty recently so i know it is when this hotel had WIFI. I would recommend that you learn how to operate your devices to connect WIFI on them before saying this place does not have it. 

#2 - 1 reviewer said that the WIFI internet (Weird since the other reviewer said it doesn't exist) was slow and terrible. Again, learn what you are doing before leaving a bad review over something you do not understand. Like stated previously, I have stayed at this hotel many times. I have NEVER had an issue with the internet service. It has always been super fast and I have never had any delays. It should be noted that I am a computer technician of over 21 years. In my experience, when someone thinks that the internet is slow, it usually has to do with their devices. usually their laptop has spyware, malware, or even viruses on it that can slow things down quite a bit, in addition people in general do not really know the difference between slow internet and a slow computer. When I read the review of slow internet (While I was connected to Excalibur's apparent non existent \/ terrible internet) I tested the internet speed and the result was over 50Mbps. So again, learn your equipment before you criticize something you know nothing about. 

As Forest Gump would say, "That's all I got to say about that."

Now, as far as the property. I have always loved it. The rooms have always been very clean, there is good quality entertainment, food choices, the buffet is great and I have ALWAYS had great luck with the staff. Not one staff member has EVER been rude as another reviewer said. 

The reason I left only 3 stars:

Resort Fee: Now Excalibur, I cannot sit here and tell you that I understand a resort fee. Because i don't. I believe this is just a B.S. way to suck more money from your customers, But back when it was $10 I did not mind so much. As you are aware a good 95% of people are not going to even use the services that you claim are covered under the resort fee. The #1 service is probably the internet. I am sure a good percentage of people will use that. But come on, who the hell is going to want to receive a fax while in Las Vegas? What is a fax anyway? Is this not the year 2015? Who is receiving faxes? People from the past? $26 for a "resort fee" is a little excessive and the bad thing is that you guys know it. 

Please do not be that hotel that people start shying away from because of this because in all honesty I looked elsewhere for the first time in a long time because of your resort fee. The only reason I stayed with it is because of the reason I was in Las Vegas and the location was convenient. I found many other hotels cheaper that yours and if I were there for pleasure I would have chosen another one only because of the ridiculous expensive resort fee. I really hope you guys consider this or have been talking about lowering this cost as it is ridiculous. The resort fee alone is more than some places charge for a room. 

Overall I love the place other than the resort fee which is what would make me look elsewhere for my future trips to Las Vegas. Bring the fee down please.

Dive with a capitol D. The only reason I am giving it 3 stars (and not 2) is because their pool is better than the tiny one at NYNY. Don't get me wrong, it's nowhere in the vicinity of the Hard Rock's Rehab (down the road) or even it's neighbor, the Luxor - but it's fair - to say the least. 
So, why did we stay here? Because it was CHEAP. But then, you get what you pay for. 
I will say that the buffet isn't any worse than it's neighbors. After all, It's pretty hard to screw up mashed potatoes or roast beef. However, it was overpriced, like all the other casino hotels. Gone are the days of $1.99 buffets. That went bye bye with the Rat Pack.  
I can't say our room was all that bad, but the free show in their moat is embarrassing. In this day and age, anyone over 5 years old would snub their noses at the obvious tracks and archaic robots. Again, at least the pool is decent. 
Also a plus is the location. It's across the street from NYNY - which has a roller coaster and MGM, which has the lion sanctuary (and a fan-freaking-tastic pool with lazy river, if you can sneak into it). 
I'd have to be pretty hard up to stay here again, but one can never say never.

I took my boyfriend to Vegas for the first time this weekend and we stayed at this hotel. My biggest problem with the hotel is their customer service. We checked into our room and when we opened the door there was still decorations, old pizza boxes and empty soda bottles left over from the previous guests. I honestly felt like I had just walked into a cheap motel in the skevy part of a neighborhood. The manager that I spoke with, Toria (or Gloria) was not very apologetic. She reacted as though this was not a common incident. She did send someone up with keys to a different room but did not fulfill my request to have at least one more key (this hotel acted as if drunk people do not lose keys and it was crime to have more than 2). The second room went to was pretty much the same type of room as the original minus the extra garbage everywhere. However, after being in the room for about an hour the toilet stopped flushing. Needless to say our visit was crappy. I felt there should have been more accommodations for their foul ups but instead we were given the passive 'we know you're upset...but no we will not refund you...'

All I can say is never again!

Basically it was a place to between going out. Not a place to chill or relax. Tv didnt work well. Didn't get King room settled for 2 queens. Staff was ok not very friendly or helpful but not rude. Price was great and even got 2 free nights but doubt I will stay again. I would much rather pay more it better hotel. Whenever you enter or leave hotel you are attack by people trying to get you to go to timeshare presentation.

Update 12\/02\/2016:
Got response from Excalibur guest relations today.They have apologized and refunded me the upgrade price and promised to review their practices with front desk employees.Also I am offered Royal Superior Room on my next visit to Excalibur.

I appreciate the commitment and customer service I have received.




Update:
Hi Lorie,
I have sent mail to the email id 3 days back.I have not got any response.


Review:
We checked in to the registration counter at around 12.30 pm on 11\/26 and was offered Resort tower room under the "Run of House" category.Upon checkin I was told my room is not ready yet(no concern over this) and I should get a call before 3pm when my room is ready.Me and my wife waited 
for the call till 3.10 pm and then I contacted registration counter again around at 3.30pm.
I was told that my room was not ready yet and they have time till 5pm to clean the room.
We were very tired and was feeling sick.We asked for alternate room and were told that, no room in my category was available, and I must pay extra if I need to enter the room right then.
We asked for complimentary upgrade because as per hotel policy checkin time is 3pm , it was already 3.30pm and we were refused.
After that I paid extra for the upgrade as we needed few hours of rest badly and could not wait till 5pm.
This was our 2nd visit to Excalibur and is really disappointed with the way we were treated.This is not expected from a MGM group hotel.

Would request you to kindly look into the matter and refund as needed.In no way, I should have been forced to pay extra just to get into a room post check in time.
I have also sent mail to the guest relations mail id, till now no reply.

Other than this, room was comfortable and conveniently located.

What can you say about Vegas hotels? They are there for three real reasons only: S, S, & S: Sleep, Shit, & Shower. 

Excaliber is an old hotel and you can tell when coming in. The ventalation is bad, not Reno bad though. I could smell smoke billowing through the hotel and rooms, at least in other hotels you feel the air ventalating with a hint of smoke.

The room needed a steep upgrade. The air conditioner was a floor unit that used cool air to cool the room not COLD air. The decor was old and drab. The phone was the best in the room, it hummed or buzzed every 15 minutes, with a low escalating buzz\/hum. 

The pool was only a plus, The pool was free with a DJ and there was a good amount of people there. 

I expected more from a Vegas hotel located on the strip.

Hotel needs a major upgrade!!  The AC in our room was so loud, it made it hard to sleep.  The entire hotel smelt - like a combination between smoke and oldness!  For the price you pay to stay at the Excalibur, you can check out Hard Rock which has been nicely upgraded.  The only good thing was that there are lots of restaurants to choose from so you don't have to leave the hotel if you don't want to.

We stayed at Excalibur the 1st time in sept 09. We had one of the new renovated rooms and it was really nice! plasma tv, comfy beds, and we paid about 150 a night. This trip we had our kids and it was a nice kid friendly place. But great for people with no kids as well. We saw the Tournament of the Kings show and it was pretty neat too. Lets say we liked it well enough to be staying again for nascar weekend. My outlook is if you spend 40-60$$ on a room your going to get what you pay for. So spend a little more if you want a nice room...thats just how it works!!
I loved it. It was nicer the expected. Very clean and comfy rooms. (widescreen tower rooms). The arcade is a lot of fun, my 6yr old daughter really enjoyed it.

In all honesty, I loved staying here! We stayed here for an entire week, Wed.-Wed. It was awesome!! We were in tower 2 and the room was great! My parents and in laws stayed in tower 1 and there were no complaints from them, all positive experiences! Wifi works great!! Great value, and overall great experience!! Bus stop that takes you all down the strip and downtown is right in front facing tropicana. Only annoying this is the solicitors for the time shares, they really should give them the boot.

My buddy and I stayed here for three nights in June. We've been to Vegas 10+ times have stayed at lots of other casinos (e.g., TI, Encore, MGM, NYNY, Luxor, Venetian, etc.). Of course, it is not the Venetian, but our room was quiet (despite being on the ground floor, not far from the casino) and clean. We ate at the Buffet one night, which was quite good. Check-in upon arrival was quick and we weren't dinged for an early check-in fee (like other casinos do), despite arriving around noon. The casino floor is good and has quite a variety of gaming tables; more than nearby NYNY or Luxor in our estimation. We were told that we'd be comp'd for our resort fees, but my buddy's credit card was still dinged. He's working on that now, but that was the only hiccup.

This is an older property- yes, dated. The best part is probably the food\/shops area (Coldstone). When you take the elevator down to the Midway (my husband used to work here years ago), it feels like it's a dungeon- ugh. The ceilings are quite low (keep in mind, I am petite) and can make one feel claustrophobic. The restaurant on the casino floor, "Dick's Last Resort" is a big hit. I used to come to the lounge to see a group perform here- it was pretty small but the dance floor was alright. I think that my husband likes the casino\/hotel better that I do. It's just ok.

I stayed here a few years ago as a poor college student on my first trip to Vegas.  The prices are great for the strip and the location is good too.  

However, the entire hotel is horribly out-dated and smokey.  They definitely need to make renovations to keep up with all the other hotels.  The best thing going for Excalibur is the price.

I've stayed here probably 5 times in the last 6 years, and it never changes one bit. 

Normally we come down for EDC in June and stay here, but we've also stayed here for random spontaneous Vegas vacations. Rooms are priced fair, cheaper than most of the strip. This is an MGM hotel. 

The front desk staff is usually rather pleasant. Check in lines can get very long, especially during summer. Beware of the pushy salesmen near the main entrance trying to convince you to buy their cheap tickets for shows - it's really for a time share thing that takes like 5 hours to go do, it's not worth wasting your time. 

The casino is pretty big, lots of updated games. Lots of tables. Well laid out. Good size bars. Dicks Last Resort is a hotspot of this hotel. If you go downstairs there is the Tournament of Kings and some sort of arcade, I've never been down there before. On the second level is a food court, the buffet, Buca Di Deppo (restaurant), and The Thunder From Down Under. I've never dined at any of the restaurants. I did go to the Thunder From Down Under, and I highly recommend it. My mom and I went together on my 21st birthday and had the best time haha.

The rooms are...eh..basic. A bed, desk, chair, and a TV in the rooms. AC units seem to have improved. The beds are so sad looking... no blankets, and two tiny pillows on a king size bed. The bed and pillows are not very comfortable, very stiff. The shower SUCKS - there's like zero water pressure so the water trickles out. I suggest bringing your own hairdryer too ladies or you could be drying your hair for hours.

There are 3 pools - one has a waterslide, one is just a normal pool, and then there is an "adult pool." Lots of kids. The adult pool has a $10 cover charge - it's a tiny pool with plushy chairs set up, not worth it - the only positive about the adult pool is no screaming kids. There is a hot tub, showers, and a bar near the pool as well. 

Our most recent visit we noticed a lot of, um, sketchy, people hanging out outside the back entrance door in the early morning hours. We saw one man follow a girl to the elevator trying to talk to her and she just kept trying to walk away. We had planned to run up to the room and change to go back down and gamble, but were rather uncomfortable due to that situation so we ended up just going to bed. 

Parking is $10, unlimited in and our privileges, and you can park at any MGM resort with your room key.

We only stay here for EDC because it's the cheapest option and we are barely in the room for that week anyways so it doesn't matter. If you're looking for something modern and comfortable, I suggest elsewhere. But for a cheap option, it isn't bad. This place could definitely stand to be updated, as it shows its age.

this is a review for the remodeled rooms.  came to this hotel during the last week of december and stayed for only one night.  very good price as usual, less then 100 bucks.  excalibur also allows you to 'upgrade' to a better room for only 5 dollars more...so we went for that.  I have to say the remodeled rooms are a big improvement compared to the older one's.  to be honest nothing is wrong with the older rooms...there just...old :P.  the new rooms were great, new carpet, hd tv, new bed frame, the works.  the bed wasn't that comfy my gf said...but to me i think it was pretty good.  they remodeled the bathroom as well, much better then before.  I guess my advice would be this:  if you wanna stay on the cheap, this hotel is much better then other cheap hotels like circus\/cicrus.  also, its worth spending another 10 or 15 bux to get the remodeled rooms.  i'd say 4 stars if you stay at a remodel room and 3 if your staying in one of the classic rooms

My wife & I recently stayed at this hotel for 4 days (Monday through Thursday).  It was the first week of August, and the place was packed!  We arrived at the hotel around 4:30 PM, but the check-in line was crazy long!  Thankfully, my in-laws had already checked into their room.  We stored our bags in their room, then went off to dinner at the Tournament of Kings.

After dinner, I went back to the check-in line.  It was shorter than before the show, but still took me 30 minutes to get to the desk.  (Note to self:  next time, use the mobile check-in option).

Here are my comments for our stay:

Room 3 stars.  The rate we got was pretty good ($65 for the room and $34 for the resort fee).  We had a 5th floor room at the Resort Tower, with a view of New York, New York & West Tropicana Avenue.  Our room was pretty big, but it was missing a few amenities.  Refrigerators are not standard and are $25\/night.  There was one less lamp in our room (compared to our in-law's room), and the TV service was not HD.  But the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was serviceable.  

Poker Room 4 stars:  we played in a morning tournament.  9 AM seems early, but there were almost 40 players (with re-entries) for a $40 buy-in (the later dailies are $45 each).  It was almost all tourists with a couple of locals.  I busted out early, but my wife got 4th place and got $110!  There are about 10 tables in the room, but I never saw more than 5 tables used at any given time.  There was usually one tournament going on as well as a couple of cash game tables.  No frills, but the poker room had action.

Casino 4 stars:  I played at least 6 session of craps during this trip.  Most of the time, I'd stay only 15 or 20 minutes, but a couple of them were about an hour long.  There were both $5 and $10 tables, which are rare on the strip (most casinos have $10 and $15 tables now).  During the day, action was steady, but not busy.  But each night, all the tables were hopping!  My wife & I wandered through at least 10 casinos during this trip, but the Excalibur seemed to have the most action at the tables.  My only complaint about the casino floor is that the music was a little too loud at night, and it was difficult to hear the craps dealers.  I liked the music, but they could have turned it down a couple of notches.

Fitness Center 4 stars:  one morning, I went to work out in the fitness center.  While the facility isn't huge, all the equipment was very new and well-kept.  Staff came around and offered bottled water to guests as well as wiped down unused equipment.  While the TVs weren't on when I was there, I did have a great view of one of the pools.  (I didn't have a chance to enjoy the pool, but it was packed by 10:00 AM when I was at the gym.  Make sure you get there early to get a chair.)

Staff 5 stars:  during my stay, I can say that the Excalibur staff were very friendly and courteous.  Even during the slower times, the staff were upbeat and engaged with the guests.  Since I played a lot of craps, some of the dealers and pit bosses recognized me.  While I'm not a high roller, it's nice to be acknowledged.

Overall, we had a great trip.  We received good value for our hotel stay, and the gaming was fun and vibrant.  I'm looking forward to our next stay here!

You get what you pay for! I'm gonna try to not be completely negative about this place, but I seriously don't recommend anyone to stay here. It has gross, sticky, smelly old carpet in the hotel rooms, two tiny towels, no conditioner, no mini fridge, no nothing. It flat out sucks here. Casino is ok, everything is just out dated. 

BUT! If you're looking for a cheap crappy place to just rest your head after a long night on the strip, this will do-- just don't expect much, or anything from this place. The good news is, Bucca Di Beppo is located in this hotel, which is delicious.

This review is for the buffet. It was total crap.

Unfortunately the kid sticking his fingers in the dessert didn't help my opinion of this place.

This is one of the cheapest buffets on the strip. So if you've had enough to drink you probably won't mind it.

I got a kick out of the Chinese people eating the Chinese food at the buffet because even this white girl can tell that was some really bad white people Chinese food. I started wondering if they weren't eating it just to see what white people thought Chinese food was.

avoid at all costs unless you are drunk.

Finding a decent hotel for under $200 during CES week is always a tall order, so to appease my company's hotel policy I 'treated' myself to three smoke infused days at Excalibur. 

Fortunately my room in Tower 2 was nicely updated and had a full view of The Strip. Despite the bed being very hard, it was my little oasis away from the gross casino downstairs. 

Pros: 
- Front desk staff were helpful and courteous 
- Easy access to Luxor, MGM, NY NY and Mandalay Bay
- Generous room service portions. The egg whites and vegetable breakfast is the bomb. 

Cons: 
- Hotel is outdated and gross
- Restaurants are mostly fast food. I had to look elsewhere for a good meal after 2pm 
- Room service is only served 6am - 2pm 
- Calling guest services is a joke. They clearly want nothing to do with you. 
- Much like the food options, shopping is essentially non-existent
- Tacky, tacky and more tacky  

The real kicker: 
- The hotel wifi went out for almost 24 hours during CES week.  Of all the times to crap out, this was easily the worst. I had to venture to nearby hotels to do work, check my email, etc. Not cool!

This was our first time staying at Excalibur Hotel and by the varying reviews, we were a little unsure of what to expect. So here's my review and what we honestly thought of the hotel.

Exterior:

The exterior of the hotel is bright and definitely stands out, especially at night. It actually looks quite magical. However it does not seem "child-like", as some may have mentioned.

Interior:

The interior of the hotel is nicely decorated and fits with the theme of the medieval castle. And yes, when you walk into the hotel there's a smell of cigarettes and cigars. That's because you have to walk through the casino to get to the check-in desk. Although I can say most hotels did have a smoke odor since you are permitted to smoke in there. The hallways are also musty and have a distinct smell, however that didn't bother us that much since we knew we weren't spending a lot of time at the hotel.

The check-in desk:

Was fast and friendly. We had no issues with check-in.

Our Room:

We had a basic non-smoking room with a king size bed. Though the room was nothing to rave about, it was comfortable, and we had a spectacular view! It seemed as if they were in the middle of trying to upgrade the room as some things looked newer, while other things looked older. It was clean though and comfortable. My only complaint is that there is no tub, only a stand-up shower. At times I just wish I could have soaked my feet, but that's okay. We had a hair dryer, plenty of towels, and all the normal hotel necessities like an iron and ironing board. I should also mention that our room DID NOT smell. It was only the hallways.

The "Time Share People":

Yes, there are people ALL OVER the hotel trying to get you to go on a four hour tour to buy a time share. They will try to bribe you with money, free tickets, free dinner, etc... Just know in advance that it's a big waste of time, so unless you're broke and need the money, DON'T do it. NOTE: These people WILL hound you and follow you around asking questions. At first it was a bit overwhelming, but finally we realized that if we told them we were leaving that night, they pretty much just left us alone and told us to have a good night. A little white lie never hurt, right? You will also encounter these people all over the strip. We used the same trick on all of them and it worked every time.

Restaurants:

Excalibur has several restaurants to choose from, including their buffet.

Dick's Last Resort: Yes, it's fun. But I just don't understand their logic of giving crappy service and making fun of their customers. They make you silly paper hats with crude comments, pretty much throw your plate of food at you, and slam your bill on the table. What gives? I have a sense of humor and could laugh at the hats, but the rest of the "act" was just stupid.

Excalibur Buffet: We were really wary about eating here. It was significantly cheaper than most other buffets in the area, but we decided to give it a try. In all honesty it wasn't bad. But it wasn't great. They had a nice variety of foods to choose from. (Just don't eat the scrambled eggs! Yuck!) This is also the only buffet I've been to here that you had to get your own drinks. I was okay with that though. No biggie. It's worth it to go to for a quick breakfast when you don't feel like cruising the strip for a place to eat.

Other Stuff:

Pools: Yes, Excalibur does have several pools. Compared to other hotels, they're just mediocre, but if you're just looking to spend a few hours there, it's no big deal. To me, a pool is a pool. The only disappointment was that the largest main pool was closed for the season.

Thunder From Down Under: As if it's not bad enough there's advertisement for it everywhere you go, but now when you walk into the hotel there's a "station" that has two strapping young lads from the show with minimal clothing on. As you walk past they give women very sexy looks and try to lure you in for a picture with them, which you have to pay for. On several occasions I had the "thunder from down under" guys say, "Do you want a picture taken, sweetie?" Well no, sweetie, I do not want my picture taken with you. In all honesty is seemed a little creepy and I felt like I was being propositioned by a male prostitute.

So all-in-all, Excalibur is a decent hotel for the money. Would

I've had so many great memories of the Excalibur Hotel. Ever since I was a kid, I always loved stories of knights and wizards and castles and all the other nerdy stuff that goes with it. So the Excalibur was always one of my favorite spots in Las Vegas.

Now that I'm older, I think it's still a great hotel, but it's certainly lost a bit of it's luster. The overall maintenance of the seems to be lacking a little bit. The hotel is not quite and posh as a lot of the newer hotels on the strip.

The hotel offers pretty much the same amenities as all the other hotels on the strip... a nice casino, lots of slots, shops, eateries, bars. One of the benefits that this hotel has that others do not is their "Fun Dungeon", which is a video arcade with midway games down in the lower level of the hotel. It's a great spot for kids or adults looking for some innocent fun.

The buffet at Excalibur is one of the cheapest on the Strip, but also one of the least impressive in my opinion. They do offer an nice deal where you pay a $35 fee to be able to eat all day at the buffet at both the Excalibur & Luxor. So the Excalibur buffet may be a good choice for the budget-minded, but not for the hardcore foodies.

The room rates are some of the cheapest you'll find, but the rooms will be fairly basic & small.

Overall, the Excalibur is a good option for families and those traveling on a slightly tight budget. Not as upscale or modern as many of the newer hotels, but you'll still get nearly all the amenities of a major hotel\/casino.

Not as bad as I thought, it has been renovated. I was there for a trade show.  Not the place to take your wife for a romantic weekend but for a fun and less than crazy expensive weekend it would be good. Close to things which is nice.

There is no wireless Internet in the hotel.  My room didn't have an internet cable.  there is a $20 resort fee to pay for the Internet (pool, workout room, and other amenities).  So to get a beat up room (with a gross bathroom) for 40 bucks actually means a $60 room without wireless Internet.  Two stars instead of one because the bed was comfortable (or well broken in - I am still too tired to care).

I'm not sure why this hotel got such bad reviews, but I have stayed here on 2 different occasions and we had nothing but great experience. Our room got upgraded ( we had castle view) and AC was working great, our room was cleaned every morning and stocked with toiletries. 
Checking out was a quick and painless process- on the iPad outside of the elevators by the Tower 2 entrance. 
We were given a coupon book that had 20$ free voucher for the bar and restaurant, and we got pia coladas there and loved them. 
Overall, I enjoyed staying at this hotel, and will probably stay here again- if the price is right :)
Stayed at the Excalibur while on a staycation and I have to say that for the price it was a very good experience, room was clean, staff I dealt with was nice, no complaints .

so, I'm basically gonna write my review about my stay as a hotel guest, and not based on what it looks like from outside. Mind you, from the outside of course, its no Ceaser's Palace but its pretty credible..looks like cinderella's castle to me and I found it to be very beautiful 
I got this via travelocity for a very good price - and the hotel is totally worth more than I actually paid. We stayed in the newly renovated tower with the 46inch widescreen LCD tv's and 2 queen beds..with strip view overlooking the MGM. Great stay, very comfortable beds, and equally well kept bathrooms. A good buy if you're planning on staying on the strip.

Here is a Hotel I would say is worth it !! Great Hotel for what you pay for !! It is a Good Price also !! That being said it is the Cheapest in price and it is right next to New York New York Hotel and MGM Hotel !! Great Location and the Room I stayed in was Clean and Neat !! It had Two Big Beds in The Room and the Bathroom was clean also !! As for the Shower it felt great it was like a Massage on my back !! Perfect for what you pay For !! I have to say I would Return and stay here again !!  For Sure !!!

Stayed here for two nights purely to save some money.  At $66 a night, you can't go wrong.  All I need in Vegas is a place to sleep, shower, and get ready -- Excalibur served its purpose.  The elevators take forever and the pool area is just ok.  However, it was quite nice to go when it first opens and you can have your pick of beach chairs.  Very family friendly with the arcade and everything.  I received two $5 coupons for drinks and two free games in the arcade area upon check-in.  I really like how there's very easy access to Luxor, Mandalay Bay, NYNY, and MGM.

This is our 3rd time in Vegas, and we will never stay at the Excalibur again. Our room was stated to be ready by 3pm at the very latest. Our flight landed at 11am so we did some exploring and gambling to pass the time. By 3:30 we were quite tired carrying our things around, but after we waited in the 25 min lineup, we were told the cleaners had JUST got to our room and it would probably take another 45 min. By 5pm we were finally allowed to check in and we were exhausted. Our bedside lamps were burnt out, the hairdryer and it's frame had completely fallen off the wall, and they said our room had a great view.. of a cement wall. The dust in our room was out of control and with my allergies, I've never been so stuffed up, dizzy and teary-eyed in my life. It made the experience so uncomfortable because I'd be sneezing 16 times in a row. Oh, and when we checked our bed, there was a semi-fresh blood stain on our sheets. Never. Again. We'll stick with the Luxor again next time.


Update: We also found coccaine in the chair cushions LOL

About 20 or so years ago Vegas was trying to market itself as a "family vacation destination". Luckily Vegas got smart and decided to stick to "adult entertainment", which it does best.

Excalibur is a big, tacky reminder of this failed attempt at good clean family fun (with a little bit of naughty mixed in). 

The rooms are cheap and the location is great and if that's all you really care about, I say go for it. Because its Vegas, and all you really need a room for is sleeping and storing your stuff, right??? WRONG!

You will spend more time in your room than you think, so be comfortable. A nice room & hotel accoutrements will also help get you in a Vegas state of mind.

The Excalibur I like this hotel for a couple of different reasons; this was my first Vegas Hotel\/casino and I spent the best week staying here.  The hotel isn't centrally located but its in a great location for quickly getting to and from many of the typical touristy attractions.  Its very family friendly and kids were running all over the place when I stayed here (I've been in and out a few times since relocating here and its not that bad now) Its still family friendly and affordable. 

I've made use of their Parking Lot a few times just because its an easy place to get in and out of and it's a quick walk to the Tram or the BLVD depending on where\/what you are doing.  The staff is very accommodating and goes out of their way to make you feel welcome.  I've picked up tickets a few times for shows at other casinos there so that should tell you how customer centric the entire casino staff is. 

My room, well I didn't spent too much time in it but it was clean, the beds had fresh linens and was easy to get too. I've stayed a few hotels were they make it a challenge for drunken tourist to locate their rooms as they want you to stay on the floor but here it was very nice to experience. 

We picked the Hotel\/casino as it was the cheapest hotel at the time and I know they are still rather affordable but have increased their room rates a bit.  If you want a clean safe Vegas vacation that allows you the opportunity to sneak off and explore the underbelly of the city this is a great place to stay so you won't be expose to too much all at once.

I have stayed at the Excalibur on two separate occasions. The first was pleasant, nothing exciting and the basic equivalent of a holiday inn. Rates were fairly inexpensive and the location isn't bad with easy access to the strip and underground passage to the Luxor and Mandalay bay. Buffet is nothing to write home about. Late night hunger can be satisfied by McDonald's and an early morning sugar high can be accomplished by the warm Krispy Creme donuts both located in the food court. However the second stay was horrible, to the point that I will not stay again. The first room that we stayed in was supposed to be a non smoking room. Whoever stayed in the room prior must have locked themselves in the room for days with several boxes of smokes. The room was saturated to the point that the cleaning crew came in and sprayed it with air freshener only to created a flower scented smoking room. They also changed all of the linens which didn't help. It was in the carpet and the curtains. My husband and I moved to a second room which was dirty. About an inch of dust was on the bathroom vent and the bed covers had stains on them. I did make the cleaning crew change the bedding to ensure that we had clean linens for the duration of the stay. it wasn't enough for us to stay again. Beyond that, the casino is nice and service is better in the wee hours of the morning. The pool is nice, small and standard.

Great place! Nice and helpful staff n reasonable prices! Try to get a tower room! Worth the upgrade !! here for hubby's bday n I have to say I am so happy to do my grading here! Makes finals better to be in a cushy place. Also a good spot for a little getaway.

The wife and I had no choice.  We booked a room here because my family stayed at the New York New York across the street and I wasn't about to pay for that!  The trip was in 2007. 

This place was awful.  The Merlin doesn't even work anymore!

I have made a point to avoid this place since.  I am a non-smoker, this is no place for a non-smoker.  The room smells like a pack of cigs from the 50's.

Tear this dump down and re-build!

I now stay on Fremont Street.

Good luck!
I'm not coming back here at all except for seeing a show or going to gambling & I called housekeeping 8x just to do my room.

The best part of this hotel was the bed and the AC actually able to keep the room cold! The channels on the TV barely worked, took about 4 tries to get the room key to work, and the room wasn't cleaned every day like our family's room was next door. The cleaning staff was friendly and very sweet. The amount of people and kids at this hotel seemed more like I was staying at Disney. People at the front were not too friendly when I tried to book another night. He was very rude. So we stayed next door.
Love the price and location of this place.  The look is amazing and the stand up showers are plenty big for two :)

Pro: comfortable bed
Clean room
Didn't find any bed bugs 

Cons:
Got stuffed in the very back corner of the first floor, what could have been a janitor closet area

I believe this happened because front desk lady seemed pissed that we couldnt afford to buy the 138$ upgrade she was trying to talk us into

We Paid extra for a room with a view. Got the worst view possible, see picture.

My experience here was good! I know everyone says it's rundown and old, etc. But to me I grew up with this kind of Vegas look. The casino tables are fairly priced and the rooms are also priced cheap. Do try to stay in Tower 2 though. It took us no more than 10 mins to check in and check out, and everyone was very friendly. The room was nice and clean, the bed was very comfy and the air conditioning always worked for us. We got a window view and it was so cool to look out and see everything that was going on in the strip. If you're looking for a decent hotel, Iwould recommend trying here. I was a little scared after reading some of the reviews on here, but this was a great hotel for us, I would stay here again!

I was very disappointed when I first got into this hotel. Finding parking was a bit difficult since there wasn't a large parking structure maybe 2 levels and that was it. There was also a long-ish walk from the parking to the hotel. Our room was small and the bathroom needs major updating. The bathroom has only a shower, the toilet flush wasn't strong...it seemed like the water was always going to overflow and their was only one sink in the bathroom, which didn't really bother me too much but with all that counter space they could have put another. In the room there is no mini bar and the TV channels were always fuzzy. The ones that weren't fuzzy was always on a Spanish channel so it was no use to me. When we first walked into the room their was a distinct smell so we quickly aired out the room. Be warned this hotel is at the bottom of the strip and it will take some time to walk to the center (unless you're taking s taxi). For the price my friend and I paid, were pretty disappointed.

Hotel: The hotel is so dirty. I book a non-smoking room, but when I got a room with very bad smell. No refrigerator and no microwave, but it cost me over $100\/ night. On the day I checked out, when I walked into the elevator, it smelled like crap. I had to back up. However, the other two elevators smelled very bad too. I reported to the security right the towel II, but he just said "Uh uh" and did nothing than stared at a sexy girl walking by.

I don't know why the hotel maids love to slam the doors while people are still sleeping. First time, I thought the customers next to my room, but days after I looked out and found out the noise was made my the hotel maids.

Another thing is the hotel let Grandview Co use its lobby for solicitation for the RCI, a cheating company. They solicited customers for a timeshare plan with RCI. You can check RCI through http:\/\/rci-timeshare.pissedconsumer.com

Casino: the first night at this hotel, I was walking around the casino to get an idea about playing cards. I'm over 30 but when I was watching people playing at a Blackjack table, the Chinese female dealer asked me for I.D check. After I handed my I.D to her, she looked and threw it back on the table very rude. Then I left this casino for the New York New York Casino.

Keeping in mind the fact that this is only a 2 1\/2 star hotel and the nightly rate is quite possibly the cheapest in Las Vegas, I will give it two stars. We stayed in an upgraded widescreen room. The room was clean and the bathroom was actually quite nice, however, I could not get over the smell in the room. It could almost  knock someone over upon entry. It really didn't get any better throughout our three night stay. 

The casino itself was fine. The waitress service, however, was poor at best. People were actually mixing their own drinks at the roulette wheel because the waitress never came around. I've stayed in many different hotels out there and this was by far the worst. The elevators were really slow. While we didn't go down to the pool, our room did overlook it. It actually looked pretty nice, but I never went down there. We received a comp for the buffet which we used and were pleasantly surprised by the food after reading some of the past reviews. They had a wide variey of items which were all quite good.

Some of the people staying at the hotel were younger which contributed to some problems. For example, a group of guys were still up drinking from the night before when we went into the casino at 9:00am. They were fighting with people as they walked by. Security dealt with this quite quickly. There were two females staying in the room next to us who started fighting with each other at 2:15 am. This went on for about 20 minutes and sensing it wouldn't be ending any time soon I did call security. They promptly responded. 

While this certainly is a bargain price wise, it attracts a different crowd because of this. I will not be staying here again. Past stays at NYNY and Monte Carlo were MUCH better in that same location.The Excalibur is past its prime, however, would be an OK hotel if you don't care about the smell, the amenities and are looking for a bargain basement price!

This is for the buffet only: I came here a few years ago because I loved this hotel as a child. After getting a big plate at the buffet, I noticed nats in my food! Not just one or two, but 100s mixed it with the ambrosia type jello salad. I immediately asked to speak to the manager. She told me "bugs are part of vegas" WTF not in my food!  After walking through the buffet with her, we noticed bugs throughout the entire buffet. made me utterly sick. My 2 friends and I demanded a refund and she said she would give us coupons to eat here again for free. I was outraged, like is ever return! She finally have us our money back, and for some reason needed our email. Since then I got nothing but a flood of emails asking us to stay at this hotel. Needless to say, I changed my email.

The casino was ok, waitress was rude and NEVER brought my drink.

This was the first stop on a week long vacation. We chose the Excalibur because it was cheap. We paid $50 and $20 was comped back to us. We used the $20 to buy two of the worst Midori Sours we've ever had.

The room itself was clean and comfortable. We couldn't have really asked for any more in that department.

The worst part of the stay was the salespeople that the hotel had strategically placed at the entrance to the hotel rooms and food court. We fell for the pick up line once..."is this your last night? Where are you from?" When we stopped to talk we were given the hard sell. After that we were forced to be rude to everyone else that gave us the same line. I was just thinking  'I'm hungry or I'd like to go to my room. Leave me alone.'

The lack of wifi in the room was another huge turn off. You could hard wire your computer in to access the internet but you can't use an iPad or phone to access it. What an inconvenience.

The Excalibur is definitely a no frills hotel. The old addage is true...you get what you pay for.

CONS- Valet sucks they take forever to get your car even though they charge... I would suggest let your family out of the car in the front with bags while you self park or else you will be waiting forever for them to get your car. Also once we were in the room it took them forever to deliver bags not worth the tips. Buffet stay away unless you have free buffet credits- not really worth the $28- food court has better options or try Bucca or Baja Fresh downstairs

PROS- they have Self check in with your phone which is super easy we got an email about  2 days before we were suppose to check in asking if we wanted to do self check in and what time we would be arriving so they can try to ensure a room was ready for us. We entered our time and sure enough  we got an email that our room was ready 30minutes before our arrival time 10:30am. We walked up to the station that says mobile check in and took literally 2 minutes to check in (compared to all those people waiting in an hour line) Very convienent and made us happy! This place is kids friendly, if you want a kid friendly place come here... it isnt elegant or like a high class place but its fun and cheap- if you like fun cheap come here! 4 Pools was fun with slide, a lot of cocktail waitress walking around, loose slots ;) , pizza hut in food court for cheap meals, dungeon for kids to play in arcade\/carnival type games, Clean, great walking distance to MGM and New York New york,,, Tram to Mandalay Bay and Luxor.

I didn't stay here, but I love how Excalibur looks. The inside is nice too. They have a really nice food court and the souvenir shops have some great deals. I would love to stay here. My friend said the buffet here is really good.

Excalibur for the location and nice views and price cant be beat.  There Jr suit are very nice the size two rooms.I love the Castle over 6 stays..The staff is very nice. And the time share personal tell them nicely no thank you    sorry i cant help you    about 4 times .and they will rember you and leave you a lone  . .Looking forward to my next stay ..

Wow I watched a bar tender call security for a guy that was black out drunk with a friend. He also called to get hookers off his bar talking to the guy blacking out at the bar. I watched the security guards walk by looking at the hookers obviously doing there thing and walk away. So if your drunk and probably want to be taken advantage of by hookers you found it.

I stayed here on my birthday and was upgraded to a suite! It was easy check-in, check-out on a friday evening. The only thing i would recommend is for your room not to be by the elevator or by the stairway which can get pretty noisy!!
it's old and out-dated, but it was only $40 for a long weekend! not much to say, but you get two free drink tickets when you check in

We went on a vacation to visit Vegas and stayed in Excalibur for 3 nights.

We booked normal rooms and got upgraded for a level above the basic room.

The deals in hotels.com and orbitz showed at 28$\/ day, and it came to 45$\/ day with taxes and resort fee (it was in week days).

No Refregirator or Microwave as they expect us to drink and eat outside...

The hotel has become old.. it looks great from outside but not great inside...

Ofcourse the sales people tried several times to sell tickets for shows, and in that process did all sort of tricks....

easy checkout process.... little bit waiting time for checkin even at 5PM..

Every  room has its own complaints.. no bath room lock for one room, no exhaust fan in bath room.. internet did not work in another room....

The beds are Okay.. carpet is old...

Stay here if you just want to sleep and spend less money for hotel and more money for gaming....

Strange thing I observed is, if we order a complimentary drink while playing keno, the waiter asked us to show how much we played, and for every 10$ we bet (and loose) they would give a coupon to get complimentary drink...

This proves Recession has impact on Gaming....

Positives: Great location-close to the Deuce bus stop (in front of M&M store). Tram to and from Excalibur, Luxor, and Mandalay bay.  The Steakhouse Camelot was good, but expensive.  There is a Starbuck, McDonalds, Popeyes, and Krispy Creme.
Negatives: Don't stay here if you have allergies or asthma.  The smoke is in the air and carpets and walls.  The slots didn't pay out for us at all.  There are not enough waitresses.  No love in the drink department.  I was hoping for some drinks while I was throwing my money in the trash, but nope.  The timeshare people harass you all day long at every entrance.  They make it seem like they are giving you something for being a hotel guest.  NOT!  The buffet left much to be desired at Excalibur and Luxor.

We stayed here for a week and were happy with the room we had, especially because it was very cheap during the week.  However, the casino wasn't the greatest.  The dealers seemed to have an attitude and didn't make gambling there any fun at all.  But it wasn't a problem, we did just fine by gambling elsewhere and just using the Excalibur as our hotel.  

One thing that did bug me was the people trying to sell me show tickets in the hotel lobby.  Seriously, I get enough of that on the street, I don't need it inside the hotel I'm paying for.  The food there is so-so, the buffet isn't the best but they do have a food court with the usual McDonalds, Pizza Hut, etc.  Also be aware that this place it a decent walk away from the North end of the strip.

I'm not sure how to rate a casino, b\/c ...well, if I lose, I have a bad taste in my mouth.  And, I lost here.  I only played poker but the experience wasn't that great. They have a few perks if you have to toss away losing pocket aces and you get to spin a wheel for some free stuff, but all in all, I didn't love it here.  

First off, the hotel is FAR from where we were staying (Caesar's) and it was a hella long walk...It also was a bit more of a family-friendly hotel, so upon entering, I was overwhelmed by this factor.  I don't understand what the appeal is ...anyway...

I also am not sure how to rate an experience, b\/c well, every experience is different depending on players and I thought the ones at my table were too serious, not at all fun and the dealer wasn't that brilliant either.  I like my dealers to have a sense of humor, be helpful and a bit complimentary...these guys were none.  It was just kind of a dark\/quiet experience.

I was going to give it a three...but now I'm dropping it to a two.  It's not worth the trek out to no man's land Vegas to lose your ass with boring dealers and patrons.

I am a local who is also a native. I have worked for other properties and found that check in went well. However when attempting to go up the elevator to go to my room I was over ran by the housekeeping staff. Most properties have an employee elevator so the guest can access their rooms without being ran over by staff departing from work. They were zigzag in front of you and expect you as the guest to get of their way when you (the guest) are trying to locate your room. Then I call for my luggage on the hotel phone and the operator snaps (I can't hear you). If they are having issues with their phone system they need to address it with IT dept as well as kindly advise the guest that unfortunately they are having trouble understanding you. If the operators are unhappy when they leave home they might want to check that attitude at the door before they enter work.

Our party of five was not really impressed. 
We were supposed to be a party of seven with two moms, three teenage boys, and two young girls. I was told over and over that we should stay at the Excalibur with the kids. I thought the castle would be so neat for the girls but they ended up not going. From the outside, the castle does look really neat. 
Other than that we were not too thrilled. Also, the staff was pretty rude. 
We ended up not being very impressed with the Fun Dungeon downstairs and there was nowhere to sit after walking so much on the strip. 
If you are not playing there are not many options. There is some seating next to the DQ.
Next time this will not be on our list of stops.

It was okay.  We stayed two nights.  Family of five in two rooms.  We stayed in Tower 2 which is supposedly the nicer of the two.  It really was fine, nothing bad or gross.  The bathrooms were quite nice.  However, the furnishings are tired and worn.  It was definitely not a fresh hotel.  I imagine it's because these rooms see non-stop action and abuse.  

As for location, I would have preferred to stay in New York, New York instead.  Anytime we wanted to go to the strip we had to make our way through casinos, tunnels, stairs, escalators, etc. just to get to NYNY and then we were on the strip.

Wow, what a difference two years make. We were diehard Excalibur loyalists but this place officially now sucks eggs. Want blankets or a fridge? Request them a day before you actually need them, since front desk seems to have better things to do. Think your linens were changed? So did we, until I turned down our bed to find my slippers shoved down at the foot where I'd inadvertently left them. My artfully folded towels still had the lipstick stain from the last woman who made out with them. 

The buffet is nothing special; we always eat at Luxor anyway. And the casinos, wah. Children run amok (we were thoughtful enough to leave our child at home with Nana), and trash is everywhere. But then there's The Room. That mother-effing room. We booked a Contemporary King in Tower II and essentially got a Tower I room with a shite view and a Contemporary II bed. If you're into parkour, then I guess it's a dream location. Just jump out the window and you're right on the roof. Which you'll want to do within minutes of arriving, as your neighbors are all loud families with screaming kids running up and down the halls at all hours. America!

Anyway, we called front desk and complained and were moved to a much nicer room, but I was already in a bad mood compliments of a cabbie who tried to longhaul us from McCarran, so Excalibur didn't make things any better. Start to finish, it was not just "meh," it was "bleh." Oh, I nearly forgot to mention that the TV channels have gotten worse. No Mlife channel in our room, but you get TWO Excalibur channels and one channel running something M-lifey (1) in black and white and (2) without sound. Wee. I remember when you'd get channels for all three adjacent hotels (Excalibur, NYNY and Luxor). Whatever, I'm scraping the barrel now, but you get it. You're better off under a table at a bar than you are staying here.

This place is cheesy. The rooms are basic, yet clean. There is a resort fee due at check in. The casino floor is dingy. Cocktail service is not that great. Dicks Last resort, a restaurant inside this hotel, is a pretty cool. We recommend this place if you're just looking for a place to stay in Vegas.

Adequate and inexpensive.  Other than the castle trappings, it's no different than any budget motel off an interstate exit.  We got the cheapest room, no upgrades or even a bathtub.  That wasn't a problem, since I'm not into soaking my body where thousands of feet and other body parts have gone before me.  I was originally interested in booking the room with a jacuzzi for 2, but decided that for the hundreds extra that would cost over the length of our stay, we'd be better off putting the money into a fund for our own hot tub back home.

My only real complaint is that the mattress was about 10 years beyond its expiration date.  It didn't hurt me to sleep on it, thankfully, but it was completely flat and cushionless.  The under-sized, deflated pillows were no better.

Outside of the room, we didn't spend too much time in this hotel.  I liked the ambiance much better at the NY NY across the street.  We did try the pool one day, which was disappointing.  4 pools, and none of them deeper than 3 1\/2 feet.  Plus they had 2 slides built into a fake rock landscape, and both were closed.  They had also closed the biggest of the pools (maybe to save money on lifeguards?).  

On the plus side, the hands-off lifeguards were just there to collect a paycheck.  They didn't care if guests drank liquor in the pools, and they did nothing to break up the homoerotic frat boy wrestling match that had the potential to end in an accidental drowning.  Maybe they didn't take their jobs seriously considering the pool level only came up to our waists.

They had 1 pool reserved for adults.  It was in the back and about 10 ft x 10 ft.  Meanwhile, the little brats had the run of the bigger pools.  I like kids when they are in an appropriate setting, but Vegas is not that setting.  And I don't appreciate a hotel in one of the world's renowned adult playgrounds catering to the handful of parents who didn't have enough sense to leave their kids at home, while the hotel's adult paying customers get stuck in a pool too small to swim in.

When we got home I checked out the room price of the nicest hotel we visited, the Venetian.  It would have cost us double what the Excalibur did.  Considering how much we were out and about during our stay, I'd consider saving money at the Excalibur again and just visiting the better hotels during the day.

let me make this short and sweet. #1 Stay in Tower 2 (remodeled\/upgraded rooms). I stayed in Tower 1 a few months ago and the elevators were dirty. The floors had rooms crammed with people. The room was dirty and had pubic hair on the floor. My boyfriend found a pair of shoes that didn't belong to us on the 3rd night we were there (strange and still unexplained!!). It seemed like they only made the bed. Tower 2 is worth the extra $$- you also get a sweet view of the pool. Our Tower 1 room had a view of the monorail. Actually we were on such a low floor the monorail went right past our room allowing no privacy!! The pools are nice and I've also used the spa service which was excellent. If you stay here you have to eat at Dick's Last Resort.  There is a decent food court upstairs and some other eateries close by.

We chose the Excalibur as a way to save money - so I can't say that I expected some outstanding experience but having stayed at the Imperial Palace (which is more centrally located and still very cheap) on a different trip I wouldn't come back to this hotel.

1. The elevators were AWFUL. There was always a huge line to get on them and they were so slow. It seems like only one or two were in service at a time or something. 

2. The buffet was totally disappointing. Vegas buffets are my favorite and this one was cheap yes, but delicious? no. 

3. The pool was ok - nothing too special and they could definitely use a better laundry service for their towels. They had this pink\/orange colored towels that were faded and dingy...just had a "gross" feeling to it.

The rooms themselves were decent. Nothing to report there. All in all I would say I didn't *hate* it but wouldn't recommend it.

We belong to the Mlife aka the rewards program. We didn't use points & aren't ballers but wanted the points & chose this "resort" for it's cost effective price because this was a last minute trip. Those are usually the best aren't they? 
I will stay anywhere safe & clean so I was not expecting Mandalay Bay or Bellagio anything. Just a remodeled clean room that the Mlife promised. Which is basically what I got. It's an older property so again I wasn't expecting much. But everything worked & nothing was too questionably unclean so it was all good. 
My issue is 1,000% the way we were treated on check out day. I booked the room under the hubs name but used my travel CC. Now my travel CC had more than enough on it for the room, parking, taxes, fees etc. when I booked this last minute room. However one night out in Vegas I gave the wrong CC at another Mlife resort restaurant & handed them my travel CC by mistake. So fast forward to check out day we get a call letting us know the mistake & that we need to come down to the front desk when we check out vs the quick checkout. My hubs apologizes for the snafu & we continue to get ready to check out. Mind you this is an hour & 15 before check out not hours. I hop in the shower & we still have 45 minutes to spare before check out. I hear a knock at the door & hear a loud man talking to my hubs. I'm like ok that's not house keeping plus it's too early.  I turn the water off & the voice had lowered but was still in the room so I get dressed quickly. I go into the room I find my hubs is being escorted by 2 older security guards like some kind of criminal or card shark (not in cuffs) down to the main desk to check out. Mind you the bill is far less than $500 because it was weekdays room charges etc. So this to me is Ludacris to say the least. I was disappointed & embarrassed for my hubs who was basically mortified by this behavior on the resorts part. I could see if he was even a little lippy to the front desk or we hadn't been loyal to the Mlife porperties for the last 10+ years or didn't have an Mlife account (which we've only had for a couple of years) but this wasn't the case at all. I had so many good memories & even spent some of our honeymoon at Mandalay Bay. I'm just so disappointed in the way this was handled.

This is my first review ever after spending a week there  I can tell you. THE WORST EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD. We booked late for the convention and we're left with no option but to stay there. The first thing my whole company noticed is the cheap vanilla smell pumped into the building. The rooms were on part with a motel 6. the buffet was out of national lampoon vegas vacation. And the water. The water had an overpowering smell that you walk into the bathroom and you can smell the water from the toilet . I hate this place. Will never stay there again. And will make an effort to warn anyone else about it

My first experience at the Excalibur was not good not bad just okay.  When I checked in my first impression was that the hotel is old and in need of an update.  My room was clean but the furniture was old and well-worn.  The room safe did not work, the shower took an hour to drain after it was used, and the plug for the Internet was missing the clip and kept popping out of my computer.  I also did not appreciate being approached by people trying to sell me things at every single entrance and exit every time I walked through the hotel.  The next time I go to Vegas I will probably pick another place to stay.

Omg this casino!

It's huge! It's normally really crowded but it has a lot of interesting games. There's a ton to do and look at and they also have a lot of shops and places to eat. It's very bright and easy to navigate. The customer service here is exceptional as compared to its sister casinos. I definitely like this one best.

I love this casino and it's great that a casino on The Strip still dedicates some of its space to a video game arcade. Unlike Luxor, MGM, Linq, Balley's whom have closed all their arcades over the past few years in favour of more casino space.

The shows are great, tournament of kings is especially fun and one of my personal favourites on The Strip. 

The Fun Dungeon has a range of games from old to new and the Pump It Up machine is in the centre of this utopia! As a side note, please upgrade the pump exceed to the newest version, I'm sure it will bring many people to this arcade!!

Keep up the good work!
Not very well kept, unclean. Walked into my room the first day arriving and the picture is what I was met with. Plus the maid staff are rude. Won't be going back.

I have stayed here three times due to the fact the with my M Life card I get really great prices, for two nights I paid around 120 with resort fees as well as taxes. A lot of people complain about the resort fee but to my knowledge pretty much every hotel charges that sort of fee. First time I stayed here was in the week so the prices were much cheaper and we got an upgraded room on the remodeled tower, I think if your one of those persons who wants something more luxurious this may night be the hotel for you. That doesn't mean its a ugly hotel its average. Anyways the pool is Great!! really big and so much fun, love the dj and how he pumps things up.  Just remember your going to Vegas to enjoy the gambling and outside your only going to be in your room to sleep and get ready :) don't be so anal...
