I think much with this hotel has been let go through the years. I suppose it's to be expected its an older hotel, that my family has been loyal to through 10+ years. 

I would recommended stay here if you want cheap stay, I mean your not going to be in your room that often any ways, so if you don't want to splurge on accommodations hit them up.  Was $75 for 2 nights stay, with a bunch of coupons for the restaurants\/gambling\/retail. Got tower one which I believe is the older of the 2 towers. Its not next to the pool, so if you want pool access request Tower 2. It's a clean and well kept hotel, but it's definitely not been updated with modern times, HEY gives it more of a medieval feel, right?, ha! Had a clogged bathroom sink, which was quickly remedied when we called it in. 

Again I recommend this room if your not looking for the fancy flare accommodations, you really shouldn't be unless you got great deals, cause to be honest if your hanging out in your room, you obviously aren't there to be in Vegas.

Cheap rooms, no real special occasion other than to be in Vegas, semi close to the main scene, not staying locked up in your room, than this is the place to inquire.

The food here is really bad.  You know when it is bad when their dessert are not home made.  They have the nasty sushi but no Wasabi available.  Feel like the chef had no passion on what they are cooking.  For $28 a person for dinner so not worth it.  Go somewhere  else if you want to spend $28.

I stayed here last week because it was such a great deal and learned my lesson the hard way. I started getting bit on the first night and it got worse on the second night. I realized they were BEDBUG bites once I was home and had already spread them to my house. I submitted an incident report as soon as realized what happened and after not receiving a response or callback, I followed up and was was told that the room was inspected and nothing was found. I couldn't believe what I was hearing so I asked for a copy of the report and they told me that they wouldn't share it with me. WHAT?!?!?! How can that be?? So shady. DON'T RISK STAYING HERE no matter how good the deal is!!!

The hotel staff was nice. Although, after the tenth time a day getting attacked by the entertainment people trying to sell you a timeshare, it gets pretty annoying especially when you're staying for four days. 

The hotel room itself had a nice space. You only get two pillows and literally one fleece blanket and a sheet on each bed. I froze to death half of the time and called down for another blanket. The a\/c unit seems like a really humid, wet, musty air. We ended up cracking the window to make it feel less stuffy. Helped a little. 

I liked the location of the hotel as well. It's in the newer strip and right in the middle of everything. Very easy to get to our show at the Luxor. 

Don't go to the Starbucks in the casino level at any time of the day if you're in a hurry. They are by far the slowest Starbucks I've ever been to. 

Souvenir shop upstairs has nice staff and a big selection of goodies. 

Casino was very clean, well ventilated, smells nice, and a great layout and selection of games. 

The pool staff was super nice when we went down to just peek around before closing. They were in the middle of cleaning up and didn't seem bothered or annoyed by us at all. They even offered us information and asked if we had any questions. Went out the next day to the adult pool, it was very quiet and worth the money.

Stayed for 1 night on a Tuesday. Purchase the cheapest price hotel room on their website.Arrived at the hotel there was plenty of parking. Check-in line was big but fast and friendly servive. Stayed at Tower 1 in the 17th floor. The pool was the reason why I stayed in this hotel it had a water slide and it was kid friendly hotel. Went in the pool and they had plenty of pools for a big crowed.My daughter love the water slide.They open the water slide pool late and close it early.The room wasnt the greatest but what do you expect when you pay the lowest room. Some people expect a 5 star hotel when they purchase a cheap deal. They had a game room for kids and games were fun and cheap not over price. They had all type of food in the hotel from Johnny Rockets,McDonalds, Popeyes and fast food. Great for when you are on a budget. On the night we stayed the fire alarm went off in the building at 2:30 am. It happens from time to time someone pulls the fire alarm. Check out was Super easy quick. 
Pros: Kid Friendly Hotel
Arcade
3 Pools
Fast Food
Cheap

The spa only gets one star from me. I would give less if possible. My friend and I were getting the $75 spa mani and pedi. It would have been a better experience to do it myself at home. First, they added an extra $15 for each of us for a "spa fee" for a total of $90 each. We were taken back to a small room together and our manicures consisted of getting our nails painted. That's it. The pedicure was toes painted and no foot\/ leg massage, just a little lotion rubbed on your feet. This was on Wed. By Friday the paint on my fingers and toes was completely chipped. This was the biggest waste of money ever! $180 for this! What a total rip off!! I will do mine at home from now on or go to the Korean guy on the corner if I want a real mani\/ pedi. It was was essentially $180 for two ladies to get there fingernails and toenails painted. Save your money and avoid this scam.

I used to stay at the Excalibur a lot as a kid.  It's a pretty nice place to stay if you're a family with kids.  I have pictures as a 4 year-old with the knight statues in there.  I absolutely loved the funzone downstairs.  There's an arcade and tons of different Vegas-style games (like the horse racing game, which was my favorite) in there and it's just a blast.  I also really liked the magic show in there when I was a kid.  The buffet was pretty good for breakfast, from what I remember.

This place is a little older and I would not want to stay there now, in my mid-20's.  Though they have a beer pong tournament in there and of course the standard casino and also the Thunder from Down Under show, it's still a very family-oriented and childish place.  

I do have fond memories there though and I would highly recommend families to stay there if you are going to Vegas.

The check in process was horrendous it was Friday around 2 and it took about 40 minutes in line. The resort fee on top of the regular price is around $30 more a night and Parking another $8 a day on top of that. The room was very old and worn down with tears in the upholstery of the chairs and a broken knob on the nightstand. The furniture was Mismatched and many of the items appear to be original to the room from the 70s. There was only a shower no bath (if that is important to you, you might want to ask specific about the room you are getting). The bed was comfortable and clean though. The amenities on sight were good including a large pool area and restaurants and all the casinos have done a good job of connecting to each other for easy walking access to everywhere.

Good room, close to everything and have good package deals. Its nothing over the top special, but if you want to stay on the strip for a good price I would recommend it. But no fridge or kitchen in the room. But bed are comfy and the staff is friendly.

Meh,
Good for a budget trip but dont expect much in the way of service.  If you are looking for a classy time go somewhere else.  Its not that the hotel is disturbing to stay in, its just not as nice as many others in vegas.  But if you are looking for a cheap place to pass out on the strip, then it works.

Ok so now that we're all done here's my full review. I actually wanted to see if someone from the hotel reads these so I added a star since I did get a response from a rep. 
As said in my first review our room was messy when we arrived after checking in and felt downgraded after switching. I didn't want to spend my time waiting in line again and just let it go. But I appreciate that someone from the hotel reads these. Maybe I can help....

This was my first time staying at a hotel on the strip. It's convenient to be right on the strip. 
Pros
Price for location 

Cons...oh so many
Maybe I didn't notice when booking but this hotel room did not have a microwave, coffee maker, or a fridge. It would be nice to have a microwave and fridge for my left overs. 

Wifi only works in public areas and not in room. And even if you are on wifi so are 1000 others so it's impossible to connect. 

The resort fee is a joke. In the room pamphlet it says the resort fee covers wired Internet...what's the point?....daily news paper, and phone calls. If it was pool and other things resort related that I would actually use then I wouldn't mind. I think it was about $25 a day.


The other thing i was super annoyed with was the promoters for the new time shares. When we first checked in (even before checking in) we were stopped asking how long we were staying and if we wanted a free show. We talked with them and realized you have to go hear the talk about it. We didn't decide right then. We were tired and wanted to check in. The problem is that there are 2-3 people at 2 exits (one by out elevator and the other by the main entrance) and every time we were coming or going we were stopped. One one way trip we were stopped 4 times!!! We hadn't even left the hotel. We would walk a long way and they would still come over to us. That turned us off and we never went back to get our free show. We were probably stopped 50 times during our 3 days there. Give your guests a wrist band or something so those know that when we checked in we talked to them. I understand that you want to talk to the visitors too but it's a bit excessive when we are stopped immediately coming out of the elevator.

When we checked out I tried the text option. It sends you a link (which I had to use my data since there's no wifi in the room). It didn't work. Tired sending my info 3 times and it said there was an error. Just called instead.

So knowing all of this I'd recommend it for someone that didn't want to spend a lot of money on a hotel. But for me I'll probably try else where next time.

Haven't stayed here before, but friend was getting married.  The room cost $239\/night with the tax and resort fee.  Room on the first floor, 1254.  At first, thought it would be great to be on the first floor.  Room dingy, sink scratched up and beautiful view of gravel and air conditioners.  Won't come back!  Thought it would be fun for the wedding, next time I will just stay at my favs...

I just got back from Vegas today. I ended up staying at Excalibur again. I don't have anything against this place it's just been like my 3-4 time in 2 years lol. 

My boyfriend and I planned on a last minute bday trip to Vegas and Excalibur had the cheapest price for a hotel that's not the best but decent enough for us to sleep since we 're not going to be in the room that much.  I also like Excalibur because it's attached to Luxor and Mandalay bay. I think staying in one of these hotels is perfect  when it's 100 degrees out.  You can walk through the hotels without stepping out in the sun.

My boyfriend and I were playing on a slot machine waiting to order drinks and 4 different drink servers passed by saying they can't take our orders it's not there section.  etc.. So is anyone working that section? Does anyone work there? Went to the lack jack tables and still no cocktail services .. Horrible. 

But yea, it's not that bad of a place if you just need a decent place to sleep for a cheap price.

Where Do I begin!!!! Excalibur, what a nice looking hotel from the outside, stinks like an old grandpas smoky couch inside but overall would never stay here again even if I was on a really tight budget.  We got a room for $49 per night plus resort fee cost.  Checked in early and the front desk were not helpful or friendly at all. I decided to pay for another day since we were checking in at 9am.  The registration process took 35  minutes.  Was tired cause had been up all night the previous night working and wanted to sleep. Got into the room and the room that we got on tower 1 had a great view of the strip. BUTTT.... The 2 beds were almost twin size looking, the furniture was old and it wasnt just because they were going for the medieveal look.  Bathroom was horrible and dingy looking.  I say that I have stayed in nicer rooms at runned down motel 6 hotels.  We got up and just walked around because we didnt want to be in the room even if I was dead tired. When we got to our room at about 9pm, we could not stand the room and response that the front desk would give us so we packed our stuff around 11pm and walked lugging all of our luggage to the LUXOR next door (its actually a pretty far walk). We checked in for a $65 dollar rate at the escalibur and got a tower room that was beautiful and great to sleep in.  Overall the best thing about the Escalibur was their all you can eat buffet for about $35 bucks all day. BUT PLEASE NEVER INTEND TO SLEEP HERE!!

The staff is great! I would give them 5 stars. 
The room is like a Motel 6. Towels, toilet paper are a bit rough. The toilet rocks. The drain gurgles constantly. No fridge, no coffee in room. 
It's clean, but old.

I can't believe this is called a 3-star hotel.  It is the worst hotel I have stayed at since I accidentally booked a 1-star in 2004.  If I were one of the many comfortable, pretty, polite 3-star hotels I have previously stayed in, I would be very insulted that Excalibur was put in my class.  The best thing about the place is leaving it.

Things right with Excalibur:
1) A pool is actually open through the winter
2) Cheap rates
3) They recycle

Things wrong with Excalibur:
1) Dated, dingy, very low quality room furnishings - and this is in "upgraded" rooms. Bed sheets and towels were great quality, but everything else from mattress to wallpaper is cheap cheap cheap and uncomfortable.
2) Non-smoking rooms that are clearly not non-smoking.
3) A staff that refuses to move you to a truly non-smoking room - and lies about the hotel being fully booked - until you call Travelocity to have them intervene.
4) Terrible proprietary dining establishments.
5) No room service in the evenings.
6) No mini-fridge in-room.
7) The total absence of any of the nice little touches that make it pleasant to stay in a hotel.

This isn't a bad hotel if you are on a budget. 

We arrived Friday night at 8pm..... came in from Tower II parking lot. I didn't think parking was that bad. 

Check in was super easy! I had already reserved and paid for our hotel online through hotels.com ( $100 for the weekend) I read the fine print before even booking that shows a resort fee so wasn't surprised when I had to pay an extra $40 at check in.

Signed me up with Mlife card which really does give you awesome discounts when used. 

Our room was clean and at this price on the strip you should be happy that it is clean and cheap. Of course our room was only for sleeping. Come on people, it's Vegas how much time are you really going to spend in your room?

Loved the upstairs food and shopping areas! That is very convenient and to be able to travel directly to The Luxor and Mandalay Bay without leaving the hotel is awesome! 

If you are going for a weekend getaway and want to spend more money on other things then a really nice hotel then this is your spot. 

Was bummed that the buffet here was closed though and our room did not come with a coffee maker! What hotel doesn't have a coffee maker in the room? Ya, this one!

Best price for this area of the strip and so close to NYNY, MGM Grand, Paris, Bellagio, etc.  Our room was very clean, beds were comfortable, even the pillows were perfect.  Housekeeping did an excellent job of restocking clean towels, bedding, and toiletries.  We were upgraded to a room with a view and had a great view of the strip facing NYNY Casino and the strip, including the roller coaster.  During check-in, there was a line, but most windows were staffed and the line moved quickly.  During check-out, however, only three windows open to serve guests and a little wait, but not bad.  Casino area was clean and the slots fun and paid enough back on your dollar to play for awhile or cash out a little ahead.  We ate at the NYNY and Planet Hollywood had prime rib for a great price nightly from 4-8pm.  (Daily Planet Restaurant) We felt harassed by Guest Services each time we walked to and from our room, to and from the entrances, and to and from the Casino floor promoting shows, tours, and packages.  A simple "No thank-you." would not be accepted and they pushed on.  We also felt that Casino Security at most resorts did not I.D. younger appearing guests on the casino floors.  And, really, Las Vegas, do we need to have "Girly Advertisement Cards" stuck in our face every few feet while walking the strip?  Homeless panhandling in excess as well?  This was a family reunion, birthdays, anniversaries, etc. celebration and most of our family stayed at the NYNY.  They feel next time they will stay at the Excalibur.  Overall, a great place to stay and have fun with a quiet night's rest.

Reviews will change and are all situational and personal.  Though a fun casino with a great shows, and an arcade.  The ambiance and nostalgia of the medieval is all around.   The thunder is a thrill for the ladies and the fun dungeon a hit with the kids..  The castle theme and name is cool.  Dicks is always a cool hangout spot.  Should check it out if you're in the area.  Shuttles even run through here.  An all around decent destination.  Tram from Mandalay and Luxor is nearby.  Mgm and New York New York only a minute away!

A group of us stayed at Excalibur for a few days during New Year's  and the rates we got were awesome, we booked our rooms at $51\/night and when we got there, we upgraded to one of the newly modelled Widescreen Rooms which was only another $20\/ night... 

The reason I wanted to stay at Excalibur was because of its location and for the price we were staying there for, who could pass it up? Before this visit to Vegas, we would find ourselves travelling to the side of the strip where Excalibur was. So, we would always be walking or spending money on monorail tickets when we should have just booked a room here in the first place. I didn't really enjoy their variety of slots though, so I'd usually walk to Luxor to gamble... 

Their food court isn't too shabby, but you can always count on their buffet, Roundtable Buffet to get your fill. We tried The Steakhouse and the food was great, but the atmosphere was a bit weird... it was your typical dimly lit steakhouse, but the music playing did not fit, it was like 80s new wave or something like that...

The room upgrade was alright, it was a standard hotel room, on the 26th floor with a view of the colorful "castle". The only big difference was probably the colors of the room and the flat screen tv. The only thing we did with the tv was express check out... so it was pretty pointless. At some point, the tv didn't work, but we assumed it was the power strip it was plugged into.. One call to the front desk and when we got back to our room, it was fixed. 

Being that it was New Year's and we were in Vegas, we brought HELLA acohol with us so we needed ice to keep it cold, but the room didn't have a fridge or anything. So of course, we went straight to the ice machine. I don't know how ice machines work, but the one on our floor was malfunctioning and wasn't make enough ice. For example, I wanted to fill the bucket for my room, and it took forever to do... and there was  guest behind me waiting for the machine as well. I don't think there was even any ice in the machine after I walked away. A friend of mine used his head and went up to the 28th floor where it seemed that there was no one occupying that floor. whenever we needed ice, we actually had to keep going up and down the elevator. 

I wouldn't mind staying here again if the price was right.

I had such a wonderful stay at the Excalibur, on July 21, and 22nd.  Everyone was SO kind and friendly!  I've stayed at other hotels in Las Vegas, that were maybe newer and nicer, but I NEVER received such great service from any of them!! From check in, to restaurants , to shopping, valet, and everything else we did, EVERYONE was so very kind.  It was much appreciated!

I've stayed here a few times, always a good experience. Parking has never been a problem, and it's easy to get in and out, with nice freeway proximity.

The casino has a good selection of games, and I've always found a decent poker tournament to join. I've never had any trouble finding a machine I like.

Never a complaint about the rooms - comfortable, and the usual stuff is there. The hotel internet seems to be wired only, however, so I had to use my phone's internet connection - WiFi would be a nice addition.

**Review of Poker Room only**

Okay, so the Excalibur may be the ugly duckling of the MGM Mirage Vegas strip family, but at least they're not Circus Circus right!

On my latest trip to Vegas I re-acquainted myself with their poker room, which I had on recent trips ignored for the more posh surroundings of the Wynn and Venetian.  But where the Excalibur's Poker Room lacks in good drinks and decor, they make up for in great staff and so-so players (which is a good thing).  The staff all seem like they've each been there 15+ years.  Dell, Daniel, and Laurie just to name a few of the dealers are all excellent dealers and fun to have dealing cards.  I'm glad to see that they got rid of that crappy free food table and now if they could just rid themselves of those half dollars they give out on the tables.

My parents and I have stayed at Excalibur twice in two years and each time, it was the hotel that the tour group chose.

It is a great hotel, both inside and outside.  The room was wonderful, the bathroom was wonderful, and the TV worked.

The only complaint was that they do not have wi-fi.  I found out in the hotel's FAQ before staying here.  They only have wired internet.

MGM Mirage will update all of its hotels to have wi-fi later this year.  I found this out while reading the Las Vegas Review Journal business section online recently.
Never stayed here.  My friends and I came here for the thunder from down under show!  Before the show, we explored and gambled at the casino.  Great gaming and atmosphere!  Great night out!

Great location with plenty of shopping and restaurants. Big casino with strange 6-5 blackjack payouts. Sadly the rooms and hallways are worn and old. Ate at dick's and bucca and loved them both. Really hated the time share vultures at each entrance. They pretend to work for the hotel and help and then ambush you.

You get what you pay for I guess.  We got a cheap rate and along with that you get an average room.

We have two young kids (9 and 5 years old) and we thought of staying here cause of the arcade and theme.  Good idea right?  But all smokey, older casino's are all the same.  Not very appealing.  The place has been around awhile and is pretty dated.  The kids liked the arcade area, but we didn't even hangout there for more than an hour. 

One thing that I didn't like was there was only one ice machine on each floor serving maybe more than 100 rooms, so the ice machine was always empty.  I had to travel different floors just to get 10 - 20 ice cubes.

If you have kids, book a hotel at higher end hotel and take an afternoon to bring the kids to the arcade.  You'll have a much more enjoyable and comfortable stay in LV.

Excellent buffet with great service. Super inexpensive for 18$ per person.
The food options were amazing.
Good job Excalibur 
Hope you keep it up

Lets start off by saying the outside looks amazing but our room was not so nice 1st we booked the room about 1month ago and asked for a non smoking & view of the strip, we get there the person that booked us in was very rude put us on the second floor and view of the pool what the heck do we want to see the pool for I mean common its vegas I want to see the lights the action that's why I booked ahead anyhow in our room to our surprise there was something not so nice waiting for us in the toilet and it smelled like pure cigarettes which we never asked for a smoking room so we call the manager he puts us on the 16th floor with a great view of the new york new york which was nice but still the rooms are not what you would think of looking at the outside there is no wi fii and the sink was clogged I should have did my research before booking but you figure its a nice looking hotel but owell we had to stay there because we already paid we was tired from switching rooms and hungry would I stay here again no way it was to much to deal with and  being in vegas I would rather be comfortable then just settled....
The hotel lobby stinks. No mini fridge. Room service from 6am to 2pm ONLY!!! That's ridiculous and just wrong. Worst experience in Vegas ever. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS STUPID HOTEL. SERIOUSLY!

Can you say 'nickel and dime'?  That's how I feel.  For peet's sake, they charge you a $5.00 resort fee which is not included in your room fee.  WTF?!?  Is there a way to avoid it?  If so, they didn't tell us how (i.e., they didn't make it optional).  The charge you $14 for high speed internet.  This wouldn't be that bad, except it's $14 EVERY 24 hours.  Seriously!

The only good thing was the fitness club, but I only say that because I was comped the fitness club.  Normally the fee is $20 per day.  Again, I say... seriously!?!
It cheaper and is on the strip.  Gambling is cheaper to from what you have to start off with.  It has alot of people but rooms are smaller.

Can you do less than 1 Star? This place is NOT recommended for many reasons...To begin, the front desk staff was not friendly despite my pre-booked reservation. We elected to do the self-parking option through the hotel and it was not a smooth process. The attendant directed us in the wrong way, but eventually we parked. 

Then, we get to our room to find the bathroom floor full of hair, dirt, and other conditions that won't be named here. We immediately called the front desk who said she would "upgrade us" and our keys were immediately transferred to our new room. Upon arriving to that room, the keys did not allow us to enter where we then had to wait over TWENTY minutes for security to meet us at the door to let us in to our new hotel room. 

This SECOND room floor was disgusting as well, see attached photos. At that point, the security officer who let us into our room was still with us and saw the floor. He said he would alert a manager to contact us regarding this condition. We got a phone call from the manager who claimed the staff member who saw the floor stated it was "spotless, and you could see the reflection even." He not only lied, but also added elaborate details that doesn't even make sense for TILE floor, pretty impossible for it to be "reflective" because it was so clean. He refused to even apologize or offer to send housekeeping to clean the room. He stood firm with his "staff member saying the room was absolutely spotless" even though we were standing there staring at how dirty the room was. Needless to say, we won't be coming back to this resort and I strongly encourage other people to look elsewhere when choosing a place to stay. The customer service, above all, should be important when choosing a place to stay, so stay away from here.
If you want to wait in a line of 200 plus people for over an hour to  check in to your room book your stay here! Disappointing to say the least!

Room was clean and comfortable. Very nice for the price. There did not seem to be away to unload at the front door without paying for valet, so we had to walk a good distance with our bags. Also, this hotel is at one end of the strip, so be prepared to do some walking to get to many of the other places.

First and last time I stay in this hotel, looks more like a big motel. As you walk through the casino lobby the smell of cigarette is very bad.
When I checked in, they gave me a suite with a king size bed...me and my boyfriend where glad about it until we got to the actual room. 
Everything in the room was just basic nothing of a suite! I payed $80.00 per night and I believe I paid too much for it. Plus I payed $30 for "resort fees" yet the pool was closed. However, the only thing we use our room was to shower and change clothes. So didn't care much for it.
If you stay in this hotel\/motel make sure you take your own toothbrush\/toothpaste, shampoo and soap. They don't provide you with them.
Only a small bar of soap and and 1 time use of shampoo. Nothing else!! 
Check in is at 3pm and check out is at 11am but the housekeeping lady starts knocking and opening the rooms at 9am wether or not you are still in your room. 
Make sure you have your do not disturb sign on the door knob. 
Also parking is not free...it's $8.00 per day if you are a guest!! 
Give it 2 stars bc its close to the strip
I don't get why it has mediocre reviews , it's clean, it's in the strip, and it's fun!

Went to Vegas with the family for the first time ( I had been as a single person many times).  I was reluctant to book at this hotel because of some bad reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised.  The pool was nice, the staff were great.  It is not a 5 star hotel, but it is a pretty good place to stay if you have kids, there is entertainment and food court, met our needs perfectly.  I do wish they had WiFI in the rooms, kids like to use their electronics in the room before bed.

Old, rundown, smells like cigarettes from when my parents stayed here last. Pisses me off that it's a 45 minute project to get an over priced cup of coffee in the morning.    No ventilation in the bathroom so the room is like Florida in August. Who was the engineer on that design. I suppose the coffee wait is good because it provides more than ample opportunity to do a Yelp review!

We stayed in a widescreen Tower II room here for two days at the insistence of my little princess.

The hotel is perfectly fine.  It's no frills Vegas.  It is comfortable enough.  

We had a nice view of the North end of the strip in our room, but I recommend asking for floor 11 or higher so there is no turret directly in front of your window.

My sister stayed here for a few days on the same trip on the 13th floor and her room was significantly nicer than mine.

PROS: 

- It's a castle.  Kids love castles.
- It is on the South end of the strip off Tropicana, making it very easy to get to other parts of Las Vegas without having to brave all the traffic on Las Vegas Boulevard.

CONS: 

- The Fun Dungeon makes games difficult for kids, which is in stark contrast to Circus Circus where they actually WANT kids to be happy.  The prices are also more expensive than the games at the big pink tent.
- It would be nice to see some beefed up security.  The security guards I noticed were always clustered together near the exit just joking around.  There was a murder the week we stayed there and the second night there was a guy getting arrested for something having to do with having a gun.  We walked past him on our way out and heard him say repeatedly "But there is only one bullet."
- It is on the South end of the strip, so if you want to be near the action... you should go to the Center strip.
- $15 a night resort fee for no real amenities.

Will I stay here again?  Not likely.  The Tropicana is way nicer at a similar price point.  If I need to be on that end of the strip, I will probably stay at The Trop or New York New York.

I would definitely recommend this hotel if you have under age children with you!!! It is clean, reasonably priced, has great restaurants, and lots for kids to do!! My girls loved the fun dungeon. Our pool experience was fabulous. Our room in the royal tower was on point every afternoon when we returned for a little rest before our nights out on the town. The only issues we had is upon check out it took an hour to get a bell hop and then he just basically unloaded our luggage on the curb where it sat for another hour and half before the valet got our car. The guys in the mornings getting taxis were always very friendly and called us by our names every morning when taking a taxi. I really think this is a great place to stay. Other than the valets and bell hops. Everyone else we encountered was great!! Especially Zernan at the comps desk who helped us get a lot of comps. We will definitely be returning to the Excalibur even if it is not a family vacation and just mine and my husbands get away. Stay here with kids and for sure by pass circus circus and others that focus on kids . You will not be disappointed I promise. Much much much cleaner and newer than circus circus. Stay here and have great family fun!!! Be sure to eat at Dick's as well for a great time.

We enjoyed our stay here this past weekend.  We got a spa room, well worth the extra cost!  The rest of the room wasn't anything fancy, just a standard  hotel room.  But it was comfortable and clean.  The only negatives-some of the pillows were kind of squishy and flat.  Also, I noticed some trays and glasses in the hall by some of the rooms that didn't get picked up.  The breakfast buffet was very good.  There was a wide variety of items, something for everyone.  If buffets aren't your thing, there were plenty of other places to eat and lots of shops, souveniers, liquor, candy, etc...  I love the moving walkway and tram that lead to Luxor and Mandalay Bay.

I feel bad giving two stars to the Excalibur, but it deserves it.  If you look at it from the glass is half full perspective, it has been around for a long time, it has served as the backdrop for many Vegas memories, and it is a really notable landmark on the Las Vegas Strip.

However, I cannot forget the smell when you walk inside, the glass windows at the entrance that seemingly never get cleaned of the fingerprints that cover them literally from top to bottom, and the overall 'quality' of the place.  It was built by the Circus Circus company in the 80's and opened in 1990, and I truly believe they are still running on the original format.  All the way down to the rooms.  Yes, I once visited a room at the Excalibur for a short period of time...don't ask.  I heard they renovated 2,000 rooms with updated TV's and furniture in 2007.  That would'nt be enough.

If you enjoy bad service, dining at the Excalibur might be perfect for you.  They have a Dick's Last Resort on the property.  Ever been to one?  It is hilarious, if you understand that the staff is paid to be rude to you.  "Shut up and eat your damn food!"  That would be an appropriate response from your server if you asked for napkin.  Good stuff like that.  I grew up in Dallas with one at the West End.  We used to go down there as high schoolers, get drunk, and argue with the staff.  Oh, the memories.

They also have a medieval dinner show (Tournament of Kings) where actors and actresses fight with swords, joust, and prance around on horses.  Can you say appetizing?  Meanwhile, you get to eat with your hands after you pluck the chicken and slaughter the cow.  That is actually false, apart from the eating with your hands part.

I don't know what other restaurant options they have, but I am sure a 24-hour cafe\/diner is in the mix, at the very least.  If they have a 'fine dining establishment' I would recommend eating elsewhere.  They have some shows.  Louie Anderson, Defending the Caveman and The Thunder from Down Under is what the website is currently showing.

As for the casino, I have had a lot of fun here.  The dealers are friendly, the tables are cheap compared to other nearby properties, and the people who play here are usually in good spirits.  The casino is the best part of the Excalibur, hands down.  Besides, you get used to the smell after a few minutes and then you can start focusing on the crowd.  As Elizabeth L. said, lots of fanny-packs, jorts, and sleeveless shirts.  Yee-haw!

One thing to note is that the thing that makes this Las Vegas Strip property unique is the actual exterior itself.  Just seeing it at night is what it is all about, and you don't have to be that close to do this.  As a matter of fact, the further away you are, the more impressive it looks.  Once you get up close, the facade looks pretty cheap and dated.

Other than that, the Excalibur doesn't have a shark aquarium, an indoor waterfall, impressive gardens, a volcano, world-class shopping or anything else noteworthy (at least not for the right reasons).  Instead, they have a dingy looking moat, which has been empty for the bulk of the past 10 years, a weird looking dragon thing that I have not seen working in the past 10 years, a kiosk selling items with flashing LED lights on them, and a tram that takes you to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay.  I am not even kidding.  The tram is definitely the best attraction.
Very middle of the road or even a little under.. Sports book is probably the nicest nook. I upgraded to a suite & honestly it looked like a regular room. I give this two stars.

Smelly, smelly, smelly. But if you are on a strict budget and want to enjoy Vegas this is probably the way to go. When we checked in our room we noticed the bed looked like it had been slept in.  Then the washroom was filthy. We called down to get a new room. When the bell boy arrived he was in a bad mood. We tried to explain why we bothered him and he shrugged his shoulders and said "I don't care, here are your keys.

To begin this hotel was relatively expensive compared to some places here in Vegas. About $150 per night then there's the $30 resort fee... But we were celebrating a 21st birthday and wanted to be in a cool place on the Strip. To begin, it took quite awhile to check in, and we got here super late, so it's not because they had a long line. They said that they upgraded our rooms, which were supposed to be standard conjoined rooms. When we got it we were disappointed. It was hot, there's no mini fridge or microwave, the beds are hard, no view, and top it off we wake up to the bright sun in our eyes, turns out there's no blackout shades. Honestly never seen that in a hotel here in Vegas. The bedding was not comfortable, really nothing special about this place whatsoever. Also in order to go up to your room, at least at night, there are security guards that ask to see your room key. Considering we had four in our party for one room and they give you two keys we ran into issues. Having to go down to get the other... Kind of annoying.

Stayed here for one night after returning from Grand Canyon.  The  staff at the registration desk was very helpful, and friendly.  We had a room with 2 queen beds.  The room was very clean.  I did notice they didn't carry a coffee maker at Excalibur which was very unusual.  Through out my stays at every hotel, all the rooms have a coffee maker available except Excalibur.  Not cos I'm a coffee fanatic, it was just something I noticed.  After all I wouldn't complain as I had got a really great deal while booking a room through Expedia.

Never again.

I had stayed here a couple of times previously which were mediocre, but not really bad.  The last time I stayed for business with coworkers, and after checking into my room I went to the restroom and found feces still splattered on the outside of the toilet bowl.  If something as blatant as this wasn't cleaned prior to check-in then I am terrified to consider what else remains unsanitary.

Even worse I was sent a survey following my visit in which I detailed my experience.  Have never received a word of feedback from the hotel.  What exactly is the point of asking for a survey from guests if you don't acknowledge them when they place a complaint?

I liked this place. It was clean and tidy, the beds were comfy, massive bathroom and in general it was just a good quality room. 
Only problem I had was the fact that there is only wifi on the casino floor which was really irritating and a long walk away. Wired internet is in the bedrooms.
$20 drink and meal voucher was included which was nice and a massive coupon book for money off on the strip.
Airport taxi is $8 and various companies operate that pick up at multiple hotels, so give yourself time to get to the airport. 
Look for coupons online so you get the best deal on your room.

People are complaining about the resort fee, but it was very clear how much I would be charged when I booked online.

+Cost
+Location
+Game room for kids

-Bad ventilation system & casino floor reeks of smoke.
-Drains in the pool need to be redone. Everyone gets hurt as they stick out too much.
-Didn't say anything about the $8 day parking they now charged when we booked.

Would stay again when making budget trips.

Have stayed here twice for HS basketball tournaments in Vegas. It's appropriately priced for a mid to lower range option. Rooms and hotel are kept clean. Nothing special to brag about. 

Location on one end of the strip makes it more difficult to get to other hotels for newer shows and casinos. Very close to airport. 

Meal options are limited and more like fast food fare. Quick walk to New York, New York or MGM and there are than many higher end options.

There is a kids entertainment room called the dungeon and a Knights in armor show as well.

I was very worried about staying here. But when I entered the room I realized everything would be ok. 

The room does have a faint smell, but nothing I can't deal with. The bed is comfortable. Clean towels and sheets, no random hairs that happen sometimes. Carpet is stain free ect. Not terrible for the price I payed.

Excalibur is one of the oldest and largest hotels on the Las Vegas Strip. Tower 1 being much older than Tower 2 you may want to request a room in tower two as i was told tower one was kind of sketchy. The base of tower two is where the pool entrance is and also has better access to the parking lot in the back. 
The resort as a whole, i think was very versatile in that is has pretty much something for everyone. The bottom floor where the Tournament of Kings show is has a huge arcade that any kid would eat their vegetable to be let lose in for an hour or five. On the casino level there is a Dick's Last Resort for the adults to get rowdy and have a few. The food court area was decent and has a little bit of everything to cure your hangover and then some. Unfortunately i didn't make it to the buffet, I that is mostly because if you planned to do the buffet its a better value to pay for the whole day (breakfast lunch and dinner) $35 than pay for individual meals. I didn't want to have to be in the hotel for every meal as Excalibur is in a great location to explore the MGM, Luxor, and New York New York.

TRAVELING COUPLES: Excalibur and many other hotels will target you on the casino floors and ask you if you want free tickets to a show....of course you do. This is a timeshare pitch that will suck 3-4 hours out of your day which I found out too late. I did get two tickets to the Tournament of Kings which were $65 a pop but 4 hours of my saturday was spend touring a condo facility and being pitched the idea of buying into a timeshare. Just an FYI

I remember first staying at the Excalibur back in 1989 when it was brand spanking new. The employees would be dressed in medieval style uniforms, the king and queen and their entourage would go around the casino for photo ops with the guests and the Roundtable Buffet was the best in quality. 

Over the years the quality has gone downhill ever since MGM MIRAGE bout out Mandalay Resorts Inc. and has just gone downhill in quality. 

The Excalibur still holds the title as, "Most Tacky Theme" in Las Vegas
Some renovations have been done with the hotel mostly on Tower II, removed and added new restaurants, increased the size of the pool area, removed all the child friendly areas and replaced it with bars and 2 Tier restaurants. Also that has been thrown out is the Merlin out on the castle by the strip and replaced with Dicks and the free dragon show outside in the so called moat near the strip entrance. 

My room was in Tower II and was recently remodeled, I get good deals through Mlife so I always book the renovated room and the weekend rates are cheap. No WiFi here just an 90's ethernet cable. The 2nd level has a foodcourt for budget travelor and it's connected to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. 

As the saying goes, "You get what you pay for", and it shows here. Avoid Tower I!

I pretty much picked the Excalibur based on location and price. I'm very happy with my choice. We have a suite in the Royal Tower and I have to say I love it. The room is spotless. The entire hotel is great. There is a wide variety of dining options here. There's 3 Starbucks on the property for coffee junkies. Excalibur is connected to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay so you never even have to venture outside in the heat. We rented a cabana at the adult pool and the service is exceptional.

Our family was pleasantly surprised.  After reading all the awful reviews we expected the worst .  They said excalibur was kid friendly and they were only right about that.

1. Hotel smoke smell was not bad.  it's Vegas people do smoke here but, it wasn't unbearably or thick.  They do a pretty good job of airing it out and keeping the smells down.

2.  Kids arcade was one of the cleanest we saw and very well ventilated unlike disgusting circus circus that we visited on our trip.  

3. Rooms were fine and clean.  We stayed in a flat screen room and it wasn't luxiourious but for the price you can't complain.

4. Pool area was fun the kids plentynof spots to sit.  Food and drinks were good.

5.  All employees were very courteous and helpful.  

6.  Check in desk was close didn't have to walk far.  It was the easiest casino to get around in.

We had a pleasant experience and would definitely return.

A friend and i stayed here last weekend and while we were checking out and loading the luggage in the car the housekeeping supervisor grabbed 3 unopened large bottles of vodka from our bags in the room and told us she thought we left them in the room and thew them away(but set all our other stuff outside the door). Why would she just take the unopened vodka to the trash??? I dont think the "threw them away".and wasn't surprised when she came back saying she couldn't find them. and when we spoke to Leah, the front desk supervisor, she said there's nothing she could do and offered us $50 .

 Lori :
Thanks for the reply. Looks like this has been an issue lately as some other yelpers have had some issues with theft as well. It was room 6129

Loved it! The hotel wasn't very pretty It was clean overall. But very old looking. 

BUT I got great service I was able to do early check in which was 7am!!! Was so awesome for only 20$ more. On Labor Day weekend! Awesome ! They let me check out late for NO extra cost. One of the hotel cleaners helped me out when I lost my room key. He was very helpful! Walked me through the whole process.

Tower 2 is a mediocre hotel. Tower 1 is a motel. mwahahahahaahasha... enough said. you get what you pay for. I stayed in tower 1 for 1 night and it smelled like fart, feet, and cigarrette smoke, you dont know what that smells like? go to the motel yourself. I asked for an upgrade to tower 2 and  the bedbugs were feasting on me like crazy that night(the only free buffet on the strip). the game floor was cool so thats why I gave it two stars.

Was comped 3 days and received a room with no view other than a wall. I guess that's what you get for free. Other than that the room was very clean and the furniture was in good condition. I am giving it four stars mainly for the bed that was very comfortable. This was the best deal as I was going to have to pay $250 at the Stratosphere which had bad reviews, $400 at the Luxor which is so so and $600 per night at the Wynn which was way out of our budget. So all in all this was a great deal. Paid $130 for the taxes and parking to the comped room.

Where do I start... 
We stayed 1 night in 2 rooms in tower 1. They said that they gave us a free upgrade. 
When we walked in the room, it was apparent that the service was not completed in the room because pillows were on the floor. Wallpaper was patch worked & falling off the walls. The furniture was falling apart and most likely the original furniture (maybe 70's). The light in the lamp was falling out. The shower (no tub) was dingy. There was no fridge. 
In the morning when we went to use the toilet, it overflowed. We turned the water off & called for service. Service was in the room within minutes, but cleanup didn't come for over an hour. (This put us late at returning our car rental costing us $100). While waiting for cleanup, the toilet water seeped through the wall into the closet. The toilet water was all over the wrap that I carry my baby in. When I let customer service know what happened, they said "that should never happen." & that was it. 

Also, played at the blackjack table for hours w\/ the M card & didn't get any points.  

This is the 1st & last Excalibur experience for us.

Do not stay i this hell hole!  Once we checked in we took our bags to the "new renovated" tower, renovated?  Really, it very dated and no refrigerator in the room unless you want to rent it.  We pulled back the sheets to get ready for bed. Unbelievable, Fecal matter and black hair in the bed of a "newly made bed". It is obvious that the maid made the bed without changing the sheets from the previous guest .  Beyond disturbing and disgusting.  I called the on duty manager  who asked several time what do you want me to do. He tells me  he will write off our resort fee. Really?? I'd post pictures, but they are too disgusting to even look at.  Yuck!!!!!

Several issues :
1. Cleanliness- sink was never wiped, trash was left on the hallway never picked up. 
2. At 3:30am security called asking for our names claiming someone in our party wanted to get into our room, when we had nobody out. Nobody took responsibility.  Very upsetting .

Don't stay here if it's a special occasion. I only booked this hotel hoping since it was on short notice  cheap and on the strip it would be OK. We only booked because of the Back Street Boys. I have never seen a cock roach in my life except at a zoo . My daughter and I were so tired after we left the concert we went to bed. Lights off, our when the head hit the pillow. I woke up before she did. Giant yellow stain on the opposite side of the bed.(we had two separate beds) We brought food in? Neither one of us would sit on the chair. If you're into flea bag on the cheap stay here. Motel 6 is better. I will say that their staff was friendly and accommodating. Very brown and dreary, stained carpets, no bathtub? This is your place! I have stayed at the Rio, Bellagio, Venetian, Monte Carlo, Palms, Mirage, ....I love Vegas! This hotel makes me shake my head in shame.

I booked this hotel for my brother as a birthday present. Long story short he came here, paid the upgrade and had sheets with dried blood on them nasty. 

I tried to reach house keeping could not, waited forty minutes on hold. Besides that I called and was only given a 30 dollar return. I think they should have also returned the resort fees, as the wifi had issues to and we needed it. I had to go to Luxor and login as a to access internet. 

Over all the arcade is cool, as is T. KIngs. Kids love that show way too much, heck even us adults do too. It saves you the trouble of rushing dinner to get to a show as it is a one stop event. 

The pools are the next best hong, nice, and no too crowded or dirty. 

Hated the staff, as not able to get assistance, and half are rude beyond anything I usually encountered. 

We love the food court, and the shops, as they are simple and not too overpriced.

Would stay again, and hopefully get better service.

This place is good to stay at for a cheap price. But hey you get what you pay for.  I stayed here and my mother got bit by something in one of the rooms but they switch her rooms to a nicer one. The room I was staying in was kinda gross. I came inside the hotel and the toilet was running, holes I'm the wall, and paint by the the tv.

Excalibur is a hotel that is decent for what you pay for. It's not cheap or expensive either. Just right for the buck.

Dated, yes very much so, but they provide a theme here like no other hotel on the strip.

I wish they would stop with their promotional stuff, stayed here Thursday to Sunday and by Friday I had to be rude on their approach.

Trust me, it gets on people's nerves because it seems like a 3D stuff it in your face commercial.

Anyhow, it's been over 20 years since I last stood here and it seems nothing has really changed but the food options.

Other then that it's just the same old castle.

Its not upscale like some of the fancy hotels you might find in Manhattan but for (sometimes) $30-40 a night? I think one of the best deals for a hotel ever. The room was a Tower 2 room, it was clean; the bed was clean, sheets were clean, ac system looked new and was really cold, and decently quiet; bathroom was clean and really big; flat screen TV was huge and worked fine; and there is wired internet with a ethernet cable already connected. Only downfall is that there is no WIFI in case you are cheap and do not want to use your phones data. I have data on my phone so it was no problem. Other than that, the casino is pretty big, but I did not get so lucky there, not their fault. Check-in clerk was very kind, and the housekeeping lady was extremely kind and gave us extra towels. Definitely a good thing to tip these people. I know I did, and I usually do not tip hotels at all because they usually charge a lot. But nope, definitely going to stay here again, and possibly again.

I have stayed at alot of Vegas hotels.......but this one stands out in one way that needs mentioned. I found the staff here to be very very very friendly and cheerfully nice. I know that one might assume that in the hotel biz, everywhere would be nice......but actually.......NO ! I have been disappointed with some 5 star places.......anyway, I really enjoyed my stay here.....like I said, the staff was just over the top friendly and I think that's worth something......btw, I think kids would really love this place.......it's really neat......btw my room was great, room service was great, housekeeping was great and not a pain in the butt in the morning.......front desk was great- NO COMPLAINTS.
I booked my room requesting a king size bed, but in arrival they had given them all away. Other than that the service provided and the fact our rooms were cleaned was excellent
Can't believe they are charging for parking when we had to walk in the rain and then pay astronomical prices once you get in there.  We're locals and are very disappointed with the new set up.

Okay,  I take back my tower 2 preference, I think it's tower 1 now! Hahahaha
This was a mush needed vacation and since we were offered 2 nights free in tower1 on the day after new years we jumped on it.  This is the first time on new years eve and the first time we actually spent time in the room, but we still did a lot of tourist stuff. We tried to go other places to eat or gamble but just headed back to the castle deciding not to fight with all the chaos or bs the castle has everything we want.
We even tried out the fun dungeon for the first time! We played til we were kicked out then went to gamble- both went well :)
Can't wait to go back!

Let me start by complementing the staff. They were all very helpful and courteous. We were unhappy with our first room and decided to request a room change. The staff was glad to help and assured us that no extra charges will  be added. 

The Hotel itself is not that bad. I agree that it may need some renovations because a lot of the furniture and overall design seems very dated. It would be great if they make them more modern and maybe add a night club inside that can attract the younger crowd. 

The room that we got was pretty neat. Bed was comfortable and the bathroom was very clean. I love how you can  just check out via their autmated e-mail (link to a website). They also have machines by each tower that allows you to check out faster. 

My only beef was the $15 "resort fee". Actually, It was not too bad compared to other Hotels who will charge you an additional $20 a night. I did not like how the Internet was wired. I'm sure it wouldn't be too costly if they were to upgrade their systems to wireless. A little tip, if you want free wifi access, go upstairs to the food court and hang out in Starbucks. 

Another tip. Be careful of some people who look like they work for the Hotel. A lof of them are acutally vendors who will try to sell you things. What can you do. I'ts Vegas after all.

Bad stay for my honeymoon the hallway smelled like weed and the smell eventually went into my room. I called security 3 times for two days straight and they never did anything to solve the problem i will just stay elsewhere on my next trip in october

Worst hotel in Las Vegas. We got here Friday at 2am and they said our reservation got cancelled. We request an extra bed and they didn't have one. The room smelled like cigarettes, the blow dryer burned. We requested towels and pillows and they gave us one! Soooo not coming back! Please pay a little more and stay somewhere else! I love Luxor (the average same price). Awful hotel!

I usually only give only good reviews but this was my worst hotel experience - the bathroom  smelled like a sewer, a lock on the door was broken, so I couldn't lick the door at night. I woke up in the middle of the night freezing cold with a pain in both ears and running nose and had to put a wool hat on and stuff my ears with cotton balls not to get sick. Then I saw a cockroach crawling on the second bed and I had to kill it with my shoe. Not to mention that it took an hour to check in and get this beautiful room. Never again will I come near this hotel.

We stayed here a couple of times before.  The rooms are nicely kept.  My little girl loves the pool so I was happy to see that they keep it very clean.  We were at another hotel and the water cloudy and cold.  So if you have kids that love to swim, stay here.  They have water slides and the waterfall looks very pretty.

My boyfriend and I spent three nights here last summer with no issues. However, this summer we had some BIG issues. Here is a copy of the letter I sent to Excalibur's official email for customer service to be greeted with no response. I'm sorry, but if I take the time to write out a letter, you sure as sh*t better, at the very least, acknowledge that you received it. I never got a response from them, and I sent it about six or seven weeks ago:

To Whom It May Concern:

I am very upset to have to write this letter but I feel that it is important to contact you about my recent stay at the Excalibur. My boyfriend and I had booked three nights at the Monte Carlo hotel from June 3rd to the 5th. We then discovered the MyVegas Facebook app and accrued enough points to redeem them for a free night at Excalibur the day after we checked out of Monte Carlo on the morning of June 6th. We had an amazing stay at the Monte Carlo and had previously enjoyed our stay at the Excalibur so we were very excited to put our MyVegas points to good use in order to extend our vacation.

We arrived at the Excalibur around 11:30am and we were told that we would receive a phone call around 1:00pm to tell us which room we had been assigned to. When we checked out the room, we had been assigned to a Tower 1 room, which is (as you know) the tower that has not been renovated. It was not NEARLY as nice as the room in Tower 2 we had stayed in last year, but I thought it would be okay considering it was just a comp room and we weren't actually paying for it. The room was extremely small and not even half the size of the room we had previously stayed in. Again, I was willing to deal with that because it was a comp room. I was not, however, ready to deal with the other aspects of the room. We wanted to take a nap after we checked in. I pulled back the covers of the bed and there was a big curly black hair right behind the pillow. Obviously, I was grossed out so I flipped the pillow around. There were three big brown spots on the pillowcase. It was definitely not clean. My boyfriend went downstairs to speak to someone and when he was away I felt something on my foot and I was disgusted to discover that it was a big spider. Thankfully, your staff at the MLife desk were fabulous and transferred us to a Tower 2 room. 

Unfortunately, our stay did not end on a pleasant note. Being that it was our last night in Vegas, my boyfriend and I stayed out very late. We didn't get to bed until well after 4am and we had set our alarm to 10:30am so that we could have plenty of time to collect our bags and check out before 11. However, at 9:20am there was a loud knock at the door. I know that hotel walls can be thin so I assumed it was a knock on the door next to ours and tried to ignore it. I then heard even more knocking and then the sound of a card going in and out of our door. I finally got up and saw that housekeeping was outside and told her to leave. Thankfully I had the dead-bolt up because if I had been woken up by someone else walking into my room I would have been extremely startled. The best part is that we had our Do Not Disturb sign on!! How can your housekeeping staff not know that? And even if it was not on, why would you be pounding on our door literally an hour and a half before we had to check out, when the sheets would have to been changed anyway? We were very irritated that we got cheated out of more than an hour of sleep that we really needed before our long drive back to LA. It's not the way you want to wake up after a night of partying.

Between the uncleanliness of the room and the rude awakening we received the morning we were due to check out, I am not willing to stay at the Excalibur again. My boyfriend and I were both very disappointed in our stay. We were especially disappointed because we had stayed at the Excalibur in June of 2012 and enjoyed ourselves. Unfortunately, this stay was simply not up to par. I'm very upset to say that you have lost customers due to our recent visit.

Excalibur is nothing fancy but it gets the job done if you come to Vegas during a busy period.

My group of friends and I booked this hotel for New Year's Eve weekend. Hotels are a lot more expensive during holidays but Excalibur had the lowest prices. We got a regular widescreen room was was actually a good size and clean room for what we paid for. Regardless, we are out of the room doing things most of the time.

Excalibur is great location-wise. It's right at the intersection next to New York New York, MGM Grand, and Tropicana. It's also directly connected to Luxor which directly connects to Mandalay Bay. Basically, you can hit up six major casinos without having to walk far. It's also very easy to get in and out being right off Interstate 15.

Excalibur also has a food court with a variety of places (even a McDonalds) which is good for people looking to eat cheap.

The bottom line is that if you are going to Vegas during the off-season, there are nicer hotels you can get at a low price. But during a time like New Year's, this is one of the best places you can stay at.

You get what you pay for. In my books this place deserves 5 stars because it is cheap. If it were to cost me 150 a night to stay here it would not deserve 5 stars. I have stayed here 5 or 6 times. I come to vegas to gamble and party cheap rooms means more money to spend elsewhere. Being on the strip it also has great location! Thankyou excaliber I will most likly be seeing you again soon!

In Las Vegas for work again...But this time we looked for the cheapest strip room to stay and see how it is. Normally we have stayed at the swanky hotels, but this time we went for the $39\/night Excalibur. Not because we had to, because we chose to. I did take a lot of things into consideration though when making the choice.... 1. It is only across a bridge to get to New York New York or the Luxor. 2. It has a free tram to Mandalay Bay. 3. It does have a Dick's Last Resort restaurant (which I always enjoy).

Well, I must say I was pretty happy with our selection. For $20 more\/night we could have upgraded to their new totally remodeled Tower II ~ but we didn't. Our room was not bad. 21st floor with two queen beds & strip views. Beds were comfortable & the shower was great. I figured we saved at least $200\/night on a hotel. Plus the Excalibur has lower priced gambling tables (we didn't gamble too much). It's a quick walk to Planet Hollywood (I love Blondies for lunch there), we did actually go to Mandalay Bay (Had an awesome hamburger at the Burger Bar (@ $20\/burger the 2 hamburgers cost more than our hotel room)), we did go to the Luxor & we did walk part of the strip. And, the Excalibur is only a $20 cab ride to Fremont Street. Other pluses: it had a nice pool that was not too crowded & they offer FREE Valet parking (with all our equipment, that was nice).

The two downsides I can think of: 1. Tower I is far from the pool 2. It was a much older crowd. Other than that, the hotel was not too smokey and it has a lot to offer....AND, you cannot beat the price.

Other quick Vegas tid bits: 1. Fremont Street ~ GREAT as always and the cheap beer and tables more than make up for the $20 cab ride...Not to mention the GREAT people watching & the live shows & the videos. 2. Burger Bar @ Mandalay Bay ~ Pricey but GOOD! 3. Blondies @ Planet Hollywood ~ ALWAYS Great!! 4. Dick's ribs & wings were awesome...

Finding parking was so hard! I have to pay for it too?!? The security in the parking lot was yelling at us for not being fast enough. Another thing to keep in mind is the smoke is unbearable for kids. We choose this one because it's a castle and thinking its family friendly. Well it is a bit but the smoke is the main pet peeve. I was in my room and was changing and I can still smell the smoke on my shirt :( For the priced I paid I rather go to another hotel. The room is a bit dated, and the bed isn't bad. The view I got was great.

yeah I know there are much better hotels on the strip that you can stay at, but I have been here 4 years in a row with Superbowl and just got back from another stay here.  I happen to like this hotel its clean, friendly and pretty much close to what you want to see.  No matter what you are wanting to do you will need to walk, bus or taxi it to the destination.  I total recommend this hotel also cuz of the prices\/deals.  This past stay I paid $103 for 2 nts.  Not bad and will def go back.

Its been 2hrs waiting in line to check in to the hotel. The line is extremely long hundreds of people maybe even a thousand, for a hotel to have this long of a check in line is inexcusable. I really wish i had chosen another hotel for attending EDC. They have not been at all helpful in trying to compensate me for my time and patience. I came alone and have needed to pee for the past hr but cant get out of line. This is the worst experience i've ever had in vegas.

hotel is located at end of strip. like most hotels in vegas has a weird air freshner smell, but this place smell particularly bugged me. the recently renovated room we upgraded to had nice modern furniture and an ok view. i enjoyed eating at the buffet and dicks last resort within hotel. cons-smell, no fridge\/coffeemaker, crappy complimentary body wash\/shampoo-conditioner all in one (leaves hair greasy), layout of hotel. pros-the lounge (a place where talented local singers\/bands play within hotel for free), cable on flat screen, food areas, shopping upstairs, arcade downstairs. place is huge and easy to get lost in. didnt get a chance to check out the pool.

I just got back from staying at the Excalibur for the second time. The first time was January 2011. Both times I was hassled nearly to death by people trying to sell me a time share. I was so angry after the 2011 visit that I made literally hundreds of phone calls to the hotel demanding a refund. Five months later I got it. I imagine it will be easier this time because now they know who they are dealing with

We had an emergency and our last resort was vegas. Long story short, ended up here after a very long and frustrating day (drove for 13+ hours on thanksgiving) of straight driving. We get into out room and it stinks from the start. Smell was the least of my problems. Walked into our "delux" room and the first thing we found was an empty bottle of lotion on the ground inside our supposedly clean room. Then, since it's winter and it's freezing, we needed more blankets. They arrived after a long time of waiting and when I tried to spread it open, CUM crusted the blanket together. Slimy, off white colored semen just all over the blanket, dried and holding it in a bunch. I am seriously so grossed out, I can't even fall asleep. I don't want to make a big deal about it at this moment because it is almost 2 am and I know if I say something my family will want to leave this place (as do I), and I just don't want to put them through that after out long and hard journey. I'll have to say something tomorrow, but till then, I will be laying in disgust. This is just unacceptable. Being ugly in decor is one thing. Having a handful of crusted over  CUM in you bedding you're handing out becomes a health hazard.

You pay for what you get. This is what my group of friends and I had to accept.

Yes, possibly one of the affordable hotels on the strip. The exterior of the Excalibur reminds me of how I am entering some really cheesy-looking castle and once inside, there are some good things and some not-so-good-still-worth-mentioning things.

The Goods:
- Affordable. If you're on a budget, it's possibly worth it. Just don't expect superb services
- Somewhat convenient. Loved the fact that I can take the tram from the Excalibur to Mandalay Bay (the "last" hotel on The Strip) or walk on the bridge to New York New York without having to walk on the street
- The employees were nice although I found it a bit strange seeing a supposely middle-age woman dressed in skimpy clothes. Then again, it's Vegas.

The Not-So-Goods:
-The elevator smells like weed.
-The Hallways smells funky. Reminds me of cocoa butter lotion
- Since we ended up in Tower I on the 3rd floor, there was no reason to open the window shade since the castle's wall completely blocked our view of anything. Instead, we would either be staring at the wall or stretching our necks high to see the sky.
-Cracks on the wall, 
smoke alarms looks like it was about to fall and crush one of our heads, 
previous occupant clothing label stickers on the wall, dirty-looking sink, 
toilet not doing its job properly since my friends and I kept thinking someone went #2. Thanks to the toilet, we had to hold any #2s until we got to the casino floors to use their toilets

Yup. Somehow we managed to survive this all...
We had dinner @ Excalibur buffet.  I would say it is good has all sorts of salad, pasta and carving roast beef, sausage and chicken.  It also has all sorts of wonderful dessert.

Was not too bad for the price!! Im very disappointed with NOBODY acknowledging my complaints i made 3 times !!!!! Until the day i was checking out !! And even when i made the last complaint i was told "we will check it out"  That is total bs !! And the wifi sucked , yet they charge a resort fee for internet  yet u cant even make a call home ... I know you are not always in the room but still !! Only upside to all of it was the food court was cool , plenty of choices and they were open late

I typically stay at Excalibur when I visit Vegas, and there's really only one reason: price.  If you join the MGM loyalty program (MLife), you can get rooms at Excalibur through the week for as cheap as $24 a night.  You won't find a cheaper place on the Strip (with the possible exception of Imperial Palace). 

The decor is a bit dated, especially the dark carpet in the rooms.  They have started to remodel, and some of the regular price rooms now have flat screens.  But honestly, if you care what the carpet looks like or how big the TV is, you're in the wrong city.

I've never had a problem with cleanliness or room quality.  The beds are comfortable.  In Vegas, you don't really need much more.  Can you find nicer rooms in Vegas? Most definitely.  But why pay so much more for a room you shouldn't be spending that much time in?

Children's game area.  We gave this place a 2nd shot and were disappointed again.  Many coin change machines are broken and now the carnival games are out of order too.  My family wanted to play the horse game where you roll the ball, out of 20 machines, only 7 were working!  The prices for the games are expensive too.  This place needs improvements.  I don't think we'll be visiting this place anymore.  Circus Circus is better.

My daughter getting bed bug bites. No and it was not an allergy. And also didnt go out the night before so i knew those were not mosquito bites.  I've stayed in other hotels with my kids in Las Vegas and this is the first time this ever happened. I did a report and was told that I will get a call that same day or no later than the next day. Mind you this happen Saturday morning. Check out time was on Monday, still no call. I went to the front desk twice and still no answer after I checked out around 
12 p.m. nothing. Around 2 p.m I received a voice mail saying "good news! the results from the report came back negative". Good news?!, good news to them since they didn't have to refund me my money. But not once did I see any movement going around in that room since they moved me a few doors down. I asked for a report of the results and was told I will get them emailed and til this day I have not received them. (2 weeks now) I am normally not the type that will give  negative feed back, but as a mother I will not let anyone else's children go through this. SMH. I will not be coming back to this place!

At one time, this casino held the world record for number of rooms. That was long ago an has been greatly surpassed in last few decades. It has a great location on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd & Tropicana Avenue. Stopping through on a popular weekend meant we were paying a fairly high price for a room...same room you can get during off season and midweek for just a couple Andrew Jacksons! BEWARE of previously unmentioned fees!...like a "resort fee". Hello, what exactly is that $29 for anyways?...it doesn't say "resort" in the title. Overall, the hotel\/casino is nice...it is attached to the Luxor via a air conditioned tunnel\/archway...which is also connected to the Mandalay Bay Casino. There is a free tram that goes between the 3 of these casinos. I've stayed here before and wouldn't object to staying here again in the future....as long as the price is less than $100\/nt on weekends.

This was our second time staying here and it will be our last. After our 8 hour drive, we had to stand in line for an hour before we could get into our room. Apparently, the lady at the front desk "upgraded" our room to a view. The view she went on and on about, was not so great. We weren't even facing the strip, but we were able to see the back of Tropicana. Once we got in, I decided to take a look at the room, to make sure it was clean. Upon checking, we found a piece of chewed up gum by one of the beds, along with what looked like a half bitten twizzler. YUCK! I then proceeded to walk to the bathroom when I found, shit\/pee\/puke on the toilet rim. FRECKEN DISGUSTING. I almost puked myself. Tried to call front desk to tell them about our room, but to no avail I sat on hold for quit some time before I gave up. We got ready to go out and decided to go visit the front desk (with the pictures that we took) to show them what the "clean" room we got, but the check in line was just as long as when we arrived. 

Once we got home, we tired contacting the hotel to talk to someone about the poor service and horrible room condition we received while we stayed at their location, but, as you guessed it no one has contacted us back. This wouldn't be such a big deal if the room was at its regular rate, but spending about $300 for our Valentines day trip is unacceptable.

This place earned every star! When I first arrived to Vegas my intent was to stay at a different hotel ... that hotel(rio) failed me.. at last minute I arrived at this hotel and everyone was extremely welcoming and assisted me with getting a room for my family. This place saved our vacation! Everything was hassle free and Mark A. (Front desk manager) was amazing in helping us set everything up due to our troubles with rio and take a break... he fixed someone else's mistake and saved our trip. Thank you so much to everyone and Mark.

Okay, so here's how it is.

The Valets are downright surly.  The signs all said "VALET FULL" but we were just checking in, dropping off the bags, and leaving.  I asked if we could pull the car up and leave it for 5 minutes.  He said "You gotta park in SelfPark" and muttered as he walked away.

Not a great first impression.  But since we didn't intend on using the Valet anyhow, I ignored him.

Their check-in desk is huge, long, counter-ish.  There are some old leftover sconces and Camelot-Theme-ey things involved.  You can easily picture this hotel, in it's heydey, calling its' guests "Kings and Queens" or "Lords and Ladies" and *really* getting into their theme.  Giving out crowns and princess hats or something.   Swords and Lances and junk.  Now it's kind of just an afterthought.  

Right on the counter where you check in are their "Upgrade Offers"... Complete with PRICES.  Hmm.  Usually, when I check in, I make friends and ask for a FREE upgrade.  And I get it.  (I certainly did at T.I. down the street!)  Guess that's what they want to avoid, though.  

The hotel is large, and the castle theme follows throughout.   The rooms are about on par with a Motel 6 or Super 8.  (We had newer, cleaner accommodations at a Roadside Comfort Inn on the way home.)  But, for what you pay, it's acceptable.   We had a King Deluxe room.  The brownish carpet had seen wear, and there was a stain on the blanket.  (That fuzzy, staticky kind.  Certainly NOT Down Comforters here.)  The bathroom has a stall shower, and was fairly clean.  The Headboards look Castle-Themed (From the 1970s of course) and there are sconces for lights, Castle-ey mirrors, etc.  The bed and pillows were comfortable enough.  The elevators came quickly, which was nice, but the walls were very thin, and we could hear people walking, talking, and stumbling in late at night in the hallways through the closed door.  Not enough to wake me up, though. 

There are security personnel at each tower's elevators, who will check your room key.  They were nice.

Caution:  Just past them, on your way into the casino, there are Vultures.  You will not know that they are Vultures, because they are wearing Jackets and NameTags, which Vultures don't usually do.  But they are, indeed, Vultures.  And they will hound you with offers for "Discounts" and "Specials" and "Deals" and will not take "NO" for an answer.  I swear, they were like those awful TimeShare people.  
I looked them straight in the eye, before they could even say anything to us, and said, in perfect, unaccented English:  "I DON'T SPEAK ENGLISH." and kept walking.  
Seemed to do the trick.
